original: tat katham ayaṃ surakṣite'py asmin gṛha evaṃvidho vyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: tat katham ayam su rakṣite pi asmin gṛhe evaṃvidhaḥ vyavahāraḥ
translated: How is this kind of behavior possible in this well-guarded house?

original: tad rājñe nivedayāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat rājñe nivedayāmaḥ
translated: So we will inform the king.

original: evaṃ niścitya sarve sametya rājānaṃ procuḥdeva /
analyzed: evam niścitya sarve sametya rājānam procuḥ deva
translated: Having thus decided, they all gathered and said to the king: Your Majesty,

original: vayaṃ na vidmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam na vidmaḥ
translated: we do not know.

original: paraṃ surakṣite'pi kanyāntaḥpure kaścit praviśati /
analyzed: param su rakṣite api kanyā antaḥpure kaścid praviśati
translated: But someone enters the well-guarded inner quarters of the princess.

original: tad devaḥ pramāṇam iti /
analyzed: tat devaḥ pramāṇam iti
translated: So Your Majesty is the authority.

original: tac chrutvā rājātīva vyākulitacitto vyacintayat
analyzed: tat śrutvā rājā atīva vyākulita cittaḥ vyacintayat
translated: Hearing this, the king became extremely agitated and thought:

original: putrīti jātā mahatīha cintā
analyzed: putrī iti jātā mahatī iha cintā
translated: A great worry has arisen for me, thinking of my daughter as 'she is enjoyed by a man'.

original: kasmai pradeyeti mahān vitarkaḥ /
analyzed: kasmai pradeyā iti mahān vitarkaḥ
translated: What is the great doubt?

original: dattvā sukhaṃ prāpsyati vā na veti
analyzed: dattvā sukham prāpsyati vā na vā iti
translated: Whether giving it away, one will attain happiness or not.

original: kanyāpitṛtvaṃ khalu nāma kaṣṭam // ///
analyzed: kanyā pitṛ tvam khalu nāma kaṣṭam
translated: Indeed, being a father of a daughter is indeed a great hardship.

original: nadyaś ca nāryaś ca sadṛkprabhāvās
analyzed: nadyaḥ ca nāryaḥ ca sadṛś prabhāvāḥ
translated: Rivers and women have similar power,

original: tulyāni kūlāni kulāni tāsām /
analyzed: tulyāni kūlāni kulāni tāsām
translated: Their banks and families are similar.

original: toyaiś ca doṣaiś ca nipātayanti
analyzed: toyaiḥ ca doṣaiḥ ca nipātayanti
translated: They destroy with their water and faults,

original: nadyo hi kūlāni kulāni nāryaḥ // ///🔽jananīmano harati jātavatī
analyzed: nadyaḥ hi kūlāni kulāni nāryaḥ  jananī manaḥ harati jātavatī
translated: For rivers destroy their banks, and women their families.🔽A mother's mind is captivated by a daughter who is born,

original: parivardhate saha śucā suhṛdām /
analyzed: parivardhate saha śucā suhṛdām
translated: She grows along with the grief of her friends.

original: parasātkṛtāpi kurute malinaṃ
analyzed: parasātkṛtā api kurute malinam
translated: Even when taken away by others, she makes them impure,

original: duritakramā duhitaro vipadaḥ // ///
analyzed: durita kramāḥ duhitaraḥ vipadaḥ
translated: Like misfortunes, daughters follow a course of sin.

original: evaṃ bahuvidhaṃ vicintya devīṃ rahaḥsthāṃ provācadevi /
analyzed: evam bahuvidham vicintya devīm rahaḥ sthām provāca devi
translated: Having thus reflected in many ways, he spoke to the queen who was in private: O queen,

original: jñāyatāṃ kim ete kañcukino vadanti /
analyzed: jñāyatām kim ete kañcukinaḥ vadanti
translated: Let it be known what these eunuchs are saying.

original: tasya kṛtāntaḥ kupito yenaitad evaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: tasya kṛtāntaḥ kupitaḥ yena etat evam kriyate
translated: The angry god of death is doing this.

original: devy api tad ākarṇya vyākulībhūtā satvaraṃ kanyāntaḥpure gatvā tāṃ khaṇḍitādharāṃ nakhavilikhitaśarīrāvayavāṃ duhitaram apaśyat /
analyzed: devī api tat ākarṇya vyākulībhūtā sa tvaram kanyā antaḥpure gatvā tām khaṇḍita adharām nakha vilikhita śarīra avayavām duhitaram apaśyat
translated: The queen, having heard that, became agitated and quickly went to the inner quarters of the maidens and saw her daughter whose lips were bitten, whose limbs were scratched, and who was ashamed.

original: āha caāḥ pāpe /
analyzed: āha ca āḥ pāpe
translated: She said: Alas, wicked one!

original: kulakalaṅkakāriṇi /
analyzed: kula kalaṅka kāriṇi
translated: Causing a stain on the family!

original: kim eva śīlakhaṇḍanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: kim eva śīla khaṇḍanam kṛtam
translated: What breach of morality have you committed?

original: ko 'yaṃ kṛtāntāvalokitas tvatsakāśam abhyeti /
analyzed: kaḥ yam kṛtānta avalokitaḥ tvad sakāśam abhyeti
translated: Who is this Death's messenger that comes to you?

original: tat kathyatāṃ mamāgre satyam /
analyzed: tat kathyatām mama agre satyam
translated: So tell me the truth.

original: iti kopāṭopavisaṅkaṭaṃ vadatyāṃ mātari rājaputrī bhayalajjānatānanaṃ provācaamba /
analyzed: iti kopa āṭopa visaṅkaṭam vadatyām mātari rāja putrī bhaya lajjā nata ānanam provāca amba
translated: When his mother said this, her face contorted with anger and anxiety, the princess, with a face downcast with fear and shame, said: Mother,

original: sākṣān nārāyaṇaḥ pratyahaṃ garuḍārūḍho niśi samāyāti /
analyzed: sākṣāt nārāyaṇaḥ pratyaham garuḍa ārūḍhaḥ niśi samāyāti
translated: Nārāyaṇa himself comes every day, mounted on Garuḍa, at night.

original: ced asatyaṃ mama vākyam /
analyzed: ced asatyam mama vākyam
translated: If my words are false,

original: tat svacakṣuṣā vilokayatu niguḍhatarā niśīthe bhagavantaṃ ramākāntam /
analyzed: tat sva cakṣuṣā vilokayatu niguḍhatarā niśīthe bhagavantam ramākāntam
translated: then let her secretly watch the Lord Rāma's lover at midnight with her own eyes.

original: tac chrutvā sāpi prahasitavadanā pulakāṅkitasarvāṅgī satvaraṃ rājānam ūcedeva /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sā api prahasita vadanā pulaka aṅkita sarva aṅgī sa tvaram rājānam ūcet eva
translated: Hearing that, she too, with a smiling face and her whole body covered with horripilation, quickly said to the king: Your Majesty,

original: diṣṭyā vardhase /
analyzed: diṣṭyā vardhase
translated: by good fortune you prosper.

original: nityam eva niśīthe bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ kanyakāpārśve'bhyeti /
analyzed: nityam eva niśīthe bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ kanyakā pārśvebhyaḥ iti
translated: The Lord Nārāyaṇa always comes at night to the side of the princess.

original: tena gāndharvavivāhena sā vivāhitā /
analyzed: tena gāndharva vivāhena sā vivāhitā
translated: Therefore, she is married by the Gandharva form of marriage.

original: tad adya tvayā mayā ca rātrau vātāyanagatābhyāṃ niśīthe draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tat adya tvayā mayā ca rātrau vātāyana gatābhyām niśīthe draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: So tonight, you and I, going to the window, should watch him at midnight.

original: yato na sa mānuṣaiḥ sahālāpaṃ karoti /
analyzed: yatas na sa mānuṣaiḥ saha ālāpam karoti
translated: For he does not converse with humans.

original: tac chrutvā harṣitasya rājñas tad dinaṃ varṣaśataprāyam iva kathañcij jagāma /
analyzed: tat śrutvā harṣitasya rājñaḥ tat dinam varṣa śata prāyam iva kathañcid jagāma
translated: Hearing that, the king, delighted, somehow spent that day, which seemed like a hundred years.

original: tatas tu rātrau nibhṛto bhūtvā rājñīsahito rājā vātāyanasstho gaganāsaktadṛṣṭir yāvat tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tatas tu rātrau nibhṛtaḥ bhūtvā rājñī sahitaḥ rājā gagana āsakta dṛṣṭiḥ yāvat tiṣṭhati
translated: Then, at night, the king, together with the queen, remaining silent, stood on the roof, his eyes fixed on the sky.

original: tāvat tasmin samaye garuḍārūḍhaṃ taṃ śaṅkacakragadāpadmahastaṃ yathoktacihnāṅkitaṃ vyomno 'vatarantaṃ nārāyaṇam apaśyat /
analyzed: tāvat tasmin samaye garuḍa ārūḍham tam śaṅka cakra gadā padma hastam yathā ukta cihna aṅkitam vyomnaḥ nārāyaṇam apaśyat
translated: While he was standing there, at that time he saw Nārāyaṇa descending from the sky, mounted on Garuḍa, with a conch, discus, mace, and lotus in his hands, marked with the aforementioned signs.

original: tataḥ sudhāpūraplāvitam ivātmānaṃ manyamānas tām uvācapriye /
analyzed: tatas sudhā pūra plāvitam iva ātmānam manyamānaḥ tām uvāca priye
translated: Then, considering himself as if flooded with nectar, he said to her, My dear,

original: nāsty anyo dhanyataro loke mattas tvattaś ca /
analyzed: na asti anyaḥ dhanyataraḥ loke mattaḥ tvattaḥ ca
translated: there is no one more fortunate in the world than me and you.

original: tat prasūtiṃ nārāyaṇo bhajate /
analyzed: tat prasūtim nārāyaṇaḥ bhajate
translated: Nārāyaṇa worships your offspring.

original: tatsiddhāḥ sarve'smākaṃ manorathāḥ /
analyzed: tad siddhāḥ sarve asmākam manorathāḥ
translated: All our desires are fulfilled by that.

original: adhunā jāmātṛprabhāveṇa sakalām api vasumatīṃ vaśyāṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: adhunā jāmātṛ prabhāveṇa sakalām api vasumatīm vaśyām kariṣyāmi
translated: Now, by the power of my son-in-law, I will bring the entire earth under my control.

original: evaṃ niścitya sarvaiḥ sīmādhipaiḥ saha maryādāvyatikramam akarot /
analyzed: evam niścitya sarvaiḥ sīmādhipaiḥ saha maryādā vyatikramam akarot
translated: Having thus resolved, he transgressed the boundaries along with all the neighboring kings.

original: te ca taṃ maryādāvyatikrameṇa vartamānam ālokya sarve sametya tena saha vigrahaṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: te ca tam maryādā vyatikrameṇa vartamānam ālokya sarve sametya tena saha vigraham cakruḥ
translated: And they, seeing him transgress the boundaries, all gathered together and waged war with him.

original: atrāntare sa rājā devīmukhena tāṃ duhitaram uvācaputri /
analyzed: atrā antare sa rājā devī mukhena tām duhitaram uvāca putri
translated: In the meantime, the king said to his daughter through Queen Mukha, Daughter,

original: tvayi duhitari vartamānāyāṃ nārāyaṇe bhagavati jāmātari sthite tat kim evaṃ yujyate yat sarve pārthivā mayā saha vigrahaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: tvayi duhitari vartamānāyām nārāyaṇe bhagavati jāmātari sthite tat kim evam yujyate yat sarve pārthivāḥ mayā saha vigraham kurvanti
translated: With you as a daughter, and Narayana, the Blessed One, as a son-in-law, how is it proper that all the kings should make war on me along with me?

original: tat sambodhyo 'dya tvayā nijabhartā /
analyzed: tat sambodhyaḥ dya tvayā nija bhartā
translated: Therefore, you should admonish your husband today,

original: yathā mama śatrūn vyāpādayati /
analyzed: yathā mama śatrūn vyāpādayati
translated: so that he may destroy my enemies.

original: tatas tayā sa kauliko rātrau savinayam abhihitaḥbhagavan /
analyzed: tatas tayā sa kaulikaḥ rātrau sa vinayam abhihitaḥ bhagavan
translated: Then she respectfully said to the Koliya at night, Blessed One,

original: tvayi jāmātari sthite mama tāto yac chatrubhiḥ paribhūyate tan na yuktam /
analyzed: tvayi jāmātari sthite mama tātaḥ yat śatrubhiḥ paribhūyate tat na yuktam
translated: it is not proper that my father should be humiliated by enemies while you, his son-in-law, are present.

original: tat prasādaṃ kṛtvā sarvāṃs tān śatrūn vyāpādaya /
analyzed: tat prasādam kṛtvā sarvān tān śatrūn vyāpādaya
translated: Therefore, having shown favor, destroy all those enemies.

original: kaulika āhasubhage /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ āha subhage
translated: The Koliya said, Fair lady,

original: kiyanmātrās tv ete tava pituḥ śatravaḥ /
analyzed: kiyanmātrāḥ tu ete tava pituḥ śatravaḥ
translated: how many are these enemies of your father?

original: tadviśvastā bhava /
analyzed: tad viśvastā bhava
translated: Be confident in that.

original: kṣaṇenāpi sudarśanacakreṇa sarvāṃs tilaśaḥ khaṇḍayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: kṣaṇena api sudarśana cakreṇa sarvān tilaśas khaṇḍayiṣyāmi
translated: In an instant, I will shatter them all to pieces with the Sudarshana discus.

original: atha gacchatā kālena sarvadeśaṃ śatrubhir udvāsya sa rājā prākāraśeṣaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: atha gacchatā kālena sarva deśam śatrubhiḥ udvāsya sa rājā prākāra śeṣaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then, as time passed, the king, having been driven out of all the country by his enemies, was left with only the walls of his city remaining.

original: tathāpi vāsudevarūpadharaṃ kaulikam ajānan rāja nityam eva viśeṣataḥ karpūrāgurukastūrikādiparimalaviśeṣān
analyzed: tathā api vāsudeva rūpa dharam kaulikam a jānan rāja nityam eva viśeṣataḥ karpūra aguru kastūrikā ādi parimala viśeṣān
translated: Still, not knowing that the Kaula practitioner had the form of Vāsudeva, the king, always and especially, sent special fragrances of camphor, agaru, musk, etc.,

original: nānāprakāravastrapuṣpabhakṣyapeyāṃś ca preṣayan duhitṛmukhena tam ūcebhagavan /
analyzed: nānā prakāra vastra puṣpa bhakṣya peyān ca preṣayan duhitṛ mukhena tam ūce bhagavan
translated: and various kinds of clothes, flowers, food, and drink, and spoke to him through the mouth of his daughter: Lord,

original: prabhāte nūnaṃ sthānabhaṅgo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: prabhāte nūnam sthāna bhaṅgaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: in the morning, the destruction of the place will surely happen.

original: yato yavasendhanakṣayaḥ sañjātas tathā sarvo 'pi janaḥ prahārair jarjaritadehaḥ saṃvṛtto yoddhum akṣamaḥ pracuro mṛtaś ca /
analyzed: yatas yavasa indhana kṣayaḥ sañjātaḥ tathā sarvaḥ pi janaḥ prahāraiḥ jarjarita dehaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ yoddhum akṣamaḥ pracuraḥ mṛtaḥ ca
translated: Because the hay and fuel are exhausted, and all the people have become battered in body from beatings, unable to fight, and many have died.

original: tad evaṃ jñātvātra kāle yad ucitaṃ bhavati tad vidheyam iti /
analyzed: tat evam jñātvā atra kāle yat ucitam bhavati tat vidheyam iti
translated: Knowing this, whatever is appropriate at this time should be done.

original: tac chrutvā kauliko 'py acintayatsthānabhaṅge jāte mamānayā saha viyogo bhaviṣyati tasmād garuḍam āruhya sāyudham ātmānam ākāśe darśayāmi
analyzed: tat śrutvā kaulikaḥ pi acintayat sthāna bhaṅge jāte mama anayā saha viyogaḥ bhaviṣyati tasmāt garuḍam āruhya sa āyudham ātmānam ākāśe darśayāmi
translated: Hearing this, the Kaula practitioner also thought, When the destruction of the place happens, I will be separated from this girl. Therefore, mounting Garuḍa, I will show myself in the sky with my weapons.

original: kadācin māṃ vāsudevaṃ manyamānās te sāśaṅkā rājño yoddhṛbhir hanyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: kadācid mām vāsudevam manyamānāḥ te sa āśaṅkāḥ rājñaḥ yoddhṛbhiḥ hanyate uktam ca
translated: Perhaps they, thinking me to be Vāsudeva, will be suspicious and the king's warriors will kill me. And it is said:

original: nirviṣeṇāpi sarpeṇa kartavyā mahatī phaṇā /
analyzed: nirviṣeṇa api sarpeṇa kartavyā mahatī phaṇā
translated: Even a harmless snake should make a great hood.

original: viṣaṃ bhavatu vā mābhūt phaṇāṭopo bhayaṅkaraḥ // ///
analyzed: viṣam bhavatu vā mā abhūt phaṇa āṭopaḥ bhayaṅkaraḥ
translated: Let there be poison or not, the hood-expansion is terrifying.

original: atha yadi mama sthānārtham udyatasya mṛtyur bhaviṣyati tad api sundarataram / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atha yadi mama sthāna artham udyatasya mṛtyuḥ bhaviṣyati tat api sundarataram uktam ca
translated: Now, if death will befall me while striving for my position, that too is more beautiful. And it is said:

original: gavām arthe brāhmaṇārthe svāmyarthe svīkṛte'thavā /
analyzed: gavām arthe brāhmaṇa arthe svāmi arthe
translated: For the sake of cows, for the sake of Brahmins, for the sake of one's master, or even for one's own sake,

original: sthānārthe yas tyajet prāṇāṃs tasya lokāḥ sanātanāḥ // ///
analyzed: sthāna arthe yaḥ tyajet prāṇān tasya lokāḥ sanātanāḥ
translated: he who gives up his life for the sake of his position, for him are the eternal worlds.

original: candre maṇḍalasaṃsthe vigṛhyate rāhuṇā dinādhīśaḥ /
analyzed: candre maṇḍala saṃsthe vigṛhyate rāhuṇā dinādhīśaḥ
translated: When the moon is in its orb, it is seized by Rahu, the lord of the day.

original: śaraṇāgatena sārdhaṃ vipad api tejasvinā ślāghyā // ///
analyzed: śaraṇa āgatena sārdham vipad api tejasvinā ślāghyā
translated: Even misfortune with one who has come for refuge is praiseworthy for the illustrious.

original: evaṃ niścitya pratyūṣe dantadhāvanaṃ kṛtvā tāṃ provācasubhage /
analyzed: evam niścitya pratyūṣe dantadhāvanam kṛtvā tām provāca subhage
translated: Having thus resolved, in the morning, after cleaning his teeth, he said to her: O fortunate one!

original: samastaiḥ śatrubhir hatair annaṃ pānaṃ cāsvādayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: samastaiḥ śatrubhiḥ hataiḥ annam pānam ca āsvādayiṣyāmi
translated: After all the enemies have been killed, I will enjoy food and drink.

original: kiṃ bahunā / tvayāpi saha saṅgamaṃ tataḥ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: kim bahunā tvayā api saha saṅgamam tatas kariṣyāmi
translated: What is the use of much talk? I will then make love with you too.

original: paraṃ vācyas tvayātmapitā yat prabhāte prabhūtena sainyena saha nagarān niṣkramya yoddhavyam /
analyzed: param vācyaḥ tvayā ātma pitā yat prabhāte prabhūtena sainyena saha nagarāt niṣkramya yoddhavyam
translated: But you must tell your father that in the morning he should come out of the city with a large army and fight.

original: ahaṃ cākāśasthita eva sarvāṃs tān nistejasaḥ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham ca ākāśa sthitaḥ eva sarvān tān nistejasaḥ kariṣyāmi
translated: And I, remaining in the sky, will deprive all of them of their splendor.

original: paścāt sukhena bhavatā hantavyāḥ yadi punar ahaṃ tān svayam eva sūdayāmi tat teṣāṃ pāpātmanāṃ vaikuṇṭhīyā gatiḥ syāt /
analyzed: paścāt sukhena bhavatā hantavyāḥ yadi punar aham tān svayam eva sūdayāmi tat teṣām pāpa ātmanām vaikuṇṭhīyā gatiḥ syāt
translated: If I myself were to kill them, those sinful ones would attain the Vaikuṇṭha abode.

original: tasmāt te tathā kartavyā yathā palāyanto hanyamānāḥ svargaṃ na gacchanti /
analyzed: tasmāt te tathā kartavyāḥ yathā palāyantaḥ hanyamānāḥ svargam na gacchanti
translated: Therefore, they should be treated in such a way that while fleeing and being killed, they do not go to heaven.

original: sāpi tad ākarṇya pituḥ samīpaṃ gatvā sarvaṃ vṛttāntaṃ nyavedayat /
analyzed: sā api tat ākarṇya pituḥ samīpam gatvā sarvam vṛttāntam nyavedayat
translated: She too, having heard that, went to her father and reported the entire incident.

original: rājāpi tasyā vākyaṃ śraddadhānaḥ pratyūṣe samutthāya samunnaddhasainyo yuddhārthaṃ niścakrāma /
analyzed: rājā api tasyāḥ vākyam śraddadhānaḥ pratyūṣe samutthāya samunnaddha sainyaḥ yuddha artham niścakrāma
translated: The king too, believing her words, rose at dawn, and with his army ready for battle, set out.

original: kauliko 'pi maraṇe kṛtaniścayaś cāpapāṇir gaganagatir garuḍārūḍho yuddhāya prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ pi maraṇe kṛta niścayaḥ cāpa pāṇiḥ gagana gatiḥ garuḍa ārūḍhaḥ yuddhāya prasthitaḥ
translated: Kauṇḍinya too, having made up his mind to die, with bow in hand, mounted on Garuḍa, set out for battle.

original: atrāntare bhagavatā nārāyaṇenātītānāgatavartamānavedinā /
analyzed: atrā antare bhagavatā nārāyaṇena atīta anāgata vartamāna vedinā
translated: In the meantime, Lord Nārāyaṇa, who knows the past, future and present,

original: smṛtamātro vainateyaḥ samprāpto vihasya proktaḥbho garutman /
analyzed: smṛta mātraḥ vainateyaḥ samprāptaḥ vihasya proktaḥ bho garutman
translated: was remembered. Garuḍa arrived and said with a smile, O Garuḍa,

original: jānāsi tvaṃ yan mama rūpeṇa kauliko dārumayagaruḍe samārūḍho rājakanyāṃ kāmayate /
analyzed: jānāsi tvam yat mama rūpeṇa kaulikaḥ dāru maya garuḍe samārūḍhaḥ rāja kanyām kāmayate
translated: you know that Kauṇḍinya, in my form, mounted on a wooden Garuḍa, desires the princess.

original: so 'bravītdeva /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt deva
translated: He said, O God,

original: sarvaṃ jñāyate tac ceṣṭitam /
analyzed: sarvam jñāyate tat ceṣṭitam
translated: all his actions are known.

original: tat kiṃ kurmaḥ sāmpratam /🔽śrībhagavān āhaadya kauliko maraṇe kṛtaniścayo vihitaniyamo yuddhārthe vinirgataḥ sa nūnaṃ pradhānakṣatriyair militvā vāsudevo garuḍaś
analyzed: tat kim kurmaḥ sāmpratam  śrī bhagavān āha adya kaulikaḥ maraṇe kṛta niścayaḥ vihita niyamaḥ yuddha arthe vinirgataḥ sa nūnam pradhāna kṣatriyaiḥ militvā vāsudevaḥ garuḍaḥ
translated: What shall we do now?

original: ca nipātitaḥ /
analyzed: ca nipātitaḥ
translated: The Lord said: Today, Kaulīka, having made up his mind to die, having observed the rules, having gone out for battle, he has certainly been brought down by the chief Kshatriyas, along with Vāsudeva and Garuḍa.

original: tataḥ paraṃ loko 'yam āvayoḥ pūjāṃ na kariṣyati /
analyzed: tatas param lokaḥ yam āvayoḥ pūjām na kariṣyati
translated: After that, this world will not offer worship to us.

original: tatas tvaṃ drutataraṃ tatra dārumayagaruḍe saṅkramaṇaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tatas tvam drutataram tatra dāru maya garuḍe saṅkramaṇam kuru
translated: Therefore, you quickly ascend that wooden Garuḍa.

original: aham api kaulikaśarīre praveśaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham api kaulika śarīre praveśam kariṣyāmi
translated: I too will enter the body of Kaulīka.

original: yena sa śatrūn vyāpādayati /
analyzed: yena sa śatrūn vyāpādayati
translated: So that he may slay the enemies.

original: tataś ca śatruvadhād āvayor māhātmyavṛddhiḥ syāt /🔽atha garuḍe tatheti pratipanne śrībhagavannārāyaṇas taccharīre saṅkramaṇam akarot /🔽tato bhagavanmāhātmyena gaganasthaḥ sa kaulikaḥ śaṅkhacakragadācāpacihnitaḥ kṣaṇād eva līlayaiva samastān api pradhānakṣatriyān nistejasaś
analyzed: tatas ca śatru vadhāt āvayoḥ māhātmya vṛddhiḥ syāt  atha garuḍe tathā iti pratipanne śrī bhagavat nārāyaṇaḥ tad śarīre saṅkramaṇam akarot  tatas bhagavat māhātmyena gagana sthaḥ sa kaulikaḥ śaṅkha cakra gadā cāpa cihnitaḥ kṣaṇāt eva līlayā eva samastān api pradhāna kṣatriyān nistejasaḥ
translated: And then, by the slaying of the enemies, there will be an increase in our greatness.🔽Then, when Garuḍa agreed, Lord Nārāyaṇa entered that body.

original: cakārar /
analyzed: cakāraḥ
translated: Then, by the greatness of the Lord, that Kaulīka, marked with a conch, discus, mace, and bow, instantly became radiant in the sky, and playfully deprived all the chief Kshatriyas of their splendor.

original: tatas tena rājñā svasainyaparivṛtena saṅgrāme jitā nihatāś ca te sarve'pi śatravaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tena rājñā sva sainya parivṛtena saṅgrāme jitāḥ nihatāḥ ca te sarve api śatravaḥ
translated: Then, surrounded by his own army, the king defeated and killed all those enemies in battle.

original: jātaś ca lokamadhye pravādo /
analyzed: jātaḥ ca loka madhye pravādaḥ
translated: And a rumor arose in the world:

original: yathāanena viṣṇujāmātṛprabhāveṇa sarve śatravo nihatā iti /
analyzed: yathā aanena viṣṇu jāmātṛ prabhāveṇa sarve śatravaḥ nihatāḥ iti
translated: By the power of this son-in-law of Vishnu, all the enemies have been killed.

original: kauliko 'pi tān hatān dṛṣṭvā pramuditamanā gaganād avatīrṇaḥ san /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ pi tān hatān dṛṣṭvā pramudita manāḥ gaganāt avatīrṇaḥ san
translated: The Kaulika, having seen them killed, descended from the sky with a joyful mind.

original: yāvad rājāmātyapauralokās taṃ nagaravāstavyaṃ kaulikaṃ paśyanti tataḥ pṛṣṭaḥ kim etad iti /
analyzed: yāvat rāja amātya paura lokāḥ tam nagara vāstavyam kaulikam paśyanti tatas pṛṣṭaḥ kim etat iti
translated: When the king, ministers, and people saw that Kaulika who lived in the city, they asked him, What is this?

original: tataḥ so 'pi mūlād ārabhya sarvaṃ prāgvṛttāntaṃ nyavedayat /
analyzed: tatas saḥ u pi mūlāt ārabhya sarvam prāc vṛttāntam nyavedayat
translated: Then he also reported the entire previous account from the beginning.

original: tataś ca kaulikasāhasānurañjitamanasā śatruvadhād avāptatejasā rājñā sā rājakanyā sakalajanapratyakṣaṃ vivāhavidhinā tasmai samarpitā
analyzed: tatas ca kaulika sāhasa anurañjita manasā śatru vadhāt avāpta tejasā rājñā sā rāja kanyā sakala jana pratyakṣam vivāha vidhinā tasmai samarpitā  /
translated: And then, with a mind delighted by the Kaulika's valor and with the splendor gained from killing the enemies, the king publicly bestowed the princess on him in a marriage ceremony.

original: deśaś ca pradattaḥ /
analyzed: deśaḥ ca pradattaḥ
translated: And a country was given to him.

original: kauliko 'pi tayā sārdhaṃ pañcaprakāraṃ jīvalokasāraṃ viṣayasukham anubhavan kālaṃ nināya /

translated: The Kaulika, enjoying the essence of the five kinds of worldly pleasures with her, spent his time.

original: atas tūcyate suprayuktasya dambhasya iti /
analyzed: atas tu ucyate su prayuktasya dambhasya iti
translated: Therefore, it is said: Of well-used hypocrisy.

original: tac chrutvā karaṭaka āhabhadra / asty evam /
analyzed: tat śrutvā karaṭakaḥ āha bhadra asti evam
translated: Hearing this, Karataka said, “My friend, it is so.

analyzed: param tathā api mahat me bhayam
translated: But still I am very afraid.

original: yato buddhimān sañjīvako raudraś ca siṃhaḥ /
analyzed: yatas buddhimān sañjīvakaḥ raudraḥ ca siṃhaḥ
translated: For Life-Giving is intelligent and the lion is fierce.

analyzed: yadi api te buddhi prāgalbhyam tathā api tvam piṅgalakāt tam viyojayitum asamarthaḥ eva
translated: Even if you are bold in intellect, you are still unable to separate him from Tawny.

original: damanaka āhabhrātaḥ /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha bhrātar
translated: Dāmanaka said, “Brother,

translated: even the incapable are capable. And it is said:

original: upāyena hi yac chakyaṃ na tac chakyaṃ parākramaiḥ /🔽kākī kanakasūtreṇa kṛṣṇasarpam aghātayat // ///

translated: For what can be done by means of a stratagem cannot be done by valor.🔽A crow killed a black snake with a golden chain.

original: karaṭaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Karataka asked, “How did that happen?”

original: so 'bravīt🔽kathā
analyzed: saḥ bravīt  kathā
translated: He replied:

original: vāyasadampatikathā
analyzed: vāyasa dampati kathā
translated: The Story of the Crow Couple

original: asti kasmiṃścit pradeśe mahān nyagrodhapādapaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid pradeśe mahān nyagrodha pādapaḥ
translated: There was a large banyan tree in a certain place.

original: tatra vāyasadampatī prativasataḥ sma /
analyzed: tatra vāyasa dampatī prativasataḥ sma
translated: A crow couple lived there.

original: atha tayoḥ prasavakāle vṛkṣavivarān niṣkramya kṛṣṇasarpaḥ sadaiva tadapatyāni bhakṣayati /
analyzed: atha tayoḥ prasava kāle vṛkṣa vivarāt niṣkramya kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ sadā eva tad apatyāni bhakṣayati
translated: Then, at the time of their offspring, a black snake always came out of a hole in the tree and ate their young.

original: tatas tau nirvedād anyavṛkṣamūlanivāsinaṃ priyasuhṛdaṃ śṛgālaṃ gatvocatuḥbhadra /
analyzed: tatas tau nirvedāt anya vṛkṣa mūla nivāsinam priya suhṛdam śṛgālam gatvā ūcatuḥ bhadra
translated: Then, out of despair, they went to a jackal who lived at the foot of another tree and was a dear friend, and said, “Sir,

analyzed: kim evaṃvidhe sañjāte āvayoḥ kartavyam bhavati
translated: What should we do in such a situation?

analyzed: tat kathyatām tad rakṣā artham kaścid upāyaḥ
translated: Please tell us some means to protect them.

original: yasya kṣetraṃ nadītīre bhāryā ca parasaṅgatā /
analyzed: yasya kṣetram nadī tīre bhāryā ca para saṅga tā
translated: Whose field is on the river bank, and whose wife is attached to another,

analyzed: sa sarpe ca gṛhe vāsaḥ katham syāt tasya nirvṛtiḥ

original: anyac ca🔽sarpayukte gṛhe vāso mṛtyur eva na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: anyat ca  sarpa yukte gṛhe vāsaḥ mṛtyuḥ eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And furthermore,🔽Living in a house with a snake is undoubtedly death itself.

original: yad grāmānte vaset sarpas tasya syāt prāṇasaṃśayaḥ // ///
analyzed: yat grāma ante vaset sarpaḥ tasya syāt prāṇa saṃśayaḥ
translated: If a snake lives at the edge of a village, there is doubt about one's life.

original: asmākam api tatrasthitānāṃ pratidinaṃ prāṇasaṃśayaḥ /🔽sa āhanātra viṣaye svalpo 'pi viṣādaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam api tatrasthitānām pratidinam prāṇa saṃśayaḥ  saḥ āha na atra viṣaye su alpaḥ pi viṣādaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: For us too, living there, there is a doubt about our lives every day.🔽He said, You should not be even slightly sad about this matter.

original: nūnaṃ sa lubdho nopāyam antareṇa vadhyaḥ syāt /🔽upāyena jayo yādṛg ripos tādṛṅ na hetibhiḥ /
analyzed: nūnam sa lubdhaḥ na upāyam antareṇa vadhyaḥ syāt  upāyena jayaḥ yādṛś ripoḥ tādṛś na hetibhiḥ
translated: Surely, that greedy one cannot be killed without means.🔽Victory through means is like that of an enemy, not through weapons.

original: upāyajño 'lpakāyo 'pi na śūraiḥ paribhūyate // ///
analyzed: upāya jñaḥ lpa kāyaḥ pi na śūraiḥ paribhūyate
translated: One who knows means, even with a small body, is not overpowered by heroes.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

translated: Having eaten many fish, the best, the worst, and the middling,

original: so 'bravīt🔽kathā
analyzed: saḥ bravīt  kathā
translated: He said:

analyzed: baka kulīraka kathā
translated: The Story of the Crane and the Owl

original: asti kasmiṃścid vanapradeśe nānājalacarasanāthaṃ mahat saraḥ /

original: sa āhavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ āhavat sa
translated: He said, Dear one,

original: satyam upalakṣitaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: satyam upalakṣitam bhavatā
translated: it is true that you have observed it.

original: mayā hi matsyādanaṃ prati paramavairāgyatayā sāmprataṃ prāyopaveśanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: mayā hi matsyādanam prati parama vairāgya tayā sāmpratam prāya upaveśanam kṛtam
translated: For I have now undertaken a fast unto death out of supreme dispassion for eating fish.

original: kiṃ tad vairāgyakāraṇam /🔽sa prāhavatsa /

original: aham asmin sarasi jāto vṛddhiṃ gataś ca /

original: uktaṃ ca varāhamihireṇa
analyzed: uktam ca varāhamihireṇa
translated: And it is said by Varāhamihira:

analyzed: dvādaśa varṣāṇi tadā nahi varṣati vāsavau bhūmau
translated: then Indra will not rain on the earth for twelve years.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca

translated: Resorting to the moon situated in the middle of the constellation Rohini,

analyzed: candram asya śaraṇīkṛtāḥ janāḥ  kvāpi yānti śiśu pācita aśanāḥ
translated: People, their food exhausted by the child,

analyzed: asmin śuṣke yaiḥ saha aham vṛddhim gataḥ

analyzed: kecid ca makara godhā śiśumāra jalahasti prabhṛtayaḥ svayam eva gacchanti

translated: Is there any means by which we can be protected?

original: eṣyati /

original: tad yadi mama pṛṣṭhaṃ kaścid ārohati /

translated: If someone can climb onto my back,

analyzed: tat aham tam tatra nayāmi
translated: then I will take him there.

original: atha te tatra viśvāsam āpannāḥ /
analyzed: atha te tatra viśvāsam āpannāḥ
translated: Then they became confident in that,

analyzed: tāta mātula bhrātar iti bruvāṇāḥ aham pūrvam aham pūrvam iti samantāt paritasthuḥ

translated: And he, with a wicked intention, gradually placed them on his back, and having reached a rock not too far from the pond,

original: tasyām ākṣipya svecchayā bhakṣayitvā bhūyo 'pi jalāśayaṃ samāsādya jalacarṇāṇāṃ mithyāvārtāsandeśakair
analyzed: tasyām ākṣipya sva icchayā bhakṣayitvā bhūyas pi jalāśayam samāsādya jalacarṇāṇām mithyā vārtā sandeśakaiḥ
translated: Having thrown her down and eaten her at will, he returned to the water and, delighting the minds of the water creatures with false news and messages,

original: manāṃsi rañjayan nityam evāhāravṛttim akarot /
analyzed: manāṃsi rañjayan nityam eva āhāra vṛttim akarot
translated: he always made a living by eating.

original: anyasmin dine ca kulīrakeṇoktaḥmāma /
analyzed: anyasmin dine ca kulīrakeṇa uktaḥ māma
translated: And on another day, the dove said to him:

original: mayā saha te prathamaḥ snehasambhāṣaḥ sañjātaḥ /
analyzed: mayā saha te prathamaḥ sneha sambhāṣaḥ sañjātaḥ
translated: My first affectionate conversation with you has taken place.

original: tat kiṃ māṃ parityajyānyān nayasi /
analyzed: tat kim mām parityajya anyān nayasi
translated: So why do you abandon me and take others?

original: tasmād adya me prāṇatrāṇaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tasmāt adya me prāṇa trāṇam kuru
translated: Therefore, save my life today.

original: tad ākarṇya so 'pi duṣṭāśayaś cintitavānnirviṇṇo 'haṃ matsyamāṃsādanena tad adyainaṃ kulīrakaṃ vyañjanasthāne karomi /

translated: Hearing that, the evil-minded one thought: I am disgusted with eating fish meat, so today I will make this dove into a dish.

original: iti vicintya taṃ pṛṣṭe samāropya tāṃ vadhyaśilām uddiśya prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: iti vicintya tam pṛṣṭe samāropya tām vadhyaśilām uddiśya prasthitaḥ
translated: Thinking this, he placed it on his back and set out towards the execution stone.

original: kulīrako 'pi dūrād evāsthiparvataṃ śilāśrayam avalokya mastyāsthīni parijñāya tam apṛcchatmāma /
analyzed: kulīrakaḥ pi dūrāt eva asthi parvatam śilā āśrayam avalokya mastya asthīni parijñāya tam apṛcchat māma
translated: The dove, seeing from afar the mountain of bones, a stone shelter, recognized the skull bones and asked him: Sir,

original: kiyad dūre sa jalāśayaḥ /
analyzed: kiyat dūre sa jalāśayaḥ
translated: how far is that water?

original: madīyabhāreṇātiśrāntas tvam /
analyzed: madīya bhāreṇa ati śrāntaḥ tvam

original: tat kathaya /
analyzed: tat kathaya
translated: So tell me.

original: so 'pi mandadhīr jalacaro 'yam iti matvā sthale na prabhavatīti sasmitam idam āhakulīraka /
analyzed: saḥ pi manda dhīḥ jalacaraḥ yam iti matvā sthale na prabhavati iti sa smitam idam āha kulīraka
translated: The crow, thinking that the water bird was slow-witted, said with a smile: “O dove!

original: kuto 'nyo jalāśayaḥ /
analyzed: kutas nyaḥ jalāśayaḥ
translated: Where else is there a body of water?

original: mama prāṇayātreyam /
analyzed: mama prāṇa yātrā iyam
translated: This is my livelihood.

original: tasmāt smaryatām ātmano 'bhīṣṭadevatā /
analyzed: tasmāt smaryatām ātmanaḥ bhīṣṭadevatā
translated: Therefore, remember your chosen deity.

original: tvām apy anyāṃ śilāyāṃ nikṣipya bhakṣayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tvām api anyām śilāyām nikṣipya bhakṣayiṣyāmi
translated: I will put you on another rock and eat you too.”

original: ity uktavati tasmin svavadanadaṃśadvayena mṛṇālanāladhavalāyāṃ mṛdugrīvāyāṃ gṛhīto mṛtaś ca /
analyzed: iti uktavati tasmin sva vadana daṃśa dvayena mṛṇāla nāla dhavalāyām mṛdu grīvāyām gṛhītaḥ mṛtaḥ ca
translated: When he said this, the dove seized him with both beaks on his soft neck, which was as white as a lotus stalk, and died.

original: atha sa tāṃ bakagrīvāṃ samādāya śanaiḥ śanais taj jalāśayam āsasāda /
analyzed: atha sa tām baka grīvām samādāya śanais śanais tat jalāśayam āsasāda
translated: Then the crow took the dove's neck and slowly approached that body of water.

original: tataḥ sarvair eva jalacaraiḥ pṛṣṭaḥbhoḥ kulīraka /
analyzed: tatas sarvaiḥ eva jalacaraiḥ pṛṣṭaḥ bhoḥ kulīraka
translated: Then all the water birds asked him: O dove!

original: kiṃ nivṛttas tvam /
analyzed: kim nivṛttaḥ tvam
translated: Why have you returned?

original: sa mātulo 'pi nāyātaḥ /
analyzed: sa mātulaḥ pi na āyātaḥ
translated: And your uncle has not come.

original: tat kiṃ cirayati /
analyzed: tat kim cirayati
translated: So why are you delaying?

original: vayaṃ sarve sotksukāḥ kṛtakṣaṇās tiṣṭhāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam sarve sa utksukāḥ kṛtakṣaṇāḥ tiṣṭhāmaḥ
translated: We are all eager and waiting for the right moment.

original: evaṃ tair abhihite kulīrako 'pi vihasyovācamūrkhāḥ /
analyzed: evam taiḥ abhihite vihasya uvāca mūrkhāḥ
translated: When they said this, the dove also laughed and said: Fools!

original: sarve jalacarās tena mithyāvādinā vañcayitvā nātidūre śilātale prakṣipya bhakṣitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve jalacarāḥ tena mithyā vādinā vañcayitvā na atidūre śilā tale prakṣipya bhakṣitāḥ
translated: He, the false speaker, deceived you all, threw you on a rock not too far away, and ate you.

original: tan mamāyuḥśeṣatayā tasya viśvāsaghātakasyābhiprāyaṃ jñātvā grīveyam ānītā /
analyzed: tat mama āyuḥ śeṣa tayā tasya viśvāsa ghātakasya abhiprāyam jñātvā grīvā iyam ānītā
translated: So, knowing the intention of that faithless fellow, I brought his neck here, as a remainder of my life.

original: tad alaṃ sambhrameṇa /
analyzed: tat alam sambhrameṇa
translated: So, enough of this alarm.

original: adhunā sarvajalacarāṇāṃ kṣemaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adhunā sarva jalacarāṇām kṣemam bhaviṣyati
translated: Now all the water creatures will be safe.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmibhakṣayitvā bahūn matsyān iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi bhakṣayitvā bahūn matsyān iti
translated: That's why I say: 'Having eaten many fish...'

original: vāyasa āhabhadra /
analyzed: vāyasaḥ āha bhadra
translated: The crow said: 'Good sir,

original: tat kathaya kathaṃ sa duṣṭasarpo vadham upaiṣyati /
analyzed: tat kathaya katham sa duṣṭa sarpaḥ vadham upaiṣyati
translated: tell me, how will that wicked snake meet his end?'

original: śṛgāla āhagacchatu bhavān kañcin nagaraṃ rājādhiṣṭhānam /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ āha gacchatu bhavān kañcid nagaram rāja adhiṣṭhānam
translated: The jackal said: 'Go to some city, a royal seat.

original: tatra kasyāpi dhanino rājāmātyādeḥ pramādinaḥ kanakasūtraṃ hāraṃ vā gṛhītvā tatkoṭare prakṣipa /
analyzed: tatra kasya api dhaninaḥ rāja amātya ādeḥ pramādinaḥ kanaka sūtram hāram vā gṛhītvā tad koṭare prakṣipa
translated: There, taking a golden thread or necklace from some careless rich man, minister, or the like, put it in his hole.

original: yena sarpas tadgrahaṇena vadhyate /
analyzed: yena sarpaḥ tad grahaṇena vadhyate
translated: By that, the snake will be killed by seizing it.

original: tatkṣaṇāt kākaḥ kākī ca tad ākarṇyātmecchayotpatitau /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt kākaḥ kākī ca tat ākarṇya ātma icchayā utpatitau
translated: At that moment, the male and female crows, having heard that, flew away as they wished.

original: tataś ca kākī kiñcit saraḥ prāpya yāvat paśyati /
analyzed: tatas ca kākī kiñcid saraḥ prāpya yāvat paśyati
translated: And then the female crow, having reached a certain lake, saw

original: tāvat tanmadhye kasyacid rājño 'ntaḥpuraṃ jalāsannaṃ nyastakanakasūtraṃ muktamuktāhāravastrābharaṇaṃ jalakrīḍāṃ kurute /
analyzed: tāvat tad madhye kasyacid rājñaḥ ntaḥpuram jala āsannam nyasta kanaka sūtram mukta muktā hāra vastra ābharaṇam jala krīḍām kurute
translated: that in its middle, the harem of some king was playing in the water, with their golden threads and pearl necklaces and garments and ornaments placed nearby.

original: atha sā vāyasī kanakasūtram ekam ādāya svagṛhābhimukhaṃ pratasthe /
analyzed: atha sā vāyasī kanaka sūtram ekam ādāya sva gṛha abhimukham pratasthe
translated: Then the crow, taking a single golden thread, set out for her home.

original: tataś ca kañcukino varṣavarāś ca tannīyamānam upalakṣya gṛhītalaguḍāḥ satvaram anuyayuḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca kañcukinaḥ varṣavarāḥ ca tat nīyamānam upalakṣya gṛhīta laguḍāḥ sa tvaram anuyayuḥ
translated: And the eunuchs and chamberlains, noticing it being carried away, quickly followed, their cudgels raised.

original: kāky api sarpakoṭare tatkanakasūtraṃ prakṣipya sudūram avasthitā /
analyzed: kākī api sarpa koṭare tat kanaka sūtram prakṣipya su dūram avasthitā
translated: The crow also threw the golden thread into a snake's hole and stayed far away.

original: atha yāvad rājapuruṣās taṃ vṛkṣam āruhya tatkoṭaram avalokayanti /
analyzed: atha yāvat rāja puruṣāḥ tam vṛkṣam āruhya tat koṭaram avalokayanti
translated: Then, while the king's men climbed the tree and looked into the hole,

original: tāvat kṛṣṇasarpaḥ prasāritabhogas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tāvat kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ prasārita bhogaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: there was a black snake lying with its hood spread out.

original: tatas taṃ laguḍaprahāreṇa hatvā kanakasūtram ādāya yathābhilaṣitaṃ sthānaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tam laguḍa prahāreṇa hatvā kanaka sūtram ādāya yathā abhilaṣitam sthānam gatāḥ
translated: Then, having killed it with a cudgel blow, they took the golden thread and went to their desired place.

original: vāyasadampatī api tataḥ paraṃ sukhena vasataḥ /🔽ato 'haṃ bravīmiupāyena hi yat kuryāt iti /
analyzed: vāyasa dampatī api tatas param sukhena vasataḥ  atas ham bravīmi upāyena hi yat kuryāt iti
translated: And the crow couple lived happily from then on.

original: tan na kiṃcid iha buddhimatām asādhyam asti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat na kiṃcid iha buddhimatām asādhyam asti uktam ca
translated: Therefore I say: For what is done by means of a stratagem, nothing is unachievable for the wise here. And it is said:

original: yasya buddhir balaṃ tasya nirbuddhes tu kuto balam /
analyzed: yasya buddhiḥ balam tasya nirbuddheḥ tu kutas balam
translated: For he whose intellect is strong, where is the strength for one without intellect?

original: vane siṃho madonmattaḥ śaśakena nipātitaḥ // ///
analyzed: vane siṃhaḥ mada unmattaḥ śaśakena nipātitaḥ
translated: In the forest, a maddened lion was brought down by a hare.

original: karaṭaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Karataka asked how it happened.

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: The other said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: bhāsurakākhyasiṃhakathā
translated: The Story of the Lion Named Shining

original: kasmiṃścid vane bhāsurako nāma siṃhaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid vane bhāsurakaḥ nāma siṃhaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain forest, there lived a lion named Shining.

original: athāsau vīryātirekān nityam evānekān mṛgaśaśakādīn vyāpādayan nopararāma /
analyzed: atha asau vīrya atirekāt nityam eva anekān mṛga śaśaka ādīn vyāpādayan na upararāma
translated: Then, due to his excessive valor, he did not cease killing many deer, rabbits, and others every day.

original: athānyedyus tadvanajāḥ sarve sāraṅgavarāhamahiṣaśaśakādayo militvā tam abhyupetya procuḥsvāmin /
analyzed: atha anyedyus tad vana jāḥ sarve sāraṅga varāha mahiṣa śaśaka ādayaḥ militvā tam abhyupetya procuḥ svāmin
translated: Then, on another day, all the forest creatures, such as deer, boars, buffaloes, rabbits, and so on, gathered together, approached him, and said: Lord,

original: kim anena sakalamṛgavadhena nityam eva /🔽yatas tavaikenāpi mṛgeṇa tṛptir bhavati tat kriyatām asmābhiḥ saha samayadharmaḥ /
analyzed: kim anena sakala mṛga vadhena nityam eva  yatas tava ekena api mṛgeṇa tṛptiḥ bhavati tat kriyatām asmābhiḥ saha samaya dharmaḥ
translated: why do you always kill all the deer?🔽Since you can be satisfied with just one deer, let us make an agreement with you.

original: adyaprabhṛti tavātropaviṣṭasya jātikrameṇa pratidinam eko mṛgo bhakṣaṇārthaṃ sameṣyati /
analyzed: adya prabhṛti tava atra upaviṣṭasya jāti krameṇa pratidinam ekaḥ mṛgaḥ bhakṣaṇa artham sameṣyati
translated: From today onwards, in turn, one deer will come to you every day for you to eat, while you are sitting here.

original: evaṃ kṛte tava tāvat prāṇayātrā kleśaṃ vināpi bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam kṛte tava tāvat prāṇayātrā kleśam vinā api bhaviṣyati
translated: If this is done, you will be able to sustain your life without any trouble.

original: asmākaṃ ca punaḥ sarvocchedanaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: asmākam ca punar sarva ucchedanam na syāt
translated: And all of us will not be completely exterminated.

original: tad eṣa rājadharmo 'nuṣṭhīyatām / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat eṣa rāja dharmaḥ nuṣṭhīyatām uktam ca
translated: So, let this royal law be followed. And it is said:

original: śanaiḥ śanaiś ca yo rājyam upabhuṅkte yathābalam /
analyzed: śanais śanais ca yaḥ rājyam upabhuṅkte yathābalam
translated: He who enjoys the kingdom gradually, according to his strength,

original: rasāyanam iva prājñaḥ sa puṣṭiṃ paramāṃ vrajet // ///
analyzed: rasāyanam iva prājñaḥ sa puṣṭim paramām vrajet
translated: like an elixir, that wise one would attain supreme nourishment.

original: vidhinā mantrayuktena rūkṣāpi mathitāpi ca /
analyzed: vidhinā mantra yuktena rūkṣā api mathitā api ca
translated: Even if the land is rough or tilled, if tilled according to the rules and with mantras,

original: prayacchati phalaṃ bhūmir araṇīva hutāśanam // ///
analyzed: prayacchati phalam bhūmiḥ araṇī iva hutāśanam
translated: it gives fruit like a flint gives fire.

original: prajānāṃ pālanaṃ śasyaṃ svargakośasya vardhanam /
analyzed: prajānām pālanam śasyam svarga kośasya vardhanam
translated: The protection of subjects is praiseworthy, it increases the treasury of heaven.

original: pīḍanaṃ dharmanāśāya pāpāyāyaśase sthitam // ///🔽gopālena prajādhenor vittadugdhaṃ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ /
analyzed: pīḍanam dharma nāśāya pāpāya ayaśase sthitam  gopālena prajā dhenoḥ vitta dugdham śanais śanais
translated: Oppression leads to the destruction of dharma and to sin and infamy.🔽The king should slowly and slowly milk the wealth from the cow of subjects, like a cowherd.

original: pālanāt poṣaṇād grāhyaṃ nyāyyāṃ vṛttiṃ samācaret // ///
analyzed: pālanāt poṣaṇāt grāhyam nyāyyām vṛttim samācaret
translated: He should adopt a just livelihood by protecting and nourishing.

original: ajām iva prajāṃ mohād yo hanyāt pṛthivīpatim /
analyzed: ajām iva prajām mohāt yaḥ hanyāt pṛthivīpatim
translated: If a king out of delusion were to kill his subjects like a goat,

original: tasyaikā jāyate tṛptir na dvitīyā kathañcana // ///
analyzed: tasya ekā jāyate tṛptiḥ na dvitīyā kathañcana
translated: he would get satisfaction once, never a second time.

original: phalārthī nṛpatir lokān pālayed yatnam āsthitaḥ /
analyzed: phala arthī nṛpatiḥ lokān pālayet yatnam āsthitaḥ
translated: A king desiring fruits should protect the people, resorting to effort,

original: dānamānāditoyena mālākāro 'ṅkurān iva // ///
analyzed: dāna māna ādi toyena mālākāraḥ ṅkurān iva
translated: like a garland-maker with water from gifts and honor, like sprouts.

original: nṛpadīpo dhanasnehaṃ prajābhyaḥ saṃharann api /
analyzed: nṛpa dīpaḥ dhana sneham prajābhyaḥ saṃharan api
translated: Even if a king collects wealth and oil for the lamp of the king,

original: āntarasthair guṇaiḥ śubhrair lakṣyate naiva kenacit // ///
analyzed: āntara sthaiḥ guṇaiḥ śubhraiḥ lakṣyate nā eva kenacid
translated: he is not known by anyone by his internal pure qualities.

original: yathā gaur duhyate kāle pālyate ca tathā prajāḥ /
analyzed: yathā gauḥ duhyate kāle pālyate ca tathā prajāḥ
translated: Subjects should be milked like a cow and protected like a cow at the right time.

original: sicyate cīyate caiva latā puṣpaphalapradā // ///
analyzed: sicyate cīyate ca eva latā puṣpa phala pradā
translated: is sprinkled and piled up, bearing flowers and fruits.

original: yathā bījāṅkuraḥ sūkṣmaḥ prayatnenābhirakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: yathā bīja aṅkuraḥ sūkṣmaḥ prayatnena abhirakṣitaḥ
translated: Just as a subtle seed sprout is carefully protected,

original: phalaprado bhavet kāle tadval lokaḥ surakṣitaḥ // ///
analyzed: phala pradaḥ bhavet kāle tadvat lokaḥ su rakṣitaḥ
translated: it will bear fruit in time, so is the world well protected.

original: hiraṇyadhānyaratnāni yānāni vividhāni ca /
analyzed: hiraṇya dhānya ratnāni yānāni vividhāni ca
translated: Gold, grain, jewels, and various vehicles,

original: tathānyad api yat kiñcit prajābhyaḥ syān mahīpateḥ // ///
analyzed: tathā anyat api yat kiñcid prajābhyaḥ syāt mahīpateḥ
translated: and whatever else may belong to the subjects of the king,

original: lokānugrahakartāraḥ pravardhante nareśvarāḥ /
analyzed: loka anugraha kartāraḥ pravardhante nareśvarāḥ
translated: the lords of men who bestow favors on the people prosper,

original: lokānāṃ saṅkṣayāc caiva kṣayaṃ yānti na saṃśayaḥ // ///
analyzed: lokānām saṅkṣayāt ca eva kṣayam yānti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: and undoubtedly decline when the people decline.

original: atha teṣāṃ tadvacanam ākarṇya bhāsuraka āhaaho satyam abhihitaṃ bhavadbhiḥ /
analyzed: atha teṣām tat vacanam ākarṇya bhāsurakaḥ āha aho satyam abhihitam bhavadbhiḥ
translated: Then, having heard their words, Bhasura said, Oh, it is true what you have said.

original: paraṃ yadi mamopaviṣṭasyātra nityam eva naikaḥ śvāpadaḥ samāgamiṣyati /
analyzed: param yadi mama upaviṣṭasya atra nityam eva na ekaḥ śvāpadaḥ samāgamiṣyati
translated: But if a single beast of prey will not come here every day while I am sitting here,

original: tan nūnaṃ sarvān api bhakṣayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat nūnam sarvān api bhakṣayiṣyāmi
translated: then I will certainly devour all of you.

original: atha te tathaiva pratijñāya nirvṛtibhājas tatraiva vane nirbhayāḥ paryaṭanti /
analyzed: atha te tathā eva pratijñāya nirvṛti bhājaḥ tatra eva vane nirbhayāḥ paryaṭanti
translated: Then, having pledged themselves in the same way, they became relieved and roamed there in the forest without fear.

original: ekaś ca pratidinaṃ krameṇa yāti /🔽vṛddho vā / vairāgyayukto vā /
analyzed: ekaḥ ca pratidinam krameṇa yāti  vṛddhaḥ vā vairāgya yuktaḥ vā
translated: And one goes every day in turn.🔽Either an old man,🔽or one endowed with detachment,

original: śokagrasto vā /
analyzed: śoka grastaḥ vā
translated: or one afflicted with grief,

original: putrakalatranāśabhīto vā /
analyzed: putra kalatra nāśa bhītaḥ vā
translated: Or he is afraid of losing his sons and wife.

original: teṣāṃ madhyāt tasya bhojanārthaṃ madhyāhnasamaya upatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: teṣām madhyāt tasya bhojana artham madhyāhna samaye upatiṣṭhate
translated: Among them, the time for his meal arrives at midday.

original: atha kadācij jātikramāc chaśakasyāvasaraḥ samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid jāti kramāt śaśakasya avasaraḥ samāyātaḥ
translated: Then, sometimes, by the order of birth, the turn of the hare has come.

original: sa samastamṛgaiḥ prerito 'nicchann api mandaṃ mandaṃ gatvā tasya vadhopāyaṃ cintayan velātikramaṃ kṛtvāvyākulitahṛdayo yāvad gacchati tāvanmārge
analyzed: sa samasta mṛgaiḥ preritaḥ nicchan api mandam mandam gatvā tasya vadha upāyam cintayan velā atikramam kṛtvā a vyākulita hṛdayaḥ yāvat gacchati tāvat mārge
translated: Urged by all the animals, he goes slowly, slowly, unwillingly, thinking of a way to kill him, making the time pass, with a troubled heart, until he reaches

original: gacchatā kūpaḥ sandṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: gacchatā kūpaḥ san dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: while going, he sees a well.

original: yāvat kūpopari pāti tāvat kūpamadhya ātmanaḥ pratibimbaṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: yāvat kūpa upari pāti tāvat kūpa madhye ātmanaḥ pratibimbam dadarśa
translated: As he was flying over the well, he saw his own reflection in the middle of the well.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tena hṛdaye cintitamyad bhāvya upāyo 'sti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tena hṛdaye cintitam yat bhāvyaḥ upāyaḥ sti
translated: And having seen it, he thought in his heart, If there is a way,

original: ahaṃ bhāsurakaṃ prakopya svabuddhyāsmin kūpe pātayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham bhāsurakam prakopya sva buddhyā asmin kūpe pātayiṣyāmi
translated: I will provoke Bhasura and make him fall into this well with my own intelligence.

original: athāsau dinaśeṣe bhāsurakasamīpaṃ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau dina śeṣe bhāsuraka samīpam prāptaḥ
translated: Then he reached near Bhasura in the remaining part of the day.

original: siṃho 'pi velātikrameṇa kṣutkṣāmakaṇṭhaḥ kopāviṣṭaḥ sṛkkaṇī parilelihad vyacintayataho /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ pi velā atikrameṇa kṣudh kṣāma kaṇṭhaḥ kopa āviṣṭaḥ parilelihat vyacintayata ho
translated: The lion too, with his throat parched with hunger due to the time passing, licking the corners of his mouth, was filled with anger and thought, Alas!

original: pratārāhārāya niḥsattvaṃ vanaṃ mayā kartavyam /
analyzed: pratāra āhārāya niḥsattvam vanam mayā kartavyam
translated: I must make the forest devoid of living beings for my own food.

original: evaṃ cintayatas tasya śaśako mandaṃ mandaṃ gatvā praṇamya tasyāgre sthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam cintayataḥ tasya śaśakaḥ mandam mandam gatvā praṇamya tasya agre sthitaḥ
translated: As he was thinking this, the hare came slowly, bowed, and stood before him.

original: atha taṃ prajvalitātmā bhāsurako bhartsayann āhare śaśakādhama ekas tāvat tvaṃ laghuḥ prāpto 'parato velātikrameṇa /
analyzed: atha tam prajvalita ātmā bhāsurakaḥ bhartsayan āhare śaśaka adhamaḥ ekaḥ tāvat tvam laghuḥ paratas velā atikrameṇa
translated: Then the blazing Bhasura reproached him and said, O lowest of hares, you have come alone, slowly, and have exceeded the time limit.

original: tad asmād aparādhāt tvāṃ nipātya prātaḥ sakalāny api mṛgakulāny ucchedayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat asmāt aparādhāt tvām nipātya prātar sakalāni api mṛga kulāni ucchedayiṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, for this offense, I will strike you down and in the morning destroy all the other herds of deer.

original: atha śaśakaḥ savinayaṃ provācasvāmin /
analyzed: atha śaśakaḥ sa vinayam provāca svāmin
translated: Then the hare spoke politely, My lord,

original: nāparādho mama /
analyzed: na aparādhaḥ mama
translated: this is not my fault.

original: na ca sattvānām /
analyzed: na ca sattvānām
translated: Nor is it the fault of the other animals.

original: tac chyrūtāṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: tat śyrūtām kāraṇam
translated: Listen to the reason.

original: siṃha āhasatvaraṃ nivedaya yāvan mama daṃṣṭrāntargato na bhavān bhaviṣyati iti /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ āha sa tvaram nivedaya yāvat mama daṃṣṭra antargataḥ na bhavān bhaviṣyati iti
translated: The lion said, Speak quickly, lest you end up in my jaws.

original: śaśaka āhasvāmin /
analyzed: śaśakaḥ āha svāmin
translated: The hare said, My lord,

original: samastamṛgair adya jātikrameṇa mama laghutarasya prastāvaṃ vijñāya tato 'haṃ pañcaśaśakaiḥ samaṃ preṣitaḥ /
analyzed: samasta mṛgaiḥ adya jāti krameṇa mama laghutarasya prastāvam vijñāya tatas ham pañca śaśakaiḥ samam preṣitaḥ
translated: today, knowing that I am the lightest of all the deer by birth order, I was sent with five other hares.

original: tataś cāham āgacchenn antarāle mahatā kenacid apareṇa siṃhena vivarān nirgatyābhihitaḥabhīṣṭadevatāṃ smarata /
analyzed: tatas ca aham āgacchet antarāle mahatā kenacid apareṇa siṃhena vivarāt nirgatya abhihitaḥ abhīṣṭadevatām smarata
translated: Then as I was coming, in the middle, a great lion came out of a hole and said, 'Remember your chosen deity.'

original: tato mayābhihitamvayaṃ svāminon bhāsurakasiṃhasya sakāśam āhārārthaṃ samayadharmeṇa gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatas mayā abhihitam vayam bhāsuraka siṃhasya sakāśam āhāra artham samaya dharmeṇa gacchāmaḥ
translated: Then I said, 'We are going to the presence of our master, the lion Shining, to eat according to the law of time.

original: tatas tenābhihitamyady evaṃ tarhi madīyam etadvanam /
analyzed: tatas tena abhihitam yadi evam tarhi madīyam etat vanam
translated: Then he said, 'If that is so, then this is my forest.

original: mayā saha samayadharmeṇa samastair api śvāpadair vartitavyam /
analyzed: mayā saha samaya dharmeṇa samastaiḥ api śvāpadaiḥ vartitavyam
translated: You must all live with me according to the law of time, even the beasts of prey.

original: corarūpī sa bhāsurakaḥ /
analyzed: cora rūpī sa bhāsurakaḥ
translated: That lion Shining is a thief.

original: atha yadi so 'tra rājā /
analyzed: atha yadi saḥ tra rājā
translated: Now if he is the king here,

original: viśvāsasthāne caturaḥ śaśakān atra dhṛtvā tam āhūya drutataram āgaccha /
analyzed: viśvāsa sthāne caturaḥ śaśakān atra dhṛtvā tam āhūya drutataram āgaccha
translated: and if you trust him, then catch four rabbits here, and call him and come quickly.

original: yena yaḥ kaścid āvayor madhyāt parākrameṇa rājā bhaviṣyati sa sarvān etān bhakṣayiṣyati iti /
analyzed: yena yaḥ kaścid āvayoḥ madhyāt parākrameṇa rājā bhaviṣyati sa sarvān etān bhakṣayiṣyati iti
translated: Whoever of us two becomes king by prowess will eat all of them.'

original: tato 'haṃ tenādiṣṭaḥ svāmisakāśam abhyāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas ham tena ādiṣṭaḥ svāmi sakāśam abhyāgataḥ
translated: Then I, being ordered by him, have come to my master.

original: etad velā vyatikramakāraṇam /
analyzed: etat velā vyatikrama kāraṇam
translated: This is the reason for my delay.

original: tad atra svāmī pramāṇam /
analyzed: tat atra svāmī pramāṇam
translated: So my master is the authority in this matter.

original: tac chrutvā bhāsuraka āhabhadra /
analyzed: tat śrutvā bhāsurakaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Hearing this, Shining said, 'Good sir,

original: yady evaṃ tat satvaraṃ darśaya me taṃ caurasiṃhaḥ yenāhaṃ mṛgakopaṃ tasyopari kṣiptvā svastho bhavāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yadi evam tat sa tvaram darśaya me tam caura siṃhaḥ yena aham mṛga kopam tasya upari kṣiptvā svasthaḥ bhavāmi uktam ca
translated: if that is so, then show him to me quickly, the thief lion, so that I can cast off my anger towards him and be at ease. And it is said:

original: bhūmir mitraṃ hiraṇyaṃ ca vigrahasya phalatrayam /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ mitram hiraṇyam ca vigrahasya phala trayam
translated: Land, friends, and gold are the three fruits of war.

original: nāsty ekam api yady eṣāṃ na taṃ kuryāt kathañcana // ///
analyzed: na asti ekam api yadi eṣām na tam kuryāt kathaṃcana
translated: If one of these is absent, one should never undertake war.

original: yatra na syāt phalaṃ bhūri yatra casyāt parābhavaḥ /
analyzed: yatra na syāt phalam bhūri yatra ca syāt parābhavaḥ
translated: Where there is little profit and where there is defeat,

original: na tatra matimān yuddhaṃ samutpādya samācaret // ///
analyzed: na tatra matimān yuddham samutpādya samācaret
translated: there a wise man should not engage in war.

original: śaśāka āhasvāmin /
analyzed: śaśākaḥ āha svāmin
translated: The hare said, My lord,

original: satyam idam /
analyzed: satyam idam
translated: this is true.

original: svabhūmihetoḥ paribhavāc ca yudhyante kṣatriyāḥ /
analyzed: sva bhūmi hetoḥ paribhavāt ca yudhyante kṣatriyāḥ
translated: Kshatriyas fight for their own land and out of contempt.

original: paraṃ sa durgāśrayaḥ durgān niṣkramya vayaṃ tena viṣkambhitāḥ /
analyzed: param sa durga āśrayaḥ durgāt niṣkramya vayam tena viṣkambhitāḥ
translated: But he, taking refuge in a fortress, has come out of the fortress and has obstructed us.

original: tato durgastho duḥsadhyo bhavati ripuḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tatas durga sthaḥ duḥsadhyaḥ bhavati ripuḥ uktam ca
translated: Therefore, an enemy in a fortress is difficult to subdue. And it is said:

original: na gajānāṃ sahasreṇa na ca lakṣeṇa vājinām /
analyzed: na gajānām sahasreṇa na ca lakṣeṇa vājinām
translated: Not with a thousand elephants, nor with a hundred thousand horses,

original: yat kṛtyaṃ sidhyati rājñāṃ durgeṇaikena vigrahe //
analyzed: yat kṛtyam sidhyati rājñām durgeṇa ekena vigrahe
translated: is that which is to be done by a king accomplished, but with a single fortress in a conflict.

original: śatam eko 'pi saṃdhatte prākārastho dhanurdharaḥ /
analyzed: śatam ekaḥ saṃdhatte prākāra sthaḥ dhanurdharaḥ
translated: A single archer stationed on a rampart can hold back a hundred.

original: tasmād durgaṃ praśaṃsanti nītiśāstravicakṣaṇāḥ //🔽purā guroḥ samādeśādd hiraṇyakaśipor bhayāt /
analyzed: tasmāt durgam praśaṃsanti nīti śāstra vicakṣaṇāḥ  purā guroḥ samādeśāt hiraṇyakaśipoḥ bhayāt
translated: Therefore, those skilled in the science of statecraft praise a fortress.🔽In ancient times, at the command of his preceptor, out of fear of Hiranyakashipu,

original: śakreṇa vihitaṃ durgaṃ prabhāvād viśvakarmaṇaḥ //
analyzed: śakreṇa vihitam durgam prabhāvāt viśvakarmaṇaḥ
translated: Shakra had a fortress built by the power of Vishvakarma.

original: tenāpi ca varo datto yasya durgaṃ sa bhūpatiḥ /
analyzed: tena api ca varaḥ dattaḥ yasya durgam sa bhūpatiḥ
translated: And he also granted a boon, saying, The king to whom this fortress belongs,

original: vijayī syāt tato bhūmau durgāṇi syuḥ sahasraśaḥ //
analyzed: vijayī syāt tatas bhūmau durgāṇi syuḥ sahasraśas
translated: And he too granted a boon, saying, The king who has a fortress will be victorious. Therefore, fortresses should be built by the thousands on the earth.

original: daṃṣṭrāvirahito nāgo madahīno yathā gajaḥ /
analyzed: daṃṣṭrā virahitaḥ nāgaḥ mada hīnaḥ yathā gajaḥ
translated: A snake is useless without fangs, an elephant without rut,

original: sarveṣāṃ jāyate vaśyo durgahīnas tathā nṛpaḥ // ///
analyzed: sarveṣām jāyate vaśyaḥ durga hīnaḥ tathā nṛpaḥ
translated: and a king without a fortress is subject to all.

original: tac chrutvā bhāsuraka āha /
analyzed: tat śrutvā bhāsurakaḥ āha
translated: Hearing that, Bhāsuraka said,

original: bhadra durgastham api darśaya taṃ caurasiṃhaṃ yena vyāpādayāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: bhadra durga stham api darśaya tam caura siṃham yena vyāpādayāmi uktam ca
translated: Good man, show me that thief-lion, even if he is in a fortress, so that I can kill him. And it is said:

original: jātamātraṃ na yaḥ śatruṃ rogaṃ ca praśamaṃ nayet /
analyzed: jāta mātram na yaḥ śatrum rogam ca praśamam nayet
translated: One who does not destroy an enemy or a disease as soon as it arises,

original: mahābalo 'pi tenaiva vṛddhiṃ prāpya sa hanyate // ///
analyzed: mahābalaḥ pi tena eva vṛddhim prāpya sa hanyate
translated: even if he is very powerful, will be destroyed by it when it has grown.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: uttiṣṭhamānas tu paro nopekṣyaḥ pathyam icchatā /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhamānaḥ tu paraḥ na upekṣyaḥ pathyam icchatā
translated: But an enemy who is rising should not be neglected by one who desires his own welfare.

original: samau hi śiṣṭair āmnātau vartsyantāv āmayaḥ sa ca // ///
analyzed: samau hi śiṣṭaiḥ āmnātau vartsyantau āmayaḥ sa ca
translated: For the wise have declared these two to be equal: an enemy and a disease.

original: api ca
analyzed: api ca
translated: And furthermore:

original: upekṣitaḥ kṣīṇabalo 'pi śatruḥ pramādadoṣāt puruṣair madāndhaiḥ /
analyzed: upekṣitaḥ kṣīṇa balaḥ api śatruḥ pramāda doṣāt puruṣaiḥ mada andhaiḥ
translated: An enemy, even if weak, if neglected, becomes incurable due to the fault of carelessness by intoxicated men.

original: sādhyo 'pi bhūtvā prathamaṃ tato 'sāv
analyzed: sādhyaḥ pi bhūtvā prathamam
translated: Having been curable in the beginning, it then

original: asādhyatāṃ vyādhir iva prayāti // ///
analyzed: asādhya tām vyādhiḥ iva prayāti
translated: becomes incurable, like a disease.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: ātmanaḥ śaktim udvīkṣya manotsāhaṃ ca yo vrajet /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ śaktim udvīkṣya manaḥ utsāham ca yaḥ vrajet
translated: He who, considering his own strength and the enthusiasm of his mind, goes forth,

original: bahūn hanti sa eko 'pi kṣatriyān bhārgavo yathā // ///
analyzed: bahūn hanti saḥ ekaḥ pi kṣatriyān bhārgavaḥ yathā
translated: even alone, can kill many, like Bhārgava did to the Kṣatriyas.

original: śaśaka āhaasty etat /
analyzed: śaśakaḥ āha asti etat
translated: The hare said, This is true.

original: tathāpi balavān sa mayā dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api balavān sa mayā dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, I saw him as very strong.

original: tan na yujyate svāminas tasya tasya sāmarthyam aviditvā gantum / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat na yujyate svāminaḥ tasya tasya sāmarthyam a viditvā gantum uktam ca
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to go without knowing the ability of one's own master. And it is said:

original: aviditvātmanaḥ śaktiṃ parasya ca samutsukaḥ /
analyzed: a viditvā ātmanaḥ śaktim parasya ca samutsukaḥ
translated: Not knowing one's own strength and that of the other, being eager,

original: gacchann abhimukho vahnau nāśaṃ yāti pataṅgavat //
analyzed: gacchan abhimukhaḥ vahnau nāśam yāti pataṅga vat
translated: going forth facing the fire, one is destroyed like a moth.

original: yo balāt pronnataṃ yāti nihantuṃ sabalo 'py arim /
analyzed: yaḥ balāt pronnatam yāti nihantum sa balaḥ api arim
translated: He who forcibly goes forth to kill a powerful enemy, even with an army,

original: vimadaḥ sa nivarteta śīrṇadanto gajo yathā // ///
analyzed: vimadaḥ sa nivarteta śīrṇa dantaḥ gajaḥ yathā
translated: returning without pride, is like an elephant with broken tusks.

original: bhāsuraka āhabhoḥ kiṃ tavānena vyāpāreṇa /
analyzed: bhāsurakaḥ āha bhoḥ kim tava anena vyāpāreṇa
translated: Bhāsurāka said, Sir, what is the use of this activity for you?

original: darśaya me taṃ durgastham api /
analyzed: darśaya me tam durga stham api
translated: Show me that one who is in a fortress.

original: atha śaśaka āhayady evaṃ tarhy āgacchatu svāmī /
analyzed: atha śaśakaḥ āha yadi evam tarhi āgacchatu svāmī
translated: Then the hare said, If it is so, then let the master come.

original: evam uktvāgre vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā agre vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Having said this, he stood in front.

original: tataś ca tenāgacchatā yaḥ kūpo dṛṣṭo 'bhūt tam eva kūpam āsādya bhāsurakam āhasvāmin kas te pratāpaṃ soḍhuṃ samarthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca tena āgacchatā yaḥ kūpaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhūt tam eva kūpam āsādya bhāsurakam āha svāmin kaḥ te pratāpam soḍhum samarthaḥ
translated: Then, having approached that very well which he had seen while coming, he said to Bhāsurāka, Master, who is able to bear your prowess?

original: tvāṃ dṛṣṭvā dūrato 'pi caurasiṃhaḥ praviṣṭaḥ svaṃ durgam /
analyzed: tvām dṛṣṭvā caura siṃhaḥ praviṣṭaḥ svam durgam
translated: Seeing you from afar, the lion thief entered his fortress.

original: tad āgaccha yathā darśayāmīti /
analyzed: tat āgaccha yathā darśayāmi iti
translated: Come, I'll show you.

original: bhāsuraka āhadarśaya me durgam /
analyzed: bhāsurakaḥ āha darśaya me durgam
translated: Bhasura said, Show me your fortress.

original: tad anu darśitas tena kūpaḥ /
analyzed: tat anu darśitaḥ tena kūpaḥ
translated: Then he showed him a well.

original: tataḥ so 'pi mūrkhaḥ siṃhaḥ kūpamadhya ātmapratibimbaṃ jalamadhyagataṃ dṛṣṭvā siṃhanādaṃ mumoca /
analyzed: tatas saḥ pi mūrkhaḥ siṃhaḥ kūpa madhye ātma pratibimbam jala madhya gatam dṛṣṭvā siṃhanādam mumoca
translated: Then that foolish lion, seeing his own reflection in the water in the well, roared like a lion.

original: tataḥ pratiśabdena kūpamadhyād dviguṇataro nādaḥ samutthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas pratiśabdena kūpa madhyāt dviguṇataraḥ nādaḥ samutthitaḥ
translated: Then a roar twice as loud arose from the bottom of the well as an echo.

original: atha tena taṃ śatruṃ matvātmānaṃ tasyopari prakṣipya prāṇāḥ parityaktāḥ /
analyzed: atha tena tam śatrum matvā ātmānam tasya upari prakṣipya prāṇāḥ parityaktāḥ
translated: Then, thinking it was his enemy, he threw himself on top of it and gave up his life.

original: śaśako 'pi hṛṣṭamanāḥ sarvamṛgān ānandya taiḥ saha praśasyamāno yathāsukhaṃ tatra vane nivasati sma /
analyzed: śaśakaḥ pi hṛṣṭa manāḥ sarva mṛgān ānandya taiḥ saha praśasyamānaḥ yathāsukham tatra vane nivasati sma
translated: The hare, with a cheerful mind, delighted all the animals, and was praised by them as he lived happily in the forest.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiyasya buddhir balaṃ tasya iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi yasya buddhiḥ balam tasya iti
translated: Therefore I say, 'He who has intelligence has strength.'

original: tad yadi bhavān kathayati tat tatraiva gatvā tayoḥ svabuddhiprabhāveṇa maitrībhedaṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat yadi bhavān kathayati tat tatra eva gatvā tayoḥ sva buddhi prabhāveṇa maitrī bhedam karomi
translated: If you tell me, then I will go there and break their friendship by my own intelligence and power.

original: karaṭaka āhabhadra /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Karataka said, Good sir.

original: yady evaṃ tarhi gaccha /
analyzed: yadi evam tarhi gaccha
translated: If that is so, then go.

original: śivās te panthānaḥ santu /
analyzed: śivāḥ te panthānaḥ santu
translated: May your paths be auspicious.

original: yathābhipretam anuṣṭhīyatām /
analyzed: yathā abhipretam anuṣṭhīyatām
translated: Do as you wish.

original: atha damanakaḥ sañjīvakaviyuktaṃ piṅgalakam avalokya tatrāntare praṇamyāgre samupaviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha damanakaḥ sañjīvaka viyuktam piṅgalakam avalokya tatra antare praṇamya agre samupaviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then Damanaka, seeing that Pīngalaka was separated from Sañjīvaka, bowed to him there, and sat down in front.

original: piṅgalako 'pi tam āhabhadra /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ pi tam āha bhadra
translated: Pīngalaka also said to him, Sir,

original: kiṃ cirād dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: kim cirāt dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: why have you been seen after such a long time?

original: damanaka āhana kañcid devapādānām asmābhiḥ prayojanam /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha na kañcid deva pādānām asmābhiḥ prayojanam
translated: Damanaka said, We have no purpose at all with your feet.

original: tenāhaṃ nāgacchāmi /
analyzed: tena aham na āgacchāmi
translated: Therefore I do not come.

original: tathāpi rājaprayojanavināśam avalokya sandahyamānahṛdayo vyākulatayā svayam evābhyāgato vaktum / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā api rāja prayojana vināśam avalokya sandahyamāna hṛdayaḥ vyākula tayā svayam eva abhyāgataḥ vaktum uktam ca
translated: Nevertheless, seeing the destruction of the king's purpose, my heart burning with anxiety, I have come myself in confusion to speak. And it is said:

original: priyaṃ vā yadi vā dveṣyaṃ śubhaṃ vā yadi vāśubham /
analyzed: priyam vā yadi vā dveṣyam śubham vā yadi vā aśubham
translated: Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, auspicious or inauspicious,

original: apṛṣṭo 'pi hitaṃ vakṣyed yasya necchet parābhavam // ///
analyzed: a pṛṣṭaḥ u pi hitam vakṣyet yasya na icchet parābhavam
translated: I will speak what is beneficial, even if not asked, for one who does not wish for defeat.

original: atha tasya sābhiprāyaṃ vacanam ākarṇya piṅgalaka āhakiṃ vaktumanā bhavān /
analyzed: atha tasya sa abhiprāyam vacanam ākarṇya piṅgalakaḥ āha kim vaktu manāḥ bhavān
translated: Then, having heard his meaningful words, Pīngalaka said, What do you wish to speak?

original: tat kathyatāṃ yat kathanīyam asti /
analyzed: tat kathyatām yat kathanīyam asti
translated: Let that be told which needs to be told.

original: sa prāhadeva sañjīvako yuṣmatpādānām upari drohabuddhir iti /
analyzed: sa prāhat eva sañjīvakaḥ yuṣmad pādānām upari droha buddhiḥ iti
translated: He said, Your Majesty, Sañjīvaka has a mind to rebel against your feet.

original: viśvāsagatasya mama vijane idam āhabho damanaka /
analyzed: viśvāsa gatasya mama vijane idam āha bho damanaka
translated: To me who was deceived, he said this in private: 'Oh Damanaka,

original: dṛṣṭā mayāsya piṅgalakasya sārāsāratā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭā mayā asya piṅgalakasya sāra asāra tā
translated: I have seen the strength and weakness of this Tawny.

original: tad aham enaṃ hatvā sakalamṛgādhipatyaṃ tvatsācivyapadavīsamanvitaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat aham enam hatvā sakala mṛga ādhipatyam tvad sācivya padavī samanvitam kariṣyāmi
translated: So I will kill him and make you the lord of all the beasts, with me as your minister.

original: piṅgalako 'pi tadvajrasāraprahārasadṛśaṃ dāruṇaṃ vacaḥ samākarṇya moham upagato na kiñcid apy uktavān /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ pi tad vajra sāra prahāra sadṛśam dāruṇam vacaḥ samākarṇya moham upagataḥ na kiñcid api uktavān
translated: And Tawny, hearing this speech, which was like a blow with a thunderbolt, was so stunned that he could not say a word.

original: damanako 'pi tasya tam ākāram ālokya cintitavānayaṃ tāvat sañjīvakanibaddharāgaḥ /
analyzed: damanakaḥ pi tasya tam ākāram ālokya cintitavān ayam tāvat sañjīvaka nibaddha rāgaḥ
translated: And Dāmanaka, seeing his condition, thought: This fellow is in love with LifeGiving.

original: tan nūnam anena mantriṇā rājā vināśam avāpsyati iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat nūnam anena mantriṇā rājā vināśam avāpsyati iti uktam ca
translated: So, no doubt, the king will be destroyed by this minister. And it is said:

original: ekaṃ bhūmipatiḥ karoti sacivaṃ rājye pramāṇaṃ yadā taṃ mohāc chrayate madaḥ sa ca madād dāsyena nirvidyate /
analyzed: ekam bhūmipatiḥ karoti sacivam rājye pramāṇam yadā tam mohāt śrayate madaḥ sa ca madāt dāsyena nirvidyate
translated: When a king makes a minister the authority in the kingdom, he is deluded and becomes proud; and from pride he becomes disaffected with his service.

original: nirviṇṇasya padaṃ karoti hṛdaye tasya svatantraspṛhā svātantryaspṛhayā tataḥ sa nṛpateḥ prāṇān abhidruhyati // ///
analyzed: nirviṇṇasya padam karoti hṛdaye tasya svatantra spṛhā svātantrya spṛhayā tatas sa nṛpateḥ prāṇān abhidruhyati
translated: When he is disaffected, the desire for independence arises in his heart; and from the desire for independence he plots to kill the king.

original: tat kim atra yuktam iti /
analyzed: tat kim atra yuktam iti
translated: So what is the right thing to do here?

original: piṅgalako 'pi cetanāṃ samāsādya katham api tam āhasañjīvakas tāvat prāṇasamo bhṛtyaḥ /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ pi cetanām samāsādya katham api tam āhasan jīvakaḥ tāvat prāṇa samaḥ bhṛtyaḥ
translated: And Tawny, recovering his senses, somehow said: LifeGiving is a servant dear as life to me.

original: sa kathaṃ mamopari drohabuddhiṃ karoti /
analyzed: sa katham mama upari droha buddhim karoti
translated: How can he harbor thoughts of treachery against me?

original: damanaka āhadeva /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha deva
translated: Dāmanaka said: Your Majesty,

original: bhṛtyo 'bhṛtya ity anekāntikam etat / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: bhṛtyaḥ bhṛtyaḥ iti anekāntikam etat uktam ca
translated: it is not certain that a servant is a servant, or that a non-servant is not a servant. And it is said:

original: na so 'sti puruṣo rājñāṃ yo na kāmayate śriyam /
analyzed: na saḥ sti puruṣaḥ rājñām yaḥ na kāmayate śriyam
translated: There is no man who does not desire prosperity from kings.

original: aśaktā eva sarvatra narendraṃ paryupāsate // ///
analyzed: aśaktāḥ eva sarvatra narendram paryupāsate
translated: Only the incapable attend on a king everywhere.

original: piṅgalaka āhabhadra /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Piṅgalaka said: Good fellow,

original: tathāpi mama tasyopari cittavṛttir na vikṛtiṃ yāti /
analyzed: tathā api mama tasya upari citta vṛttiḥ na vikṛtim yāti
translated: nevertheless, my attitude towards him has not changed.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or rather, this is well said:

original: anekadoṣaduṣṭasya kāyaḥ kasya na vallabhaḥ /
analyzed: aneka doṣa duṣṭasya kāyaḥ kasya na vallabhaḥ
translated: Whose body is not loved, full of many faults?

original: kurvann api vyalīkāni yaḥ priyaḥ priya eva saḥ // ///
analyzed: kurvan api vyalīkāni yaḥ priyaḥ priyaḥ eva saḥ
translated: Even if he does wrong, a beloved is beloved.

original: damanaka āhaata evāyaṃ doṣaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha atas eva ayam doṣaḥ uktam ca
translated: Dāmanaka said: For this very reason this is a fault. And it is said:

original: yasminn evādhikaṃ cakṣur āropayati pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin eva adhikam cakṣuḥ āropayati pārthivaḥ
translated: In whom the king places his eye,

original: akulīnaḥ kulīno vā sa śriyā bhājanaṃ naraḥ // ///
analyzed: akulīnaḥ kulīnaḥ vā sa śriyāḥ bhājanam naraḥ
translated: whether of low or noble birth, that man is a vessel of prosperity.

original: aparaṃ kena gaṇaviśeṣeṇa svāmī sañjīvakaṃ nirguṇakam api nikaṭe dhārayati /
analyzed: aparam kena gaṇa viśeṣeṇa svāmī sañjīvakam nirguṇakam api nikaṭe dhārayati
translated: Moreover, by what special quality does the master keep Sañjīvaka, who is of no use, close by?

original: atha deva / yady evaṃ cintayasi mahākāyo 'yam /
analyzed: atha deva yadi evam cintayasi mahā kāyaḥ yam
translated: Now, Your Majesty, if you think like this: 'This one is big-bodied.

original: anena ripūn vyāpādayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: anena ripūn vyāpādayiṣyāmi
translated: With him I will destroy my enemies.'

original: tad asmān na sidhyati /
analyzed: tat asmāt na sidhyati
translated: That will not succeed for us.

original: yato 'yaṃ śaṣpabhojī /
analyzed: yatas yam śaṣpa bhojī
translated: Because he eats grass.

original: devapādānāṃ punaḥ śatravo māṃsāśinaḥ /
analyzed: deva pādānām punar śatravaḥ māṃsa āśinaḥ
translated: But the enemies of the king's feet are flesh-eaters.

original: tadripusādhanam asya sāhāyyena na bhavati /
analyzed: tat ripu sādhanam asya sāhāyyena na bhavati
translated: So his help is not suitable for accomplishing that enemy.

original: tasmād enaṃ dūṣayitvā hanyatām iti /
analyzed: tasmāt enam dūṣayitvā hanyatām iti
translated: Therefore, let him be slandered and killed.

original: piṅgalaka āha
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ āha
translated: Pingalaka said:

original: ukto bhavati yaḥ pūrvaṃ guṇavān iti saṃsadi /
analyzed: uktaḥ bhavati yaḥ pūrvam guṇavān iti saṃsadi
translated: He who was previously said to have good qualities in the assembly,

original: tasya doṣo na vaktavyaḥ pratijñābhaṅgabhīruṇā // ///
analyzed: tasya doṣaḥ na vaktavyaḥ pratijñā bhaṅga bhīruṇā
translated: his fault should not be spoken of by one who fears breaking a promise.

original: anyac ca / mayāsya tava vacanenābhayapradānaṃ dattam /
analyzed: anyat ca mayā asya tava vacanena abhaya pradānam dattam
translated: And furthermore, I have given him the gift of fearlessness by your words.

original: tat kathaṃ svayam eva vyāpādayāmi /
analyzed: tat katham svayam eva vyāpādayāmi
translated: So how can I myself kill him?

original: sarvathā sañjīvako 'yaṃ suhṛd asmākam /
analyzed: sarvathā sañjīvakaḥ yam suhṛd asmākam
translated: In every way, this Sanjivaka is our friend.

original: na taṃ prati kaścin manyur iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na tam prati kaścid manyuḥ iti uktam ca
translated: There is no anger towards him at all. And it was said:

original: itaḥ sa daityaḥ prāptaśrīr neta evārhati kṣayam /
analyzed: itas sa daityaḥ prāpta śrīḥ na itas eva arhati kṣayam
translated: That demon, having attained prosperity from here, does not deserve destruction at all.

original: viṣavṛkṣo 'pi saṃvardhya svayaṃ chettum asāmpratam // ///🔽ādau na vā praṇayināṃ praṇayo vidheyo
analyzed: saṃvardhya svayam chettum asāmpratam  ādau na vā praṇayinām praṇayaḥ
translated: It is not proper to cut down oneself even a poisonous tree that has grown.🔽At the outset, affection should not be shown to those who are affectionate,

original: datto 'thavā pratidinaṃ paripoṣaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: pratidinam paripoṣaṇīyaḥ
translated: or if given, it should be nurtured day by day.

original: utkṣipya yat kṣipati tat prakaroti lajjāṃ
analyzed: utkṣipya yat kṣipati tat prakaroti lajjām
translated: When one throws something up and throws it away, it causes shame,

original: bhūmau sthitasya patanād bhayam eva nāsti // ///
analyzed: bhūmau sthitasya patanāt bhayam eva na asti
translated: for one who is standing on the ground, there is no fear of falling at all.

original: upakāriṣu yaḥ sādhuḥ sādhutve tasya ko guṇaḥ /
analyzed: upakāriṣu yaḥ sādhuḥ sādhu tve tasya kaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: If someone is good to those who have helped him, what virtue is there in that?

original: apakāriṣu yaḥ sādhuḥ sa sādhuḥ sadbhir ucyate // ///
analyzed: apakāriṣu yaḥ sādhuḥ sa sādhuḥ sadbhiḥ ucyate
translated: But if someone is good to those who have harmed him, he is truly good, the good say.

original: taddrohabuddher api mayāsya na viruddham ācaraṇīyam /
analyzed: tad droha buddheḥ api mayā asya na viruddham ācaraṇīyam
translated: I should not act against him, even though he has the intention to harm me.

original: damanaka āhasvāmin /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha svāmin
translated: Dāmanaka said, My lord,

original: naiṣa rājadharmo yad drohabuddhir api kṣamyate / uktaṃ ca🔽tulyārthaṃ tulyasāmarthyaṃ marmajñaṃ vyavasāyinam /
analyzed: na eṣa rāja dharmaḥ yat droha buddhiḥ api kṣamyate uktam ca  tulya artham tulya sāmarthyam marma jñam vyavasāyinam
translated: it is not the king's duty to forgive even someone who has the intention to harm. And it is said:🔽One should not kill a servant who has the same goal, the same ability, who knows the secrets, is resolute,

original: ardharājyaharaṃ bhṛtyaṃ yo na hanyāt sa hanyate // ///
analyzed: ardha rājya haram bhṛtyam yaḥ na hanyāt sa hanyate
translated: and takes half of the kingdom. He who kills him is killed.

original: aparaṃ tvayāsya sakhitvāt sarvo 'pi rājadharmaḥ parityaktaḥ rājadharmābhāvāt sarvo 'pi parijano viraktiṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: aparam tvayā asya sakhi tvāt sarvaḥ pi rāja dharmaḥ parityaktaḥ rāja dharma abhāvāt sarvaḥ pi parijanaḥ viraktim gataḥ
translated: Moreover, because of your friendship with him, you have abandoned all royal duties. Because of the absence of royal duties, all your retinue has become disaffected.

original: yaḥ sañjīvakaḥ śaṣpabhojī /
