analyzed: yaḥ sañjīvakaḥ śaṣpa bhojī
translated: That Life-Giving eats grass.

original: bhavān māṃsādaḥ /
analyzed: bhavān māṃsa ādaḥ
translated: You eat meat.

original: tava prakṛtayaś ca yat tavāvadhyavyasāyabāhyaṃ kutas tāsāṃ māṃsāśanam /
analyzed: tava prakṛtayaḥ ca yat tava avadhya vyasāya bāhyam kutas tāsām māṃsa aśanam
translated: And your subjects, being outside your unassailable resolve, how can they eat meat?

original: yadrahitās tvāṃ tyaktvā yāsyanti /
analyzed: yad rahitāḥ tvām tyaktvā yāsyanti
translated: Without that, they will leave you and go away.

original: tato 'pi tvaṃ vinaṣṭa eva /
analyzed: tatas pi tvam vinaṣṭaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, you are already lost.

original: asya saṅgatyā punas te na kadācid ākheṭake matir bhaviṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: asya saṅgatyā punar te na kadācid ākheṭake matiḥ bhaviṣyati uktam ca
translated: And because of your association with him, you will never again have any inclination towards hunting. And it is said:

original: yādṛśaiḥ sevyate bhṛtyair yādṛśāṃś copasevate /
analyzed: yādṛśaiḥ sevyate bhṛtyaiḥ yādṛśān ca upasevate
translated: As a person is served by servants and associates with whom he associates,

original: kadācin nātra sandehas tādṛg bhavati pūruṣaḥ // ///
analyzed: kadācid na atra sandehaḥ tādṛś bhavati pūruṣaḥ
translated: so he becomes like them, there is no doubt about it.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: santaptāyasi saṃsthitasya payaso nāmāpi na jñāyate
analyzed: santapta ayasi saṃsthitasya payasaḥ nāma api na jñāyate
translated: The water that stands on heated iron is not even known by name.

original: muktakāratayā tad eva nalinīpatrasthitaṃ rājate /🔽svātau sāgaraśuktikukṣipatitaṃ taj jāyate mauktikaṃ
analyzed: mukta kāra tayā tat eva nalinī patra sthitam rājate  svātau sāgara śukti kukṣi patitam tat jāyate mauktikam
translated: But when freed from that, it shines when placed on a lotus leaf.🔽When it falls into the mouth of a sea-shell in its own season, it becomes a pearl.

original: prāyeṇādhamamadhyamottamaguṇaḥ saṃvāsato jāyate // ///
analyzed: prāyeṇa adhama madhyama uttama guṇaḥ saṃvāsataḥ jāyate
translated: Generally, by association, one becomes of low, middling, or high quality.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: asatāṃ saṅgadoṣeṇa satī yāti matir bhramam /
analyzed: asatām saṅga doṣeṇa satī yāti matiḥ bhramam
translated: The mind of a good person goes astray due to the fault of associating with the wicked.

original: ekarātripravāsena kāṣṭhaṃ muñje pralambitam // ///
analyzed: eka rātri pravāsena kāṣṭham muñje pralambitam
translated: By staying away for one night, a piece of wood tied to reeds becomes free from them.

original: ata eva santo nīcasaṅgaṃ varjayanti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atas eva santaḥ nīca saṅgam varjayanti uktam ca
translated: For this very reason, the good avoid association with the low. And it is said:

original: na hy avijñātaśīlasya pradātavyaḥ pratiśrayaḥ /
analyzed: na hi a vijñāta śīlasya pradātavyaḥ pratiśrayaḥ
translated: Shelter should not be given to one whose character is unknown.

original: matkuṇasya ca doṣeṇa hatā mandavisarpiṇī // ///
analyzed: matkuṇasya ca doṣeṇa hatā manda visarpiṇī
translated: And the slow-moving one was destroyed by the fault of the louse.

original: piṅgalaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Piṅgalaka asked, How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The story

original: mandavisarpiṇīnāmayūkākathā
analyzed: manda visarpiṇīnām ayūka kathā
translated: The story of the louse named Slow-Moving

original: asti kasyacin mahīpater manoramaṃ śayanasthānam /
analyzed: asti kasyacid mahīpateḥ manoramam śayana sthānam
translated: There is a delightful bedchamber belonging to a certain king.

original: tatra śvetatarapaṭayugalamadhyasaṃsthitā mandavisarpiṇī yūkā prativasati sma /
analyzed: tatra śvetatara paṭa yugala madhya saṃsthitā manda visarpiṇī yūkā prativasati sma
translated: There, in the middle of a pair of very white cloths, lived a slowly crawling louse.

original: sā ca tasya mahīpate raktam āsvādayantī sukhena kālaṃ nayamānā tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sā ca tasya mahīpate raktam āsvādayantī sukhena kālam nayamānā tiṣṭhati
translated: And she, enjoying the blood of that king, was passing the time happily.

original: anyedyuś ca tatra śayane kvacid bhrāmyann agnimukho nāma matkuṇaḥ samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: anyedyus ca tatra śayane kvacid bhrāmyan agnimukhaḥ nāma matkuṇaḥ samāyātaḥ
translated: And the next day, wandering somewhere on that bed, a louse named Agni-mukha came.

original: atha taṃ dṛṣṭvā sā viṣaṇṇavadanā provāca /
analyzed: atha tam dṛṣṭvā sā viṣaṇṇa vadanā provāca
translated: Then, seeing him, she spoke with a sad face:

original: bho 'gnimukha kutas tvam atrānucitasthāne samāyātaḥ /🔽tad yāvan na kaścid vetti tāvac chīghraṃ gamyatām iti /
analyzed: bho gnimukha kutas tvam atra anucita sthāne samāyātaḥ  tat yāvat na kaścid vetti tāvat śīghram gamyatām iti
translated: Oh Agni-mukha, from where have you come to this improper place?🔽So go quickly while no one knows.

original: sa āhabhagavati gṛhāgatasyāsādhor api naitad yujyate vaktum / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: saḥ āha bhagavati gṛha āgatasya asādhoḥ api nā etat yujyate vaktum uktam ca
translated: He said: Lady, it is not proper to speak like this even to an unrighteous guest who has come to one's house. And it is said:

original: ehy āgaccha samāviśāsanam idaṃ kasmāc cirād dṛśyase kā vārteti sudurbalo 'si kuśalaṃ prīto 'smi te darśanāt /
analyzed: ehi āgaccha samāviśa āsanam idam kasmāt cirāt dṛśyase kā vārttā iti su durbalaḥ si kuśalam prītaḥ smi te darśanāt
translated: Come, come, sit down, this seat is yours, why have I not seen you for so long? What news? Are you very weak? I am well, I am pleased to see you.

original: evaṃ ye samupāgatān praṇayinaḥ pratyālapanty ādarāt teṣāṃ yuktam aśaṅkitena manasā harmyāṇi gantuṃ sadā // ///
analyzed: evam ye samupāgatān praṇayinaḥ pratyālapanti ādarāt teṣām yuktam aśaṅkitena manasā harmyāṇi gantum sadā
translated: Thus, those who respectfully address their affectionate guests who have come like this, it is proper for them to go to their houses with an unsuspicious mind at all times.🔽...🔽...

original: aparaṃ mayānekamānuṣāṇām anekavidhāni rudhirāṇy āsvāditāny āhāradoṣāt kaṭutiktakaṣāyāmlarasāsvādāni na ca kadācin madhuraraktaṃ samāsvāditam
analyzed: aparam mayā aneka mānuṣāṇām anekavidhāni rudhirāṇi āsvāditāni āhāra doṣāt kaṭu tikta kaṣāya amla rasa āsvādāni na ca kadācid madhura raktam samāsvāditam
translated: Moreover, I have tasted the many kinds of blood of many humans due to the fault of food, bitter, pungent, astringent, sour tastes, but never have I tasted sweet blood.

original: tad yadi tvaṃ prasādaṃ karoṣi tad asya nṛpater vividhavyañjanānnapānacoṣyalehyasvādvāhāravaśād
analyzed: tat yadi tvam prasādam karoṣi tat asya nṛpateḥ vividha vyañjana anna pāna coṣya lehya svādu āhāra vaśāt
translated: If you favor me, then by the power of the various condiments, drinks, chewables, lickables, and delicious food of this king,

original: asya śarīre yan miṣṭaṃ raktaṃ saṃjātaṃ tadāsvādanena saukhyaṃ sampādayāmi jihvāyā iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: asya śarīre yat miṣṭam raktam saṃjātam tad āsvādanena saukhyam sampādayāmi jihvāyāḥ iti uktam ca
translated: in his body, whatever sweet blood has arisen, by tasting it I will bring happiness to the tongue. And it is said:

original: raṅkasya nṛpater vāpi jihvāsaukhyaṃ samaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: raṅkasya nṛpateḥ vā api jihvā saukhyam samam smṛtam
translated: The happiness of the tongue of a king or a beggar is considered the same.

original: tanmātraṃ ca smṛtaṃ sāraṃ tadarthaṃ yatate janaḥ // ///
analyzed: tanmātram ca smṛtam sāram tad artham yatate janaḥ
translated: And that alone is considered the essence, for which people strive.

original: yady eva na bhavel loke karma jihvāpratuṣṭidam /
analyzed: yadi eva na bhavet loke karma jihvā pratuṣṭi dam
translated: If in this world there were no action that gives satisfaction to the tongue,

original: tan na bhṛtyo bhavet kaścit kasyacid vaśago 'tha vā //
analyzed: tat na bhṛtyaḥ bhavet kaścid kasyacid vā
translated: then no one would be a servant of anyone else, or under anyone's control.

original: yad asatyaṃ vaden martyo yad vāsevyaṃ ca sevate /
analyzed: yat asatyam vadet martyaḥ yat vā asevyam ca sevate
translated: Whatever untruth a mortal speaks, whatever he serves and attends to,

original: yad gacchati videśaṃ ca tat sarvam udarārthataḥ // ///
analyzed: yat gacchati videśam ca tat sarvam udara arthataḥ
translated: whatever he goes to a foreign land, all that is for the sake of the belly.

original: tan mayā gṛhāgatena bubhukṣayā pīḍyamānenāpi tvatsakāśād bhojanam arthanīyam /
analyzed: tat mayā gṛha āgatena bubhukṣayā pīḍyamānena api tvad sakāśāt bhojanam arthanīyam
translated: So I, who have come to your house and am suffering from hunger, must ask you for food.

original: tan na tvayaikākinyāsya bhūpate raktabhojanaṃ kartuṃ yujyate /
analyzed: tat na tvayā ekākinyā asya bhūpate rakta bhojanam kartum yujyate
translated: But it is not proper for you alone to make a bloody meal for the king.

original: tac chrutvā mandavisarpiṇy āhabho matkuṇa /
analyzed: tat śrutvā mandavisarpiṇī āha bho matkuṇa
translated: Hearing this, Slow-Mo said, Hey, Flea!

original: asya nṛpater nidrāvaśaṃ gatasya raktam āsvādayāmi /
analyzed: asya nṛpateḥ nidrā vaśam gatasya raktam āsvādayāmi
translated: I'll taste the blood of this king who has fallen asleep.

original: punas tvam agnimukhaś capalaś catad yadi mayā saha raktapānaṃ karoṣi tat tiṣṭha /
analyzed: punar tvam agni mukhaḥ capalaḥ yadi mayā saha rakta pānam karoṣi tat tiṣṭha
translated: If you, Fire-Mouth, are fickle and want to drink blood with me, then stay.

original: abhīṣṭatararaktam āsvādaya /
analyzed: abhīṣṭatara raktam āsvādaya
translated: Taste the most desirable blood.

original: so 'bravītbhagavaty evaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt bhagavati evam kariṣyāmi
translated: He said, Lady, I will do as you say.

original: yāvat tvaṃ nāsvādayasi prathamaṃ nṛparaktaṃ tāvan mama devagurukṛtaḥ śapathaḥ syād yadi tad āsvādayāmi /
analyzed: yāvat tvam nā āsvādayasi prathamam nṛpa raktam tāvat mama deva guru kṛtaḥ śapathaḥ syāt yadi tat āsvādayāmi
translated: As long as you do not taste the king's blood first, I will have taken an oath before the gods and teachers. If I taste it,

original: evaṃ tayoḥ parasparaṃ vadatoḥ sa rājā tacchayanam āsādya prasuptaḥ /
analyzed: evam tayoḥ parasparam vadatoḥ sa rājā tat śayanam āsādya prasuptaḥ
translated: As they were talking to each other like this, the king approached his bed and fell asleep.

original: athāsau matkuṇo jihvālaulyotkṛṣṭautsukyāj jāgratam api taṃ mahīpatim adaśat /
analyzed: athā asau matkuṇaḥ jihvā laulya utkṛṣṭa autsukyāt jāgratam api tam mahīpatim adaśat
translated: Then the flea, out of intense eagerness to lick his tongue, bit the king even though he was awake.

original: atha vā sādhv idam ucyate /
analyzed: atha vā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: svabhāvo nopadeśena śakyate kartum anyathā /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ nā upadeśena śakyate kartum anyathā
translated: One's nature cannot be made otherwise by instruction.

original: sutaptam api pānīyaṃ punar gacchati śītatām //
analyzed: su taptam api pānīyam punar gacchati śīta tām
translated: Even well-heated water returns to coldness.

original: yadi syāc chītalo vahniḥ śītāṃśur dahanātmakaḥ /
analyzed: yadi syāt śītalaḥ vahniḥ śītāṃśuḥ dahana ātmakaḥ
translated: If fire were cold and the moon had the nature of burning,

original: na svabhāvo 'tra martyānāṃ śakyate kartum anyathā // ///
analyzed: na svabhāvaḥ tra martyānām śakyate kartum anyathā
translated: the nature of mortals could not be made otherwise here.

original: athāsau mahīpatiḥ sūcyagraviddha iva tacchayanaṃ tyaktvā tatkṣaṇād evotthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau mahīpatiḥ sūci agra viddhaḥ iva tat śayanam tyaktvā tad kṣaṇāt eva utthitaḥ
translated: Then the king, as if pricked by a needle, immediately got up, leaving the bed.

original: aho jñāyatām atra pracchādanapaṭe matkuṇo yūkā vā nūnaṃ tiṣṭhati yenāhaṃ daṣṭa iti /
analyzed: aho jñāyatām atra pracchādana paṭe matkuṇaḥ yūkā vā nūnam tiṣṭhati yena aham daṣṭaḥ iti
translated: Oh, let it be known that a louse or flea is surely hidden under this covering cloth, by which I have been bitten.

original: atha ye kañcukinas tatra sthitās te satvaraṃ pracchādanapaṭaṃ gṛhītvā sūkṣmadṛṣṭyā vīkṣāṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: atha ye kañcukinaḥ tatra sthitāḥ te sa tvaram pracchādana paṭam gṛhītvā sūkṣma dṛṣṭyā vīkṣām cakruḥ
translated: Then those chamberlains who were there quickly took up the covering cloth and examined it with keen eyes.

original: atrāntare sa matkuṇaś cāpalyāt khaṭvāntaṃ praviṣṭaḥ sā mandavisarpiṇy api vastrasandhyantargatā tair dṛṣṭā vyāpāditā ca /
analyzed: atrā antare sa matkuṇaḥ cāpalyāt khaṭvāntam praviṣṭaḥ sā mandavisarpiṇī api vastra sandhi antargatā taiḥ dṛṣṭā vyāpāditā ca
translated: In the meantime, that louse, out of restlessness, entered the bed, and that slow-moving one, hidden inside the cloth seam, was seen by them and killed.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmina hy avijñātaśīlasya iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi na hi a vijñāta śīlasya iti
translated: Therefore I say: For one whose character is unknown...

original: evaṃ jñātvā tvayiṣa vadhyaḥ /
analyzed: evam jñātvā vadhyaḥ
translated: Knowing this, you should kill him.

original: no cet tvāṃ vyāpādayiṣyatīti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: no ced tvām vyāpādayiṣyati iti uktam ca
translated: Otherwise he will kill you. And it is said:

original: tyaktāś cābhyantarā yena bāhyāś cābhyantarīkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tyaktāḥ ca abhyantarāḥ yena bāhyāḥ ca abhyantarīkṛtāḥ
translated: And he who abandons those within and makes outsiders his intimates,

original: sa eva mṛtyum āpnoti yathā rājā kakuddrumaḥ // ///
analyzed: saḥ eva mṛtyum āpnoti yathā rājā kakud drumaḥ
translated: he alone meets death, as did King Kakudruma.

original: piṅgalaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Piṅgalaka asked, How is that?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: caṇḍaravanāmaśṛgālakathā
analyzed: caṇḍa rava nāma śṛgāla kathā
translated: The Story of the Jackal Named Caṇḍarava

original: asti kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe caṇḍaravo nāma śṛgālaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe caṇḍaravaḥ nāma śṛgālaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain forest region, there lived a jackal named Caṇḍarava.

original: sa kadācit kṣudhāviṣṭo jihvālaulyān nagaramadhye praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa kadācid kṣudhā āviṣṭaḥ jihvā laulyāt nagara madhye praviṣṭaḥ
translated: One day, overcome by hunger, out of greed for food, he entered the middle of a city.

original: atha taṃ nagaravāsinaḥ sārameyā avalokya sarvataḥ śabdāyamānāḥ paridhāvya tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭṛāgrair bhakṣitum ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: atha tam nagara vāsinaḥ sārameyāḥ avalokya sarvatas śabdāyamānāḥ paridhāvya tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭṛ agraiḥ bhakṣitum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Then the city-dwellers, seeing him, barked from all sides, ran around, and began to bite him with the tips of their sharp fangs.

original: so 'pi tair bhakṣyamāṇaḥ prāṇabhayāt pratyāsannarajakagṛhaṃ praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi taiḥ bhakṣyamāṇaḥ prāṇa bhayāt pratyāsanna rajaka gṛham praviṣṭaḥ
translated: He, being eaten by them, out of fear for his life, entered the house of a nearby washerman.

original: tatra nīlīrasaparipūrṇaṃ mahābhāṇḍam sajjīkṛtam āsīt /
analyzed: tatra nīlī rasa paripūrṇam mahā bhāṇḍam sajjīkṛtam āsīt
translated: There, a large vessel filled with indigo dye was prepared.

original: tatra sārameyair ākrānto bhāṇḍamadhye patitaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sārameyaiḥ ākrāntaḥ bhāṇḍa madhye patitaḥ
translated: There, being attacked by the dogs, he fell into the vessel.

original: atha yāvan niṣkrāntas tāvan nīlīvarṇaḥ sañjātaḥ /
analyzed: atha yāvat niṣkrāntaḥ tāvat nīlī varṇaḥ sañjātaḥ
translated: Then, as he came out, he became indigo-colored.

original: tatrāpare sārameyās taṃ śṛgālam ajānanto yathābhīṣṭadiśaṃ jagmuḥ /
analyzed: tatra apare sārameyāḥ tam śṛgālam a jānantaḥ yathā abhīṣṭa diśam jagmuḥ
translated: There, other dogs, not recognizing that jackal, went in the desired direction.

original: caṇḍaravo 'pi dūrataraṃ pradeśam āsādya kānanābhimukhaṃ pratasthe /
analyzed: caṇḍaravaḥ pi dūrataram pradeśam āsādya kānana abhimukham pratasthe
translated: And Caṇḍa-ravā encountered a very remote region and set out towards the forest.

original: na ca nīlavarṇena kadācin nijaraṅgas tyajyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na ca nīlavarṇena kadācid nija raṅgaḥ tyajyate uktam ca
translated: And he never abandoned his own color, which was blue. It is said:

original: vajralepasya mūrkhasya nārīṇāṃ karkaṭasya ca /
analyzed: vajra lepasya mūrkhasya nārīṇām karkaṭasya ca
translated: Of the foolish one smeared with cement, of women, of the crab,

original: eko grahas tu mīnānāṃ nīlīmadyapayor yathā // ///
analyzed: ekaḥ grahaḥ tu mīnānām nīlī madyapayoḥ yathā
translated: And of the fish, there is only one attachment, as with indigo and wine.

original: atha taṃ haragalagaralatamālasamaprabham apūrvaṃ sattvam avalokya sarve siṃhavyāghradvīpivṛkaprabhṛtayo
analyzed: atha tam hara gala garala tamāla sama prabham apūrvam sattvam avalokya sarve siṃha vyāghra dvīpi vṛka prabhṛtayaḥ
translated: Then, seeing that unprecedented being, having the color of the tamāla tree, which is like the poison in Śiva's throat, all the forest-dwellers, such as lions, tigers, leopards, and wolves,

original: 'raṇyanivāsino bhayavyākulitacittāḥ samantāt palāyanakriyāṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: raṇya nivāsinaḥ bhaya vyākulita cittāḥ samantāt palāyana kriyām kurvanti
translated: with minds agitated by fear, fled in all directions.

original: kathayanti cana jñāyate'sya kīdṛg viceṣṭitaṃ pauruṣaṃ ca /
analyzed: kathayanti cana jñāyate isya kīdṛś viceṣṭitam pauruṣam ca
translated: And they said, We do not know what kind of behavior and manliness he has.

original: tad dūrataraṃ gacchāmaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat dūrataram gacchāmaḥ uktam ca
translated: So let us go far away. And it is said:

original: na yasya ceṣṭitaṃ vidyān na kulaṃ na parākramam /
analyzed: na yasya ceṣṭitam vidyāt na kulam na parākramam
translated: One should not trust someone whose behavior, family, or valor is unknown,

original: na tasya viśvaset prājño yadīcchec chriyam ātmanaḥ // ///
analyzed: na tasya viśvaset prājñaḥ yadi icchet śriyam ātmanaḥ
translated: if one desires one's own prosperity.

original: caṇḍaravo 'pi bhayavyākulitān vijñāyedam āhabho bhoḥ śvāpadāḥ /
analyzed: caṇḍaravaḥ pi bhaya vyākulitān vijñāya idam āha bho bhoḥ śvāpadāḥ
translated: And Caṇḍa-ravā, understanding that they were agitated by fear, said this: Hey, beasts of prey!

original: kiṃ yūyaṃ māṃ dṛṣṭvaiva saṃtrastā vrajatha /
analyzed: kim yūyam mām dṛṣṭvā eva saṃtrastāḥ vrajatha
translated: Why do you flee in fear as soon as you see me?

original: tan na bhetavyam /
analyzed: tat na bhetavyam
translated: So you need not be afraid.

original: ahaṃ brahmaṇādya svayam eva sṛṣṭvābhihitaḥyac chvāpadānāṃ kaścid rājā nāsti /
analyzed: aham brahmaṇā adya svayam eva sṛṣṭvā abhihitaḥ yat śvāpadānām kaścid rājā na asti
translated: Brahma himself created me first and said, 'Since there is no king for the beasts of prey,

original: tat tvaṃ mayādya sarvaśvāpadaprabhutve'bhiṣiktaḥ kakuddrumābhidhaḥ /
analyzed: tat tvam mayā adya sarva śvāpada prabhu tvebhiḥ siktaḥ kakuddruma abhidhaḥ
translated: I anoint you today as the lord of all beasts of prey, named Kakudru.

original: tato gatvā kṣititale tān sarvān paripālayeti /
analyzed: tatas gatvā kṣiti tale tān sarvān paripālaya iti
translated: Then go to the earth and protect them all.'

original: tato 'ham atrāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas ham atra āgataḥ
translated: So I have come here.

original: tan mama cchatracchāyāyāṃ sarvair api śvāpadair vartitavyam /
analyzed: tat mama chatra chāyāyām sarvaiḥ api śvāpadaiḥ vartitavyam
translated: Therefore, all the beasts of prey must live in the shade of my umbrella.

original: ahaṃ kakuddrumo nāma rājā trailokye'pi sañjātaḥ /
analyzed: aham kakuddrumaḥ nāma rājā trailokye pi sañjātaḥ
translated: I am the king named Kakudru, born in the three worlds.

original: tac chrutvā siṃhavyāghrapuraḥsarāḥ śvāpadāḥ svāmin prabho samādiśeti vadantas taṃ parivavruḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā siṃha vyāghra puraḥsarāḥ śvāpadāḥ svāmin prabho samādiśa iti vadantaḥ tam parivavruḥ
translated: Hearing that, the beasts of prey, with the lion and tiger at the forefront, surrounded him, saying, Lord, master, command us.

original: atha tena siṃhasyāmātyapadavī pradattā /🔽vyāghrasya śayyāpālakatvam /🔽dvīpinas tāmbūlādhikāraḥ /
analyzed: atha tena siṃhasya amātya padavī pradattā  vyāghrasya śayyā pālaka tvam  dvīpinaḥ tāmbūla adhikāraḥ
translated: Then the kingship was given to the lion,🔽the post of bed-keeper to the tiger,🔽the post of betel-nut bearer to the leopard,

original: vṛkasya dvārapālakatvam /
analyzed: vṛkasya dvāra pālaka tvam
translated: the post of door-keeper to the wolf,

original: ye cātmīyāḥ śṛgālās taiḥ sahālāpamātram api na karoti /
analyzed: ye ca ātmīyāḥ śṛgālāḥ taiḥ saha ālāpa mātram api na karoti
translated: and he did not even speak with his own jackals.

original: śṛgālāḥ sarve'py adharmacandraṃ dattvā niḥsāritāḥ /
analyzed: śṛgālāḥ sarve api adharmacandram dattvā niḥsāritāḥ
translated: All the jackals were expelled after being given a Dharma-moon.

original: evaṃ tasya rājyakriyayāṃ vartamānasya te siṃhādayo mṛgān vyāpādya tatpurataḥ prakṣipanti /
analyzed: evam tasya rājya kriyayām vartamānasya te siṃha ādayaḥ mṛgān vyāpādya tad puratas prakṣipanti
translated: And while he was thus ruling his kingdom, the lions and the others killed deer and threw them down in front of him.

original: so 'pi prabhudharmeṇa sarveṣāṃ tān pravibhajya prayacchati /
analyzed: saḥ pi prabhu dharmeṇa sarveṣām tān pravibhajya prayacchati
translated: And he, in accordance with the law of the lord, divided them all up and gave them out.

original: evaṃ gacchati kāle kadācit tena samāgatena dūradeśe śabdāyamānasya śṛgālavṛndasya kolāhalo 'śrāvi /🔽taṃ śabdaṃ śrutvā pulakitatanur ānandāśrupūrṇanayana utthāya tārasvareṇa virotum ārabdhavān /
analyzed: evam gacchati kāle kadācid tena samāgatena dūra deśe śabdāyamānasya śṛgāla vṛndasya kolāhalaḥ śrāvi  tam śabdam śrutvā pulakita tanuḥ ānanda aśru pūrṇa nayanaḥ utthāya tāra svareṇa virotum ārabdhavān
translated: In this way, as time went on, one day he heard the commotion of a pack of jackals howling in a distant land.🔽Hearing that sound, his body bristling with joy, his eyes filled with tears of joy, he rose up and began to howl in a loud voice.

original: atha te siṃhādayas taṃ tārasvaram ākarṇya śṛgālo 'yam iti matvā lajjāyādhomukhāḥ kṣaṇaṃ sthitvā procuḥbhoḥ /
analyzed: atha te siṃha ādayaḥ tam tāra svaram ākarṇya śṛgālaḥ yam iti matvā lajjāya adhomukhāḥ kṣaṇam sthitvā procuḥ bhoḥ
translated: Then the lions and the others, hearing that loud howl, thinking This is a jackal, stood there for a moment with their heads down in shame, and said, Hey!

original: vāhitā vayam anena kṣudraśṛgālena /
analyzed: vāhitāḥ vayam anena kṣudra śṛgālena
translated: We have been deceived by this petty jackal.

original: tad vadhyatām iti /
analyzed: tat vadhyatām iti
translated: So let him be killed.

original: so 'pi tad ākarṇya palāyitum icchaṃs tatra sthāna eva siṃhādibhiḥ khaṇḍaśaḥ kṛto mṛtaś ca /
analyzed: saḥ pi tat ākarṇya palāyitum icchan tatra sthāne eva siṃha ādibhiḥ khaṇḍaśas kṛtaḥ mṛtaḥ ca
translated: And he, hearing that, wanting to run away, was cut to pieces right there by the lions and the others and died.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmityaktāś cābhyantarā yena iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi iti aktāḥ ca abhyantarāḥ yena iti
translated: That is why I say, 'Those who are abandoned from within...'

original: tad ākarṇya piṅgalaka āhabho damanaka /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya piṅgalakaḥ āha bho damanaka
translated: Hearing that, Tawny said, My friend Dāmanaka,

original: kaḥ pratyayo 'tra viṣaye yat sa mamopari duṣṭabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ viṣaye yat sa mama upari duṣṭa buddhiḥ
translated: What proof is there that he is ill-disposed toward me?

original: sa āhayad adya mamāgre tena niścayaḥ kṛto yat prabhāte piṅgalakaṃ vadhiṣyāmi /
analyzed: saḥ āha yat adya mama agre tena niścayaḥ kṛtaḥ yat prabhāte piṅgalakam vadhiṣyāmi
translated: He replied, “Today I made a resolution in his presence that I would kill Tawny tomorrow morning.

original: tad atraiva pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: tat atra eva pratyayaḥ
translated: That is the proof.

original: prabhāte'vasaravelāyām āraktamukhanayanaḥ sphuritādharo diśo 'valokayann anucitasthānopaviṣṭas tvāṃ krūradṛṣṭyā vilokayiṣyati /
analyzed: prabhāta ivasara velāyām ārakta mukha nayanaḥ sphurita adharaḥ diśaḥ valokayan anucita sthāna upaviṣṭaḥ tvām krūra dṛṣṭyā vilokayiṣyati
translated: Tomorrow morning, at the time of opportunity, with a red face and eyes, lips quivering, looking at the directions, sitting in an improper place, he will look at you with a cruel glance.

original: evaṃ jñātvā yad ucitaṃ tat kartavyam /🔽iti kathayitvā sañjīvakasakāśaṃ gatas taṃ praṇamyopaviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: evam jñātvā yat ucitam tat kartavyam  iti kathayitvā sañjīvaka sakāśam gataḥ tam praṇamya upaviṣṭaḥ
translated: Knowing this, you should do what is appropriate.”🔽Having said this, he went to Live-Strong, bowed to him and sat down.

original: sañjīvako 'pi sodvegākāraṃ mandagatyā samāyāntaṃ tam udvīkṣya sādarataram uvācabho mitra /🔽svāgatam /
analyzed: sañjīvakaḥ pi sa udvega ākāram manda gatyā samāyāntam tam udvīkṣya sādarataram uvāca bho mitra  svāgatam
translated: Live-Strong, seeing him coming slowly with a troubled expression, looked at him with even greater respect and said, “Welcome, friend.

original: cirād dṛṣṭo 'si /
analyzed: cirāt dṛṣṭaḥ si
translated: You are seen after a long time.

original: api śivaṃ bhavataḥ /
analyzed: api śivam bhavataḥ
translated: Is all well with you?

original: tat kathaya yenādeyam api tubhyaṃ gṛhāgatāya prayacchāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat kathaya yena ādeyam api tubhyam gṛhāgatāya prayacchāmi uktam ca
translated: Then tell me, so that I can give you, who have come to my house, even what is not to be given. And it is said:

original: te dhanyās te vivekajñās te sabhyā iha bhūtale /
analyzed: te dhanyāḥ te viveka jñāḥ te sabhyāḥ iha bhū tale
translated: Those who are wise, those who know discrimination, those who are honorable on this earth,

original: āgacchanti gṛhe yeṣāṃ kāryārthaṃ suhṛdo janāḥ // ///
analyzed: āgacchanti gṛhe yeṣām kārya artham suhṛdaḥ janāḥ
translated: To whose houses friends and people come for business, they are blessed.

original: damanaka āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Damanaka said: My friend,

original: kathaṃ śivaṃ sevakajanasya /
analyzed: katham śivam sevaka janasya
translated: how can the life of a servant be happy?

original: sampattayaḥ parāyattāḥ sadā cittam anirvṛtam /
analyzed: sampattayaḥ parāyattāḥ sadā cittam anirvṛtam
translated: Their wealth always depends on others, their minds are never at ease,

original: svajīvite'py aviśvāsas teṣāṃ ye rājasevakāḥ // ///
analyzed: sva jīvite pi aviśvāsaḥ teṣām ye rāja sevakāḥ
translated: and they have no confidence even in their own lives - those who are royal servants.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: sevayā dhanam icchadbhiḥ sevakaiḥ paśya yat kṛtam /
analyzed: sevayā dhanam icchadbhiḥ sevakaiḥ paśya yat kṛtam
translated: Look what has been done by servants who desire wealth through service.

original: svātantryaṃ yac charīrasya mūḍhais tad api hāritam // ///
analyzed: svātantryam yat śarīrasya mūḍhaiḥ tat api hāritam
translated: Even their independence of body has been stolen by the foolish.

original: tāvaj janmātiduḥkhāya tato durgatatā sadā /
analyzed: tāvat janma ati duḥkhāya tatas durgata tā sadā
translated: To that extent, birth is extremely painful, then there is always misfortune,

original: tatrāpi sevayā vṛttir aho duḥkhaparamparā // ///
analyzed: tatra api sevayā vṛttiḥ aho duḥkha paramparā
translated: and even there, livelihood through service - oh, what a succession of suffering!

original: jīvanto 'pi mṛtāḥ pañca śrūyante kila bhārate /
analyzed: jīvantaḥ pi mṛtāḥ pañca śrūyante kila bhārate
translated: It is said that five people are considered dead even while living in India:

original: daridro vyādhito mūrkhaḥ pravāsī nityasevakaḥ // ///
analyzed: daridraḥ vyādhitaḥ mūrkhaḥ pravāsī nitya sevakaḥ
translated: The poor, the sick, the fool, the exile, and the constant servant.

original: nāśnāti svacchayotsukyād vinidro na prabudhyate /
analyzed: na aśnāti svacchayā utsukyāt vinidraḥ na prabudhyate
translated: Out of eagerness for his own welfare, he does not eat, he does not sleep, he does not wake up,

original: na niḥśaṅkaṃ vaco brūte sevako 'py atra jīvati // ///
analyzed: na niḥśaṅkam vacaḥ brūte sevakaḥ pi atra jīvati
translated: and he does not speak without fear - even a servant lives here like this.

original: sevā śvavṛttir ākhyātā yais tair mithyā prajalpitam /
analyzed: sevā śvavṛttiḥ ākhyātā yaiḥ taiḥ mithyā prajalpitam
translated: Those who have said that service is the conduct of a dog have spoken falsely,

original: svacchandaṃ carati svātra sevakaḥ paraśāsanāt // ///
analyzed: svacchandam carati sevakaḥ para śāsanāt
translated: for a servant moves about at will in his own house, but under the control of another.

original: bhūśayyā brahmacaryaṃ ca kṛśatvaṃ laghubhojanam /🔽sevakasya yater yadvad viśeṣaḥ pāpadharmajaḥ // ///
analyzed: bhū śayyā brahmacaryam ca kṛśa tvam laghu bhojanam  sevakasya yateḥ yadvat viśeṣaḥ pāpa dharma jaḥ
translated: Sleeping on the ground, celibacy, emaciation, and light meals,🔽are the special qualities of a servant and an ascetic, born of virtuous conduct.

original: śītātapādikaṣṭāni sahate yāni sevakaḥ /
analyzed: śīta ātapa ādi kaṣṭāni sahate yāni sevakaḥ
translated: The hardships a servant endures, such as cold, heat, etc.,

original: dhanāya tāni cālpāni yadi dharmān na mucyate // ///🔽mṛdunāpi suvṛttena suśliṣṭenāpi hāriṇā /
analyzed: dhanāya tāni ca alpāni yadi dharmāt na mucyate  mṛdunā api su vṛttena su śliṣṭena api hāriṇā
translated: are of little value if one does not attain virtue by them.🔽What is the use of that sweet-natured, well-behaved, and charming

original: modakenāpi kiṃ tena niṣpattir yasya sevayā // ///
analyzed: modakena api kim tena niṣpattiḥ yasya sevayā
translated: sugar candy by whose service one does not attain perfection?

original: sañjīvaka āhaatha bhavān kiṃ vaktumanāḥ /
analyzed: sañjīvakaḥ āha atha bhavān kim vaktu manāḥ
translated: Sañjīvaka said, Then what do you wish to say?

original: so 'bravītmitra /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt mitra
translated: He said, Friend,

original: sacivānāṃ mantrabhedaṃ na yujyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: sacivānām mantra bhedam na yujyate uktam ca
translated: it is not proper to divulge the counsel of ministers. And it is said:

original: yo mantraṃ svāmino bhidyāt sācivye sanniyojitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mantram svāminaḥ bhidyāt sācivye sanniyojitaḥ
translated: One who, being appointed as a minister, divulges the counsel of his master,

original: sa hatvā nṛpakāryaṃ tat svayaṃ ca narakaṃ vrajet // ///🔽yena yasya kṛto bhedaḥ sacivena mahīpateḥ /
analyzed: sa hatvā nṛpa kāryam tat svayam ca narakam vrajet  yena yasya kṛtaḥ bhedaḥ sacivena mahīpateḥ
translated: destroys the king's affairs and himself goes to hell.🔽Nārada says that by whomsoever the counsel of a king is divulged,

original: tenāśastravadhas tasya kṛta ity āha nāradaḥ // ///
analyzed: tena aśastra vadhaḥ tasya kṛtaḥ iti āha nāradaḥ
translated: he has been killed without weapons.

original: tathāpi mayā tava snehapāśabaddhena mantrabhedaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api mayā tava sneha pāśa baddhena mantra bhedaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, out of affection for you, I have divulged the counsel.

original: yatas tvaṃ mama vacanenātra rājakule viśvastaḥ praviṣṭaś ca / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas tvam mama vacanena atra rāja kule viśvastaḥ praviṣṭaḥ ca uktam ca
translated: Because you entered this royal court with confidence in my words. And it is said:

original: viśrambhād yasya yo mṛtyum avāpnoti kathañcana /
analyzed: viśrambhāt yasya yaḥ mṛtyum avāpnoti kathañcana
translated: By whom death is somehow obtained through trust,

original: tasya hatyā tadutthā sā prāhedaṃ vacanaṃ manuḥ // ///
analyzed: tasya hatyā tad utthā sā prāha idam vacanam manuḥ
translated: For him, that arising from it, is murder. Manu said this.

original: tat tavopari piṅgalako 'yaṃ duṣṭabuddhiḥ kathitaṃ cādyānena matpurataś catuṣkarṇatayāyat prabhāte sañjīvakaṃ hatvā samastamṛgaparivāraṃ
analyzed: tat tava upari piṅgalakaḥ yam duṣṭabuddhiḥ kathitam ca adya anena mad puratas prabhāte sañjīvakam hatvā samasta mṛga parivāram
translated: Therefore, this Pingalaka, of wicked mind, has told me today in the presence of four witnesses that in the morning, after killing Sanjayaka and all the animals,

original: cirāt tṛptiṃ neṣyāmi /
analyzed: cirāt tṛptim neṣyāmi
translated: he will satisfy his hunger for a long time.

original: tataḥ sa mayoktaḥsvāmin /
analyzed: tatas sa mayā uktaḥ svāmin
translated: Then I said to him, My lord,

original: na yuktam idaṃ yan mitradroheṇa jīvanaṃ kriyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na yuktam idam yat mitra droheṇa jīvanam kriyate uktam ca
translated: this is not right that life is made by treachery to friends. And it is said:

original: api brahmavadhaṃ kṛtvā prāyaścittena śudhyati /
analyzed: api brahma vadham kṛtvā prāyaścittena śudhyati
translated: Even after committing the murder of a Brahmin, one is purified by penance.

original: tadarthena vicīrṇena na kathañcit suhṛddruhaḥ // ///
analyzed: tad arthena vicīrṇena na kathañcid suhṛd druhaḥ
translated: By that very purpose, never by the one who injures a friend.

original: tatas tenāhaṃ samarṣeṇoktaḥbho duṣṭabuddhe /
analyzed: tatas tena aham samarṣeṇa uktaḥ bho duṣṭabuddhe
translated: Then he, with anger, said to me, O wicked-minded one!

original: sañjīvakas tāvac chaṣpabhojī /
analyzed: sañjīvakaḥ tāvat śaṣpa bhojī
translated: Sanjayaka eats grass.

original: vayaṃ māṃsāśinaḥ /
analyzed: vayam māṃsa āśinaḥ
translated: We are flesh-eaters.

original: tad asmākaṃ svābhāvikaṃ vairam iti kathaṃ ripur upekṣyate /
analyzed: tat asmākam svābhāvikam vairam iti katham ripuḥ upekṣyate
translated: Therefore, our natural enmity - how can an enemy be ignored?

original: tasmāt sāmādibhir upāyair hanyate /
analyzed: tasmāt sāma ādibhiḥ upāyaiḥ hanyate
translated: Therefore, he is killed by means such as conciliation and so on.

original: na ca hate tasmin doṣaḥ syāt / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na ca hate tasmin doṣaḥ syāt uktam ca
translated: And if he is killed, there will be no fault. It is said:

original: dattvāpi kanyakāṃ vairī nihantavyo vipaścitā /
analyzed: dattvā api kanyakām vairī nihantavyaḥ vipaścitā
translated: Even after giving away his daughter, an enemy should be killed by a wise man,

original: anyopāyair aśakyo yo hate doṣo na vidyate // ///
analyzed: anya upāyaiḥ aśakyaḥ yaḥ hate doṣaḥ na vidyate
translated: If he cannot be killed by other means, there is no fault in killing him.

original: kṛtyākṛtyaṃ na manyeta kṣatriyo yudhi saṅgataḥ /
analyzed: kṛtyā akṛtyam na manyeta kṣatriyaḥ yudhi saṅgataḥ
translated: A kshatriya should not consider what should be done and what should not be done when engaged in battle.

original: prasupto droṇaputreṇa dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ purā hataḥ // ///
analyzed: prasuptaḥ droṇaputreṇa dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ purā hataḥ
translated: Dhrishtadyumna was previously killed by Drona's son while asleep.

original: tad ahaṃ tasya niścayaṃ jñātvā tvatsakāśam ihāgataḥ /
analyzed: tat aham tasya niścayam jñātvā tvad sakāśam iha āgataḥ
translated: Knowing his resolve, I have come here to you.

original: sāmprataṃ me nāsti viśvāsaghātakadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: sāmpratam me nā asti viśvāsa ghātaka doṣaḥ
translated: Now I have no fault of treachery.

original: mayā suguptamantras tava niveditaḥ /
analyzed: mayā su gupta mantraḥ tava niveditaḥ
translated: I have conveyed your well-guarded secret.

original: atha yat te pratibhāti tat kuruṣva iti /
analyzed: atha yat te pratibhāti tat kuruṣva iti
translated: Now do what you think is appropriate.

original: atha sañjīvakas tasya tadvajrapātadāruṇaṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā moham upagataḥ /
analyzed: atha sañjīvakaḥ tasya tat vajra pāta dāruṇam vacanam śrutvā moham upagataḥ
translated: Then Jīvaka, hearing those words of his, harsh as a thunderbolt, fell into a swoon.

original: atha cetanāṃ labdhvā savairāgyam idam āhabho sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: atha cetanām labdhvā sa vairāgyam idam āha bho sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Then, regaining consciousness, he spoke this with dispassion: Oh, this is well said:

original: durjanagamyā nāryaḥ prāyeṇāsnehavān bhavati rājā /
analyzed: durjana gamyāḥ nāryaḥ prāyeṇa a snehavān bhavati rājā
translated: Women are generally accessible to bad men, a king is not affectionate,

original: kṛpaṇānusāri ca dhanaṃ megho giridurgavarṣī ca // ///
analyzed: kṛpaṇa anusāri ca dhanam meghaḥ giri durga varṣī ca
translated: And wealth follows the miser, a cloud rains on the inaccessible mountain.

original: ahaṃ hi saṃmato rājño ya evaṃ manyate kudhīḥ /
analyzed: aham hi saṃmataḥ rājñaḥ yaḥ evam manyate kudhīḥ
translated: I am honored by the king, he who thinks this is a fool.

original: balīvardaḥ sa vijñeyo viṣāṇaparivarjitaḥ // ///
analyzed: balīvardaḥ sa vijñeyaḥ viṣāṇa parivarjitaḥ
translated: He should be known as a bull devoid of horns.

original: varaṃ vanaṃ varaṃ bhaikṣaṃ varaṃ bhāropajīvanam /
analyzed: varam vanam varam bhaikṣam varam bhāra upajīvanam
translated: Better a forest, better alms, better a life of carrying loads,

original: varaṃ vyādhir manuṣyāṇāṃ nādhikāreṇa sampadaḥ // ///
analyzed: varam vyādhiḥ manuṣyāṇām na adhikāreṇa sampadaḥ
translated: Better a disease for humans, than prosperity through authority.

original: tad yuktaṃ mayā kṛtaṃ tad anena saha maitrī vihitā / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat yuktam mayā kṛtam tat anena saha maitrī vihitā uktam ca
translated: That was done by me, and friendship was formed with him. And it is said:

original: yayor eva samaṃ vittaṃ yayor eva samaṃ kulam /
analyzed: yayoḥ eva samam vittam yayoḥ eva samam kulam
translated: Between those who have equal wealth, between those who have equal families,

original: tayor maitrī vivāhaś ca na tu puṣṭavipuṣṭayoḥ // ///
analyzed: tayoḥ maitrī vivāhaḥ ca na tu puṣṭa vipuṣṭayoḥ
translated: Friendship and marriage are proper, not between the well-nourished and the emaciated.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is:

original: mṛgā mṛgaiḥ saṅgam anuvrajanti
analyzed: mṛgāḥ mṛgaiḥ saṅgam anuvrajanti
translated: Deer associate with deer,

original: gāvaś ca gobhis turagās turagaiḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ ca gobhiḥ turagāḥ turagaiḥ
translated: cows with cows, horses with horses,

original: mūrkhāś ca mūrkhaiḥ sudhiyaḥ
analyzed: mūrkhāḥ ca mūrkhaiḥ sudhiyaḥ
translated: fools with fools, the wise with the wise.

original: sudhībhiḥ samānaśīlavyasanena sakhyam // ///
analyzed: sudhībhiḥ samāna śīla vyasanena sakhyam
translated: Friendship is with one of similar conduct and vice.

original: tad yadi gatvā taṃ prasādayāmi /
analyzed: tat yadi gatvā tam prasādayāmi
translated: So if I go and appease him,

original: tathāpi na prasādaṃ yāsyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā api na prasādam yāsyati uktam ca
translated: still he will not be appeased. And it is said:

original: nimittam uddiśya hi yaḥ prakupyati
analyzed: nimittam uddiśya hi yaḥ prakupyati
translated: For one who gets angry for a reason,

original: dhruvaṃ sa tasyāpagame praśāmyati /
analyzed: dhruvam sa tasya apagame praśāmyati
translated: he will certainly be pacified when that is removed.

original: akāraṇadveṣaparo hi yo bhavet
analyzed: akāraṇa dveṣa paraḥ hi yaḥ bhavet
translated: But one who is intent on hatred without reason,

original: kathaṃ naras taṃ paritoṣayati // ///
analyzed: katham naraḥ tam paritoṣayati
translated: how does a man satisfy him?

original: aho sādhu cedam ucyate
analyzed: aho sādhu ca idam ucyate
translated: Ah, this is well said:

original: bhaktānām upakāriṇāṃ parahitavyāpārayuktātmanāṃ
analyzed: bhaktānām upakāriṇām para hita vyāpāra yukta ātmanām
translated: To those who help devotees, whose minds are engaged in benefiting others,

original: sevāsaṃvyavahāratattvaviduṣāṃ drohacyutānām api /
analyzed: sevā saṃvyavahāra tattva viduṣām droha cyutānām api
translated: Who know the truth of service and conduct, who are free from hostility, even to others,

original: vyāpattiḥ skhalitāntareṣu niyatā siddhir bhaved vā na vā
analyzed: vyāpattiḥ skhalita antareṣu niyatā siddhiḥ bhavet vā na vā
translated: If there is a transgression or a slip in the midst of difficulties, success may or may not come.

original: tasmād ambupater ivāvanipateḥ sevā sadā śaṅkinī // ///
analyzed: tasmāt ambu pateḥ iva avanipateḥ sevā sadā śaṅkinī
translated: Therefore, service to the lord of the earth should always be done with apprehension, as if from the lord of the waters.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: bhāvasnigdhair upakṛtam api dveṣyatāṃ yāti loke
analyzed: bhāva snigdhaiḥ upakṛtam api dveṣya tām yāti loke
translated: Even if one is kindly disposed, in this world one becomes an object of hatred.

original: sākṣād anyair apakṛtam api prītaye copayāti /🔽durgrāhyatvān nṛpatimanasāṃ naikabhāvāśrayāṇāṃ
analyzed: sākṣāt anyaiḥ apakṛtam api prītaye ca upayāti  durgrāhya tvāt nṛpati manasām na eka bhāva āśrayāṇām
translated: Even if one is directly harmed by others, it comes to please them.

original: sevādharmaḥ paramagahano yoginām apy agamyaḥ // ///
analyzed: sevā dharmaḥ parama gahanaḥ yoginām api agamyaḥ
translated: The dharma of service is extremely difficult to understand, even for yogis, because the minds of kings do not rest on a single thing.

original: tat parijñātaṃ mayā matprasādam asahamānaiḥ samīpavartibhir eṣa piṅgalakaḥ prakopitaḥ /
analyzed: tat parijñātam mayā mad prasādam asahamānaiḥ samīpa vartibhiḥ eṣa piṅgalakaḥ prakopitaḥ
translated: This has been understood by me. Unable to bear my favor, those nearby have incited this Pingalaka.

original: tenāyaṃ mamādoṣasyāpy evaṃ vadati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tena ayam mama adoṣasya api evam vadati uktam ca
translated: Therefore, he speaks thus about me, even though I am faultless. And it is said:

original: prabhoḥ prasādam anyasya na sahantīha sevakāḥ /
analyzed: prabhoḥ prasādam anyasya na sahanti iha sevakāḥ
translated: Servants here cannot bear the favor of their master,

original: sapatnya iva saṅkruddhāḥ sapatnyāḥ sukṛtair api // ///
analyzed: sapatnyaḥ iva saṅkruddhāḥ sapatnyāḥ sukṛtaiḥ api
translated: Like angry co-wives, even with the good deeds of a co-wife.

original: bhavati caivaṃ yad guṇavatsu samīpavartiṣu guṇahīnānāṃ na prasādo bhavati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: bhavati ca evam yat guṇavatsu samīpa vartiṣu guṇa hīnānām na prasādaḥ bhavati uktam ca
translated: And it is true that those who lack good qualities do not favor those who possess them, even if they are nearby. As it is said:

original: guṇavattarapātreṇa chādyante guṇināṃ guṇāḥ /
analyzed: guṇavattara pātreṇa chādyante guṇinām guṇāḥ
translated: The qualities of the virtuous are obscured by those who are more virtuous.

original: rātrau dīpaśikhākāntir na bhānāv udite sati // ///
analyzed: rātrau dīpa śikhā kāntiḥ na bhānau udite sati
translated: The radiance of a lamp flame at night does not exist when the sun has risen.

original: damanaka āhabho mitra /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha bho mitra
translated: Dāmanaka said, My friend,

original: yady evaṃ tan nāsti te bhayam /
analyzed: yadi evam tat na asti te bhayam
translated: if that is so, then you have nothing to fear.

original: prakopito 'pi sa durjanais tava vacanaracanayā prasādaṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: prakopitaḥ pi sa durjanaiḥ tava vacana racanayā prasādam yāsyati
translated: Even if angered by the wicked, he will be appeased by your eloquent words.

original: sa āhabhoḥ / na yuktam uktaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhoḥ na yuktam uktam bhavatā
translated: He said, My friend, what you say is not right.

original: laghūnām api durjanānāṃ madhye vastuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: laghūnām api durjanānām madhye vastum na śakyate
translated: It is not possible for even the lowly to live among the wicked.

original: upāyāntaraṃ vidhāya te nūnaṃ ghnanti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: upāya antaram vidhāya te nūnam ghnanti uktam ca
translated: Having devised other means, they certainly kill. As it is said:

original: bahavaḥ paṇḍitāḥ kṣudrāḥ sarve māyopajīvinaḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ paṇḍitāḥ kṣudrāḥ sarve māyā upajīvinaḥ
translated: Many learned, petty people, all living by deceit,

original: kuryuḥ kṛtyam akṛtyaṃ vā uṣṭre kākādayo yathā // ///
analyzed: kuryuḥ kṛtyam akṛtyam vai uṣṭre kāka ādayaḥ yathā
translated: may do their duty or not, like camels, crows, and so on.

original: damaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: damakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Dāmanaka asked how it was so.

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: madotkaṭasiṃhakathā
analyzed: mada utkaṭa siṃha kathā
translated: The Story of the Elephant in Rut

original: asti kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe madotkaṭo nāma siṃhaḥ prativasa ti sma /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe madotkaṭaḥ nāma siṃhaḥ sma
translated: There was a lion named Madotkaṭa living in a certain forest region.

original: tasya cānucarā anye dvīpivāyasagomāyavaḥ santi /
analyzed: tasya ca anucarāḥ anye dvīpi vāyasa gomāyavaḥ santi
translated: And he had other followers: a leopard, a crow, and a jackal.

original: atha kadācit tair itas tato bhramadbhiḥ sārthād bhraṣṭaḥ krathanako nāmoṣtro dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid taiḥ itas tatas bhramadbhiḥ sārthāt bhraṣṭaḥ krathanakaḥ nāma uṣtraḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Now one day, as they were wandering about, they saw a camel named Crusher who had strayed from a caravan.

original: atha siṃha āhaaho apūrvam idaṃ sattvam /
analyzed: atha siṃhaḥ āha aho apūrvam idam sattvam
translated: Then the lion said, “Ah, this is an unprecedented creature.

original: taj jñāyatāṃ kim etad āraṇyakaṃ grāmyaṃ veti /
analyzed: tat jñāyatām kim etat āraṇyakam grāmyam vā iti
translated: Let us find out whether it is a wild animal or a domestic one.”

original: tac chrutvā vāyasa āhabhoḥ svāmin /
analyzed: tat śrutvā vāyasaḥ āha bhoḥ svāmin
translated: Hearing this, the crow said, “My lord,

original: grāmyo 'yam uṣṭranāmā jīvaviśeṣas tava bhojyaḥ /
analyzed: grāmyaḥ yam uṣṭra nāmā jīva viśeṣaḥ tava bhojyaḥ
translated: this is a domestic animal called a camel, a special kind of living being, fit to be your food.

original: tad vyāpādyatām /
analyzed: tat vyāpādyatām
translated: So kill it.

original: siṃha āhanāhaṃ gṛham āgataṃ hanmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: siṃhaḥ āhana aham gṛham āgatam hanmi uktam ca
translated: The lion said, “I do not kill one who has come to my house. And it is said:

original: gṛhaṃ śatrum api prāptaṃ viśvastam akutobhayam /
analyzed: gṛham śatrum api prāptam viśvastam akutobhayam
translated: Even if an enemy comes to one’s house, one should trust him and not fear him.

original: yo hanyāt tasya pāpaṃ syāc chatabrāhmaṇaghātajam // ///🔽tad abhayapradānaṃ dattvā matsakāśam ānīyatāṃ yenāsyāgamakāraṇaṃ pṛcchāmi /
analyzed: yaḥ hanyāt tasya pāpam syāt śata brāhmaṇa ghāta jam  tat abhaya pradānam dattvā mad sakāśam ānīyatām yena asya āgama kāraṇam pṛcchāmi
translated: If one kills him, one will incur the sin of killing a hundred Brahmins.🔽So give him the gift of fearlessness and bring him to me, so that I can ask him why he came here.”

original: athāsau sarvair api viśvāsyābhayapradānaṃ dattvā madotkaṭasakāśam ānītaḥ praṇamyopaviṣṭaś ca /
analyzed: atha asau sarvaiḥ api viśvāsya abhaya pradānam dattvā mada utkaṭa sakāśam ānītaḥ praṇamya upaviṣṭaḥ ca
translated: Then all of them gave him the gift of fearlessness and brought him to me. He bowed and sat down.

original: tatas tasya pṛcchatas tenātmavṛttāntaḥ sārthabhraṃśasamudbhavo niveditaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tasya pṛcchataḥ tena ātma vṛttāntaḥ sārtha bhraṃśa samudbhavaḥ niveditaḥ
translated: Then, when he asked, the crow told him his story, beginning with the loss of the caravan.

original: tataḥ siṃhenoktambhoḥ krathanaka /
analyzed: tatas siṃhena uktam bhoḥ krathanaka
translated: Then the lion said, “Ah, Crow!

original: mā tvaṃ grāmaṃ gatvā bhūyo 'pi bhārodvahanakaṣṭabhāgī bhūyāḥ /
analyzed: mā tvam grāmam gatvā bhūyāḥ bhāra udvahana kaṣṭa bhāgī bhūyāḥ
translated: Don’t go to the village again and suffer the hardship of carrying loads.

original: tad atraivāraṇye nirviśaṅko marakatasadṛśāni śaṣpāgrāṇi bhakṣayan mayā saha sadaiva vasa /
analyzed: tat atra eva araṇye nirviśaṅkaḥ marakata sadṛśāni śaṣpa agrāṇi bhakṣayan mayā saha sadā eva vasa
translated: Stay right here in the forest, eating the emerald-like tips of the grass without fear, always with me.”

original: so 'pi tathety uktvā teṣāṃ madhye vicaran na kuto 'pi bhayam iti sukhenāste /🔽tathānyedyur madotkaṭasya mahāgajenāraṇyacāriṇā saha yuddham abhavat /
analyzed: saḥ u pi tathā iti uktvā teṣām madhye vicaran na kutas pi bhayam iti sukhena āste  tathā anyedyus mada utkaṭasya mahāgajena araṇya cāriṇā saha yuddham abhavat
translated: The crow agreed, and wandering among them, he lived happily, fearing nothing.🔽The next day, there was a fight between him and a huge rutting elephant that roamed the forest.

original: tatas tasya dantamusalaprahārair vyathā sañjātā /
analyzed: tatas tasya danta musala prahāraiḥ vyathā sañjātā
translated: Then, from the blows of the elephant’s tusks, he felt pain.

original: vyathitaḥ katham api prāṇair na viyuktaḥ /
analyzed: vyathitaḥ katham api prāṇaiḥ na viyuktaḥ
translated: Though in pain, he somehow did not lose his life.

original: atha śarīrāsāmarthyān na kutracit padam api calituṃ śaknoti /
analyzed: atha śarīra asāmarthyāt na kutracid padam api calitum śaknoti
translated: Then, due to the weakness of his body, he was unable to move even a single step anywhere.

original: te sarve kākādayo 'py aprabhutvena kṣudhāviṣṭāḥ paraṃ duḥkhaṃ bhejuḥ /
analyzed: te sarve kāka ādayaḥ api aprabhu tvena kṣudhā āviṣṭāḥ param duḥkham bhejuḥ
translated: All the crows and others, being powerless, were overcome with hunger and experienced great suffering.

original: atha tān siṃhaḥ prāhabhoḥ /
analyzed: atha tān siṃhaḥ prāhabhoḥ
translated: Then the lion said to them, “Gentlemen,

original: anviṣyatāṃ kutracit kiṃcit sattvaṃ yenāham etām api daśāṃ prāptas tad dhatvā yuṣmadbhojanaṃ sampādayāmi /
analyzed: anviṣyatām kutracid kiṃcid sattvam yena aham etām api daśām prāptaḥ tat hatvā yuṣmad bhojanam sampādayāmi
translated: I will search somewhere for some creature, so that I can kill it and provide you with food.

original: atha te catvāro 'pi bhramitum ārabdhā yāvan na kiṃcit sattvaṃ paśyanti tāvad vāyasaśṛgālau parasparaṃ mantrayataḥ /
analyzed: atha te catvāraḥ pi bhramitum ārabdhāḥ yāvat na kiṃcid sattvam paśyanti tāvat vāyasa śṛgālau parasparam mantrayataḥ
translated: Then all four of them started wandering around, but as long as they didn't see any creature, the crow and the jackal consulted each other.

original: śṛgāla āhabho vāyasa /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ āhabho vāyasa
translated: The jackal said, Hey crow!

original: kiṃ prabhūtabhrāntena /
analyzed: kim prabhūta bhrāntena
translated: What's the use of wandering around a lot?

original: ayam asmākaṃ prabhoḥ krathanako viśvastas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: ayam asmākam prabhoḥ krathanakaḥ viśvastaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: This our master Krathika is here, trusting us.

original: tad enaṃ hatvā prāṇayātrāṃ kurmaḥ /
analyzed: tat enam hatvā prāṇayātrām kurmaḥ
translated: So let's kill him and make a living.

original: vāyasa āhayuktam uktaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: vāyasaḥ āha yuktam uktam bhavatā
translated: The crow said, What you said is right.

original: paraṃ svāminā tasyābhayapradānaṃ dattam āste na vadhyo 'yam iti /
analyzed: param svāminā tasya abhaya pradānam dattam āste na vadhyaḥ yam iti
translated: But our master has given him a promise of safety, so he cannot be killed.

original: śṛgāla āhabho vāyasa /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ āhabho vāyasa
translated: The jackal said, Hey crow!

original: ahaṃ svāminaṃ vijñāpya tathā kariṣye yathā svāmī vadhaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: aham svāminam vijñāpya tathā kariṣye yathā svāmī vadham kariṣyati
translated: I will inform our master and do what he says, so that he will order his execution.

original: tat tiṣṭhantu bhavanto 'traiva /
analyzed: tat tiṣṭhantu bhavantaḥ trā eva
translated: So you all stay right here.

original: yāvad ahaṃ gṛhaṃ gatvā prabhor ājñāṃ gṛhītvā cāgacchāmi /
analyzed: yāvat aham gṛham gatvā prabhoḥ ājñām gṛhītvā ca āgacchāmi
translated: While I go home and take the master's order, I will return.

original: evam abhidhāya satvaraṃ siṃham uddiśya prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam abhidhāya sa tvaram siṃham uddiśya prasthitaḥ
translated: Having said this, he quickly set off towards the lion.

original: atha siṃham āsādyedam āhasvāmin /
analyzed: atha siṃham āsādya idam āha svāmin
translated: Then, approaching the lion, he said this: My lord,

original: samastaṃ vanaṃ bhrāntvā vayam āgatāḥ /
analyzed: samastam vanam bhrāntvā vayam āgatāḥ
translated: we have roamed the entire forest and have come back.

original: na kiṃcit sattvam āsāditam /
analyzed: na kiṃcid sattvam āsāditam
translated: We have not encountered any living being.

original: tat kiṃ kurmo vayam /
analyzed: tat kim kurmaḥ vayam
translated: So what shall we do?

original: samprati vayaṃ bubhukṣayā padam ekam api pracalituṃ na śaknumaḥ /
analyzed: samprati vayam bubhukṣayā padam ekam api pracalitum na śaknumaḥ
translated: Now, we cannot move even a single step due to hunger.

original: devo 'pi pathyāśī vartate /
analyzed: devaḥ pi pathya āśī vartate
translated: Your Majesty also subsists on what is wholesome.

original: tad yadi devādeśo bhavati tat krathanakapiśitenādya pathyakriyā kriyate /
analyzed: tat yadi deva ādeśaḥ bhavati tat krathanaka piśitena adya pathya kriyā kriyate
translated: Therefore, if Your Majesty commands, today the wholesome act is performed with the flesh of a monkey.

original: atha siṃhas tasya tad dāruṇaṃ vacanam ākarṇya sakopam idam āhadhik pāpādhama /
analyzed: atha siṃhaḥ tasya tat dāruṇam vacanam ākarṇya sa kopam idam āha dhik pāpa adhama
translated: Then the lion, hearing those terrible words, said this angrily: Fie on you, sinful wretch!

original: yady evaṃ bhūyo 'pi vadasi /
analyzed: yadi evam bhūyas vadasi
translated: If you speak like this again,

original: tatas tvāṃ tatkṣaṇam eva vadhiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatas tvām tad kṣaṇam eva vadhiṣyāmi
translated: then I will kill you that very moment.

original: tato mayā tasyābhayaṃ pradattam /
analyzed: tatas mayā tasya abhayam pradattam
translated: Then I gave him assurance.

original: tat kathaṃ vyāpādayāmi / uktaṃ ca🔽na gopradānaṃ na mahīpradānaṃ
analyzed: tat katham vyāpādayāmi uktam ca  na go pradānam na mahī pradānam
translated: So how can I kill him? And it is said:🔽The gift of a cow, the gift of land,

original: na cānnadānaṃ hi tathā pradhānam /
analyzed: na ca anna dānam hi tathā pradhānam
translated: and the gift of food are not as important,

original: yathā vadantīha budhāḥ pradhānaṃ
analyzed: yathā vadanti iha budhāḥ pradhānam
translated: as the wise ones say is the most important

original: sarvapradāneṣv abhayapradānam // ///
analyzed: sarva pradāneṣu abhaya pradānam
translated: of all gifts, the gift of fearlessness.

original: tac chrutvā śṛgāla āhasvāmin yady abhayapradānaṃ dattvā vadhaḥ kriyate tad eṣa doṣo bhavati /
analyzed: tat śrutvā śṛgālaḥ āha svāmin yadi abhaya pradānam dattvā vadhaḥ kriyate tat eṣa doṣaḥ bhavati
translated: Hearing this, the jackal said, If you kill him after giving him a promise of safety, that is a fault.

original: punar yadi devapādānāṃ bhaktyā sātmano jīvitavyaṃ prayacchati tan na doṣaḥ /
analyzed: punar yadi deva pādānām bhaktyā sa ātmanaḥ jīvitavyam prayacchati tat na doṣaḥ
translated: But if he gives his own life out of devotion to your feet, then there is no fault.

original: tato yadi sa svayam evātmānaṃ vadhāya niyojayati tad vadhyo 'nyathāsmākaṃ madhyād ekatamo vadhya iti yato devapādāḥ pathyāśinaḥ kṣunnirodhād
analyzed: tatas yadi sa svayam eva ātmānam vadhāya niyojayati tat vadhyaḥ nyathā asmākam madhyāt ekatamaḥ vadhyaḥ iti yatas deva pādāḥ pathya āśinaḥ kṣudh nirodhāt
translated: So if he himself commits suicide, then he should be killed. Otherwise one of us should be killed, because your feet are accustomed to wholesome food, and from the obstruction of hunger

original: antyāṃ daśāṃ yāsyanti /
analyzed: antyām daśām yāsyanti
translated: they will reach a final state.

original: tat kim etaiḥ prāṇair asmākaṃ ye svāmyarthe na yāsyanti /
analyzed: tat kim etaiḥ prāṇaiḥ asmākam ye svāmi arthe na yāsyanti
translated: So what is the use of these lives of ours, which will not go for the sake of our master?

original: aparaṃ paścād apy asmābhir vahnipraveśaḥ kāryo yadi svāmipādānāṃ kiṃcid aniṣṭaṃ bhaviṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: aparam paścāt api asmābhiḥ vahnipraveśaḥ kāryaḥ yadi svāmi pādānām kiṃcid aniṣṭam bhaviṣyati uktam ca
translated: Moreover, later we will have to enter the fire if anything unfortunate happens to your feet. And it is said:

original: yasmin kule yaḥ puruṣaḥ pradhānaḥ
analyzed: yasmin kule yaḥ puruṣaḥ pradhānaḥ
translated: In whatever family a man is the chief,

original: sa sarvayatnaiḥ parirakṣaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: sa sarva yatnaiḥ parirakṣaṇīyaḥ
translated: he should be protected by all means.

original: tasmin vinaṣṭe svakulaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ
analyzed: tasmin vinaṣṭe sva kulam vinaṣṭam
translated: If he is destroyed, the family is destroyed,

original: na nābhibhaṅge hy arakā vahanti // ///
analyzed: na na abhibhaṅge hi arakāḥ vahanti
translated: for the spokes do not move when the nave is broken.

original: tad ākarṇya madotkaṭa āhayady evaṃ tat kuruṣva yad rocate /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya mada utkaṭaḥ āha yadi evam tat kuruṣva yat rocate
translated: Hearing that, the intoxicated one said, If it is so, then do what you like.

original: tac chrutvā sa satvaraṃ gatvā tān āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sa sa tvaram gatvā tān āha bhoḥ
translated: Hearing this, he quickly went to them and said, Gentlemen,

original: svāmino mahaty avasthā vartate /
analyzed: svāminaḥ mahatī avasthā vartate
translated: our master is in a critical condition.

original: tat kiṃ paryaṭitena /
analyzed: tat kim paryaṭitena
translated: So what's the point of wandering around?

original: tena vinā ko 'trāsmān rakṣayiṣyati /
analyzed: tena vinā kaḥ trā asmān rakṣayiṣyati
translated: Without him, who will protect us here?

original: tad gatvā tasya kṣudrogāt paralokaṃ prasthitasyātmaśarīradānaṃ kurmo yena svāmiprasādasya anṛṇatāṃ gacchāmaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat gatvā tasya kṣudh rogāt para lokam prasthitasya ātma śarīra dānam kurmaḥ yena svāmi prasādasya anṛṇa tām gacchāmaḥ uktam ca
translated: Therefore, let us go and offer our own bodies to him, who is about to depart to the next world due to a minor illness, so that we may become free from the favor of our master. And it is said:

original: āpadaṃ prāpnuyāt svāmī yasya bhṛtyasya paśyataḥ /
analyzed: āpadam prāpnuyāt svāmī yasya bhṛtyasya paśyataḥ
translated: If a master encounters a calamity while a servant is watching,

original: prāṇeṣu vidyamāneṣu sa bhṛtyo narakaṃ vrajet // ///🔽tadanantaraṃ te sarve bāṣpapūritadṛśo madotkaṭaṃ praṇamyopaviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇeṣu vidyamāneṣu sa bhṛtyaḥ narakam vrajet  tad anantaram te sarve bāṣpa pūrita dṛśaḥ mada utkaṭam praṇamya upaviṣṭāḥ
translated: that servant, even if his life is at stake, will go to hell.🔽After that, all of them, their eyes filled with tears, bowed to Madotkaṭa and sat down.

original: tān dṛṣṭvā madotkaṭa āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā mada utkaṭaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Seeing them, Madotkaṭa said, Gentlemen,

original: prāptaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ vā kiṃcit sattvam /
analyzed: prāptam dṛṣṭam vā kiṃcid sattvam
translated: have you found or seen any being?

original: atha teṣāṃ madhyāt kākaḥ provācasvāmin /
analyzed: atha teṣām madhyāt kākaḥ provāca svāmin
translated: Then from among them, a crow said, Master,

original: vayaṃ tāvat sarvatra paryaṭitāḥ paraṃ na kiṃcit sattvam āsāditaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ vā /
analyzed: vayam tāvat sarvatra paryaṭitāḥ param na kiṃcid sattvam āsāditam dṛṣṭam vā
translated: we have wandered everywhere, but we have not found or seen any being.

original: tad adya māṃ bhakṣayitvā prāṇān dhārayatu svāmī /
analyzed: tat adya mām bhakṣayitvā prāṇān dhārayatu svāmī
translated: So today, let our master sustain his life by eating me.

original: yena devasyāśvāsanaṃ bhavati mama punaḥ svargaprāptir iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yena devasya āśvāsanam bhavati mama punar svarga prāptiḥ iti uktam ca
translated: By which the king is comforted, and I attain heaven. And it is said:

original: svāmyarthe yas tyajet prāṇān bhṛtyo bhaktisamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: svāmi arthe yaḥ tyajet prāṇān bhṛtyaḥ bhakti samanvitaḥ
translated: The servant who, full of devotion, gives up his life for the master's sake,

original: sa paraṃ padam āpnoti jarāmaraṇavarjitam // ///
analyzed: sa param padam āpnoti jarā maraṇa varjitam
translated: attains the highest state, free from old age and death.

original: tac chrutvā śṛgāla āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā śṛgālaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Hearing this, the jackal said, Sir,

original: svalpakāyo bhavān /🔽tava bhakṣaṇāt svāminas tāvat prāṇayātrā na bhavati /
analyzed: su alpa kāyaḥ bhavān  tava bhakṣaṇāt svāminaḥ tāvat prāṇa yātrā na bhavati
translated: you are of small body.

original: aparo doṣaś ca tāvat samutpadyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: aparaḥ doṣaḥ ca tāvat samutpadyate uktam ca
translated: By eating you, the master's life will not be sustained, and another fault will arise. And it is said:

original: kākamāṃsaṃ tathocchiṣṭaṃ stokaṃ tad api durbalam /
analyzed: kāka māṃsam tathā ucchiṣṭam stokam tat api durbalam
translated: The crow's meat, the leftovers, are little and weak.

original: bhakṣitenāpi kiṃ tena yena tṛptir na jāyate // ///🔽tad darṣitā svāmibhaktir bhavatā gataṃ ca ānṛṇyaṃ bhartṛpiṇḍasya prāptaś cobhayaloke sādhuvādaḥ /
analyzed: bhakṣitena api kim tena yena tṛptiḥ na jāyate  tat darṣitā svāmi bhaktiḥ bhavatā gatam ca ānṛṇyam bhartṛ piṇḍasya prāptaḥ ca ubhaya loke sādhuvādaḥ
translated: What is the use of eating it, by which satisfaction is not produced?

original: tad apasarāgrataḥ /
analyzed: tat apasara agratas
translated: Thus your devotion to the master is shown, and you have become free from debt to the master's food, and you have attained praise in both worlds.

original: ahaṃ svāminaṃ vijñāpayāmi /
analyzed: aham svāminam vijñāpayāmi
translated: So move aside, I will inform the master.

original: tathānuṣṭhite śṛgālaḥ sādaraṃ praṇamyopaviṣṭaḥ prāhasvāmin /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite śṛgālaḥ sa ādaram praṇamya upaviṣṭaḥ prāha svāmin
translated: When this was done, the jackal respectfully bowed and sat down and said, Master,

original: māṃ bhakṣayitvādya prāṇayātrāṃ vidhāya mamobhayalokaprāptiṃ kuru / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: mām bhakṣayitvā adya prāṇayātrām vidhāya mama ubhaya loka prāptim kuru uktam ca
translated: having eaten me today, sustain your life and bring about my attainment of both worlds. And it is said:

original: svāmyāyattāḥ sadā prāṇā bhṛtyānām arjitā dhanaiḥ /
analyzed: svāmi āyattāḥ sadā prāṇāḥ bhṛtyānām arjitāḥ dhanaiḥ
translated: The lives of servants always depend on their masters, and wealth is earned by them.

original: yatas tato na doṣo 'sti teṣāṃ grahaṇasambhavaḥ // ///
analyzed: yatas tatas na doṣaḥ sti teṣām grahaṇa sambhavaḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in their being captured.

original: atha tac chrutvā dvīpy āhabhoḥ sādhūktaṃ bhavatā punar bhavān api svalpakāyaḥ svajātiś ca nakhāyudhatvād abhakṣya eva / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atha tat śrutvā dvīpī āha bhoḥ sādhu uktam bhavatā punar bhavān api su alpa kāyaḥ sva jātiḥ ca nakha āyudha tvāt abhakṣyaḥ eva uktam ca
translated: Then the jackal, having heard that, said, Sir, you have spoken well. But you are also small-bodied and of your own kind, and are not edible because you have claws as weapons. And it is said:

original: nābhakṣyaṃ bhakṣayet prājñaḥ prāṇaiḥ kaṇṭhagatair api /
analyzed: na abhakṣyam bhakṣayet prājñaḥ prāṇaiḥ kaṇṭha gataiḥ api
translated: A wise man should not eat what is not edible, even if his life is at stake.

original: viśeṣāt tad api stokaṃ lokadvayavināśakam // ///
analyzed: viśeṣāt tat api stokam loka dvaya vināśakam
translated: Especially that little bit, which destroys both worlds.

original: tad darśitaṃ tvayātmanaḥ kaulīnyam /
analyzed: tat darśitam tvayā ātmanaḥ kaulīnyam
translated: You have shown your nobility.

original: atha vā sādhu cedam ucyate
analyzed: atha vā sādhu ca idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: etadarthaṃ kulīnānāṃ nṛpāḥ kurvanti saṅgraham /🔽ādimadhyāvasāneṣu na te gacchanti vikriyām // ///
analyzed: etad artham kulīnānām nṛpāḥ kurvanti saṅgraham  ādi madhya avasāneṣu na te gacchanti vikriyām
translated: For this purpose, kings gather the noble.🔽They do not undergo change at the beginning, middle, or end.

original: tad apasarāgrataḥ /
analyzed: tat apasara agratas
translated: So move aside.

original: yenāhaṃ svāminaṃ vijñāpayāmi /
analyzed: yena aham svāminam vijñāpayāmi
translated: So that I can inform my master.

original: tathānuṣṭhite dvīpī praṇamya madotkaṭam āhasvāmin /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite dvīpī praṇamya mada utkaṭam āha svāmin
translated: When that was done, the jackal bowed and said to the haughty lion, Master,

original: kriyatām adya mama prāṇaiḥ prāṇayātrā /
analyzed: kriyatām adya mama prāṇaiḥ prāṇa yātrā
translated: today let my life's journey be accomplished by my life.

original: dīyatām akṣayo vāsaḥ svarge /
analyzed: dīyatām akṣayaḥ vāsaḥ svarge
translated: Let an imperishable abode in heaven be given.

original: mama vistāryatāṃ kṣititale prabhūtaṃ yaśaḥ /
analyzed: mama vistāryatām kṣiti tale prabhūtam yaśaḥ
translated: Spread my abundant fame on the earth.

original: tan nātra vismayaḥ kāryaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat na atra vismayaḥ kāryaḥ uktam ca
translated: So there is no need for surprise here. And it is said:

original: mṛtānāṃ svāminaḥ kārye bhṛtyānām anuvartinām /
analyzed: mṛtānām svāminaḥ kārye bhṛtyānām anuvartinām
translated: For servants who follow the orders of their dead master,

original: bhavet svarge akṣayo vāsaḥ kīrtiś ca dharaṇītale // ///
analyzed: bhavet svarge akṣayaḥ vāsaḥ kīrtiḥ ca dharaṇī tale
translated: There will be eternal dwelling in heaven and fame on earth.

original: tac chrutvā krathanakaś cintayāmāsaetais tāvat sarvair api śobhāvākyāny uktāni na caiko 'pi svāminā vināśitaḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā krathanakaḥ cintayāmāsa etaiḥ tāvat sarvaiḥ api śobhā vākyāni uktāni na ca ekaḥ svāminā vināśitaḥ
translated: Hearing this, Krathana thought: All of them have spoken words of beauty, and not a single one has been destroyed by the master.

original: tad aham api prāptakālaṃ vakṣyāmi citrakaṃ yena madvacanam ete trayo 'pi samarthayanti /
analyzed: tat aham api prāpta kālam vakṣyāmi citrakam yena mad vacanam ete trayaḥ samarthayanti
translated: So I too will speak at the right time, with a colorful story, so that these three support my words.

original: iti niścitya provācabhoḥ satyam uktaṃ bhavatā paraṃ bhavān api nakhāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: iti niścitya provāca bhoḥ satyam uktam bhavatā param bhavān api nakha āyudhaḥ
translated: Having decided this, he said: Sir, you have spoken the truth, but you too are a claw-weaponed one.

original: tat kathaṃ bhavantaṃ svāmī bhakṣayati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat katham bhavantam svāmī bhakṣayati uktam ca
translated: So how can the master eat you? And it is said:

original: manasāpi svajātyānāṃ yo 'niṣṭāni pracintayet /
analyzed: manasā api sva jātyānām yaḥ niṣṭāni pracintayet
translated: One who even mentally thinks of unpleasant things for his own kind,

original: bhavanti tasya tāny eva iha loke paratra ca // ///
analyzed: bhavanti tasya tāni eva iha loke paratra ca
translated: Those very things happen to him in this world and the next.

original: tad apasarāgrataḥ /
analyzed: tat apasara agratas
translated: So move aside in front.

original: yenāhaṃ svāminaṃ vijñāpayāmi /
analyzed: yena aham svāminam vijñāpayāmi
translated: So that I can inform the master.

original: tathānuṣṭhite krathanako 'gre sthitvā praṇamyovācasvāmin /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite krathanakaḥ gre sthitvā praṇamya uvāca svāmin
translated: When this was done, Krathana stood in front, bowed and said, My lord,

original: ete'bhakṣyās tava tan mama prāṇaiḥ prāṇayātrā vidhīyatāṃ yena mamobhayalokaprāptir bhavati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: ete bhakṣyāḥ tava tat mama prāṇaiḥ prāṇa yātrā vidhīyatām yena mama ubhaya loka prāptiḥ bhavati uktam ca
translated: these are not edible for you, so please provide for my life with them, so that I may attain both worlds. And it is said:

original: na yajvāno 'pi gacchanti tāṃ gatiṃ naiva yoginaḥ /
analyzed: na yajvānaḥ api gacchanti tām gatim na eva yoginaḥ
translated: Even those who perform sacrifices do not go to that state, nor do even the yogis.

original: yāṃ yānti projjhitaprāṇāḥ svāmyarthe sevakottamāḥ // ///
analyzed: yām yānti projjhita prāṇāḥ svāmi arthe sevaka uttamāḥ
translated: Those excellent servants who abandon their lives for the master's sake go to that state.

original: evam abhihite tābhyāṃ śṛgālacitrakābhyāṃ vidāritobhayakukṣiḥ krathanakaḥ prāṇān atyākṣīt /
analyzed: evam abhihite tābhyām śṛgāla citrakābhyām vidārita ubhaya kukṣiḥ krathanakaḥ prāṇān atyākṣīt
translated: When this was said, the jackal and the painter tore open Krathana's belly on both sides and he gave up his life.

original: tataś ca taiḥ kṣudrapaṇḍitaiḥ sarvair bhakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca taiḥ kṣudra paṇḍitaiḥ sarvaiḥ bhakṣitaḥ
translated: And then all those petty scholars ate him.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmibahavaḥ paṇḍitāḥ kṣudrāḥ iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi bahavaḥ paṇḍitāḥ kṣudrāḥ iti
translated: Therefore I say: There are many petty scholars.

original: tad bhadra / kṣudraparivāro 'yaṃ te rājā mayā samyag jātaḥ /
analyzed: tat bhadra kṣudra parivāraḥ yam te rājā mayā samyak jātaḥ
translated: So, good sir, this king of yours has been rightly made by me to have a retinue of petty people.

original: satām asevyaṃ ca / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: satām asevyam ca uktam ca
translated: And it is unapproachable by the good. And it is said:

original: aśuddhaprakṛtau rājñi janatā nānurajyate /
analyzed: aśuddha prakṛtau rājñi janatā na anurajyate
translated: When the king's subjects are impure, the people do not take delight.

original: yathā gṛdhrasamāsannaḥ kalahaṃsaḥ samācaret // ///
analyzed: yathā gṛdhra samāsannaḥ kalahaṃsaḥ samācaret
translated: Just as a swan would behave when near a vulture.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: gṛdhrākāro 'pi sevyaḥ syād dhaṃsākāraiḥ sabhāsadaiḥ /
analyzed: gṛdhra ākāraḥ pi sevyaḥ syāt dhaṃsa ākāraiḥ sabhāsadaiḥ
translated: Even one with the form of a vulture should be served by the members of the assembly with the form of swans.

original: haṃsākāro 'pi santyājyo gṛdhrākāraiḥ sa tair nṛpaḥ // ///
analyzed: haṃsa ākāraḥ gṛdhra ākāraiḥ sa taiḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Even a swan-like king should be abandoned by those vulture-like ministers.

original: tan nūnaṃ mamopari kenacid durjanenāyaṃ prakopitaḥ /
analyzed: tat nūnam mama upari kenacid durjanena ayam prakopitaḥ
translated: Therefore, this must have been incited by some wicked person against me.

original: tenaivaṃ vadati /
analyzed: tena evam vadati
translated: Therefore, he speaks thus.

original: athavā bhavaty etat / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: athavā bhavati etat uktam ca
translated: Or this may be so, and it is said:

original: mṛdunā salilena khanyamā
analyzed: mṛdunā salilena
translated: When dug with soft water,

original: nānyavad dhṛṣyanti girer api sthalāni /
analyzed: na anya vat dhṛṣyanti gireḥ api sthalāni
translated: The places of even a mountain are not as easily pleased as others.

original: upajāpavidāṃ ca karṇajāpaiḥ
analyzed: upajāpa vidām ca karṇa jāpaiḥ
translated: And by the whispers in the ears of those who know how to whisper,

original: kim u cetāṃsi mṛdūni mānavānām // ///
analyzed: kim u cetāṃsi mṛdūni mānavānām
translated: What to say of the soft minds of men?

original: karṇaviṣeṇa ca bhagnaḥ kiṃ kiṃ na karoti bāliśo lokaḥ /
analyzed: karṇa viṣeṇa ca bhagnaḥ kim kim na karoti bāliśaḥ lokaḥ
translated: And being broken by the poison in the ear, what foolish thing does the world not do?

original: kṣapaṇakatām api dhatte pibati surāṃ narakapālena // ///
analyzed: kṣapaṇaka tām api dhatte pibati surām naraka pālena
translated: He even takes on the state of a Jaina monk and drinks liquor with the skull of a hell-being.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: pādāhato 'pi dṛḍhadaṇḍasamāhato 'pi
analyzed: pāda āhataḥ pi dṛḍha daṇḍa samāhataḥ pi
translated: Even if struck by the foot or struck by a firm stick,

original: yaṃ daṃṣṭrayā spṛśati taṃ kila hanti sarpaḥ /
analyzed: yam daṃṣṭrayā spṛśati tam kila hanti sarpaḥ
translated: It is said that a snake kills whoever it touches with its fangs.

original: ko 'py eṣa eva piśunogramanuṣyadharmaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ pi eṣaḥ eva piśuna ugra manuṣya dharmaḥ
translated: This is indeed the fierce and cruel human dharma of a slanderer,

original: karṇe paraṃ spṛśati hanti paraṃ samūlam // ///
analyzed: karṇe param spṛśati hanti param sa mūlam
translated: It touches another in the ear and destroys the other along with its roots.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: aho khalabhujaṅgasya viparīto vadhakramaḥ /
analyzed: aho khala bhujaṅgasya viparītaḥ vadha kramaḥ
translated: Oh, the opposite order of killing of a wicked snake!

original: karṇe lagati cānyasya prāṇair anyo viyujyate // ///
analyzed: karṇe lagati ca anyasya prāṇaiḥ anyaḥ viyujyate
translated: Another is attached to the ear of another and is separated from life.

original: tad evaṃ gate'pi kiṃ kartavyam ity ahaṃ tvāṃ suhṛdbhāvāt pṛcchāmi /
analyzed: tat evam gate api kim kartavyam iti aham tvām suhṛd bhāvāt pṛcchāmi
translated: So, even if it has come to this, what should be done? I ask you as a friend.

original: damanaka āhataddeśāntaragamanaṃ yujyate /🔽naivaṃvidhasya kusvāminaḥ sevāṃ vidhātum / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha tad deśa antara gamanam yujyate  na evaṃvidhasya ku svāminaḥ sevām vidhātum uktam ca
translated: Dāmanaka said, Then it is right to go to another country.🔽It is not right to serve such a bad master. And it is said:

original: guror apy avaliptasya kāryākāryam ajānataḥ /
analyzed: guroḥ api avaliptasya kārya akāryam a jānataḥ
translated: Even if a guru is arrogant and does not know right from wrong,

original: utpathapratipannasya parityāgo vidhīyate // ///
analyzed: utpatha pratipannasya parityāgaḥ vidhīyate
translated: If he has gone astray, it is prescribed to abandon him.

original: sañjīvaka āhaasmākam upari svāmini kupite gantuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: sañjīvakaḥ āha asmākam upari svāmini kupite gantum na śakyate
translated: Sañjīvaka said, When the master is angry with us, it is not possible to leave.

original: na cānyatra gatānām api nirvṛtir bhavati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na ca anyatra gatānām api nirvṛtiḥ bhavati uktam ca
translated: And even if we go elsewhere, we will not find peace. And it is said:

original: mahatāṃ yo 'parādhyena dūrastho 'smīti nāśvaset /
analyzed: mahatām dūra sthaḥ smi iti na āśvaset
translated: One who has offended the great should not be confident, thinking, 'I am far away.'

original: dīrghau buddhimato bāhū tābhyāṃ hiṃsati hiṃsakam // ///
analyzed: dīrghau buddhimataḥ bāhū tābhyām hiṃsati hiṃsakam
translated: The wise man's arms are long; with them he harms the one who harms him.

original: tad yuddhaṃ muktvā me nānyad asit śreyaskaram / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat yuddham muktvā me na anyat asit śreyaskaram uktam ca
translated: So, apart from war, I see no other way to prosperity. And it is said:

original: na tān hi tīrthais tapasā ca lokān🔽svargaiṣiṇo dānaśataiḥ suvṛttaiḥ /🔽kṣaṇena yān yānti raṇeṣu dhīrāḥ
analyzed: na tān hi tīrthaiḥ tapasā ca lokān  svarga eṣiṇaḥ dāna śataiḥ su vṛttaiḥ  kṣaṇena yān yānti raṇeṣu dhīrāḥ
translated: Those who seek heaven do not attain those worlds by holy places, austerities,🔽Hundreds of gifts, or good conduct, in an instant those worlds are attained by the brave

original: prāṇān samujjhanti hi ye suśīlāḥ // ///
analyzed: prāṇān samujjhanti hi ye su śīlāḥ
translated: Who give up their lives in battle, those of good character.

original: mṛtaiḥ samprāpyate svargo jīvadbhiḥ kīrtir uttamā /
analyzed: mṛtaiḥ samprāpyate svargaḥ jīvadbhiḥ kīrtiḥ uttamā
translated: By the dead, heaven is attained; by the living, the highest fame.

original: tad ubhāv api śūrāṇāṃ guṇāv etau sudurlabhau // ///
analyzed: tat ubhau api śūrāṇām guṇau etau su durlabhau
translated: Those two qualities of the brave are extremely difficult to obtain.

original: lalāṭadeśe rudhiraṃ sravat tu
analyzed: lalāṭa deśe rudhiram sravat tu
translated: The blood flowing from the forehead

original: śūrasya yasya praviśec ca vaktre /
analyzed: śūrasya yasya praviśet ca vaktre
translated: of the hero who enters his mouth,

original: tat somapānena samaṃ bhavec ca
analyzed: tat soma pānena samam bhavet ca
translated: that would be equal to drinking soma,

original: saṅgrāmayajñe vidhivat pradiṣṭam // ///
analyzed: saṅgrāma yajñe vidhivat pradiṣṭam
translated: prescribed in the ritual of the sacrifice of battle.

original: tathā ca🔽homārthair vidhivat pradānavidhinā sadvipravṛndārcanair
analyzed: tathā ca  homa arthaiḥ vidhivat pradāna vidhinā sat vipra vṛnda arcanaiḥ
translated: And so it is said:🔽The fruit that is attained by the proper offering of oblations for the sake of the sacrifice, by the worship of the best of brahmins,

original: yajñair bhūrisudakṣiṇaiḥ suvihitaiḥ samprāpyate yat phalam /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ bhūri su dakṣiṇaiḥ su vihitaiḥ samprāpyate yat phalam
translated: by sacrifices with abundant gifts, well performed,

original: sattīrthāśramavāsahomaniyamaiś cāndrāyaṇādyaiḥ kṛtaiḥ
analyzed: sat tīrtha āśrama vāsa homa niyamaiḥ cāndrāyaṇa ādyaiḥ kṛtaiḥ
translated: by men who have performed austerities, lunar and other fasts,

original: pumbhis tatphalam āhave vinihitaiḥ samprāpyate tatkṣaṇāt // ///
analyzed: pumbhiḥ tad phalam āhave vinihitaiḥ samprāpyate tad kṣaṇāt
translated: that fruit is attained in an instant by those who are killed in battle.

original: tad ākarṇya damanakaś cintayāmāsayuddhāya kṛtaniścayo 'yaṃ dṛśyate durātmā /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya damanakaḥ cintayāmāsa yuddhāya kṛta niścayaḥ yam dṛśyate durātmā
translated: Hearing that, Damanaka thought: This evil-minded one is seen to be determined for battle.

original: tad yadi kadācit tīkṣṇaśṛgālābhyāṃ svāminaṃ prahariṣyati tan mahān anarthaḥ sampatsyate /
analyzed: tat yadi kadācid tīkṣṇa śṛgālābhyām svāminam prahariṣyati tat mahān anarthaḥ sampatsyate
translated: If at some time he strikes his master with his sharp claws, then great misfortune will befall.

original: tad enaṃ bhūyo 'pi svabuddhyā prabodhya tathā karomi /
analyzed: tat enam bhūyas sva buddhyā prabodhya tathā karomi
translated: I shall therefore awaken him again with my own intelligence and act accordingly.

original: yathā deśāntaragamanaṃ karoti /
