analyzed: yathā deśa antara gamanam karoti
translated: Just as one goes to another country.

original: āha cabho mitra /
analyzed: āha cabho mitra
translated: And he said, Friend,

original: samyag abhihitaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: samyak abhihitam bhavatā
translated: you have spoken well.

original: paraṃ kaḥ svāmibhṛtyayoḥ saṅgrāmaḥ / uktaṃ ca🔽balavantaṃ ripuṃ dṛṣṭvā kilātmānaṃ pragopayet /
analyzed: param kaḥ svāmi bhṛtyayoḥ saṅgrāmaḥ uktam ca  balavantam ripum dṛṣṭvā kila ātmānam pragopayet
translated: But what is the point of a quarrel between master and servant? And it is said:🔽Seeing a powerful enemy, one should hide oneself.

original: balavadbhiś ca kartavyā śaraccandraprakāśatā // ///
analyzed: balavadbhiḥ ca kartavyā śarad candra prakāśa tā
translated: And one should be as radiant as the autumn moon in the presence of the powerful.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And moreover:

original: śatror vikramam ajñātvā vairam ārabhate hi yaḥ /
analyzed: śatroḥ vikramam a jñātvā vairam ārabhate hi yaḥ
translated: He who begins a feud without knowing the enemy's prowess,

original: sa parābhavam āpnoti samudraṣ ṭiṭṭibhād yathā // ///
analyzed: sa parābhavam āpnoti samudraḥ ṭiṭṭibhāt yathā
translated: he meets with defeat, like the ocean did from the lapwing.

original: sañjīvaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: sañjīvakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Life-Giving asked how it happened.

original: so 'bravīt🔽kathā
analyzed: saḥ bravīt  kathā
translated: He replied:

original: ṭiṭṭibhadampatīkathā
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibha dampatī kathā
translated: The Story of the Lapwing Couple

original: kasmiṃścit samudraikadeśe ṭiṭṭibhadampatī vasataḥ /🔽tato gacchati kāla ṛtusamayam āsādya ṭiṭṭibhī garbham ādhatta /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid samudra eka deśe ṭiṭṭibha dampatī vasataḥ  tatas gacchati kāle ṛtu samayam āsādya ṭiṭṭibhī garbham ādhatta
translated: In a certain part of the ocean, a lapwing couple lived.🔽Then, as time passed, the female lapwing conceived at the right season.

original: āsannaprasavā satī sā ṭiṭṭibham ūcebhoḥ kānta /
analyzed: āsanna prasavā satī sā ṭiṭṭibham ūce bhoḥ kānta
translated: When she was about to give birth, she said to the male lapwing, My dear,

original: mama prasavasamayo vartate /
analyzed: mama prasava samayaḥ vartate
translated: my time to give birth has come.

original: tad vicintyatāṃ kim api nirupadravaṃ sthānaṃ yena tatrāham aṇḍakamokṣaṇaṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat vicintyatām kim api nirupadravam sthānam yena tatra aham aṇḍaka mokṣaṇam karomi
translated: Please think of some place free from danger where I can lay my eggs.

original: ṭiṭṭibhaḥ prāhabhadre ramyo 'yaṃ samudrapradeśaḥ /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhaḥ prāha bhadre ramyaḥ yam samudra pradeśaḥ
translated: The lapwing said, My dear, this part of the ocean is delightful.

original: tad atraiva prasavaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: tat atra eva prasavaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: So let's have our young here.

original: sā prāhaatra pūrṇimādine samudravelā carati /
analyzed: sā prāha atra pūrṇimā dine samudra velā carati
translated: She said, Here on the full moon day, the ocean tide comes in.

original: sā mattagajendrān api samākarṣati /
analyzed: sā matta gaja indrān api samākarṣati
translated: It drags in even intoxicated mighty elephants.

original: tad dūram anyatra kiṃcit sthānam anviṣyatām /
analyzed: tat dūram anyatra kiṃcid sthānam anviṣyatām
translated: So let's find some other place far away.

original: tac chrutvā vihasya ṭiṭṭibha āhabhadre na yuktam uktaṃ bhavatyā /
analyzed: tat śrutvā vihasya ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha bhadre na yuktam uktam bhavatyā
translated: Hearing this, the lapwing laughed and said, My dear, you have spoken unwisely.

original: kā mātrā samudrasya yā mama dūṣayiṣyati prasūtim /
analyzed: kā mātrā samudrasya yā mama dūṣayiṣyati prasūtim
translated: What is the extent of the ocean that will spoil my offspring?

original: kiṃ na śrutaṃ bhavatyā
analyzed: kim na śrutam bhavatyā
translated: Have you not heard

original: baddhvāmbaracaramārgaṃ vyapagatadhūmaṃ sadā mahad bhayadam /
analyzed: baddhvā ambara cara mārgam vyapagata dhūmam sadā mahat bhaya dam
translated: The path of the sky is blocked, the great fire is always smokeless and fearful.

original: mandamatiḥ kaḥ praviśati hutāśanaṃ svecchayā manujaḥ // ///🔽mattebhakumbhavidalanakṛtaśramaṃ suptam antakapratimam /
analyzed: manda matiḥ kaḥ praviśati hutāśanam sva icchayā manujaḥ  matta ibha kumbha vidalana kṛta śramam suptam antaka pratimam
translated: What foolish man would enter the fire at will?🔽The lion awakens the sleeping god of death, who is tired from splitting the temples of intoxicated elephants.

original: yamalokadarśanecchuḥ siṃhaḥ bodhayati ko nāma // ///
analyzed: yama loka darśana icchuḥ siṃhaḥ bodhayati kaḥ nāma
translated: Who would awaken him, desiring to see the world of Yama?

original: ko gatvā yamasadanaṃ svayam antakam ādiśaty ajātabhayaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ gatvā yama sadanam svayam antakam ādiśati ajāta bhayaḥ
translated: Who, unafraid of death, goes to Yama's abode and commands the god of death himself?

original: prāṇān apahara matto yadi śaktiḥ kācid asti tava // ///
analyzed: prāṇān apahara mattaḥ yadi śaktiḥ kācid asti tava
translated: Take away my life if you have any power.

original: prāleyaleśamiśre maruti prābhātike ca vāti jaḍe /
analyzed: prāleya leśa miśre maruti prābhātike ca vāti jaḍe
translated: When the morning breeze mixes with a few snow flakes,

original: guṇadoṣajñaḥ puruṣo jalena kaḥ śītam apanayati // ///
analyzed: guṇa doṣa jñaḥ puruṣaḥ jalena kaḥ śītam apanayati
translated: which man, knowing good and bad, would remove the cold with water?

original: tasmād viśrabdhātraiva garbhaṃ muñca / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tasmāt viśrabdhā atra eva garbham muñca uktam ca
translated: Therefore, be confident and release the embryo right here. And it is said:

original: yaḥ parābhavasantrastaḥ svasthānaṃ santyajen naraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ parābhava santrastaḥ sva sthānam santyajet naraḥ
translated: If a man, frightened by defeat, abandons his own place,

original: tena cet putriṇī mātā tad vandhyā kena kathyate // ///
analyzed: tena ced putriṇī mātā tat vandhyā kena kathyate
translated: and if his mother is a child-bearing woman, then by whom is she called barren?

original: tac chrutvā samudraś cintayām āsaaho garvaḥ pakṣikīṭasyāsya /
analyzed: tat śrutvā samudraḥ cintayām āsa aho garvaḥ pakṣi kīṭasya asya
translated: Hearing this, the ocean thought: Oh, this bird-insect has pride.

original: atha vā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: atha vā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: But this is well said:

original: utkṣipya ṭiṭṭibhaḥ pādāv āste bha gabhayād divaḥ /
analyzed: utkṣipya ṭiṭṭibhaḥ pādau āste gabhayāt divaḥ
translated: The lapwing raises its feet and stays out of fear of the sun.

original: svacittakalpito garvaḥ kasya nātrāpi vidyate // ///
analyzed: sva citta kalpitaḥ garvaḥ kasya na atrā api vidyate
translated: Who does not have pride imagined by his own mind here?

original: tan mayāsya pramāṇaṃ kutūhalād api draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tat mayā asya pramāṇam kutūhalāt api draṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, I must see his measure out of curiosity.

original: kiṃ mamaiṣo 'ṇḍāpahāre kṛte kariṣyati /
analyzed: kim mama eṣaḥ ṇḍa apahāre kṛte kariṣyati
translated: What will he do when I destroy his eggs?

original: iti cintayitvā sthitaḥ /
analyzed: iti cintayitvā sthitaḥ
translated: Thinking this, he remained still.

original: atha prasavānantaraṃ prāṇayātrārthaṃ gatāyāṣ ṭiṭṭibhyāḥ samudro velāvyājenāṇḍāny apajahāra /
analyzed: atha prasava anantaram prāṇayātrā artham gatāyāḥ ṭiṭṭibhyāḥ samudraḥ velā vyājena aṇḍāni apajahāra
translated: Then, when the lapwing had gone for her livelihood after giving birth, the ocean, under the pretext of the shore, took away her eggs.

original: athāyātā sā ṭiṭṭibhī prasavasthānaṃ śūnyam avalokya pralapantī ṭiṭṭibham ūcebho mūrkha /
analyzed: atha āyātā sā ṭiṭṭibhī prasava sthānam śūnyam avalokya pralapantī ṭiṭṭibham ūca ibho mūrkha
translated: Then the female lapwing came back and, seeing the nest empty, lamented. She said to the male lapwing, “Hey, fool!

original: kathitam āsīn mayā te yat samudravelayā aṇḍānāṃ vināśo bhaviṣyati tad dūrataraṃ vrajāvaḥ paraṃ mūḍhatayāhaṃkāram āśritya mama vacanaṃ na karoṣi
analyzed: kathitam āsīt mayā te yat samudra velayā aṇḍānām vināśaḥ bhaviṣyati tat dūrataram vrajāvaḥ param mūḍha tayā ahaṃkāram āśritya mama vacanam na karoṣi
translated: I told you that the eggs would be destroyed by the ocean tide, so we should have gone far away. But out of foolishness you insisted on your own way and didn’t do what I said.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate /
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or rather, this is well said:

original: suhṛdāṃ hitakāmānāṃ na karotīha yo vacaḥ /
analyzed: suhṛdām hita kāmānām na karoti iha yaḥ vacaḥ
translated: He who does not heed the words of well-wishers who desire his welfare,

original: sa kūrma iva durbuddhiḥ kāṣṭhād bhraṣṭo vinaśyati // ///
analyzed: sa kūrmaḥ iva durbuddhiḥ kāṣṭhāt bhraṣṭaḥ vinaśyati
translated: that foolish fellow, like a tortoise fallen from a tree, will perish.

original: ṭiṭṭibha āhakatham etat /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha katham etat
translated: The lapwing asked how it had happened.

original: sābravīt🔽kathā
analyzed: sā bravīt  kathā
translated: She replied:

original: kambugrīvākhyakūrmakathā
analyzed: kambugrīva ākhya kūrma kathā
translated: The Story of the Tortoise Named Conch-Neck

original: asti kasmiṃścij jalāśaye kambugrīvo nāma kacchapaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid jalāśaye kambugrīvaḥ nāma kacchapaḥ
translated: In a certain body of water there was a tortoise named Conch-Neck.

original: tasya ca saṅkaṭavikaṭanāmnī mitre haṃsajātīye paramasnehakoṭim āśrite nityam
analyzed: tasya ca saṅkaṭa vikaṭa nāmnī mitre haṃsa jātīye parama sneha koṭim āśrite nityam
translated: And he had two friends named Tight-Ass and Rough-Neck, who were geese. They were devoted to the highest degree of affection.

original: eva sarastīram āsādya tena sahānekadevarṣimaharṣīṇāṃ kathāḥ kṛtvāstamayavelāyāṃ
analyzed: eva saraḥ tīram āsādya tena saha aneka devarṣi mahā ṛṣīṇām kathāḥ kṛtvā astamaya velāyām
translated: Every day they would come to the shore of the lake, and after telling many stories of gods, sages, and great sages with him,

original: svanīḍāsaṃśrayaṃ kurutaḥ /
analyzed: sva nīḍā saṃśrayam kurutaḥ
translated: at sunset they would go to their nest to sleep.

original: atha gacchatā kālenāvṛṣṭivaśāt saraḥ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ śoṣam agamat /
analyzed: atha gacchatā kālena avṛṣṭi vaśāt saraḥ śanais śanais śoṣam agamat
translated: Then, as time went on, the lake gradually dried up due to lack of rain.

original: tatas tadduḥkhaduḥkhitau tāv ūcatuḥbho mitra /
analyzed: tatas tad duḥkha duḥkhitau tau ūcatuḥ bho mitra
translated: Then, afflicted by that sorrow, they said: Oh friend,

original: jambālaśeṣam etatsaraḥ sañjātam /
analyzed: jambāla śeṣam etat saraḥ sañjātam
translated: this lake has become a mere swamp.

original: tat kathaṃ bhavān bhaviṣyatīti vyākulatvaṃ no hṛdi vartate /
analyzed: tat katham bhavān bhaviṣyati iti vyākula tvam naḥ hṛdi vartate
translated: So we are worried about how you will fare.

original: tac chrutvā kambugrīva āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā kambugrīvaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Hearing that, Conch-Neck said: Oh,

original: sāmprataṃ nāsty asmākaṃ jīvitavyaṃ jalābhāvāt /
analyzed: sāmpratam na asti asmākam jīvitavyam jala abhāvāt
translated: now we have no means of living due to lack of water.

original: tathāpy upāyaś cintyatām iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā api upāyaḥ cintyatām iti uktam ca
translated: Nevertheless, let a remedy be considered. And it is said:

original: tyājyaṃ na dhairyaṃ vidhure'pi kāle
analyzed: tyājyam na dhairyam vidhure pi kāle
translated: In difficult times, one should not abandon courage,

original: dhairyāt kadācid gatim āpnuyāt saḥ /🔽yathā samudre'pi ca potabhaṅge
analyzed: dhairyāt kadācid gatim āpnuyāt saḥ  yathā ca pota bhaṅge
translated: for one may sometimes find a way through courage.🔽Just as a sailor still wishes to cross the ocean

original: sāṃyātriko vāñchati tartum eva // ///
analyzed: sāṃyātrikaḥ vāñchati tartum eva
translated: even when his ship is wrecked.

original: aparaṃ ca🔽mitrārthe bāndhavārthe ca buddhimān yatate sadā /
analyzed: aparam ca  mitra arthe bāndhava arthe ca buddhimān yatate sadā
translated: And further:🔽The wise always strive for the sake of friends and relatives.

original: jātāsv āpatsu yatnena jagādedaṃ vaco manuḥ // ///
analyzed: jātāsu āpatsu yatnena jagāda idam vacaḥ manuḥ
translated: Manu said this with effort in times of adversity.

original: tad ānīyatāṃ kācid dṛḍharajjur laghukāṣṭhaṃ vā /
analyzed: tat ānīyatām kācid dṛḍha rajjuḥ laghu kāṣṭham vā
translated: So let some strong rope or light wood be brought.

original: anviṣyatāṃ ca prabhūtajalasanāthaṃ saraḥ /
analyzed: anviṣyatām ca prabhūta jala sanātham saraḥ
translated: And let a lake with plenty of water be searched for.

original: yena mayā madhyapradeśe dantair gṛhīte sati yuvāṃ koṭibhāgayos tatkāṣṭhaṃ mayā sahitaṃ saṅgṛhya tatsaro nayathaḥ /
analyzed: yena mayā madhya pradeśe dantaiḥ gṛhīte sati yuvām koṭi bhāgayoḥ tat kāṣṭham mayā sahitam saṅgṛhya tat saraḥ nayathaḥ
translated: When I have seized it with my teeth in the middle, you two, taking the log with the two ends, will carry it to the lake.

original: tāv ūcatuḥbho mitra /
analyzed: tau ūcatuḥ bho mitra
translated: They said, 'Friend,

original: evaṃ kariṣyāvaḥ /
analyzed: evam kariṣyāvaḥ
translated: we will do as you say.

original: paraṃ bhavatā maunavratena sthātavyam /
analyzed: param bhavatā mauna vratena sthātavyam
translated: But you must keep silent.

original: no cet tava kāṣṭhāt pāto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: no ced tava kāṣṭhāt pātaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Otherwise you will fall from the log.'

original: tathānuṣṭhite gacchatā kambugrīveṇādhobhāgavyavasthitaṃ kiṃcit puram ālokitam /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite gacchatā kambugrīveṇa adhas bhāga vyavasthitam kiṃcid puram ālokitam
translated: As they were going along, Kambuग्रीव saw a certain city below,

original: tatra ye paurās te tathā nīyamānaṃ vilokya savismayam idam ūcuḥaho cakrākāraṃ kim api pakṣibhyāṃ nīyate /
analyzed: tatra ye paurāḥ te tathā nīyamānam vilokya sa vismayam idam ūcuḥ aho cakra ākāram kim api pakṣibhyām nīyate
translated: where the citizens, seeing them carried along in that way, said with amazement, 'Oh, something shaped like a wheel is being carried by the birds.

original: paśyata paśyata /🔽atha teṣāṃ kolāhalam ākarṇya kambugrīva āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: paśyata paśyata  atha teṣām kolāhalam ākarṇya kambugrīvaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Look, look!'

original: kim eṣa kolāhalaḥ /
analyzed: kim eṣa kolāhalaḥ
translated: Then, hearing their uproar, Kambuग्रीव said, 'What is this uproar?'

original: iti vaktumanā ardhokte patitaḥ pauraiḥ khaṇḍaśaḥ kṛtaś ca /
analyzed: iti vaktu manāḥ ardha ukte patitaḥ pauraiḥ khaṇḍaśas kṛtaḥ ca
translated: Desiring to say this, he fell in the middle of the sentence and was cut to pieces by the citizens.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmisuhṛdāṃ hitakāmānām iti / tathā ca
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi suhṛdām hita kāmānām iti tathā ca
translated: Therefore I say: 'The well-wishers who desire your welfare,' and so on.

original: anāgatavidhātā ca pratyutpannamatis tathā /
analyzed: anāgatavidhātā ca pratyutpannamatiḥ tathā
translated: And: The one who plans for the future, and the one who is quick-witted,

original: dvāv etau sukham edhete yadbhaviṣyo vinaśyati // ///
analyzed: dvau etau sukham edhete yadbhaviṣyaḥ vinaśyati
translated: These two live happily, while the one who is to be born perishes.

original: ṭiṭṭibha āhakatham etat /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha katham etat
translated: The partridge asked, How is this?

original: sābravīt
analyzed: sā bravīt
translated: She said:

original: kathā🔽anāgatavidhātādimatsyatrayakathā
analyzed: kathā  anāgatavidhātā ādi matsya traya kathā
translated: The Story🔽The Story of the Three Fish: The Planner for the Future, the Present-Mindful, and the One to Be

original: kasmiṃścij jalāśaye'nāgatavidhātā pratyutpannamatir yadbhaviṣyaś ceti trayo matsyāḥ santi /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid jalāśayena āgatavidhātā pratyutpannamatiḥ yadbhaviṣyaḥ ca iti trayaḥ matsyāḥ santi
translated: In a certain body of water, there were three fish: the Planner for the Future, the Present-Mindful, and the One to Be.

original: atha kadācit taṃ jalāśayaṃ dṛṣṭvā gacchadbhir matsyajīvibhir uktamyad aho bahumatsyo 'yaṃ hradaḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid tam jalāśayam dṛṣṭvā gacchadbhiḥ matsya jīvibhiḥ uktam yat aho bahu matsyaḥ yam hradaḥ
translated: Then, seeing that body of water, some fishermen said, Oh, this pond has many fish.

original: kadācid api nāsmābhir anveṣitaḥ /
analyzed: kadācid api na asmābhiḥ anveṣitaḥ
translated: We have never searched it before.

original: tad adya tāvad āhāravṛttiḥ sañjātā /
analyzed: tat adya tāvat āhāra vṛttiḥ sañjātā
translated: Now we have found our livelihood.

original: sandhyāsamayaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: sandhyā samayaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: And evening has come.

original: tataḥ prabhāte'trāgantavyam iti niścayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prabhātā itra āgantavyam iti niścayaḥ
translated: We will come here in the morning. This was their decision.

original: atas teṣāṃ tatkuliśapātopamaṃ vacaḥ samākarṇyānāgatavidhātā sarvān matsyān āhūyedam ūceaho /
analyzed: atas teṣām tat kuliśa pāta upamam vacaḥ samākarṇya anāgatavidhātā sarvān matsyān āhūya idam ūce aho
translated: Hearing their words, which were like the fall of Indra's thunderbolt, the Planner for the Future called all the fish and said this: Oh.

original: śrutaṃ bhavadbhir yan matsyajīvibhir abhihitam /
analyzed: śrutam bhavadbhiḥ yat matsya jīvibhiḥ abhihitam
translated: Have you heard what the fishermen said?

original: tad rātrāv api gamyatāṃ kiñcin nikaṭaṃ saraḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat rātrau api gamyatām kiñcid nikaṭam saraḥ uktam ca
translated: So go to a nearby pond even at night. And it is said:

original: aśaktair balinaḥ śatroḥ kartavyaṃ prapalāyanam /
analyzed: aśaktaiḥ balinaḥ śatroḥ kartavyam prapalāyanam
translated: The weak should flee from powerful enemies.

original: saṃśritavyo 'thavā durgo nānyā teṣāṃ gatir bhavet // ///
analyzed: durgaḥ na anyā teṣām gatiḥ bhavet
translated: or a fortress to take refuge in, for they have no other recourse.

original: tan nūnaṃ prabhātasamaye matsyajīvino 'tra samāgamya matsyasaṅkṣayaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: tat nūnam prabhāta samaye matsya jīvinaḥ samāgamya matsya saṅkṣayam kariṣyanti
translated: Then, no doubt, in the morning the fishermen will come here and destroy the fish.

original: etan mama manasi vartate /
analyzed: etat mama manasi vartate
translated: This is what I think.

original: tan na yuktaṃ sāmprataṃ kṣaṇam apy atrāvasthātum / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat na yuktam sāmpratam kṣaṇam api atrā avasthātum uktam ca
translated: So it is not right to stay here even for a moment now. And it is said:

original: vidyamānā gatir yeṣām anyatrāpi sukhāvahā /
analyzed: vidyamānā gatiḥ yeṣām anyatra api sukha āvahā
translated: For those who have a means of escape elsewhere, even if it brings happiness,

original: te na paśyanti vidvāṃso dehabhaṅgaṃ kulakṣayam // ///
analyzed: te na paśyanti vidvāṃsaḥ deha bhaṅgam kula kṣayam
translated: The wise do not see the destruction of the body or the ruin of the family.

original: tad ākarṇya pratyutpannamatiḥ prāhaaho satyam abhihitaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya pratyutpanna matiḥ prāha aho satyam abhihitam bhavatā
translated: Having heard that, Pratyutsahana said: Oh, what you have said is true.

original: mamāpy abhīṣṭam etat /
analyzed: mama api abhīṣṭam etat
translated: This is what I also desire.

original: tad anyatra gamyatām iti / uktaṃ ca🔽paradeśabhayāt bhītā bahumāyā napuṃsakāḥ /
analyzed: tat anyatra gamyatām iti uktam ca  para deśa bhayāt bhītāḥ bahu māyāḥ napuṃsakāḥ
translated: So let us go elsewhere. And it is said:🔽Frightened by the danger of foreign lands, full of deceit, neither male nor female,

original: svadeśe nidhanaṃ yānti kākāḥ kāpuruṣā mṛgāḥ // ///
analyzed: sva deśe nidhanam yānti kākāḥ kāpuruṣāḥ mṛgāḥ
translated: In their own country, crows, cowards, and deer meet their end.🔽Having heard that, Pratyutsahana said: Oh, what you have said is true.🔽This is what I also desire.🔽So let us go elsewhere. And it is said:

original: yasyāsti sarvatra gatiḥ sa kasmāt
analyzed: yasya asti sarvatra gatiḥ sa kasmāt
translated: He who has a way of escape everywhere, why does he

original: svadeśarāgeṇa hi yāti nāśam /
analyzed: sva deśa rāgeṇa hi yāti nāśam
translated: Go to destruction out of attachment to his own country?

original: tātasya kūpo 'yam iti bruvāṇāḥ
analyzed: tātasya kūpaḥ yam iti bruvāṇāḥ
translated: Saying This is my father's well,

original: kṣārajalaṃ kāpuruṣāḥ pibanti // ///
analyzed: kṣāra jalam kāpuruṣāḥ pibanti
translated: Cowards drink the salt water.

original: atha tat samākarṇya proccair vihasya yadbhaviṣyaḥ provācaaho /
analyzed: atha tat samākarṇya proccais vihasya yadbhaviṣyaḥ provāca aho
translated: Then, hearing that, Yadbhavisya laughed loudly and said:

original: na bhavadbhyāṃ mantritaṃ samyag etad iti /
analyzed: na bhavadbhyām mantritam samyak etat iti
translated: You two have not consulted properly about this.

original: yataḥ kiṃ vāṅmātreṇāpi teṣāṃ pitṛpaitāmahikam etat saras tyaktuṃ yujyate /
analyzed: yatas kim vāc mātreṇa api teṣām pitṛpaitāmahikam etat saraḥ tyaktum yujyate
translated: For how can they abandon this lake, which has been their ancestral home, just because of a few words?

original: yady āyuḥkṣayo 'sti tad anyatra gatānām api mṛtyur bhaviṣyaty eva / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yadi āyuḥ kṣayaḥ sti tat anyatra gatānām api mṛtyuḥ bhaviṣyati eva uktam ca
translated: If there is a loss of life, then death will surely come even if they go elsewhere. And it is said:

original: arakṣitaṃ tiṣṭhati daivarakṣitaṃ
analyzed: a rakṣitam tiṣṭhati daiva rakṣitam
translated: What is not protected remains protected by fate,

original: surakṣitaṃ daivahataṃ vinaśyati /
analyzed: su rakṣitam daiva hatam vinaśyati
translated: What is well-protected perishes when struck by fate.

original: jīvaty anātho 'pi vane visarjitaḥ
analyzed: jīvati vane visarjitaḥ
translated: Even a helpless one released in the forest lives,

original: kṛtaprayatno 'pi gṛhe na jīvati // ///
analyzed: kṛta prayatnaḥ u pi gṛhe na jīvati
translated: Even one making efforts does not live in the house.

original: tad ahaṃ na yāsyāmi bhavadbhyāṃ ca yat pratibhāti tat kartavyam /
analyzed: tat aham na yāsyāmi bhavadbhyām ca yat pratibhāti tat kartavyam
translated: Therefore, I will not go. And you two should do what you think is right.

original: atha tasya taṃ niścayaṃ jñātvānāgatavidhātā pratyutpannamatiś ca niṣkrānau saha parijanena /
analyzed: atha tasya tam niścayam jñātvā anāgatavidhātā pratyutpanna matiḥ ca niṣkrānau saha parijanena
translated: Then, knowing his resolve, Anagatavidhata and Pratyutpannamaति left with their retinue.

original: atha prabhāte tair matsyajīvibhir jālais taj jalāśayam āloḍya yadbhaviṣyeṇa saha tatsaro nirmatsyatāṃ nītam /
analyzed: atha prabhāte taiḥ matsya jīvibhiḥ jālaiḥ tat jalāśayam āloḍya yadbhaviṣyeṇa saha tat saraḥ nirmatsya tām nītam
translated: Then in the morning, those fishermen stirred up that pond with their nets and emptied it of fish along with Yadbhavisya.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmianāgatavidhātā ceti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi anāgatavidhātā ca iti
translated: Therefore, I say: And Anagatavidhata.

original: tac chrutvā ṭiṭṭibha āhabhadre /
analyzed: tat śrutvā ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha bhadre
translated: Hearing this, the lapwing said: “My dear!

original: kiṃ māṃ yadbhaviṣyasadṛśaṃ sambhāvayasi /
analyzed: kim mām yadbhaviṣya sadṛśam sambhāvayasi
translated: Why do you think I am like a coward?

original: tat paśya me buddhiprabhāvaṃ yāvad enaṃ duṣṭasamudraṃ svacañcvā śoṣayāmi /
analyzed: tat paśya me buddhi prabhāvam yāvat enam duṣṭa samudram sva cañcvā śoṣayāmi
translated: Just see the power of my intelligence. I will dry up that wicked ocean with my own beak.”

original: ṭiṭṭibhy āhaaho kas te samudreṇa saha vigrahaḥ /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhī āha aho kaḥ te samudreṇa saha vigrahaḥ
translated: The lapwing said: “Oh! Why do you want to fight with the ocean?

original: tan na yuktam asyopari kopaṃ kartum / uktaṃ ca🔽puṃsām asamarthānām upadravāyātmano bhavet kopaḥ /
analyzed: tat na yuktam asya upari kopam kartum uktam ca  puṃsām asamarthānām upadravāya ātmanaḥ bhavet kopaḥ
translated: It is not right to be angry with him. It is said:🔽Anger is for one's own affliction, for the harm of those who are powerless.

original: piṭharaṃ jvaladatimātraṃ nijapārśvān eva dahatitarām // ///
analyzed: piṭharam jvalat atimātram nija pārśvān eva dahatitarām
translated: A pot heated too much burns its own sides the most...

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: aviditvātmanaḥ śaktiṃ parasya na samutsukaḥ /
analyzed: a viditvā ātmanaḥ śaktim parasya na samutsukaḥ
translated: Without knowing one's own strength, one should not be eager against another.

original: gacchann abhimukho vahnau nāśaṃ yāti pataṅgavat // ///🔽ṭiṭṭibha āhapriye /
analyzed: gacchan abhimukhaḥ vahnau nāśam yāti pataṅga vat  ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha priye
translated: Going towards the fire, one is destroyed like an insect...🔽The lapwing said: My dear!

original: mā maivaṃ vada /
analyzed: mā mā evam vada
translated: Do not speak like that.

original: yeṣām utsāhaśaktir bhavati te svalpā api gurūn vikramante / uktaṃ ca🔽viśeṣāt paripūrṇasya yāti śatror amarṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām utsāha śaktiḥ bhavati te su alpāḥ api gurūn vikramante uktam ca  viśeṣāt paripūrṇasya yāti śatroḥ amarṣaṇaḥ
translated: Those who have the power of enthusiasm, even if few, overcome the great. And it is said:🔽The moon, being full, goes to the enemy, the sun,

original: ābhimukhyaṃ śaśāṅkasya yathādyāpi vidhuntudaḥ // ///
analyzed: ābhimukhyam śaśāṅkasya yathā adya api vidhuntudaḥ
translated: even today, as if out of contempt.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:🔽The sun, being full, goes to the enemy, the moon,🔽even today, as if out of contempt.

original: pramāṇād adhikasyāpi gaṇḍaśyāmamadacyuteḥ /
analyzed: pramāṇāt adhikasya api gaṇḍaśyāma mada cyuteḥ
translated: Even though he is greater than Pramana, the elephant-faced Ganesa,

original: padaṃ mūrdhni samādhatte kesarī mattadantinaḥ // ///
analyzed: padam mūrdhni samādhatte kesarī matta dantinaḥ
translated: the lion places his foot on the head of the intoxicated elephant.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: bālasyāpi raveḥ pādāḥ patanty upari bhūbhṛtām /
analyzed: bālasya api raveḥ pādāḥ patanti upari bhūbhṛtām
translated: Even the rays of the young sun fall upon the heads of the mountains.

original: tejasā saha jātānāṃ vayaḥ kutropayujyate // ///
analyzed: tejasā saha jātānām vayaḥ kutra upayujyate
translated: Where is age of use for those born with brilliance?

original: hastau sthūlataraḥ sa cāṅkuśavaśaḥ kiṃ hastimātro 'ṅkuśo
analyzed: hastau sthūlataraḥ sa ca aṅkuśa vaśaḥ kim
translated: His trunk is thicker, and he is under the control of the goad. Is the goad just an elephant?

original: dīpe prajvalite praṇaśyati tamaḥ kiṃ dīpamātraṃ tamaḥ /
analyzed: dīpe prajvalite praṇaśyati tamaḥ kim dīpa mātram tamaḥ
translated: When a lamp is lit, darkness disappears. Is darkness just a lamp?

original: vajreṇāpi hatāḥ patanti girayaḥ kiṃ vajramātro giris
analyzed: vajreṇa api hatāḥ patanti girayaḥ kim vajra mātraḥ giriḥ
translated: Even when struck by a thunderbolt, mountains fall. Is a mountain just a thunderbolt?

original: tejo yasya virājate sa balavān sthūleṣu kaḥ pratyayaḥ // ///
analyzed: tejaḥ yasya virājate sa balavān sthūleṣu kaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: He in whom brilliance shines is powerful. Where is faith in the gross?

original: tad anayā cañcvāsya sakalaṃ toyaṃ śuṣkasthalatāṃ nayāmi /
analyzed: tat anayā cañcvā asya sakalam toyam śuṣka sthala tām nayāmi
translated: With this beak of mine, I can turn all that water into dry land.

original: ṭiṭṭibhy āhabhoḥ kānta /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhī āha bhoḥ kānta
translated: The tittibha bird said: Oh my dear!

original: yatra jāhnavī navanadīśatāni gṛhītvā nityam eva praviśati /
analyzed: yatra jāhnavī nava nadī śatāni gṛhītvā nityam eva praviśati
translated: Where the Ganges, taking with her a hundred new rivers, always enters,

original: tathā sindhuś ca /
analyzed: tathā sindhuḥ ca
translated: and so does the Sindhu river.

original: tat kathaṃ tvam aṣṭādaśanadīśataiḥ pūryamāṇaṃ taṃ vipruṣavāhinyā cañcvā śoṣayiṣyasi /
analyzed: tat katham tvam aṣṭādaśa nadī śataiḥ pūryamāṇam tam vipruṣa vāhinyā cañcvā śoṣayiṣyasi
translated: How will you dry it up with a beak carrying a few drops of water, filled with eighteen hundred rivers?

original: tat kim aśraddho yenoktena /
analyzed: tat kim aśraddhaḥ yena uktena
translated: So why be unbelieving in what is said?

original: ṭiṭṭibha āhapriye /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha priye
translated: The male tittibha said, My dear!

original: anirvedaḥ śriyo mūlaṃ cañcur me lohasannibhā /
analyzed: anirvedaḥ śriyaḥ mūlam cañcuḥ me loha sannibhā
translated: Lack of discouragement is the root of prosperity, my beak is like iron.

original: ahorātrāṇi dīrghāṇi samudraḥ kiṃ na śuṣyati // ///
analyzed: ahorātrāṇi dīrghāṇi samudraḥ kim na śuṣyati
translated: Are days and nights long? Why doesn't the ocean dry up?

original: duradhigamaḥ parabhāgo yāvat puruṣeṇa pauruṣaṃ na kṛtam /
analyzed: duradhigamaḥ parabhāgaḥ yāvat puruṣeṇa pauruṣam na kṛtam
translated: As long as a man does not exert himself, the highest state is difficult to attain.

original: jayati tulām adhirūḍho bhāsvān api jaladapaṭalāni // ///
analyzed: jayati tulām adhirūḍhaḥ bhāsvān api jalada paṭalāni
translated: But when the sun mounts the scale, it conquers even the clouds.

original: ṭiṭṭibhy āhayadi tvayāvaśyaṃ samudreṇa saha vigrahānuṣṭhānaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhī āha yadi tvayā avaśyam samudreṇa saha vigraha anuṣṭhānam kāryam
translated: The female tittibha said, If you must wage war with the ocean,

original: tad anyān api vihaṅgamān āhūya suhṛjjanasahita evaṃ samācara / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat anyān api vihaṅgamān āhūya suhṛd jana sahitaḥ evam samācara uktam ca
translated: then summon other birds and, with your friends, act accordingly. And it is said:

original: bahūnām apy asārāṇāṃ samvāyo hi durjayaḥ /
analyzed: bahūnām api asārāṇām samvāyaḥ hi durjayaḥ
translated: Even the combination of many useless things is difficult to conquer.

original: tṛṇair āveṣṭyate rajjur yathā nāgo 'pi baddhyate // ///
analyzed: tṛṇaiḥ āveṣṭyate rajjuḥ yathā nāgaḥ u pi baddhyate
translated: A rope is bound by grass, and even an elephant is bound.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: caṭakākāṣṭhakūṭena makṣikādardurais tathā /
analyzed: caṭakā kāṣṭha kūṭena makṣikā darduraiḥ tathā
translated: By the sparrow, the woodpecker, the housefly, and the lizard,

original: mahājanavirodhena kuñjaraḥ pralayaṃ gataḥ // ///
analyzed: mahā jana virodhena kuñjaraḥ pralayam gataḥ
translated: The elephant was destroyed by the opposition of the multitude.

original: ṭiṭṭibha āhakatham etat /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha katham etat
translated: The male tittibha said, How is that?

original: sā prāha
analyzed: sā prāha
translated: She said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: kuñjaracaṭakadampatīkathā
analyzed: kuñjara caṭaka dampatī kathā
translated: The Story of the Elephant and the Pair of Tittibhas

original: kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe caṭakadampatī tamālatarukṛtanilayau prativasataḥ sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe caṭaka dampatī tamāla taru kṛta nilayau prativasataḥ sma
translated: In a certain forest region, a pair of partridges lived, making their nest in a tamāla tree.

original: atha tayor gacchatā kālena santatir abhavat /
analyzed: atha tayoḥ gacchatā kālena santatiḥ abhavat
translated: Then, as time went on, they had offspring.

original: anyasminn ahani pramatto vanagajaḥ kaścit taṃ tamālavṛkṣaṃ gharmārtaś chāyārthī samāśritaḥ /
analyzed: anyasmin ahani pramattaḥ vana gajaḥ kaścid tam tamāla vṛkṣam gharma ārtaḥ chāyā arthī samāśritaḥ
translated: On another day, a certain elephant, heedless and afflicted by the heat, came to that tamāla tree for shade.

original: tato madotkaṛṣāt tāṃ tasya śākhāṃ caṭakāśritāṃ puṣkarāgreṇākṛṣya babhañja /
analyzed: tatas mada utkaṛṣāt tām tasya śākhām caṭaka āśritām puṣkara agreṇa ākṛṣya babhañja
translated: Then, out of intoxication, he pulled down with the tip of his trunk that branch occupied by the partridge and broke it.

original: tasyā bhaṅgena caṭakāṇḍāni sarvāṇi viśīrṇāni /
analyzed: tasyāḥ bhaṅgena caṭaka aṇḍāni sarvāṇi viśīrṇāni
translated: By its breaking, all the partridge eggs were shattered.

original: āyuḥśeṣatayā ca caṭakau katham api prāṇair na viyuktau /
analyzed: āyuḥ śeṣa tayā ca caṭakau katham api prāṇaiḥ na viyuktau
translated: But by the remainder of their life-span, the partridge pair somehow did not lose their lives.

original: atha caṭakā sāṇḍabhaṅgābhibhūtā pralāpān kurvāṇā na kiñcit sukham āsasāda /🔽atrāntare tasyās tān pralāpān śrutvā kāṣṭhakūṭo nāma pakṣī tasyāḥ paramasuhṛttadduḥkhaduḥkhito 'bhyetya tām uvācabhagavati /
analyzed: atha caṭakā sa aṇḍabhaṅga abhibhūtā pralāpān kurvāṇā na kiñcid sukham āsasāda  atrā antare tasyāḥ tān pralāpān śrutvā kāṣṭhakūṭaḥ nāma pakṣī tasyāḥ parama suhṛd tad duḥkha duḥkhitaḥ bhyetya tām uvāca bhagavati
translated: Then that partridge, overwhelmed by the breaking of the eggs, making lamentations, found no happiness at all.

original: kiṃ vṛthā pralāpena / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: kim vṛthā pralāpena uktam ca
translated: In the meantime, having heard her lamentations, a bird named Kāṣṭhaka, her closest friend, afflicted by her sorrow, came to her and said: Lady, why lament in vain? And it is said:

original: naṣṭaṃ mṛtam atikrāntaṃ nānuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: naṣṭam mṛtam atikrāntam na anuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise do not grieve over what is lost, dead, or past.

original: paṇḍitānāṃ ca mūrkhāṇāṃ viśeṣo 'yaṃ yataḥ smṛtaḥ // ///
analyzed: paṇḍitānām ca mūrkhāṇām viśeṣaḥ yam yatas smṛtaḥ
translated: For this is the difference remembered between the wise and the foolish.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: aśocyānīha bhūtāni yo mūḍhas tāni śocati /
analyzed: a śocyāni iha bhūtāni yaḥ mūḍhaḥ tāni śocati
translated: Herein, beings are not to be grieved over. But the fool grieves over them.

original: tadduḥkhāl labhate duḥkhaṃ dvāv anarthau niṣevate // ///
analyzed: tad duḥkhāt labhate duḥkham dvau anarthau niṣevate
translated: From that grief he obtains grief. He resorts to two misfortunes.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore:

original: śleṣmāśru bāndhavair muktaṃ preto bhuṅkte yato 'vaśaḥ /
analyzed: śleṣma aśru bāndhavaiḥ muktam pretaḥ bhuṅkte yatas vaśaḥ
translated: Phlegm and tears are released by relatives, which the helpless ghost eats.

original: tasmān na roditavyaṃ hi kriyāḥ kāryāś ca śaktitaḥ // ///
analyzed: tasmāt na roditavyam hi kriyāḥ kāryāḥ ca śaktitaḥ
translated: Therefore, one should not weep, but rites should be performed to the best of one's ability.

original: caṭakā prāhaastv etat /
analyzed: caṭakā prāha astu etat
translated: The quail said: Let this be so.

original: paraṃ duṣṭagajena madān mama santānakṣayaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: param duṣṭa gajena madāt mama santāna kṣayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: But a wicked elephant has destroyed my offspring out of arrogance.

original: tad yadi mama tvaṃ suhṛtsatyas tad asya gajāpasadasya ko 'pi vadhopāyaś cintyatām /
analyzed: tat yadi mama tvam suhṛd satyaḥ tat asya gaja apasadasya kaḥ pi vadha upāyaḥ cintyatām
translated: If you are truly my friend, then let some means of killing that wretched elephant be thought of.

original: yasyānuṣṭhānena me santatināśaduḥkham apasarati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yasya anuṣṭhānena me santati nāśa duḥkham apasarati uktam ca
translated: By carrying it out, my grief over the destruction of my offspring will be removed. And it is said:

original: āpadi yenopakṛtaṃ yena ca hasitaṃ daśāsu viṣamāsu /
analyzed: āpadi yena upakṛtam yena ca hasitam daśāsu viṣamāsu
translated: By whom help was rendered in an emergency and with whom laughter was shared in difficult circumstances,

original: upakṛtya tayor ubhayoḥ punar api jātaṃ naraṃ manye // ///
analyzed: upakṛtya tayoḥ ubhayoḥ punar api jātam naram manye
translated: I consider that man to be reborn again after rendering help to both of them.

original: kāṣṭhakūṭa āhabhagavati /
analyzed: kāṣṭhakūṭaḥ āha bhagavati
translated: The woodpecker said: Lady,

original: satyam abhihitaṃ bhavatyā / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: satyam abhihitam bhavatyā uktam ca
translated: what you have said is true. And it is said:

original: sa suhṛdvyasane yaḥ syād anyajātyudbhavo 'pi san /
analyzed: sa suhṛd vyasane yaḥ syāt san
translated: He who is a friend in the misfortune of a friend, even if born in another species,

original: vṛddhau sarvo 'pi mitraṃ syāt sarveṣām eva dehinām // ///
analyzed: vṛddhau mitram syāt sarveṣām eva dehinām
translated: In prosperity, all are friends, of all embodied beings...

original: sa suhṛdvyasane yaḥ syāt sa putro yas tu bhaktimān /
analyzed: sa suhṛd vyasane yaḥ syāt sa putraḥ yaḥ tu bhaktimān
translated: He who is a friend in misfortune, he is a son who is devoted,

original: sa bhṛtyo yo vidheyajñaḥ sā bhāryā yatra nirvṛtiḥ // ///
analyzed: sa bhṛtyaḥ yaḥ vidheya jñaḥ sā bhāryā yatra nirvṛtiḥ
translated: He is a servant who knows what to do, she is a wife where there is contentment...

original: tat paśya me buddhiprabhāvam /
analyzed: tat paśya me buddhi prabhāvam
translated: See my intelligence and power.

original: paraṃ mamāpi suhṛdbhūtā vīṇāravā nāma makṣikāsti /
analyzed: param mama api suhṛd bhūtā vīṇāravā nāma makṣikā asti
translated: I also have a friend named Vīṇārava, a fly.

original: tat tām āhūyāgacchāmi /
analyzed: tat tām āhūya āgacchāmi
translated: Having called her, I will come.

original: yena sa durātmā duṣṭagajo badhyate /
analyzed: yena sa durātmā duṣṭa gajaḥ badhyate
translated: By which that wicked elephant will be killed.

original: athāsau caṭakayā saha makṣikām āsādya provācabhadre /
analyzed: atha asau caṭakayā saha makṣikām āsādya provāca bhadre
translated: Then he, together with the quail, approached the fly and said, My good lady,

original: mameṣṭeyaṃ caṭakā kenacid duṣṭagajena parābhūtāṇḍasphoṭanena /🔽tat tasya vadhopāyam anutiṣṭhato me sāhāyyaṃ kartum arhasi /
analyzed: mama iṣṭā iyam caṭakā kenacid duṣṭa gajena parābhūtā aṇḍa sphoṭanena  tat tasya vadha upāyam anutiṣṭhataḥ me sāhāyyam kartum arhasi
translated: this quail of mine is defeated by some wicked elephant who breaks her eggs.🔽Therefore, please help me in carrying out the means of killing him.

original: makṣikāpy āhabhadra /
analyzed: makṣikā api āha bhadra
translated: The fly also said, My good sir,

original: kim ucyate'tra viṣaye / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: kim ucyate itra viṣaye uktam ca
translated: what is to be said in this matter? And it is said:

original: punaḥ pratyupakārāya mitrāṇāṃ kriyate priyam /
analyzed: punar pratyupakārāya mitrāṇām kriyate priyam
translated: The good is done to friends in return for help.

original: yat punar mitramitrasya kāryaṃ mitrair na kiṃ kṛtam // ///
analyzed: yat punar mitra mitrasya kāryam mitraiḥ na kim kṛtam
translated: What has not been done by friends for the friend of a friend?

original: satyam etat /
analyzed: satyam etat
translated: This is true.

original: paraṃ mamāpi bheko meghanādo nāma mitraṃ tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: param mama api bhekaḥ meghanādaḥ nāma mitram tiṣṭhati
translated: But I also have a friend named Megha-nada, a frog.

original: tam apy āhūya yathocitaṃ kurmaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tam api āhūya yathocitam kurmaḥ uktam ca
translated: Let us summon him and do what is proper. And it is said:

original: hitaiḥ sādhusamācāraiḥ śāstrajñair matiśālibhiḥ /
analyzed: hitaiḥ sādhu samācāraiḥ śāstra jñaiḥ mati śālibhiḥ
translated: By the virtuous, well-behaved, learned, and wise,

original: kathañcin na vikalpante vidvadbhiś cintitā nayāḥ // ///
analyzed: kathañcid na vikalpante vidvadbhiḥ cintitāḥ nayāḥ
translated: The plans thought out by the learned are never in any way altered.

original: atha te trayo 'pi gatvā meghanādasyāgre samastaṃ vṛttāntaṃ nivedya tasthuḥ /
analyzed: atha te trayaḥ pi gatvā meghanādasya agre samastam vṛttāntam nivedya tasthuḥ
translated: Then the three of them went and told the whole story to Megha-nada, and waited.

original: atha sa provācakiyan mātro 'sau varāko gajo mahājanasya kupitasyāgre /
analyzed: atha sa provāca kiyat sau varākaḥ gajaḥ mahā janasya kupitasya agre
translated: Then he said, How small is that wretched elephant before an angry multitude?

original: tan madīyo mantraḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tat madīyaḥ mantraḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: So my advice should be followed.

original: makṣike / tvaṃ gatvā madhyāhnasamaye tasya madoddhatasya gajasya karṇe vīṇāravasadṛśaṃ śabdaṃ kuru /
analyzed: makṣike tvam gatvā madhyāhna samaye tasya mada uddhatasya gajasya karṇe vīṇā rava sadṛśam śabdam kuru
translated: Mosquito, you go and at midday make a sound like the sound of a lute in the ear of that elephant maddened with rut.

original: yena śravaṇasukhalālaso nimīlitanayano bhavati /
analyzed: yena śravaṇa sukha lālasaḥ nimīlita nayanaḥ bhavati
translated: By which he will become eager for the pleasure of hearing and close his eyes.

original: tataś ca kāṣṭhakūṭacañcvā sphoṭitanayano 'ndhībhūtas tṛṣārto mama gartataṭāśritasya saparikarasya śabdaṃ śrutvā jalāśayaṃ matvā samabhyeti
analyzed: tatas ca kāṣṭha kūṭa cañcvā sphoṭita nayanaḥ tṛṣā ārtaḥ mama garta taṭa āśritasya sa parikarasya śabdam śrutvā jalāśayam matvā samabhyeti
translated: Then, his eyes burst by the beak of the partridge, blinded and thirsty, hearing the sound of me and my retinue on the bank of the pit, thinking it a body of water, he will come.

original: tato gartam āsādya patiṣyati pañcatvaṃ yāsyati ceti /
analyzed: tatas gartam āsādya patiṣyati pañcatvam yāsyati ca iti
translated: Then, approaching the pit, he will fall into it and die.

original: evaṃ samavāyaḥ kartavyo yathā vairasādhanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam samavāyaḥ kartavyaḥ yathā vaira sādhanam bhavati
translated: Thus the conspiracy was made, so that the enmity could be accomplished.

original: atha tathānuṣṭhite sa mattagajo makṣikāgeyasukhān nimīlitanetraḥ kāṣṭhakūṭahṛtacakṣur
analyzed: atha tathā anuṣṭhite sa matta gajaḥ makṣikā geya sukhāt nimīlita netraḥ kāṣṭha kūṭa hṛta cakṣuḥ
translated: Then, when it was carried out in that way, that intoxicated elephant, his eyes closed in the pleasure of the buzzing of flies, his eyes gouged out by the woodpecker,

original: madhyāhnasamaye bhrāmyan maṇḍūkaśabdānusārī gacchan mahatīṃ gartam āsādya patito mṛtaś ca /
analyzed: madhyāhna samaye bhrāmyan maṇḍūka śabda anusārī gacchan mahatīm gartam āsādya patitaḥ mṛtaḥ ca
translated: wandering at midday, following the sound of a frog, went and fell into a great pit and died.🔽Therefore I say: 'The quail by the woodpecker.'

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmicaṭakā kāṣṭhakūṭena iti /🔽ṭiṭṭibha āhabhadre /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi caṭakā kāṣṭha kūṭena iti  ṭiṭṭibhaḥ āha bhadre
translated: The partridge said: 'My dear,

original: evaṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: evam bhavatu
translated: let it be so.

original: suhṛdvargasamudāyena saha samudraṃ śoṣayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: suhṛd varga samudāyena saha samudram śoṣayiṣyāmi
translated: I will dry up the ocean along with a group of friends.'

original: iti niścitya bakasārasamayūrādīn samāhūya provācabhoḥ parābhūto 'haṃ samudreṇāṇḍakāpahareṇa /
analyzed: iti niścitya baka sārasa mayūra ādīn samāhūya provāca bhoḥ parābhūtaḥ ham samudreṇa aṇḍaka apahareṇa
translated: Having decided this, he summoned the cranes, storks, peacocks, and others, and said: 'Gentlemen, I have been defeated by the ocean, which stole my eggs.

original: tac cintyatām asya śoṣaṇopāyaḥ /
analyzed: tat cintyatām asya śoṣaṇa upāyaḥ
translated: Let that be considered, the means of drying it up.'

original: te sammantrya procuḥaśaktā vayaṃ samudraśoṣaṇe /
analyzed: te sammantrya procuḥ aśaktāḥ vayam samudra śoṣaṇe
translated: They consulted and said: 'We are unable to dry up the ocean.

original: tat kiṃ vṛthā prayāsena / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat kim vṛthā prayāsena uktam ca
translated: So what is the use of futile effort? And it is said:

original: abalaḥ pronnataṃ śatruṃ yo yāti madamohitaḥ /
analyzed: abalaḥ pronnatam śatrum yaḥ yāti mada mohitaḥ
translated: He who, intoxicated with pride and delusion, attacks a powerful enemy,

original: yuddhārthaṃ sa nivarteta śīrṇadanto yathā gajaḥ // ///
analyzed: yuddha artham sa nivarteta śīrṇa dantaḥ yathā gajaḥ
translated: He would turn back from battle, like an elephant with broken tusks.

original: tad asmākaṃ svāmī vainateyo 'sti /
analyzed: tat asmākam svāmī vainateyaḥ sti
translated: We have a master, Garuda.

original: tasmai sarvam etatparibhavasthānaṃ nivedyatām /
analyzed: tasmai sarvam etat paribhava sthānam nivedyatām
translated: Let us inform him of all this humiliating situation.

original: yena svajātiparibhavakupito vairānṛṇyaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: yena sva jāti paribhava kupitaḥ vaira ānṛṇyam gacchati
translated: By which, angry at the humiliation of his own kind, he will repay the enmity.

original: athavātrāvalepaṃ kariṣyati tathāpi nāsti vo duḥkham / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: athavā atrā avalepam kariṣyati tathā api na asti vaḥ duḥkham uktam ca
translated: Or if he will show contempt here, still there is no sorrow for you. And it is said:

original: suhṛdi nirantararacite guṇavati bhṛtye'nuvartini kalatre /
analyzed: suhṛdi nirantara racite guṇavati bhṛtya inuvartini kalatre
translated: When a friend is constantly devoted, a virtuous servant is obedient, a wife

original: svāmini śaktisamete nivedya duḥkhaṃ sukhī bhavati // ///
analyzed: svāmini śakti samete nivedya duḥkham sukhī bhavati
translated: When a master is endowed with ability, having informed of sorrow one becomes happy.

original: tad yāmo vinateyasakāśaṃ yato 'sāv asmākaṃ svāmī /
analyzed: tat yāmaḥ vinateya sakāśam yatas saḥ asmākam svāmī
translated: Therefore, we will go to Garuda, since he is our master.

original: tathānuṣṭhite sarve te pakṣiṇo viṣaṇṇavadanā bāṣpapūritadṛśo vainateyasakāśam āsādya karuṇasvareṇa phūtkartum ārabdhāḥaho /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite sarve te pakṣiṇaḥ viṣaṇṇa vadanāḥ bāṣpa pūrita dṛśaḥ vainateya sakāśam āsādya karuṇa svareṇa phūtkartum ārabdhāḥ aho
translated: When this was done, all those birds, with dejected faces and eyes filled with tears, approached Garuda and began to lament in a piteous voice: Alas!

original: abrahmaṇyam abrahmaṇyam /
analyzed: a brahmaṇyam a brahmaṇyam
translated: It is not fit for Brahmins, it is not fit for Brahmins!

original: adhunā sadācārasya ṭiṭṭibhasya bhavati nāthe sati samudreṇāṇḍāny apahṛtāni tatpranaṣṭam adhunā pakṣikulam /
analyzed: adhunā sat ācārasya ṭiṭṭibhasya bhavati nāthe sati samudreṇa aṇḍāni apahṛtāni tat pranaṣṭam adhunā pakṣi kulam
translated: Now that the good-natured Tittibha has a lord, his eggs have been carried off by the ocean, and that flock of birds is now lost.

original: anye'pi svecchayā samudreṇa vyāpādiṣyante / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: anye api sva icchayā samudreṇa vyāpādiṣyante uktam ca
translated: Others too will be killed by the ocean out of their own will. And it is said:

original: kva kasya karma saṃvīkṣya karoty anyo 'pi garhitam /
analyzed: kva kasya karma saṃvīkṣya karoti garhitam
translated: Where, whose, and what action observing, does another also do what is condemned?

original: gatānugatiko loko na lokaḥ pāramārthikaḥ // ///🔽cāṭutaskaradurvṛttais tathā sāhasikādibhiḥ /
analyzed: gatānugatikaḥ lokaḥ na lokaḥ pāramārthikaḥ  cāṭu taskara durvṛttaiḥ tathā sāhasika ādibhiḥ
translated: The world follows what has gone before; the world is not ultimately real.🔽By flatterers, thieves, the wicked, and likewise by the rash and so on,

original: pīḍyamānāḥ prajā rakṣyāḥ kaṭūcchadmādibhis tathā // ///
analyzed: pīḍyamānāḥ prajāḥ rakṣyāḥ kaṭu ucchadma ādibhiḥ tathā
translated: and by the harsh-speaking and so on, the people being oppressed are to be protected.

original: prajānāṃ dharmaṣaḍbhāgo rājño bhavati rakṣituḥ /
analyzed: prajānām dharma ṣaḍbhāgaḥ rājñaḥ bhavati rakṣituḥ
translated: The king who protects the people obtains a sixth part of their religious merit.

original: adharmād api ṣaḍbhāgo jāyate yo na rakṣati // ///
analyzed: adharmāt api ṣaḍbhāgaḥ jāyate yaḥ na rakṣati
translated: And a sixth part of their irreligion accrues to him who does not protect.

original: prajāpīḍanasantāpāt samudbhūto hutāśanaḥ /
analyzed: prajā pīḍana santāpāt samudbhūtaḥ hutāśanaḥ
translated: The fire that arises from the oppression and affliction of the people,

original: rājñaḥ śriyaṃ kulaṃ prāṇān nādagdhvā vinivartate // ///
analyzed: rājñaḥ śriyam kulam prāṇān na a dagdhvā vinivartate
translated: does not turn back without consuming the king's glory, family, and life.

original: rājā bandhur abandhūnāṃ rājā cakṣur acakṣuṣām /
analyzed: rājā bandhuḥ a bandhūnām rājā cakṣuḥ a cakṣuṣām
translated: The king is the friend of the friendless, the king is the eye of the eyeless,

original: rājā pitā ca mātā ca sarveṣāṃ nyāyavartinām // ///
analyzed: rājā pitā ca mātā ca sarveṣām nyāya vartinām
translated: the king is the father and the mother of all who live righteously.

original: phalārthī pārthivo lokān pālayed yatnam āsthitaḥ /🔽dānamānāditoyena mālākāro 'ṅkurān iva // ///
analyzed: phala arthī pārthivaḥ lokān pālayet yatnam āsthitaḥ  dāna māna ādi toyena mālākāraḥ ṅkurān iva
translated: The king, desiring fruits, should strive to protect the people,🔽like a gardener with water, honor, and so on, protects the sprouts.

original: yathā bījāṅkuraḥ sūkṣmaḥ pratnenābhirakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: yathā bīja aṅkuraḥ sūkṣmaḥ pratnena abhirakṣitaḥ
translated: Just as a subtle sprout from a seed is protected by the gardener,

original: phalaprado bhavet kāle tadval lokaḥ surakṣitaḥ // ///
analyzed: phala pradaḥ bhavet kāle tadvat lokaḥ su rakṣitaḥ
translated: and the people well protected, will yield fruits in due time.

original: hiraṇyadhānyaratnāni yānāni vividhāni ca /
analyzed: hiraṇya dhānya ratnāni yānāni vividhāni ca
translated: Gold, grain, jewels, and various vehicles,

original: tathānyad api yat kiñcit prajābhyaḥ syān nṛpasya tat // ///
analyzed: tathā anyat api yat kiñcid prajābhyaḥ syāt nṛpasya tat
translated: and whatever else belongs to the people, that belongs to the king.

original: athaivaṃ garuḍaḥ samākarṇya tadduḥkhaduḥkhitaḥ kopāviṣṭaś ca vyacintayataho /
analyzed: athā evam garuḍaḥ samākarṇya tad duḥkha duḥkhitaḥ kopa āviṣṭaḥ ca vyacintayata ho
translated: Then Garuḍa, hearing this, was pained by their suffering and filled with anger, he thought: Ah!

original: satyam uktam etaiḥ pakṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: satyam uktam etaiḥ pakṣibhiḥ
translated: This has been truthfully said by these birds.

original: tad adya gatvā taṃ samudraṃ śoṣayāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat adya gatvā tam samudram śoṣayāmaḥ
translated: So today I will go and dry up that ocean.

original: evaṃ cintayatas tasya viṣṇudūtaḥ samāgatyāhabho garutman /
analyzed: evam cintayataḥ tasya viṣṇu dūtaḥ samāgatya āha bho garutman
translated: While he was thinking thus, a messenger of Viṣṇu came and said: O Garuḍa!

original: bhagavatā nārāyaṇenāhaṃ tava pārśve preṣitaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavatā nārāyaṇena aham tava pārśve preṣitaḥ
translated: I have been sent by Lord Nārāyaṇa to you.

original: devakāryāya bhagavān amarāvatyāṃ yāsyatīti /
analyzed: deva kāryāya bhagavān amarāvatyām yāsyati iti
translated: For the sake of the gods, the Lord will go to Amarāvatī.

original: tat satvaram āgamyatām /
analyzed: tat satvaram āgamyatām
translated: So come quickly.

original: tac chrutvā garuḍaḥ sābhimānaṃ prāhabho dūta /
analyzed: tat śrutvā garuḍaḥ sa abhimānam prāha bho dūta
translated: Hearing this, Garuḍa said arrogantly: O messenger!

original: kiṃ mayā kubhṛtyena bhagavān kariṣyati /
analyzed: kim mayā ku bhṛtyena bhagavān kariṣyati
translated: What will the Lord do with me, a bad servant?

original: tad gatvā taṃ vada yad anyo bhṛtyo vāhanāysamatsthāne kriyatām /
analyzed: tat gatvā tam vada yat anyaḥ bhṛtyaḥ kriyatām
translated: So go and tell him that another servant capable of carrying him should be made.

original: madīyo namaskāro vācyo bhagavataḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: madīyaḥ namaskāraḥ vācyaḥ bhagavataḥ uktam ca
translated: My salutations should be conveyed to the Lord. And it is said:

original: yo na vetti guṇān yasya na taṃ seveta paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na vetti guṇān yasya na tam seveta paṇḍitaḥ
translated: A wise man should not serve someone who does not know his qualities,

original: na hi tasmāt phalaṃ kiñcit sukṛṣṭād ūṣarād iva // ///
analyzed: na hi tasmāt phalam kiñcid su kṛṣṭāt ūṣarāt iva
translated: for no fruit comes from him, like from a well-ploughed barren field.

original: dūta āhabho vainateya /
analyzed: dūtaḥ āha bho vainateya
translated: The messenger said: O son of Vinata,

original: kadācid api bhagavantaṃ prati tvayā naitad abhihitam īdṛk /
analyzed: kadācid api bhagavantam prati tvayā nā etat abhihitam īdṛś
translated: have you never said this to the Lord before?

original: tat kathaya /
analyzed: tat kathaya
translated: Tell me.

original: kiṃ te bhagavatāpamānasthānaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: kim te bhagavatā apamāna sthānam kṛtam
translated: What insult has the Lord done to you?

original: garuḍa āhabhagavadāśrayabhūtena samudreṇāsmaṭ ṭiṭṭibhāṇḍāny apahṛtāni /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ āha bhagavat āśraya bhūtena samudreṇa asmat ṭiṭṭibhāṇḍāni apahṛtāni
translated: Garuda said: The ocean, which is the abode of the Lord, has stolen the eggs of the Tittibha birds.

original: tad yadi nigrahaṃ na karoti tad ahaṃ bhagavato na bhṛtya ity eṣa niścayas tvayā vācyaḥ /
analyzed: tat yadi nigraham na karoti tat aham bhagavataḥ na bhṛtyaḥ iti eṣa niścayaḥ tvayā vācyaḥ
translated: If you do not punish him, then I will decide that I am not the Lord's servant.

original: tad drutataraṃ gatvā bhavatā bhagavataḥ samīpe vaktavyam /
analyzed: tat drutataram gatvā bhavatā bhagavataḥ samīpe vaktavyam
translated: So go quickly and tell the Lord this.

original: atha dūtamukhena praṇayakupitaṃ vainateyaṃ vijñāya sammānapuraḥsaraṃ tam ānayāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atha dūta mukhena praṇaya kupitam vainateyam vijñāya sammāna puraḥsaram tam ānayāmi uktam ca
translated: Then, knowing that Vinata's son is angry out of affection, I will bring him with honor. And it is said:

original: bhaktaṃ śaktaṃ kulīnaṃ ca na bhṛtyam avamānayet /
analyzed: bhaktam śaktam kulīnam ca na bhṛtyam avamānayet
translated: One should not insult a servant who is devoted, capable, and of noble birth,

original: putraval lālayen nityaṃ ya icchec chriyam ātmanaḥ // ///
analyzed: putra vat lālayet nityam yaḥ icchet śriyam ātmanaḥ
translated: but should always cherish him like a son, if one desires one's own prosperity.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore:

original: rājā tuṣṭo 'pi bhṛtyānām arthamātraṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: rājā tuṣṭaḥ u pi bhṛtyānām artha mātram prayacchati
translated: Even if the king is satisfied, he gives his servants only money.

original: te tu sammānitās tasya prāṇair apy upakurvate // ///
analyzed: te tu sammānitāḥ tasya prāṇaiḥ api upakurvate
translated: But when they are honored by him, they help him even with their lives.

original: ity evaṃ sampradhārya rukmapure vainateyasakāśaṃ satvaram agamat /
analyzed: iti evam sampradhārya rukmapure vainateya sakāśam sa tvaram agamat
translated: Having thought thus, he quickly went to Vainateya in Rukmapura.

original: vainateyo 'pi gṛhāgataṃ bhagavantam avalokya trapādhomukhaḥ praṇamyovācabhagavan /
analyzed: vainateyaḥ pi gṛha āgatam bhagavantam avalokya trapā adhomukhaḥ praṇamya uvāca bhagavan
translated: Vainateya also, seeing the Lord who had come to his house, bowed down with his face lowered in shame and said, O Lord,

original: tvadāśrayonmattena samudreṇa mama bhṛtyāsyāṇḍāny apahṛtya mamāpamāno vihitaḥ /
analyzed: tvad āśraya unmattena samudreṇa mama bhṛtyā asya aṇḍāni apahṛtya mama apamānaḥ vihitaḥ
translated: the ocean, intoxicated by relying on you, has abducted my servant's eggs and insulted me.

original: paraṃ bhagavallajjayā mayā vilambitam /
analyzed: param bhagavat lajjayā mayā vilambitam
translated: But, O Lord, out of shame, I have delayed.

original: no ced enam ahaṃ sthalāntaram adyaiva nayāmi /
analyzed: no ced enam aham sthala antaram adyā eva nayāmi
translated: If not, I will take him to another place today itself.

original: yataḥ svāmibhayāc chravaṇo 'pi prahāro na dīyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas svāmi bhayāt prahāraḥ na dīyate  uktam ca
translated: For, out of fear of the master, even a blow is not given to Śravaṇa. And it is said:

original: yena syāl laghutā vātha pīḍā citte prabhoḥ kvacit /
analyzed: yena syāt laghu tā vā atha pīḍā citte prabhoḥ kvacid
translated: By whom there may be lightness or pain in the mind of the master somewhere,

original: prāṇatyāge'pi tat karma na kuryāt kulasevakaḥ // ///
analyzed: prāṇatyāge api tat karma na kuryāt kula sevakaḥ
translated: that deed a family servant should not do even at the cost of his life.

original: tac chrutvā bhagavān āhabho vainateya /
analyzed: tat śrutvā bhagavān āha bho vainateya
translated: Hearing that, the Lord said, O Vainateya,

original: satyam abhihitaṃ bhavatā / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: satyam abhihitam bhavatā uktam ca
translated: what you have said is true. And it is said:

original: bhṛtyāparādhajo daṇḍaḥ svāmino jāyate yataḥ /
analyzed: bhṛtya aparādha jaḥ daṇḍaḥ svāminaḥ jāyate yatas
translated: For the punishment of the servant's offense befalls the master.

original: tena lajjāpi tasyotthā na bhṛtyasya tathā punaḥ // ///
analyzed: tena lajjā api tasya utthā na bhṛtyasya tathā punar
translated: Therefore, his shame also arose, and not so much of the servant.

original: tad āgaccha yenāṇḍāni samudrād ādāya ṭiṭṭibhaṃ sambhāvayāvaḥ /
analyzed: tat āgaccha yena aṇḍāni samudrāt ādāya ṭiṭṭibham sambhāvayāvaḥ
translated: Come, let us go and take the eggs from the ocean and honor the lapwing.

original: amarāvatīṃ ca gacchāvaḥ /
analyzed: amarāvatīm ca gacchāvaḥ
translated: And let us go to Amaravati.

original: tathānuṣṭhite samudro bhagavatā nirbharsyāgneyaṃ śaraṃ sandhyāyābhihitaḥbho durātman /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite samudraḥ bhagavatā nirbharsya āgneyam śaram sandhyāya abhihitaḥ bho durātman
translated: When that was done, the ocean was terrified by the Blessed One and a fiery arrow was aimed by the twilight: Hey, evil-minded one!

original: dīyantāṃ ṭiṭṭibhāṇḍāni /
analyzed: dīyantām ṭiṭṭibhāṇḍāni
translated: Give up the lapwing's eggs.

original: no cet sthalatāṃ tvāṃ nayāmi /
analyzed: no ced sthala tām tvām nayāmi
translated: If not, I will lead you to dry land.

original: tataḥ samudreṇa sabhayena ṭiṭṭibhāṇḍāni tāni pradattāni /
analyzed: tatas samudreṇa sa bhayena ṭiṭṭibha aṇḍāni tāni pradattāni
translated: Then the ocean, in fear, gave up those eggs of the lapwing.

original: ṭiṭṭibhenāpi bhāryāyai samarpitāni /🔽ato 'haṃ bravīmiśatror balam avijñāya iti /
analyzed: ṭiṭṭibhena api bhāryāyai samarpitāni  atas ham bravīmi śatroḥ balam a vijñāya iti
translated: And the lapwing also handed them over to his wife.

original: tasmāt puruṣeṇodyamo na tyājyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt puruṣeṇa udyamaḥ na tyājyaḥ
translated: Therefore I say: 'Without knowing the strength of the enemy' - thus one should not give up effort.

original: tad ākarṇya sañjīvakas tam eva bhūyo 'pi papracchabho mitra /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya sañjīvakaḥ tam eva bhūyas pi papraccha bho mitra
translated: Having heard that, Life-Giving again asked him: Friend,

original: kathaṃ jñeyo mayāsau duṣṭabuddhir iti /
analyzed: katham jñeyaḥ mayā asau duṣṭa buddhiḥ iti
translated: how should I know that he is evil-minded?

original: iyantaṃ kālaṃ yāvad uttarottarasnehena prasādena cāhaṃ dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: iyantam kālam yāvat uttara uttara snehena prasādena ca aham dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: For so long, I have been seen with increasing affection and favor.

original: na kadācit tadvikṛtir dṛṣṭā /
analyzed: na kadācid tad vikṛtiḥ dṛṣṭā
translated: Never has his change been seen.

original: tat kathyatāṃ yenāham ātmarakṣārthaṃ tadvadhāyodyamaṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat kathyatām yena aham ātma rakṣā artham tad vadhāya udyamam karomi
translated: So tell me, so that I can make an effort to kill him in order to protect myself.

original: damanaka āhabhadra /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Damanaka said: Good sir,

original: kim atra jñeyam /
analyzed: kim atra jñeyam
translated: what is there to know here?

original: eṣa te pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa te pratyayaḥ
translated: This is the test.

original: yadi raktanetras triśikhāṃ bhrūkuṭiṃ dadhānaḥ sṛkkaṇī parilelihan tvāṃ dṛṣṭvā bhavati /
analyzed: yadi rakta netraḥ tri śikhām bhrūkuṭim dadhānaḥ parilelihan tvām dṛṣṭvā bhavati
translated: If he becomes angry, with red eyes, a frown with three lines, licking the corners of his mouth when he sees you,

original: tad duṣṭabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: tat duṣṭa buddhiḥ
translated: then he is a wicked-minded one.

original: anyathā suprasādaś ceti /
analyzed: anyathā su prasādaḥ ca iti
translated: Otherwise, he is easily pleased.

original: tad ājñāpaya mām /
analyzed: tat ājñāpaya mām
translated: So order me.

original: svāśrayaṃ prati gacchāmi /
analyzed: sva āśrayam prati gacchāmi
translated: I will go to my own place.

original: tvayā ca yathāyaṃ mantrabhedo na bhavati tathā kāryam /
analyzed: tvayā ca yathā ayam mantra bhedaḥ na bhavati tathā kāryam
translated: And you should act in such a way that this counsel remains secret.

original: yadi niśāmukhaṃ prāpya gantuṃ śaknoṣi taddeśatyāgaḥ kāryaḥ / yataḥ🔽tyajed ekaṃ kulasyārthe grāmasyārthe kulaṃ tyajet /
analyzed: yadi niśā mukham prāpya gantum śaknoṣi tad deśa tyāgaḥ kāryaḥ yatas  tyajet ekam kulasya arthe grāmasya arthe kulam tyajet
translated: If you can go at the end of the night, then you should leave that place. For🔽one should abandon one for the sake of a family, a family for the sake of a village,

original: grāmaṃ janapadasyārthe svātmārthe pṛthivīṃ tyajet // ///🔽āpadarthe dhanaṃ rakṣed dārān rakṣed dhanair api /
analyzed: grāmam janapadasya arthe sva ātma arthe pṛthivīm tyajet  āpad arthe dhanam rakṣet dārān rakṣet dhanaiḥ api
translated: a village for the sake of a country, and the whole earth for the sake of oneself.🔽One should protect wealth for the sake of misfortune, one's wife even with one's wealth,

original: ātmānaṃ satataṃ rakṣed dārair api dhanair api // ///
analyzed: ātmānam satatam rakṣet dāraiḥ api dhanaiḥ api
translated: one should always protect oneself even with one's wife and wealth.

original: balavatābhibhūtasya videśagamanaṃ tadanupraveśo vā nītiḥ /
analyzed: balavatā abhibhūtasya videśa gamanam tad anupraveśaḥ vā nītiḥ
translated: For one who is overpowered by a stronger one, it is a policy to go to a foreign country or to join him.

original: taddeśatyāgaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: tad deśa tyāgaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: One should abandon that place.

original: athavātmā sāmādibhir upāyair ābharakṣaṇīyaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: athavā ātmā sāma ādibhiḥ upāyaiḥ ābha rakṣaṇīyaḥ uktam ca
translated: Or else, one's self should be protected by means of conciliation and other expedients. And it is said:

original: api putrakalatrair vā prāṇān rakṣeta paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: api putra kalatraiḥ vā prāṇān rakṣeta paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Even with one's sons and wife, a wise man should protect his life.

original: vidyamānair yatas taiḥ syāt sarvaṃ bhūyo 'pi dehinām // ///
analyzed: vidyamānaiḥ yatas taiḥ syāt sarvam dehinām
translated: For all this can be regained again by embodied beings who have it.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: yena kenāpy upāyena śubhenāpy aśubhena vā /
analyzed: yena kena api upāyena śubhena api aśubhena vā
translated: By any means, good or bad,

original: uddhared dīnam ātmānaṃ samartho dharmam ācaret // ///
analyzed: uddharet dīnam ātmānam samarthaḥ dharmam ācaret
translated: one who is able should uplift one's wretched self and practice dharma.

original: yo māyāṃ kurute mūḍhaḥ prāṇatyāge dhanādiṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ māyām kurute mūḍhaḥ prāṇatyāge dhana ādiṣu
translated: One who, out of delusion, resorts to deceit in matters of life and wealth,

original: tasya prāṇāḥ praṇaśyanti tair naṣṭair naṣṭam eva tat // ///
analyzed: tasya prāṇāḥ praṇaśyanti taiḥ naṣṭaiḥ naṣṭam eva tat
translated: his life is lost, and with its loss, all is lost.

original: evam abhidhāya damanakaḥ karaṭakasakāśam agamat /
analyzed: evam abhidhāya damanakaḥ karaṭaka sakāśam agamat
translated: Having said this, Damanaka went to Karataka.

original: karaṭako 'pi tam āyāntaṃ dṛṣṭvā provācabhadra /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ pi tam āyāntam dṛṣṭvā provāca bhadra
translated: Karataka, seeing him coming, said: Good sir,

original: kiṃ kṛtaṃ tatrabhavatā /
analyzed: kim kṛtam tatrabhavatā
translated: what was done there by you?

original: damanaka āhamayā tāvan nītibījanirvāpaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha mayā tāvat nīti bīja nirvāpaṇam kṛtam
translated: Damanaka said: I have sown the seeds of policy.

original: parato daivavihitāyattam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: paratas daiva vihita āyattam uktam ca
translated: The rest depends on fate. And it is said:

original: parāṅmukhe'pi daive'tra kṛtyaṃ kāryaṃ vipaścitā /
analyzed: parāṅmukhe api daiva itra kṛtyam kāryam vipaścitā
translated: Even when fate is adverse, an intelligent person should act,

original: ātmadoṣavināśāya svacittastambhanāya ca // ///
analyzed: ātma doṣa vināśāya sva citta stambhanāya ca
translated: to destroy his own faults and to support his own mind.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: udyoginaṃ puruṣasiṃham upaiti lakṣmīr
analyzed: udyoginam puruṣa siṃham upaiti lakṣmīḥ
translated: Fortune favors the enterprising man, the lion among men.

original: daivena deyam iti kāpuruṣā vadanti /
analyzed: daivena deyam iti kāpuruṣāḥ vadanti
translated: Cowards say, It is given by fate.

original: daivaṃ nihatya kuru pauruṣam ātmaśaktyā yatne kṛte yadi na sidhyati ko 'tra doṣaḥ // ///
analyzed: daivam nihatya kuru pauruṣam ātma śaktyā yatne kṛte yadi na sidhyati kaḥ tra doṣaḥ
translated: Having destroyed fate, strive with your own ability. If, despite effort, it is not accomplished, who is at fault?

original: karaṭaka āhatat kathaya kīdṛk tvayā nītibījaṃ nirvāpitam /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ āha tat kathaya kīdṛś tvayā nīti bījam nirvāpitam
translated: Karataka said, Tell me, how did you extinguish the seed of policy?

original: so 'bravītmayānyonyaṃ tābhyāṃ mithyāprajalpena bhedas tathā vihito yathā bhūyo 'pi mantrayantāv ekasthānasthitau na drakṣyasi /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt mayā anyonyam tābhyām mithyā prajalpena bhedaḥ tathā vihitaḥ yathā mantrayantau eka sthāna sthitau na drakṣyasi
translated: He said, I created such a division between them by mutual false talk that even if they consult again while staying in one place, you will not see them.

original: karaṭaka āhaaho /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ āha aho
translated: Karataka said, Oh!

original: na yuktaṃ bhavatā vihitaṃ yat parasparaṃ tau snehārdrahṛdayau sukhāśrayau kopasāgare prakṣiptau / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na yuktam bhavatā vihitam yat parasparam tau sneha ārdra hṛdayau sukha āśrayau kopa sāgare prakṣiptau uktam ca
translated: What you have done is not right, that you have thrown those two, whose hearts are moist with affection for each other, who are a source of happiness, into an ocean of anger. And it is said:

original: aviruddhaṃ sukhasthaṃ yo duḥkhamārge niyojayet /
analyzed: aviruddham sukha stham yaḥ duḥkha mārge niyojayet
translated: He who causes one who is happily situated without conflict to be placed on a path of suffering,

original: janmajanmāntare duḥkhī sa naraḥ syād asaṃśayam // ///
analyzed: janma janmāntare duḥkhī sa naraḥ syāt asaṃśayam
translated: that man will undoubtedly be miserable in all his future lives.

original: aparaṃ tvaṃ yad bhedamātreṇāpi hṛṣṭas tad apy ayuktam /
analyzed: aparam tvam yat bheda mātreṇa api hṛṣṭaḥ tat api ayuktam
translated: Moreover, it is also wrong that you are delighted merely by their division.

original: yataḥ sarvato 'pi jano virūpakaraṇe samartho bhavati nopakartum / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas sarvatas pi janaḥ virūpa karaṇe samarthaḥ bhavati na upakartum uktam ca
translated: For, a person is capable of causing disfigurement everywhere, but not of helping. And it is said:

original: ghātayitum eva nīcaḥ parakāryaṃ vetti na prasādayitum /
analyzed: ghātayitum eva nīcaḥ para kāryam vetti na prasādayitum
translated: A low person knows only how to destroy the work of others, not how to make them prosper.

original: pātayitum asti śaktir vāyor vṛkṣaṃ na connamitum // ///
analyzed: pātayitum asti śaktiḥ vāyoḥ vṛkṣam na ca unnamitum
translated: The wind has the power to knock down a tree, but not to raise it up.

original: damanaka āhaanabhijño bhavān nītiśāstrasya /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha anabhijñaḥ bhavān nīti śāstrasya
translated: Damanaka said: You are ignorant of the science of statecraft.

original: tenaitad bravīṣi /
analyzed: tena etat bravīṣi
translated: That is why you say this.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: As it is said:

original: jātamātraṃ na yaḥ śatruṃ vyādhiṃ ca praśamaṃ nayet /
analyzed: jāta mātram na yaḥ śatrum vyādhim ca praśamam nayet
translated: He who does not destroy an enemy or a disease as soon as it arises,

original: mahābalo 'pi tenaiva vṛddhiṃ prāpya sa hanyate // ///
analyzed: mahābalaḥ pi tena eva vṛddhim prāpya sa hanyate
translated: even if he is very powerful, will be destroyed by it when it has grown.

original: tacchatrubhūto 'yam asmākaṃ mantripadāharaṇāt / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tad śatru bhūtaḥ yam asmākam mantri pada āharaṇāt uktam ca
translated: This one is our enemy because he has taken the minister's position. And it is said:

original: pitṛpaitāmahaṃ sthānaṃ yo yasyātra jigīṣate /
analyzed: pitṛpaitāmaham sthānam yaḥ yasya atra jigīṣate
translated: Whoever desires to conquer the position of his father and grandfather,

original: sa tasya sahajaḥ śatrur ucchedyo 'pi priye sthitaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa tasya sahajaḥ śatruḥ ucchedyaḥ pi priye sthitaḥ
translated: he is his natural enemy, even if he remains dear, he must be destroyed.

original: tan mayā sa udāsīnatayā samānīto 'bhayapradānena yāvat tāvad aham api tena sācivyāt pracyāvitaḥ /
analyzed: tat mayā saḥ udāsīna tayā samānītaḥ bhaya pradānena yāvat tāvat aham api tena sācivyāt pracyāvitaḥ
translated: So I brought him here with neutrality and the promise of safety, and as long as he did that, I was also removed from his council.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or rather, this is well said:

original: dadyāt sādhur yadi nijapade durjanāya praveśaṃ
analyzed: dadyāt sādhuḥ yadi nija pade durjanāya praveśam
translated: If a good person gives entry into his position to a bad person,

original: tannāśāya prabhavati tato vāñchamānaḥ svayaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: tad nāśāya prabhavati tatas vāñchamānaḥ svayam saḥ
translated: then the latter, desiring it, becomes powerful for his destruction.

original: tasmād deyo vipulamatibhir nāvakāśo 'dhamānāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt deyaḥ vipula matibhiḥ na avakāśaḥ dhamānām
translated: Therefore, those of vast intellect should not give an opportunity to the low,

original: jārāpi syād gṛhapatir iti śrūyate vākyato 'tra // ///
analyzed: jārā api syāt gṛhapatiḥ iti śrūyate tra
translated: it is heard in this statement that even a paramour can be a householder.

original: tena mayā tasyopari vadhopāya eva viracyate /
analyzed: tena mayā tasya upari vadha upāyaḥ eva viracyate
translated: Therefore, I am devising a means of killing him.

original: deśatyāgāya vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: deśa tyāgāya vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Or it will be for abandoning the country.

original: tac ca tvāṃ muktvānyo na jñāsyati /
analyzed: tat ca tvām muktvā anyaḥ na jñāsyati
translated: And no one but you will know that.

original: tad uktam etat te svārthāyānuṣṭhitam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat uktam etat te sva arthāya anuṣṭhitam uktam ca
translated: And that has been done for your own sake. And it is said:

original: nistriṃśaṃ hṛdayaṃ kṛtvā vāṇīm ikṣurasopāmām /
analyzed: nistriṃśam hṛdayam kṛtvā vāṇīm ikṣu rasa upāmām
translated: Having made the heart like a sword, and the speech like sugarcane juice,

original: vikalpo 'tra na kartavyo hanyāt tatrāpakāriṇam // ///
analyzed: vikalpaḥ tra na kartavyaḥ hanyāt tatra apakāriṇam
translated: one should not hesitate here, one should kill the offender.

original: aparaṃ mṛto 'py asmākaṃ bhojyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aparam mṛtaḥ u pi asmākam bhojyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Moreover, even if he is dead, he will be our food.

original: tad ekaṃ tāvad varasādhanam /
analyzed: tat ekam tāvat vara sādhanam
translated: That is one good means.

original: aparaṃ sācivyaṃ ca bhaviṣyati tṛptiś ceti /
analyzed: aparam sācivyam ca bhaviṣyati tṛptiḥ ca iti
translated: And it will be assistance and satisfaction.

original: tadguṇatraye'sminn upasthite kasmān māṃ dūṣayasi tvaṃ jāḍyabhāvāt / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tad guṇa traye ismin upasthite kasmāt mām dūṣayasi tvam jāḍya bhāvāt uktam ca
translated: When these three qualities are present, why do you slander me out of stupidity? And it is said:

original: parasya pīḍanaṃ kurvan svārthasiddhiṃ ca paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: parasya pīḍanam kurvan sva artha siddhim ca paṇḍitaḥ
translated: A wise man, causing harm to another and achieving his own purpose,

original: mūḍhabuddhir na bhakṣeta vane caturako yathā // ///
analyzed: mūḍha buddhiḥ na bhakṣeta vane caturakaḥ yathā
translated: should not eat like a foolish-minded one eats in the forest.

original: karaṭaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: karaṭakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Karataka said: How is this?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: vajradaṃṣṭranāmasiṃhakathā
analyzed: vajradaṃṣṭra nāma siṃha kathā
translated: The story of the lion named Vajradaṃṣṭra

original: asti kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe vajradaṃṣṭro nāma siṃhaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe vajradaṃṣṭraḥ nāma siṃhaḥ
translated: In a certain forest region, there was a lion named Vajradaṃṣṭra.

original: tasya caturakakravyamukhanāmānau śṛgālavṛkau bhṛtyabhūtau sadaivānugatau tatraiva vane prativasataḥ /
analyzed: tasya caturaka kravyamukha nāmānau śṛgāla vṛkau bhṛtya bhūtau sadā eva anugatau tatra eva vane prativasataḥ
translated: And his servants, a jackal and a wolf named Caturaka and Kṛvyamukha, always followed him and lived in that very forest.

original: athānyadine siṃhena kadācid āsannaprasavā prasavavedanayā svayūthād bhraṣṭoṣṭry upaviṣṭā kasmiṃścid vanagahane samāsāditā /
analyzed: atha anya dine siṃhena kadācid āsanna prasavā prasava vedanayā sva yūthāt bhraṣṭa uṣṭrī upaviṣṭā kasmiṃścid vana gahane samāsāditā
translated: Then one day, the lion happened to find an old camel that had strayed from its herd due to the pain of giving birth, sitting in a certain forest thicket.

original: atha tāṃ vyāpādya yāvad udaraṃ sphoṭayati /
analyzed: atha tām vyāpādya yāvat udaram sphoṭayati
translated: Then, after killing her, while he was tearing open her belly,

original: tāvaj jīvan laghudāserakaśiśur niṣkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat jīvan laghudāseraka śiśuḥ niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: a small living camel calf came out.

original: siṃho 'pi dāserakyāḥ piśitena saparivāraḥ parāṃ tṛptim upāgataḥ /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ pi dāserakyāḥ piśitena sa parivāraḥ parām tṛptim upāgataḥ
translated: And the lion, along with his retinue, attained the highest satisfaction with the flesh of the camel.

original: paraṃ snehād bāladāsekaṃ tyaktaṃ gṛham ānīyedam uvācabhadra /
analyzed: param snehāt bāla dāsa ikam tyaktam gṛham ānīya idam uvāca bhadra
translated: But out of affection, he took the young camel calf, which he had abandoned, to his den and said this: Good fellow,

original: na te'sti mṛtyor bhayaṃ matto nānyasmād api /
analyzed: na te sti mṛtyoḥ bhayam mattaḥ nā anyasmāt api
translated: you have no fear of death from me or anyone else.

original: tataḥ svecchayātra vane bhrāmyatām iti /
analyzed: tatas svecchayā atra vane bhrāmyatām iti
translated: Therefore, wander here in the forest as you wish.

original: yatas te śaṅkusadṛśau karṇau /
analyzed: yatas te śaṅku sadṛśau karṇau
translated: Because your ears are like pegs,

original: tataḥ śaṅkukarṇo nāma bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas śaṅkukarṇaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati
translated: therefore you will be named Śaṅkukarṇa.

original: evam anuṣṭhite catvāro 'pi na ekasthāne vihāriṇaḥ parasparam anekaprakāragoṣṭhīsukham anubhavantas tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: evam anuṣṭhite catvāraḥ pi na eka sthāne vihāriṇaḥ parasparam aneka prakāra goṣṭhī sukham anubhavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: And when this was done, the four of them lived in different places, enjoying the pleasure of conversation with each other.

original: śaṅkukarṇo 'pi yauvanapadavīm ārūḍhaḥ kṣaṇam api na taṃ siṃhaṃ muñcati /
analyzed: śaṅkukarṇaḥ pi yauvana padavīm ārūḍhaḥ kṣaṇam api na tam siṃham muñcati
translated: And Shankukarna, now grown up, never left the lion for a moment.

original: atha kadācid vajradaṃṣṭrasya kenacid vanyena mattagajena saha yuddham abhavat /
analyzed: atha kadācid vajradaṃṣṭrasya kenacid vanyena matta gajena saha yuddham abhavat
translated: Now one day Vajradanstra had a fight with a wild elephant in rut.

original: tena madavīryāt sa dantaprahārais tathā kṣataśarīro vihito yathā pracalituṃ na śaknoti /🔽tadā kṣutkṣāmakaṇṭhas tān provācabhoḥ /
analyzed: tena mada vīryāt sa danta prahāraiḥ tathā kṣata śarīraḥ vihitaḥ yathā pracalitum na śaknoti  tadā kṣudh kṣāma kaṇṭhaḥ tān provāca bhoḥ
translated: And by the power of his rut, the elephant struck him with his tusks so that he was unable to move.

original: anviṣyatāṃ kiñcit sattvaṃ yenāham evaṃ sthito 'pi taṃ vyāpādyātmano yuṣmākaṃ ca kṣutpraṇāśaṃ karomi /
analyzed: anviṣyatām kiñcid sattvam yena aham evam tam vyāpādya ātmanaḥ yuṣmākam ca kṣudh praṇāśam karomi
translated: Then, his throat parched with hunger, he said to them, “Look for some creature, so that even in this condition I can kill it and satisfy your hunger as well as my own.”

original: tac chrutvā te trayo 'pi vane sandhyākālaṃ yāvad bhrāntāḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā te trayaḥ vane sandhyā kālam yāvat bhrāntāḥ
translated: Hearing this, the three of them wandered about in the forest until evening.

original: paraṃ na kiñcit sattvam āsāditam /
analyzed: param na kiñcid sattvam āsāditam
translated: But they did not find a single creature.

original: atha caturakaś cintayāmāsayadi śaṅkukarṇo 'yaṃ vyāpādyeta tataḥ sarveṣāṃ katicid dināni tṛptir bhavati /
analyzed: atha caturakaḥ cintayāmāsa yadi śaṅkukarṇaḥ yam vyāpādyeta tatas sarveṣām katicid dināni tṛptiḥ bhavati
translated: Then Chatur said to himself, “If Shankukarna were killed, all of us could be satisfied for some days.

original: paraṃ nainaṃ svāmī mitratvād āśrayasamāśritatvāc ca vināśayiṣyati /
analyzed: param nā enam svāmī mitra tvāt āśraya samāśrita tvāt ca vināśayiṣyati
translated: But the master will not destroy him out of friendship and because he is a dependent.

original: athavā buddhiprabhāveṇa svāminaṃ pratibodhya tathā kariṣye yathā vyāpādayiṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: athavā buddhi prabhāveṇa svāminam pratibodhya tathā kariṣye yathā vyāpādayiṣyati uktam ca
