translated: Or, having awakened the master through my intelligence, I will act in such a way that he will kill him. And it is said:

original: avadhyaṃ vāthavāgamyam akṛtyaṃ nāsti kiṃcana /
analyzed: avadhyam vā athavā agamyam akṛtyam na asti kiṃcana
translated: There is nothing that cannot be killed or reached or done

original: loke buddhimatām atra tasmāt tāṃ yojayāmy aham // ///
analyzed: loke buddhimatām atra tasmāt tām yojayāmi aham
translated: in this world by the intelligent. Therefore I will employ that.

original: evaṃ vicintya śaṅkukarṇam idam āhabhoḥ śaṅkukarṇa /🔽svāmī tāvat pathyaṃ vinā kṣudhayā paripīḍyate /
analyzed: evam vicintya śaṅkukarṇam idam āha bhoḥ śaṅkukarṇa  svāmī tāvat pathyam vinā kṣudhayā paripīḍyate
translated: Having thought thus, he said this to Sharp-Ear: Oh Sharp-Ear,🔽the master is indeed afflicted by hunger without food.

original: svāmyabhāvād asmākam api dhruvaṃ vināśa eva /
analyzed: svāmi abhāvāt asmākam api dhruvam vināśaḥ eva
translated: And due to the absence of a master, our destruction is certain.

original: tato vākyaṃ kiñcit svāmyarthe vadiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatas vākyam kiñcid svāmi arthe vadiṣyāmi
translated: Therefore I will speak some words for the sake of the master.

original: tac chrūyatām /
analyzed: tat śrūyatām
translated: Listen to that.

original: śaṅkukarṇa āhabhoḥ śīghraṃ nivedyatāṃ /
analyzed: śaṅkukarṇaḥ āha bhoḥ śīghram nivedyatām
translated: Sharp-Ear said: Oh, let it be quickly told,

original: yena te vacanaṃ śīghraṃ nirvikalpaṃ karomi /
analyzed: yena te vacanam śīghram nirvikalpam karomi
translated: so that I can carry out your words without hesitation.

original: aparaṃ svāminohite kṛte mayā sukṛtaśataṃ kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aparam svāminā ūhite kṛte mayā sukṛta śatam kṛtam bhaviṣyati
translated: And if I do what is beneficial for the master, it will be as if I have done a hundred good deeds.

original: atha caturaka āhabho bhadra /
analyzed: atha caturakaḥ āha bho bhadra
translated: Then Smart said: Oh good one,

original: ātmaśarīraṃ dviguṇalābhena svāmine prayaccha /
analyzed: ātma śarīram dviguṇa lābhena svāmine prayaccha
translated: give your own body to the master for double the price.

original: yena te dviguṇaṃ śarīraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yena te dviguṇam śarīram bhavati
translated: By which your body will be doubled.

original: svāminaḥ punaḥ prāṇayātrā bhavati /
analyzed: svāminaḥ punar prāṇa yātrā bhavati
translated: And the master will be saved.

original: tad ākarṇya śaṅkukarṇaḥ prāhabhadra /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya śaṅkukarṇaḥ prāha bhadra
translated: Hearing that, Shankukarna said, Good sir,

original: yady evaṃ tan madīyaprayojanam etad ucyatām /
analyzed: yadi evam tat madīya prayojanam etat ucyatām
translated: if it is so, then let my purpose be stated.

original: svāmyarthaḥ kriyatām iti /
analyzed: svāmi arthaḥ kriyatām iti
translated: Let the master's purpose be done.

original: param atra dharmaḥ pratibhūḥ iti /
analyzed: param atra dharmaḥ pratibhūḥ iti
translated: But here, Dharma is the surety.

original: te vicintya sarve siṃhasakāśam ājagmuḥ /
analyzed: te vicintya sarve siṃha sakāśam ājagmuḥ
translated: Having thought about it, they all went to the lion.

original: tataś caturaka āhadeva /
analyzed: tatas caturakaḥ āhat eva
translated: Then Chaturaka said, Your Majesty,

original: na kiñcit sattvaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: na kiñcid sattvam prāptam
translated: no being has been found.

original: bhagavān ādityo 'py astaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān ādityaḥ api astam gataḥ
translated: And the sun has also set.

original: tad yadi svāmī dviguṇaṃ śarīraṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: tat yadi svāmī dviguṇam śarīram prayacchati
translated: So if the master gives his body doubled,

original: tataḥ śaṅkukarṇo 'yaṃ dviguṇavṛddhyā svaśarīraṃ prayacchati dharmapratibhuvā /
analyzed: tatas śaṅkukarṇaḥ yam dviguṇa vṛddhyā sva śarīram prayacchati dharma pratibhuvā
translated: then this Shankukarna will give his body doubled with Dharma as surety.

original: siṃha āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ āhabhoḥ
translated: The lion said, Sir,

original: yady evaṃ tat sundarataram /
analyzed: yadi evam tat sundarataram
translated: if it is so, then it is more beautiful.

original: vyavahārasyāsya dharmaḥ pratibhūḥ kriyatām iti /
analyzed: vyavahārasya asya dharmaḥ pratibhūḥ kriyatām iti
translated: Let Dharma be made the surety for this transaction.

original: atha siṃhavacanānantaraṃ vṛkaśṛgālābhyāṃ vidāritobhayakukṣiḥ śaṅkukarṇaḥ pañcatvam upāgataḥ /
analyzed: atha siṃha vacana anantaram vṛka śṛgālābhyām vidārita ubhaya kukṣiḥ śaṅku karṇaḥ pañcatvam upāgataḥ
translated: Then, immediately after the lion's words, Shankukarna, his belly torn open by the wolf and jackal, died.

original: atha vajradaṃṣṭraś caturakam āhabhoś caturaka /
analyzed: atha vajradaṃṣṭraḥ caturakam āha bhoḥ caturaka
translated: Then Vajradanstra said to Chaturaka, Sir Chaturaka,

original: yāvad ahaṃ nadīṃ gatvā snānaṃ devatārcanavidhiṃ kṛtvāgacchāmi /
analyzed: yāvat aham nadīm gatvā snānam devatā arcana vidhim kṛtvā āgacchāmi
translated: I’m going to the river to bathe and worship the gods.

original: tāvat tvayātrāpamattena bhāvyam ity uktvā nadyāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tāvat tvayā atra apamattena bhāvyam iti uktvā nadyām gataḥ
translated: In the meantime, you must stay here on guard.’ With these words he went to the river.

original: atha tasmin gate caturakaś cintayāmāsakathaṃ mamaikākino bhojyo 'yam uṣṭro bhaviṣyati iti vicintya kravyamukham āhabhoḥ kravyamukha /
analyzed: atha tasmin gate caturakaḥ cintayāmāsa katham mama ekākinaḥ bhojyaḥ yam uṣṭraḥ bhaviṣyati iti vicintya kravyamukham āha bhoḥ kravyamukha
translated: Then, after he had gone, Smart thought, ‘How can I eat this camel all by myself?’ Having thus reflected, he said to Meat-Face, ‘My friend Meat-Face,

original: kṣudhālur bhavān /
analyzed: kṣudhāluḥ bhavān
translated: you are hungry.

original: tad yāvad asau svāmī nāgacchati /
analyzed: tat yāvat asau svāmī na āgacchati
translated: So, while the master is away,

original: tāvat tvam asyoṣṭrasya māṃsaṃ bhakṣaya /
analyzed: tāvat tvam asya uṣṭrasya māṃsam bhakṣaya
translated: you eat the flesh of this camel.

original: ahaṃ tvāṃ svāmino nirdoṣaṃ pratipādayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham tvām svāminaḥ nirdoṣam pratipādayiṣyāmi
translated: I will clear you of blame in the master’s eyes.’

original: so 'pi tac chrutvā yāvat kiñcin māṃsam āsvādayati tāvac caturakeṇoktambhoḥ kravyamukha /
analyzed: saḥ u pi tat śrutvā yāvat kiñcid māṃsam āsvādayati tāvat caturakeṇa uktam bhoḥ kravyamukha
translated: When Meat-Face heard this, he began to eat a little of the flesh. Then Smart said, ‘My friend Meat-Face,

original: samāgacchati svāmī /
analyzed: samāgacchati svāmī
translated: the master is coming.

original: tat tyaktvainaṃ dūre tiṣṭha /
analyzed: tat tyaktvā enam dūre tiṣṭha
translated: So drop it and stand far away,

original: yenāsya bhakṣaṇaṃ na vikalpayati /
analyzed: yena asya bhakṣaṇam na vikalpayati
translated: so that he will not suspect you of eating it.’

original: tathānuṣṭhite siṃhaḥ samāyāto yāvad uṣṭraṃ paśyati tāvad riktīkṛtahṛdayo dāserakaḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite siṃhaḥ samāyātaḥ yāvat uṣṭram paśyati tāvat riktīkṛta hṛdayaḥ dāserakaḥ
translated: When they had done as he suggested, the lion came back and saw the camel with its heart torn out.

original: tato bhṛkuṭiṃ kṛtvā paruṣataram āhaaho kenaiṣa uṣṭra ucchiṣṭatāṃ nīto /
analyzed: tatas bhṛkuṭim kṛtvā paruṣataram āha aho kena eṣaḥ uṣṭraḥ ucchiṣṭa tām
translated: Then he frowned and said in a harsh voice, “Ah, who has made this camel impure?

original: yena tam api vyāpādayāmi /🔽evam abhihite kravyamukhaś caturakamukham avalokayati /
analyzed: yena tam api vyāpādayāmi  evam abhihite kravyamukhaḥ caturaka mukham avalokayati
translated: I will kill him too.”🔽When this was said, Blood-Face looked at Smart.

original: atha caturako vihasyovācabhoḥ /
analyzed: atha caturakaḥ vihasya uvāca bhoḥ
translated: Then Smart laughed and said, “Sir,

original: mām anādṛtya piśitaṃ bhakṣayitvādhunā manmukham avalokayasi /
analyzed: mām an ādṛtya piśitam bhakṣayitvā adhunā mad mukham avalokayasi
translated: you ignored me, ate the meat, and now you look at my face.

original: tadāsvādayāsya durṇayataroḥ phalam iti /
analyzed: tat āsvādaya asya durṇaya taroḥ phalam iti
translated: Taste the fruit of that evil deed.”

original: tad ākarṇya kravyamukho jīvanāśabhayād dūradeśaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya kravyamukhaḥ jīva nāśa bhayāt dūra deśam gataḥ
translated: Hearing that, Blood-Face, fearing for his life, went to a distant land.

original: etasminn antare tena mārgeṇa dāserakasārtho bhārākrāntaḥ samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: etasmin antare tena mārgeṇa dāseraka sārthaḥ bhāra ākrāntaḥ samāyātaḥ
translated: In the meantime, a caravan of slaves, exhausted by their load, came along that path.

original: tasyāgresaroṣṭrasya kaṇṭhe mahatī ghaṇṭā baddhā /
analyzed: tasya agresara uṣṭrasya kaṇṭhe mahatī ghaṇṭā baddhā
translated: A large bell was tied around the neck of their leading camel.

original: tasyāḥ śabdaṃ durato 'py ākarṇya siṃho jambukam āhabhadra /
analyzed: tasyāḥ śabdam ākarṇya siṃhaḥ jambukam āha bhadra
translated: Hearing its sound from afar, the lion said to the jackal, “Good sir,

original: jñāyatāṃ kim eṣa raudraḥ śabdaḥ śrūyate'śrutapūrvaḥ /
analyzed: jñāyatām kim eṣa raudraḥ śabdaḥ śrūyate śruta pūrvaḥ
translated: find out what this terrible sound is that is heard, never heard before.”

original: tac chrutvā /
analyzed: tat śrutvā
translated: Hearing that,

original: caturakaḥ kiñcid vanāntaraṃ gatvā satvaram abhyupetya provācasvāmin /
analyzed: caturakaḥ kiñcid vana antaram gatvā sa tvaram abhyupetya provāca svāmin
translated: Smart went a little way into the forest, quickly returned, and said, “Master,

original: gamyatāṃ gamyatāṃ yadi śaknoṣi gantum /
analyzed: gamyatām gamyatām yadi śaknoṣi gantum
translated: go, go, if you can go.

original: so 'bravītbhadra /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt bhadra
translated: He said, “Good fellow!

original: kim evaṃ māṃ vyākulayasi /
analyzed: kim evam mām vyākulayasi
translated: Why do you disturb me like this?

original: tat kathaya kim etat /
analyzed: tat kathaya kim etat
translated: So tell me, what is it?”

original: iti caturaka āhasvāmin /
analyzed: iti caturake āha svāmin
translated: Clever then said, “Master,

original: eṣa dharmarājas tavopari kupitaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa dharmarājaḥ tava upari kupitaḥ
translated: this King of Righteousness is angry with you.

original: yad anenākāle dāserako 'yaṃ madīyo vyāpāditaḥ /
analyzed: yat anena akāle dāserakaḥ yam madīyaḥ vyāpāditaḥ
translated: Since he has killed my donkey at an inopportune time,

original: tat sahasraguṇam uṣṭram asya sakāśād grahīṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat sahasraguṇam uṣṭram asya sakāśāt grahīṣyāmi
translated: I will take a thousand times as much from him.

original: iti niścitya bṛhanmānam ādāyāgresarasyoṣṭrasya grīvāyāṃ ghaṇṭāṃ baddhvā badhyadāserakasaktān api pitṛpitāmahān ādāya vairaniryātanārtham
analyzed: iti niścitya bṛhat mānam ādāya agresarasya uṣṭrasya grīvāyām ghaṇṭām baddhvā badhya dāseraka saktān api pitṛ pitāmahān ādāya vaira niryātana artham
translated: Having decided this, he took a large measure, tied a bell to the neck of the leading camel, and, taking with him even his ancestors, fathers and grandfathers, who were tied to the donkey, he came

original: āyāta eva /
analyzed: āyātaḥ eva
translated: to avenge himself.

original: siṃho 'pi tac chrutvā sarvato dūrād evāvalokya mṛtam uṣṭraṃ parityajya prāṇabhayāt praṇaṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ pi tat śrutvā sarvatas dūrāt eva avalokya mṛtam uṣṭram parityajya prāṇa bhayāt praṇaṣṭaḥ
translated: When the lion heard this, he looked all around from a distance, abandoned the dead camel, and fled out of fear for his life.

original: caturako 'pi śanaiḥ śanais tasyoṣṭrasya māṃsaṃ bhakṣayāmāsa /
analyzed: caturakaḥ pi śanais śanais tasya uṣṭrasya māṃsam bhakṣayāmāsa
translated: And Clever slowly ate the flesh of that camel.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiparasaya pīḍanaṃ kurvan iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi parasaya pīḍanam kurvan iti
translated: That is why I say: 'One who inflicts pain on another...'

original: atha damanake gate sañjīvakaś cintayāmāsaaho kim etan mayā kṛtam /
analyzed: atha damanake gate sañjīvakaḥ cintayāmāsa aho kim etat mayā kṛtam
translated: Then, after Damanaka had left, Life-Giving thought, Oh, what have I done!

original: yac chaṣpādo 'pi māṃsāśitas tasyānugaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: yat śaṣpādaḥ pi māṃsa āśitaḥ tasya anugaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: That even a six-footed flesh-eater has become his follower.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: agamyāni pumān yāti yo 'sevyāṃś ca niṣevate /
analyzed: agamyāni pumān yāti sevyān ca niṣevate
translated: A man who goes to forbidden places and associates with the unapproachable,

original: sa mṛtyum upagṛhṇāti garbham aśvatarī yathā // ///
analyzed: sa mṛtyum upagṛhṇāti garbham aśvatarī yathā
translated: He embraces death like a mule conceives.

original: tat kiṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat kim karomi
translated: What shall I do?

original: kva gacchāmi /
analyzed: kva gacchāmi
translated: Where shall I go?

original: kathaṃ me śāntir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: katham me śāntiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How will I find peace?

original: athavā tam eva piṅgalakaṃ gacchāmi /
analyzed: athavā tam eva piṅgalakam gacchāmi
translated: Or rather, I shall go to that very Pingalaka.

original: kadācin māṃ śaraṇāgataṃ rakṣati /
analyzed: kadācid mām śaraṇa āgatam rakṣati
translated: Perhaps he will protect me, who have come for refuge,

original: prāṇair na viyojayati /
analyzed: prāṇaiḥ na viyojayati
translated: And will not separate me from my life.

original: yata uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas uktam ca
translated: For it is said:

original: dharmārthaṃ yatatām apīha vipado devād yadi syuḥ kvacit
analyzed: dharma artham yatatām api iha vipadaḥ devāt yadi syuḥ kvacid
translated: If calamities should befall those striving for dharma here, even from the gods, somewhere,

original: tat tāsām upaśāntaye sumatibhiḥ kāryo viśeṣān nayaḥ /
analyzed: tat tāsām upaśāntaye sumatibhiḥ kāryaḥ viśeṣāt nayaḥ
translated: For their complete cessation, a special policy should be devised by the wise.

original: loke khyātim upāgatātra sakale lokoktir eṣā yato
analyzed: loke khyātim upāgatā atra sakale loka uktiḥ eṣā yatas
translated: For this worldly saying has become well-known in the world:

original: dagdhānāṃ kila vahninā hitakaraḥ seko 'pi tasyodbhavaḥ // ///
analyzed: dagdhānām kila vahninā hita karaḥ sekaḥ api tasya udbhavaḥ
translated: 'It is said that sprinkling with water is beneficial for those burned by fire, and that is its origin.'

original: tathā ca🔽loke'thavā tanubhṛtāṃ nijakarmapākaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca  tanubhṛtām nija karma pākam
translated: And so it is:

original: nityaṃ samāśritavatāṃ suhitakriyāṇām /🔽bhāvārjitaṃ śubham athāpy aśubhaṃ nikāmaṃ
analyzed: nityam samāśritavatām su hita kriyāṇām  bhāva arjitam śubham atha api aśubham nikāmam
translated: In the world, or for embodied beings who always rely on the ripening of their own actions,🔽For those engaged in good deeds,

original: yad bhāvi tad bhavati nātra vicārahetuḥ // ///
analyzed: yat bhāvi tat bhavati na atra vicāra hetuḥ
translated: Whatever is destined to happen, whether good or bad, that happens, there is no cause for deliberation.

original: aparaṃ cānyatra gatasyāpi me kasyacid duṣṭasattvasya māṃsāśinaḥ sakāśān mṛtyur bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aparam ca anyatra gatasya api me kasyacid duṣṭa sattvasya māṃsa āśinaḥ sakāśāt mṛtyuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And if I go elsewhere, I will die at the hands of some evil creature who eats flesh.

original: tad varaṃ siṃhāt / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat varam siṃhāt uktam ca
translated: Better to die at the lion's. And it is said:

original: mahadbhiḥ spardhamānasya vipad eva garīyasī /
analyzed: mahadbhiḥ spardhamānasya vipad eva garīyasī
translated: For one who competes with the great, disaster is the most serious thing.

original: dantabhaṅge'pi nāgānāṃ ślāghyo girividāraṇe // ///
analyzed: danta bhaṅge api nāgānām ślāghyaḥ giri vidāraṇe
translated: Even when their tusks are broken, elephants are praised for tearing apart mountains.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: mahato 'pi kṣayaṃ labdhvā ślāghyaṃ nīco 'pi gacchati /
analyzed: mahataḥ pi kṣayam labdhvā ślāghyam nīcaḥ u pi gacchati
translated: Even a low person, having obtained the destruction of a great one, goes to glory.

original: dānārthī madhupo yadvad gajakarṇasamāhataḥ // ///
analyzed: dāna arthī madhupaḥ yadvat gaja karṇa samāhataḥ
translated: Like a bee, desiring honey, struck by an elephant's ear.

original: evaṃ niścitya sa sthalitagatiṃ mandaṃ gatvā siṃhāśrayaṃ paśyann apaṭhataho /
analyzed: evam niścitya sa sthalita gatim mandam gatvā siṃha āśrayam paśyan apaṭhata ho
translated: Having decided thus, he walked slowly with a limp, looking at the lion's abode, and recited:

original: sādhv idam ucyate🔽antarlīnabhujaṅgamaṃ gṛham ivāntaḥsthograsiṃhaṃ vanaṃ
analyzed: sādhu idam ucyate  antar līna bhujaṅgamam gṛham iva antaḥstha ugra siṃham vanam
translated: This is well said:🔽A forest with a fierce lion hidden within, like a house with a hidden serpent,

original: grāhākīrṇam ivābhirāmakamalacchāyāsanāthaṃ saraḥ /🔽kālenāryajanāpavādapiśunaiḥ kṣudrair anāryaiḥ śritaṃ
analyzed: grāha ākīrṇam iva abhirāma kamala chāyā sanātham saraḥ  kālena ārya jana apavāda piśunaiḥ kṣudraiḥ anāryaiḥ śritam
translated: A lake with beautiful lotuses shaded by the sun, but infested with crocodiles.🔽Approached with difficulty, with fear, the mind of kings is like that, in the age of Kali,

original: duḥkhena pravigāhyate sacakitaṃ rājñāṃ manaḥ sāmayam // ///
analyzed: duḥkhena pravigāhyate sa cakitam rājñām manaḥ sa āmayam
translated: frequented by low, ignoble people, slanderers of the good, in time.

original: evaṃ paṭhan damanakoktākāraṃ piṅgalakaṃ dṛṣṭvā pracakitaḥ saṃvṛtaśarīro dūrataraṃ praṇāmakṛtiṃ vināpy upaviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: evam paṭhan damanaka ukta ākāram piṅgalakam dṛṣṭvā pracakitaḥ saṃvṛta śarīraḥ dūrataram praṇāma kṛtim vinā api upaviṣṭaḥ
translated: Damanaka, seeing that Pīngalaka was in the condition he had described, was frightened, and, keeping his body well under control, sat down at a distance, without making a bow.

original: piṅgalako 'pi tathāvidhaṃ taṃ vilokya damanakavākyaṃ śraddadhānaḥ kopāt tasyopari papāta /
analyzed: piṅgalakaḥ pi tathāvidham tam vilokya damanaka vākyam śraddadhānaḥ kopāt tasya upari papāta
translated: And Pīngalaka, seeing him in that state, believed Damanaka’s story, and fell upon him in a passion.

original: atha sañjīvakaḥ kharanakhavikartitapṛṣṭhaḥ śṛṅgābhyāṃ tadudaram ullikhya katham api tasmād apetaḥ śṛṅgābhyāṃ hantum icchan yuddhāyāvasthitaḥ🔽atha dvāv api tau puṣpitapalāśapratimau parasparavadhakāṅkṣiṇau dṛṣṭvā karaṭako damanakam āhabho mūḍhamate /
analyzed: atha sañjīvakaḥ khara nakha vikartita pṛṣṭhaḥ śṛṅgābhyām tat udaram ullikhya katham api tasmāt apetaḥ śṛṅgābhyām hantum icchan yuddhāya avasthitaḥ  atha dvau api tau puṣpita palāśa pratimau paraspara vadha kāṅkṣiṇau dṛṣṭvā karaṭakaḥ damanakam āha bho mūḍha mate
translated: Then Life-Giving, his back torn by the sharp claws, scratched his enemy’s belly with his horns, and somehow got away from him. And he stood ready for battle, wishing to kill him with his horns.

original: anayor virodhaṃ vitanvatā tvayā sādhu na kṛtam /
analyzed: anayoḥ virodham vitanvatā tvayā sādhu na kṛtam
translated: Then seeing that both of them were like flowering Palāśa trees, eager to kill each other, Kārataka said to Damanaka: “Ah! You have not done well in spreading this quarrel between them.

original: na ca tvaṃ nītitattvaṃ vetsi /
analyzed: na ca tvam nīti tattvam vetsi
translated: And you do not know the truth of politics.

original: nītividbhir uktaṃ ca
analyzed: nīti vidbhiḥ uktam ca
translated: And it is said by those who know politics:

original: kāryāṇy uttamadaṇḍasāhasaphalāny āyāsasādhyāni ye prītyā saṃśamayanti nītikuśalāḥ sāmnaiva te mantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: kāryāṇi uttama daṇḍa sāhasa phalāni āyāsa sādhyāni ye prītyā saṃśamayanti nīti kuśalāḥ sāmnā eva te mantriṇaḥ
translated: Those ministers who, by their skill in politics, gladly make peace with little effort with affairs that have great results and are hard to accomplish by force, are ministers who use conciliation.

original: niḥsārālpaphalāni ye tv avidhinā vāñchanti daṇḍodyamais
analyzed: niḥsāra alpa phalāni ye tu avidhinā vāñchanti daṇḍa udyamaiḥ
translated: But those who desire the fruit of the tree by force, without proper means,

original: teṣāṃ durnayaceṣṭitair narapater āropyate śrīs tulām // ///
analyzed: teṣām durnaya ceṣṭitaiḥ narapateḥ āropyate śrīḥ tulām
translated: their bad conduct is weighed against the king's glory.

original: tad yadi svāmyabhighāto bhaviṣyati tat kiṃ tavdīyamantrabuddhyā kriyate /
analyzed: tat yadi svāmi abhighātaḥ bhaviṣyati tat kim tavdīya mantra buddhyā kriyate
translated: If it will be an offense to the master, then why is it done by your ministerial intelligence?

original: atha sañjīvako na badhyate tathāpy abhavyam /
analyzed: atha sañjīvakaḥ na badhyate tathā api abhavyam
translated: Or if Sanjivaka is not killed, then also it is unfortunate.

original: yataḥ prāṇasandehāt tasya ca vadhaḥ /
analyzed: yatas prāṇa sandehāt tasya ca vadhaḥ
translated: Because there is a risk to his life and he may be killed.

original: tan mūḍha /
analyzed: tat mūḍha
translated: So, fool,

original: kathaṃ tvaṃ mantripadam abhilaṣasi /
analyzed: katham tvam mantri padam abhilaṣasi
translated: how do you desire the position of minister?

original: sāmasiddhiṃ na vetsi /
analyzed: sāma siddhim na vetsi
translated: You do not know the success of conciliation.

original: tad vṛthā manoratho 'yaṃ te daṇḍaruceḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat vṛthā manorathaḥ yam te daṇḍaruceḥ  uktam ca
translated: So this desire of yours for the use of force is in vain. And it is said:

original: sāmādidaṇḍaparyanto nayaḥ proktaḥ svayambhuvā /
analyzed: sāma ādi daṇḍa paryantaḥ nayaḥ proktaḥ svayambhuvā
translated: The self-existent one has declared policy to end with force beginning with conciliation.

original: teṣāṃ daṇḍas tu pāpīyāṃs taṃ paścād viniyojayet // ///
analyzed: teṣām daṇḍaḥ tu pāpīyān tam paścāt viniyojayet
translated: But force is the worst of them, it should be employed last.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: sāmnaiva yatra siddhir na tatra daṇḍo budhena viniyojyaḥ /
analyzed: sāmnā eva yatra siddhiḥ na tatra daṇḍaḥ budhena viniyojyaḥ
translated: Where there is success by conciliation alone, force should not be employed there by the wise.

original: pittaṃ yadi śarkarayā śāmyati ko 'rthaḥ paṭolena // ///
analyzed: pittam yadi śarkarayā śāmyati kaḥ arthaḥ paṭolena
translated: If bile is cured by sugar, what is the use of patola?

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: ādau sāma prayoktavyaṃ puruṣeṇa vijānatā /
analyzed: ādau sāma prayoktavyam puruṣeṇa vijānatā
translated: Conciliation should first be employed by a wise man.

original: sāmasādhyāni kāryāṇi vikriyāṃ yānti na kvacit // ///
analyzed: sāma sādhyāni kāryāṇi vikriyām yānti na kvacid
translated: Deeds accomplished through conciliation never go to waste.

original: na candreṇa na cāuṣadhyā na sūryeṇa na vahninā /
analyzed: na candreṇa na ca auṣadhyā na sūryeṇa na vahninā
translated: Not by the moon, not by herbs, not by the sun, not by fire,

original: sāmnaiva vilayaṃ yāti vidveṣaprabhavaṃ tamaḥ // ///
analyzed: sāmnā eva vilayam yāti vidveṣa prabhavam tamaḥ
translated: But only by conciliation does the darkness born of hatred perish.

original: tathā yat tvaṃ mantritvam abhilaṣasi /
analyzed: tathā yat tvam mantri tvam abhilaṣasi
translated: Similarly, you aspire to the position of minister.

original: tad apy ayuktam /
analyzed: tat api ayuktam
translated: That too is improper.

original: yatas tvaṃ mantrigatiṃ na vetsi /
analyzed: yatas tvam mantri gatim na vetsi
translated: Because you do not know the way of a minister.

original: yataḥ pañcavidho mantraḥ /
analyzed: yatas pañcavidhaḥ mantraḥ
translated: Because counsel is of five kinds.

original: sa ca karmaṇām ārambhopāyaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca karmaṇām ārambha upāyaḥ
translated: And it is the means of undertaking actions.

original: puruṣadravyasampat /
analyzed: puruṣa dravya sampad
translated: It is the abundance of human resources.

original: deśakālavibhāgaḥ /
analyzed: deśa kāla vibhāgaḥ
translated: It is the division of place and time.

original: vinipātapratīkāraḥ /
analyzed: vinipāta pratīkāraḥ
translated: It is the remedy for misfortune.

original: kāryasiddhiś ceti /
analyzed: kārya siddhiḥ ca iti
translated: And it is the accomplishment of the task.

original: so 'yaṃ svāmyamātyayor ekatamasya kiṃ vā dvayor api vinipātaḥ samutpadyate lagnaḥ /🔽tad yadi kācic chaktir asti tad vicintyatāṃ vinipātapratīkāraḥ /
analyzed: saḥ yam svāmi amātyayoḥ ekatamasya kim vā dvayoḥ api vinipātaḥ samutpadyate lagnaḥ  tat yadi kācid śaktiḥ asti tat vicintyatām vinipāta pratīkāraḥ
translated: Now, does the misfortune of either the king or the minister or both arise and stick?🔽If there is any power, then let the remedy for misfortune be considered.

original: bhinnasandhāne hi mantriṇāṃ buddhiparīkṣā /
analyzed: bhinna sandhāne hi mantriṇām buddhi parīkṣā
translated: For the test of a minister's intellect is in the mending of what is broken.

original: tan mūrkha /
analyzed: tat mūrkha
translated: So you are a fool.

original: tat kartum asamarthatvaṃ yato viparītabuddhir asi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat kartum asamartha tvam yatas viparīta buddhiḥ asi uktam ca
translated: Your inability to do that is because you have a contrary intellect. And it is said:

original: mantriṇāṃ bhinnasandhāne bhiṣajāṃ sāṃnipātike /
analyzed: mantriṇām bhinna sandhāne bhiṣajām sāṃnipātike
translated: In the mending of what is broken for ministers, in the simultaneous [treatment] for physicians,

original: karmaṇi vyajyate prajñā susthe ko vā na paṇḍitaḥ // ///
analyzed: karmaṇi vyajyate prajñā susthe kaḥ vā na paṇḍitaḥ
translated: When a task is accomplished, wisdom is evident; who is not wise when things are going well?

original: anyac ca🔽ghātayitum eva nīcaḥ parakāryaṃ vetti na prasādhayitum /
analyzed: anyat ca  ghātayitum eva nīcaḥ para kāryam vetti na prasādhayitum
translated: And furthermore:🔽A low person only knows how to destroy the work of others, not how to accomplish it.

original: pātayitum eva śaktir nākhoruddhartum annapiṭakam // ///
analyzed: pātayitum eva śaktiḥ na ākhoḥ uddhartum annapiṭakam
translated: He is only able to bring down, not to lift up a basket of food with his claws.

original: athavā na te doṣo 'yam /
analyzed: athavā na te doṣaḥ yam
translated: Or rather, this is not your fault.

original: svāmino doṣaḥ /
analyzed: svāminaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: It is the fault of the master.

original: yas te vākyaṃ śraddadhāti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yaḥ te vākyam śraddadhāti uktam ca
translated: Whoever believes your words. And it is said:

original: narādhipā nīcajanānuvartino
analyzed: narādhipāḥ
translated: Kings who follow low people

original: budhopadiṣṭena pathā na yānti ye /
analyzed: budha upadiṣṭena pathā na yānti ye
translated: Do not go by the path taught by the wise.

original: viśanty ato durgamamārganirgamaṃ
analyzed: viśanti atas durgama mārga nirgamam
translated: Therefore they enter the difficult path, the exit from which is difficult,

original: samastasambādham anarthapañjaram // ///
analyzed: samasta sambādham anartha pañjaram
translated: The cage of misfortune, completely obstructed.

original: tad yadi tvam asya mantrī bhaviṣyasi tadānyo 'pi kaścin nāsya samīpe sādhujanaḥ sameṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat yadi tvam asya mantrī bhaviṣyasi tadā anyaḥ api kaścid na asya samīpe sādhu janaḥ sameṣyati uktam ca
translated: If you become his advisor, then no other good person will come near him. And it is said:

original: guṇālayo 'py asan mantrī nṛpatir nādhigamyate /
analyzed: guṇa ālayaḥ pi asat mantrī nṛpatiḥ na adhigamyate
translated: Even if a minister has qualities, a king is not known.

original: prasannasvādusalilo duṣṭagrāhyo yathā hradaḥ // ///
analyzed: prasanna svādu salilaḥ duṣṭa grāhyaḥ yathā hradaḥ
translated: Like a lake with clear, tasty water, but with dangerous crocodiles.

original: tathā ca śiṣṭajanarahitasya svāmino 'pi nāśo bhaviṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā ca śiṣṭa jana rahitasya svāminaḥ nāśaḥ bhaviṣyati uktam ca
translated: And thus the destruction of a master who is devoid of good people will also occur. And it is said:

original: citrāsvādakathair bhṛtyair anāyāsitakārmukaiḥ /
analyzed: citra āsvāda kathaiḥ bhṛtyaiḥ an āyāsita kārmukaiḥ
translated: With servants who tell colorful and tasty stories, without tiring the bow,

original: ye ramante nṛpās teṣāṃ ramante ripavaḥ śriyā // ///
analyzed: ye ramante nṛpāḥ teṣām ramante ripavaḥ śriyā
translated: If kings delight in them, their enemies delight in their prosperity.

original: tat kiṃ mūrkhopadeśena /
analyzed: tat kim mūrkha upadeśena
translated: So what's the use of instructing fools?

original: kevalaṃ doṣo na guṇaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: kevalam doṣaḥ na guṇaḥ uktam ca
translated: There's only fault, not virtue. And it's said:

original: nānāmyaṃ namate dāru nāśmani syāt kṣurakriyā /
analyzed: na anāmyam namate dāru na aśmani syāt kṣura kriyā
translated: Wood bends when wet, not so stone. A razor's edge is sharp, not a needle's point.

original: sūcīmukhaṃ vijānīhi nāśiṣyāyopaśyate // ///
analyzed: sūcīmukham vijānīhi na a śiṣyāya upaśyate
translated: Know that a needle's point is not seen by one who is not a disciple.

original: damanaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Damanaka said: How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: vānarayūthakathā
analyzed: vānara yūtha kathā
translated: The Story of the Monkey Troop

original: asti kasmiṃścit parvataikadeśe vānarayūtham /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid parvata eka deśe vānara yūtham
translated: There was a monkey troop in a certain part of a mountain.

original: tac ca kadācid dhemantasamaye'tikaṭhoravātasaṃsparśavepamānakalevaraṃ tuṣāravarṣoddhatapravarṣaghanadhārānipātasamāhataṃ na kathañcic
analyzed: tat ca kadācid hemanta samaya iti kaṭhora vāta saṃsparśa vepamāna kalevaram tuṣāra varṣa uddhata pravarṣa ghana dhārā nipāta samāhatam na kathañcid
translated: And that, once in a winter season, its body trembling from the touch of very harsh winds, struck by the heavy rain of dense showers of snow and rain, did not in any way

original: chāntim agamat /
analyzed: chāntim agamat
translated: attain peace.

original: atha kecid vānarā vahnikaṇasadṛśāni guñjāphalāny avacitya vahnivāñchayā phūtkurvantaḥ samantāt tasthuḥ /
analyzed: atha kecid vānarāḥ vahni kaṇa sadṛśāni guñjā phalāni avacitya vahni vāñchayā phūtkurvantaḥ samantāt tasthuḥ
translated: Then some monkeys, having gathered gunja fruits resembling sparks of fire, hissing all around with the desire for fire, stood there.

original: atha sucīmukho nāma pakṣī teṣāṃ taṃ vṛthāyāsamavalokya provācabhoḥ /
analyzed: atha sucīmukhaḥ nāma pakṣī teṣām tam vṛthāyāsam avalokya provāca bhoḥ
translated: Then a bird named Needle-mouth, seeing their vain exertion, said: Oh!

original: sarve mūrkhā yūyam /
analyzed: sarve mūrkhāḥ yūyam
translated: You are all fools.

original: naite vahnikaṇāḥ guñjāphalāni etāni /
analyzed: na ete vahni kaṇāḥ guñjā phalāni etāni
translated: These are not sparks of fire, these are gunja fruits.

original: tat kiṃ vṛthā śrameṇa /
analyzed: tat kim vṛthā śrameṇa
translated: So why bother with this?

original: naitasmāc chītarakṣā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na etasmāt śīta rakṣā bhaviṣyati
translated: This won't protect us from the cold.

original: tad anviṣyatāṃ kaścin nirvāto vanapradeśo guhā girikandaraṃ vā /
analyzed: tat anviṣyatām kaścid nirvātaḥ vana pradeśaḥ guhā giri kandaram vā
translated: Let's look for some sheltered place in the forest, a cave or a mountain hollow.

original: adyāpi saṭopā medhā dṛśyante /
analyzed: adya api sa ṭopāḥ medhāḥ dṛśyante
translated: We can still see the signs of intelligence.

original: atha teṣām ekatamo vṛddhavānaras tam uvācabho mūrkha /
analyzed: atha teṣām ekatamaḥ vṛddha vānaraḥ tam uvāca bho mūrkha
translated: Then an old monkey said to him, “Hey, you fool.

original: kiṃ tāvad anena vyāpāreṇa /
analyzed: kim tāvat anena vyāpāreṇa
translated: What's the point of this activity?

original: tad gamyatām / uktaṃ ca🔽muhur vighnitakarmāṇaṃ dyūtakāraṃ parājitam /
analyzed: tat gamyatām uktam ca  muhur vighnita karmāṇam dyūtakāram parājitam
translated: Let's go. And it is said:🔽A man who knows how to discriminate should not talk to a gambler who is repeatedly thwarted in his actions and defeated.

original: nālāpayed vivekajño yadīcchet siddhim ātmanaḥ // ///
analyzed: na ālāpayet viveka jñaḥ yadi icchet siddhim ātmanaḥ
translated: If he wants to succeed, he should not.

original: tathā ca🔽ākheṭakaṃ vṛthākleśaṃ mūrkhaṃ vyasanasaṃsthitam /
analyzed: tathā ca  ākheṭakam vṛthā kleśam mūrkham vyasana saṃsthitam
translated: And also:🔽A man who associates with a hunter, who is a fool, who is addicted to vice, and who is a source of useless trouble,

original: samālāpena yo yuṅkte sa gacchati parābhavam // ///
analyzed: samālāpena yaḥ yuṅkte sa gacchati parābhavam
translated: will be defeated.

original: so 'pi tam anādṛtya bhūyo 'pi vānarān anavaratam āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi tam an ādṛtya bhūyas pi vānarān anavaratam āhabhoḥ
translated: He ignored him and again said to the monkeys, “Hey,

original: kiṃ vṛthā kleśena /
analyzed: kim vṛthā kleśena
translated: what's the point of this useless trouble?

original: atha yāvad asau na kathañcit pralapan viramati tāvad ekena vānareṇa vyarthaśramatvāt kupitena pakṣābhyāṃ gṛhītvā śilāyām āsphālita uparataś
analyzed: atha yāvat asau na kathañcid pralapan viramati tāvat ekena vānareṇa vyartha śrama tvāt kupitena pakṣābhyām gṛhītvā śilāyām āsphālitaḥ uparataḥ
translated: But as long as he did not stop talking in any way, then an angry monkey grabbed him by the wings and threw him on a rock, and he died.

original: ca /
analyzed: ca
translated: And so it happened.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīminānamyaṃ namate dāru ity ādi / tathā ca🔽upadeśo hi mūrkhāṇāṃ prakopāya na śāntaye /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi nānamyam namate dāru iti ādi tathā ca  upadeśaḥ hi mūrkhāṇām prakopāya na śāntaye
translated: That's why I say, 'Wood that is not bent is bent,' and so on. And so:🔽Advice to fools only incites anger, not peace.

original: payaḥpānaṃ bhujaṅgānāṃ kevalaṃ viṣavardhanam // ///
analyzed: payaḥ pānam bhujaṅgānām kevalam viṣa vardhanam
translated: Drinking milk for snakes only increases their poison.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore:

original: upadeśo na dātavyo yādṛśe tādṛśe nare /
analyzed: upadeśaḥ na dātavyaḥ yādṛśe tādṛśe nare
translated: Advice should not be given to just anyone.

original: paśya vānaramūrkheṇa sugṛhī nirgṛhīkṛtā // ///
analyzed: paśya vānara mūrkheṇa sugṛhī nirgṛhīkṛtā
translated: Look how a monkey took a well-made pot and made it useless.

original: damanaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Dāmanaka said, How is that?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā🔽kasmiṃścid vane śamīvṛkṣaśākhālambitavasathaṃ kṛtvāraṇyacaṭakadampatī prativasataḥ sma /🔽atha kadācit tayoḥ sukhasaṃsthayor hemantamegho mandaṃ mandaṃ varṣitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: kathā  kasmiṃścid vane śamī vṛkṣa śākhā ālambita vasatham kṛtvā araṇya caṭaka dampatī prativasataḥ sma  atha kadācid tayoḥ sukha saṃsthayoḥ hemanta meghaḥ mandam mandam varṣitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Story🔽In a certain forest, a pair of wild partridges made a home on a branch of a shami tree and lived there.🔽One day, while they were comfortably settled, a winter cloud began to rain gently.

original: atrāntare kaścic chākhāmṛgo vātāsārasamāhataḥ proddhūṣitaśarīro dantavīṇāṃ vādayan vepamānas tasyāḥ śamyā mūlam āsādyopaviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atra antare kaścid śākhāmṛgaḥ vāta āsāra samāhataḥ proddhūṣita śarīraḥ danta vīṇām vādayan vepamānaḥ tasyāḥ śamyāḥ mūlam āsādya upaviṣṭaḥ
translated: In the meantime, a certain tree-monkey, his body bristling with cold and sneezing, playing a tooth-flute, shivering, reached the base of that shami tree and sat down.

original: atha taṃ tādṛṣam avalokya caṭakā prāhabho bhadra /
analyzed: atha tam tādṛṣam avalokya caṭakā prāha bho bhadra
translated: Then, seeing him like that, the female partridge said, Sir,

original: hastapādasamopeto dṛśyase puruṣākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: hasta pāda samopetaḥ dṛśyase puruṣa ākṛtiḥ
translated: You appear to have hands and feet, and the form of a man.

original: śītena bhidyase mūḍha kathaṃ na kuruṣe gṛham // ///
analyzed: śītena bhidyase mūḍha katham na kuruṣe gṛham
translated: You are split by the cold, fool! Why don't you make a house?

original: etac chrutvā tāṃ vānaraḥ sakopam āhaadhame kasmān na tvaṃ maunavratā bhavasi /
analyzed: etat śrutvā tām vānaraḥ sa kopam āha adhame kasmāt na tvam mauna vratā bhavasi
translated: Hearing this, the monkey angrily said, You wretched one, why don't you take a vow of silence?

original: aho dhārṣṭyam asyāḥ /
analyzed: aho dhārṣṭyam asyāḥ
translated: Oh, her audacity!

original: adya mām upahasati
analyzed: adya mām upahasati
translated: Today she laughs at me.

original: sūcīmukhi durācārā raṇḍā paṇḍitavādinī /
analyzed: sūcī mukhi durācārā raṇḍā paṇḍita vādinī
translated: You needle-faced, ill-behaved, sluttish, self-important talker,

original: nāśaṅkate prajalpantī tat kim enāṃ na hanmy aham // ///
analyzed: na āśaṅkate prajalpantī tat kim enām na hanmi aham
translated: talking without a care, why don't I kill you?

original: evaṃ pralapya tām āhamugdhe /
analyzed: evam pralapya tām āha mugdhe
translated: Having babbled thus, he said to her, You fool,

original: kiṃ mama cintayā tava prayojanam / uktaṃ ca🔽vācyaṃ śraddhāsametasya pṛcchateś ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: kim mama cintayā tava prayojanam uktam ca  vācyam śraddhā sametasya pṛcchateḥ ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: what do you have to do with my thoughts? And it is said:🔽What should be said is especially to one who asks with faith.

original: proktaṃ śraddhāvihīnasya araṇyaruditopamam // ///
analyzed: proktam śraddhā vihīnasya araṇya rudita upamam
translated: What is said to one lacking faith is like crying in the wilderness.

original: tat kiṃ bahunā tāvat /
analyzed: tat kim bahunā tāvat
translated: So what's the point of much talk?

original: kulāyasthitayā tayā punar apy abhihitaḥ /
analyzed: kulāya sthitayā tayā punar api abhihitaḥ
translated: She, remaining in the nest, again said to him.

original: sa tāvat tāṃ śamīm āruhya tasyāḥ kulāyaṃ śatadhā khaṇḍaśo 'karot /
analyzed: sa tāvat tām śamīm āruhya tasyāḥ kulāyam śatadhā khaṇḍaśas karot
translated: He climbed up to that shami tree and cut her nest into a hundred pieces.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiupadeśo na dātavyaḥ iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi upadeśaḥ na dātavyaḥ iti
translated: Therefore I say: Advice should not be given.

original: tan mūrkha / śikṣāpito 'pi na śikṣitas tvam /
analyzed: tat mūrkha na śikṣitaḥ tvam
translated: So, fool, even though instructed, you have not learned.

original: athavā na te doṣo 'sti /
analyzed: athavā na te doṣaḥ sti
translated: Or rather, it is not your fault.

original: yataḥ sādhoḥ śikṣā guṇāya sampadyate /
analyzed: yatas sādhoḥ śikṣā guṇāya sampadyate
translated: Because the training of a good person leads to virtue.

original: nāsādhoḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na asādhoḥ uktam ca
translated: Not of a bad person. And it is said:

original: kiṃ karoty eva pāṇḍityam asthāne viniyojitam /
analyzed: kim karoti eva pāṇḍityam asthāne viniyojitam
translated: What does scholarship do when employed in the wrong place?

original: andhakārapraticchanne ghaṭe dīpa ivāhitaḥ // ///
analyzed: andhakāra praticchanne ghaṭe dīpaḥ iva āhitaḥ
translated: Like a lamp placed in a pot covered in darkness.

original: tadvyarthapāṇḍityam āśritya mama vacanam aśṛṇvann ātmanaḥ śāntim api vetsi /
analyzed: tad vyartha pāṇḍityam āśritya mama vacanam aśṛṇvan ātmanaḥ śāntim api vetsi
translated: ... Relying on that useless scholarship, not listening to my words, you do not even know your own peace.

original: tan nūnam apajātas tvam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat nūnam apajātaḥ tvam uktam ca
translated: So you are certainly a bad person. And it is said:

original: jātaḥ putro 'nujātaś ca atijātas tathaiva ca /
analyzed: jātaḥ putraḥ nujātaḥ ca atijātaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: A son born, a son born after, and likewise a son born superior,

original: apajātaś ca loke'smin mantavyāḥ śāstravedibhiḥ // ///
analyzed: apajātaḥ ca loke ismin mantavyāḥ śāstra vedibhiḥ
translated: And a son born bad should be considered in this world by those who know the scriptures.

original: mātṛtulyaguṇo jātas tv anujātaḥ pituḥ samaḥ /
analyzed: mātṛ tulya guṇaḥ jātaḥ tu anujātaḥ pituḥ samaḥ
translated: ... A son born with qualities equal to the mother, a son born after is equal to the father,

original: atijāto 'dhikas tasmād apajāto 'dhamādhamaḥ // ///
analyzed: atijātaḥ dhikaḥ tasmāt apajātaḥ dhama adhamaḥ
translated: A son born superior is more than that, a son born bad is the lowest of the low.

original: apy ātmano vināśaṃ gaṇayati na khalaḥ paravyasanahṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: api ātmanaḥ vināśam gaṇayati na khalaḥ para vyasana hṛṣṭaḥ
translated: ... A wicked person does not count his own destruction, delighted by the misfortune of others.

original: prāyo mastakanāśe samaramukhe nṛtyati kabandhaḥ // ///
analyzed: prāyas mastaka nāśe samara mukhe nṛtyati kabandhaḥ
translated: Usually a headless torso dances in the face of battle when the head is destroyed.

original: aho / sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: aho sādhu idam ucyate
translated: ... Ah. This is well said:

original: dharmabuddhiḥ kubuddhiś ca dvāv etau viditau mama /
analyzed: dharmabuddhiḥ kubuddhiḥ ca dvau etau viditau mama
translated: Dharmabuddhi and Kubuddhi, these two are known to me.🔽The father was killed by his son through useless scholarship and smoke.

original: putreṇa vyarthapāṇḍityāt pitā dhūmena ghātitaḥ // ///
analyzed: putreṇa vyartha pāṇḍityāt pitā dhūmena ghātitaḥ
translated: The father was killed by his son through useless scholarship and smoke.

original: damanaka āhakatham etat /🔽so 'bravīt
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha katham etat  saḥ bravīt
translated: How was that? asked Victor. And Cheek told the story of The Monkey and the Dolphin🔽

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: Damanaka asked how it had happened, and Life-Giving related:🔽There was once a king named Victorious in Battle.

original: kṛṣṇasarpakathā
analyzed: kṛṣṇa sarpa kathā
translated: One day, while he was out hunting, he saw a snake and killed it with his arrow.

original: kasmiṃścid deśe dharmabuddhiḥ pāpabuddhiś ca dve mitre prativasataḥ /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid deśe dharmabuddhiḥ pāpabuddhiḥ ca dve mitre prativasataḥ
translated: In a certain place, two friends lived together, Dharmabuddhi and Papbuddhi.

original: atha kadācit pāpabuddhinā cintitaṃ yadahaṃ tāvan mūrkho dāridryopetaś ca /
analyzed: atha kadācid pāpa buddhinā cintitam yat aham tāvat mūrkhaḥ dāridrya upetaḥ ca
translated: One day, Papbuddhi thought, I am foolish and poor.

original: tad enaṃ dharmabuddhim ādāya deśāntaraṃ gatvā asyāśrayeṇārthopārjanāṃ kṛtvainam api vañcayitvā sukhībhavāmi /
analyzed: tat enam dharmabuddhim ādāya deśāntaram gatvā asya āśrayeṇa artha upārjanām kṛtvā enam api vañcayitvā sukhībhavāmi
translated: So I will take Dharmabuddhi with me, go to another country, earn wealth by relying on him, deceive him too, and become happy.

original: athānyasminn ahani pāpabuddhir dharmabuddhiṃ prāhabho mitra /
analyzed: atha anyasmin ahani pāpa buddhiḥ dharma buddhim prāha bho mitra
translated: Then one day, Papbuddhi said to Dharmabuddhi, My friend,

original: vārdhakabhāve kiṃ tv ātmaviceṣṭitaṃ smarasi /
analyzed: vārddhaka bhāve kim tu ātma viceṣṭitam smarasi
translated: do you remember your own actions in old age?

original: deśāntaram adṛṣṭvā kāṃ śiṣṭajanasya vārttāṃ kathayiṣyasi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: deśa antaram a dṛṣṭvā kām śiṣṭa janasya vārttām kathayiṣyasi uktam ca
translated: Without seeing another country, what news of good people will you tell? And it is said:

original: deśāntareṣu bahuvidhabhāṣāveṣādi yena na jñātam /
analyzed: deśa antareṣu bahuvidha bhāṣā veṣa ādi yena na jñātam
translated: By one who has not learned the various languages, costumes, etc. of other countries,

original: bhramatā dharaṇīpīṭhe tasya phalaṃ janmano vyartham // ///
analyzed: bhramatā dharaṇī pīṭhe tasya phalam janmanaḥ vyartham
translated: wandering on the earth, the fruit of his birth is useless.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: vidyāṃ vittaṃ śilpaṃ tāvan nāpnoti mānavaḥ samyak /
analyzed: vidyām vittam śilpam tāvat na āpnoti mānavaḥ samyak
translated: A man does not properly obtain knowledge, wealth, or skill,

original: yāvad vrajati na bhūmau deśād deśāntaraṃ hṛṣṭaḥ // ///
analyzed: yāvat vrajati na bhūmau deśāt deśa antaram hṛṣṭaḥ
translated: As long as he does not go from one country to another on earth with joy.

original: atha tasya tadvacanam ākarṇya prahṛṣṭamanās tenaiva saha gurujanānujñātaḥ śubhe'hani deśāntaraṃ prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha tasya tat vacanam ākarṇya prahṛṣṭa manāḥ tena eva saha guru jana anujñātaḥ śubha ihani deśa antaram prasthitaḥ
translated: Then, having heard his words, with a delighted mind, with his permission, on an auspicious day, he set out for another country with him.

original: tatra ca dharmabuddhiprabhāveṇa bhramatā pāpabuddhinā prabhūtataraṃ vittam āsāditam /
analyzed: tatra ca dharmabuddhi prabhāveṇa bhramatā pāpabuddhinā prabhūtataram vittam āsāditam
translated: And there, by the power of Dharmabuddhi, while wandering, Pāpabuddhi obtained a large amount of wealth.

original: tataś ca tau dvāv api prabhūtopārjitadravyau prahṛṣṭau svagṛhaṃ praty autsukyena prasthitau / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tatas ca tau dvau api prabhūta upārjita dravyau prahṛṣṭau sva gṛham prati autsukyena prasthitau uktam ca
translated: And then, both of them, having earned a large amount of wealth, delighted, set out with eagerness for their own home. And it is said:

original: prāptavidyārthaśilpānāṃ deśāntaranivāsinām /
analyzed: prāpta vidyā artha śilpānām deśa antara nivāsinām
translated: For those who have obtained knowledge, wealth, and skills, and who reside in other countries,

original: krośamātro 'pi bhūbhāgaḥ śatayojanavad bhavet // ///
analyzed: krośa mātraḥ bhū bhāgaḥ śata yojana vat bhavet
translated: Even a distance of a mere one krośa (about 2 miles) would be like a hundred yojanas (about 800 miles).

original: atha svasthānasamīpavartinā pāpabuddhinā dharmabuddhir abhihitaḥbhadra /
analyzed: atha sva sthāna samīpa vartinā pāpabuddhinā dharmabuddhiḥ abhihitaḥ bhadra
translated: Then Pāpabuddhi, who was near his own place, said to Dharmabuddhi: My good friend,

original: na sarvam etad dhanaṃ gṛhaṃ prati netuṃ yujyate /
analyzed: na sarvam etat dhanam gṛham prati netum yujyate
translated: It is not proper to take all this wealth back to the house.

original: yataḥ kuṭumbino bāndhavāś ca prārthayiṣyante /
analyzed: yatas kuṭumbinaḥ bāndhavāḥ ca prārthayiṣyante
translated: Because relatives and kinsmen will make requests.

original: tad atraiva vanagahane kvāpi bhūmau nikṣipya kiñcin mātram ādāya gṛhaṃ praviśāvaḥ /
analyzed: tat atrā eva vana gahane kvāpi bhūmau nikṣipya kiñcid mātram ādāya gṛham praviśāvaḥ
translated: So let us deposit some of it in a certain place in this forest grove and take only a little and enter the house.

original: bhūyo 'pi prayojane sañjāte tanmātraṃ sametyāsmāt sthānān neṣyāvaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: bhūyas pi prayojane sañjāte tanmātram sametya asmāt sthānāt neṣyāvaḥ uktam ca
translated: And if the need arises again, we will meet there and take it from that place. It is said:

original: na vittaṃ darśayet prājñaḥ kasyacit svalpam apy aho /
analyzed: na vittam darśayet prājñaḥ kasyacid su alpam api aho
translated: A wise man should not show his wealth to anyone, even a little,

original: muner api yatas tasya darśanāc calate manaḥ // ///
analyzed: muneḥ api yatas tasya darśanāt calate manaḥ
translated: Because even a sage's mind wavers upon seeing it.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: yathāmiṣaṃ jale matsyair bhakṣyate śvāpadair bhuvi /
analyzed: yathā āmiṣam jale matsyaiḥ bhakṣyate śvāpadaiḥ bhuvi
translated: Just as fish are eaten by other fish in the water, by beasts on the ground,

original: ākāśe pakṣibhiś caiva tathā sarvatra vittavān // ///
analyzed: ākāśe pakṣibhiḥ ca eva tathā sarvatra vittavān
translated: And by birds in the sky, so is a wealthy man everywhere.

original: tad ākarṇya dharmabuddhir āhabhadra evaṃ kriyatām /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya dharmabuddhiḥ āha bhadraḥ evam kriyatām
translated: Hearing this, Dharmabuddhi said, My friend, let us do as you say.

original: tathānuṣṭhite dvāv api tau svagṛhaṃ gatvā sukhena saṃsthitavantau /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite dvau api tau sva gṛham gatvā sukhena saṃsthitavantau
translated: When this was done, the two of them went to their own homes and remained happily.

original: athānyasminn ahani pāpabuddhir niśīthe'ṭavyāṃ gatvā tat sarvaṃ vittaṃ samādāya gartaṃ pūrayitvā svabhavanaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: atha anyasmin ahani pāpa buddhiḥ niśītha iṭavyām gatvā tat sarvam vittam samādāya gartam pūrayitvā sva bhavanam jagāma
translated: Then on another day, Pāpabuddhi went to the forest at midnight, took all that wealth, filled up the pit, and went to his own house.

original: athānyedyur dharmabuddhiṃ sametya provācasakhe bahukuṭumbā vayaṃ vittābhāvāt sīdāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha anyedyus dharmabuddhim sametya provāca sakhe bahu kuṭumbāḥ vayam vitta abhāvāt sīdāmaḥ
translated: Then on another day, he met Dharmabuddhi and said, Friend, we have large families and are suffering from lack of wealth.

original: tad gatvā tatra sthāne kiṃcin mātraṃ dhanam ānayāvaḥ /🔽so 'bravītbhadra /
analyzed: tat gatvā tatra sthāne kiṃcid mātram dhanam ānayāvaḥ  saḥ bravīt bhadra
translated: So let us go to that place and bring back some wealth.

original: evaṃ kriyatām /
analyzed: evam kriyatām
translated: He said, My friend, let us do so.

original: atha dvāv api gatvā tat sthānaṃ yāvat khanatas tāvad riktaṃ bhāṇḍaṃ dṛṣṭavantau /
analyzed: atha dvau api gatvā tat sthānam yāvat khanataḥ tāvat riktam bhāṇḍam dṛṣṭavantau
translated: Then the two of them went and dug up the spot, and saw an empty pot.

original: atrāntare pāpabuddhiḥ śiras tāḍayan provācabho dharmabuddhe /
analyzed: atrā antare pāpa buddhiḥ śiraḥ tāḍayan provāca bho dharmabuddhe
translated: In the meantime, Evil-Mind, beating his head, said, Hey, Wise-Mind!

original: tvayā hṛtam etad dhanaṃ / nānyena /
analyzed: tvayā hṛtam etat dhanam na anyena
translated: You stole this money, not anyone else.

original: yato bhūyo 'pi gartāpūraṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yatas bhūyas garta āpūraṇam kṛtam
translated: Because you filled up the hole again.

original: tat prayaccha me tasyārdham /
analyzed: tat prayaccha me tasya ardham
translated: So give me half of it.

original: anyathāhaṃ rājakule nivedayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: anyathā aham rāja kule nivedayiṣyāmi
translated: Otherwise I will report it to the royal court.

original: sa āhabho durātman /
analyzed: saḥ āha bho durātman
translated: He said, Hey, evil-minded one!

original: mā maivaṃ vada /
analyzed: mā mā evam vada
translated: Don't say that.

original: dharmabuddhiḥ khalv aham /
analyzed: dharma buddhiḥ khalu aham
translated: I am Wise-Mind, after all.

original: naitac caurakarma karomi / uktaṃ ca🔽mātṛvat paradārāṇi paradravyāṇi loṣṭavat /
analyzed: na etat caura karma karomi uktam ca  mātṛ vat para dārāṇi para dravyāṇi loṣṭa vat
translated: I don't do such thievery. And it is said:🔽The wise regard others' wives as their mothers, others' wealth as clods of earth,

original: ātmavat sarvabhūtāni vīkṣante dharmabuddhayaḥ // ///
analyzed: ātma vat sarva bhūtāni vīkṣante dharma buddhayaḥ
translated: and all beings as themselves.

original: evaṃ dvāv api vivadamānau dharmādhikāriṇaṃ gatau /
analyzed: evam dvau api vivadamānau dharma adhikāriṇam gatau
translated: Thus, the two of them, arguing, went to the court of justice.

original: procatuś ca parasparaṃ dūṣayantau /
analyzed: procatuḥ ca parasparam dūṣayantau
translated: And they spoke, slandering each other.

original: atha dharmādhikaraṇādhiṣṭhitapuruṣair divyārthaṃ yāvan niyojitau tāvat pāpabuddhir āha
analyzed: atha dharma adhikaraṇa adhiṣṭhita puruṣaiḥ divya artham yāvat niyojitau tāvat pāpa buddhiḥ āha
translated: Then, when the officials of the court of justice were about to appoint them for a divine purpose, Evil-Mind said:

original: aho na samyagdṛṣṭo nyāyaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: aho na samyak dṛṣṭaḥ nyāyaḥ uktam ca
translated: Oh, justice is not seen properly. And it is said:

original: vivāde anviṣyate patraṃ tadabhāve'pi sākṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: vivāde anviṣyate patram tad abhāve pi sākṣiṇaḥ
translated: In a dispute, a written document is sought; in its absence, witnesses.

original: sākṣy abhāvāt tato divyaṃ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ // ///
analyzed: sākṣī abhāvāt tatas divyam pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: In the absence of witnesses, the wise prescribe ordeals.

original: tad atra viṣaye mama vṛkṣadevatāḥ sākṣibhūtās tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tat atra viṣaye mama vṛkṣa devatāḥ sākṣi bhūtāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: In this matter, the tree deities are my witnesses.

original: tā apy āvayor ekataraṃ cauraṃ sādhuṃ vā kariṣyanti /
analyzed: tāḥ api āvayoḥ ekataram cauram sādhum vā kariṣyanti
translated: They will also make one of us a thief or a good man.

original: atha taiḥ sarvair abhihitambho yuktam uktaṃ bhavatā / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atha taiḥ sarvaiḥ yuktam uktam bhavatā uktam ca
translated: Then they all said, Oh, you have spoken rightly. And it is said:

original: antyajo 'pi yadā sākṣī vivāde samprajāyate /
analyzed: antyajaḥ pi yadā sākṣī vivāde samprajāyate
translated: Even if an outcaste becomes a witness in a dispute,

original: na tatra yujyate divyaṃ kiṃ punar vanadevatāḥ // ///
analyzed: na tatra yujyate divyam kim punar vana devatāḥ
translated: then an ordeal is not appropriate there, let alone forest deities.

original: tad asmākam apy atra viṣaye mahat kautūhalam vartate /
analyzed: tat asmākam api atra viṣaye mahat kautūhalam vartate
translated: In this matter, we also have great curiosity.

original: pratyūṣasamaye yuvābhyām apy asmābhiḥ saha tatra vanoddeśe gantavyam iti /
analyzed: pratyūṣa samaye yuvābhyām api asmābhiḥ saha tatra vana uddeśe gantavyam iti
translated: In the morning, you two should also go with us to that forest region.

original: etasminn antare pāpabuddhiḥ svagṛhaṃ gatvā svajanakam uvācatāta /
analyzed: etasmin antare pāpa buddhiḥ sva gṛham gatvā sva janakam uvāca tāta
translated: In the meantime, Pāpabuddhi went home and said to his father, Father,

original: prabhūto 'yaṃ mayārtho dharmabuddheś coritaḥ /
analyzed: prabhūtaḥ yam mayā arthaḥ dharmabuddheḥ coritaḥ
translated: I have stolen a large amount of wealth from Dharmabuddhi.

original: sa ca tava vacanena pariṇatiṃ gacchati /
analyzed: sa ca tava vacanena pariṇatim gacchati
translated: And it is transformed by your words.

original: anyathāsmākaṃ prāṇaiḥ saha yāsyati /
analyzed: anyathā asmākam prāṇaiḥ saha yāsyati
translated: Otherwise, it will go with our lives.

original: sa āhavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ āhavat sa
translated: He said, Son,

original: drutaṃ vada yena procya tad dravyaṃ sthiratāṃ nayāmi /🔽pāpabuddhir āhatāta /
analyzed: drutam vada yena procya tat dravyam sthira tām nayāmi  pāpa buddhiḥ āha tāta
translated: Speak quickly so that I can tell them and make the money stable.

original: asti tatpradeśe mahāśamī /
analyzed: asti tad pradeśe mahā śamī
translated: Evil Mind said, Father, there is a large shami tree in that area.

original: tasyāṃ mahat koṭaram asti /
analyzed: tasyām mahat koṭaram asti
translated: In it there is a large hollow.

original: tatra tvaṃ sāṃpratam eva praviśa /
analyzed: tatra tvam sāṃpratam eva praviśa
translated: You should enter it right now.

original: tataḥ prabhāte yadāhaṃ satyaśrāvaṇaṃ karomi /
analyzed: tatas prabhāte yadā aham satya śrāvaṇam karomi
translated: Then when I perform the hearing of the truth in the morning,

original: tadā tvayā vācyaṃ yad dharmabuddhiś caura iti /
analyzed: tadā tvayā vācyam yat dharmabuddhiḥ cauraḥ iti
translated: you should say that Dharma Mind is a thief.

original: tathānuṣṭhite pratyūṣe snātvā pāpabuddhiḥ dharmabuddhipuraḥsaro dharmādhikaraṇakaiḥ saha tāṃ śamīm abhyetya tārasvareṇa provāca /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite pratyūṣe snātvā pāpabuddhiḥ dharma buddhi puraḥsaraḥ dharma adhikaraṇakaiḥ saha tām śamīm abhyetya tāra svareṇa provāca
translated: When that was done, in the morning, after bathing, Evil Mind, with Dharma Mind in front, together with those in the court of justice, approached the shami tree and said in a loud voice,

original: ādityacandrāv anilo 'nalaś ca
analyzed: āditya candrau anilaḥ nalaḥ ca
translated: The sun, the moon, the wind, the fire,

original: dyaur bhūmir āpo hṛdayaṃ yamaś ca /
analyzed: dyauḥ bhūmiḥ āpaḥ hṛdayam yamaḥ ca
translated: the sky, the earth, the waters, the heart, and Yama,

original: ahaś ca rātriś ca ubhe ca sandhye
analyzed: ahar ca rātriḥ ca ubhe ca sandhye
translated: the day, the night, and the two twilights,

original: dharmo hi jānāti narasya vṛttam // ///
analyzed: dharmaḥ hi jānāti narasya vṛttam
translated: Dharma indeed knows a man's conduct.

original: bhagavati vanadevate /
analyzed: bhagavati vana devate
translated: O revered forest deity,

original: āvayor madhye yaś caura tat kathayata /🔽atha pāpabuddhipitā śamīkoṭarasthaḥ provācabho /
analyzed: āvayoḥ madhye yaḥ caura tat kathayata  atha pāpabuddhi pitā śamī koṭara sthaḥ provāca bho
translated: tell us which of us two is the thief.

original: dharmabuddhinā hṛtam etad dhanam /
analyzed: dharmabuddhinā hṛtam etat dhanam
translated: Then the father of Evil Mind, who was in the hollow of the shami tree, said, Gentlemen, this wealth was taken by Dharma Mind.

original: tad ākarṇya sarve te rājapuruṣā vismayotphullalocanā yāvad dharmabuddher vittaharaṇocitaṃ
analyzed: tat ākarṇya sarve te rāja puruṣāḥ vismaya utphulla locanāḥ yāvat dharmabuddheḥ vitta haraṇa ucitam
translated: Hearing that, all those royal officers, their eyes wide with wonder, took away Dharmabuddhi's wealth, which was fit to be confiscated,

original: nigrahaṃ śāstradṛṣṭyāvalokayanti tāvad dharmabuddhinā tac chamīkoṭaraṃ vahnibhojyadravyaiḥ
analyzed: nigraham śāstra dṛṣṭyā avalokayanti tāvat dharmabuddhinā tat śamī koṭaram vahni bhojya dravyaiḥ
translated: Hearing this, all those royal officers, their eyes wide with wonder, while they were looking at the punishment befitting the confiscation of Dharmabuddhi's wealth from the point of view of the scriptures, Dharmabuddhi surrounded that hollow of the shami tree with combustible materials

original: pariveṣṭya vahninā sandīpitam /
analyzed: pariveṣṭya vahninā sandīpitam
translated: and set it on fire.

original: atha jvalati tasmin śamīkoṭare'rdhadagdhaśarīraḥ sphuṭitekṣaṇaḥ karuṇaṃ paridevayan pāpabuddhipitā niścakrāma /
analyzed: atha jvalati tasmin śamī koṭara īrdha dagdha śarīraḥ sphuṭita īkṣaṇaḥ karuṇam paridevayan pāpa buddhi pitā niścakrāma
translated: Then, when that hollow of the shami tree was burning, Papabuddhi's father, with half his body burned and his eyes bursting, came out wailing piteously.

original: tataś ca taiḥ sarvaiḥ pṛṣṭaḥbho kim idam /
analyzed: tatas ca taiḥ sarvaiḥ pṛṣṭaḥ bho kim idam
translated: Then he was asked by all of them, Hey, what is this?

original: ity ukte idaṃ sarvaṃ kukṛtyaṃ pāpabuddheḥ kāraṇāj jātam ity uktvā mṛtaḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte idam sarvam kukṛtyam pāpa buddheḥ kāraṇāt jātam iti uktvā mṛtaḥ
translated: When this was said, he said, All this evil deed happened because of Papabuddhi, and died.

original: tatas te rājapuruṣāḥ pāpabuddhiṃ śamīśākhāyāṃ pratilambya dharmabuddhiṃ praśaṃsyedam ūcuḥ
analyzed: tatas te rāja puruṣāḥ pāpa buddhim śamī śākhāyām pratilambya dharma buddhim praśaṃsya idam ūcuḥ
translated: Then those royal officers, hanging Papabuddhi from a branch of the shami tree, praising Dharmabuddhi, said this

original: aho sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: aho sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Oh, this is well said:

original: upāyaṃ cintayet prājñas tathāpāyam api cintayet /
analyzed: upāyam cintayet prājñaḥ tathā apāyam api cintayet
translated: The wise one should think of a means, and also think of a danger.

original: paśyato bakamūrkhasya nakulair bhakṣitāḥ sutāḥ // ///
analyzed: paśyataḥ baka mūrkhasya nakulaiḥ bhakṣitāḥ sutāḥ
translated: While the foolish crane was watching, his sons were eaten by mongooses.

original: dharmabuddhiḥ prāhakatham etat /
analyzed: dharmabuddhiḥ prāha katham etat
translated: Dharmabuddhi said, How is this?

original: te procuḥ
analyzed: te procuḥ
translated: They said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: jīrṇadhananāmavaṇikputrakathā
analyzed: jīrṇa dhana nāma vaṇij putra kathā
translated: The Story of the Merchant's Son Named Jīrṇadhana

original: asti kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe bahubakasanātho vaṭapādapaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe bahu baka sanāthaḥ vaṭa pādapaḥ
translated: In a certain forest region, there was a banyan tree inhabited by many cranes.

original: tasya koṭare kṛṣṇasarpaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tasya koṭare kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In its hollow lived a black cobra.

original: sa ca bakabālakān ajātapakṣān api sadaiva bhakṣayan kālaṃ nayati /
analyzed: sa ca baka bālakān ajāta pakṣān api sadā eva bhakṣayan kālam nayati
translated: And he always spent his time devouring the crane chicks, even those with unfledged wings.

original: athaiko bakas tena bhakṣitāny apatyāni dṛṣṭvā śiśuvairāgyāt sarastīram āsādya bāṣpapūraitanayano 'dhomukhas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: athā ekaḥ bakaḥ tena bhakṣitāni apatyāni dṛṣṭvā śiśu vairāgyāt saraḥ tīram āsādya bāṣpa pūra eta nayanaḥ dhomukhaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Then one crane, seeing his young ones eaten by the snake, out of childlike dispassion, reached the bank of a lake and stood with his eyes filled with tears, his face downcast.

original: taṃ ca tādṛkceṣṭitam avalokya kulīrakaḥ provācamāma kim evaṃ rudyate bhavatādya /
analyzed: tam ca tādṛś ceṣṭitam avalokya kulīrakaḥ kim evam rudyate bhavatā adya
translated: And seeing him acting like that, the owl said, Why are you crying like this today?

original: sa āhabhadra kiṃ karomi /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhadra kim karomi
translated: He said, Good sir, what can I do?

original: mama mandabhāgyasya bālakāḥ koṭaranivāsinā sarpeṇa bhakṣitāḥ /
analyzed: mama mandabhāgyasya bālakāḥ koṭara nivāsinā sarpeṇa bhakṣitāḥ
translated: My unfortunate young ones have been eaten by a snake living in a hollow.

original: tadduḥkhaduḥkhito 'haṃ rodimi /
analyzed: tad duḥkha duḥkhitaḥ ham rodimi
translated: I am crying out of sorrow for that grief.

original: tat kathaya me yady asti kaścid upāyas tadvināśāya /🔽tad ākarṇya kulīrakaś cintayāmāsaayaṃ tāvad asmatsahajavairī /
analyzed: tat kathaya me yadi asti kaścid upāyaḥ tad vināśāya 🔽tat ākarṇya kulīrakaḥ cintayāmāsa ayam tāvat asmad sahaja vairī
translated: So tell me if there is any means to destroy it.🔽Hearing that, the owl thought, This is indeed my natural enemy.

original: tathopadeśaṃ prayacchāmi satyānṛtaṃ yathānye'pi bakāḥ sarve saṅkṣayam āyānti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā upadeśam prayacchāmi satya anṛtam yathā anye api bakāḥ sarve saṅkṣayam āyānti uktam ca
translated: I will give such advice that all the other cranes will be destroyed. And it is said:

original: navanītasamāṃ vāṇīṃ kṛtvā cittaṃ tu nirdayam /
analyzed: navanīta samām vāṇīm kṛtvā cittam tu nirdayam
translated: Having made a speech like fresh butter, and having made the mind merciless,

original: tathā prabodhyate śatruḥ sānvayo mriyate yathā // ///
analyzed: tathā prabodhyate śatruḥ sa anvayaḥ mriyate yathā
translated: The enemy is thus awakened, so that he and his relatives die.

original: āha camāma / yady evaṃ tan matsyamāṃsakhaṇḍāni nakulasya biladvārāt sarpakoṭaraṃ yāvat prakṣipa yathā nakulas tanmārgeṇa gatvā taṃ duṣṭasarpaṃ 🔽vināśayati /
analyzed: āha camāma yadi evam tat matsya māṃsa khaṇḍāni nakulasya bila dvārāt sarpa koṭaram yāvat prakṣipa yathā nakulaḥ tad mārgeṇa gatvā tam duṣṭa sarpam  vināśayati
translated: And he said: If so, then throw pieces of fish meat from the mongoose's hole to the snake's hole, so that the mongoose will go by that path and destroy that evil snake.

original: atha tathānuṣṭhite matsyamāṃsānusāriṇā nakulena taṃ kṛṣṇasarpaṃ nihatya te'pi tadvṛkṣāśrayāḥ sarve bakāś ca śanaiḥ śanair bhakṣitāḥ /
analyzed: atha tathā anuṣṭhite matsya māṃsa anusāriṇā nakulena tam kṛṣṇa sarpam nihatya te api tad vṛkṣa āśrayāḥ sarve bakāḥ ca śanais śanais bhakṣitāḥ
translated: And when that was done, the mongoose, following the fish meat, killed that black snake, and those cranes who lived in that tree also gradually ate all the other cranes.

original: ato vayaṃ brūmaḥupāyaṃ cintayed iti /
analyzed: atas vayam brūmaḥ upāyam cintayet iti
translated: Therefore we say: One should think of a means.

original: evaṃ mūḍha / tvayāpy apāyaś cintito nopāyaḥ pāpabuddhivat /
analyzed: evam mūḍha tvayā api apāyaḥ cintitaḥ na upāyaḥ pāpa buddhi vat
translated: Thus, fool, you have thought of a calamity, not a means, like one with an evil mind.

original: tan na bhavasi tvaṃ sajjanaḥ /
analyzed: tat na bhavasi tvam sat janaḥ
translated: Therefore, you are not a good person.

original: kevalaṃ pāpabuddhir asi /
analyzed: kevalam pāpa buddhiḥ asi
translated: You are simply one with an evil mind.

original: jñāto mayā svāminaḥ prāṇasandehānayanāt /
analyzed: jñātaḥ mayā svāminaḥ prāṇa sandeha ānayanāt
translated: I know you from causing doubt about my master's life.

original: prakaṭīkṛtaṃ tvayā svayam evātmano duṣṭatvaṃ kauṭilyaṃ ca /
analyzed: prakaṭīkṛtam tvayā svayam evā ātmanaḥ duṣṭa tvam kauṭilyam ca
translated: You yourself have revealed your wickedness and crookedness.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: yatnād api kaḥ paśyec chikhinām āhāraniḥsaraṇamārgam /
analyzed: yatnāt api kaḥ paśyet śikhinām āhāra niḥsaraṇa mārgam
translated: Who would even try to see the path of the peacocks' food and exit?

original: yadi jaladadhvanimuditās ta eva mūḍhā na nṛtyeyuḥ // ///
analyzed: yadi jalada dhvani muditāḥ te eva mūḍhāḥ na nṛtyeyuḥ
translated: If those very foolish ones do not dance delighted by the sound of clouds...

original: yadi tvaṃ svāminam enāṃ daśāṃ nayasi tad asmadvidhasya kā gaṇanā /
analyzed: yadi tvam svāminam enām daśām nayasi tat asmadvidhasya kā gaṇanā
translated: If you lead your master to this state, then what to speak of someone like me?

original: tasmān mamāsannena bhavatā na bhāvyam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tasmāt mama āsannena bhavatā na bhāvyam uktam ca
translated: Therefore, you should not be close to me. And it is said:

original: tulāṃ lohasahasrasya yatra khādanti mūṣakāḥ /
analyzed: tulām loha sahasrasya yatra khādanti mūṣakāḥ
translated: Where rats eat up a thousand pounds on the scale,

original: rājaṃs tatra harec chyeno bālakaṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ // ///
analyzed: rājan tatra haret śyenaḥ bālakam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: O king, there the hawk will surely carry off the young one...

original: damanaka āhakatham etat /
analyzed: damanakaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Damanaka said: How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: jīrṇadhananāmavaṇikputrakathā
analyzed: jīrṇa dhana nāma vaṇij putra kathā
translated: The Story of the Merchant's Son Named Jīrṇadhana

original: asti kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne jīrṇadhano nāma vaṇikputraḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne jīrṇadhanaḥ nāma vaṇij putraḥ
translated: In a certain town there was a merchant's son named Jīrṇadhana.

original: sa ca dravyakṣayād deśāntaragamanamanā vyacintayat
analyzed: sa ca dravya kṣayāt deśa antara gamana manāḥ vyacintayat
translated: And due to the loss of wealth, he thought of going to another country:

original: yatra deśe atha vā sthāne bhogān bhuktvā svavīryataḥ /
analyzed: yatra deśe atha vā sthāne bhogān bhuktvā sva vīryataḥ
translated: In whatever country or place, having enjoyed pleasures through one's own valor,

original: tasmin vibhavahīno yo vaset sa puruṣādhamaḥ // ///
analyzed: tasmin vibhava hīnaḥ yaḥ vaset sa puruṣa adhamaḥ
translated: that man who lives there without wealth is the lowest of men.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: yenāhaṃkārayuktena ciraṃ vilasitaṃ purā /
analyzed: yena ahaṃkāra yuktena ciram vilasitam purā
translated: By whom, full of pride, I sported for a long time in the past.

original: dīnaṃ vadati tatraiva yaḥ pareṣāṃ sa ninditaḥ // ///
analyzed: dīnam vadati tatra eva yaḥ pareṣām sa ninditaḥ
translated: He who speaks humbly to others there alone is condemned.

original: tasya ca gṛhe sahasralohabhāraghaṭitā pūrvapuruṣopārjitā tulāsīt /
analyzed: tasya ca gṛhe sahasra loha bhāra ghaṭitā pūrva puruṣa upārjitā tulā āsīt
translated: And in his house there was a balance made of a thousand pounds of iron, earned by his ancestors.

original: tāṃ ca kasyacid chreṣṭino gṛhe nikṣepabhūtāṃ kṛtvā deśāntaraṃ prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tām ca kasyacid śreṣṭinaḥ gṛhe nikṣepa bhūtām kṛtvā deśa antaram prasthitaḥ
translated: And having deposited it as a pledge in the house of a certain merchant, he set out for another country.

original: tataḥ suciraṃ kālaṃ deśāntaraṃ yathecchayā bhrāntvā punaḥ svapuram āgatya taṃ śreṣṭhinam uvācabhoḥ śreṣṭhin /
analyzed: tatas su ciram kālam deśa antaram yathā icchayā bhrāntvā punar sva puram āgatya tam śreṣṭhinam uvāca bhoḥ śreṣṭhin
translated: Then, having wandered for a very long time in other countries as he wished, he returned to his own city and said to that merchant, O merchant!

original: dīyatāṃ me sā nikṣepatulā /
analyzed: dīyatām me sā nikṣepa tulā
translated: Give me that balance which was deposited.

original: sa āhabho / nāsti sā tvadīyā tulā /
analyzed: saḥ āha bho na asti sā tvadīyā tulā
translated: He said, O! That balance of yours does not exist.

original: mūṣikair bhakṣitā /
analyzed: mūṣikaiḥ bhakṣitā
translated: It was eaten by mice.

original: jīrṇadhana āhabhoḥ śreṣṭhin /
analyzed: jīrṇa dhanaḥ āhabhoḥ śreṣṭhin
translated: The old man said, O merchant!

original: nāsti doṣas te yadi mūṣikair bhakṣiteti /
analyzed: na asti doṣaḥ te yadi mūṣikaiḥ bhakṣitā iti
translated: There is no fault on your part if it was eaten by mice.

original: īdṛg evāyaṃ saṃsāraḥ /
analyzed: īdṛś eva ayam saṃsāraḥ
translated: This world is just like that.

original: na kiṃcid atra śāśvatam asti /
analyzed: na kiṃcid atra śāśvatam asti
translated: There is nothing permanent here at all.

original: param ahaṃ nadyāṃ snānārthaṃ gamiṣyāmi /
analyzed: param aham nadyām snāna artham gamiṣyāmi
translated: But I will go to the river to bathe.

original: tat tvam ātmīyaṃ śiśum enaṃ dhanadevanāmānaṃ mayā saha snānopakaraṇahastaṃ preṣayeti /
analyzed: tat tvam ātmīyam śiśum enam dhanadeva nāmānam mayā saha snāna upakaraṇa hastam preṣaya iti
translated: Therefore, you send that son of yours named Dhanadeva with me, holding the bathing equipment.

original: so 'pi cauryabhayāt tasya śaṅkitaḥ svaputram uvācavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ pi caurya bhayāt tasya śaṅkitaḥ sva putram uvāca vatsa
translated: He, too, out of fear of being caught, suspected the boy and said to him, My dear,

original: pitṛvyo 'yaṃ tava snānārthaṃ nadyāṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: pitṛvyaḥ yam tava snāna artham nadyām yāsyati
translated: this is your uncle. He is going to the river to bathe.

original: tad gamyatām anena sārdhaṃ snānopakaraṇam ādāyeti /
analyzed: tat gamyatām anena sārdham snāna upakaraṇam ādāya iti
translated: So go with him, taking the bathing requisites.

original: aho sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: aho sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Ah, this is well said:

original: na bhaktyā kasyacit ko 'pi priyaṃ prakurute naraḥ /
analyzed: na bhaktyā kasyacid kaḥ pi priyam prakurute naraḥ
translated: No man does a favor to anyone out of affection,

original: muktvā bhayaṃ pralobhaṃ vā kāryakāraṇam eva vā // ///
analyzed: muktvā bhayam pralobham vā kārya kāraṇam eva vā
translated: except out of fear, temptation, or cause and effect.

original: tathā ca🔽atyādaro bhaved yatra kāryakāraṇavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca  atyādaraḥ bhavet yatra kārya kāraṇa varjitaḥ
translated: And so:🔽Where there is excessive favor, devoid of cause and effect,

original: tatra śaṅkā prakartavyā pariṇāme'sukhāvahā // ///🔽athāsau vaṇikśiśuḥ snānopakaraṇam ādāya prahṛṣṭamanās tenābhyāgatena saha prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatra śaṅkā prakartavyā pariṇāme sukha āvahā  atha asau vaṇij śiśuḥ snāna upakaraṇam ādāya prahṛṣṭa manāḥ tena abhyāgatena saha prasthitaḥ
translated: there suspicion should be aroused, leading to unhappiness in the end.🔽Then the merchant's boy, taking the bathing requisites, set out with him in a joyful mood.

original: tathānuṣṭhite vaṇik snātvā taṃ śiśuṃ nadīguhāyāṃ prakṣipya taddvāraṃ bṛhacchilayācchādya satvaraṃ gṛham āgataḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite vaṇij snātvā tam śiśum nadī guhāyām prakṣipya tat dvāram bṛhat śilayā ācchādya sa tvaram gṛham āgataḥ
translated: When that was done, the merchant bathed and threw the boy into a cave in the river, covered the entrance with a large stone, and quickly returned home.

original: pṛṣṭaś ca tena vaṇijābho 'bhyāgata tat kathyatāṃ kutra me śiśur yas tvayā saha nadīṃ gataḥ iti /
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ ca tena vaṇija ābhaḥ bhyāgata tat kathyatām kutra me śiśuḥ yaḥ tvayā saha nadīm gataḥ iti
translated: And when asked by the merchant, Where is the boy you went to the river with? he said, I don't know.

original: sa āhanadītaṭāt sa śyenena hṛta iti /
analyzed: saḥ āhanadī taṭāt sa śyenena hṛtaḥ iti
translated: He said, “He was carried off by a hawk from the riverbank.”

original: śreṣṭhy āhamithyāvādin /
analyzed: śreṣṭhī āha mithyā vādin
translated: The merchant said, “You’re a liar!

original: kiṃ kvacic chyeno bālaṃ hartuṃ śaknoti /
analyzed: kim kvacid śyenaḥ bālam hartum śaknoti
translated: Can a hawk anywhere carry off a child?

original: tat samarpaya me sutam /
analyzed: tat samarpaya me sutam
translated: Give me back my son.

original: anyathā rājakule nivedayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: anyathā rāja kule nivedayiṣyāmi iti
translated: Otherwise I’ll report you to the royal court.”

original: sa āhabhoḥ satyavādin /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhoḥ satya vādin
translated: He said, “Sir, you’re the liar!

original: yathā śyeno bālaṃ na nayati tathā mūṣikā api lohabhāraghaṭitāṃ tulāṃ na bhakṣayanti /
analyzed: yathā śyenaḥ bālam na nayati tathā mūṣikāḥ api loha bhāra ghaṭitām tulām na bhakṣayanti
translated: Just as a hawk can’t carry off a child, so mice can’t eat a scale that’s been weighed down with iron.

original: tad arpaya me tulāṃ yadi dārakeṇa prayojanam /
analyzed: tat arpaya me tulām yadi dārakeṇa prayojanam
translated: Give me back the scale if you want the child.”

original: evaṃ vivadamānau dvāv api rājakulaṃ gatau /
analyzed: evam vivadamānau dvau api rāja kulam gatau
translated: Arguing in this way, they both went to the royal court.

original: tatra śreṣṭhī tārasvareṇa provācabho 'brahmaṇyam abrahmaṇyam /
analyzed: tatra śreṣṭhī tāra svareṇa provāca bho brahmaṇyam a brahmaṇyam
translated: There the merchant shouted in a loud voice, “Shame! Shame!

original: mama śiśur anena caureṇāpahṛtaḥ /
analyzed: mama śiśuḥ anena caureṇa apahṛtaḥ
translated: This thief has carried off my child.”

original: atha dharmādhikāriṇas tam ūcuḥbhoḥ samarpyatāṃ śreṣṭhisutaḥ /
analyzed: atha dharma adhikāriṇaḥ tam ūcuḥ bhoḥ samarpyatām śreṣṭhi sutaḥ
translated: Then the judges said to him, “Sir, give back the merchant’s son.”

original: sa āhakiṃ karomi /
analyzed: saḥ āha kim karomi
translated: He said, “What can I do?

original: paśyato me nadītaṭāc chyenenāpahṛtaḥ śiśuḥ /
analyzed: paśyataḥ me nadī taṭāt śyenena apahṛtaḥ śiśuḥ
translated: While I was watching, a hawk carried off my child from the riverbank.”

original: tac chrutvā te procuḥbho na satyam abhihitaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: tat śrutvā te procuḥ bho na satyam abhihitam bhavatā
translated: Hearing this, they said, “Sir, you’re not telling the truth.

original: kiṃ śyenaḥ śiśuṃ hartuṃ samartho bhavati /
analyzed: kim śyenaḥ śiśum hartum samarthaḥ bhavati
translated: Can a hawk carry off a child?”

original: sa āhabho bhoḥ śrūyatāṃ madvacaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha bho bhoḥ śrūyatām mad vacaḥ
translated: He said, Listen, gentlemen, to my words.

original: tulāṃ lohasahasrasya yatra khādanti mūṣikāḥ /
analyzed: tulām loha sahasrasya yatra khādanti mūṣikāḥ
translated: Where mice eat up a thousand pounds of iron on a scale,

original: rājaṃs tatra harec chyeno bālakaṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ // ///
analyzed: rājan tatra haret śyenaḥ bālakam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: there, Your Majesty, a hawk will surely carry off a child.

original: te procuḥkatham etat /
analyzed: te procuḥ katham etat
translated: They asked, How is that?

original: tataḥ śreṣṭhī sabhyānām agre sarvaṃ vṛttāntaṃ nivedayāmāsa /
analyzed: tatas śreṣṭhī sabhyānām agre sarvam vṛttāntam nivedayāmāsa
translated: Then the merchant related the whole story in front of the assembly.

original: tatas tair vihasya dvāv api tau parasparaṃ sambodhya tulāśiśupradānena santoṣitau /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ vihasya dvau api tau parasparam sambodhya tulā śiśu pradānena santoṣitau
translated: Then they laughed and reconciled the two, satisfying them with the gift of a balance and a child.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmitulāṃ lohasahasrasya iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi itulām loha sahasrasya iti
translated: Therefore I say, Where mice eat up a thousand pounds of iron on a scale...

original: tan mūrkha / sañjīvakaprasādam asahamānena tvayaitat kṛtam /
analyzed: tat mūrkha sañjīvaka prasādam a sahamānena tvayā etat kṛtam
translated: So, fool, this was done by you, unable to bear the favor shown to Sañjīvaka.

original: aho sādhv idam ucyate🔽prāyeṇātra kulānvitaṃ kukulajāḥ śrīvallabhaṃ durbhagā
analyzed: aho sādhu idam ucyate  prāyeṇa atra kula anvitam ku kula jāḥ śrīvallabham durbhagā
translated: Ah, this is well said:🔽The unfortunate, born in low families, always hate the virtuous, born in noble families, the beloved of Lakshmi.

original: dātāraṃ kṛpaṇā ṛjūn anṛjavo vitte sthitaṃ nirdhanāḥ /
analyzed: dātāram kṛpaṇāḥ ṛjūn anṛjavaḥ vitte sthitam nirdhanāḥ
translated: The miserly hate the generous, the crooked hate the honest, the poor hate the rich.

original: vairūpyopahṛtāś ca kāntavapuṣaṃ dharmāśrayaṃ pāpino
analyzed: vairūpya upahṛtāḥ ca kānta vapuṣam dharma āśrayam
translated: The sinful hate the righteous, the ugly hate the handsome.

original: nānāśāstravicakṣaṇaṃ ca puruṣaṃ nindanti mūrkhāḥ sadā // ///
analyzed: nānā śāstra vicakṣaṇam ca puruṣam nindanti mūrkhāḥ sadā
translated: The fools always hate the wise, who are skilled in various scriptures.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: mūrkhāṇāṃ paṇḍitā dveṣyā nirdhanānāṃ mahādhanāḥ /
analyzed: mūrkhāṇām paṇḍitāḥ dveṣyāḥ nirdhanānām mahādhanāḥ
translated: The wise are hated by fools, the very rich by the poor,

original: vratinaḥ pāpaśīlānām asatīnāṃ kulastriyaḥ // ///
