analyzed: atrā antare tvayā darbha maya bandhana veṣṭanāni khaṇḍanīyāni yena asau mantharakaḥ drutataram palvalam praviśati
translated: In the meantime, you should break the bonds of darbha grass, so that Slow-Mo can quickly enter the pond.

original: citrāṅgaḥ prāhabho bhadro 'yaṃ dṛṣṭo mantras tvayā /
analyzed: citrāṅgaḥ prāha bho bhadraḥ yam dṛṣṭaḥ mantraḥ tvayā
translated: Citrāṅga said, Oh, you have seen this good mantra.

original: nūnaṃ mantharako mukto mantavyaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: nūnam mantharakaḥ muktaḥ mantavyaḥ uktam ca
translated: Surely Slow-Mo must be released. And it is said:

original: siddhiṃ vā yadi vāsiddhiṃ cittotsāho nivedayet /
analyzed: siddhim vā yadi vā asiddhim citta utsāhaḥ nivedayet
translated: Whether it is success or failure, enthusiasm of mind should be shown.

original: prathamaṃ sarvajantūnāṃ prājño vetti na cetaraḥ // ///
analyzed: prathamam sarva jantūnām prājñaḥ vetti na ca itaraḥ
translated: The wise one knows first among all beings, not the other.

original: tat tad evaṃ kriyatām /
analyzed: tat tat evam kriyatām
translated: So let it be done in that way.

original: tathānuṣṭhite sa lubdhakas tathaiva mārgāsannapalvalatīrasthaṃ citrāṅgaṃ vāyasasanātham adrākṣīt /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite sa lubdhakaḥ tathā eva mārga āsanna palvala tīra stham citrāṅgam vāyasa sanātham adrākṣīt
translated: When that was done, the hunter saw Citrāṅga in the same way, on the bank of the pond near the path, with a crow.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā harṣitamanā vyacintayat /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā harṣita manāḥ vyacintayat
translated: Seeing him, with a delighted mind he thought:

original: nūnaṃ pāśavedanayā varāko 'yaṃ mṛgo gatvāyuḥśeṣajīvitaḥ pāśaṃ troṭayitvā katham apy etad vanāntaraṃ praviṣṭo yāvan mṛtaḥ /
analyzed: nūnam pāśa vedanayā varākaḥ yam mṛgaḥ gatvā āyuḥ śeṣa jīvitaḥ pāśam troṭayitvā katham api etat vana antaram praviṣṭaḥ yāvat mṛtaḥ
translated: Surely this poor deer, having gone through the pain of the noose, with the remaining life, having torn the noose, somehow entered this forest and died.

original: tad vaśyo 'yaṃ me kacchapaḥ suyantritatvāt /
analyzed: tat vaśyaḥ yam me kacchapaḥ su yantrita tvāt
translated: So this tortoise of mine is under my control, because it is well-bound.

original: tad enam api tāvad gṛhṇāmīty avardhāya kacchapaṃ bhūtale prakṣipya mṛgam upādravat /
analyzed: tat enam api tāvat gṛhṇāmi iti avardhāya kacchapam bhū tale prakṣipya mṛgam upādravat
translated: I will catch him too.’ And he let the tortoise go, threw it on the ground, and ran after the deer.

original: atrāntare hiraṇyakena vajropamadaṃṣṭrāprahāreṇa tad darbhaveṣṭanaṃ tatkṣaṇāt khaṇḍaśaḥ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: atrā antare hiraṇyakena vajra upama daṃṣṭrā prahāreṇa tat darbha veṣṭanam tad kṣaṇāt khaṇḍaśas kṛtam
translated: In the meantime, with a blow of his diamond-hard teeth, Hiranyaka instantly broke the grass-rope into pieces.

original: mantharako 'pi tṛṇamadhyān niṣkramya palvalaṃ praviṣṭaḥ /🔽citrāṅgo 'py aprāptasyāpi tasyotthāya vāyasena saha drutaṃ pranaṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: mantharakaḥ pi tṛṇa madhyāt niṣkramya palvalam praviṣṭaḥ  citrāṅgaḥ pi aprāptasya api tasya utthāya vāyasena saha drutam pranaṣṭaḥ
translated: And Slow-Mo came out from the grass and entered the pond.🔽And Colorful, though he had not yet arrived, got up and quickly disappeared with the crow.

original: atrāntare vilakṣo viṣādaparo nivṛtto lubdhako yāvat paśyati tāvat kacchapo 'pi gataḥ /
analyzed: atra antare vilakṣaḥ viṣāda paraḥ nivṛttaḥ lubdhakaḥ yāvat paśyati tāvat kacchapaḥ pi gataḥ
translated: In the meantime, the hunter, embarrassed and dejected, turned back. When he looked, the tortoise was gone too.

original: tataś ca tatropaviśyemaṃ ślokam apaṭhat
analyzed: tatas ca tatra upaviśya imam ślokam apaṭhat
translated: Then he sat down there and recited this verse:

original: prāpto bandhanam apy ayaṃ gurumṛgas tāvat tvayā me hṛtaḥ
analyzed: prāptaḥ bandhanam api ayam guru mṛgaḥ tāvat tvayā me hṛtaḥ
translated: ‘This great deer has been caught and you have taken him away from me.

original: samprāptaḥ kamaṭhaḥ sa cāpi niyataṃ naṣṭas tavādeśataḥ /
analyzed: samprāptaḥ kamaṭhaḥ sa ca api niyatam naṣṭaḥ tava ādeśataḥ
translated: And the tortoise has certainly been lost on your orders.

original: kṣutkṣāmo 'tra vane bhramāmi śiśukais tyaktaḥ samaṃ bhāryayā
analyzed: kṣudh kṣāmaḥ u tra vane bhramāmi śiśukaiḥ tyaktaḥ samam bhāryayā
translated: Emaciated with hunger, I wander in this forest, abandoned by my children and my wife.

original: yac cānyan na kṛtaṃ kṛtānta kurute tac cāpi sahyaṃ mayā // ///
analyzed: yat ca anyat na kṛtam kṛtānta kurute tat ca api sahyam mayā
translated: And whatever else is done, O Death, I can bear that too.’

original: evaṃ bahuvidhaṃ vilapya svagṛhaṃ gataḥ /🔽atha tasmin dūrībhūte sarve'pi te kākakūrmamṛgākhavaḥ paramānandabhājo militvā
analyzed: evam bahuvidham vilapya sva gṛham gataḥ  atha tasmin dūrībhūte sarve api te kāka kūrma mṛga ākhavaḥ parama ānanda bhājaḥ militvā
translated: Having lamented in various ways, he went home.🔽Then, when he had gone away, all those crows, tortoises, deer, and rabbits, filled with supreme joy, gathered together

original: parasparam āliṅgya punar jātān ivātmano manyamānas tad eva saraḥ prāpya mahāsukhena
analyzed: parasparam āliṅgya punar jātān iva ātmanaḥ manyamānaḥ tat eva saraḥ prāpya mahā sukhena
translated: and embraced each other, considering themselves reborn. Thinking that, they returned to that very lake and spent their time

original: subhāṣitagoṣṭhīvinodaṃ kurvantaḥ kālaṃ nayanti sma /🔽evaṃ jñātvā vivekinā mitrasaṅgrahaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: subhāṣita goṣṭhī vinodam kurvantaḥ kālam nayanti sma  evam jñātvā vivekinā mitra saṅgrahaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: enjoying the pleasure of good stories, passing the time with great happiness.🔽Knowing this, the wise should make friends.

original: tathā mitreṇa sahāvyājena vartitavyam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā mitreṇa saha a vyājena vartitavyam uktam ca
translated: And one should conduct oneself without deceit with a friend. And it is said:

original: yo mitrāṇi karoty atra na kauṭilyena vartate /
analyzed: yaḥ mitrāṇi karoti atra na kauṭilyena vartate
translated: He who makes friends here and does not conduct himself with crookedness,

original: taiḥ samaṃ na parābhūtiṃ samprāpnoti kathañcana // ///🔽iti śrīviṣṇuśarmaviracite pañcatantre mitrasamprāptir nāma
analyzed: taiḥ samam na parābhūtim samprāpnoti kathañcana  iti śrī viṣṇuśarma viracite pañcatantre mitrasamprāptiḥ nāma
translated: he never meets with defeat along with them.🔽Thus ends the second book named Acquisition of Friends

original: dvitīyaṃ tantraṃ samāptam ////
analyzed: dvitīyam tantram samāptam
translated: in the Pancatantra composed by the illustrious Vishnu Sharma.

original: tṛtīyaṃ tantram
analyzed: tṛtīyam tantram
translated: The third book

original: atha kākolūkīyam
analyzed: atha kākolūkīyam
translated: Now begins the third book named The Story of the Crow and the Owl.

original: prastāvanā kathā
analyzed: prastāvanā kathā
translated: The introductory story

original: meghavarṇārimardanavṛttāntaḥ
analyzed: meghavarṇa ari mardana vṛttāntaḥ
translated: The story of Meghavarna and Ari Mardana

original: athedam ārabhyate kākolūkīyaṃ nāma tṛtīyaṃ tantram /
analyzed: atha idam ārabhyate kākolūkīyam nāma tṛtīyam tantram
translated: Now this begins, the third book named The Story of the Crow and the Owl.

original: yasyāyam ādyaḥ ślokaḥ
analyzed: yasya ayam ādyaḥ ślokaḥ
translated: This is its first verse:

original: na viśvaset pūrvavirodhitasya
analyzed: na viśvaset pūrva virodhitasya
translated: One should not trust a former enemy

original: śatroś ca mitratvam upāgatasya /🔽dagdhāṃ guhāṃ paśya ulūkapūrṇāṃ
analyzed: śatroḥ ca mitra tvam upāgatasya  dagdhām guhām paśya ulūka pūrṇām
translated: who has become a friend.🔽Look at the cave burned by the crow

original: kākapraṇītena hutāśanena // ///
analyzed: kāka praṇītena hutāśanena
translated: who brought the fire, filled with owls.

original: tad yathānuśruyateasti dakṣiṇātye janapade mahilāropyaṃ nāma nagaram /
analyzed: tat yathā anuśruyate asti dakṣiṇātye janapade mahilāropyam nāma nagaram
translated: As it is heard: In the southern country there is a city named Mahilāropya.

original: tasya samīpastho 'nekaśākhāsanātho 'tighanatarapatracchanno nyagrodhapādapo 'sti /
analyzed: tasya samīpa sthaḥ ti ghanatara patra channaḥ nyagrodha pādapaḥ sti
translated: Near it there is a banyan tree with many branches and very thick foliage.

original: tatra ca meghavarṇo nāma vāyasarājo 'nekakākaparivāraḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tatra ca meghavarṇaḥ nāma vāyasa rājaḥ neka kāka parivāraḥ prativasati sma
translated: And there lived a crow king named Meghavarṇa with many crows as his retinue.

original: sa tatra vihitadurgaracanaḥ saparijanaḥ kālaṃ nayati /
analyzed: sa tatra vihita durga racanaḥ sa parijanaḥ kālam nayati
translated: He spent his time there with his retinue, having made a secure nest.

original: tathānyo 'rimardano nāmolūkarājo 'saṅkhyolūkaparivāro giriguhādurgāśrayaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tathā anyaḥ rimardanaḥ nāma ulūka rājaḥ saṅkhyā ulūka parivāraḥ giri guhā durga āśrayaḥ prativasati sma
translated: Similarly, another owl king named Arimarḍana lived in a mountain cave with an uncountable retinue of owls.

original: sa ca rātrāv abhyetya sadaiva tasya nyagrodhasya samantāt paribhramati /
analyzed: sa ca rātrau abhyetya sadā eva tasya nyagrodhasya samantāt paribhramati
translated: And he always came at night and circled all around that banyan tree.

original: atholūkarājaḥ pūrvavirodhavaśādyaṃ kañcid vāyasasamāsādayati /
analyzed: atha ulūka rājaḥ pūrva virodha vaśāt yam kañcid vāyasasam āsādayati
translated: Then the owl king, out of the power of a former enmity, whenever he encountered a crow,

original: taṃ vyāpādya gacchati /
analyzed: tam vyāpādya gacchati
translated: he would kill it and leave.

original: evaṃ nityābhigamanāc chanaiḥ śanais tan nyagrodhapādapaddurgaṃ tena samantān nirvāyasaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: evam nitya abhigamanāt śanais śanais tat nyagrodha pādapad durgam tena samantāt nirvāyasam kṛtam
translated: In this way, by constantly approaching it, little by little that impenetrable banyan tree was completely cleared by him.

original: athavā bhavaty evam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: athavā bhavati evam uktam ca
translated: Or this happens, and it is said:

original: ya upekṣeta śatruṃ svaṃ prasarantaṃ yadṛcchayā /
analyzed: yaḥ upekṣeta śatrum svam prasarantam yadṛcchayā
translated: He who ignores his enemy, who spreads as he wishes,

original: rogaṃ cālasyasaṃyuktaḥ sa śanais tena hanyate // ///
analyzed: rogam ca ālasya saṃyuktaḥ sa śanais tena hanyate
translated: and who is afflicted with disease and laziness, is slowly killed by him.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: jātamātraṃ na yaḥ śatruṃ vyādhiṃ ca praśamaṃ nayet /
analyzed: jāta mātram na yaḥ śatrum vyādhim ca praśamam nayet
translated: He who does not pacify an enemy as soon as he is born, or a disease,

original: mahābalo 'pi tenaiva vṛddhiṃ prāpya sa hanyate // ///
analyzed: mahābalaḥ pi tena eva vṛddhim prāpya sa hanyate
translated: even if he is very powerful, is killed by him when he has grown.

original: athānyedyuḥ sa vāyasarājaḥ sarvān sacivān āhūya provācabhoḥ /
analyzed: atha anyedyus sa vāyasa rājaḥ sarvān sacivān āhūya provāca bhoḥ
translated: Then on another day, that king of crows, having summoned all his ministers, said: Gentlemen,

original: utkaṭas tāvad asmākaṃ śatrur udyamasampannaś ca kālavic ca nityam eva niśāgame sametyāsmatpakṣakadanaṃ karoti /
analyzed: utkaṭaḥ tāvat asmākam śatruḥ udyama sampannaḥ ca kāla vid ca nityam eva niśā āgame sametya asmad pakṣa kadanam karoti
translated: our enemy is indeed powerful, enterprising, and knows the right time. He always comes at night and destroys our faction.

original: tat katham asya prativighātavyam /🔽vayaṃ tāvad rātrau na paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat katham asya prativighātavyam  vayam tāvat rātrau na paśyāmaḥ
translated: How should we counter him?🔽We cannot see at night.

original: na ca divā durgaṃ vijānīmo yena gatvā praharāmaḥ /
analyzed: na ca divā durgam vijānīmaḥ yena gatvā praharāmaḥ
translated: And we do not know the impenetrable place during the day, where we can go and strike.

original: tad atra kiṃ yujyate sandhivigrahayānāsanasaṃśrayadvaidhībhāvānāṃ madhyāt /
analyzed: tat atra kim yujyate sandhi vigraha yāna āsana saṃśraya dvaidhībhāvānām madhyāt
translated: What is appropriate here - among peace, war, marching, halting, seeking shelter, and duplicity?

original: atha te procuḥyuktam abhihitaṃ devena yad eṣa praśnaḥ kṛtaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atha te procuḥ yuktam abhihitam devena yat eṣa praśnaḥ kṛtaḥ uktam ca
translated: Then they said: What the king has said is right, that this question has been asked. And it is said:

original: apṛṣṭenāpi vaktavyaṃ sacivenātra kiṃcana /
analyzed: apṛṣṭena api vaktavyam sacivena atra kiṃcana
translated: Even without being asked, a minister should say something here.

original: pṛṣṭena tu viśeṣeṇa vācyaṃ pathyaṃ mahīpateḥ // ///
analyzed: pṛṣṭena tu viśeṣeṇa vācyam pathyam mahīpateḥ
translated: But when asked, he should especially speak what is beneficial to the king.

original: yo na pṛṣṭo hitaṃ brūte pariṇāme sukhāvaham /
analyzed: yaḥ na pṛṣṭaḥ hitam brūte pariṇāme sukha āvaham
translated: He who, without being asked, speaks what is beneficial, which brings happiness in the end,

original: mantro na priyavaktā ca kevalaṃ sa ripuḥ smṛtam // ///
analyzed: mantraḥ na priya vaktā ca kevalam sa ripuḥ smṛtam
translated: is not a minister, but merely a friend. He is remembered as an enemy.

original: tasmād ekāntam āsādya kāryo mantro mahīpate /
analyzed: tasmāt ekāntam āsādya kāryaḥ mantraḥ mahīpate
translated: Therefore, having gone to a secluded place, the king's counsel should be held.

original: yena tasya vayaṃ kurmo niyamaṃ kāraṇaṃ tathā // ///
analyzed: yena tasya vayam kurmaḥ niyamam kāraṇam tathā
translated: By which we will make a rule and the reason for that.

original: uktaṃ ca
analyzed: uktam ca
translated: And it is said:

original: balīyasi praṇamatāṃ kāle praharatām api /
analyzed: balīyasi praṇamatām kāle praharatām api
translated: For those who bow to the stronger, who strike at the right time,

original: sampado nāvagacchanti pratīpam iva nimnagāḥ // ///
analyzed: sampadaḥ na avagacchanti pratīpam iva nimnagāḥ
translated: wealth does not go against them, like rivers flowing downwards.

original: satyāḍhyo dhārmikaś cāryo bhrātṛsaṅghātavān balī /
analyzed: satya āḍhyaḥ dhārmikaḥ ca āryaḥ bhrātṛ saṅghātavān balī
translated: One who is wealthy with truth, righteous, noble, strong, and has a group of brothers,

original: anekavijayī caiva sandheyaḥ sa ripur bhavet // ///
analyzed: aneka vijayī ca eva sandheyaḥ sa ripuḥ bhavet
translated: and is victorious in many ways, should be allied with, even if he is an enemy.

original: sandhiḥ kāryo 'py anāryeṇa vijñāya prāṇasaṃśayam /
analyzed: sandhiḥ kāryaḥ u pi anāryeṇa vijñāya prāṇa saṃśayam
translated: Even an ignoble person should make peace, knowing the danger to his life.

original: prāṇaiḥ saṃrakṣitaiḥ sarvaṃ yato bhavati rakṣitam // ///
analyzed: prāṇaiḥ saṃrakṣitaiḥ sarvam yatas bhavati rakṣitam
translated: For everything is protected when life is protected.

original: anekayuddhavijayī sandhānaṃ yasya gacchati /
analyzed: aneka yuddha vijayī sandhānam yasya gacchati
translated: Having been victorious in many battles, he should make peace with whom he goes.

original: tatprabhāveṇa tasyāśu vaśaṃ gacchanty arātayaḥ // ///
analyzed: tad prabhāveṇa tasya āśu vaśam gacchanti arātayaḥ
translated: By the power of that, his enemies quickly come under his control.

original: sandhim icchet samenāpi sandigdho vijayī yudhi /
analyzed: sandhim icchet samena api sandigdhaḥ vijayī yudhi
translated: He should desire peace even with an equal, for victory in battle is doubtful.

original: na hi sāṃśayikaṃ kuryād ity uvāca bṛhaspatiḥ // ///
analyzed: na hi sāṃśayikam kuryāt iti uvāca bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: For Brihaspati said that one should not make it doubtful.

original: sandigdho vijayo yuddhe janānām iha yuddhyatām /
analyzed: sandigdhaḥ vijayaḥ yuddhe janānām iha yuddhyatām
translated: Victory in battle is doubtful for people fighting here.

original: upāyatritayād ūrdhvaṃ tasmād yuddhaṃ samācaret // ///
analyzed: upāya tritayāt ūrdhvam tasmāt yuddham samācaret
translated: Therefore, one should engage in battle after the three means have been exhausted.

original: asandadhāno mānāndhaḥ samenāpi hato bhṛśam /
analyzed: asandadhānaḥ māna andhaḥ samena api hataḥ bhṛśam
translated: One who is blinded by pride and does not make peace is severely defeated even by an equal.

original: āmakumbham ivābhittvā nāvatiṣṭheta śaktimān // ///
analyzed: āma kumbham iva a bhittvā na avatiṣṭheta śaktimān
translated: Like a raw pot, a powerful one does not stand firm after being broken.

original: samaṃ śaktimatā yuddham aśaktasya hi mṛtyave /
analyzed: samam śaktimatā yuddham aśaktasya hi mṛtyave
translated: For one who is not powerful, a battle with an equal is for death.

original: vṛṣatkumbhaṃ yathā bhittvā tāvat tiṣṭhati śaktimān // ///
analyzed: vṛṣat kumbham yathā bhittvā tāvat tiṣṭhati śaktimān
translated: Like a powerful one stands after breaking a bull's forehead,

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And moreover:

original: bhūmir mitraṃ hiraṇyaṃ vā vigrahasya phalatrayam /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ mitram hiraṇyam vā vigrahasya phala trayam
translated: Land, friends, or gold - these are the three fruits of war.

original: nāsty ekam api yady eṣāṃ vigrahaṃ na samācaret // ///
analyzed: na asti ekam api yadi eṣām vigraham na samācaret
translated: If one does not have even one of these, one should not engage in war.

original: khanann ākhubilaṃ siṃhaḥ pāṣāṇaśakalākulam /
analyzed: khanan ākhu bilam siṃhaḥ pāṣāṇa śakala ākulam
translated: A lion digging a rat-hole full of stone fragments,

original: prāpnoti nakhabhaṅgaṃ hi phalaṃ vā mūṣako bhavet // ///
analyzed: prāpnoti nakha bhaṅgam hi phalam vā mūṣakaḥ bhavet
translated: only breaks his claws and gets nothing in return.

original: tasmān na syāt phalaṃ yatra puṣṭaṃ yuddhaṃ tu kevalam /
analyzed: tasmāt na syāt phalam yatra puṣṭam yuddham tu kevalam
translated: Therefore, where there is no fruit, but only a complete battle,

original: na hi tat svayam utpādyaṃ kartavyaṃ na kathañcana // ///
analyzed: na hi tat svayam utpādyam kartavyam na kathañcana
translated: one should never engage in it, even if one has produced it oneself.

original: balīyasā samākrānto vaitasīṃ vṛttim āśrayet /
analyzed: balīyasā samākrāntaḥ vaitasīm vṛttim āśrayet
translated: When overpowered by a stronger one, one should adopt the behavior of a reed.

original: vāñchann abhraṃśinīṃ lakṣmīṃ na bhaujaṅgī kadācana // ///
analyzed: vāñchan abhraṃśinīm lakṣmīm na bhaujaṅgī kadācana
translated: One who desires imperishable prosperity should never be like a snake.

original: kurvan hi vaitasīṃ vṛttiṃ prāpnoti mahatīṃ śriyam /🔽bhujaṅgavṛttim āpanno vadham arhati kevalam // ///
analyzed: kurvan hi vaitasīm vṛttim prāpnoti mahatīm śriyam  bhujaṅga vṛttim āpannaḥ vadham arhati kevalam
translated: By adopting the behavior of a reed, one attains great prosperity.🔽One who adopts the behavior of a snake deserves only death.

original: kaurmaṃ saṅkocam āsthāya prahārān api marṣayet /
analyzed: kaurmam saṅkocam āsthāya prahārān api marṣayet
translated: Assuming the contraction of a tortoise, one should endure even blows.

original: kāle kāle ca matimān uttiṣṭhet kṛṣṇasarpavat // ///
analyzed: kāle kāle ca matimān uttiṣṭhet kṛṣṇa sarpa vat
translated: And from time to time, the wise one should rise up like a black serpent.

original: āgataṃ vigrahaṃ vidvān upāyaiḥ praśamaṃ nayet /🔽vijayasya hy anityatvād rabhasena na sampatet // ///
analyzed: āgatam vigraham vidvān upāyaiḥ praśamam nayet  vijayasya hi anitya tvāt rabhasena na sampatet
translated: A wise man should bring about the cessation of a war that has come about through means.🔽For victory is uncertain, so one should not rush into it.

original: balinā saha yoddhavyam iti nāsti nidarśanam /
analyzed: balinā saha yoddhavyam iti na asti nidarśanam
translated: There is no example of a battle being fought with a stronger opponent.

original: prativātaṃ na hi ghanaḥ kadācid upasarpati // ///🔽śatruṇā na hi sandadhyāt suśliṣṭenāpi sandhinā /
analyzed: prativātam na hi ghanaḥ kadācid upasarpati  śatruṇā na hi sandadhyāt su śliṣṭena api sandhinā
translated: For a cloud never approaches against the wind.🔽One should not make peace with an enemy, even if the peace is well-established.

original: sutaptam api pānīyaṃ śamayaty eva pāvakam // ///
analyzed: su taptam api pānīyam śamayati eva pāvakam
translated: Even if water is very hot, it still extinguishes fire.

original: uktaṃ ca
analyzed: uktam ca
translated: And it is said:

original: satyadharmavihīnena na sandadhyāt kathañcana /
analyzed: satya dharma vihīnena na sandadhyāt kathañcana
translated: One should never make peace with one who lacks truth and righteousness.

original: sugandhito 'py asādhutvād acirād yāti vikriyām // ///
analyzed: pi asādhu tvāt acirāt yāti vikriyām
translated: Even if fragrant, due to its unwholesomeness, it soon turns bad.

original: tasmāt tena yoddhavyam iti me matiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tena yoddhavyam iti me matiḥ
translated: Therefore, in my opinion, one should fight with him.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: krūro lubdho 'laso 'satyaḥ pramādī bhīrur asthiraḥ /
analyzed: krūraḥ lubdhaḥ lasaḥ satyaḥ pramādī bhīruḥ asthiraḥ
translated: A cruel, greedy, lazy, untruthful, careless, timid, unstable,

original: mūḍho yodhāvamantā ca sukhocchedyo bhaved ripuḥ // ///
analyzed: mūḍhaḥ yodha avamantā ca sukha ucchedyaḥ bhavet ripuḥ
translated: deluded, and contemptuous warrior enemy can be easily destroyed.

original: aparaṃ tena parābhūtā vayam /🔽tad yadi sandhānakīrtanaṃ kariṣyāmas tad bhūyo 'tyantaṃ kopaṃ kariṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: aparam tena parābhūtāḥ vayam  tat yadi sandhāna kīrtanam kariṣyāmaḥ tat bhūyas tyantam kopam kariṣyati uktam ca
translated: Moreover, we have been defeated by him.🔽If we were to speak of reconciliation, he would become extremely angry again. And it is said:

original: caturthopāyasādhye tu ripau sāntvam apakriyā /
analyzed: caturtha upāya sādhye tu ripau sāntvam apakriyā
translated: But when an enemy can be subdued by the fourth means [i.e. conciliation], conciliation is ineffective.

original: svedyam āmajvaraṃ prājñaḥ ko 'mbhasā pariṣiñcati // ///
analyzed: svedyam āma jvaram prājñaḥ kaḥ mbhasā pariṣiñcati
translated: What wise person would sprinkle water on a fever caused by indigestion?

original: sāmavādāḥ sakopasya śatroḥ pratyuta dīpikāḥ /
analyzed: sāmavādāḥ sa kopasya śatroḥ pratyuta dīpikāḥ
translated: For an angry enemy, conciliatory words are rather like lamps.

original: prataptasyeva sahasā sarpiṣas toyabindavaḥ // ///🔽pramāṇābhyadhikasyāpi mahatsattvam adhiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: prataptasya iva sahasā sarpiṣaḥ toya bindavaḥ  pramāṇa abhyadhikasya api mahat sattvam adhiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Like drops of water on a heated pan of ghee.🔽Even if the enemy is superior in size, he should be struck down by one who is superior in strength and courage.

original: padaṃ mūrdhni samādhatte kesarī mattadantinaḥ // ///
analyzed: padam mūrdhni samādhatte kesarī matta dantinaḥ
translated: Just as a lion places its paw on the head of an enraged elephant.

original: utsāhaśaktisampanno hanyāc chatruṃ laghur gurum /
analyzed: utsāha śakti sampannaḥ hanyāt śatrum laghuḥ gurum
translated: A weak person can kill a strong enemy if he possesses enthusiasm and ability,

original: yathā kaṇṭhīravo nāgaṃ bhāradvājaḥ pracakṣate // ///
analyzed: yathā kaṇṭhīravaḥ nāgam bhāradvājaḥ pracakṣate
translated: Just as Bharadvaja killed the elephant with the sound of a flute, as they say.

original: māyayā śatravo vadhyā avadhyāḥ syur balena ye /
analyzed: māyayā śatravaḥ vadhyāḥ avadhyāḥ syuḥ balena ye
translated: Enemies who cannot be killed by force should be killed by deceit.

original: yathā strīrūpam āsthāya hato bhīmena kīcakaḥ // ///
analyzed: yathā strī rūpam āsthāya hataḥ bhīmena kīcakaḥ
translated: Just as Kichaka was killed by Bhima in the form of a woman.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: mṛtyor ivogradaṇḍasya rājño yānti vaśaṃ dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ iva ugra daṇḍasya rājñaḥ yānti vaśam dviṣaḥ
translated: Enemies come under the control of a king who wields the fierce rod of death,

original: sarvaṃsahaṃ tu manyante tṛṇāya ripavaś ca tam // ///
analyzed: sarvaṃsaham tu manyante tṛṇāya ripavaḥ ca tam
translated: But his enemies consider him to be insignificant, like a blade of grass.

original: na jātu śamanaṃ yasya tejas tejasvitejasām /
analyzed: na jātu śamanam yasya tejaḥ tejasvi tejasām
translated: One whose brilliance cannot be subdued by the brilliance of the brilliant,

original: vṛthā jātena kiṃ tena mātur yauvanahāriṇā // ///
analyzed: vṛthā jātena kim tena mātuḥ yauvana hāriṇā
translated: What is the use of such a person born in vain, who robs the youth of his mother?

original: yā lakṣmīr nānuliptāṅgī vairśoṇitakuṅkumaiḥ /
analyzed: yā lakṣmīḥ na anulipta aṅgī vaiḥ śoṇita kuṅkumaiḥ
translated: That Lakshmi whose limbs are not smeared with the saffron of enemy's blood,

original: kāntāpi manasaḥ prītiṃ na sā dhatte manasvinām // ///
analyzed: kāntā api manasaḥ prītim na sā dhatte manasvinām
translated: That beloved does not give mental satisfaction to the wise.

original: ripuraktena saṃsiktā tatstrīnetrāmbubhis tathā /
analyzed: ripu raktena saṃsiktā tad strī netrāmbubhiḥ tathā
translated: Smeared with the blood of enemies and the tears of their women,

original: na bhūmir yasya bhūpasya kā ślāghā tasya jīvite // ///
analyzed: na bhūmiḥ yasya bhūpasya kā ślāghā tasya jīvite
translated: What praise is there for the life of a king whose land is not conquered?

original: balotkaṭena duṣṭena maryādārahitena ca /
analyzed: bala utkaṭena duṣṭena maryādā rahitena ca
translated: By one who is haughty with power, wicked, and devoid of boundaries,

original: na sandhivigrahau naiva vinā yānaṃ praśasyate // ///
analyzed: na sandhi vigrahau na eva vinā yānam praśasyate
translated: Neither peace nor war is praised without a vehicle.

original: dvidhākāraṃ bhaved yānaṃ bhavet prāṇārtharakṣaṇam /
analyzed: dvidhākāram bhavet yānam bhavet prāṇa artha rakṣaṇam
translated: The vehicle should be twofold, for the protection of life and wealth.

original: ekam anyaj jigīṣoś ca yātrālakṣaṇam ucyate // ///🔽kārttike vātha caitre vā vijigīṣoḥ praśasyate /
analyzed: ekam anyat jigīṣoḥ ca yātrā lakṣaṇam ucyate  kārttike vā atha caitre vā vijigīṣoḥ praśasyate
translated: One is said to be the characteristic of a conqueror's expedition.

original: yānam utkṛṣṭavīryasya śatrudeśe na cānyadā // ///
analyzed: yānam utkṛṣṭa vīryasya śatru deśe na ca anyadā
translated: In Kārtika or Caitra, the vehicle of one with superior valor is praised in the enemy's country, not at other times.

original: avaskandapradānasya sarve kālāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: avaskanda pradānasya sarve kālāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: All times are declared for the bestowal of a raid,

original: vyasane vartamānasya śatrocchidrānvitasya ca // ///
analyzed: vyasane vartamānasya śatru chidra anvitasya ca
translated: For one who is in distress and has the weakness of an enemy.

original: svasthānaṃ sudṛḍhaṃ kṛtvā śūraiś cātair mahābalaiḥ /
analyzed: sva sthānam su dṛḍham kṛtvā śūraiḥ ca ataiḥ mahā balaiḥ
translated: Having made one's own place very firm with brave and very powerful men,

original: paradeśaṃ tato gacchet praṇidhivyāptam agrataḥ // ///
analyzed: para deśam tatas gacchet praṇidhi vyāptam agratas
translated: One should then go to another country, preceded by spies.

original: ajñātavīvadhāsāratoyaśasyo vrajet tu yaḥ /
analyzed: ajñāta vīvadha asāra taḥ yaśasyaḥ vrajet tu yaḥ
translated: One who goes without knowing the enemy's army, provisions, water, and praise,

original: pararāṣṭraṃ na bhūyaḥ sa svarāṣṭram adhigacchati // ///
analyzed: para rāṣṭram na bhūyas sa sva rāṣṭram adhigacchati
translated: Does not return to one's own country after conquering the enemy's kingdom.

original: tat te yuktaṃ kartum apasaraṇam / anyac ca
analyzed: tat te yuktam kartum apasaraṇam anyat ca
translated: It is proper for you to retreat. And furthermore,

original: tan na yuktaṃ prabho kartuṃ dvitīyaṃ yānam eva ca /
analyzed: tat na yuktam prabho kartum dvitīyam yānam eva ca
translated: It is not proper for you, O Lord, to do this second vehicle,

original: na vigraho na sandhānaṃ balinā tena pāpinā // ///
analyzed: na vigrahaḥ na sandhānam balinā tena pāpinā
translated: There is no quarrel, no reconciliation with that powerful sinner,🔽and so on.

original: aparaṃ kāraṇāpekṣayāpasaraṇaṃ kriyate budhaiḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: aparam kāraṇa apekṣayā apasaraṇam kriyate budhaiḥ uktam ca
translated: And for the sake of another reason, the wise withdraw. And it is said:

original: yad apasarati meṣaḥ kāraṇaṃ tat prahartuṃ
analyzed: yat apasarati meṣaḥ kāraṇam tat prahartum
translated: If a ram withdraws, that is the reason to strike,

original: mṛgapatir api kopāt saṅkucaty utpatiṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: mṛgapatiḥ api kopāt saṅkucati utpatiṣṇuḥ
translated: Even the lord of beasts, though ready to pounce, shrinks back in anger.

original: hṛdayanihitabhāvā gūḍhamantrapracārāḥ
analyzed: hṛdaya nihita bhāvāḥ gūḍha mantra pracārāḥ
translated: Those who have feelings hidden in their hearts, who spread secret counsel,

original: kim api vigaṇayanto buddhimantaḥ sahante // ///
analyzed: kim api vigaṇayantaḥ buddhimantaḥ sahante
translated: The wise ones endure, calculating something,🔽and so on.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore:

original: balavantaṃ ripuṃ dṛṣṭvā deśatyāgaṃ karoti yaḥ /
analyzed: balavantam ripum dṛṣṭvā deśa tyāgam karoti yaḥ
translated: He who, seeing a powerful enemy, abandons his country,

original: yudhiṣṭhira ivāpnoti punar jīvan sa medinīm // ///
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ iva āpnoti punar jīvan sa medinīm
translated: Like Yudhishthira, he regains the earth alive again,🔽and so on.

original: yudhyate'haṅkṛtiṃ kṛtvā durbalo yo balīyasā /
analyzed: yudhyata ihaṅkṛtim kṛtvā durbalaḥ yaḥ balīyasā
translated: He who, being weak, fights, making himself great, with a stronger person,

original: sa tasya vāñchitaṃ kuryād ātmanaś ca kulakṣayam // ///
analyzed: sa tasya vāñchitam kuryāt ātmanaḥ ca kula kṣayam
translated: He will fulfill his desire and destroy his own family,🔽and so on.

original: tad balavatābhiyuktsyāpasaraṇasamayo 'yaṃ na sandher vigrahasya ca /
analyzed: tat balavatā abhiyuktsya apasaraṇa samayaḥ yam na sandheḥ vigrahasya ca
translated: Therefore, this is the time for withdrawal for one attacked by a powerful [enemy], not for peace or war.

original: evam anujīvimantro 'pasaraṇasya /
analyzed: evam anujīvi mantra upasaraṇasya
translated: Thus, the counsel of withdrawal is for one who has a powerful enemy.

original: atha tasya vacanam ākarṇya prajīvanam āhabhadra /
analyzed: atha tasya vacanam ākarṇya prajīvanam āha bhadra
translated: Then, having heard his words, Prajīvana said, Good sir,

original: tvam apy ātmano 'bhiprāyaṃ vada /
analyzed: tvam api ātmanaḥ bhiprāyam vada
translated: You also state your opinion.

original: so 'bravītdeva /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt deva
translated: He said, Your Majesty,

original: mama sandhivigrahayānāni trīṇy api na pratibhānti /
analyzed: mama sandhi vigraha yānāni trīṇi api na pratibhānti
translated: I do not see any of the three options of peace, war, or marching available to me.

original: viśeṣataś cāsanaṃ pratibhāti / uktaṃ ca🔽nakraḥ svasthānam āsādya gajendram api karṣati /
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ ca āsanam pratibhāti uktam ca  nakraḥ sva sthānam āsādya gaja indram api karṣati
translated: In particular, staying in place seems appropriate. It is said:🔽A crocodile, having reached its own place, can drag away even a great elephant.

original: sa eva pracyutaḥ sthānāc chunāpi paribhūyate // ///
analyzed: saḥ eva pracyutaḥ sthānāt śunā api paribhūyate
translated: But if it is dislodged from that place, it is even humiliated by a dog.

original: tathā
analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly,

original: abhiyukto balavatā tiṣṭhan durge prayatnavān /
analyzed: abhiyuktaḥ balavatā tiṣṭhan durge prayatnavān
translated: A king who is attacked by a powerful enemy, staying in a fortress and making efforts,

original: tatrasthaḥ suhṛdāhvānaṃ kurvītātmavimuktaye // ///🔽yo ripor āgamaṃ śrutvā bhayasantrastamānasaḥ /
analyzed: tatrasthaḥ suhṛd āhvānam kurvīta ātma vimuktaye  yaḥ ripoḥ āgamam śrutvā bhaya santrasta mānasaḥ
translated: should call upon allies to free himself from that situation.🔽One who, having heard of the enemy's arrival, abandons his own place with a mind terrified by fear,

original: svasthānaṃ hi tyajet tatra na tu bhūyo viśec ca saḥ // ///
analyzed: sva sthānam hi tyajet tatra na tu bhūyas viśet ca saḥ
translated: will not return there again.

original: daṃṣṭrāvirahitaḥ sarpo madahīno yathā gajaḥ /
analyzed: daṃṣṭrā virahitaḥ sarpaḥ mada hīnaḥ yathā gajaḥ
translated: A snake without fangs, an elephant without rut,

original: sthānahīnas tathā rājā gamyaḥ syāt sarvajantuṣu // ///
analyzed: sthāna hīnaḥ tathā rājā gamyaḥ syāt sarva jantuṣu
translated: a king without a place - all of them are vulnerable to all creatures.

original: nijasthānasthito 'py ekaḥ śataṃ yoddhuṃ sahen naraḥ /
analyzed: nija sthāna sthitaḥ api ekaḥ śatam yoddhum sahet naraḥ
translated: A man who can fight a hundred enemies alone,

original: śaktānām api śatrūṇāṃ tasmāt sthānaṃ na santyajet // ///
analyzed: śaktānām api śatrūṇām tasmāt sthānam na santyajet
translated: even though they are powerful, should not abandon his place.

original: tasmād durgaṃ dṛḍhaṃ kṛtvā subhaṭāsārasaṃyutam /
analyzed: tasmāt durgam dṛḍham kṛtvā su bhaṭa āsāra saṃyutam
translated: Therefore, having made a fortress strong, with a good army and provisions,

original: prākāraparikhāyuktaṃ śastrādibhir alaṅkṛtam // ///
analyzed: prākāra parikhā yuktam śastra ādibhiḥ alaṅkṛtam
translated: Surrounded by ramparts and moats, adorned with weapons and other things.

original: tiṣṭhen madhyagato nityaṃ yuddhāya kṛtaniścayaḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhet madhya gataḥ nityam yuddhāya kṛta niścayaḥ
translated: He should always stand in the middle, determined for battle.

original: jīvan samprāptsyati rājyaṃ mṛto vā svargam eṣyati //
analyzed: jīvan samprāptsyati rājyam mṛtaḥ vā svargam eṣyati
translated: If he lives, he will obtain the kingdom; if he dies, he will go to heaven.

original: yugmakam
analyzed: yugmakam
translated: A couplet

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And another thing

original: balināpi na bādhyante laghavo 'py ekasaṃśrayāḥ /
analyzed: balinā api na bādhyante laghavaḥ pi eka saṃśrayāḥ
translated: Even the weak, when united, are not oppressed by the strong.

original: vipakṣeṇāpi marutā yathaikasthānavīrudhāḥ // ///
analyzed: vipakṣeṇa api marutā yathā eka sthāna vīrudhāḥ
translated: Even by the hostile winds, like the plants growing in the same place.

original: mahān apy ekajo vṛkṣaḥ balavān supratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: mahān api eka jaḥ vṛkṣaḥ balavān su pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Even a great tree, though single, strong and well-established,

original: prasahya iva vātena śakyo dharṣayituṃ yataḥ // ///
analyzed: prasahyaḥ iva vātena śakyaḥ dharṣayitum yatas
translated: Can be violently shaken by the wind, as if it were weak.

original: atha ye saṃhatā vṛkṣā sarvataḥ supratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: atha ye saṃhatāḥ vṛkṣā sarvatas su pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: But those trees that are united, well-established in every way,

original: te na raudrānilenāpi hanyante hy ekasaṃśrayāt // ///
analyzed: te na raudra anilena api hanyante hi eka saṃśrayāt
translated: They are not destroyed even by fierce winds, because they are united.

original: evaṃ manuṣyam apy ekaṃ śauryeṇāpi samanvitam /
analyzed: evam manuṣyam api ekam śauryeṇa api samanvitam
translated: In the same way, even a single man, though endowed with courage,

original: śakyaṃ dviṣanto manyante hiṃsanti ca tataḥ param // ///
analyzed: śakyam dviṣantaḥ manyante hiṃsanti ca tatas param
translated: The enemies think he can be harmed and then attack him.

original: evaṃ prajīvamantraḥ /
analyzed: evam prajīva mantraḥ
translated: Thus is the counsel of the long-lived one.

original: idam āsanasaṃjñakam /
analyzed: idam āsana saṃjñakam
translated: This is called the seat.

original: etat samākarṇya cirañjīvinaṃ prāhabhadra /
analyzed: etat samākarṇya cirañjīvinam prāha bhadra
translated: Having heard this, the long-lived one said, Sir,

original: tvam api svābhiprāyaṃ vada /
analyzed: tvam api sva abhiprāyam vada
translated: you also speak your own intention.

original: so 'bravītdeva /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt deva
translated: He said, God,

original: ṣāḍguṇyamadhye mama saṃśrayaḥ samyak pratibhāti /
analyzed: ṣāḍguṇya madhye mama saṃśrayaḥ samyak pratibhāti
translated: Of the six expedients, seeking refuge seems right to me.

original: tat tasyānuṣṭhānaṃ kāryam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat tasya anuṣṭhānam kāryam uktam ca
translated: Therefore, that should be done. And it is said:

original: asahāyaḥ samartho 'pi tejasvī kiṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: asahāyaḥ tejasvī kim kariṣyati
translated: Even if capable, without allies, what can a brilliant person do?

original: nirvāte jvalito vahniḥ svayam eva praśāmyati // ///
analyzed: nirvāte jvalitaḥ vahniḥ svayam eva praśāmyati
translated: A fire burning in a windless place is extinguished by itself.

original: saṅgatiḥ śreyasī puṃsāṃ svapakṣe ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: saṅgatiḥ śreyasī puṃsām sva pakṣe ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: Association is best for a person, especially on one's own side.

original: tuṣair api paribhraṣṭā na prarohanti taṇḍulāḥ // ///
analyzed: tuṣaiḥ api paribhraṣṭāḥ na prarohanti taṇḍulāḥ
translated: Rice grains fallen with husks do not sprout.

original: tad atraiva sthitena tvayā kaścit samarthaḥ samāśrayaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: tat atrā eva sthitena tvayā kaścid samarthaḥ samāśrayaṇīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, while staying here itself, you should seek refuge with someone capable.

original: yo vipatpratikāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: yaḥ vipad pratikāram karoti
translated: Who will remedy misfortune.

original: yadi punas tvaṃ svasthānaṃ tyaktvānyatra yāsyasi /
analyzed: yadi punar tvam sva sthānam tyaktvā anyatra yāsyasi
translated: But if you leave your own place and go elsewhere,

original: tat ko 'pi te vāṅmātreṇāpi sahāyatvaṃ na kariṣyati /
analyzed: tat kaḥ pi te vāc mātreṇa api sahāya tvam na kariṣyati
translated: no one will help you even with mere words.

original: uktaṃ ca / yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said: Because

original: vanāni dahato vahneḥ sakhī bhavati mārutaḥ /
analyzed: vanāni dahataḥ vahneḥ sakhī bhavati mārutaḥ
translated: The wind becomes a friend to the fire burning the forests.

original: sa eva dīpanāśāya kṛśe kasyāsti sauhṛdam // ///
analyzed: saḥ eva dīpa nāśāya kṛśe kasya asti sauhṛdam
translated: That very [wind] is for extinguishing the lamp. Who has friendship with the emaciated?

original: athavā naitad ekāntaṃ yad balinam ekaṃ samāśrayet /
analyzed: athavā nā etat ekāntam yat balinam ekam samāśrayet
translated: Or rather, it is not absolute that one should seek refuge with a single powerful person.

original: laghūnām api saṃśrayo rakṣāyai eva bhavati /
analyzed: laghūnām api saṃśrayaḥ rakṣāyai eva bhavati
translated: Association with the light ones also becomes protection.

original: uktaṃ ca / yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said: Because

original: saṅghātavān yathā veṇur niviḍair veṇubhir vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: saṅghātavān yathā veṇuḥ nibiḍaiḥ veṇubhiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: Just as a bamboo with a bundle of tightly bound bamboos

original: na śakyeta samucchettuṃ durbalo 'pi yathā nṛpaḥ // ///
analyzed: na śakyeta samucchettum durbalaḥ pi yathā nṛpaḥ
translated: cannot be cut by even a weak king,

original: yadi punar uttamasaṃśrayo bhavati tat kim ucyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yadi punar uttama saṃśrayaḥ bhavati tat kim ucyate uktam ca
translated: If, on the other hand, one has a superior support, what is to be said? And it is said:

original: mahājanasya samparkaḥ kasya nonnatikārakaḥ /
analyzed: mahājanasya samparkaḥ kasya nā unnati kārakaḥ
translated: Who is not elevated by association with the great?

original: padmapatrasthitaṃ toyaṃ dhatte muktāphalaśriyam // ///
translated: The water held in a lotus leaf attains the beauty of a pearl.

original: tad evaṃ saṃśrayaṃ vinā na kaścit pratīkāro bhavati iti me'bhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: tat evam saṃśrayam vinā na kaścid pratīkāraḥ bhavati iti mā ibhiprāyaḥ
translated: Thus, my intention is that without support, no remedy is possible.

original: evaṃ cirañjīvimantraḥ /
analyzed: evam cirañjīvi mantraḥ
translated: And so is the long-life mantra.

original: athaivam abhihite sa meghavarṇo rājā cirantanaṃ pitṛsacivaṃ dīrghāyuṣaṃ sakalanītiśāstrapāraṅgataṃ sthirajīvināmānaṃ praṇamya provācatāta
analyzed: athā evam abhihite sa meghavarṇaḥ rājā cirantanam pitṛ sacivam dīrgha āyuṣam sakala nīti śāstra pāraṅgatam sthirajīvi nāmānam praṇamya provāca tāta
translated: Then, when this was said, that King Meghavarṇa, bowing to his long-lived father's minister, who had mastered all the scriptures of statecraft, named Sthirajīva, said: Father,

original: yad ete mayā pṛṣṭāḥ sacivās tāvad atrasthitasyāpi tava tatparīkṣārtham /
analyzed: yat ete mayā pṛṣṭāḥ sacivāḥ tāvat atra sthitasya api tava tad parīkṣā artham
translated: since these ministers have been questioned by me, even though you are here, it is for the sake of testing them.

original: yena tvaṃ sakalaṃ śrutvā yad ucitaṃ tan me samādiśasi /
analyzed: yena tvam sakalam śrutvā yat ucitam tat me samādiśasi
translated: By which you, having heard everything, will instruct me in what is proper.

original: tad yady uktaṃ bhavati tas samādeśyam /
analyzed: tat yadi uktam bhavati samādeśyam
translated: Therefore, if it is said, it should be instructed.

original: sa āhavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ āhavat sa
translated: He said: My son,

original: sarvair apy etair nītiśāstrāśrayam uktaṃ sacivaiḥ /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ api etaiḥ nīti śāstra āśrayam uktam sacivaiḥ
translated: All these ministers have said that one should rely on the science of statecraft.

original: tad upayujyate svakālocitaṃ sarvam eva /
analyzed: tat upayujyate sva kāla ucitam sarvam eva
translated: All of it is useful, as appropriate for one's own time.

original: param eṣa dvaidhībhāvasya kālaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: param eṣa dvaidhībhāvasya kālaḥ uktam ca
translated: But this is the time for double-dealing. And it is said:

original: aviśvāsaṃ sadā tiṣṭhet sandhinā vigraheṇa ca /🔽dvaidhībhāvaṃ samāśritya pāpe śatrau balīyasi // ///
analyzed: aviśvāsam sadā tiṣṭhet sandhinā vigraheṇa ca  dvaidhībhāvam samāśritya pāpe śatrau balīyasi
translated: One should always remain suspicious, both in peace and in war.

original: tac chatruṃ viśvāsyāviśvastair lobhaṃ darśayadbhiḥ sukhenocchidyate ripuḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat śatrum viśvāsya aviśvastaiḥ lobham darśayadbhiḥ sukhena ucchidyate ripuḥ uktam ca
translated: Relying on double-dealing, one should easily destroy an evil, untrustworthy, powerful enemy. And it is said:

original: ucchedyam api vidvāṃso vardhayanty arim ekadā /
analyzed: ucchedyam api vidvāṃsaḥ vardhayanti arim ekadā
translated: Even what is to be destroyed, the wise sometimes increase an enemy.

original: guḍena vardhitaḥ śleṣmā yato niḥśeṣatāṃ vrajet // ///
analyzed: guḍena vardhitaḥ śleṣmā yatas niḥśeṣa tām vrajet
translated: Phlegm, when increased by molasses, goes to complete destruction.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: strīṇāṃ śatroḥ kumitrasya paṇyastrīṇāṃ viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: strīṇām śatroḥ ku mitrasya paṇya strīṇām viśeṣataḥ
translated: One who has single-minded devotion to women, enemies, bad friends, and especially prostitutes,

original: yo bhaved ekabhāvo 'tra na sa jīvati mānavaḥ // ///
analyzed: yaḥ bhavet na sa jīvati mānavaḥ
translated: that man does not live.

original: kṛtyaṃ devadvijātīnām ātmanaś ca guros tathā /
analyzed: kṛtyam deva dvijātīnām ātmanaḥ ca guroḥ tathā
translated: The duties of gods, Brahmins, oneself, and one's guru,

original: ekabhāvena kartavyaṃ śeṣaṃ dvaidhasamāśritam // ///
analyzed: eka bhāvena kartavyam śeṣam dvaidha samāśritam
translated: should always be done with single-minded devotion, the rest relying on double-dealing.

original: eko bhāvaḥ sadā śasto yatīnāṃ bhāvitātmanām /
analyzed: ekaḥ bhāvaḥ sadā śastaḥ yatīnām bhāvitātmanām
translated: Single-minded devotion is always praised for ascetics with purified souls.

original: śrīlubdhānāṃ na lokānāṃ viśeṣeṇa mahībhujām // ///
analyzed: śrī lubdhānām na lokānām viśeṣeṇa mahībhujām
translated: especially for kings who are greedy for wealth.

original: tad dvaidhībhāvaṃ saṃśritasya tava svasthāne vāso bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat dvaidhībhāvam saṃśritasya tava sva sthāne vāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If you resort to a double life, you will be able to stay in your own place.

original: lobhāśrayāc ca śatrum uccāṭayiṣyasi aparaṃyadi kiñcic chidraṃ tasya paśyasi /
analyzed: lobha āśrayāt ca śatrum uccāṭayiṣyasi aparam yadi kiñcid chidram tasya paśyasi
translated: And out of greed, you will drive out your enemy. If you see any weakness in him,

original: tad gatvā vyāpādayiṣyasi /
analyzed: tat gatvā vyāpādayiṣyasi
translated: you will go and destroy him.

original: meghavarṇa āhatāta mayā so 'vidita saṃśrayaḥ /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha tāta mayā saḥ vidita saṃśrayaḥ
translated: Meghavarṇa said, Father, I do not know his refuge.

original: tat kathaṃ tasya chidraṃ jñāsyāmi /
analyzed: tat katham tasya chidram jñāsyāmi
translated: So how will I know his weakness?

original: sthirajīvy āhavatsa /
analyzed: sthirajīvī āhavatsa
translated: Sthirayu said, Son.

original: na kevalaṃ sthānaṃ /
analyzed: na kevalam sthānam
translated: Not only the place,

original: chidrāṇy api tasya prakaṭīkariṣyāmi praṇadhibhiḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: chidrāṇi api tasya prakaṭīkariṣyāmi praṇadhibhiḥ uktam ca
translated: but I will also reveal his weaknesses through spies. And it is said:

original: gāvo gandhena paśyanti vedaiḥ paśyanti vai dvijāḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ gandhena paśyanti vedaiḥ paśyanti vai dvijāḥ
translated: Cows see by smell, twice-born people see by the Vedas,

original: cārai paśyanti rājānaś cakṣurbhyām itare janāḥ // ///
analyzed: cāraiḥ paśyanti rājānaḥ cakṣurbhyām itare janāḥ
translated: Kings see by spies, other people see with their eyes.

original: uktaṃ cātra viṣaye🔽yas tīrthāni nije pakṣe parapakṣe viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: uktam ca atra viṣaye  yaḥ tīrthāni nije pakṣe para pakṣe viśeṣataḥ
translated: And it is said in this context:🔽The king who knows through secret spies the holy places in his own faction and especially in the faction of others,

original: guptaiś cārair nṛpo vetti na sa durgatim āpnuyāt // ///
analyzed: guptaiḥ cāraiḥ nṛpaḥ vetti na sa durgatim āpnuyāt
translated: he will not fall into misfortune.

original: meghavarṇa āhatāta /🔽kāni tīrthāny ucyante /🔽kati saṅkhyāni ca /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha tāta  kāni tīrthāni ucyante  kati saṅkhyāni ca
translated: Meghavarṇa said, Father.🔽What are those holy places said to be?🔽How many are there?

original: kīdṛśā guptacarāḥ /
analyzed: kīdṛśāḥ gupta carāḥ
translated: What are the secret spies like?

original: tat sarvaṃ nivedyatām iti /
analyzed: tat sarvam nivedyatām iti
translated: Please tell me all that.

original: sa āhaatra viṣaye bhagavatā nāradena yudhiṣṭhiraḥ proktaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha atra viṣaye bhagavatā nāradena yudhiṣṭhiraḥ proktaḥ
translated: He said, In this matter, the Blessed Nārada spoke to Yudhiṣṭhira:

original: yac chatrupakṣe'ṣṭādaśatīrthāni /
analyzed: yat śatru pakṣa iṣṭādaśa tīrthāni
translated: 'There are eighteen factions of the enemy,

original: svapakṣe pañcadaśa /
analyzed: sva pakṣe pañcadaśa
translated: fifteen of one's own side.

original: tribhis tribhir guptacarais tāni jñeyāni /
analyzed: tribhiḥ tribhiḥ gupta caraiḥ tāni jñeyāni
translated: They should be known through three spies for each,

original: tair jñātaiḥ svapakṣaḥ parapakṣaś ca vaśyo bhavati /
analyzed: taiḥ jñātaiḥ sva pakṣaḥ para pakṣaḥ ca vaśyaḥ bhavati
translated: by knowing them, one's own side and the enemy's side become under control.'

original: uktaṃ ca nāradena yudhiṣṭhiraṃ prati🔽kaccid aṣṭadaśāny eṣu svapakṣe daśa pañca ca /
analyzed: uktam ca nāradena yudhiṣṭhiram prati  kaccit aṣṭadaśāni eṣu sva pakṣe daśa pañca ca
translated: And Nārada said to Yudhiṣṭhira:

original: tribhis tribhir avijñātair vetsi tīrthāni cārakaiḥ // ///
analyzed: tribhiḥ tribhiḥ avijñātaiḥ vetsi tīrthāni cārakaiḥ
translated: 'Do you know through three unknown spies the eighteen factions here on your side and the fifteen on the other side?'

original: tīrthaśabdenāyuktakarmābhidhīyate /
analyzed: tīrtha śabdena ayukta karma abhidhīyate
translated: The word 'tīrtha' refers to improper action.

original: tad yadi teṣāṃ kutsitaṃ bhavati tat svāmino 'bhighātāya /
analyzed: tat yadi teṣām kutsitam bhavati tat svāminaḥ abhighātāya
translated: If their conduct is contemptible, it leads to the downfall of the king.

original: yadi pradhānaṃ bhavati tadvṛddhaye syād iti /
analyzed: yadi pradhānam bhavati tad vṛddhaye syāt iti
translated: If it is praiseworthy, it leads to his prosperity.

original: tad yathāmantrī /🔽purohitaḥ /🔽senāpatiḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā mantrī  purohitaḥ  senāpatiḥ
translated: For example, a minister,🔽a priest,🔽a general,

original: yuvarājaḥ /
analyzed: yuvarājaḥ
translated: a prince,

original: dauvārikaḥ /
analyzed: dauvārikaḥ
translated: a doorkeeper,

original: antarvāsikaḥ /
analyzed: antarvāsikaḥ
translated: an intimate,

original: praśāsakaḥ /🔽samāhartṛsannidhātṛpradeṣṭṛjñāpakāḥ /
analyzed: praśāsakaḥ  samāhartṛ sannidhātṛ pradeṣṭṛ jñāpakāḥ
translated: an administrator,

original: sādhanādhyakṣaḥ /🔽gajādhyakṣaḥ /
analyzed: sādhana adhyakṣaḥ  gaja adhyakṣaḥ
translated: a collector, a storekeeper, a commander, an informer,🔽a chief engineer,

original: kośādhyakṣaḥ /
analyzed: kośa adhyakṣaḥ
translated: an elephant keeper,🔽a treasury officer,

original: durgapālakarapālasīmāpālaprotkaṭabhṛtyāḥ /
analyzed: durga pāla karapāla sīmāpāla protkaṭa bhṛtyāḥ
translated: The chief of the fortress guards, the chief of the hand guards, the chief of the border guards, and the most prominent servants,

original: eṣāṃ bhedena drāg ripuḥ sādhyate /🔽svapakṣe ca devī /
analyzed: eṣām bhedena drāk ripuḥ sādhyate  sva pakṣe ca devī
translated: by dividing these, the enemy is quickly accomplished.

original: jananī /🔽kañcukī /
analyzed: jananī  kañcukī
translated: And in one's own faction, the goddess,

original: mālikaḥ /🔽śayyāpālakaḥ /🔽spaśādhyakṣaḥ /
analyzed: mālikaḥ  śayyā pālakaḥ  spaśā adhyakṣaḥ
translated: the mother,🔽the chamberlain,🔽the garland maker,🔽the bed guard,🔽the chief of the spies,

original: sāṃvatsarikaḥ /
analyzed: sāṃvatsarikaḥ
translated: the astrologer,

original: bhiṣag /
analyzed: bhiṣaj
translated: the physician,

original: tāmbūlavāhakaḥ /
translated: the betel nut bearer,

original: ācāryaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ
translated: the teacher,

original: aṅgarakṣakaḥ /
analyzed: aṅga rakṣakaḥ
translated: the bodyguard,

original: sthānacintakaḥ /
translated: the counselor,

original: chatradharaḥ / vilāsinī /
analyzed: chatra dharaḥ vilāsinī
translated: the umbrella bearer, and the courtesan,

original: eṣāṃ vairadvāreṇa svapakṣe vighātaḥ / tathā ca
analyzed: eṣām vaira dvāreṇa sva pakṣe vighātaḥ tathā ca
translated: by the enmity of these, there is destruction in one's own faction. And thus:

original: vaidyasāṃvatsarācāryāḥ svapakṣe'dhikṛtāś carāḥ /
analyzed: vaidya sāṃvatsara ācāryāḥ sva pakṣa idhi kṛtāḥ carāḥ
translated: The physician, the astrologer, the teacher, and the authorized spies in one's own faction,

original: tathāhituṇḍikonmattāḥ sarvaṃ jānanti śatruṣu // ///
analyzed: tathā ahi tuṇḍika unmattāḥ sarvam jānanti śatruṣu
translated: as well as the snake charmer and the madman, know everything about the enemies.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And thus:

original: kṛtvā kṛtyavidas tīrtheṣv antaḥ praṇidhayaḥ padam /
analyzed: kṛtvā kṛtya vidaḥ tīrtheṣu antar praṇidhayaḥ padam
translated: Having performed their duties, the spies in the holy places, with hidden intentions,

original: vidāṅkurvantu mahatas talaṃ vidviṣadambhasaḥ // ///
analyzed: mahataḥ talam vidviṣat ambhasaḥ
translated: may know the great expanse of water belonging to the enemies.

original: evaṃ mantrivākyam ākarṇyātrāntare meghavarṇa āhatāta /
analyzed: evam mantri vākyam ākarṇya atrā antare meghavarṇaḥ āha tāta
translated: Having heard the minister's words in this way, at that time, Meghavarṇa said, Father,

original: atha kiṃ nimittam evaṃvidhaṃ prāṇāntikaṃ sadaiva vāyasolūkānāṃ vairam /
analyzed: atha kim nimittam evaṃvidham prāṇāntikam sadā eva vāyasa ulūkānām vairam
translated: then why is there always such a life-ending enmity between crows and owls for such a reason?

original: sa āhavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ āhavat sa
translated: He said, My son,

original: kadācid dhaṃsaśukakokilacātakaulūkamayūrakapātapārāvataviṣkiraprabhṛtayaḥ sarve'pi pakṣiṇaḥ sametya sodvegaṃ mantrayitum ārabdhāḥ
analyzed: kadācid dhaṃsa śuka kokila cātaka aulūka mayūraka pāta pārāvata viṣkira prabhṛtayaḥ sarve api pakṣiṇaḥ sametya sa udvegam mantrayitum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Once upon a time, all the birds, including swans, parrots, cuckoos, chātaka birds, owls, peacocks, crows, pigeons, and partridges, gathered together and began to consult anxiously.

original: aho asmākaṃ tāvad vainateyo rājā /
analyzed: aho asmākam tāvat vainateyaḥ rājā
translated: Oh, our king is indeed Garuḍa.

original: sa ca vāsudevabhakto na kām api cintām asmākaṃ karoti /
analyzed: sa ca vāsudeva bhaktaḥ na kām api cintām asmākam karoti
translated: And he, being a devotee of Vāsudeva, does not give any thought to us at all.

original: tat kiṃ tena vṛthāsvāminā /
analyzed: tat kim tena vṛthāsvāminā
translated: So what is the use of having such a useless master?

original: yo lubdhakapāśair nityaṃ nibadhyamānānāṃ na rakṣāṃ vidhatte / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yaḥ lubdhaka pāśaiḥ nityam nibadhyamānānām na rakṣām vidhatte uktam ca
translated: He who does not provide protection to those who are constantly being bound by the hunter's snares. And it is said:

original: yo na rakṣati vitrastān pīḍyamānān paraiḥ sadā /
analyzed: yaḥ na rakṣati vitrastān pīḍyamānān paraiḥ sadā
translated: He who does not protect the frightened ones who are always oppressed by others,

original: jantūn pārthivarūpeṇa sa kṛtānto na saṃśayaḥ // ///🔽yadi na syān narapatiḥ samyaṅ netāḥ tataḥ prajāḥ /
analyzed: jantūn pārthiva rūpeṇa sa kṛtāntaḥ na saṃśayaḥ  yadi na syāt narapatiḥ samyak netā tatas prajāḥ
translated: that king, in the form of the god of death, has no doubt.

original: akarṇadhārā jaladhau viplaveteha naur iva // ///
analyzed: a karṇa dhārā jaladhau viplaveta iha nauḥ iva
translated: If there were no king, the proper leader, then the people would be like a boat without oars sinking in the ocean here.

original: ṣaḍ imān puruṣo jahyād bhinnāṃ nāvam ivārṇave /🔽apravaktāram ācāryam anadhīyānam ṛtvijam // ///
analyzed: ṣaṭ imān puruṣaḥ jahyāt bhinnām nāvam iva arṇave  a pravaktāram ācāryam an adhīyānam ṛtvijam
translated: A person should abandon these six, like a broken boat in the ocean:

original: arakṣitāraṃ rājānaṃ bhāryāṃ cāpiryavādinīm /
analyzed: arakṣitāram rājānam bhāryām ca apirya vādinīm
translated: A teacher who does not speak, a priest who does not study, a king who does not protect, a wife who is always quarrelsome,

original: grāmakāmaṃ ca gopālaṃ vanakāmaṃ ca nāpitam // /// yugmam
analyzed: grāma kāmam ca gopālam vana kāmam ca nāpitam yugmam
translated: The cowherd desiring a village, and the barber desiring the forest.

original: tat / sañcityānyaḥ kaścid rājā vihaṅgamānāṃ kriyatām iti /🔽atha tair bhadrākāram ulūkam avalokya sarvair abhihitamyad eṣa ulūko rājāsmākaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat sañcitya anyaḥ kaścid rājā vihaṅgamānām kriyatām iti  atha taiḥ bhadra ākāram ulūkam avalokya sarvaiḥ abhihitam yat eṣaḥ ulūkaḥ rājā asmākam bhaviṣyati
translated: Having accumulated that, let some other king be made for the birds.🔽Then, having seen an owl with an auspicious appearance, all of them said, If this owl is to be our king,

original: tad ānīyantāṃ nṛpābhiṣekasambandhinaḥ sambhārāḥ iti /
analyzed: tat ānīyantām nṛpa abhiṣeka sambandhinaḥ sambhārāḥ iti
translated: then let the requisites for the royal consecration be brought.

original: atha sādhite vividhatīrthodake /
analyzed: atha sādhite vividha tīrtha udake
translated: Then, when the water from various holy places had been prepared,

original: praguṇīkṛte'ṣṭottaraśatamūlikāsaṅghāte pradatte siṃhāsane /
analyzed: praguṇīkṛta iṣṭa uttara śata mūlikā saṅghāte pradatte siṃhāsane
translated: when the throne had been offered, consisting of one hundred and eight roots,

original: vartite saptadvīpasamudrabhūdharavicitre dharitrīmaṇḍale /
analyzed: vartite sapta dvīpa samudra bhūdhara vicitre dharitrī maṇḍale
translated: when the mandala of the earth had been drawn, with its seven islands, oceans, and mountains,

original: prastārite vyāghracarmaṇi āpūriteṣu hemakumbheṣu dīpeṣu vādyeṣu ca sajjīkṛteṣu darpaṇādiṣu māṅgalyavastuṣu /
analyzed: prastārite vyāghra carmaṇi āpūriteṣu hema kumbheṣu dīpeṣu vādyeṣu ca sajjīkṛteṣu darpaṇa ādiṣu māṅgalya vastuṣu
translated: when the tiger skin had been spread out, when the golden pots, lamps, and musical instruments had been filled, and when the auspicious objects such as the mirror had been arranged,

original: paṭhatsu vandimukhyeṣu /
analyzed: paṭhatsu vandi mukhyeṣu
translated: when the chief bards were reciting,

original: vedoccāraṇapareṣu samuditamukheṣu brāhmaṇeṣu /🔽gītapare yuvatijane /
analyzed: veda uccāraṇa pareṣu samudita mukheṣu brāhmaṇeṣu  gīta pare yuvati jane
translated: when the Brahmins with melodious voices were chanting the Vedas,🔽when the young women were singing,

original: ānītāyām agramahiṣyāṃ kṛkālikāyām /
analyzed: ānītāyām agramahiṣyām kṛkālikāyām
translated: when the chief queen, Kṛkālikā, had been brought,

original: ulūko 'bhiṣekārthaṃ yāvat siṃhāsane upaviśati tāvat kuto 'pi vāyasaḥ samāyātaḥ so 'cintayataho /
analyzed: ulūkaḥ bhiṣeka artham yāvat siṃhāsane upaviśati tāvat kutas pi vāyasaḥ samāyātaḥ saḥ
translated: When the owl was about to sit on the lion throne for his consecration, a crow came from somewhere and thought, Oh!

original: kim eṣa sakalapakṣisamāgamo mahotsavaś ca /
analyzed: kim eṣa sakala pakṣi samāgamaḥ mahā utsavaḥ ca
translated: Is this a great festival with the assembly of all the birds?

original: atha te pakṣiṇas taṃ dṛṣṭvā mithaḥ procuḥ /
analyzed: atha te pakṣiṇaḥ tam dṛṣṭvā mithas procuḥ
translated: Then the birds, seeing him, said to each other, This is the crow.

original: pakṣiṇāṃ madhye vāyasaś caturaḥ śrūyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: pakṣiṇām madhye vāyasaḥ caturaḥ śrūyate uktam ca
translated: Among birds, the crow is said to be clever. And it is said:

original: narāṇāṃ nāpito dhūrtaḥ pakṣiṇāṃ caiva vāyasaḥ /
analyzed: narāṇām nāpitaḥ dhūrtaḥ pakṣiṇām ca eva vāyasaḥ
translated: The barber is a rogue among men, and the crow among birds,

original: daṃṣṭriṇāṃ ca śṛgālas tu śvebhikṣus tapasvinām // ///
analyzed: daṃṣṭriṇām ca śṛgālaḥ tu śvebhikṣuḥ tapasvinām
translated: and the jackal among those with fangs, and the mendicant monk among ascetics.

original: tad asyāpi vacanaṃ grāhyam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat asya api vacanam grāhyam uktam ca
translated: Therefore, his word should also be accepted. And it is said:

original: bahudhā bahubhiḥ sārdhaṃ cintitāḥ sunirūpitāḥ /
analyzed: bahudhā bahubhiḥ sārdham cintitāḥ su nirūpitāḥ
translated: Many things are thought of in many ways, well considered,

original: kathañcin na vilīyante vidvadbhiś cintitā nayāḥ // ///
analyzed: kathañcid na vilīyante vidvadbhiḥ cintitāḥ nayāḥ
translated: but somehow the policies thought of by the wise do not dissolve.

original: atha vāyasaḥ sametya tān āhaaho /
analyzed: atha vāyasaḥ sametya tān āha aho
translated: Then the crow approached them and said, Oh!

original: kiṃ mahājanasamāgamo 'yaṃ paramamahotsavaś ca /
analyzed: kim mahā jana samāgamaḥ yam parama mahā utsavaḥ ca
translated: Is this a great gathering of people and a great festival?

original: te procuḥbhoḥ /
analyzed: te procuḥ bhoḥ
translated: They said, Sir!

original: nāsti kaścid vihaṅgamānāṃ rājā /
analyzed: na asti kaścid vihaṅgamānām rājā
translated: There is no king of the birds.

original: tad asyolūkasya vihaṅgarājyābhiṣeko nirūpitas tiṣṭhati samastapakṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: tat asya ulūkasya vihaṅga rājya abhiṣekaḥ nirūpitaḥ tiṣṭhati samasta pakṣibhiḥ
translated: Therefore, this consecration of the owl as king of the birds is being performed by all the birds.

original: tattvam api svamataṃ dehi /
analyzed: tattvam api sva matam dehi
translated: So give your opinion too.

original: prastāve samāgato 'si /
analyzed: prastāve samāgataḥ si
translated: You have come at the right time.

original: athāsau kāko vihasyāhaaho /
analyzed: atha asau kākaḥ vihasya āha aho
translated: Then the crow laughed and said, Oh!

original: na yuktam etat /
analyzed: na yuktam etat
translated: This is not right.

original: yan mayūrahaṃsakokilacakravākaśukakāraṇḍavahārītasārasādiṣu pakṣipradhāneṣu vidyamāneṣu divāndhasyāsya karālavaktrasyābhiṣekaḥ kriyate
analyzed: yat mayūra haṃsa kokila cakravāka śuka kāraṇḍava hārīta sārasa ādiṣu pakṣi pradhāneṣu vidyamāneṣu divā andhasya asya karāla vaktrasya abhiṣekaḥ kriyate
translated: When there are foremost birds like peacocks, geese, cuckoos, ruddy geese, parrots, karandavas, and cranes, the consecration of this one with a terrible face, blind during the day, is being performed.

original: tatraitan mama matam / yataḥ
analyzed: tatra etat mama matam yatas
translated: There is this opinion of mine, namely:

original: vakranāsaṃ sujihmākṣaṃ krūram apriyadarśanam /
analyzed: vakra nāsam su jihma akṣam krūram apriya darśanam
translated: One with a crooked nose, very crooked eyes, cruel, and unpleasant to look at,

original: akruddhasyedṛśaṃ vaktraṃ bhavet kruddhasya kīdṛśam // ///
analyzed: akruddhasya īdṛśam vaktram bhavet kruddhasya kīdṛśam
translated: what will his face be like when angry, when he is not angry like this?

original: svabhāvaraudram atyugraṃ krūram apriyavādinam /
analyzed: svabhāva raudram ati ugram krūram apriya vādinam
translated: Making an owl the king, who is naturally fierce, very violent, cruel, and unpleasant to speak to,

original: ulūkaṃ nṛpatiṃ kṛtvā kā naḥ siddhir bhaviṣyati // ///
analyzed: ulūkam nṛpatim kṛtvā kā naḥ siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: what success will we have?

original: aparaṃ vainateye svāmini sthite kim eṣa divāndhaḥ kriyate rājā /
analyzed: aparam vainateye svāmini sthite kim eṣa divā andhaḥ kriyate rājā
translated: Moreover, when Garuḍa is the lord, why is this one blind during the day being made king?

original: tad yadyapi guṇavān bhavati /
analyzed: tat yadi api guṇavān bhavati
translated: Even if he has good qualities,

original: tathāpy ekasmin svāmini sthite nānyo bhūpaḥ praśasyate /
analyzed: tathā api ekasmin svāmini sthite na anyaḥ bhūpaḥ praśasyate
translated: nevertheless, when there is one lord, another king is not praised.

original: eka eva hitārthāya tejasvī pārthivo bhuvaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva hita arthāya tejasvī pārthivaḥ bhuvaḥ
translated: One powerful king alone is for the good of the earth,

original: yugānta iva bhāsvanto bahavo 'tra vipattaye // ///
analyzed: yuga ante iva bhāsvantaḥ bahavaḥ tra vipattaye
translated: many like suns at the end of an aeon are here for destruction.

original: tat tasya nāmnāpi yūyaṃ pareṣām agamyā bhaviṣyatha / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat tasya nāmnā api yūyam pareṣām agamyāḥ bhaviṣyatha uktam ca
translated: By the mere mention of his name, you will become inaccessible to others. It is said:

original: gurūṇāṃ nāmamātre'pi gṛhīte svāmisambhave /
analyzed: gurūṇām nāma mātre api gṛhīte svāmi sambhave
translated: Even by merely uttering the names of superiors, when there is a master,

original: duṣṭānāṃ purataḥ kṣemaṃ tatkṣaṇād eva jāyate // ///
analyzed: duṣṭānām puratas kṣemam tad kṣaṇāt eva jāyate
translated: the safety of the wicked arises instantly in front of them.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: vyapadeśena mahatāṃ siddiḥ sañjāyate parā /
analyzed: vyapadeśena mahatām siddiḥ sañjāyate parā
translated: By the great designation, supreme success arises.

original: śaśino vyapadeśena vasanti śaśakāḥ sukham // ///
analyzed: śaśinaḥ vyapadeśena vasanti śaśakāḥ sukham
translated: By the designation of the moon, rabbits live happily.

original: pakṣiṇa ūcuḥkatham etat /
analyzed: pakṣiṇaḥ ūcuḥ katham etat
translated: The birds said: How is this?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: caturdantanāmamahāgajakathā
analyzed: catur danta nāma mahā gaja kathā
translated: The Story of the Great Elephant Named Four-Tusked

original: kasmiṃścid vane caturdanto nāma mahāgajo yūthādhipaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid vane caturdantaḥ nāma mahā gajaḥ yūtha adhipaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain forest, a great elephant named Four-Tusked lived as the leader of a herd.

original: tatra kadācin mahaty anāvṛṣṭiḥ sañjātā prabhūtavarṣāṇi yāvat /
analyzed: tatra kadācid mahatī anāvṛṣṭiḥ sañjātā prabhūta varṣāṇi yāvat
translated: One day, a great drought occurred there, lasting for many years.

original: tayā taḍāgahradapalvalasarāṃsi śoṣam upagatāni /
analyzed: tayā taḍāga hrada palvala sarāṃsi śoṣam upagatāni
translated: Because of that, the ponds, lakes, marshes, and pools dried up.

original: atha taiḥ samastagajaiḥ sa gajarājaḥ proktaḥdeva /
analyzed: atha taiḥ samasta gajaiḥ sa gaja rājaḥ proktaḥ deva
translated: Then all the elephants said to that king of elephants, Your Majesty,

original: pipāsākulā gajakalabhā mṛtaprāyā apare mṛtāś ca /
analyzed: pipāsā ākulāḥ gaja kalabhāḥ mṛta prāyāḥ apare mṛtāḥ ca
translated: the young elephants are afflicted with thirst, some are dying and others have died.

original: tad anviṣyatāṃ kaścij jalāśayo yatra jalapānena svasthatāṃ vrajanti /
analyzed: tat anviṣyatām kaścid jalāśayaḥ yatra jala pānena svastha tām vrajanti
translated: Therefore, let some water reservoir be sought out, where they can drink water and become well.

original: tataś ciraṃ dhyātvā tenābhihitamasti mahāhrado vivikte pradeśe sthalamadhyagataḥ pātālagaṅgājalena sadaiva pūrṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ciram dhyātvā tena abhihitam asti mahāhradaḥ vivikte pradeśe sthala madhya gataḥ pātālagaṅgā jalena sadā eva pūrṇaḥ
translated: Then, after thinking for a long time, he said, There is a great lake in a secluded place, in the middle of the land, always full with the water of the Ganges of the underworld.

original: tat tatra gamyatāṃ iti /
analyzed: tat tatra gamyatām iti
translated: Go there.

original: tathānuṣṭḥite pañcarātram upasarpadbhiḥ samāsāditas taiḥ sa hradaḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭḥite pañca rātram upasarpadbhiḥ samāsāditaḥ taiḥ sa hradaḥ
translated: When they did as he said, after five nights of approaching, they reached that lake.

original: tatra svecchayā jalam avagāhyās tam anavelāyāṃ niṣkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: tatra sva icchayā jalam avagāhyāḥ tam anavelāyām niṣkrāntāḥ
translated: There, they entered the water as they wished and came out at an improper time.

original: tasya ca hradasya samantāc chaśakabilāni asaṅkhyāni sukomalabhūmau tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tasya ca hradasya samantāt śaśaka bilāni asaṅkhyāni su komala bhūmau tiṣṭhanti
translated: And all around that lake, there are countless rabbit holes in the very soft ground.

original: tāny api samastair api tair gajair itas tato bhramadbhiḥ paribhagnāni /
analyzed: tāni api samastaiḥ api taiḥ gajaiḥ itas tatas bhramadbhiḥ paribhagnāni
translated: Those were also completely destroyed by those elephants wandering here and there.

original: bahavaḥ śaśakāḥ bhagnapādaśirogrīvā vihitāḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ śaśakāḥ bhagna pāda śiraḥ grīvāḥ vihitāḥ
translated: Many rabbits had their legs, heads, and necks broken.

original: kecin mṛtāḥ kecij jīvaśeṣā jātāḥ /
analyzed: kecid mṛtāḥ kecid jīva śeṣāḥ jātāḥ
translated: Some died, some were left alive.

original: atha gate tasmin gajayūthe śaśakāḥ sodvegā gajapādakṣuṇṇasamāvāsāḥ kecid bhagnapādāḥ /
analyzed: atha gate tasmin gaja yūthe śaśakāḥ sa udvegāḥ gaja pāda kṣuṇṇa samāvāsāḥ kecid bhagna pādāḥ
translated: Then, when that herd of elephants had gone, the rabbits, their dwelling places trampled by the elephants' feet, were distressed. Some had broken legs.

original: anye jarjaritakalevarā rudhiraplutāḥ /
analyzed: anye jarjarita kalevarāḥ rudhira plutāḥ
translated: Others had their bodies crushed and were covered in blood.

original: anye hataśiśavo bāṣpapihitalocanāḥ sametya mitho mantraṃ cakruḥaho vinaṣṭā vayam /
analyzed: anye hata śiśavaḥ bāṣpa pihita locanāḥ sametya mithas mantram cakruḥ aho vinaṣṭāḥ vayam
translated: Others, their young ones killed, their eyes filled with tears, gathered together and consulted with each other: Alas, we are ruined.

original: nityam evaitad gajayūtham āgamiṣyati yato nānyatra jalam asti /
analyzed: nityam eva etat gaja yūtham āgamiṣyati yatas na anyatra jalam asti
translated: This herd of elephants always comes here, because there is no water elsewhere.

original: tat sarveṣāṃ nāśo bhaviṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat sarveṣām nāśaḥ bhaviṣyati uktam ca
translated: Therefore, our destruction is certain. And it is said:

original: spṛśann api gajo hanti jighrann api bhujaṅgamaḥ /
analyzed: spṛśan api gajaḥ hanti jighran api bhujaṅgamaḥ
translated: Even a touched elephant kills, even a smelling snake kills,

original: hasann api nṛpo hanti mānayann api durjanaḥ // ///
analyzed: hasan api nṛpaḥ hanti mānayan api durjanaḥ
translated: even a laughing king kills, even a respected bad person kills.

original: tac cintyatāṃ kaścid upāyaḥ /
analyzed: tat cintyatām kaścid upāyaḥ
translated: Therefore, let some means be considered.

original: tatraikaḥ provācagamyatāṃ deśatyāgena /
analyzed: tatra ekaḥ provāca gamyatām deśa tyāgena
translated: There, one said: Let us go by abandoning the country.

original: kim anyat / uktaṃ ca manunā vyāsena ca🔽tyajed ekaṃ kulasyārthe grāmasyārthe kulaṃ tyajet /
analyzed: kim anyat uktam ca manunā vyāsena ca  tyajet ekam kulasya arthe grāmasya arthe kulam tyajet
translated: What else? And it is said by Manu and Vyasa:🔽One should abandon one for the sake of a family, a family for the sake of a village,

original: grāmaṃ janapadasyārthe ātmārthe pṛthivīṃ tyajet // ///
analyzed: grāmam janapadasya arthe ātma arthe pṛthivīm tyajet
translated: a village for the sake of a country, and the earth for one's own sake.

original: kṣemyāṃ śasyapradāṃ nityaṃ paśuvṛddhikarīm api /
analyzed: kṣemyām śasya pradām nityam paśu vṛddhi karīm api
translated: Even if it is always prosperous, productive of crops, and increases cattle,

original: parityajen nṛpo bhūmim ātmārtham avicārayan // ///🔽āpadarthe dhanaṃ rakṣed dārān rakṣed dhanair api /
analyzed: parityajet nṛpaḥ bhūmim ātma artham a vicārayan  āpad arthe dhanam rakṣet dārān rakṣet dhanaiḥ api
translated: a king should abandon the land without hesitation for his own sake.🔽For the sake of calamity, one should protect wealth, and one should protect one's wife even with wealth,

original: ātmānaṃ satataṃ rakṣed dārair api dhanair api // ///
analyzed: ātmānam satatam rakṣet dāraiḥ api dhanaiḥ api
translated: one should always protect oneself even with one's wife and wealth.

original: tataś cānye procuḥbhoḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca anye procuḥ bhoḥ
translated: Then others said, Ah!

original: pitṛpaitāmahaṃ sthānaṃ na śakyate sahasā tyaktum /
analyzed: pitṛpaitāmaham sthānam na śakyate sahasā tyaktum
translated: It is not possible to suddenly abandon the place of our fathers and grandfathers.

original: tat kriyatāṃ teṣāṃ kṛte kācid vibhīṣikā /
analyzed: tat kriyatām teṣām kṛte kācid vibhīṣikā
translated: So let us make some kind of threat against them.

original: yat katham api daivān na samāyānti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yat katham api daivāt na samāyānti uktam ca
translated: By some means or other, by fate, they will not come. And it is said:

original: nirviṣeṇāpi sarpeṇa kartavyā mahatī phaṭā /
analyzed: nirviṣeṇa api sarpeṇa kartavyā mahatī phaṭā
translated: Even a harmless snake should be made to hiss loudly.

original: viṣaṃ bhavatu mā vāstu phaṭāṭopo bhayaṅkaraḥ // ///
analyzed: viṣam bhavatu mā vā astu phaṭa āṭopaḥ bhayaṅkaraḥ
translated: Let the poison be or not, the hissing is terrifying.

original: athānye procuḥyady evaṃ tatas teṣāṃ mahadvibhīṣikāsthānam asti yena nāgamiṣyanti /
analyzed: atha anye procuḥ yadi evam tatas teṣām mahat vibhīṣikā sthānam asti yena na āgamiṣyanti
translated: Then others said: If that is so, then there is a great place of fear for them by which they will not come.

original: sā ca caturadūtāyattā vibhīṣikā /
analyzed: sā ca catura dūta āyattā vibhīṣikā
translated: And that threat depends on four messengers.

original: yato vijayadatto nāmāsmatsvāmī śaśakaś candramaṇḍale nivasati /
analyzed: yatas vijayadattaḥ nāma asmad svāmī śaśakaḥ candra maṇḍale nivasati
translated: Because our master named Vijaya-datta and the hare live in the lunar sphere.

original: tat preṣyatāṃ kaścin mithyādūto yūthādhipasakāśaṃ yac candras tvām atra hrada āgacchantaṃ niṣedhayati /
analyzed: tat preṣyatām kaścid mithyā dūtaḥ yūtha adhipa sakāśam yat candraḥ tvām atra hrade āgacchantam niṣedhayati
translated: So let some false messenger be sent to the leader of the herd, who says that the moon forbids you from coming here to the lake.

original: yato 'smatparigraho 'sya samantād vasati /
analyzed: yatas smat parigrahaḥ sya samantāt vasati
translated: Because our possession lives all around it.

original: evam abhihite śraddheyavacanāt kadāpi nivartate /
analyzed: evam abhihite śraddheya vacanāt kadāpi nivartate
translated: When this is said, he may turn back, because his words are credible.

original: athānye procuḥyady evaṃ tad asti lambakarṇo nāma śaśakaḥ /
analyzed: atha anye procuḥ yadi evam tat asti lambakarṇaḥ nāma śaśakaḥ
translated: Then others said: If that is so, then there is a hare named Long-Ear.

original: sa ca vacanaracanācaturo dūtakarmajñaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca vacana racanā caturaḥ dūta karma jñaḥ
translated: And he is skilled in the art of speech and knows the work of a messenger.

original: sa tatra preṣyatām iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: sa tatra preṣyatām iti uktam ca
translated: And it is said:

original: sākāro niḥspṛho vāgmī nānāśāstravicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa ākāraḥ niḥspṛhaḥ vāgmī nānā śāstra vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: One with expression, free from desire, eloquent, skilled in various scriptures,

original: paracittāvagantā ca rājño dūtaḥ sa iṣyate // ///
analyzed: para citta avagantā ca rājñaḥ dūtaḥ saḥ iṣyate
translated: and able to understand the minds of others - he is considered the king's messenger.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore:

original: yo mūrkhaṃ laulyasampannaṃ rājadvārikam ācaret /
analyzed: yaḥ mūrkham laulya sampannam rājadvārikam ācaret
translated: One who employs a foolish, lustful person at the king's gate,

original: mithyāvādaṃ viśeṣeṇa tasya kāryaṃ na sidhyati // ///
analyzed: mithyā vādam viśeṣeṇa tasya kāryam na sidhyati
translated: especially one who speaks falsely, his work will not be accomplished.

original: tad anviṣyatāṃ yady asmād vyasanād ātmanāṃ sunirmuktiḥ /
analyzed: tat anviṣyatām yadi asmāt vyasanāt ātmanām su nirmuktiḥ
translated: So let us search for a way to be completely freed from this calamity.

original: athānye procuḥaho yuktam etat /
analyzed: atha anye procuḥ aho yuktam etat
translated: Then others said: This is right.

original: nānyaḥ kaścid upāyo 'smākaṃ jīvitasya /
analyzed: na anyaḥ kaścid upāyaḥ smākam jīvitasya
translated: There is no other means for us to live.

original: tathaiva kriyatām /🔽atha lambakarṇo gajayūthādhipasamīpe nirūpito gataś ca /
analyzed: tathā eva kriyatām  atha lambakarṇaḥ gaja yūtha adhipa samīpe nirūpitaḥ gataḥ ca
translated: Let it be done in the same way.🔽Then Long Ears was appointed near the leader of the elephant herd and went there.

original: tathānuṣṭhite lambakarṇo 'pi gajamārgam āsādyāgamyaṃ sthalam āruhya taṃ gajam uvācabhoḥ bhoḥ duṣṭagaja /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite lambakarṇaḥ gaja mārgam āsādya agamyam sthalam āruhya tam gajam uvāca bhoḥ bhoḥ duṣṭa gaja
translated: When that was done, Long Ears reached the elephant path, climbed to an inaccessible place, and said to that elephant: Hey, hey, you wicked elephant!

original: kim evaṃ līlayā niḥśaṅkayātra candrahrada āgacchasi /
analyzed: kim evam līlayā niḥśaṅkayā atra candrahrade āgacchasi
translated: Why do you come here to Moon Lake so playfully and fearlessly?

original: tan nāgantavyaṃ nivartyatām iti /
analyzed: tat na āgantavyam nivartyatām iti
translated: So you should not come here. Turn back!

original: tad ākarṇya vismitamanā gaja āhabhoḥ / kas tvam /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya vismita manāḥ gajaḥ āha bhoḥ kaḥ tvam
translated: Hearing this, the elephant was amazed and said, Who are you?

original: sa āhaahaṃ lambakarṇo nāma śaśakaś candramaṇḍale vasāmi /
analyzed: saḥ āha aham lambakarṇaḥ nāma śaśakaḥ candra maṇḍale vasāmi
translated: He replied, I am a rabbit named Long-Ear who lives in the lunar sphere.

original: sāmprataṃ bhagavatā candramasā tava pārśve prahito dūtaḥ /
analyzed: sāmpratam bhagavatā candramasā tava pārśve prahitaḥ dūtaḥ
translated: Now the Blessed One, the Moon, has sent me as a messenger to you.

original: jānāty eva bhavān /
analyzed: jānāti eva bhavān
translated: You know that.

original: yathārthavādino dūtasya na doṣaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: yathārtha vādinaḥ dūtasya na doṣaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: A messenger who speaks the truth should not be harmed.

original: dūtamukhā hi rājānaḥ sarva eva / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: dūta mukhāḥ hi rājānaḥ sarve eva uktam ca
translated: For all kings are like messengers. And it is said:

original: udyateṣv api śastreṣu bandhuvargavadheṣv api /
analyzed: udyateṣu api śastreṣu bandhu varga vadheṣu api
translated: Even when weapons are raised, even when kinsmen are being killed,

original: puruṣāṇy api jalpanto vadhyā dūtā na bhūbhujā // ///
analyzed: puruṣāṇi api jalpantaḥ vadhyāḥ dūtāḥ na bhūbhujā
translated: messengers should not be killed by kings, even if they speak harshly.

original: tac chrutvā sa āhabhoḥ śaśaka /
analyzed: tat śrutvā saḥ āha bhoḥ śaśaka
translated: Hearing this, the elephant said, Oh rabbit!

original: tat kathaya bhagavataś candramasaḥ sandeśam /
analyzed: tat kathaya bhagavataḥ candramasaḥ sandeśam
translated: Then tell me the message of the Blessed One, the Moon.

original: yena satvaraṃ kriyate /
analyzed: yena satvaram kriyate
translated: So that it can be quickly carried out.

original: sa āhabhavatātītadivase yūthena sahāgacchatā prabhūtāḥ śaśakā nipātitāḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhavatā atīta divase yūthena saha āgacchatā prabhūtāḥ śaśakāḥ nipātitāḥ
translated: He replied, Yesterday, when you came with your herd, many rabbits were killed.

original: tat kiṃ na vetti bhavān /
analyzed: tat kim na vetti bhavān
translated: Don't you know that?

original: yan mama parigraho 'yam /
analyzed: yat mama parigrahaḥ yam
translated: This is my possession.
