original: tad yadi jīvitena te prayojanaṃ tadā kenāpi prayojanenāpy atra hrade nāgantavyam iti sandeśaḥ /
analyzed: tat yadi jīvitena te prayojanam tadā kena api prayojanena api atra hrade nā āgantavyam iti sandeśaḥ
translated: So if you value your life, then the message is that you should not come to this lake for any reason.

original: gaja āhaatha kva vartate bhagavān svāmī candraḥ /
analyzed: gajaḥ āha atha kva vartate bhagavān svāmī candraḥ
translated: Where is your master, the moon?

original: sa āhaatra hrade sāmprataṃ śaśakānāṃ bhavadyūthamathitānāṃ hataśeṣāṇāṃ samāśvāsanāya samāyātas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: saḥ āha atra hrade sāmpratam śaśakānām bhavat yūtha mathitānām hata śeṣāṇām samāśvāsanāya samāyātaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: He replied: “He has come here to comfort the survivors of the rabbit tribe, who were crushed by your herd. He is staying in this lake.

original: ahaṃ punas tavāntikaṃ preṣitaḥ /
analyzed: aham punar tava antikam preṣitaḥ
translated: And I have been sent to you.

original: gaja āhayady evaṃ tad darśaya me taṃ svāminaṃ yena praṇamyānyatra gacchāmi /
analyzed: gajaḥ āha yadi evam tat darśaya me tam svāminam yena praṇamya anyatra gacchāmi
translated: ” The elephant said: “If that is so, show me that master, so that I can bow to him and go elsewhere.

original: śaśaka āhaāgaccha mayā sahaikakī yena darśayāmi /
analyzed: śaśakaḥ āha āgaccha mayā saha ekakī yena darśayāmi
translated: ” The rabbit said: “Come with me alone, so that I can show you.

original: tathānuṣṭhite śaśako niśāsamaye taṃ hradatīre nītvā jalamadhye sthitaṃ candrabimbam adarśayat /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite śaśakaḥ niśā samaye tam hrada tīre nītvā jala madhye sthitam candra bimbam adarśayat
translated: ” When they did that, the rabbit took him to the shore of the lake at night and showed him the moon’s orb in the water.

original: āha cabhoḥ eṣa naḥ svāmī jalamadhye samādhisthas tiṣṭhati tannibhṛtaṃ praṇamya vrajeti /
analyzed: āha cabhoḥ eṣa naḥ svāmī jala madhye samādhi sthaḥ tiṣṭhati tat nibhṛtam praṇamya vraja iti
translated: And he said: “Sir, our master is meditating in the water. So go after bowing to him silently.

original: no cet / samādhibhaṅgabhayād bhūyo 'pi prabhūtaṃ kopaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: no ced samādhi bhaṅga bhayāt prabhūtam kopam kariṣyati
translated: Otherwise, out of fear of disturbing his meditation, he will again become very angry.

original: atha gajo 'pi trastamanās taṃ praṇamya punar gamanāya prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha gajaḥ pi trasta manāḥ tam praṇamya punar gamanāya prasthitaḥ
translated: ” Then the elephant, his mind frightened, bowed to him and set out to go again.

original: śaśakaś ca taddinād ārabhya saparivārāḥ sukhena sveṣu sthāneṣu tiṣṭhanti sma /
analyzed: śaśakaḥ ca tad dināt ārabhya sa parivārāḥ sukhena sveṣu sthāneṣu tiṣṭhanti sma
translated: And from that day on, the hare and his family lived happily in their own place.🔽That's why I say: Even with a great pretext...

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmi vyapadeśena mahatām iti / api ca🔽kṣudram alasaṃ kāpuruṣaṃ vyasaninam akṛtajñaṃ jīvitakāmaḥ /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi vyapadeśena mahatām iti api ca  kṣudram alasam kāpuruṣam vyasaninam akṛtajñam jīvita kāmaḥ
translated: Moreover,🔽One who desires to live should not appoint a petty, lazy, cowardly, addicted, ungrateful person to the position of master,

original: pṛṣṭhapralapanaśīlaṃ svāmitve nābhiyojayet // ///
analyzed: pṛṣṭha pralapana śīlam svāmi tve na abhiyojayet
translated: Who is accustomed to backbiting.

original: tathā ca🔽kṣudram arthapatiṃ prāpya nyāyānveṣaṇatatparau /
analyzed: tathā ca  kṣudram arthapatim prāpya nyāya anveṣaṇa tatparau
translated: And so it is said:🔽Having obtained a petty master, both the hare and the partridge, intent on seeking justice,

original: ubhāv api kṣayaṃ prāptau purā śaśakapiñjalau // ///
analyzed: ubhau api kṣayam prāptau purā śaśa kapiñjalau
translated: Have perished in the past.

original: te procuḥkatham etat /
analyzed: te procuḥ katham etat
translated: They said, How is that?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: Story

original: śaśakapiñjalakathā
analyzed: śaśa kapiñjala kathā
translated: The story of the hare and the partridge

original: kasmiṃścid vṛkṣe purāham avasam /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid vṛkṣe purā aham avasam
translated: Long ago, I lived in a certain tree.

original: tatrādhastāt koṭare kapiñjalo nāma caṭakaḥ prativasati sma /🔽atha sadaivāstam anavelāyām āgatayor dvayor anekasubhāṣitagoṣṭhyā devarṣibrahmarṣirājarṣipurāṇacaritakīrtanena
analyzed: tatra adhastāt koṭare kapiñjalaḥ nāma caṭakaḥ prativasati sma  atha sadā eva astam anavelāyām āgatayoḥ dvayoḥ aneka subhāṣita goṣṭhyā devarṣi brahmarṣi rājarṣi purāṇa carita kīrtanena
translated: Below it, in a hole, lived a partridge named Kapinjala.🔽Then, at the time of sunset, the two of us, having come, experienced great happiness by conversing about many good sayings, by narrating the stories of celestial sages, brahmin sages, royal sages and ancient heroes,

original: ca paryaṭanadṛṣṭānekakautūhalaprakathanena ca paramasukham anubhavatoḥ kālo vrajati /
analyzed: ca paryaṭana dṛṣṭa aneka kautūhala prakathanena ca parama sukham anubhavatoḥ kālaḥ vrajati
translated: And by recounting the many wonders seen while wandering.🔽Time passed for us in this way.

original: atha kadācit kapiñjalaḥ prāṇayātrārtham anyaiś caṭakaiḥ sahānyaṃ pakvaśāliprāñaṃ deśaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid kapiñjalaḥ prāṇayātrā artham anyaiḥ caṭakaiḥ saha anyam pakva śāli prāñam deśam gataḥ
translated: One day, in order to get food, the partridge went to another place with some other partridges, where there was ripe grain.

original: tato yāvan niśāsamaye'pi nāyātas tāvad ahaṃ sodvegamanās tadviprayogaduḥkhitaś cintitavānaho kim adya kapiñjalo nāyātaḥ /🔽kiṃ kenāpi pāśena baddhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas yāvat niśā samaye api na āyātaḥ tāvat aham sa udvega manāḥ tad viprayoga duḥkhitaḥ cintitavān aho kim adya kapiñjalaḥ na āyātaḥ  kim kena api pāśena baddhaḥ
translated: Then, even at nightfall, he did not return. I became anxious and, afflicted by the pain of separation from him, I thought: Alas! Why hasn't the partridge come today?🔽Has he been caught in a trap by someone?

original: āho svit kenāpi vyāpāditaḥ /
analyzed: āho svid kena api vyāpāditaḥ
translated: Or has he been killed by someone?

original: sarvathā yadi kuśalo bhavati /
analyzed: sarvathā yadi kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: In any case, if he is well,

original: yan māṃ vinā na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yat mām vinā na tiṣṭhati
translated: he will not stay without me.

original: evaṃ me cintayato bahūny anyāni vyatikrāntāni /
analyzed: evam me cintayataḥ bahūni anyāni vyatikrāntāni
translated: While I was thinking this way, many days passed.

original: tataś ca tatra koṭare kadācic chīghrago nāma śaśako 'stam anavelāyām āgatya praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca tatra koṭare kadācid śīghragaḥ nāma anavelāyām āgatya praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, one day, a hare named Swift entered that hole at sunset.

original: mayāpi kapiñjalanirāśatvena na nivāritaḥ /
analyzed: mayā api kapiñjala nirāśa tvena na nivāritaḥ
translated: Since I had lost hope of the partridge, I did not stop him.

original: athānyasminn ahani kapiñjalaḥ śālibhakṣaṇād atīva pīvaratanuḥ svāśrayaṃ smṛtvā bhūyo 'py atraiva samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: atha anyasmin ahani kapiñjalaḥ śāli bhakṣaṇāt atīva pīvara tanuḥ sva āśrayam smṛtvā bhūyas pi atra eva samāyātaḥ
translated: Then, on another day, the partridge, having eaten a lot of grain, became very fat. Remembering his home, he came back to that same place.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: na tādṛg jāyate saukhyam api svarge śarīriṇām /
analyzed: na tādṛś jāyate saukhyam api svarge śarīriṇām
translated: Such happiness is not born even in heaven for embodied beings,🔽as is born in the heart of the virtuous when they are united with the virtuous.

original: dāridrye'pi hi yādṛk syāt svadeśe svapure gṛhe // ///
analyzed: dāridrye api hi yādṛś syāt sva deśe sva pure gṛhe
translated: Even in poverty, one should be like this in one's own country, city, and house.

original: athāsau koṭarāntargataṃ śaśakaṃ dṛṣṭvā sākṣepam āhabhoḥ śaśaka /
analyzed: atha asau koṭara antargatam śaśakam dṛṣṭvā sa ākṣepam āha bhoḥ śaśaka
translated: Then, seeing the rabbit inside the hole, he said reproachfully, Oh rabbit.

original: na tvayā sundaraṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: na tvayā sundaram kṛtam
translated: You have not done well.

original: yan mamāvasathasthāne praviṣṭo 'si /
analyzed: yat mama āvasatha sthāne praviṣṭaḥ si
translated: You have entered my dwelling place.

original: tac chīghraṃ niṣkramyatām /
analyzed: tat śīghram niṣkramyatām
translated: So get out quickly.

original: śaśaka āhana tavedaṃ gṛham /
analyzed: śaśakaḥ āhana tava idam gṛham
translated: The rabbit said, This is not your house.

original: kintu mamaiva /
analyzed: kintu mama eva
translated: But it is mine.

original: tat kiṃ mithyā paruṣāṇi jalpasi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat kim mithyā paruṣāṇi jalpasi uktam ca
translated: So why do you speak harsh words falsely? And it is said:

original: vāpīkūpataḍāgānāṃ devālayakujanmanām /
analyzed: vāpī kūpa taḍāgānām devālaya ku janmanām
translated: Of wells, wells, and ponds, of temples and houses,

original: utsargāt parataḥ svāmyam api kartuṃ na śakyate // ///
analyzed: utsargāt paratas svāmyam api kartum na śakyate
translated: Ownership after abandonment cannot be established even by witnesses or written documents.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: pratyakṣaṃ yasya yad bhuktaṃ kṣetrādyaṃ daśa vatsarān /
analyzed: pratyakṣam yasya yat bhuktam kṣetra ādyam daśa vatsarān
translated: If something is enjoyed by someone for ten years, that is direct evidence.

original: tatra bhuktiḥ pramāṇaṃ syād na sākṣī nākṣarāṇi vā // ///
analyzed: tatra bhuktiḥ pramāṇam syāt na sākṣī na akṣarāṇi vā
translated: There, enjoyment would be the evidence, not witnesses or written documents.

original: mānuṣāṇām ayaṃ nyāyo munibhiḥ parikīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: mānuṣāṇām ayam nyāyaḥ munibhiḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: This is the rule for humans, proclaimed by the sages.

original: tiraścāṃ ca vihaṅgānāṃ yāvad eva samāśrayaḥ // ///
analyzed: tiraścām ca vihaṅgānām yāvat eva samāśrayaḥ
translated: And for animals and birds, as long as it is a shelter.

original: tan mamaitad gṛham / na taveti /
analyzed: tat mama etat gṛham na tava iti
translated: So this is my house, not yours.

original: kapiñjala āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: kapiñjalaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Kapinjala said, Oh.

original: yadi smṛtiṃ pramāṇīkaroṣi /
analyzed: yadi smṛtim pramāṇīkaroṣi
translated: If you consider memory to be authoritative,

original: tad āgaccha mayā saha yena smṛtipāṭhakaṃ pṛṣṭvā sa yasya dadāti sa gṛhṇātu /
analyzed: tat āgaccha mayā saha yena smṛti pāṭhakam pṛṣṭvā sa yasya dadāti sa gṛhṇātu
translated: So come with me, so that we can ask a reciter of the Smṛti, and whoever he gives it to, he can take it.

original: tathānuṣṭhite mayāpi cintitaṃkim atra bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite mayā api cintitam kim atra bhaviṣyati
translated: When this was done, I also thought, What will happen here?

original: mayā draṣṭavyo 'yaṃ nyāyaḥ /
analyzed: mayā draṣṭavyaḥ yam nyāyaḥ
translated: I must see this justice.

original: tataḥ kautukād aham api tāv anuprasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kautukāt aham api tau anuprasthitaḥ
translated: Then out of curiosity, I too set out after them.

original: atrāntare tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭro nāmāraṇyamārjāras tayor vivādaṃ śrutvā mārgāsannaṃ nadītaṭam
analyzed: atrā antare tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭraḥ nāma araṇya mārjāraḥ tayoḥ vivādam śrutvā mārga āsannam nadī taṭam
translated: In the meantime, a forest cat named Sharp-Fangs, having heard their dispute, reached a riverbank near the road,

original: āsādya kṛtakuśopagraho nimīlitanayana ūrdhvabāhur ardhapādaspṛṣṭabhūmiḥ śrīsūryābhimukha
analyzed: āsādya kṛta kuśa upagrahaḥ nimīlita nayanaḥ ūrdhva bāhuḥ ardha pāda spṛṣṭa bhūmiḥ śrī sūrya abhimukha
translated: and having arranged some kusha grass, with closed eyes, raised arms, and half a foot touching the ground, he faced the glorious sun

original: imāṃ dharmopadeśanām akarotaho /
analyzed: imām dharma upadeśanām akarota ho
translated: and made this Dharma teaching: Alas!

original: asāro 'yaṃ saṃsāraḥ /
analyzed: asāraḥ yam saṃsāraḥ
translated: This world is insubstantial.

original: kṣaṇabhaṅgurāḥ prāṇāḥ /🔽svapnasadṛśaḥ priyasamāgamaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇa bhaṅgurāḥ prāṇāḥ  svapna sadṛśaḥ priya samāgamaḥ
translated: Life is fleeting.🔽The union with loved ones is like a dream.

original: indrajālavat kuṭumbaparigraho 'yam /
analyzed: indrajāla vat kuṭumba parigrahaḥ yam
translated: This family and possessions are like a magic trick.

original: tad dharmaṃ muktvā nānyā gatir asti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat dharmam muktvā na anyā gatiḥ asti uktam ca
translated: Therefore, apart from Dharma, there is no other refuge. And it is said:

original: anityāni śarīrāṇi vibhavo naiva śāśvataḥ /
analyzed: anityāni śarīrāṇi vibhavaḥ nā eva śāśvataḥ
translated: The bodies are impermanent, wealth is not eternal,🔽Death is always present, the collection of Dharma should be done.

original: nityaṃ saṃnihito mṛtyuḥ kartavyo dharmasaṃgrahaḥ // ///
analyzed: nityam saṃnihitaḥ mṛtyuḥ kartavyaḥ dharma saṃgrahaḥ
translated: Death is always present. The collection of Dharma should be done.

original: yasya dharmavihīnāni dināny āyānti yānti ca /
analyzed: yasya dharma vihīnāni dināni āyānti yānti ca
translated: He whose days pass by devoid of dharma,

original: sa lohakārabhastreva śvasann api na jīvati // ///
analyzed: sa lohakāra bhastrā iva śvasan api na jīvati
translated: he lives like a blacksmith's bellows, breathing but not alive.

original: nācchādayati kaupīnaṃ na daṃśamaśakāpaham /
analyzed: na ācchādayati kaupīnam na daṃśa maśaka apaham
translated: He who does not cover his private parts, nor protect against mosquitoes and flies,

original: śunaḥpuccham iva vyarthaṃ pāṇḍityaṃ dharmavarjitam // ///
analyzed: śunaḥpuccham iva vyartham pāṇḍityam dharma varjitam
translated: his learning, devoid of dharma, is as useless as a dog's tail.

original: anyac ca🔽pulākā iva dhānyeṣu pūtikā iv pakṣiṣu /
analyzed: anyat ca  pulākāḥ iva dhānyeṣu pūtikāḥ iva pakṣiṣu
translated: And furthermore:🔽Those for whom dharma is not the reason, they are like husks in grains, like rotten birds,

original: maśakā iva martyeṣu yeṣāṃ dharmo na kāraṇam // ///
analyzed: maśakāḥ iva martyeṣu yeṣām dharmaḥ na kāraṇam
translated: like mosquitoes among mortals.

original: śreyaḥ puṣpaphalaṃ vṛkṣād dadhnaḥ śreyo ghṛtaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: śreyaḥ puṣpa phalam vṛkṣāt dadhnaḥ śreyaḥ ghṛtam smṛtam
translated: The best fruit is from a tree, the best product is ghee from curd,

original: śreyas tailaṃ ca puṇyākāc chreyān dharmas tu mānuṣāt // ///
analyzed: śreyaḥ tailam ca puṇyākāt śreyān dharmaḥ tu mānuṣāt
translated: the best oil is from holy sesame, but dharma is better than human.

original: sṛṣṭā mūtrapurīṣārtham āhārāya ca kevalam /
analyzed: sṛṣṭāḥ mūtra purīṣa artham āhārāya ca kevalam
translated: They are created only for the purpose of urine, feces, and food,

original: dharmahīnāḥ parārthāya puruṣāḥ paśavo yathā // ///
analyzed: dharma hīnāḥ parārthāya puruṣāḥ paśavaḥ yathā
translated: men devoid of dharma are like animals for the sake of others.

original: sthairyaṃ sarveṣu kṛtyeṣu śaṃsanti nayapaṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: sthairyam sarveṣu kṛtyeṣu śaṃsanti naya paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise in policy praise steadfastness in all undertakings,

original: bahvantarāyayuktasya dharmasya tvaritā gatiḥ // ///
analyzed: bahu antarāya yuktasya dharmasya tvaritā gatiḥ
translated: but the course of dharma is swift for one beset with many obstacles.

original: saṅkṣepāt kathyate dharmo janāḥ kiṃ vistareṇa vaḥ /
analyzed: saṅkṣepāt kathyate dharmaḥ janāḥ kim vistareṇa vaḥ
translated: Dharma is being told in brief, people, what is the use of elaborating?

original: paropakāraḥ puṇyāya pāpāya parapīḍanam // ///
analyzed: para upakāraḥ puṇyāya pāpāya para pīḍanam
translated: Helping others is for merit, harming others is for sin.

original: śrūyatāṃ dharmasarvasvaṃ śrutvā caivāvadhāryatām /
analyzed: śrūyatām dharma sarvasvam śrutvā ca eva avadhāryatām
translated: Listen to the essence of Dharma, and having heard, understand it.

original: ātmanaḥ pratikūlāni pareṣāṃ na samācaret // ///
analyzed: ātmanaḥ pratikūlāni pareṣām na samācaret
translated: One should not do to others what is disagreeable to oneself.

original: atha tasya tāṃ dharmopadeśanāṃ śrutvā śaśaka āhabhoḥ bhoḥ kapiñjala /
analyzed: atha tasya tām dharma upadeśanām śrutvā śaśakaḥ āha bhoḥ bhoḥ kapiñjala
translated: Then, having heard his teaching on Dharma, the hare said, Oh, oh, partridge!

original: eṣa nadītīre tapasvī dharmavādī tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: eṣa nadī tīre tapasvī dharma vādī tiṣṭhati
translated: This ascetic who speaks of Dharma is standing on the bank of the river.

original: tad enaṃ pṛcchāvaḥ /
analyzed: tat enam pṛcchāvaḥ
translated: Let us ask him.

original: kapiñjala āhananu svabhāvato 'yam asmākaṃ śatrubhūtaḥ /
analyzed: kapiñjalaḥ āha nanu svabhāvataḥ yam asmākam śatru bhūtaḥ
translated: Partridge said, Well, he is naturally our enemy.

original: tad dūre sthitvā pṛcchāvaḥ /
analyzed: tat dūre sthitvā pṛcchāvaḥ
translated: So let us ask him while staying far away.

original: kadācid asya vratavaikalyaṃ sampadyeta /
analyzed: kadācid asya vrata vaikalyam sampadyeta
translated: Perhaps his vow may be incomplete.

original: tato dūrastho tāv ūcatuḥbhos tapasvin /
analyzed: tatas dūra sthaḥ tau ūcatuḥ bhoḥ tapasvin
translated: Then, while staying far away, they said, Oh ascetic!

original: dharmopadeśaka /
analyzed: dharma upadeśaka
translated: Teacher of Dharma!

original: āvayor vivādo vartate /
analyzed: āvayoḥ vivādaḥ vartate
translated: We have a dispute.

original: tad dharmaśāstradvāreṇāsmākaṃ nirṇayaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tat dharma śāstra dvāreṇa asmākam nirṇayam kuru
translated: So decide between us by means of the Dharma scriptures.

original: yo hīnavādī sa te bhakṣya iti /
analyzed: yaḥ hīna vādī sa te bhakṣyaḥ iti
translated: The one who speaks less is to be eaten by you.

original: sa āhabhadrau /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhadrau
translated: He said, Gentlemen!

original: mā maivaṃ vadatam /
analyzed: mā mā evam vadatam
translated: Do not speak like that.

original: nivṛtto 'haṃ narakamārgād dhiṃsākarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: nivṛttaḥ ham naraka mārgāt dhiṃsā karmaṇaḥ
translated: I have turned away from the path to hell, from the act of violence.

original: ahiṃsaiva dharmamārgaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: ahiṃsā eva dharma mārgaḥ uktam ca
translated: Non-violence itself is the path of Dharma. And it is said:

original: ahiṃsāpūrvako dharmo yasmāt sarvahite rataḥ /
analyzed: ahiṃsā pūrvakaḥ dharmaḥ yasmāt sarva hite rataḥ
translated: Since Dharma is preceded by non-violence, being engaged in the welfare of all,

original: yūkāmatkuṇadaṃśādīṃs tasmāt tān api rakṣayet // ///
analyzed: yūkā matkuṇa daṃśa ādīn tasmāt tān api rakṣayet
translated: Therefore, one should protect even them, such as lice, bugs, mosquitoes, etc.

original: hiṃsakāny api bhūtāni yo hiṃsati sa nirghṛṇaḥ /
analyzed: hiṃsakāni api bhūtāni yaḥ hiṃsati sa nirghṛṇaḥ
translated: He who injures even those creatures that are harmful, is merciless.

original: sa yāti narakaṃ ghoraṃ kiṃ punar yaḥ śubhāni ca // ///
analyzed: sa yāti narakam ghoram kim punar yaḥ śubhāni ca
translated: He goes to a terrible hell, how much more so he who injures those that are auspicious.

original: ete'pi ye yājñikā yajñakarmaṇi paśūn vyāpādayanti / te mūrkhāḥ /
analyzed: ete api ye yājñikāḥ yajña karmaṇi paśūn vyāpādayanti te mūrkhāḥ
translated: Those foolish sacrificers who kill animals in the sacrificial rite,

original: paramārthaṃ śruter na jānanti /
analyzed: parama artham śruteḥ na jānanti
translated: they do not know the true meaning of the Veda.

original: tatra kilaitad uktamajayaiṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tatra kila etat uktam ajaya eṣṭavyam
translated: There it is said: The goat should be sacrificed.

original: ajā vrīhayas tāvat saptavārṣikāḥ kathyante na punaḥ paśuviśeṣaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: ajāḥ vrīhayaḥ tāvat sapta vārṣikāḥ kathyante na punar paśu viśeṣaḥ uktam ca
translated: The goat is said to be seven years old, not a particular animal. And it is said:

original: vṛkṣāṃś chittvā paśūn hatvā kṛtvā rudhirakardamam /
analyzed: vṛkṣān chittvā paśūn hatvā kṛtvā rudhira kardamam
translated: Having cut down trees, having killed animals, having made a mire of blood,

original: yady evaṃ gamyate svargaṃ narakaṃ kena gamyate // ///
analyzed: yadi evam gamyate svargam narakam kena gamyate
translated: if one goes to heaven in this way, by what does one go to hell?

original: tan nāhaṃ bhakṣayāmi /
analyzed: tat na aham bhakṣayāmi
translated: Therefore, I do not eat it.

original: paraṃ jayaparājayanirṇayaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: param jaya parājaya nirṇayam kariṣyāmi
translated: But I will decide on victory and defeat.

original: kintv ahaṃ vṛddho dūrān na yathāvac chṛṇomi /
analyzed: kintu aham vṛddhaḥ dūrāt na yathāvat śṛṇomi
translated: However, I am old and do not hear as well from a distance.

original: evaṃ jñātvā mama samīpavartino bhūtvā mamāgre nyāyaṃ vadataṃ /
analyzed: evam jñātvā mama samīpa vartinaḥ bhūtvā mama agre nyāyam vadatam
translated: Knowing this, come near me and state your case in my presence.

original: yena vijñāya /
analyzed: yena vijñāya
translated: By which (I will know) and

original: vivādaparamārthaṃ vaco vadato me paralokabādhā na bhavati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: vivāda parama artham vacaḥ vadataḥ me para loka bādhā na bhavati uktam ca
translated: When I speak words that are the ultimate truth in debate, I have no fear of the next world. And it is said:

original: mānād vā yadi vā lobhāt krodhād vā yadi vā bhayāt /
analyzed: mānāt vā yadi vā lobhāt krodhāt vā yadi vā bhayāt
translated: Whether out of pride, greed, anger, or fear,

original: yo nyāyam anyathā brūte sa yāti narakaṃ naraḥ // ///
analyzed: yaḥ nyāyam anyathā brūte sa yāti narakam naraḥ
translated: The man who speaks the law otherwise goes to hell.

original: pañca paśvanṛte hanti daśa hanti gavānṛte /
analyzed: pañca paśu anṛte hanti daśa hanti gava anṛte
translated: He who kills a cow out of falsehood kills five, he who kills a bull out of falsehood kills ten,

original: śataṃ kanyānṛte hanti sahasraṃ puruṣānṛte // ///
analyzed: śatam kanyā anṛte hanti sahasram puruṣa anṛte
translated: He who kills a cow out of falsehood kills a hundred, he who kills a man out of falsehood kills a thousand.

original: upaviṣṭaḥ sabhāmadhye yo na vakti sphuṭaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: upaviṣṭaḥ sabhā madhye yaḥ na vakti sphuṭam vacaḥ
translated: He who, seated in the midst of the assembly, does not speak clearly,

original: tasmād dūreṇa sa tyājyo na yo vā kīrtayed ṛtam // ///
analyzed: tasmāt dūreṇa sa tyājyaḥ na yaḥ vā kīrtayet ṛtam
translated: Or he who does not proclaim the truth, should be dismissed from afar.

original: tasmād viśrabdhau mama karṇopāntike sphuṭaṃ nivedayatam /
analyzed: tasmāt viśrabdhau mama karṇa upāntike sphuṭam nivedayatam
translated: Therefore, you two should speak clearly in my presence with full confidence.

original: kiṃ bahunā / tena kṣudreṇa tathā tau pūrṇaṃ viśvāsitau yathā tasyotsaṅgavartinau jātau /
analyzed: kim bahunā tena kṣudreṇa tathā tau pūrṇam viśvāsitau yathā tasya utsaṅga vartinau jātau
translated: What more? He gained their full trust to such an extent that they came to sit in his lap.

original: tataś ca tenāpi samakālam evaikaḥ pādāntenākrānto 'nyo daṃṣṭrākrakacena ca tato gataprāṇau bhakṣitāv iti /
analyzed: tatas ca tena api sama kālam eva ekaḥ pāda antena ākrāntaḥ nyaḥ daṃṣṭrā krakacena ca tatas gata prāṇau bhakṣitau iti
translated: And then at the same time, one was crushed with his foot and the other was killed with his claws, and they were eaten while still alive.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmikṣudram arthapatiṃ prāpya iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi ikṣudram arthapatim prāpya iti
translated: Therefore I say: 'Having obtained a petty master...'

original: bhavanto 'py enaṃ divāndhaṃ kṣudram arthapatim āsādya rātryandhāḥ santaḥ śaśakapiñjalamārgeṇa yāsyanti /
analyzed: bhavantaḥ pi enam divāndham kṣudram arthapatim āsādya rātri andhāḥ santaḥ śaśa kapiñjala mārgeṇa yāsyanti
translated: You too, having obtained this petty master, blind by day, will be blind by night and will go by the way of the hare and the partridge.

original: evaṃ jñātvā yad ucitaṃ tad vidheyam /
analyzed: evam jñātvā yat ucitam tat vidheyam
translated: Knowing this, you should do what is proper.

original: atha tasya tadvacanam ākarṇya sādhv anenābhihitam ity uktā /
analyzed: atha tasya tat vacanam ākarṇya sādhu anena abhihitam iti uktā
translated: Then, having heard his words, they said, Well said! This has been spoken well.

original: bhūyo 'pi pārthivāthaṃ sametya mantrayiṣyāmahe iti bruvāṇāḥ sarve pakṣiṇo yathābhimataṃ jagmuḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas u pi pārthiva atham sametya mantrayiṣyāmahe iti bruvāṇāḥ sarve pakṣiṇaḥ yathā abhimatam jagmuḥ
translated: We will meet again for the sake of the king and consult. Saying this, all the birds went as they wished.

original: kevalam avaśiṣṭo bhadrāsanopaviṣṭo 'bhiṣekābhimukho divāndhaḥ kṛkālikayā sahāste /
analyzed: kevalam avaśiṣṭaḥ bhadrāsana upaviṣṭaḥ bhiṣeka abhimukhaḥ divā andhaḥ kṛkālikayā saha āste
translated: Only the day-blind crow remained, seated on a good seat, facing the consecration, with the she-crow.

original: āha cakaḥ ko 'tra bhoḥ /
analyzed: āha cakaḥ kaḥ tra bhoḥ
translated: And he said, Who is there, my good fellow?

original: kim adyāpi na kriyate mamābhiṣekaḥ /
analyzed: kim adya api na kriyate mama abhiṣekaḥ
translated: Why is my consecration not being performed even now?

original: iti śrutvā kṛkālikayābhihitambhadra /
analyzed: iti śrutvā kṛkālikayā abhihitam bhadra
translated: Hearing this, the she-crow said, Good sir,

original: kuto 'yaṃ vighnas te kākena /
analyzed: kutas yam vighnaḥ te kākena
translated: where is this obstacle for you, O crow?

original: gatāś ca sarve'pi vihagā yathepsitāsu dikṣu kevalam eko 'yaṃ vāyaso 'vaśiṣṭas tiṣṭhati kenāpi kāraṇena /
analyzed: gatāḥ ca sarve api vihagāḥ yathā īpsitāsu dikṣu kevalam ekaḥ yam vāyasaḥ vaśiṣṭaḥ tiṣṭhati kena api kāraṇena
translated: And all the birds have gone to their desired directions. Only this crow remains here for some reason.

original: tat tvaritam uttiṣṭha /
analyzed: tat tvaritam uttiṣṭha
translated: So get up quickly.

original: yena tvāṃ svāśrayaṃ prāpayāmi /
analyzed: yena tvām sva āśrayam prāpayāmi
translated: So that I can take you to your home.

original: tac chrutvā saviṣādam ulūko vāyasam āhabho bho duṣṭātman /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sa viṣādam ulūkaḥ vāyasam āha bho bho duṣṭa ātman
translated: Hearing that, the owl said to the crow with sadness, Hey, you wicked one!

original: kiṃ mayā te'pakṛtaṃ yad rājyābhiṣeko me vighnitaḥ /
analyzed: kim mayā tepa kṛtam yat rājya abhiṣekaḥ me vighnitaḥ
translated: What wrong have I done to you that my coronation has been disrupted?

original: tad adyaprabhṛti sānvayam āvayor vairaṃ sañjātam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat adya prabhṛti sa anvayam āvayoḥ vairam sañjātam uktam ca
translated: From now on, our enmity has begun with all its consequences. And it is said:

original: rohate sāyakair viddhaṃ chinnaṃ rohati cāsinā /
analyzed: rohate sāyakaiḥ viddham chinnam rohati ca asinā
translated: What is pierced by arrows grows, what is cut by a sword grows.

original: vaco duruktaṃ bībhatsaṃ na prarohati vākkṣatam // ///
analyzed: vacaḥ duruktam bībhatsam na prarohati vākkṣatam
translated: But a hateful and contemptible statement does not grow, a wound of speech does not grow.

original: ity evam abhidhāya kṛkālikayā saha svāśramaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: iti evam abhidhāya kṛkālikayā saha sva āśramam gataḥ
translated: Having said this, he went to his hermitage with the she-owl.

original: atha bhayavyākulo vāyaso vyacintayataho /
analyzed: atha bhaya vyākulaḥ vāyasaḥ vyacintayata ho
translated: Then the crow, agitated with fear, thought: Alas!

original: akāraṇaṃ vairam āsāditaṃ mayā /
analyzed: akāraṇam vairam āsāditam mayā
translated: I have incurred enmity without reason.

original: kim idaṃ vyāhṛtam / uktaṃ ca🔽adeśakālajñam anāyatikṣamaṃ🔽yad apriyaṃ lāghavakāri cātmanaḥ /
analyzed: kim idam vyāhṛtam uktam ca  a deśa kāla jñam an āyati kṣamam  yat apriyam lāghava kāri ca ātmanaḥ
translated: What have I said? And it is said:🔽What is spoken at the wrong place and time, what is not conducive to future well-being,

original: yo 'trābravīt kāraṇavarjitaṃ vaco
analyzed: yaḥ trābravīt kāraṇa varjitam vacaḥ
translated: what is unpleasant and makes one appear contemptible,🔽if someone speaks such words without reason,

original: na tad vacaḥ syād viṣam eva tad bhavet // ///
analyzed: na tat vacaḥ syāt viṣam eva tat bhavet
translated: those words will not be effective, they will be like poison.

original: balopapanno 'pi hi buddhimān naraḥ
analyzed: bala upapannaḥ pi hi buddhimān naraḥ
translated: Even a wise man who possesses strength

original: pare nayen na svayam eva vairitām /
analyzed: pare nayet na svayam eva vairi tām
translated: should not himself engage in enmity with others.

original: bhiṣaṅ mamāstīti vicintya bhakṣayed
analyzed: bhiṣaj mama asti iti vicintya bhakṣayet
translated: Thinking 'I have a remedy,' one should eat

original: akāraṇāt ko hi vicakṣaṇo viṣam // ///
analyzed: akāraṇāt kaḥ hi vicakṣaṇaḥ viṣam
translated: For what wise person would do something without a reason?

original: parivādaḥ pariṣadi na kathañcit paṇḍitena vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: parivādaḥ pariṣadi na kathañcid paṇḍitena vaktavyaḥ
translated: A scholar should never speak ill of others in an assembly.

original: satyam api tan na vācyaṃ yad uktam asukhāvahaṃ bhavati // ///
analyzed: satyam api tat na vācyam yat uktam asukha āvaham bhavati
translated: Even if it is true, one should not speak what causes unhappiness.

original: suhṛdbhir āptair asakṛdvicāritaṃ
analyzed: suhṛdbhiḥ āptaiḥ asakṛt vicāritam
translated: What is repeatedly examined by trusted friends

original: svayaṃ hi buddhyā pravicāritāśrayam /
analyzed: svayam hi buddhyā pravicārita āśrayam
translated: and personally investigated with one's own intelligence,

original: karoti kāryaṃ khalu yaḥ sa buddhimān
analyzed: karoti kāryam khalu yaḥ sa buddhimān
translated: only that wise person can accomplish the task,

original: sa eva lakṣmyā yaśasāṃ ca bhājanam // ///🔽evaṃ vicintya kāko 'pi prayātaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva lakṣmyāḥ yaśasām ca bhājanam  evam vicintya kākaḥ pi prayātaḥ
translated: and he alone is the recipient of fortune and fame.🔽Having thought thus, the crow also left.

original: tadāprabhṛty asmābhiḥ saha kauśikānām anvayāgataṃ vairam asti /
analyzed: tadā prabhṛti asmābhiḥ saha kauśikānām anvaya āgatam vairam asti
translated: From that time onwards, we have inherited enmity with the Koushikas.

original: meghavarṇa āhatāta /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āhatāta
translated: Meghavarṇa said, Father.

original: evaṃ gate'smābhiḥ kiṃ kriyate /
analyzed: evam gate smābhiḥ kim kriyate
translated: What should we do now that this has happened?

original: sa āhavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ āhavat sa
translated: He said, My son.

original: evaṃ gate'pi ṣāḍguṇyād aparaḥ sthūlo 'bhiprāyo 'sti /🔽tam aṅgīkṛtya svayam evāhaṃ tadvijayāya yāsyāmi /
analyzed: evam gate ipi ṣāḍguṇyāt aparaḥ sthūlaḥ sti  tam aṅgīkṛtya svayam eva aham tad vijayāya yāsyāmi
translated: Even though this has happened, there is another gross intention apart from the sixfold policy.🔽Accepting that, I myself will go to conquer them.

original: ripūn vañcayitvā vadhiṣyāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: ripūn vañcayitvā vadhiṣyāmi uktam ca
translated: Having deceived the enemies, I will kill them. And it is said:

original: bahubuddhisamāyuktāḥ suvijñānā balotkaṭān /
analyzed: bahu buddhi samāyuktāḥ su vijñānāḥ bala utkaṭān
translated: Those endowed with much intelligence and good knowledge

original: śaktā vañcayituṃ dhūrtā brāhmaṇaṃ chāgalad iva // ///
analyzed: śaktāḥ vañcayitum dhūrtāḥ brāhmaṇam chāgalat iva
translated: are able to deceive the powerful, like the brahmin did with the goat.

original: meghavarṇa āhakatham etat /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha katham etat
translated: The crow asked, How is that?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: mitraśarmabrāhmaṇakathā
analyzed: mitraśarma brāhmaṇa kathā
translated: The Story of the Brahmin Mitraśarman

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne mitraśarmā nāma brāhmaṇaḥ kṛtāgnihotraparigrahaḥ prativasati sma /🔽tena kadācin māghamāse saumyānile pravāti /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne mitraśarmā nāma brāhmaṇaḥ kṛta agnihotra parigrahaḥ prativasati sma  tena kadācid māgha māse saumya anile pravāti
translated: In a certain place, there lived a Brahmin named Mitraśarman, who had taken up the practice of Agnihotra.🔽One day, in the month of Māgha, when the gentle breeze was blowing,

original: meghācchādite gagane mandaṃ mandaṃ pravarṣati parjanye /🔽paśuprārthanārthaṃ kiñcid grāmāntaraṃ gatvā /
analyzed: megha ācchādite gagane mandam mandam pravarṣati parjanye  paśu prārthanā artham kiñcid grāma antaram gatvā
translated: the sky was covered with clouds, and the rain was falling slowly,🔽he went to another village to beg for an animal for a sacrifice.

original: kaścid yajamāno yācitaḥbho yajamāna /
analyzed: kaścid yajamānaḥ yācitaḥ bho yajamāna
translated: He requested a certain patron, O patron,

original: āgāminyām amāvāsyāyām ahaṃ yakṣyāmi yajñam /
analyzed: āgāminyām amāvāsyāyām aham yakṣyāmi yajñam
translated: on the upcoming new moon day, I will perform a sacrifice.

original: tad dehi me paśum ekam /
analyzed: tat dehi me paśum ekam
translated: Please give me an animal.

original: atha tena yasya śāstroktaḥ pīvaratanuḥ paśuḥ pradattaḥ /
analyzed: atha tena yasya śāstra uktaḥ pīvara tanuḥ paśuḥ pradattaḥ
translated: Then he was given an animal with a fat body, as prescribed by the scriptures.

original: so 'pi taṃ samartham itaś cetaś ca gacchantaṃ vijñāya skandhe kṛtvā satvaraṃ svapurābhimukhaḥ pratasthe /
analyzed: saḥ u pi tam samartham itas ca itas ca gacchantam vijñāya skandhe kṛtvā sa tvaram sva pura abhimukhaḥ pratasthe
translated: He, realizing that it was capable of going here and there, put it on his shoulder and quickly set out towards his own city.

original: atha tasya gacchato mārge trayo dhūrtāḥ kṣutkṣāmakaṇṭhāḥ saṃmukhā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: atha tasya gacchataḥ mārge trayaḥ dhūrtāḥ kṣudh kṣāma kaṇṭhāḥ saṃmukhāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Then, as he was going along the road, three rogues with throats parched by hunger appeared before him.🔽And seeing an animal with such a fat body on his shoulder,

original: taiś ca tādṛśaṃ pīvaratanuṃ skandha ārūḍham ālokya /
analyzed: taiḥ ca tādṛśam pīvara tanum skandhe ārūḍham ālokya
translated: they said to each other:

original: mitho 'bhihitaṃaho /🔽asya paśor bhakṣaṇād adyatanīyo himapāto vyarthatāṃ nīyate /
analyzed: mithas bhihitaṃaho  asya paśoḥ bhakṣaṇāt adyatanīyaḥ hima pātaḥ vyartha tām nīyate
translated: Oh, what they said to each other!🔽By eating this animal, the present snowfall will be rendered useless.

original: tad enaṃ vañcayitvā paśum ādāya śītatrāṇaṃ kurmaḥ /
analyzed: tat enam vañcayitvā paśum ādāya śīta trāṇam kurmaḥ
translated: So let's deceive him and take the animal to protect ourselves from the cold.

original: atha teṣām ekatamo veśaparivartanaṃ vidhāya saṃmukho bhūtvāpamārgeṇa tam āhitāgnim ūcebho bhoḥ /
analyzed: atha teṣām ekatamaḥ veśa parivartanam vidhāya saṃmukhaḥ bhūtvā apamārgeṇa tam āhitāgnim ūce bho bhoḥ
translated: Then one of them, changing his clothes, stood in front of the householder who maintained the sacred fire and said on a side path, Hey!

original: bālāgnihotrin /
analyzed: bāla agnihotrin
translated: O young Agnihotri!

original: kim evaṃ janaviruddhaṃ hāsyakāryam anuṣṭhīyate /
analyzed: kim evam jana viruddham hāsya kāryam anuṣṭhīyate
translated: Why are you doing this ridiculous thing that goes against the people?

original: yad eṣa sārameyo 'pavitraḥ skandhādhirūḍho nīyate /
analyzed: yat eṣa sārameyaḥ pavitraḥ skandha adhirūḍhaḥ nīyate
translated: That this impure dog is being taken, riding on someone's shoulder.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ /
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: śvānakukkuṭacāṇḍālāḥ samasparśāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: śvāna kukkuṭa cāṇḍālāḥ sama sparśāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Dogs, chickens, and outcastes are declared to be of equal touch.

original: rāsabhoṣṭrau viśeṣeṇa tasmāt tān naiva saṃspṛśet // ///
analyzed: rāsabha uṣṭrau viśeṣeṇa tasmāt tān na eva saṃspṛśet
translated: Donkeys and camels are especially so, therefore one should not touch them at all.

original: tataś ca tena kopābhibhūtenābhihitamaho /
analyzed: tatas ca tena kopa abhibhūtena abhihitam aho
translated: Then, overwhelmed with anger, he said, Oh!

original: kim andho bhavān /
analyzed: kim andhaḥ bhavān
translated: Are you blind?

original: yat paśuṃ sārameyatvena pratipādayasi /
analyzed: yat paśum sārameya tvena pratipādayasi
translated: In that you present the animal as a dog.

original: so 'bravītbrahman /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt brahman
translated: He said, Brahmin!

original: kopas tvayā na kāryaḥ /
analyzed: kopaḥ tvayā na kāryaḥ
translated: You should not be angry.

original: yathecchaṃ gamyatām /
analyzed: yatheccham gamyatām
translated: Go as you wish.

original: atha yāvat kiñcid adhvano 'ntaraṃ gacchati /
analyzed: atha yāvat kiñcid adhvanaḥ ntaram gacchati
translated: Then, as he went a little distance on the road,

original: tāvad dvitīyo dhūrtaḥ sammukham abhyupetya tam uvācabhoḥ brahman /
analyzed: tāvat dvitīyaḥ dhūrtaḥ sammukham abhyupetya tam uvāca bhoḥ brahman
translated: Then the second swindler came up to him and said, Sir, what is this?

original: kaṣṭaṃ kaṣṭam /
analyzed: kaṣṭam kaṣṭam
translated: Oh dear, oh dear!

original: yadyapi vallabho 'yaṃ te mṛtavatsas tathāpi skandham āropayitum ayuktam /
analyzed: yadi api vallabhaḥ yam te mṛta vatsaḥ tathā api skandham āropayitum ayuktam
translated: Although this calf of yours is dead, it is not right to put it on your shoulder.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: As it is said:

original: tiryañcaṃ mānuṣaṃ vāpi yo mṛtaṃ saṃspṛśet kudhīḥ /
analyzed: tiryañcam mānuṣam vā api yaḥ mṛtam saṃspṛśet kudhīḥ
translated: If a foolish person touches a dead animal or human,

original: pañcagavyena śuddhiḥ syāt tasya cāndrāyaṇena vā // ///
analyzed: pañcagavyena śuddhiḥ syāt tasya cāndrāyaṇena vā
translated: he should be purified by the five products of the cow or by the lunar penance.

original: athāsau sakopam idam āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: atha asau sa kopam idam āha bhoḥ
translated: Then he said angrily, Sir,

original: kim andho bhavān /
analyzed: kim andhaḥ bhavān
translated: are you blind?

original: yat paśuṃ mṛtavatsaṃ vadati /
analyzed: yat paśum mṛta vatsam vadati
translated: That you call an animal a dead calf?

original: so 'bravītbhagavan /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt bhagavan
translated: He said, Sir,

original: mā kopaṃ kuru /
analyzed: mā kopam kuru
translated: do not be angry.

original: ajñānān mayābhihitam /
analyzed: ajñānāt mayā abhihitam
translated: I said that out of ignorance.

original: tat tvam ātmaruciṃ samācara iti /🔽atha yāvat stokaṃ vanāntaraṃ gacchati tāvat tṛtīyo 'nyaveśadhārī dhūrtaḥ sammukhaḥ samupetya tam uvācabhoḥ /
analyzed: tat tvam ātma rucim samācara iti  atha yāvat stokam vana antaram gacchati tāvat tṛtīyaḥ nyaveśa dhārī dhūrtaḥ sammukhaḥ samupetya tam uvāca bhoḥ
translated: So please do as you wish.

original: ayuktam etat /
analyzed: ayuktam etat
translated: Then as he was going a little way into the forest, the third swindler, dressed in another way, came up to him and said, Sir, this is not right.

original: yad rāsabhaṃ skandhādhirūḍhaṃ nayasi /
analyzed: yat rāsabham skandha adhirūḍham nayasi
translated: That you are carrying a donkey on your shoulder.

original: tat tyajyatām eṣaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat tyajyatām eṣaḥ uktam ca
translated: So let it go. And it is said:

original: yaḥ spṛśed rāsabhaṃ martyo jñānād ajñānato 'pi vā /
analyzed: yaḥ spṛśet rāsabham martyaḥ jñānāt vā
translated: If a man knowingly or unknowingly touches a donkey,🔽he should bathe with his clothes on and eat ghee.

original: sacailaṃ snānam uddiṣṭaṃ tasya pāpapraśāntaye // ///
analyzed: sa cailam snānam uddiṣṭam tasya pāpa praśāntaye
translated: And a bath with clothes on is prescribed for the pacification of his sin.

original: tat tyajainaṃ yāvad anyaḥ kaścin na paśyati /
analyzed: tat tyaja enam yāvat anyaḥ kaścid na paśyati
translated: Throw it away before anyone else sees it.

original: athāsau taṃ paśuṃ rāsabhaṃ manyamāno bhayād bhūmau prakṣipya svagṛham uddiśya palāyituṃ prārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau tam paśum rāsabham manyamānaḥ bhayāt bhūmau prakṣipya sva gṛham uddiśya palāyitum prārabdhaḥ
translated: Then he, considering that animal a donkey, out of fear threw it on the ground and started to run away, aiming for his own house.

original: tatas te'pi trayo militvā paśum ādāya yathecchaṃ bhakṣitum ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: tatas te api trayaḥ militvā paśum ādāya yatheccham bhakṣitum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Then those three, having gathered together, started to eat the animal as they wished.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmibahubuddhisamāyuktāḥ iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi bahu buddhi samāyuktāḥ iti
translated: Therefore I say: Endowed with much intelligence.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: abhinavasevakavinayaiḥ prāghuṇakoktair vilāsinīr uditaiḥ /
analyzed: abhinava sevaka vinayaiḥ prāghuṇaka uktaiḥ vilāsinīḥ uditaiḥ
translated: By the humility of new servants, by the greetings of guests, by the words of courtesans,

original: dhūrtajanavacananikarair iha kaścid avañcito nāsti // ///
analyzed: dhūrta jana vacana nikaraiḥ iha kaścid a vañcitaḥ na asti
translated: By the multitude of words of rogues, no one here is deceived.

original: kiṃ cadurbalair api bahubhiḥ saha virodho na yuktaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: kim ca durbalaiḥ api bahubhiḥ saha virodhaḥ na yuktaḥ uktam ca
translated: Moreover, it is not proper to quarrel with many weak people. And it is said:

original: bahavo na viroddhavyā durjayā hi mahājanāḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ na viroddhavyāḥ durjayāḥ hi mahājanāḥ
translated: Many should not be opposed, for great people are difficult to conquer.

original: sphurantam api nāgendraṃ bhakṣayanti pipīlikāḥ // ///
analyzed: sphurantam api nāga indram bhakṣayanti pipīlikāḥ
translated: Even a shining king of elephants is eaten by ants.

original: meghavarṇa āhakatham etat /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Meghavarṇa said: How is this?

original: sthirajīvī kathayati
analyzed: sthirajīvī kathayati
translated: Sthirajīva told:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: Story

original: atidarpanāmasarpakathā
analyzed: ati darpa nāma sarpa kathā
translated: The story of the snake named Atidarpita

original: asti kasmiṃścid valmīke mahākāyaḥ kṛṣṇasarpo 'tidarpo nāma /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid valmīke mahā kāyaḥ tidarpaḥ nāma
translated: In a certain anthill, there was a black snake named Great-Arrogance.

original: sa kadācid vilānusārimārgam utsṛjyānyena laghudvāreṇa niṣkramitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: sa kadācid vila anusāri mārgam utsṛjya anyena laghu dvāreṇa niṣkramitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Sometimes, abandoning the path of the ant-hill, he started to come out through another small hole.

original: niṣkrāmataś ca tasya mahākāyatvād daivavaśatayā laghuvivaratvāc ca śarīre vraṇaḥ samutpannaḥ /
analyzed: niṣkrāmataḥ ca tasya mahā kāya tvāt daiva vaśa tayā laghu vivara tvāt ca śarīre vraṇaḥ samutpannaḥ
translated: And as he was coming out, due to his large body and the force of fate, a wound arose in his body due to the narrowness of the hole.

original: atha vraṇaśoṇitagandhānusāriṇībhiḥ pipīlikābhiḥ sarvato vyāpto vyākulīkṛtaś ca /
analyzed: atha vraṇa śoṇita gandha anusāriṇībhiḥ pipīlikābhiḥ sarvatas vyāptaḥ vyākulīkṛtaḥ ca
translated: Then, followed by ants attracted by the smell of the wound and blood, he became completely covered and agitated.

original: kati vyāpādayati kati vā tāḍayati /
analyzed: kati vyāpādayati kati vā tāḍayati
translated: How many did he kill or beat?

original: atha prabhūtatvād vistāritabahuvraṇaḥ kṣatasarvāṅgo 'tidarpaḥ pañcatvam upāgataḥ /
analyzed: atha prabhūta tvāt vistārita bahu vraṇaḥ kṣata sarva aṅgaḥ tidarpaḥ pañcatvam upāgataḥ
translated: Then, due to his large size, with many wounds spread out, his entire body injured, Great-Arrogance died.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmibahavo na viroddhavyā iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi bahavaḥ na viroddhavyāḥ iti
translated: Therefore, I say: Many should not be opposed.

original: tad atrāsti me kiñcid vaktavyam eva /
analyzed: tat atra asti me kiñcid vaktavyam eva
translated: In this matter, I have something to say.

original: tad avadhārya yathoktam anuṣṭhīyatām /
analyzed: tat avadhārya yathā uktam anuṣṭhīyatām
translated: Understand that and do as stated.

original: meghavarṇa āhatat samādeśaya /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha tat samādeśaya
translated: Cloud-Color said: Then instruct me.

original: tavādeśo nānyathā kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: tava ādeśaḥ na anyathā kartavyaḥ
translated: Your command should not be done otherwise.

original: sthirajīvī prāhavatsa /
analyzed: sthirajīvī
translated: Firm-Life said: Dear one.

original: samākarṇaya tarhi /
analyzed: samākarṇaya tarhi
translated: Then listen.

original: sāmādīn atikramya yo mayā pañcama upāyo nirūpitaḥ /
analyzed: sāma ādīn atikramya yaḥ mayā pañcamaḥ upāyaḥ nirūpitaḥ
translated: Excluding conciliation and the others, the fifth means I have determined,

original: tan māṃ vipakṣabhūtaṃ kṛtvāni niṣṭhuravacanair nirbhartsya /
analyzed: tat mām vipakṣa bhūtam kṛtvāni niṣṭhura vacanaiḥ nirbhartsya
translated: Having thus made me an enemy, you should revile me with harsh words,

original: yathā vipakṣapraṇidhīnāṃ pratyayo bhavati /
analyzed: yathā vipakṣa praṇidhīnām pratyayaḥ bhavati
translated: and then, as a condition for the enemies' oath,

original: tathā samāhṛtarudhirair ālipyāsyaiva nyagrodhasyādhastāt prakṣipya māṃ gamyatāṃ parvatam ṛṣyamūkaṃ prati /
analyzed: tathā samāhṛta rudhiraiḥ ālipya asya eva nyagrodhasya adhastāt prakṣipya mām gamyatām parvatam ṛṣyamūkam prati
translated: having smeared me with the collected blood, throw me under this very banyan tree and go to the Rishyamooka mountain.

original: tatra saparivāras tiṣṭha /
analyzed: tatra sa parivāraḥ tiṣṭha
translated: Stay there with your retinue.

original: yāvad ahaṃ samastān sapatnān supraṇītena vidhinā viśvāsyābhimukhān kṛtvā kṛtārtho jñātadurgamadhyo divase tān andhatāṃ prāptāṃs tvāṃ nītvā
analyzed: yāvat aham samastān sapatnān su praṇītena vidhinā viśvāsya abhimukhān kṛtvā kṛtārthaḥ jñāta durga madhyaḥ divase tān andha tām prāptān tvām nītvā
translated: Until I, having completely deceived all my enemies with well-planned methods, having accomplished my purpose and knowing the fortress's interior, will lead you, who will have become blind during the day,

original: vyāpādayāmi /
analyzed: vyāpādayāmi
translated: and kill you.

original: jñātaṃ mayā samyak nānyathāsmākaṃ siddhir asti /
analyzed: jñātam mayā samyak na anyathā asmākam siddhiḥ asti
translated: I know it well, not otherwise is our success.

original: yato durgam etad apasārarahitaṃ kevalaṃ vadhāya bhaviṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas durgam etat apasāra rahitam kevalam vadhāya bhaviṣyati uktam ca
translated: Because this fortress is without escape and will only lead to death. And it is said:

original: apasārasamāyuktaṃ na yajñair durgam ucyate /
analyzed: apasāra samāyuktam na yajñaiḥ durgam ucyate
translated: A fortress is not said to be without escape by sacrifices.

original: apasāraparityaktaṃ durgavyājena bandhanam // ///
analyzed: apasāra parityaktam durga vyājena bandhanam
translated: Abandoned without escape, a fortress is a trap in the guise of a fortress.

original: na ca tvayā madarthaṃ kṛpā kāryā / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na ca tvayā mad artham kṛpā kāryā uktam ca
translated: And you should not have pity on me for my sake. And it is said:

original: api prāṇasamān iṣṭān pālitān lālitān api /
analyzed: api prāṇa samān iṣṭān pālitān lālitān api
translated: Even those who are dear as life, protected and cherished,

original: bhṛtyān yuddhe samutpanne paśyec chuṣkam ivendhanam // ///
analyzed: bhṛtyān yuddhe samutpanne paśyet śuṣkam iva indhanam
translated: He should regard his servants as dry fuel when a fire breaks out in the battle.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: prāṇavad rakṣayed bhṛtyān svakāyam iva poṣayet /
analyzed: prāṇa vat rakṣayet bhṛtyān sva kāyam iva poṣayet
translated: He should protect his servants as if they were his own life, and nourish them as if they were his own body.

original: sadaikadivasasyārthe yatra syād ripusaṅgamaḥ // ///
analyzed: sadā eka divasasya arthe yatra syāt ripu saṅgamaḥ
translated: For the sake of a single day, where there would be an encounter with an enemy,

original: tat tvayāhaṃ nātra viṣaye pratiṣedhanīyaḥ /
analyzed: tat tvayā aham na atra viṣaye pratiṣedhanīyaḥ
translated: you should not oppose me in this matter.

original: ity uktvā tena saha śuṣkakalahaṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā tena saha śuṣka kalaham kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Having said this, he began to have a dry quarrel with him.

original: athānye tasya bhṛtyāḥ sthirajīvinam ucchṛṅkhalavacanair jalpantam avalokya tasya vadhāyodyatā meghavarṇenābhihitāḥaho /
analyzed: atha anye tasya bhṛtyāḥ sthira jīvinam ucchṛṅkhala vacanaiḥ jalpantam avalokya tasya vadhāya udyatāḥ meghavarṇena abhihitāḥ aho
translated: Then, seeing Sthirajīvin talking with unrestrained words, the other servants of his rose up to kill him. Meghavarṇa said: Oh!

original: nivartadhvaṃ yūyam /
analyzed: nivartadhvam yūyam
translated: Turn back, you all.

original: aham evāsya śatrupakṣapātino durātmanaḥ svayaṃ nigrahaṃ kariṣyāṃi /🔽ity abhidhāya tasyopari samāruhya /
analyzed: aham eva asya śatru pakṣapātinaḥ durātmanaḥ svayam nigraham kariṣyāmi  iti abhidhāya tasya upari samāruhya
translated: I myself will punish this wicked one who sides with the enemy.🔽Having said this, he mounted on him,

original: laghubhiś cañcuprahārais taṃ nihatyāhṛtarudhireṇa plāvayitvā tadupadiṣṭam ṛṣyamūkaparvataṃ saparivāro gataḥ /
analyzed: laghubhiḥ cañcu prahāraiḥ tam nihatya āhṛta rudhireṇa plāvayitvā tad upadiṣṭam ṛṣyamūka parvatam sa parivāraḥ gataḥ
translated: and with light pecks of his beak, killed him, and having flooded him with the blood he had drawn, he went to the Rṣyamūka mountain, which he had been instructed to, along with his retinue.

original: etasminn antare kṛkālikayā dviṣatpraṇidhībhūtayā tat sarvaṃ tadamātyavyasanaṃ kvacit pracalitaḥ saparivāra iti /
analyzed: etasmin antare kṛkālikayā dviṣat praṇidhībhūtayā tat sarvam tat amātya vyasanam kvacid pracalitaḥ sa parivāraḥ iti
translated: In the meantime, a she-owl, who was a spy for the enemy, reported all that to the minister of the crows, saying, The enemy is on the move with his retinue.

original: atholūkādhipas tad ākarṇyāstam anavelāyāṃ sāmātyaḥ saparijano vāyasavadhārthaṃ pracalitaḥ /
analyzed: atha ulūka adhipaḥ tat ākarṇya astam anavelāyām sa amātyaḥ sa parijanaḥ vāyasa vadha artham pracalitaḥ
translated: Then the owl king, hearing this, at sunset, with his ministers and retinue, set out to kill the crow.

original: prāha catvaryatāṃ tvaryatāṃ bhītaḥ śatruḥ palāyanaparaḥ puṇyair labhyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: prāha catvaryatām tvaryatām bhītaḥ śatruḥ palāyana paraḥ puṇyaiḥ labhyate uktam ca
translated: And he said, Hurry, hurry! The frightened enemy is intent on fleeing. He is obtained through merit. And it is said:

original: śatroḥ pracalane chidram ekam anyaṃ ca saṃśrayam /
analyzed: śatroḥ pracalane chidram ekam anyam ca saṃśrayam
translated: When the enemy is on the move, one should look for a weakness and seek another's support.

original: kurvāṇo jāyate vaśyo vyagratve rājasevinām // ///
analyzed: kurvāṇaḥ jāyate vaśyaḥ vyagra tve rāja sevinām
translated: When royal servants are distracted, one becomes invincible by doing this.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaḥ samantān nyagrodhapādapam adhaḥ pariveṣṭya vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇaḥ samantāt nyagrodha pādapam adhas pariveṣṭya vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Speaking thus, he stood surrounding the foot of a banyan tree all around.

original: yāvan na kaścid vāyaso dṛśyate /
analyzed: yāvat na kaścid vāyasaḥ dṛśyate
translated: As long as no crow was seen,

original: tāvac chākhāgram adhirūḍho hṛṣṭamanā vandibhir abhiṣṭūyamāno 'rimardanas tān parijanān provācaaho /
analyzed: tāvat śākhā agram adhirūḍhaḥ hṛṣṭa manāḥ vandibhiḥ abhiṣṭūyamānaḥ rimardanaḥ tān parijanān provāca aho
translated: then, having climbed to the top of a branch, with a cheerful mind, praised by bards, Arimaradana said to his attendants, Ah!

original: jñāyatāṃ teṣāṃ mārgaḥ /
analyzed: jñāyatām teṣām mārgaḥ
translated: Let their path be known.

original: katamena mārgeṇa pranaṣṭāḥ kākāḥ /
analyzed: katamena mārgeṇa pranaṣṭāḥ kākāḥ
translated: By what path have the crows disappeared?

original: tad yāvan na durgaṃ samāśrayanti /
analyzed: tat yāvat na durgam samāśrayanti
translated: As long as they do not take refuge in a fortress,

original: tāvad eva pṛṣṭhato gatvā vyāpādyā bhavanti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tāvat eva pṛṣṭhatas gatvā vyāpādyāḥ bhavanti uktam ca
translated: They go back a little way, and then kill him. And it is said:

original: vṛttim apy āśritaḥ śatrur avadhyaḥ syāj jigīṣuṇā /
analyzed: vṛttim api āśritaḥ śatruḥ avadhyaḥ syāt jigīṣuṇā
translated: Even if an enemy is dependent, he should not be killed by a conqueror who seeks to rule.

original: kiṃ punaḥ saṃśrito durgaṃ sāmagryā parayā yutam // ///
analyzed: kim punar saṃśritaḥ durgam sāmagryā parayā yutam
translated: How much less so if he is dependent, in a fortress, and endowed with great resources?

original: athaitasmin prastāve sthirajīvī cintayāmāsayad ete'smac chatravo 'nulabdhāsmadvṛttāntā yathāgatam eva yānti tato mayā na kiñcit kṛtaṃ bhavati
analyzed: atha etasmin prastāve sthirajīvī cintayāmāsayat ete ismat śatravaḥ nu labdha asmad vṛttāntāḥ yathāgatam eva yānti tatas mayā na kiñcid kṛtam bhavati
translated: Then, on this occasion, Steady-Life thought: If these enemies, having obtained my story, go away as they came, then I have done nothing.

original: uktaṃ ca
analyzed: uktam ca
translated: And it is said:

original: anārambho hi kāryāṇāṃ prathamaṃ buddhilakṣaṇam /
analyzed: anārambhaḥ hi kāryāṇām prathamam buddhi lakṣaṇam
translated: Non-initiation is the first characteristic of intelligence in undertakings.

original: ārabdhasyāntagamanaṃ dvitīyaṃ buddhilakṣaṇam // ///
analyzed: ārabdhasya anta gamanam dvitīyam buddhi lakṣaṇam
translated: The second characteristic of intelligence is the completion of what has been begun.

original: tad varam anārambho na cārambhavighātaḥ /
analyzed: tat varam anārambhaḥ na ca ārambha vighātaḥ
translated: It is better not to initiate than to obstruct what has been initiated.

original: tad aham etān śabdaṃ saṃśrāvya ātmānaṃ darśayāmi iti vicārya mandaṃ mandaṃ śabdam akarot /
analyzed: tat aham etān śabdam saṃśrāvya ātmānam darśayāmi iti vicārya mandam mandam śabdam akarot
translated: Therefore, I will make a sound, announce myself, and show myself. Having considered this, he made a slow, slow sound.

original: tac chrutvā te sakalā apy ulūkās tadvadhāya prajagmuḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā te sakalāḥ api ulūkāḥ tad vadhāya prajagmuḥ
translated: Hearing that, all the owls went to kill him.

original: atha tenoktaṃaho /🔽ahaṃ sthirajīvī nāma meghavarṇasya mantrī /
analyzed: atha tena uktam aho  aham sthirajīvī nāma meghavarṇasya mantrī
translated: Then he said: Oh!🔽I am the minister of Cloudy, named Steady-Life.

original: meghavarṇenaivedṛśīm avasthāṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: meghavarṇena eva īdṛśīm avasthām nītaḥ
translated: I have been reduced to this state by Cloudy himself.

original: tan nivedayatātmasvāmine /
analyzed: tat nivedayata ātma svāmine
translated: So inform your master.

original: tena saha bahu vaktavyam asti /
analyzed: tena saha bahu vaktavyam asti
translated: I have much to discuss with him.

original: atha tair niveditaḥ sa ulūkarājo vismayāviṣṭas tatkṣaṇāt tasya sakāśaṃ gatvā provācabhoḥ bhoḥ /
analyzed: atha taiḥ niveditaḥ saḥ ulūka rājaḥ vismaya āviṣṭaḥ tad kṣaṇāt tasya sakāśam gatvā provāca bhoḥ bhoḥ
translated: Then, when they reported this, the king of owls, filled with wonder, immediately went to him and said, Oh! Oh!

original: kim etāṃ daśāṃ gatas tvam /
analyzed: kim etām daśām gataḥ tvam
translated: How did you come to this state?

original: tat kathyatām /
analyzed: tat kathyatām
translated: So tell me.

original: sthirajīvī prāhadeva /
analyzed: sthirajīvī prāha deva
translated: Sthira-jīva said, Your Majesty,

original: śrūyatāṃ tadavasthākāraṇam /
analyzed: śrūyatām tad avasthā kāraṇam
translated: listen to the cause of my condition.

original: atītadine sa durātmā meghavarṇo yuṣmadvyāpāditaprabhūtavāyasānāṃ pīḍayā yuṣmākam upari kopaśokagrasto yuddhārthaṃ pracalita āsīt /
analyzed: atīta dine sa durātmā meghavarṇaḥ yuṣmad vyāpādita prabhūta vāyasānām pīḍayā yuṣmākam upari kopa śoka grastaḥ yuddha artham pracalitaḥ āsīt
translated: Yesterday, that evil-minded Megha-varṇa, overwhelmed with anger and grief at the loss of many crows killed by you, was ready to fight against you.

original: tato mayābhihitaṃsvāmin /
analyzed: tatas mayā abhihitam svāmin
translated: Then I said, 'My lord,

original: na yuktaṃ bhavatas tadupari gantum /🔽balavanta ete /
analyzed: na yuktam bhavataḥ tat upari gantum  balavantaḥ ete
translated: it is not right for you to go against him.🔽They are powerful,

original: balahīnāś ca vayam / uktaṃ ca🔽balīyasā hīnabalo virodhaṃ
analyzed: bala hīnāḥ ca vayam uktam ca  balīyasā hīna balaḥ virodham
translated: and we are weak. And it is said:

original: na bhūtikāmo manasāpi vāñchet /
analyzed: na bhūti kāmaḥ manasā api vāñchet
translated: The weak should never, even in thought, desire to fight🔽with the strong, if they value their lives.

original: na vadhyate vetasavṛttir atra
analyzed: na vadhyate vetasa vṛttiḥ atra
translated: The willow tree is not destroyed here,

original: vyaktaṃ praṇāśo 'sti pataṅgavṛtteḥ // ///
analyzed: vyaktam praṇāśaḥ sti pataṅga vṛtteḥ
translated: but the fate of the moth is clearly destruction.

original: tat tasyoāyanapradānena sandhir eva yuktaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat tasya ūāyana pradānena sandhiḥ eva yuktaḥ uktam ca
translated: Therefore, it is right to make peace by giving him tribute. And it is said:

original: balavantaṃ ripuṃ dṛṣṭvā sarvasvam api buddhimān /
analyzed: balavantam ripum dṛṣṭvā sarva svam api buddhimān
translated: Seeing a powerful enemy, even a wise man,

original: dattvā hi rakṣayet prāṇān rakṣitais tair dhanaṃ punaḥ // ///
analyzed: dattvā hi rakṣayet prāṇān rakṣitaiḥ taiḥ dhanam punar
translated: having given up everything, should protect his life; with his life saved, he can again earn wealth.

original: tac chrutvā durjanakopitena tvatpakṣapātinaṃ mām āśaṅkamānenemāṃ daśāṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā durjana kopitena tvad pakṣapātinam mām āśaṅkamānena imām daśām nītaḥ
translated: Hearing this, I, who am partial to you, was suspected by the angry Durjanaka and brought to this state.

original: tat tava pādau sāmprataṃ me śaraṇaṃ /
analyzed: tat tava pādau sāmpratam me śaraṇam
translated: Now your feet are my refuge.

original: kiṃ bahunā vijñaptena /
analyzed: kim bahunā vijñaptena
translated: What is the use of speaking much?

original: yāvad ahaṃ pracalituṃ śaknomi tāvat tvāṃ tasyāvāsaṃ nītvā sarvavāyasakṣayaṃ vidhāsyāmi iti /
analyzed: yāvat aham pracalitum śaknomi tāvat tvām tasya āvāsam nītvā sarva vāyasa kṣayam vidhāsyāmi iti
translated: As long as I am able to move, I will take you to his abode and destroy all the crows.

original: athārimardanas tad ākarṇya pitṛpitāmahakramāgatamantribhiḥ sārdhaṃ mantrayāṃcakre /
analyzed: atha arimardanaḥ tat ākarṇya pitṛ pitāmaha krama āgata mantribhiḥ sārdham mantrayāṃcakre
translated: Then Arimardana, having heard that, consulted with his ministers who had held the office of minister through the succession of his father and grandfather.

original: tasya ca pañca mantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca pañca mantriṇaḥ
translated: And he had five ministers.

original: tad yathāraktākṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā arakta akṣaḥ
translated: Namely, Raktaksha,

original: krūrākṣaḥ /
analyzed: krūra akṣaḥ
translated: Kruraksha,

original: dīptākṣaḥ /
analyzed: dīpta akṣaḥ
translated: Diptaksha,

original: vakranāsaḥ /
analyzed: vakra nāsaḥ
translated: Vakranasa,

analyzed: anyedyus bhramataḥ tasya vane kā api kapotikā

original: jātā hastagatā tāṃ sa prākṣipat pañjcarāntare // ///
analyzed: jātā hasta gatā tām sa prākṣipat pañjcara antare
translated: Came into his hand, and he threw her into the cage.

original: atha kṛṣṇā diśaḥ sarvā vanasthasyābhavan ghanaiḥ
analyzed: atha kṛṣṇāḥ diśaḥ sarvāḥ vanasthasya abhavan ghanaiḥ
translated: Then, for him in the forest, all the directions became dark with clouds

original: vātavṛṣṭiś ca mahato kṣayakāla ivābhavat // ///
analyzed: vāta vṛṣṭiḥ ca mahataḥ kṣaya kāle iva abhavat
translated: And a great wind and rain arose, as if at the time of destruction.

original: tataḥ sa trastahṛdayaḥ kampamāno muhur muhuḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa trasta hṛdayaḥ kampamānaḥ muhur muhur
translated: Then, with a frightened heart, trembling again and again,

original: anveṣayan paritrāṇam āsasāda vanaspatim // ///
analyzed: anveṣayan paritrāṇam āsasāda vanaspatim
translated: Seeking protection, he came upon a forest tree.

original: muhūrtaṃ paśyate yāvad viyad vimalatārakam /
analyzed: muhūrtam paśyate yāvat viyat vimala tārakam
translated: For a moment he saw the sky with its clear stars,

original: prāpya vṛkṣaṃ vadaty evaṃ yo 'tra tiṣṭhati kaścana // ///
analyzed: prāpya vṛkṣam vadati evam yaḥ tra tiṣṭhati kaścana
translated: Having reached the tree, he says thus: 'Whoever is here, please save me.'

original: tasyāhaṃ śaraṇaṃ prāptaḥ sa paritrātu mām iti /
analyzed: tasya aham śaraṇam prāptaḥ sa paritrātu mām iti
translated: I have taken refuge in him. May he save me.

original: śītena bhidyamānaṃ ca kṣudhayā gatacetanam // ///🔽atha tasya taroḥ skandhe kapotaḥ suciroṣitaḥ /
analyzed: śītena bhidyamānam ca kṣudhayā gata cetanam  atha tasya taroḥ skandhe kapotaḥ su cira uṣitaḥ
translated: Being afflicted by cold and hunger, and having lost consciousness,🔽Then on the trunk of that tree, a pigeon that had lived there for a long time,

original: bhāryāvirahitas tiṣṭhan vilalāpa suduḥkhitaḥ // ///
analyzed: bhāryā virahitaḥ tiṣṭhan vilalāpa su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Staying separated from his wife, lamented in great sorrow:

original: vātavarṣo mahān āsīn na cāgacchati me priyā /
analyzed: vāta varṣaḥ mahān āsīt na ca āgacchati me priyā
translated: There was a great storm and rain, but my beloved does not come.

original: tayā virahitaṃ hy etac chūnyam adya gṛhaṃ mama // ///
analyzed: tayā virahitam hi etat śūnyam adya gṛham mama
translated: Without her, this house of mine is empty today.

original: pativratā patiprāṇā patyuḥ priyahite ratā /
analyzed: pativratā pati prāṇā patyuḥ priya hite ratā
translated: A faithful wife, whose life is devoted to her husband, delights in her husband's love and welfare,

original: yasya syād īdṛśī bhāryā dhanyaḥ sa puruṣo bhuvi // ///
analyzed: yasya syāt īdṛśī bhāryā dhanyaḥ sa puruṣaḥ bhuvi
translated: He whose wife is like this, that man is blessed on earth.

original: na gṛhaṃ gṛham ity āhur gṛhiṇī gṛham ucyate /
analyzed: na gṛham gṛham iti āhuḥ gṛhiṇī gṛham ucyate
translated: They do not call a house a house, a wife is said to be a house.

original: gṛhaṃ tu gṛhiṇīhīnam araṇyasadṛśaṃ matam // ///
analyzed: gṛham tu gṛhiṇī hīnam araṇya sadṛśam matam
translated: But a house without a wife is considered like a forest.

original: pañjarasthā tataḥ śrutvā bhartur duḥkhānvitaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: pañjara sthā tatas śrutvā bhartuḥ duḥkha anvitam vacaḥ
translated: Then the female pigeon, hearing her husband's sorrowful words,

original: kapotikā susantuṣṭā vākyaṃ cedam athāha sā // ///
analyzed: kapotikā su santuṣṭā vākyam ca idam atha āha sā
translated: The female pigeon, being very pleased, spoke these words:

original: na sā strīty abhimantavyā yasyāṃ bhartā na tuṣyati /
analyzed: na sā strī iti abhimantavyā yasyām bhartā na tuṣyati
translated: She who is not satisfied with her husband should not be considered a wife.

original: tuṣṭe bhartari nārīṇāṃ tuṣṭāḥ syuḥ sarvadevatāḥ // ///
analyzed: tuṣṭe bhartari nārīṇām tuṣṭāḥ syuḥ sarva devatāḥ
translated: When the husband is pleased, all the deities are pleased with the women.

original: dāvāgninā vidagdheva sapuṣpastavakā latā /
analyzed: dāva agninā vidagdhā iva sa puṣpa stavakā latā
translated: Like a creeper with flowers and shoots burnt by a forest fire,

original: bhasmībhavatu sā nārī yasyāṃ bhartā na tuṣyati // ///
analyzed: bhasmībhavatu sā nārī yasyām bhartā na tuṣyati
translated: may that woman be reduced to ashes, in whom the husband is not pleased.

original: mitaṃ dadāti hi pitā mitaṃ bhrātā mitaṃ sutaḥ /
analyzed: mitam dadāti hi pitā mitam bhrātā mitam sutaḥ
translated: The father gives in limited measure, the brother gives in limited measure, the son gives in limited measure.

original: amitasya hi dātāraṃ bhartāraṃ kā na pūjayet // ///
analyzed: amitasya hi dātāram bhartāram kā na pūjayet
translated: Who would not honor the husband, the giver of the unlimited?

original: punaś cābravīt
analyzed: punar ca abravīt
translated: And again she said:

original: śṛṇuṣvāvahitaḥ kānta yat te vakṣyāmy ahaṃ hitam /
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva avahitaḥ kānta yat te vakṣyāmi aham hitam
translated: Listen attentively, my beloved, to what I shall tell you for your welfare.

original: prāṇair api tvayā nityaṃ saṃrakṣyaḥ śaraṇāgataḥ // ///
analyzed: prāṇaiḥ api tvayā nityam saṃrakṣyaḥ śaraṇa āgataḥ
translated: You should always protect with your life this one who has come to you for refuge.

original: eṣa śākunikaḥ śete tavāvāsaṃ samāśritaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa śākunikaḥ śete tava āvāsam samāśritaḥ
translated: This fowler is sleeping, having resorted to your abode.

original: śītārtaś ca kṣudhārtaś ca pūjām asmai samācara // ///
analyzed: śīta ārtaḥ ca kṣudhā ārtaḥ ca pūjām asmai samācara
translated: He is afflicted by cold and hunger, show him respect.

original: śrūyate ca
analyzed: śrūyate ca
translated: And it is heard:

original: yaḥ sāyam atithiṃ prāptaṃ yathāśakti na pūjayet /
analyzed: yaḥ sāyam atithim prāptam yathāśakti na pūjayet
translated: One who does not honor a guest who arrives in the evening to the best of his ability,

original: tasyāsau duṣkṛtaṃ dattvā sukṛtaṃ cāpakarṣati // ///
analyzed: tasya asau duṣkṛtam dattvā sukṛtam ca apakarṣati
translated: he gives him demerit and takes away his merit.

original: mā cāsmai tvaṃ kṛthā dvaiṣaṃ baddhāneneti matpriyā /
analyzed: mā ca asmai tvam kṛthāḥ dvaiṣam baddhā anena iti mad priyā
translated: And do not hate him, thinking he has bound me, my beloved.

original: svakṛtair eva baddhāhaṃ prāktanaiḥ karmabandhanaiḥ // ///
analyzed: sva kṛtaiḥ eva baddhā aham prāktanaiḥ karma bandhanaiḥ
translated: I am bound by my own past actions, by the bonds of karma.

original: dāridryarogaduḥkhāni bandhanavyasanāni ca /
analyzed: dāridrya roga duḥkhāni bandhana vyasanāni ca
translated: Poverty, disease, sorrow, bondage, and calamities,

original: ātmāparādhavṛkṣasya phalāny etāni dehinām // ///
analyzed: ātma aparādha vṛkṣasya phalāni etāni dehinām
translated: are the fruits of the tree of self-offenses for embodied beings.

original: tasmāt tvaṃ dveṣam utsṛjya madbandhanasamudbhavam /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam dveṣam utsṛjya mad bandhana samudbhavam
translated: Therefore, give up your hatred arising from my bondage,

original: dharme manaḥ samādhāya pūjayainaṃ yathāvidhi // ///
analyzed: dharme manaḥ samādhāya pūjaya enam yathāvidhi
translated: and with your mind focused on dharma, worship him according to the prescribed rites.

original: tasyās tadvacanaṃ śrutvā dharmayuktisamanvitam /
analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā dharma yukti samanvitam
translated: Having heard her words, which were full of dharma and reason,

original: upagamya tato 'dhṛṣṭaḥ kapotaḥ prāha lubdhakam // ///
analyzed: upagamya tatas dhṛṣṭaḥ kapotaḥ prāha lubdhakam
translated: the fearless pigeon then approached and spoke to the hunter.

original: bhadra susvāgataṃ te'stu brūhi kiṃ karavāṇi te /
analyzed: bhadra su svāgatam te tu brūhi kim karavāṇi te
translated: O good man, welcome to you! Tell me what I can do for you.

original: santāpaś ca na kartavyaḥ svagṛhe vartate bhavān // ///
analyzed: santāpaḥ ca na kartavyaḥ sva gṛhe vartate bhavān
translated: And you should not be distressed, for you are in your own house.

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā pratyuvāca vihaṅgamam /
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā pratyuvāca vihaṅgamam
translated: Having heard his words, he replied to the bird:

original: kapota khalu śītaṃ me himatrāṇaṃ vidhīyatām // ///
analyzed: kapota khalu śītam me hima trāṇam vidhīyatām
translated: O pigeon, I am indeed cold. Provide protection from the cold.

original: sa gatvāṅgārakaṃ nītvā pātayāmāsa pāvakam /
analyzed: sa gatvā aṅgārakam nītvā pātayāmāsa pāvakam
translated: He went and brought some charcoal and dropped it into the fire.

original: tataḥ śuṣkeṣu parṇeṣu tam āśu samadīpayat // ///
analyzed: tatas śuṣkeṣu parṇeṣu tam āśu samadīpayat
translated: Then he quickly set it ablaze on the dry leaves.

original: susandīptaṃ tataḥ kṛtvā tam āha śaraṇāgatam /
analyzed: su sandīptam tatas kṛtvā tam āha śaraṇa āgatam
translated: Having made it well-flaming, he said to the one who had come for refuge:

analyzed: pratāpayasva viśrabdham sva gātrāṇi atra nirbhayaḥ
translated: Warm yourself fearlessly here, with confidence, on your own body.

original: udgatena ca jīvāmo vayaṃ sarve vanaukasaḥ /
analyzed: udgatena ca jīvāmaḥ vayam sarve vanaukasaḥ
translated: We all, the forest-dwellers, live on what is left over.

original: na cāsti vibhavaḥ kaścin nāśaye yena te kṣudham // ///
analyzed: na ca asti vibhavaḥ kaścid na āśaye yena te kṣudham
translated: There is no wealth with us by which we can remove your hunger.

original: sahasraṃ bharate kaścic chatamanyo daśāparaḥ /
analyzed: sahasram bharate kaścid śatamanyaḥ daśa aparaḥ
translated: One supports a thousand, another a hundred, and another ten.

analyzed: mama tu a kṛta puṇyasya kṣudrasya ātmā api durbharaḥ

original: ekasyāpy atither annaṃ yaḥ pradātuṃ na śaktimān /
analyzed: ekasya api atitheḥ annam yaḥ pradātum na śaktimān
translated: He who is not able to give food even to one guest,

original: tasyānekaparikleśe gṛhe kiṃ vasataḥ phalam // ///
analyzed: tasya aneka parikleśe gṛhe kim vasataḥ phalam
translated: what is the use of his living in a house full of many difficulties?

original: tat tathā sādhayāmy etac charīraṃ duḥkhajīvitam /
analyzed: tat tathā sādhayāmi etat śarīram duḥkha jīvitam
translated: Therefore, I shall make use of this body, which is a source of misery,

original: yathā bhūyo na vakṣyāmi nāstīty arthisamāgame // ///
analyzed: yathā bhūyas na vakṣyāmi na asti iti arthi samāgame
translated: so that I may never again have to say 'no' to a supplicant who comes to me.

original: sa ninindi kilātmānaṃ na tu taṃ lubdhakaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: sa ninindi kila ātmānam na tu tam lubdhakam punar
translated: He then reproached himself, but not the fowler again.

original: uvāca tarpayiṣye tvāṃ muhūrtaṃ pratipālaya // ///
analyzed: uvāca tarpayiṣye tvām muhūrtam pratipālaya
translated: He said, I will satisfy you, wait for a moment.

original: evam uktvā sa dharmātmā prahṛṣṭenāntarātmanā /
analyzed: evam uktvā sa dharma ātmā prahṛṣṭena antarātmanā
translated: Having said this, the righteous one, with a delighted heart,

original: tam agniṃ samparikramya praviveśa svaveśmavat // ///
analyzed: tam agnim samparikramya praviveśa sva veśma vat
translated: circumambulated the fire and entered his house as if it were his own.

original: tatas taṃ lubdhako dṛṣṭvā kṛpayā pīḍito bhṛśam /
analyzed: tatas tam lubdhakaḥ dṛṣṭvā kṛpayā pīḍitaḥ bhṛśam
translated: Then the fowler, seeing the pigeon fallen into the fire, was greatly afflicted with compassion,🔽and spoke these words:
