original: tasya purīṣe suvarṇam utpadyate /🔽atha kadācit tam uddiśya vyādhaḥ ko 'pi samāyayau /
analyzed: tasya purīṣe suvarṇam utpadyate  atha kadācid tam uddiśya vyādhaḥ kaḥ pi samāyayau
translated: In his excrement gold was produced.🔽Then one day a hunter came for him.

original: sa ca pakṣī tadagrata eva purīṣam utsasarja /
analyzed: sa ca pakṣī tad agratas eva purīṣam utsasarja
translated: And the bird released his excrement right in front of him.

original: atha pātasamakālam eva tatsuvarṇībhūtaṃ dṛṣṭvā vyādho vismayam agamataho mama śiśukālād ārabhya śakunibandhavyasanino 'śītivarṣāṇi
analyzed: atha pāta sama kālam eva tat suvarṇībhūtam dṛṣṭvā vyādhaḥ vismayam agamata ho mama śiśu kālāt ārabhya śīti varṣāṇi
translated: Then, when it was evening, the hunter saw that it had turned to gold, and was amazed. “Ah! From the time I was a boy, I have been addicted to the vice of catching birds, for eighty years.

original: na ca kadācit pakṣipurīṣe suvarṇaṃ dṛṣṭam iti vicintya tatra vṛkṣe pāśaṃ babandha /🔽athāsāv api pakṣī mūrkhas tatraiva viśvastacitto yathāpūrvam upaviṣṭas tatkālam eva pāśena baddhaḥ /
analyzed: na ca kadācid pakṣi purīṣe suvarṇam dṛṣṭam iti vicintya tatra vṛkṣe pāśam babandha  atha asau api pakṣī mūrkhaḥ tatra eva viśvasta cittaḥ yathāpūrvam upaviṣṭaḥ tad kālam eva pāśena baddhaḥ
translated: And never have I seen gold in a bird’s dung.” Thinking thus, he tied a noose to that tree.🔽Then that foolish bird, trusting, sat down as before, and at that very moment was caught in the noose.

original: vyādhas tu taṃ pāśād unmucya pañjarake saṃsthāpya nijāvāsaṃ nītavān /🔽atha cintayāmāsakim anena sāpāyena pakṣiṇāhaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: vyādhaḥ tu tam pāśāt unmucya pañjarake saṃsthāpya nija āvāsam nītavān  atha cintayāmāsa kim anena sa apāyena pakṣiṇā aham kariṣyāmi
translated: But the hunter, releasing him from the noose, placed him in a cage and took him to his own dwelling.

original: yadi kadācit ko
analyzed: yadi kadācid kaḥ
translated: Then he thought, “What shall I do with this bird that is so dangerous?

original: 'py amum īdṛśaṃ jñātvā rājñe nivedayiṣyati tan nūnaṃ prāṇasaṃśayo me bhavet /
analyzed: pi amum īdṛśam jñātvā rājñe nivedayiṣyati tat nūnam prāṇa saṃśayaḥ me bhavet
translated: If someone should recognize him and inform the king, then my life would certainly be in danger.

original: ataḥ svayam eva pakṣiṇaṃ rājñe nivedayāmi /
analyzed: atas svayam eva pakṣiṇam rājñe nivedayāmi
translated: Therefore I myself will inform the king of the bird.”

original: iti vicārya tathaivānuṣṭhitavān /
analyzed: iti vicārya tathā eva anuṣṭhitavān
translated: Having considered thus, he did just that.

original: atha rājāpi taṃ pakṣiṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā vikasitanayanavadanakamalaḥ parāṃ tuṣṭim upagataḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā api tam pakṣiṇam dṛṣṭvā vikasita nayana vadana kamalaḥ parām tuṣṭim upagataḥ
translated: Then the king, seeing that bird, with his lotus face and eyes blooming, attained the highest satisfaction.

original: prāha caivaṃhaṃho rakṣāpuruṣāḥ /
analyzed: prāha ca evaṃhaṃho rakṣā puruṣāḥ
translated: And he said, Hey, you guards!

original: enaṃ pakṣiṇaṃ yatnena rakṣata /
analyzed: enam pakṣiṇam yatnena rakṣata
translated: Carefully protect this bird.

original: aśanapānādikaṃ cāsya yathecchaṃ prayacchata /
analyzed: aśana pāna ādikam ca asya yatheccham prayacchata
translated: And give it food, drink, and so on, as it desires.

original: atha mantriṇābhihitamkim anenāśraddheyavyādhavacanamātraparigṛhītenāṇḍajena /
analyzed: atha mantriṇā abhihitam kim anena aśraddheya vyādha vacana mātra parigṛhītena aṇḍajena
translated: Then the minister said, What's the use of this bird, accepted only on the word of an unbelievable hunter?

original: kiṃ kadācit pakṣīpurīṣe suvarṇaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: kim kadācid pakṣī purīṣe suvarṇam sambhavati
translated: Can gold ever be found in a bird's droppings?

original: tan mucyatāṃ pañjarabandhanād ayaṃ pakṣī /
analyzed: tat mucyatām pañjara bandhanāt ayam pakṣī
translated: So let this bird be released from its cage.

original: iti mantrivacanād rājñā mocito 'sau pakṣy unnatadvāratoraṇe samupaviśya suvarṇamayīṃ
analyzed: iti mantri vacanāt rājñā sau pakṣī unnata dvāra toraṇe samupaviśya suvarṇa mayīm
translated: By the minister's words, the king released the bird. It sat on the high door arch, made a golden

original: viṣṭhāṃ vidhāyapūrvaṃ tāvad ahaṃ mūrkhaḥ iti ślokaṃ paṭhitvā yathāsukham ākāśamārgeṇa prāyāt /
analyzed: viṣṭhām tāvat aham mūrkhaḥ iti ślokam paṭhitvā yathāsukham ākāśa mārgeṇa prāyāt
translated: dropping, recited the verse First I was a fool, and went away through the sky as it pleased.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmipūrvaṃ tāvad ahaṃ mūrkhaḥ iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi pūrvam tāvat aham mūrkhaḥ iti
translated: Therefore I say: First I was a fool.

original: atha te punar api pratikūladaivatayā hitam api raktākṣavacanam anādṛtya bhūyas taṃ prabhūtamāṃsādivividhāhāreṇa poṣayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: atha te punar api pratikūla daivatayā hitam api raktākṣa vacanam an ādṛtya bhūyas tam prabhūta māṃsa ādi vividha āhāreṇa poṣayāmāsuḥ
translated: Then, again due to their adverse fate, they disregarded the beneficial words of Raktaja, and again nourished him with abundant meat and various other foods.

original: atha raktākṣaḥ svavargam āhūya rahaḥ provācaaho /
analyzed: atha raktākṣaḥ sva vargam āhūya rahaḥ provāca aho
translated: Then Raktaja called his own group and said in private, Oh!

original: etāvad evāsmadbhūpateḥ kuśalaṃ durgaṃ ca /
analyzed: etāvat eva asmad bhūpateḥ kuśalam durgam ca
translated: This much is the well-being and difficulty of our king.

original: tad upadiṣṭaṃ mayā yat kulakramāgataḥ sacivo 'bhidhatte /
analyzed: tat upadiṣṭam mayā yat kula krama āgataḥ sacivaḥ abhidhatte
translated: I have advised what the minister who has come in the family lineage says.

original: tad vayam anyat parvatadurgaṃ samprati samāśrayāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat vayam anyat parvata durgam samprati samāśrayāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, we should now resort to another mountain fortress.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ🔽anāgataṃ yaḥ kurute sa śobhate
analyzed: uktam ca yatas  anāgatam yaḥ kurute sa śobhate
translated: And it is said:🔽He who does what is to come is glorious.

original: sa śocate yo na karoty anāgatam /
analyzed: sa śocate yaḥ na karoti anāgatam
translated: He who does not do what is to come grieves.

original: vane vasann eva jarām upāgato
analyzed: vane vasan eva jarām upāgataḥ
translated: Even dwelling in the forest, having reached old age,

original: bilasya vācā na kadāpi hi śrutā // ///
analyzed: bilasya vācā na kadāpi hi śrutā
translated: The voice of the cave was never heard.

original: te procuḥkatham etat /
analyzed: te procuḥ katham etat
translated: They said: How is this?

original: raktākṣaḥ kathayati
analyzed: raktākṣaḥ kathayati
translated: Raktaksha told the story:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: Story

original: kharanakharasiṃhakathā
translated: The story of the lion with sharp claws

original: kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe kharanakharo nāma siṃhaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe kharanakharaḥ nāma siṃhaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain forest region, there lived a lion named Sharp Claws.

original: sa kadācid itaś cetaś ca paribhraman kṣutkṣāmakaṇṭho na kiñcid api sattvam āsasāda /
analyzed: sa kadācid itas ca itas ca paribhraman kṣudh kṣāma kaṇṭhaḥ na kiñcid api sattvam āsasāda
translated: He, wandering here and there, with his throat parched with hunger, did not find any being at all.

original: tataś cāstam anasamaye mahatīṃ giriguhām āsādya praviṣṭaś cintayāmāsanūnam etasyāṃ guhāyāṃ rātrau kenāpi sattvenāgantavyam /
analyzed: tatas ca astam ana samaye mahatīm giri guhām āsādya praviṣṭaḥ cintayāmāsa nūnam etasyām guhāyām rātrau kena api sattvena āgantavyam
translated: Then, at the time of sunset, having reached a great mountain cave and entered it, he thought: Surely, in this cave, some being will come at night.

original: tan nibhṛto bhūtvā tiṣṭhāmi /
analyzed: tat nibhṛtaḥ bhūtvā tiṣṭhāmi
translated: So I shall stay here, being careful.

original: etasminn antare tatsvāmī dadhipuccho nāma śṛgālaḥ samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: etasmin antare tad svāmī dadhipucchaḥ nāma śṛgālaḥ samāyātaḥ
translated: In the meantime, the jackal named Curd-Tail came there.

original: sa ca yāvat paśyati tāvat siṃhapadapaddhatir guhāyāṃ praviṣṭaḥ /🔽na ca niṣkrāntā iti dṛṣṭavān /
analyzed: sa ca yāvat paśyati tāvat siṃha pada paddhatiḥ guhāyām praviṣṭaḥ  na ca niṣkrāntāḥ iti dṛṣṭavān
translated: When he saw that the lion’s footprints entered the cave,

original: tataś cācintayataho vinaṣṭo 'smi /
analyzed: tatas ca acintayata ho vinaṣṭaḥ smi
translated: but no one came out, he thought, “Alas, I am ruined!

original: nūnam asyāntargatena siṃhena bhāvyam /
analyzed: nūnam asya antargatena siṃhena bhāvyam
translated: Surely there must be a lion inside.

original: tat kiṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat kim karomi
translated: What shall I do?

original: kathaṃ jñāsyāmi /
analyzed: katham jñāsyāmi
translated: How can I find out?”

original: evaṃ vicintya dvārasthaḥ phūtkartum ārabdhaḥaho bila /
analyzed: evam vicintya dvārasthaḥ phūtkartum ārabdhaḥ aho bila
translated: Thinking thus, he stood at the door and began to whistle, “Oh, cave!

original: aho bila /
analyzed: aho bila
translated: Oh, cave!”

original: ity uktvā tūṣṇīṃbhūya bhūyo 'pi tathaiva pratyabhāṣatabhoḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā tūṣṇīṃbhūya tathā eva pratyabhāṣata bhoḥ
translated: Having said this, he remained silent, and then spoke again in the same way, “Hey!

original: kiṃ na smarasi yan mayā tvayā saha samayaḥ kṛto 'sti /
analyzed: kim na smarasi yat mayā tvayā saha samayaḥ kṛtaḥ sti
translated: Don’t you remember the agreement I made with you?

original: yan mayā bāhyāt samāgatena tvaṃ vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: yat mayā bāhyāt samāgatena tvam vaktavyaḥ
translated: When I come from outside, you should call me.

original: tvayā cāham ākaraṇīyaḥ iti /
analyzed: tvayā ca aham ākaraṇīyaḥ iti
translated: And I should be called by you.

original: tad yadi māṃ nāhvayasi tato 'haṃ dvitīyaṃ bilaṃ yāsyāmi /
analyzed: tat yadi mām na āhvayasi tatas ham dvitīyam bilam yāsyāmi
translated: If you don’t call me, then I will go to another cave.”

original: atha tac chrutvā siṃhaś cintitavānnūnam eṣā guhāsya samāgatasya sadā samāhvānaṃ karoti /
analyzed: atha tat śrutvā siṃhaḥ cintitavān nūnam eṣā guhā asya samāgatasya sadā samāhvānam karoti
translated: Hearing this, the lion thought, “Surely this cave always calls out when someone comes,

original: param adya madbhayān na kiṃcid brūte /
analyzed: param adya mad bhayāt na kiṃcid brūte
translated: but today it says nothing out of fear of me.”

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: bhayasantrastamanasāṃ hastapādādikāḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: bhaya santrasta manasām hasta pāda ādikāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: The actions of hands, feet, etc. of those whose minds are frightened by fear,

original: pravartante na vāṇī ca vepathuś cādhiko bhavet // ///
analyzed: pravartante na vāṇī ca vepathuḥ ca adhikaḥ bhavet
translated: Do not proceed, and speech trembles even more.

original: tad aham asyāhvānaṃ karomi yena tadanusāreṇa praviṣṭo 'yaṃ me bhojyatāṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: tat aham asya āhvānam karomi yena tad anusāreṇa praviṣṭaḥ yam me bhojya tām yāsyati
translated: Therefore, I call him, so that following him, he will enter and become my food.

original: evaṃ sampradhārya siṃhas tasyāhvānam akarot /
analyzed: evam sampradhārya siṃhaḥ tasya āhvānam akarot
translated: Having thus considered, the lion made his call.

original: atha siṃhaśabdena sā guhā pratiravasampūrṇā anyān api dūrasthān araṇyajīvāṃs trāsayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha siṃha śabdena sā guhā pratirava sampūrṇā anyān api dūra sthān araṇya jīvān trāsayāmāsa
translated: Then, filled with echoes, the cave frightened others living in the forest, even those far away.

original: śṛgālo 'pi palāyamāna imaṃ ślokam apaṭhatanāgataṃ yaḥ kurute sa śobhate ity ādi /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ pi palāyamānaḥ imam ślokam yaḥ kurute sa śobhate iti ādi
translated: The jackal, as he fled, recited this verse beginning with He who prepares for the future shines.

original: tad evaṃ matvā yuṣmābhir mayā saha gantavyam iti /
analyzed: tat evam matvā yuṣmābhiḥ mayā saha gantavyam iti
translated: Having understood this, you should go with me.

original: evam abhidhāyātmānuyāyiparivārānugato dūradeśāntaraṃ raktākṣo jagāma /
analyzed: evam abhidhāya ātma anuyāyi parivāra anugataḥ dūra deśa antaram raktākṣaḥ jagāma
translated: Having said this, Raktaja, followed by his own retinue and attendants, went to a distant foreign land.

original: atha raktākṣe gate sthirajīvy atihṛṣṭamanā vyacintayataho /
analyzed: atha raktākṣe gate sthirajīvī ati hṛṣṭa manāḥ vyacintayata ho
translated: Then, when Raktaja had gone, Sthirajiva, with a very happy mind, thought: Ah!

original: kalyāṇam asmākam upasthitam /
analyzed: kalyāṇam asmākam upasthitam
translated: A good thing has come to us.

original: yad raktāṃśo gataḥ sa dīrghadarśī ete ca mūḍhamanasaḥ /
analyzed: yat rakta aṃśaḥ gataḥ sa dīrghadarśī ete ca mūḍha manasaḥ
translated: That Raktaja has gone, he who is far-sighted, and these have foolish minds.

original: tato mama sukhaghātyāḥ sañjātāḥ /
analyzed: tatas mama sukha ghātyāḥ sañjātāḥ
translated: Then they became easy to kill for me.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: na dīrghadarśino yasya mantriṇaḥ syur mahīpateḥ /
analyzed: na dīrgha darśinaḥ yasya mantriṇaḥ syuḥ mahīpateḥ
translated: If a king does not have ministers who have foresight,

original: kramāyātā dhruvaṃ tasya na cirāt syāt parikṣayaḥ // ///
analyzed: krama āyātāḥ dhruvam tasya na cirāt syāt parikṣayaḥ
translated: it is certain that his kingdom will perish soon.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: mantrirūpā hi ripavaḥ sambhāvyās te vicakṣaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: mantri rūpāḥ hi ripavaḥ sambhāvyāḥ te vicakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: The wise should consider enemies in the form of ministers,

original: ye santaṃ nayam utsṛjya sevante pratilomataḥ // ///
analyzed: ye santam nayam utsṛjya sevante pratilomataḥ
translated: who, abandoning good policy, serve in the opposite way.

original: evaṃ vicintya svakulāya ekaikāṃ vanakāṣṭhikāṃ guhāpradīpanārthaṃ dine dine prakṣipati /
analyzed: evam vicintya sva kulāye ekaikām vana kāṣṭhikām guhā pradīpana artham dine dine prakṣipati
translated: Thinking thus, he throws one piece of wood from the forest into the cave every day to set it on fire for his own nest.

original: na ca te mūrkhā ulūkā vijānanti /
analyzed: na ca te mūrkhāḥ ulūkāḥ vijānanti
translated: And those foolish owls do not understand.

original: yad eṣa kulāyam asmaddāhāya vṛddhiṃ nayati /
analyzed: yat eṣa kulāyam asmad dāhāya vṛddhim nayati
translated: That he is increasing the nest for our destruction.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: amitraṃ kurute mitraṃ mitraṃ dveṣṭi hinasti ca /
analyzed: amitram kurute mitram mitram dveṣṭi hinasti ca
translated: A man struck by fate befriends an enemy, hates a friend and harms him,

original: śubhaṃ vetty aśubhaṃ pāpaṃ bhadraṃ daivahato naraḥ // ///
analyzed: śubham vetti aśubham pāpam bhadram daiva hataḥ naraḥ
translated: knows evil as good, and commits sin.

original: atha kulāyavyājena durgadvāre kṛte kāṣṭhanicaye /
analyzed: atha kulāya vyājena durga dvāre kṛte kāṣṭha nicaye
translated: Then, when the nest was made as a pretext, a pile of wood was made at the gate of the fortress.

original: sañjāte sūryodaye /
analyzed: sañjāte sūrya udaye
translated: When the sun rose,

original: andhatāṃ prāpteṣūlūkeṣu satsu sthirajīvī śīghram ṛṣyamūkaṃ gatvā meghavarṇam āhasvāmin /
analyzed: andha tām prāpteṣu ulūkeṣu satsu sthira jīvī śīghram ṛṣyamūkam gatvā meghavarṇam āha svāmin
translated: When the owls had become blind, Firm-Life quickly went to Ṛṣyamūka and said to Cloudy: Master,

original: dāhasādhyā kṛtā ripuguhāḥ /🔽tat saparivāraḥ sametyaikaikā vanakāṣṭhikāṃ jvalantī gṛhītvā guhādvāre'smatkulāye prakṣipa yena sarve śatravaḥ kumbhīpākanarakaprāyeṇa
analyzed: dāha sādhyā kṛtāḥ ripu guhāḥ  tat sa parivāraḥ sametya ekaikā vana kāṣṭhikām jvalantī gṛhītvā guhā dvāre ismad kulāye prakṣipa yena sarve śatravaḥ kumbhīpāka naraka prāyeṇa  /
translated: the enemy's cave has been made ready for burning.

original: duḥkhena mriyante /
analyzed: duḥkhena mriyante
translated: Therefore, together with your retinue, take one flaming log from the forest each, and throw it at the entrance to our nest in the cave, so that all the enemies will die with the suffering of the Kumbhīpāka hell.

original: tac chrutvā prahṛṣṭo meghavarṇa āhatāta /
analyzed: tat śrutvā prahṛṣṭaḥ meghavarṇaḥ āha tāta
translated: Hearing this, Cloudy was delighted and said, Father,

original: kathayātmavṛttāntam /
analyzed: kathaya ātma vṛttāntam
translated: tell your story.

original: cirād adya dṛṣṭo 'si /
analyzed: cirāt adya dṛṣṭaḥ si
translated: After a long time, I see you today.

original: sa āhavatsa /
analyzed: saḥ āhavat sa
translated: He said, Son,

original: nāyaṃ kathanasya kālaḥ /
analyzed: na ayam kathanasya kālaḥ
translated: this is not the time to tell.

original: yataḥ kadācit tasya ripo kaścit praṇidhir mamehāgamanaṃ nivedayiṣyati /
analyzed: yatas kadācid tasya ripoḥ kaścid praṇidhiḥ mama iha āgamanam nivedayiṣyati
translated: Because sometimes an agent of that enemy will inform me of your coming here,

original: yaj jñānād andho 'nyatrāpasaraṇaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: yat jñānāt andhaḥ nyatra apasaraṇam kariṣyati
translated: from whose knowledge the blind one will go elsewhere.

original: tat tvaryatām / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat tvaryatām uktam ca
translated: Therefore, hurry. And it is said:

original: śīghrakṛtyeṣu kāryeṣu vilambayati yo naraḥ /
analyzed: śīghra kṛtyeṣu kāryeṣu vilambayati yaḥ naraḥ
translated: A man who delays in urgent matters,

original: tat kṛtyaṃ devatās tasya kopād vighnanty asaṃśayam // ///
analyzed: tat kṛtyam devatāḥ tasya kopāt vighnanti asaṃśayam
translated: the gods, without doubt, obstruct that task out of anger.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: yasya yasya hi kāryasya phalitasya viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: yasya yasya hi kāryasya phalitasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: Of whatever task, especially when accomplished,

original: kṣipram akriyamāṇasya kālaḥ pibati tatphalam // ///
analyzed: kṣipram a kriyamāṇasya kālaḥ pibati tad phalam
translated: The time drinks up the fruit of that which is not quickly done.

original: tadguhāyām āyātasya te hataśatroḥ sarvaṃ savistaraṃ nirvyākulatayā kathayiṣyāmi
analyzed: tat guhāyām āyātasya te hata śatroḥ sarvam sa vistaram nirvyākula tayā kathayiṣyāmi
translated: I will tell you in detail, without confusion, everything about the enemy who has been killed, when you come to that cave.

original: athāsau tadvacanam ākarṇya saparijana ekaikāṃ jvalantīṃ vanakāṣṭhikāṃ cañcvagreṇa
analyzed: atha asau tad vacanam ākarṇya sa parijanaḥ ekaikām jvalantīm vana kāṣṭhikām cañcu agreṇa
translated: Then, having heard those words, along with his retinue, he took each burning piece of forest wood with the tip of his beak,

original: gṛhītvā tadguhādvāraṃ prāpya sthirajīvikulāye prākṣipat /
analyzed: gṛhītvā tat guhā dvāram prāpya sthira jīvi kulāye prākṣipat
translated: reached the entrance to that cave, and threw it into the nest of Sthirayu.

original: tataḥ sarve te divāndhā raktākṣavākyāni smaranto dvārasyāvṛtatvād aniḥsaranto guhāmadhye kumbhīpākanyāyam āpannā mṛtāś ca /
analyzed: tatas sarve te divā andhāḥ rakta akṣa vākyāni smarantaḥ dvārasya āvṛta tvāt a niḥsarantaḥ guhā madhye kumbhīpāka nyāyam āpannāḥ mṛtāḥ ca
translated: Then, all of them, blind during the day, remembering the words of Raktaja, not being able to escape due to the closed door, met with the fate of being cooked in a cauldron in the middle of the cave and died.

original: evaṃ śatrūn niḥśeṣatāṃ nītvā bhūyo 'pi meghavarṇas tad eva nyagrodhapādapadurgaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: evam śatrūn niḥśeṣa tām nītvā bhūyas u pi meghavarṇaḥ tat eva nyagrodha pādapa durgam jagāma
translated: Thus, having brought the enemies to complete destruction, Meghavarṇa again went to that very fortress of the banyan tree.

original: tataḥ siṃhāsanastho bhūtvā sabhāmadhye pramuditamanāḥ sthirajīvinam apṛcchattāta /
analyzed: tatas siṃhāsana sthaḥ bhūtvā sabhā madhye pramudita manāḥ sthira jīvinam apṛcchat tāta
translated: Then, having sat on the lion throne, in the middle of the assembly, with a delighted mind, he asked Sthirayu, Father,

original: kathaṃ tvayā śatrumadhye gatena etāvatparyantaṃ kālo nītaḥ /
analyzed: katham tvayā śatru madhye gatena etāvat paryantam kālaḥ nītaḥ
translated: how were you able to spend so much time in the midst of enemies?

original: tad atra kautukam asmākaṃ vartate /
analyzed: tat atra kautukam asmākam vartate
translated: That is a wonder to us here.

original: tat kathyatām / yataḥ
analyzed: tat kathyatām yatas
translated: Therefore, it should be told, because

original: varamagnau pradīpte tu prapātaḥ puṇyakarmaṇām /
analyzed: varam agnau pradīpte tu prapātaḥ puṇya karmaṇām
translated: It is better for the virtuous to fall into a blazing fire,

original: na cārijanasaṃsargo muhūrtam api sevitaḥ // ///
analyzed: na cāri jana saṃsargaḥ muhūrtam api sevitaḥ
translated: than to associate with the wicked even for a moment.

original: tad ākarṇya sthirajīvy āhabhadra /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya sthirajīvī āha bhadra
translated: Hearing this, Sthirajīva said, Sir,

original: āgāmiphalavāñchayā kaṣṭam api sevako na jānāti /
analyzed: āgāmi phala vāñchayā kaṣṭam api sevakaḥ na jānāti
translated: A servant does not know the hardship even if he serves with the desire for future fruits.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: kāryasyāpekṣayā bhuktaṃ viṣam apy amṛtāyate /
analyzed: kāryasya apekṣayā bhuktam viṣam api amṛtāyate
translated: Food taken in consideration of the work becomes nectar even if it is poison.

original: sarveṣāṃ prāṇināṃ yatra nātra kāryā vicāraṇā // ///
analyzed: sarveṣām prāṇinām yatra na atra kāryā vicāraṇā
translated: Where all living beings are, there is no need to think.

original: upanatabhaye yo yo mārgo hitārthakaro bhavet sa sa nipuṇayā buddhyā sevyo mahān kṛpaṇo 'pi vā /
analyzed: upanata bhaye yaḥ yaḥ mārgaḥ hita artha karaḥ bhavet sa sa nipuṇayā buddhyā sevyaḥ mahān vā
translated: When there is imminent danger, whatever path may be beneficial should be followed with sharp intelligence, whether it is great or small.

original: karikaranibhau jyāghātā kau mahāstraviśāradau valayaracitau strīvad bāhū kṛtau na kirīṭinā // ///
analyzed: kari kara nibhau jyā ghātā kau mahā astra viśāradau valaya racitau strī vat bāhū kṛtau na kirīṭinā
translated: The two arms of Arjuna, which are like the trunk of an elephant and which are skilled in the use of great weapons, have been made to resemble a woman's arms with bracelets by the diadem-wearing Arjuna.

original: śaktenāpi satā janena viduṣā kālāntarāpekṣiṇā
analyzed: śaktena api satā janena viduṣā kāla antara apekṣiṇā
translated: Even by a powerful and wise person, who looks forward to future time,

original: vastavyaṃ khalu vākyavajraviṣame kṣudre'pi pāpe jane /
analyzed: vastavyam khalu vākya vajra viṣame kṣudre api pāpe jane
translated: one must indeed live among the wicked, even the smallest sinner, on the uneven ground of words.

original: darvīvyagrakareṇa dhūmamalinenāyāsayukte ca
analyzed: darvī vyagra kareṇa dhūma malinena āyāsa yukte ca
translated: With a ladle busy in his hand, soiled with smoke, and with effort,

original: bhīmenātibalena matsyabhavane kiṃ noṣitaṃ sūdavat // ///
analyzed: bhīmena ati balena matsya bhavane kim nā uṣitam sūda vat
translated: what was not done by the cook in the house of Matsya, with a terrible and very strong (ladle)?

original: yad vā tad vā viṣamapatitaḥ sādhu vā garhitaṃ vā
analyzed: yat vā tat vā viṣama patitaḥ sādhu vā garhitam vā
translated: Whatever the case may be, whether it be good or bad, whether it be right or wrong,

original: kālāpekṣī hṛdayanihitaṃ buddhimān karma kuryāt /🔽kiṃ gāṇḍīvasphuraduruguṇāsphālanakrūrapāṇir
analyzed: kāla apekṣī hṛdaya nihitam buddhimān karma kuryāt  kim gāṇḍīva sphurat uru guṇa āsphālana krūra pāṇiḥ
translated: the wise man should do his duty, keeping in mind the right time.🔽Was not Savyasachi, with his left hand playing gracefully, his girdle jingling,

original: nāsīl līlānaṭanavilasan mekhalī savyasācī // ///
analyzed: na āsīt līlā naṭana vilasan mekhalī savyasācī
translated: his right hand cruel in striking with the fierce string of the Gandiva?

original: siddhiṃ prārthayatā janena viduṣā tejo nigṛhya svakaṃ
analyzed: siddhim prārthayatā janena viduṣā tejaḥ nigṛhya svakam
translated: By a wise man who desires success, restraining his own energy,

original: sattvotsāhavatāpi daivavidhiṣu sthairyaṃ prakārya kramāt /
analyzed: sattva utsāhavatā api daiva vidhiṣu sthairyam prakārya kramāt
translated: and even with fortitude and enthusiasm, steadiness should be shown in the course of fate.

original: devendradraviṇeśvarāntakasamair apy anvito bhrātṛbhiḥ
analyzed: deva indra draviṇa īśvara antaka samaiḥ api anvitaḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ
translated: Even though accompanied by brothers equal to the lord of gods, Kubera, and Yama,

original: kiṃ kliṣṭaḥ suciraṃ virāṭabhavane śrīmān na dharmātmajaḥ // ///
analyzed: kim kliṣṭaḥ su ciram virāṭa bhavane śrīmān na dharmātmajaḥ
translated: was not the glorious son of Dharma afflicted for a long time in the house of Virata?

original: rūpābhijanasampanno mādrīputrau balānvitau /
analyzed: rūpa abhijana sampannaḥ mādrī putrau bala anvitau
translated: The sons of Madri, endowed with beauty and noble birth, and possessing strength,

original: gokarmarakṣāvyāpāre virāṭapreṣyatāṃ gatau // ///
analyzed: go karma rakṣā vyāpāre virāṭa preṣya tām gatau
translated: were engaged in the occupation of tending cattle and guarding, and became servants of Virata.

original: rūpeṇāpratimena yauvanaguṇaiḥ śreṣṭhe kule janmanā
analyzed: rūpeṇa apratimena yauvana guṇaiḥ śreṣṭhe kule janmanā
translated: She who was incomparable in beauty, in a noble family with the qualities of youth,

original: kāntyā śrīr iva yātra sāpi vidaśāṃ kālakramād āgatā /
analyzed: kāntyā śrīḥ iva yā atra sā api vidaśām kāla kramāt āgatā
translated: and with loveliness like Lakshmi, she too has come to misfortune in course of time.

original: sairandhrīti sagarvitaṃ yuvatibhiḥ sākṣepam ākhyātayā
analyzed: sairandhrī iti sa garvitam yuvatibhiḥ sa ākṣepam ākhyātayā
translated: She who was called by young women with pride and contempt as Sairandhri,

original: draupadyā nanu matsyarājabhavane dhṛṣṭaṃ na kiṃ candanam // ///
analyzed: draupadyā nanu matsya rāja bhavane dhṛṣṭam na kim candanam
translated: Didn't you boldly use sandalwood in the palace of the King of Matsya with Draupadi?

original: meghavarṇa āhatāta /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āhatāta
translated: Meghavarṇa said, Father,

original: asidhārāvratam idaṃ manye yad ariṇā saha saṃvāsaḥ /
analyzed: asidhārā vratam idam manye yat ariṇā saha saṃvāsaḥ
translated: I think this is the sword-edge vow, to live with an enemy.

original: so 'bravītdeva /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt deva
translated: He said, Your Majesty,

original: evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat
translated: it is so.

original: paraṃ na tādṛṅmūrkhasamāgamaḥ kvāpi mayā dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: param na tādṛś mūrkha samāgamaḥ kvāpi mayā dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: But I have never seen such a foolish association anywhere else.

original: na ca mahāprajñam anekaśāstreṣv apratimabuddhiṃ raktākṣaṃ vinā dhīmān /
analyzed: na ca mahā prajñam aneka śāstreṣu apratima buddhim raktākṣam vinā dhīmān
translated: And there is no wise man without Raktaaksha, who is greatly wise and has unmatched intelligence in many scriptures.

original: yatkāraṇaṃ tena madīyaṃ yathāvasthitaṃ cittaṃ jñātam /
analyzed: yatkāraṇam tena madīyam yathā avasthitam cittam jñātam
translated: For he knew my mind as it was.

original: ye punar anye mantriṇas te mahāmūrkhā mantrimātravyapadeśopajīvino 'tattvakuśalā /
analyzed: ye punar anye mantriṇaḥ te mahā mūrkhāḥ mantri mātra vyapadeśa upajīvinaḥ tattva kuśalāḥ
translated: But the other ministers are very foolish, living only on the designation of being ministers, unskilled in reality.

original: yair idam api na jñātam / yataḥ🔽arito 'bhyāgato bhṛtyo duṣṭas tatsaṅgatatparaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ idam api na jñātam yatas
translated: By whom this was not known. Because🔽A servant who has come from an enemy, is wicked, attached to him,

original: apasarpasadharmatvān nityodvegī ca dūṣitaḥ // ///
analyzed: apasarpa sadharma tvāt nitya udvegī ca dūṣitaḥ
translated: is always suspicious due to being of the same nature as a deserter.

original: āsane śayane yāne pānabhojanavastuṣu /
analyzed: āsane śayane yāne pāna bhojana vastuṣu
translated: On seats, beds, vehicles, and in drinks and food,

original: dṛṣṭvāntaraṃ pramatteṣu praharanty arayo 'riṣu // ///
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā antaram pramatteṣu praharanti arayaḥ
translated: enemies strike when they see an opportunity in careless enemies.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena trivarganilayaṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena trivarga nilayam budhaḥ
translated: Therefore, with all effort, a wise man, the abode of the three goals,

original: ātmānam ādṛto rakṣet pramādād dhi vinaśyati // ///
analyzed: ātmānam ādṛtaḥ rakṣet pramādāt hi vinaśyati
translated: One should carefully protect oneself, for one is destroyed by negligence.

original: sādhu cedam ucyate🔽santāpayanti kam apathyabhujaṃ na rogā
analyzed: sādhu ca idam ucyate  santāpayanti kam apathya bhujam na rogā
translated: And this is well said:🔽Do not diseases afflict one who eats unwholesome food?

original: durmantriṇaṃ kam upayānti na nītidoṣāḥ /
analyzed: durmantriṇam kam upayānti na nīti doṣāḥ
translated: Do not faults of policy befall a bad minister?

original: kaṃ śrīr na darpayati kaṃ na nihanti mṛtyuḥ
analyzed: kam śrīḥ na darpayati kam na nihanti mṛtyuḥ
translated: Does not death kill one who is proud of wealth?

original: kaṃ svīkṛtā na viṣayā paripīḍayanti // ///
analyzed: kam svīkṛtāḥ na viṣayā paripīḍayanti
translated: Do not objects that have been accepted cause suffering?

original: lubdhasya naśyati yaśaḥ piśunasya maitrī
analyzed: lubdhasya naśyati yaśaḥ piśunasya maitrī
translated: The fame of a greedy person is destroyed, the friendship of a slanderer,

original: naṣṭakriyasya kula arthaparasya dharmaḥ /
analyzed: naṣṭa kriyasya kula artha parasya dharmaḥ
translated: The dharma of one who has abandoned action, the wealth of one who is devoted to wealth.

original: vidyāphalaṃ vyasaninaḥ kṛpaṇasya saukhyaṃ
analyzed: vidyā phalam vyasaninaḥ kṛpaṇasya saukhyam
translated: The fruit of learning of one who is addicted, the happiness of a miser,

original: rājyaṃ pramattasacivasya narādhipasya // ///
analyzed: rājyam pramatta sacivasya narādhipasya
translated: The kingdom of a king whose ministers are negligent.

original: tad rājan / asidhārāvrataṃ mayācaritam aritam arisaṃsargād iti yad bhavatoktaṃ /
analyzed: tat rājan asidhārā vratam mayā ācaritam aritam ari saṃsargāt iti yat bhavatā uktam
translated: Therefore, O king, what you said: I have observed the vow of the sword's edge, which is difficult to observe, due to association with enemies,

original: tan mayā sākṣād evānubhūtam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat mayā sākṣāt eva anubhūtam uktam ca
translated: That has been directly experienced by me. And it is said:

original: apamānaṃ puraskṛtya mānaṃ kṛtvā tu pṛṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: apamānam puraskṛtya mānam kṛtvā tu pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Placing disrespect in front and respect in the back,

original: svārtham abhyuddharet prājñaḥ kāryadhvaṃso hi mūrkhatā // ///
analyzed: sva artham abhyuddharet prājñaḥ kārya dhvaṃsaḥ hi mūrkha tā
translated: A wise person should rescue his own self, for destruction of duty is foolishness.

original: skandhenāpi vahec chatruṃ kālam āsādya buddhimān /
analyzed: skandhena api vahet śatrum kālam āsādya buddhimān
translated: Even on his shoulders a wise man would carry an enemy, having reached the right time.

original: mahatā kṛṣṇasarpeṇa maṇḍūkā bahavo hatāḥ // ///
analyzed: mahatā kṛṣṇasarpeṇa maṇḍūkāḥ bahavaḥ hatāḥ
translated: Many frogs were killed by a large black snake.

original: meghavarṇa āhakatham etat /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Meghavarṇa said, How is this?

original: sthirajīvī kathayati
analyzed: sthirajīvī kathayati
translated: Sthirayu said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The story

original: mandaviṣasarpakathā
analyzed: manda viṣa sarpa kathā
translated: The story of the slow-poisoned snake

original: asti varuṇādrisamīpa ekasmin pradeśe pariṇatavayā mandaviṣo nāma kṛṣṇasarpaḥ /
analyzed: asti varuṇa adri samīpe ekasmin pradeśe pariṇata vayāḥ mandaviṣaḥ nāma kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ
translated: Near the Varunādri mountain, in a certain place, there was an old black snake named Mandavisa.

original: sa evaṃ citte sañcintitavānkathaṃ nāma mayā sukhopāyavṛttyā vartitavyam iti /
analyzed: saḥ evam citte sañcintitavān katham nāma mayā sukha upāya vṛttyā vartitavyam iti
translated: He thought in his mind, How can I live by a method that is easy and pleasant?

original: tato bahumaṇḍūkaṃ hradam upagamya dhṛtiparītam ivātmānaṃ darśitavān /🔽atha tathā sthite saudakaprāntagatenaikena maṇḍūkena pṛṣṭaḥmāma /
analyzed: tatas bahu maṇḍūkam hradam upagamya dhṛti parītam iva ātmānam darśitavān  atha tathā sthite saudaka prānta gatena ekena maṇḍūkena pṛṣṭaḥ māma
translated: Then he went to a pond with many frogs and showed himself as if he were full of patience.

original: kim adya yathāpūrvam āhārārthaṃ na viharasi /
analyzed: kim adya yathāpūrvam āhāra artham na viharasi
translated: Then, when he was standing like that, a frog that was on the edge of the water asked him, Why are you not moving today to get food as usual?

original: so 'bravītbhadra /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt bhadra
translated: He said, Good sir,

original: kuto me mandabhāgyasyāhārābhilāṣaḥ /
analyzed: kutas me mandabhāgyasya āhāra abhilāṣaḥ
translated: how can I, unfortunate as I am, have a desire for food?

original: yat kāraṇam adya rātrau pradoṣa eva mayāhārārthaṃ viharamāṇena dṛṣṭa eko maṇḍūkaḥ /
analyzed: yat kāraṇam adya rātrau pradoṣe eva mayā āhāra artham viharamāṇena dṛṣṭaḥ ekaḥ maṇḍūkaḥ
translated: For this reason, last night at dusk, while I was moving to get food, I saw a single frog.

original: tadgrahaṇārthaṃ mayā kramaḥ sajjitaḥ /
analyzed: tad grahaṇa artham mayā kramaḥ sajjitaḥ
translated: In order to catch it, I prepared a path.

original: so 'pi māṃ dṛṣṭvā mṛtyubhayena svādhyāyaprasaktānāṃ brāhmaṇānām antaram apakrānto na vibhāvito mayā kvāpi gataḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi mām dṛṣṭvā mṛtyu bhayena svādhyāya prasaktānām brāhmaṇānām antaram apakrāntaḥ na vibhāvitaḥ mayā kvāpi gataḥ
translated: He, too, seeing me, fled out of fear of death among the Brahmins engaged in reciting the Vedas. I did not notice where he went.

original: tatsādṛśyamohitacittena mayā kasyacid brāhmaṇasya sūnor hradataṭajalāntaḥstho 'ṅguṣṭho daṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tad sādṛśya mohita cittena mayā kasyacid brāhmaṇasya sūnoḥ hrada taṭa jala antar sthaḥ ṅguṣṭhaḥ daṣṭaḥ
translated: With my mind confused by his resemblance, I bit the thumb of the son of some Brahmin who was standing in the water on the bank of a lake.

original: tato 'sau sapadi pañcatvam upāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas sau sapadi pañcatvam upāgataḥ
translated: Then he immediately died.

original: atha tasya pitrā duḥkhitenāhaṃ śapto yathādurātman /
analyzed: atha tasya pitrā duḥkhitena aham śaptaḥ yathā durātman
translated: Then his grieving father cursed me, O evil-souled one!

original: tvayā niraparādho matsuto daṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā niraparādhaḥ mad sutaḥ daṣṭaḥ
translated: You have bitten my innocent son.

original: tad anena doṣeṇa tvaṃ maṇḍūkānāṃ vāhanaṃ bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: tat anena doṣeṇa tvam maṇḍūkānām vāhanam bhaviṣyasi
translated: For this fault, you will become the vehicle of frogs.

original: tatprasādalabdhajīvikayā vartiṣye iti /
analyzed: tad prasāda labdha jīvikayā vartiṣye iti
translated: I will live by the livelihood obtained from him.

original: tato 'haṃ yuṣmākaṃ vāhanārtham āgato 'smi /
analyzed: tatas ham yuṣmākam vāhana artham āgataḥ smi
translated: Then I have come to be your vehicle.

original: tena ca sarvamaṇḍūkānām idam āveditam /
analyzed: tena ca sarva maṇḍūkānām idam āveditam
translated: And that was announced to all the frogs.

original: tatas taiḥ prahṛṣṭamanobhiḥ sarvair eva gatvā jalapādanāmno dardurarājasya vijñaptam /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ prahṛṣṭa manobhiḥ sarvaiḥ eva gatvā jalapāda nāmnaḥ dardura rājasya vijñaptam
translated: Then all of them, with delighted minds, went and informed the frog king named Jalapa.

original: athāsāv api mantriparivṛto 'tyadbhutam idam iti manyamāno sasambhramaṃ hradād uttīrya mandaviṣasya phaṇinaḥ phaṇāpradeśam adhirūḍhaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau api mantri parivṛtaḥ tyadbhutam idam iti manyamānaḥ sa sambhramam hradāt uttīrya manda viṣasya phaṇinaḥ phaṇā pradeśam adhirūḍhaḥ
translated: Then he, surrounded by his ministers, thinking this was extremely wonderful, got out of the lake in great excitement and climbed onto the hood of the slow-poisoned snake.

original: śeṣā api yathājyeṣṭhaṃ tatpṛṣṭhopari samāruruhuḥ /
analyzed: śeṣāḥ api yathājyeṣṭham tad pṛṣṭha upari samāruruhuḥ
translated: The others also climbed onto its back in order of seniority.

original: kiṃ bahunā / uparitasthānam aprāptavantas tasyānupadaṃ dhāvanti /
analyzed: kim bahunā uparita sthānam a prāptavantaḥ tasya anupadam dhāvanti
translated: What's the use of more? They are running after him, not reaching the place he is in.

original: mandaviṣo 'pi teṣāṃ tuṣṭyartham anekaprakārān gativiśeṣān adarśayat /
analyzed: mandaviṣaḥ pi teṣām tuṣṭi artham aneka prakārān gati viśeṣān adarśayat
translated: And Slow-Poison, to please them, displayed various kinds of special movements.

original: atha jalapādo labdhasukhas tam āha🔽na tathā kariṇā yānaṃ turageṇa rathena vā /
analyzed: atha jalapādaḥ labdha sukhaḥ tam āha  na tathā kariṇā yānam turageṇa rathena vā
translated: Then Slow-Poison, having obtained happiness, said to him:🔽A ride on an elephant, a horse, or a chariot,

original: narayānena vā yānaṃ yathā mandaviṣeṇa me // ///
analyzed: nara yānena vā yānam yathā manda viṣeṇa me
translated: or a ride in a human vehicle, is not like my ride on Slow-Poison.

original: athānyedyur mandaviṣaś chadmanā mandaṃ mandaṃ visarpati /
analyzed: atha anyedyus manda viṣaḥ chadmanā mandam mandam visarpati
translated: Then on another day, Slow-Poison was moving slowly and slowly in a deceitful way.

original: tac ca dṛṣṭvā jalapādo 'bravītbhadra /
analyzed: tat ca dṛṣṭvā jalapādaḥ bravīt bhadra
translated: And seeing that, Slow-Poison said: Friend,

original: mandaviṣa /
analyzed: mandaviṣa
translated: Slow-Poison,

original: yathāpūrvaṃ kim adya sādhu nohyate /
analyzed: yathāpūrvam kim adya sādhu na uhyate
translated: why are you not carrying us as before today?

original: mandaviṣo 'bravītdeva adyāhāravaikalyān na me voḍhuṃ śaktir asti /
analyzed: mandaviṣaḥ bravīt deva adya āhāra vaikalyāt na me voḍhum śaktiḥ asti
translated: Slow-Poison said: Your Majesty, today I do not have the strength to carry you because of a lack of food.

original: athāsāv abravītbhadra /
analyzed: atha asau abravīt bhadra
translated: Then he said: Friend,

original: bhakṣaya kṣudramaṇḍūkān /
analyzed: bhakṣaya kṣudra maṇḍūkān
translated: eat small frogs.

original: tac chrutvā praharṣitasarvagātro mandaviṣaḥ sasambhramam abravītmamāyam eva vipraśāpo 'sti /
analyzed: tat śrutvā praharṣita sarva gātraḥ manda viṣaḥ sa sambhramam abravīt mama ayam eva vipra śāpaḥ sti
translated: Hearing that, Mandavisha, with all his limbs filled with joy, said with excitement: This is indeed the curse of the brahmin on me.

original: tat tavānenānujñāvacanena prīto 'smi /
analyzed: tat tava anena anujñā vacanena prītaḥ smi
translated: Therefore, I am pleased with this permission of yours.

original: tato 'sau nairantaryeṇa maṇḍūkān bhakṣayan katipayair evāhobhir balavān saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sau nairantaryeṇa maṇḍūkān bhakṣayan katipayaiḥ eva ahobhiḥ balavān saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: Then he, eating frogs continuously, became strong in just a few days.

original: prahṛṣṭaś cāntarlīnam avahasyedam abravīt
analyzed: prahṛṣṭaḥ ca antar līnam avahasya idam abravīt
translated: And being delighted, he laughed inwardly and said this:

original: maṇḍūkā vividhā hy ete chalapūrvopasādhitāḥ /
analyzed: maṇḍūkāḥ vividhāḥ hi ete chala pūrva upasādhitāḥ
translated: These are various frogs, first deceived by deceit.

original: kiyantaṃ kālam akṣīṇā bhaveyuḥ khāditā mama // ///
analyzed: kiyantam kālam a kṣīṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ khāditāḥ mama
translated: For how long would they become inexhaustible if eaten by me?

original: jalapādo 'pi mandaviṣeṇa kṛtakavacanavyāmohitacittaḥ kim api nāvabudhyate /
analyzed: jalapādaḥ pi manda viṣeṇa kṛtaka vacana vyāmohita cittaḥ kim api na avabudhyate
translated: Jalapadi, his mind deluded by the false words of Mandavisha, did not understand anything.

original: atrāntare'nyo mahākāyaḥ kṛṣṇasarpas tam uddeśaṃ samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: atra antarenyaḥ mahā kāyaḥ kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ tam uddeśam samāyātaḥ
translated: In the meantime, another large black snake came to that place.

original: taṃ ca maṇḍūkair vāhyamānaṃ dṛṣṭvā vismayagatam /
analyzed: tam ca maṇḍūkaiḥ vāhyamānam dṛṣṭvā vismaya gatam
translated: And seeing him being carried by the frogs, he was amazed.

original: āha cavayasya /
analyzed: āha cavayasya
translated: And he said: Friend.

original: yad asmākam aśanaṃ taiḥ kathaṃ vāhyase /
analyzed: yat asmākam aśanam taiḥ katham vāhyase
translated: How is it that you are being carried by those who are our food?

original: viruddham etat /
analyzed: viruddham etat
translated: This is contradictory.

original: mandaviṣo 'bravīt
analyzed: mandaviṣaḥ bravīt
translated: Mandavisha said:

original: sarvam etad vijānāmi yathā vāhyo 'smi darduraiḥ /
analyzed: sarvam etat vijānāmi yathā vāhyaḥ smi darduraiḥ
translated: I know all this, how I am being carried by the frogs.

original: kiñcit kālaṃ pratīkṣe'haṃ ghṛtāndho brāhmaṇo yathā // ///
analyzed: kiñcid kālam pratīkṣa iham ghṛta andhaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yathā
translated: I will wait for some time, like the ghee-blind brahmin.

original: so 'bravītkatham etat /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt katham etat
translated: He said, How is that?

original: mandaviṣaḥ kathayati🔽kathā
analyzed: manda viṣaḥ kathayati  kathā
translated: Mandavisha told the story:

original: ghṛtāndhabrāhmaṇakathā
analyzed: ghṛta andha brāhmaṇa kathā
translated: The Story of the Ghee-Blind Brahmin

original: asti kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne yajñadatto nāma brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne yajñadattaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: In a certain town there was a brahmin named Yajnadatta.

original: tasya bhāryā puṃścaly anyāsaktamanā ajasraṃ viṭāyasakhaṇḍaghṛtān ghṛtapūrān kṛtvā bhartuś caurikayā prayacchati /
analyzed: tasya bhāryā puṃścalī anya āsakta manāḥ ajasram viṭa āyasa khaṇḍa ghṛtān ghṛta pūrān kṛtvā bhartuḥ caurikayā prayacchati
translated: His wife was unchaste, her mind attached to others, and she constantly made ghee-filled pastries with ghee and gave them to a paramour by stealth.

original: atha kadācid bhartā dṛṣṭvābravītbhadre /
analyzed: atha kadācid bhartā dṛṣṭvā abravīt bhadre
translated: One day the husband saw this and said, My dear,

original: kim etat paripacyate /
analyzed: kim etat paripacyate
translated: what is this being cooked?

original: kutra vājasraṃ nayasīdam /
analyzed: kutra vā ajasram nayasi idam
translated: Or where do you take this ghee every day?

original: tat kathaya satyam /
analyzed: tat kathaya satyam
translated: So tell the truth.

original: sā cotpannapratibhā kṛtakavacanair bhartāram abravītasty atra nātidūre bhagavatyā devyā āyatanam /
analyzed: sā ca utpanna pratibhā kṛtaka vacanaiḥ bhartāram abravīt asti atra na atidūre bhagavatyāḥ devyāḥ āyatanam
translated: And she, her wit sharpened, spoke to her husband with fabricated words: Not far from here is a temple of the Blessed Goddess.

original: tatrāham upoṣitā satī baliṃ bhakṣyaviśeṣāṃś cāpūrvān nayāmi /
analyzed: tatra aham upoṣitā satī balim bhakṣya viśeṣān ca apūrvān nayāmi
translated: There, having fasted, I offer oblations and previously unseen special foods.

original: atha tat paśyatā gṛhītvā tat sakalaṃ devyāyatanābhimukhī pratasthe /
analyzed: atha tat paśyatā gṛhītvā tat sakalam devī āyatana abhimukhī pratasthe
translated: Then, seeing that, he took it all and set out in the direction of the Goddess's temple.

original: yat kāraṇaṃ devyā niveditenānena madīyo bhartaivaṃ maṃsyate yat mama brāhmaṇī bhagavatyāḥ
analyzed: yat kāraṇam devyā niveditena anena madīyaḥ bhartā evam maṃsyate yat mama brāhmaṇī bhagavatyāḥ
translated: For this reason, when I offer this to the Goddess, my husband will think that I am🔽a Brahmin woman who has entered the river to bathe for the sake of the Goddess.

original: kṛte nadyām avatīrya yāvat snānaṃ karoti tāvat tad bhartāpi mārgāntareṇāgatya devyāḥ
analyzed: kṛte nadyām avatīrya yāvat snānam karoti tāvat tat bhartā api mārga antareṇa āgatya devyāḥ
translated: Meanwhile, his husband also came by a different path and stood behind the Goddess,

original: pṛṣṭhato 'dṛśyo 'vatasthe /
analyzed: pṛṣṭhatas dṛśyaḥ vatasthe
translated: unseen.

original: atha sā brāhmaṇī snātvā devyāyatanam āgatya snānānulepanamālyadhūpabalikriyādikaṃ kṛtvā devīṃ praṇamya vyajijñapatbhagavati /
analyzed: atha sā brāhmaṇī snātvā devī āyatanam āgatya snāna anulepana mālya dhūpa bali kriyā ādikam kṛtvā devīm praṇamya vyajijñapat bhagavati
translated: Then, after bathing, the Brahmin woman came to the Goddess' temple, performed bathing, anointing, garland, incense, oblation, and other rites, bowed to the Goddess, and said, O Goddess!

original: kena prakāreṇa mama bhartāndho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kena prakāreṇa mama bhartā andhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: By what means will my husband become blind?

original: tac chrutvā svarabhedena devīpṛṣṭhasthito brāhmaṇo jagādayadi tvam ajasraṃ ghṛtapūrādibhakṣyaṃ tasmai bhartre prayacchasi /
analyzed: tat śrutvā svarabhedena devī pṛṣṭha sthitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ jagāda yadi tvam ajasram ghṛtapūra ādi bhakṣyam tasmai bhartre prayacchasi
translated: Hearing that, the Brahmin standing behind the Goddess spoke in a different voice, If you constantly give that food of ghee and other delicacies to your husband,

original: tataḥ śīghram andho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas śīghram andhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: then he will quickly become blind.

original: sā tu bandhakī kṛtakavacanavañcitamānasā tasmai brāhmaṇāya tad eva nityaṃ pradadau /
analyzed: sā tu bandhakī kṛtaka vacana vañcita mānasā tasmai brāhmaṇāya tat eva nityam pradadau
translated: But the adulteress, her mind deceived by the fabricated words, gave him that very thing every day.

original: athānyedyur brāhmaṇenābhihitambhadre /
analyzed: atha anyedyus brāhmaṇena abhihitam bhadre
translated: Then on another day, the Brahmin said, My dear!

original: nāhaṃ sutarāṃ paśyāmi /
analyzed: na aham sutarām paśyāmi
translated: I can't see very well.

original: tac chrutvā cintitam anayādevyāḥ prasādo 'yaṃ prāpta iti /
analyzed: tat śrutvā cintitam anayādevyāḥ prasādaḥ yam prāptaḥ iti
translated: Hearing this, she thought, “This is a favor from the goddess.”

original: atha tasyā hṛdayavallabho viṭas tatsakāśamandhībhūto 'yaṃ brāhmaṇaḥ kiṃ mama kariṣyatīti niḥśaṅkaṃ pratidinam abhyeti /
analyzed: atha tasyāḥ hṛdaya vallabhaḥ viṭaḥ tad sakāśam andhībhūtaḥ yam brāhmaṇaḥ kim mama kariṣyati iti niḥśaṅkam pratidinam abhyeti
translated: Then her lover, who was dear to her heart, thought, “This blind man is a brahman. What can he do to me?” So he came to her house every day without fear.

original: athānyedyus taṃ praviśantam abhyāśagataṃ dṛṣṭvā keśair gṛhītvā laguḍapārṣṇiprabhṛtiprahārais tāvad atāḍayat yāvad asau pañcatvam āpa /
analyzed: atha anyedyus tam praviśantam abhyāśa gatam dṛṣṭvā keśaiḥ gṛhītvā laguḍa pārṣṇi prabhṛti prahāraiḥ tāvat atāḍayat yāvat asau pañcatvam āpa
translated: But the next day, when he entered, she saw him coming near. She grabbed his hair, and beat him with sticks, heels, and so on, until he died.

original: tām api puṣṭapatnīṃ vicchannanāsikāṃ kṛtvā visasarja /
analyzed: tām api puṣṭa patnīm vicchanna nāsikām kṛtvā visasarja
translated: And she cut off the nose of his wife, too, and let her go.🔽That’s why I say, “You should carry your enemy on your shoulders…”

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiskandhenāpi vahec chatrum ity ādi /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi skandhena api vahet śatrum iti ādi
translated: And so on.

original: atha rājan / yathā mandaviṣeṇa buddhibalena maṇḍūkā nihatās tathā mayāpi sarve vairiṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājan yathā manda viṣeṇa buddhi balena maṇḍūkāḥ nihatāḥ tathā mayā api sarve vairiṇaḥ
translated: Then, Your Majesty, just as the frog was killed by the power of the slow-acting poison, so I will kill all my enemies.

original: sādhu cedam ucyate🔽vane prajvalito vahnir dahan mūlāni rakṣati /
analyzed: sādhu ca idam ucyate  vane prajvalitaḥ vahniḥ dahan mūlāni rakṣati
translated: And this is well said:🔽A fire burning in the forest🔽conserves its fuel by burning the roots.🔽But a gentle, cool breeze

original: samūlonmūlanaṃ kuryād vāyur yo mṛduśītalaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa mūla unmūlanam kuryāt vāyuḥ yaḥ mṛdu śītalaḥ
translated: would uproot it completely.

original: meghavarṇa āhatāta /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āhatāta
translated: CloudColor said, “Father,

original: satyam evaitat /
analyzed: satyam eva etat
translated: that is true.

original: ye mahātmāno bhavanti te mahāsattvā āpadgatā api prārabdhaṃ na tyajanti /
analyzed: ye mahātmānaḥ bhavanti te mahāsattvāḥ āpad gatāḥ api prārabdham na tyajanti
translated: Those who are great souls, they are great beings. Even in a crisis, they do not abandon what they have begun.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: mahattvam etan mahatāṃ nayālaṅkāradhāriṇām /
analyzed: mahat tvam etat mahatām naya alaṅkāra dhāriṇām
translated: This is the greatness of the great, who uphold the ornament of policy,

original: na muñcanti yad ārabdhaṃ kṛcchre'pi vyasanodaye // ///
analyzed: na muñcanti yat ārabdham vyasana udaye
translated: That they do not abandon what they have begun, even in the rise of a calamity.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: prārabhyate na khalu vighnabhayena nīcaiḥ
analyzed: prārabhyate na khalu vighna bhayena nīcaiḥ
translated: The low do not begin out of fear of obstacles.

original: prārabhya vighnavihatā viramanti madhyāḥ /
analyzed: prārabhya vighna vihatāḥ viramanti madhyāḥ
translated: The middling, when begun, stop when obstructed.

original: vighnaiḥ sahasraguṇitair api hanyamānāḥ
analyzed: vighnaiḥ sahasra guṇitaiḥ api hanyamānāḥ
translated: Even when struck by a thousandfold obstacles,

original: prārabdham uttamaguṇā na parityajanti // ///
analyzed: prārabdham uttama guṇāḥ na parityajanti
translated: The best do not abandon what they have begun.

original: tat kṛtaṃ niṣkaṇṭakaṃ mama rājyaṃ śatrūn niḥśeṣatāṃ nayatā tvayā /
analyzed: tat kṛtam niṣkaṇṭakam mama rājyam śatrūn niḥśeṣa tām nayatā tvayā
translated: You have made my kingdom free of thorns by destroying the enemies without remainder.

original: athavā yuktam etan nayavedinām /
analyzed: athavā yuktam etat naya vedinām
translated: Or this is proper for those who know policy.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: ṛṇaśeṣaṃ cāgniśeṣaṃ ca śatruśeṣaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: ṛṇa śeṣam ca agni śeṣam ca śatru śeṣam tathā eva ca
translated: The remainder of a debt, the remainder of a fire, and the remainder of an enemy,

original: vyādhiśeṣaṃ ca niḥśeṣaṃ kṛtvā prājño na sīdati // ///
analyzed: vyādhi śeṣam ca niḥśeṣam kṛtvā prājñaḥ na sīdati
translated: And the remainder of a disease, the wise man makes completely gone and does not languish.

original: so 'bravītdeva /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt deva
translated: He said, Your Majesty,

original: bhāgyavān tvam evāsi /
analyzed: bhāgyavān tvam eva asi
translated: You alone are fortunate,

original: yasyārabdhaṃ sarvam eva saṃsiddhyati /
analyzed: yasya ārabdham sarvam eva saṃsiddhyati
translated: Whose undertakings are all successful.

original: tan na kevalaṃ śauryaṃ kṛtyaṃ sādhayati /
analyzed: tat na kevalam śauryam kṛtyam sādhayati
translated: Not only bravery accomplishes the task.

original: kintu prajñayā yat kriyate tad eva vijayāya bhavati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: kintu prajñayā yat kriyate tat eva vijayāya bhavati uktam ca
translated: But what is done with wisdom is for victory. And it is said:

original: śastrair hatā na hi hatā ripavo bhavanti
analyzed: śastraiḥ hatāḥ na hi hatāḥ ripavaḥ bhavanti
translated: Enemies are not really slain by weapons,

original: prajñāhatās tu ripavaḥ suhatā bhavanti /
analyzed: prajñā hatāḥ tu ripavaḥ su hatāḥ bhavanti
translated: but enemies slain by wisdom are truly slain.

original: śastaṃ nihanti puruṣasya śarīram ekaṃ
analyzed: śastam nihanti puruṣasya śarīram ekam
translated: A weapon kills only one person's body,

original: prajñā kulaṃ ca vibhavaś ca yaśaś ca hanti // ///
analyzed: prajñā kulam ca vibhavaḥ ca yaśaḥ ca hanti
translated: but wisdom kills a family, wealth, and fame.

original: tad evaṃ prajñāpuruṣakārābhyāṃ yuktasyāyatnena kāryasiddhayaḥ sambhavanti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat evam prajñā puruṣakārābhyām yuktasya ayatnena kārya siddhayaḥ sambhavanti uktam ca
translated: Thus, for one who is endowed with wisdom and human effort, the accomplishments of one's goals are possible without effort. And it is said:

original: prasarati matiḥ kāryārambhe dṛḍhībhavati smṛtiḥ
analyzed: prasarati matiḥ kārya ārambhe dṛḍhībhavati smṛtiḥ
translated: The mind spreads out in the undertaking of tasks, memory becomes firm,

original: svayam upanayann arthān mantro na gacchati viplavam /
analyzed: svayam upanayan arthān mantraḥ na gacchati viplavam
translated: when one brings the meanings by oneself, the counsel does not go astray.

original: sphurati saphalas tarkaś cittaṃ samunnatim aśnute
analyzed: sphurati sa phalaḥ tarkaḥ cittam samunnatim aśnute
translated: Reasoning shines forth with results, the mind attains elevation,

original: bhavati ca ratiḥ ślāghye kṛtye narasya bhaviṣyataḥ // ///
analyzed: bhavati ca ratiḥ ślāghye kṛtye narasya bhaviṣyataḥ
translated: and there is delight in the praiseworthy task of a man who is to be.

original: tathā ca nayatyāgaśauryasampanne puruṣe rājyam iti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā ca naya tyāga śaurya sampanne puruṣe rājyam iti uktam ca
translated: And thus, the kingdom is in a man who is endowed with generosity, renunciation, and heroism. And it is said:

original: tyāgini śūre viduṣi ca saṃsargarucir jano guṇī bhavati /
analyzed: tyāgini śūre viduṣi ca saṃsarga ruciḥ janaḥ guṇī bhavati
translated: People who delight in association with the generous, the heroic, and the wise become virtuous.

original: guṇavati dhanaṃ dhanāc chrīḥ śrīmaty ājñā tato rājyam // ///
analyzed: guṇavati dhanam dhanāt śrīḥ śrīmatī ājñā tatas rājyam
translated: In the virtuous, wealth; from wealth, prosperity; from the prosperous, command; from that, a kingdom.

original: meghavarṇa āhanūnaṃ sadyaḥphalāni nītiśāstrāṇi yat tvayānukṛtyenānupraviśyārimardanaḥ saparijano niḥśeṣitaḥ /
analyzed: meghavarṇaḥ āha nūnam sadyas phalāni nīti śāstrāṇi yat tvayā anukṛtyena anupraviśya ari mardanaḥ sa parijanaḥ niḥśeṣitaḥ
translated: Cloud Color said, Indeed, the treatises on statecraft bear fruit immediately, since you entered by deceit and completely destroyed the enemy-crusher and his retinue.

original: sthirajīvy āha
analyzed: sthirajīvī āha
translated: Long Life said

original: tīkṣṇopāyaprāptigamyo 'pi yo 'rthas
analyzed: tīkṣṇa upāya prāpti gamyaḥ pi yaḥ rthas
translated: Even if wealth can be obtained through sharp means,

original: tasyāpy ādau saṃśrayaḥ sādhu yuktaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api ādau saṃśrayaḥ sādhu yuktaḥ
translated: at the beginning, it is right to rely on good means.

original: uttuṅgāgraḥ sārabhūto vanānāṃ
analyzed: uttuṅga agraḥ sāra bhūtaḥ vanānām
translated: The king of trees, the essence of the forest, with its lofty peak,

original: mānyābhyarcya cchidyate pādapendraḥ // ///
analyzed: mānya abhyarcya chidyate pādapa indraḥ
translated: is cut down after being honored by the respectable.

original: athavā svāmin /
analyzed: athavā svāmin
translated: Now then, my lord.

original: kiṃ tenābhihitena /
analyzed: kim tena abhihitena
translated: What is the use of what he said?

original: yad anantarajāle kriyārahitam asukhasādhyaṃ vā bhavati /
analyzed: yat anantara jāle kriyā rahitam asukha sādhyam vā bhavati
translated: What is beyond the net, devoid of action, or difficult to accomplish without suffering,

original: sādhu cedam ucyate
analyzed: sādhu ca idam ucyate
translated: And this is well said:

original: aniścitair adhyavasāyabhīrubhir🔽yatheṣṭasaṃlāparatiprayojanaiḥ /
analyzed: aniścitaiḥ adhyavasāya bhīrubhiḥ  yathā iṣṭa saṃlāpa rati prayojanaiḥ
translated: By those who are uncertain, afraid of making decisions,🔽Whose only purpose is to engage in idle talk as they please,

original: phale visaṃvādam upāgatā giraḥ
analyzed: phale visaṃvādam upāgatāḥ giraḥ
translated: Words that fail to deliver results

original: prayānti loke parihāsavastutām // ///
analyzed: prayānti loke parihāsa vastu tām
translated: Become objects of ridicule in the world.

original: na ca laghuṣv api kartavyeṣu dhīmadbhir anādaraḥ kartavyaḥ / yataḥ
analyzed: na ca laghuṣu api kartavyeṣu dhīmadbhiḥ anādaraḥ kartavyaḥ yatas
translated: And the wise should not be dismissive even of small tasks that need to be done. Because

original: śakṣyāmi kartum idam alpam ayatnasādhyam
analyzed: śakṣyāmi kartum idam alpam ayatna sādhyam
translated: I can do this small thing that is easily accomplished without effort,

original: anādaraḥ ka iti kṛtyam upekṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: anādaraḥ kaḥ iti kṛtyam upekṣamāṇāḥ
translated: why be dismissive? thinking thus, those who neglect their duties,

original: kecit pramattamanasaḥ paritāpaduḥkham
analyzed: kecid pramatta manasaḥ paritāpa duḥkham
translated: Some, with distracted minds, experience the suffering of regret,

original: āpatprasaṅgasulabhaṃ puruṣā prayānti // ///
analyzed: āpad prasaṅga sulabham prayānti
translated: Men go to places where they can easily find help in times of trouble.

original: tad adya jitārer madvibhor yathāpūrvaṃ nidrālābho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat adya jita areḥ mad vibhoḥ yathāpūrvam nidrā lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Now, as before, my lord, the conqueror, will obtain sleep.

original: ucyate caitat
analyzed: ucyate ca etat
translated: And this is said:

original: niḥsarpe baddhasarpe vā bhavane suṣyate sukham /
analyzed: niḥsarpe baddha sarpe vā bhavane suṣyate sukham
translated: One sleeps happily in a house free from snakes or with bound snakes.

original: sadā dṛṣṭabhujaṅge tu nidrā duḥkhena labhyate // ///
analyzed: sadā dṛṣṭa bhujaṅge tu nidrā duḥkhena labhyate
translated: But sleep is obtained with difficulty when a snake is always seen.

original: tathā ca🔽vistīrṇavyavasāyasādhyamahatāṃ snighdopayuktāśiṣāṃ
analyzed: tathā ca  vistīrṇa vyavasāya sādhya mahatām snighda upayukta āśiṣām
translated: And so it is said:🔽The affairs of those who achieve great things through extensive plans, whose blessings are smooth and useful,

original: kāryāṇāṃ nayasāhasonnatimatām icchāpadārohiṇām /
analyzed: kāryāṇām naya sāhasa unnatimatām icchā pada ārohiṇām
translated: whose desires are mounted on the height of policy and daring,

original: mānotsekaparākramavyasaninaḥ pāraṃ na yāvadgatāḥ
analyzed: māna utseka parākrama vyasaninaḥ pāram na yāvat gatāḥ
translated: who are addicted to pride, insolence and valor, not having gone to the other shore,

original: sāmarṣe hṛdaye'vakāśaviṣayā tāvat kathaṃ nirvṛtiḥ // ///
analyzed: sa amarṣe hṛdaya ivakāśa viṣayā tāvat katham nirvṛtiḥ
translated: how can there be peace in a jealous heart, with its limited scope and objects?

original: tad avasitakāryārambhasya viśrāmyatīva me hṛdayam /
analyzed: tat avasita kārya ārambhasya viśrāmyati iva me hṛdayam
translated: So my heart is resting, as it were, now that the undertaking of my task is finished.

original: tad idam adhunā nihatakaṇṭakaṃ rājyaṃ prajāpālanatatparo bhūtvā putrapautrādikrameṇācalacchatrāsanaśrīḥ ciraṃ bhuṅkṣva / api ca
analyzed: tat idam adhunā nihata kaṇṭakam rājyam prajā pālana tatparaḥ bhūtvā putra pautra ādi krameṇa acala chatra āsana śrīḥ ciram bhuṅkṣva api ca
translated: Now, having become intent on protecting the people in this kingdom which is now free from thorns, enjoy it for a long time with your sons, grandsons and so on, with the glory of an unshakable parasol and throne. Moreover:

original: prajā na rañjayed yas tu rājā rakṣādibhir guṇaiḥ /
analyzed: prajāḥ na rañjayet yaḥ tu rājā rakṣā ādibhiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: A king who does not delight his subjects with the qualities of protection and so on,

original: ajāgalastanasyeva tasya rājyaṃ nirarthakam // ///🔽guṇeṣu rāgo vyasaneṣv anādaro
analyzed: ajāgala stanasya iva tasya rājyam nirarthakam  guṇeṣu rāgaḥ vyasaneṣu
translated: His kingdom is as useless as the udder of a barren goat.🔽For the king who has passion for virtues, disregard for vices,

original: ratiḥ subhṛtyeṣu ca yasya bhūpateḥ /🔽ciraṃ sa bhuṅkte calacāmarāṃśukāṃ
analyzed: ratiḥ su bhṛtyeṣu ca yasya bhūpateḥ  ciram sa bhuṅkte cala cāmara aṃśukām
translated: and delight in good servants,🔽he enjoys for a long time the royal glory with a moving yak-tail fan,

original: sitātapatrābharaṇāṃ nṛpaśriyam // ///
analyzed: sita ātapatra ābharaṇām nṛpa śriyam
translated: a white parasol, and ornaments.

original: na ca tvayā prāptarājyo 'ham iti matvā śrīmadenātmā vyasayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca tvayā prāpta rājyaḥ ham iti matvā śrīmadena ātmā vyasayitavyaḥ
translated: And you should not indulge in self-destruction by thinking I have attained the kingdom out of pride.

original: yat kāraṇamcalā hi rājño vibhūtayaḥ vaṃśārohaṇavad rājyalakṣmīdurārohā /
analyzed: yat kāraṇam calāḥ hi rājñaḥ vibhūtayaḥ vaṃśa ārohaṇa vat rājya lakṣmī durārohā
translated: For the prosperity of kings is fleeting. The glory of kingship is difficult to ascend, like climbing a tree.

original: kṣaṇavinipātaratā /
analyzed: kṣaṇa vinipāta ratā
translated: It delights in falling in an instant.

original: prayatnaśatair api dhāryamāṇā durdharā /
analyzed: prayatna śataiḥ api dhāryamāṇā durdharā
translated: Even if held with a hundred efforts, it is difficult to bear.

original: praśastārādhitāpy ante vipralambhinī /🔽vānarajātir iva vidrutānekacittā /🔽padmapatram ivāghaṭitasaṃśleṣā /
analyzed: praśasta ārādhitā api ante vipralambhinī  vānara jātiḥ iva vidruta aneka cittā  padma patram iva āghaṭita saṃśleṣā
translated: Even if worshipped with praise, it is deceptive in the end.🔽Like the monkey species, it has many fickle minds.🔽Like a lotus leaf, it has no fixed attachment.

original: pavanagatir ivāticapalā /
analyzed: pavana gatiḥ iva ati capalā
translated: Like the wind, it is extremely fickle.

original: anāryasaṅgatir ivāsthirā /
analyzed: an ārya saṅgatiḥ iva asthirā
translated: Like association with the ignoble, it is unstable.

original: āśīviṣa iva durupacārā /🔽sandhyābhralekheva muhūrtarāgā /
analyzed: āśīviṣaḥ iva durupacārā  sandhyā abhra lekhā iva muhūrta rāgā
translated: Like a poisonous snake, it is difficult to serve.🔽Like the lines of evening clouds, it is momentary.

original: jalabudbudāvalīva svabhāvabhaṅgurā /
analyzed: jala budbuda āvalī iva svabhāva bhaṅgurā
translated: Like a series of water bubbles, it is naturally perishable.

original: śarīraprakṛtir iva kṛtaghnā /
analyzed: śarīra prakṛtiḥ iva kṛtaghnā
translated: Like the nature of the body, it is ungrateful.

original: svapnalabdhadravyarāśir iva kṣaṇadṛṣṭanaṣṭā / api ca
analyzed: svapna labdha dravya rāśiḥ iva kṣaṇa dṛṣṭa naṣṭāḥ api ca
translated: Like a heap of wealth obtained in a dream, seen for a moment and then lost. Moreover,

original: yadaiva rājye kriyate'bhiṣekas
analyzed: yadā eva rājye kriyate abhiṣekaḥ
translated: The moment one is consecrated to the kingdom,

original: tadaiva buddhir vyasaneṣu yojyā /
analyzed: tadā eva buddhiḥ vyasaneṣu yojyā
translated: at that very moment, one's mind should be engaged in vices.

original: ghaṭā hi rājñām abhiṣekakāle
analyzed: ghaṭāḥ hi rājñām abhiṣeka kāle
translated: For at the time of a king's consecration,

original: sahāmbhasaivāpadam udgiranti // ///
analyzed: saha ambhasā eva āpadam udgiranti
translated: pots vomit calamity along with water.

original: na ca kaścid anadhigamanīyo nāmāsty āpadām / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na ca kaścid anadhigamanīyaḥ nāma asti āpadām uktam ca
translated: And there is no one who is not subject to calamities. It is said:

original: rāmasya vrajanaṃ vane nivasanaṃ pāṇḍoḥ sutānāṃ vane
analyzed: rāmasya vrajanam vane nivasanam pāṇḍoḥ sutānām vane
translated: Rama's departure to the forest, the Pandavas' dwelling in the forest,

original: vṛṣṇīnāṃ nidhanaṃ nalasya nṛpate rājyāt paribhraṃśanam /
analyzed: vṛṣṇīnām nidhanam nalasya nṛpate rājyāt paribhraṃśanam
translated: the destruction of the Vrishnis, King Nala's fall from the kingdom,

original: nāṭyācāryakam arjunasya patanaṃ sañcintya laṅkeśvare
analyzed: nāṭya ācāryakam arjunasya patanam sañcintya laṅkā īśvare
translated: Arjuna's becoming a dancing master, the fall of the lord of Lanka - all this

original: sarve kālavaśāj jano 'tra sahate kaḥ kaṃ paritrāyate // ///
analyzed: sarve kāla vaśāt sahate kaḥ kam paritrāyate
translated: people here endure due to the power of time. Who can save whom?

original: kva sa daśarathaḥ svarge bhūtvā mahendrasuhṛd gataḥ
analyzed: kva sa daśarathaḥ svarge bhūtvā mahā indra suhṛd gataḥ
translated: Where is that Dasharatha, who became Indra's friend in heaven?

original: kva sa jalanidher velāṃ baddhvā nṛpaḥ sagaras tathā /
analyzed: kva sa jalanidheḥ velām baddhvā nṛpaḥ sagaraḥ tathā
translated: Where is that king Sagara, who bound the shore of the ocean?

original: kva sa karatalāj jāto vainyaḥ kva sūryatanur manuḥ
analyzed: kva sa kara talāt jātaḥ vainyaḥ kva sūrya tanuḥ manuḥ
translated: Where is that Manu born from the palm, and where is that Manu born from the sun?

original: nanu balavatā kālenaite prabodhya nimīlitāḥ // ///
analyzed: nanu balavatā kālena ete prabodhya nimīlitāḥ
translated: Surely, these have been awakened and closed by powerful time.

original: māndhātā kva gatas trilokavijayī rājā kva satyavrataḥ
analyzed: māndhātā kva gataḥ triloka vijayī rājā kva satya vrataḥ
translated: Where is Mandhatri, the king who conquered the three worlds? Where is Satyavrata?

original: devānāṃ nṛpatir gataḥ kva nahuṣaḥ sacchāstravān keśavaḥ /
analyzed: devānām nṛpatiḥ gataḥ kva nahuṣaḥ sat śāstravān keśavaḥ
translated: Where has King Nahusha of the gods gone? Where is Keshava, who possessed true scriptures?

original: manyante sarathāḥ sakuñjaravarāḥ śakrāsanādhyāsinaḥ
analyzed: manyante sa rathāḥ sa kuñjara varāḥ śakra āsana adhyāsinaḥ
translated: They consider themselves to be seated on Indra's throne, with chariots and the best of elephants.

original: kālenaiva mahātmanā tv anukṛtāḥ kālena nirvāsitāḥ // ///
analyzed: kālena eva mahātmanā tu anukṛtāḥ kālena nirvāsitāḥ
translated: But they are all brought down by time, and expelled by time.

original: api ca
analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

original: sa ca nṛpatis te sacivās tāḥ pramadās tāni kānanavanāni /
analyzed: sa ca nṛpatiḥ te sacivāḥ tāḥ pramadāḥ tāni kānana vanāni
translated: That king, those ministers, those women, those forests and gardens,

original: sa ca te ca tāś ca tāni ca kṛtāntadṛṣṭāni naṣṭāni // ///
analyzed: sa ca te ca tāḥ ca tāni ca kṛtānta dṛṣṭāni naṣṭāni
translated: They and you, all seen by Death, are destroyed.

original: evaṃ mattakarikarṇacañcalāṃ rājyalakṣmīm avāpya nyāyaikaniṣṭho bhūtvopabhuṅkṣva /🔽iti śrīviṣṇuśarmaviracite pañcatantre kākolūkīyaṃ nāma🔽tṛtīyaṃ tantraṃ samāptam ////
analyzed: evam matta kari karṇa cañcalām rājya lakṣmīm avāpya nyāya eka niṣṭhaḥ bhūtvā upabhuṅkṣva  iti śrī viṣṇuśarma viracite pañcatantre kākolūkīyam nāma  tṛtīyam tantram samāptam
translated: Thus, having obtained the fleeting royal prosperity like the flapping ears of an elephant in rut, be devoted solely to righteousness and enjoy it.

original: caturthatantram🔽atha labdhapraṇāśam
analyzed: caturtha tantram  atha labdha praṇāśam
translated: Thus ends the Kākolya-tantra, the third tantra in the Pañcatantra composed by the great poet Viṣṇu Śarman.🔽The fourth tantra begins.

original: athedam ārabhate labdhapraṇāśaṃ nāma caturthaṃ tantram /
analyzed: atha idam ārabhate labdhapraṇāśam nāma caturtham tantram
translated: Now, this fourth tantra begins, named The Loss of What is Gained.

original: yasyāyam ādimaḥ ślokaḥ
analyzed: yasya ayam ādimaḥ ślokaḥ
translated: Its first verse is:

original: samutpanneṣu kāryeṣu buddhir yasya na hīyate /
analyzed: samutpanneṣu kāryeṣu buddhiḥ yasya na hīyate
translated: The intellect of one whose duties have arisen does not diminish.

original: sa eva durgaṃ tarati jalastho vānaro yathā // ///
analyzed: saḥ eva durgam tarati jala sthaḥ vānaraḥ yathā
translated: He alone crosses the difficult [situation], like a monkey in the water.

original: tad yathānuśrūyate
analyzed: tat yathā anuśrūyate
translated: That is to be heard:

original: prastāvanākathā
translated: The introductory story

original: vānaramakaravṛttāntaḥ
analyzed: vānara makara vṛttāntaḥ
translated: The story of the monkey and the crocodile

original: asti kasmiṃścit samudropakaṇṭhe mahān jambūpādapaḥ sadāphalaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid samudra upakaṇṭhe mahān jambū pādapaḥ sadāphalaḥ
translated: There is a great rose-apple tree near the ocean, always bearing fruit.

original: tatra ca raktamukho nāma vānaraḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tatra ca raktamukhaḥ nāma vānaraḥ prativasati sma
translated: And there lived a monkey named Red-face.

original: tatra ca tasya taror adhaḥ kadācit karālamukho nāma makaraḥ samudrasalilān niṣkramya sukomalabālukāsanāthe tīropānte nyaviśata /
analyzed: tatra ca tasya taroḥ adhas kadācid karālamukhaḥ nāma makaraḥ samudra salilāt niṣkramya su komala bālukā sanāthe tīra upānte nyaviśata
translated: And there, under that tree, a crocodile named Fierce-face, having emerged from the water of the ocean, sat on the shore covered with very soft sand.

original: tataś ca raktamukhena sa proktaḥbhoḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca rakta mukhena sa proktaḥ bhoḥ
translated: And then Red-face said to him: Hey!

original: bhavān samabhyāgato 'tithiḥ /
analyzed: bhavān samabhyāgataḥ tithiḥ
translated: You have come as a guest.

original: tad bhakṣayatu mayā dattāny amṛtatulyāni jambūphalāni / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat bhakṣayatu mayā dattāni amṛta tulyāni jambū phalāni uktam ca
translated: So eat the rose-apple fruits given by me, which are like nectar. And it is said:

original: priyo vā yadi vā dveṣyo mūrkho vā yadi paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: priyaḥ vā yadi vā dveṣyaḥ mūrkhaḥ vā yadi paṇḍitaḥ
translated: Whether he is a friend or an enemy, a fool or a wise man,

original: vaiśvadevāntam āpannaḥ so 'tithiḥ svargasaṅkramaḥ // ///
analyzed: vaiśvadeva antam āpannaḥ saḥ tithiḥ svarga saṅkramaḥ
translated: when he has arrived at the end of the Vaiśvadeva [offering], he is a guest, a bridge to heaven.

original: na pṛcchec caraṇaṃ gotraṃ na ca vidyāṃ kulaṃ na ca /
analyzed: na pṛcchet caraṇam gotram na ca vidyām kulam na ca
translated: One should not ask about his caste, family, learning, or lineage,

original: atithiṃ vaiśvadevānte śrāddhe ca manur abravīt // ///
analyzed: atithim vaiśvadeva ante śrāddhe ca manuḥ abravīt
translated: at the end of the Vaiśvadeva [offering] in a śrāddha, Manu has said.

original: dūramārgaśramaśrāntaṃ vaiśvadevāntam āgatam /
analyzed: dūra mārga śrama śrāntam vaiśvadeva antam āgatam
