translated: I offer it to the wife of my brother.

original: tvayāhaṃ śūnyahṛdayo 'tra kasmād ānītaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā aham śūnya hṛdayaḥ tra kasmāt ānītaḥ
translated: Why did you bring me here with a vacant heart?

original: tad ākarṇya makaraḥ sānandam āhabhadra /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya makaraḥ sa ānandam āha bhadra
translated: Hearing that, the crocodile said joyfully, “Good sir,

original: yady evaṃ tad arpaya me hṛdayam /
analyzed: yadi evam tat arpaya me hṛdayam
translated: if that is so, then give me your heart.

original: yena sā duṣṭapatnī tad bhakṣayitvānaśanād utthiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yena sā duṣṭa patnī tat bhakṣayitvā anaśanāt utthiṣṭhati
translated: So that wicked wife will get up from her fast after eating it.

original: ahaṃ tvāṃ tam eva jambūpādapaṃ prāpayāmi /
analyzed: aham tvām tam eva jambu pādapam prāpayāmi
translated: I will take you back to that rose-apple tree.

original: evam uktvā nivartya jambūtalam agāt /
analyzed: evam uktvā nivartya jambu talam agāt
translated: Having said this, he turned around and went to the rose-apple tree.

original: vānaro 'pi katham api jalpitavividhadevatopacārapūjas tīram āsāditavān /
analyzed: vānaraḥ pi katham api jalpita vividha devatā upacāra pūjaḥ tīram āsāditavān
translated: The monkey somehow reached the bank after reciting various prayers and offerings to the gods.

original: tataś ca dīrghataracaṅkramaṇena tam eva jambūpādapam ārūḍhaś cintayāmāsaaho /
analyzed: tatas ca dīrghatara caṅkramaṇena tam eva jambu pādapam ārūḍhaḥ cintayāmāsa aho
translated: And after a long walk, he climbed that very rose-apple tree and thought, Oh!

original: labdhās tāvat prāṇāḥ /
analyzed: labdhāḥ tāvat prāṇāḥ
translated: I have regained my life.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: na viśvased aviśvaste viśvaste'pi na viśvaset /
analyzed: na viśvaset a viśvaste viśvasta ipi na viśvaset
translated: One should not trust the untrustworthy, nor should one trust the trustworthy.

original: viśvāsād bhayam utpannaṃ mūlāny api nikṛntati // ///
analyzed: viśvāsāt bhayam utpannam mūlāni api nikṛntati
translated: Fear arising from trust cuts off even the roots.

original: tan mamaitad adya punar janmadinam iva sañjātam /
analyzed: tat mama etat adya punar janma dinam iva sañjātam
translated: So today is like my rebirth.

original: iti cintayamānaṃ makara āhabho mitra /
analyzed: iti cintayamānam makaraḥ āha bho mitra
translated: Thinking this, the crocodile said, Friend,

original: arpaya tad dhṛdayaṃ yathā te bhrātṛpatnī bhakṣayitvānaśanād uttiṣṭhati /
analyzed: arpaya tat hṛdayam yathā te bhrātṛ patnī bhakṣayitvā an aśanāt uttiṣṭhati
translated: Give me that heart, so that your brother's wife can rise from her fast by eating it.

original: atha vihasya nirbhartsayan vānaras tam āhadhig dhiṅ mūrkha viśvāsaghātaka /
analyzed: atha vihasya nirbhartsayan vānaraḥ tam āha dhik dhik mūrkha viśvāsa ghātaka
translated: Then the monkey, laughing and reproaching him, said, Fie, fie, fool, betrayer of trust!

original: kiṃ kasyacid dhṛdayadvayaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kim kasyacid hṛdaya dvayam bhavati
translated: How can anyone have two hearts?

original: tad āśu gamyatāṃ jambūvṛkṣasyādhastān na bhūyo 'pi tvayātrāgantavyam /
analyzed: tat āśu gamyatām jambu vṛkṣasya adhastāt na bhūyas tvayā atrā gantavyam
translated: So go quickly to the foot of the rose-apple tree, and never come here again.

original: uktaṃ ca yataḥ
analyzed: uktam ca yatas
translated: And it is said:

original: sakṛd duṣṭaṃ ca yo mitraṃ punaḥ sandhātum icchati /
analyzed: sakṛt duṣṭam ca yaḥ mitram punar sandhātum icchati
translated: He who wishes to reconcile a friend once offended,

original: sa mṛtyum upagṛhṇāti garbham aśvatarī yathā // ///
analyzed: sa mṛtyum upagṛhṇāti garbham aśvatarī yathā
translated: Takes death upon himself, as the she-mule conceives.

original: tac chrutvā makaraḥ saṃvilakṣaṃ cintitavānaho /
analyzed: tat śrutvā makaraḥ saṃvilakṣam cintitavān aho
translated: Hearing this, the crocodile, embarrassed, thought, Alas!

original: mayātimūḍhena kim asya svacittābhiprāyo niveditaḥ /
analyzed: mayā ati mūḍhena kim asya sva citta abhiprāyaḥ niveditaḥ
translated: By me, so foolish, what was in his mind was revealed.

original: tad yady asau punar api kathañcid viśvāsaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tat yadi asau punar api kathañcid viśvāsam gacchati
translated: So if he somehow gains trust again,

original: tad bhūyo 'pi viśvāsayāmi /
analyzed: tat bhūyas u pi viśvāsayāmi
translated: I will win his confidence once more.

original: āha camitra /
analyzed: āha camitra
translated: And he said, Friend!

original: hāsyena mayā te'bhiprāyo labdhaḥ /
analyzed: hāsyena mayā tad abhiprāyaḥ labdhaḥ
translated: I understood your intention by your laughter.

original: tasyā na kiñcit tava hṛdayena prayojanam /
analyzed: tasyāḥ na kiñcid tava hṛdayena prayojanam
translated: She has no use for your heart.

original: tad āgaccha prāghuṇikanyāyenāsmadgṛham /
analyzed: tat āgaccha prāghuṇika nyāyena asmad gṛham
translated: So come to my house as a guest.

original: vānara āhabho duṣṭa /
analyzed: vānaraḥ āha bho duṣṭa
translated: The monkey said, Hey, you scoundrel!

original: gamyatām /
analyzed: gamyatām
translated: Go away.

original: adhunā nāham āgamiṣyāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: adhunā na aham āgamiṣyāmi uktam ca
translated: Now I will not come back. And it is said:

original: bubhukṣitaḥ kiṃ na karoti pāpaṃ
analyzed: bubhukṣitaḥ kim na karoti pāpam
translated: What evil deed will not a hungry man do?

original: kṣīṇā janā niṣkaruṇā bhavanti /
analyzed: kṣīṇāḥ janāḥ niṣkaruṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: When people are destitute, they become heartless.

original: ākhyāhi bhadre priyadarśanasya
analyzed: ākhyāhi bhadre priyadarśanasya
translated: Tell me, good lady, about Priyadarśana,

original: na gaṅgadattaḥ punar eti kūpam // ///
analyzed: na gaṅgadattaḥ punar eti kūpam
translated: that Gaṅgadatta will not return to the well.

original: makara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: makaraḥ āha katham etat
translated: The crocodile asked, How is that?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: gaṅgadattapriyadarśanakathā
analyzed: gaṅgadatta priyadarśana kathā
translated: The Story of Gaṅgadatta and Priyadarśana

original: kasmiṃścit kūpe gaṅgadatto nāma maṇḍūkarājaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid kūpe gaṅgadattaḥ nāma maṇḍūka rājaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain well, there lived a frog king named Gaṅgadatta.

original: sa kadācid dāyādair udvejito 'raghaṭṭaghaṭīm āruhya niṣkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: sa kadācid dāyādaiḥ udvejitaḥ raghaṭṭa ghaṭīm āruhya niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: Once, troubled by his relatives, he climbed out of the well on a waterwheel.

original: atha tena cintitamyat kathaṃ tesāṃ dāyādānāṃ mayā pratyapakāraḥ kartavyaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: atha tena cintitam yat katham tesām dāyādānām mayā pratyapakāraḥ kartavyaḥ uktam ca
translated: Then he thought, How can I retaliate against those relatives? And it is said:

original: āpadi yenāpakṛtaṃ yena ca hasitaṃ daśāsu viṣamāsu /
analyzed: āpadi yena apakṛtam yena ca hasitam daśāsu viṣamāsu
translated: In times of adversity, by whom harm was done and by whom laughter was had in difficult situations,

original: apakṛtya tayor ubhayoḥ punar api jātaṃ naraṃ manye // ///
analyzed: apakṛtya tayoḥ ubhayoḥ punar api jātam naram manye
translated: I think that man is born again after having done harm to both of them.

original: evaṃ cintayan bile praviśantaṃ kṛṣṇasarpam apaśyat /
analyzed: evam cintayan bile praviśantam kṛṣṇa sarpam apaśyat
translated: Thinking thus, he saw a black serpent entering the hole.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā bhūyo 'py acintayatyad enaṃ tatra kūpe nītvā sakaladāyādānām ucchedaṃ karomi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā bhūyas api acintayat yat enam tatra kūpe nītvā sakala dāyādānām ucchedam karomi uktam ca
translated: Seeing him, he thought again, I'll take him to that well and kill all my relatives. And it is said:

original: śatrubhir yojayec chatruṃ balinā balavattaram /
analyzed: śatrubhiḥ yojayet śatrum balinā balavattaram
translated: One should join an enemy with an enemy, stronger with a stronger one,

original: svakāryāya yato na syāt kācit pīḍātra tatkṣaye // ///
analyzed: sva kāryāya yatas na syāt kācid pīḍā atra tad kṣaye
translated: Because there will be no harm to one's own cause when he is destroyed.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: śatrum unmūlayet prājñas tīkṣṇaṃ tīkṣṇena śatruṇā /
analyzed: śatrum unmūlayet prājñaḥ tīkṣṇam tīkṣṇena śatruṇā
translated: A wise man should uproot an enemy with a sharp enemy,

original: vyathākaraṃ sukhārthāya kaṇṭakenaiva kaṇṭakam // ///
analyzed: vyathā karam sukha arthāya kaṇṭakena eva kaṇṭakam
translated: Causing pain for the sake of happiness, with a thorn against a thorn.

original: evaṃ sa vibhāvya biladvāraṃ gatvā tam āhūtavānehy ehi priyadarśana / ehi /
analyzed: evam sa vibhāvya bila dvāram gatvā tam āhūtavān ehi ehi priyadarśana ehi
translated: Having thought thus, he went to the entrance of the hole and called out, Come, come, dear friend, come!

original: tac chrutvā sarpaś cintayāmāsaya evaṃ mām āhvayati /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sarpaḥ evam mām āhvayati
translated: Hearing that, the snake thought, He is calling me like this.

original: svajātīyo na bhavati /
analyzed: sva jātīyaḥ na bhavati
translated: He is not of my kind.

original: yato naiṣā sarpavāṇī /
analyzed: yatas na eṣā sarpa vāṇī
translated: Because this is not the voice of a snake.

original: anyena kenāpi saha mama martyaloke sandhānaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: anyena kena api saha mama martya loke sandhānam na asti
translated: I have no connection with anyone else in the mortal world.

original: tad atraiva durge sthitas tāvad vedmi ko 'yaṃ bhaviṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat atrā eva durge sthitaḥ tāvat vedmi kaḥ yam bhaviṣyati uktam ca
translated: So I will stay right here in this inaccessible place and find out who he is. And it is said:

original: yasya na jāyate śīlaṃ na kulaṃ na ca saṃśrayaḥ /
analyzed: yasya na jāyate śīlam na kulam na ca saṃśrayaḥ
translated: One should not associate with him who has no character, no family, and no support,

original: na tena saṅgatiṃ kuryād ity uvāca bṛhaspatiḥ // ///
analyzed: na tena saṅgatim kuryāt iti uvāca bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: So said Brihaspati.

original: kadācitko 'pi mantravādy auṣadhacaturo vā mām āhūya bandhane kṣipati /
analyzed: kadācitkaḥ pi mantra vādī auṣadha caturaḥ vā mām āhūya bandhane kṣipati
translated: Sometimes a magician or a skilled physician might summon me and throw me into prison.

original: athavā kaścit puruṣo vairam āśritya kasyacid bhakṣaṇārthe mām āhvayati /
analyzed: athavā kaścid puruṣaḥ vairam āśritya kasyacid bhakṣaṇa arthe mām āhvayati
translated: Or someone might summon me for the sake of eating me, having taken a vow of enmity with someone.

original: āha cabhoḥ / ko bhavān /
analyzed: āha cabhoḥ kaḥ bhavān
translated: He said, Who are you, sir?

original: sa āhaahaṃ gaṅgadatto nāma maṇḍūkādhipatis tvatsakāśe maitryartham abhyāgataḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha aham gaṅgadattaḥ nāma maṇḍūka adhipatiḥ tvad sakāśe maitrī artham abhyāgataḥ
translated: He said, I am a frog king named Gangadatta, come to you for friendship.

original: tac chrutvā sarpa āhabho /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sarpaḥ āha bho
translated: Hearing that, the snake said, Sir,

original: aśraddheyam etat yattṛṇānāṃ vahninā saha saṅgamaḥ / uktaṃ ca🔽yo yasya jāyate vadhyaḥ sa svapne'pi kathañcana /
analyzed: aśraddheyam etat yat tṛṇānām vahninā saha saṅgamaḥ uktam ca  yaḥ yasya jāyate vadhyaḥ sa svapne pi kathañcana
translated: this is unbelievable - the union with the fire of grass. And it is said:🔽Whoever is to be killed by whom, he never comes near him even in a dream.

original: na tatsamīpam abhyeti tat kim evaṃ prajalpasi // ///
analyzed: na tad samīpam abhyeti tat kim evam prajalpasi
translated: So why do you talk like this?

original: gaṅgadatta āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgadattaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Gangadatta said, Sir,

original: satyam etat /
analyzed: satyam etat
translated: this is true.

original: svabhāvavairī tvam asmākam /
analyzed: svabhāva vairī tvam asmākam
translated: You are my natural enemy.

original: paraṃ paraparibhavāt prāpto 'haṃ te sakāśam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: param para paribhavāt prāptaḥ ham te sakāśam uktam ca
translated: But I have come to you out of contempt for others. And it is said:

original: sarvanāśe ca sañjāte prāṇānām api saṃśaye /
analyzed: sarva nāśe ca sañjāte prāṇānām api saṃśaye
translated: When all is lost and even life is in doubt,

original: api śatruṃ praṇamyāpi rakṣet prāṇāndhanāni ca // ///
analyzed: api śatrum praṇamya api rakṣet prāṇān dhanāni ca
translated: one should bow even to an enemy and protect one's life and wealth.

original: sarpa āhakathaya kasmāt te paribhavaḥ /
analyzed: sarpaḥ āha kathaya kasmāt te paribhavaḥ
translated: The snake said, Tell me, why are you despised?

original: sa āhadāyādebhyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha dāyādebhyaḥ
translated: He said, By my relatives.

original: so 'py āhakva te āśrayo vāpyāṃ kūpe taḍāge hrade vā /
analyzed: saḥ pi āha kva te āśrayaḥ vāpyām kūpe taḍāge hrade vā
translated: The snake said, “Where is your home? In a pond, a well, a lake, or a pool?”

original: tat kathaya svāśrayam /
analyzed: tat kathaya sva āśrayam
translated: “Tell me your home.”

original: tenoktampāṣāṇacayanibaddhe kūpe /
analyzed: tena uktam pāṣāṇa caya nibaddhe kūpe
translated: The mouse said, “In a well surrounded by a pile of stones.”

original: sarpa āhaaho apadā vayam /
analyzed: sarpaḥ āha aho apadāḥ vayam
translated: The snake said, “Oh, we are unlucky!

original: tatrāsti tatra me praveśaḥ /
analyzed: tatra asti tatra me praveśaḥ
translated: There is a place there, and I can enter there.

original: praviṣṭasya ca sthānaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: praviṣṭasya ca sthānam na asti
translated: But once I’m inside, there’s no place to stay.

original: yatra sthitas tava dāyādān vyāpādayāmi /
analyzed: yatra sthitaḥ tava dāyādān vyāpādayāmi
translated: Where I stay, I’ll kill your heirs.”

original: tad gamyatām / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat gamyatām uktam ca
translated: “So go away.” And it is said:

original: yac chakyaṃ grasituṃ yasya grastaṃ pariṇamec ca yat /
analyzed: yat śakyam grasitum yasya grastam pariṇamet ca yat
translated: What can be swallowed, what is digested after being swallowed,

original: hitaṃ ca pariṇāme yat tad ādyaṃ bhūtim icchatā // ///
analyzed: hitam ca pariṇāme yat tat ādyam bhūtim icchatā
translated: and what is beneficial after digestion—that is the first thing for one who desires prosperity.

original: gaṅgadatta āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgadattaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Ganga-datta said, “Sir,

original: samāgaccha tvam /
analyzed: samāgaccha tvam
translated: come to me.

original: ahaṃ sukhopāyena tatra tava praveśaṃ kārayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham sukha upāyena tatra tava praveśam kārayiṣyāmi
translated: I will make a way for you to enter there by an easy method.

original: tathā tasya madhye jalopānte ramyataraṃ koṭaram asti /
analyzed: tathā tasya madhye jala upānte ramyataram koṭaram asti
translated: And in the middle of it, near the water’s edge, there is a very pleasant hole.

original: tatra sthitas tvaṃ līlayā dāyādān vyāpādayiṣyasi /
analyzed: tatra sthitaḥ tvam līlayā dāyādān vyāpādayiṣyasi
translated: Staying there, you will easily kill the heirs.”

original: tac chrutvā sarpo vyacintayatahaṃ tāvat pariṇatavayāḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sarpaḥ vyacintayata ham tāvat pariṇata vayāḥ
translated: Hearing that, the snake thought, “I am now old.

original: kadācit kathañcin mūṣakam ekaṃ prāpnomi /
analyzed: kadācid kathañcid mūṣakam ekam prāpnomi
translated: Sometimes somehow I get a single mouse.

original: tat sukhāvaho jīvanopāyo 'yam anena kulāṅgāreṇa darśitaḥ /
analyzed: tat sukha āvahaḥ jīvana upāyaḥ yam anena kula aṅgāreṇa darśitaḥ
translated: This method of livelihood is a source of happiness, shown by this family charcoal-burner.

original: tad gatvā tān maṇḍūkān bhakṣayāmi iti /
analyzed: tat gatvā tān maṇḍūkān bhakṣayāmi iti
translated: So I will go and eat those frogs.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: yo hi prāṇaparikṣīṇaḥ sahāyaparivarjitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi prāṇa parikṣīṇaḥ sahāya parivarjitaḥ
translated: One who is exhausted by life, abandoned by companions,

original: sa hi sarvasukhopāyāṃ vṛttim āracayed budhaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa hi sarva sukha upāyām vṛttim āracayet budhaḥ
translated: that wise one should devise a livelihood that is a means of all happiness.

original: evaṃ vicintya tam āhabho gaṅgadatta /
analyzed: evam vicintya tam āha bho gaṅgadatta
translated: Having thought thus, he said to him, O Gangadatta!

original: yady evaṃ tadagre bhava /
analyzed: yadi evam tad agre bhava
translated: If it is so, then be in front.

original: yena tatra gacchāvaḥ /
analyzed: yena tatra gacchāvaḥ
translated: By which we will go there.

original: gaṅgadatta āhabhoḥ priyadarśana /
analyzed: gaṅgadattaḥ āha bhoḥ priya darśana
translated: Gangadatta said, O Priyadarśana!

original: ahaṃ tvāṃ sukhopāyena tatra neṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham tvām sukha upāyena tatra neṣyāmi
translated: I will take you there by an easy means,

original: sthānaṃ ca darśayiṣyāmi ta eva bhakṣaṇīyāḥ iti /
analyzed: sthānam ca darśayiṣyāmi te eva bhakṣaṇīyāḥ iti
translated: and I will show you the place where they are to be eaten.

original: sarpa āhasāmprataṃ tvaṃ me mitraṃ jātam /
analyzed: sarpaḥ āha sāmpratam tvam me mitram jātam
translated: The snake said, Now you are my friend.

original: tan na bhetavyam /
analyzed: tat na bhetavyam
translated: So there is no need to fear.

original: tava vacanena bhakṣaṇyās te dāyādāḥ /
analyzed: tava vacanena bhakṣaṇyāḥ te dāyādāḥ
translated: By your word, they are the heirs to be eaten.

original: evam uktvā bilān niṣkramya tam āliṅgya ca tenaiva saha prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā bilāt niṣkramya tam āliṅgya ca tena eva saha prasthitaḥ
translated: Having said this, he came out of the hole, embraced him, and set out with him.

original: atha kūpam āsādyāraghaṭṭaghaṭikāmārgeṇa sarpas tenātmanā svālayaṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: atha kūpam āsādya āraghaṭṭa ghaṭikā mārgeṇa sarpaḥ tena ātmanā sva ālayam nītaḥ
translated: Then, having reached the well, the snake was taken to his own abode by the pulley and bucket on the well-rope.

original: gaṅgadatta āhabhadra /
analyzed: gaṅgadattaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Gangadatta said, Sir!

original: kutaḥ tvayā mitrakṛtyam /
analyzed: kutas tvayā mitrakṛtyam
translated: Why did you do a favor for your friend?

original: tat sāmpratam anenaiva ghaṭikāyantramārgeṇa gamyatām iti /
analyzed: tat sāmpratam anena eva ghaṭikāyantra mārgeṇa gamyatām iti
translated: So now, by this very method of the water clock, you should go.

original: sarpa āhabho gaṅgadatta /
analyzed: sarpaḥ āha bho gaṅgadatta
translated: The snake said, O Gangadatta,

original: na samyag abhihitaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: na samyak abhihitam tvayā
translated: you have not spoken correctly.

original: katham ahaṃ tatra gacchāmi /
analyzed: katham aham tatra gacchāmi
translated: How can I go there?

original: madīyabiladurgam anyena ruddhaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: madīya bila durgam anyena ruddham bhaviṣyati
translated: My snake hole will be blocked by another.

original: tasmād atrasthasya me maṇḍūkam ekaikaṃ svavargīyaṃ prayaccha /
analyzed: tasmāt atrasthasya me maṇḍūkam ekaikam svavargīyam prayaccha
translated: Therefore, while I am here, give me one frog from your group each day.

original: no cet sarvān api bhakṣayiṣyāmi iti /
analyzed: no ced sarvān api bhakṣayiṣyāmi iti
translated: Otherwise, I will eat all of you.

original: tac chrutvā gaṅgadatto vyākulamanā vyācintayataho kim etan mayā kṛtaṃ sarpam ānayatā /
analyzed: tat śrutvā gaṅgadattaḥ vyākula manāḥ vyācintayata ho kim etat mayā kṛtam sarpam ānayatā
translated: Hearing that, Gangadatta, with a troubled mind, thought, Alas, what have I done by bringing the snake here?

original: tad yadi niṣedhayiṣyāmi tat sarvān api bhakṣayiṣyati /
analyzed: tat yadi niṣedhayiṣyāmi tat sarvān api bhakṣayiṣyati
translated: If I refuse, he will eat all of us.

original: athavā yuktam ucyate🔽yo 'mitraṃ kurute mitraṃ vīryābhyadhikam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: athavā yuktam ucyate  yaḥ mitram kurute mitram vīrya abhyadhikam ātmanaḥ
translated: Or it is said rightly,🔽He who makes an enemy his friend, who is superior in strength to himself,

original: sa karoti na sandehaḥ svayaṃ hi viṣabhakṣaṇam // ///
analyzed: sa karoti na sandehaḥ svayam hi viṣa bhakṣaṇam
translated: he undoubtedly commits suicide.

original: tat prayacchāmy asyaikaikaṃ pratidinaṃ suhṛdam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat prayacchāmi asya ekaikam pratidinam suhṛdam uktam ca
translated: Therefore, I will give him one friend each day. And it is said,

original: sarvasvaharaṇe yuktaṃ śatruṃ buddhiyutā narāḥ /
analyzed: sarva sva haraṇe yuktam śatrum buddhi yutāḥ narāḥ
translated: Wise men should make peace with an enemy who is capable of taking everything,

original: toṣayanty alpadānena bāḍavaṃ sāgaro yathā // ///
analyzed: toṣayanti alpa dānena bāḍavam sāgaraḥ yathā
translated: They please him with a small offering, like the ocean with the Bāḍava fire.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: yo durbalo 'ṇūn api yācyamāno
analyzed: yaḥ durbalaḥ ṇūn api yācyamānaḥ
translated: One who is weak, even when asked for small things,

original: balīyasā yacchati naiva sāmnā /
analyzed: balīyasā yacchati na eva sāmnā
translated: Does not give out of conciliation to a stronger person.

original: prayacchate naiva ca darśyamānaṃ
analyzed: prayacchate na eva ca darśyamānam
translated: He does not give even when shown,

original: khārīṃ sa cūrṇasya punar dadāti // ///
analyzed: khārīm sa cūrṇasya punar dadāti
translated: And again gives a khāri of powder.

original: tathā ca🔽sarvanāśe samutpanne ardhaṃ tyajati paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca  sarva nāśe samutpanne ardham tyajati paṇḍitaḥ
translated: And so:🔽When all destruction has arisen, the wise one abandons half.

original: ardhena kurute kāryaṃ sarvanāśo hi dustaraḥ // ///
analyzed: ardhena kurute kāryam sarva nāśaḥ hi dustaraḥ
translated: With half he performs his duties, for all destruction is difficult to cross.

original: na svalpasya kṛte bhūri nāśayen matimān naraḥ /
analyzed: na su alpasya kṛte bhūri nāśayet matimān naraḥ
translated: For the sake of a small amount, a wise man should not destroy a large amount.

original: etad eva hi pāṇḍityaṃ yat svalpād bhūrirakṣaṇam // ///
analyzed: etat eva hi pāṇḍityam yat su alpāt bhūri rakṣaṇam
translated: This alone is wisdom, that one protects a large amount from a small amount.

original: evaṃ niścintya nityam ekaikam ādiśati /
analyzed: evam niścintya nityam ekaikam ādiśati
translated: Having thus always decided, he orders each one.

original: so 'pi taṃ bhakṣayitvā tasya parokṣe'nyān api bhakṣayati /
analyzed: saḥ u pi tam bhakṣayitvā tasya parokṣenyān api bhakṣayati
translated: He, having eaten him, eats others in his absence.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: yathā hi malinair vastrair yatra tatropaviśyate /
analyzed: yathā hi malinaiḥ vastraiḥ yatra tatra upaviśyate
translated: Just as one sits down anywhere with dirty clothes,

original: evaṃ calitavittas tu vittaśeṣaṃ na rakṣati // ///
analyzed: evam calita vittaḥ tu vitta śeṣam na rakṣati
translated: In the same way, one whose wealth is shaken does not protect the remaining wealth.

original: athānyadine tenāparān maṇḍūkān bhakṣayitvā gaṅgadattasuto yamunādatto bhakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: atha anya dine tena aparān maṇḍūkān bhakṣayitvā gaṅgadatta sutaḥ yamunādattaḥ bhakṣitaḥ
translated: Then on another day, having eaten other frogs, Gangadatta's son Yamunadatta was eaten.

original: taṃ bhakṣitaṃ matvā gaṅgadattas tārasvareṇa dhig dhik pralāpaparaḥ kathañcid api na virarāma /
analyzed: tam bhakṣitam matvā gaṅgadattaḥ tāra svareṇa dhik dhik pralāpa paraḥ kathañcid api na virarāma
translated: Thinking he had been eaten, Gangadatta, with a loud cry of Shame! Shame! could not stop himself from lamenting.

original: tataḥ svapatnyābhihitaḥ
analyzed: tatas sva patnyā abhihitaḥ
translated: Then his wife said to him:

original: kiṃ krandasi durākranda svapakṣakṣayakāraka /
analyzed: kim krandasi durākranda sva pakṣa kṣaya kāraka
translated: Why do you lament so pitifully, causing the destruction of your own side?

original: svapakṣasya kṣaye jāte ko nas trātā bhaviṣyati // ///
analyzed: sva pakṣasya kṣaye jāte kaḥ naḥ trātā bhaviṣyati
translated: When the destruction of your own side has occurred, who will be our protector?

original: tad adyāpi vicintyatām ātmano niṣkramaṇam asya vadhopāyaś ca /
analyzed: tat adya api vicintyatām ātmanaḥ niṣkramaṇam asya vadha upāyaḥ ca
translated: So consider now your own escape and a means of killing him.

original: atha gacchatā kālena sakalam api kavalitaṃ maṇḍūkakulam /
analyzed: atha gacchatā kālena sakalam api kavalitam maṇḍūka kulam
translated: Then, as time passed, the entire family of frogs was swallowed.

original: kevalam eko gaṅgadattas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kevalam ekaḥ gaṅgadattaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Only Gangadatta remained.

original: tataḥ priyadarśanena bhaṇitambhoḥ gaṅgadatta /
analyzed: tatas priyadarśanena bhaṇitam bhoḥ gaṅgadatta
translated: Then Priyadarsana said, Oh Gangadatta!

original: bubhukṣito 'ham /
analyzed: bubhukṣitaḥ ham
translated: I am hungry.

original: niḥśeṣitāḥ sarve maṇḍūkāḥ /
analyzed: niḥśeṣitāḥ sarve maṇḍūkāḥ
translated: All the frogs have been finished.

original: tad dīyatāṃ me kiñcid bhojanaṃ yato 'haṃ tvayātrānītaḥ /
analyzed: tat dīyatām me kiñcid bhojanam yatas ham tvayā atra ānītaḥ
translated: So give me something to eat, since I was brought here by you.

original: sa āhabho mitra /
analyzed: saḥ āhabho mitra
translated: He said, Oh friend!

original: na tvayātra viṣaye mayāvasthitena kāpi cintā kāryā /
analyzed: na tvayā atra viṣaye mayā avasthitena kā api cintā kāryā
translated: You should not worry at all about me staying here.

original: tad yadi māṃ preṣayati tato 'nyakūpasthān api maṇḍūkān viśvāsyātrānayāmi /
analyzed: tat yadi mām preṣayati tatas nyakūpa sthān api maṇḍūkān viśvāsya atra ānayāmi
translated: So if you send me, then I will win the trust of the frogs in the other wells and bring them here.

original: sa āhamama tāvat tvam abhakṣyo bhrātṛsthāne /
analyzed: saḥ āha mama tāvat tvam a bhakṣyaḥ bhrātṛ sthāne
translated: He said, “First of all, you are not food for me in the place of a brother.

original: tad yady evaṃ karoṣi tat sāmprataṃ pitṛsthāne bhavasi /
analyzed: tat yadi evam karoṣi tat sāmpratam pitṛ sthāne bhavasi
translated: So if you do this, then you are now in the place of a father.

original: tad evaṃ kriyatām iti /
analyzed: tat evam kriyatām iti
translated: So let it be done this way.”

original: so 'pi tad ākarṇyāraghaṭṭaghaṭikām āśritya vividhadevatopakalpitapūjopayācitas tatkūpād viniṣkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi tat ākarṇya araghaṭṭa ghaṭikām āśritya vividha devatā upakalpita pūjā upayācitaḥ tad kūpāt viniṣkrāntaḥ
translated: He, too, having heard that, having made an offering to the various gods, having prayed, came out of that well, relying on the waterwheel.

original: priyadarśano 'pi tadākāṅkṣayā tatrasthaḥ pratīkṣamāṇas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: priyadarśanaḥ pi tad ākāṅkṣayā tatrasthaḥ pratīkṣamāṇaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Priyadarshana, too, longing for him, remained there, waiting.

original: atha cirād anāgate gaṅgadatte priyadarśano 'nyakoṭaranivāsinīṃ godhām uvācabhadre /
analyzed: atha cirāt anāgate gaṅgadatte priyadarśanaḥ nya koṭara nivāsinīm godhām uvāca bhadre
translated: Then, when Gangadatta came back after a long time, Priyadarshana said to the monitor living in another hole, “My dear.

original: kriyatāṃ stokaṃ sāhāyyam /
analyzed: kriyatām stokam sāhāyyam
translated: Please do a little favor.

original: yataś ciraparicitas te gaṅgadattaḥ /
analyzed: yatas cira paricitaḥ te gaṅgadattaḥ
translated: And Gangadatta, who has been known to you for a long time,

original: tad gatvā tatsakāśaṃ kutracij jalāśaye'nviṣya mama sandeśaṃ kathaya /
analyzed: tat gatvā tad sakāśam kutracid jalāśaya inviṣya mama sandeśam kathaya
translated: having gone to him, having searched for him somewhere in a body of water, tell him my message.

original: yenāgamyatām ekākināpi bhavatā drutataraṃ yady anye maṇḍūkā nāgacchanti /
analyzed: yena āgamyatām ekākinā api bhavatā drutataram yadi anye maṇḍūkāḥ na āgacchanti
translated: So that he may come alone, even if the other frogs do not come quickly.

original: ahaṃ tvayā vinā nātra vastuṃ śaknomi /
analyzed: aham tvayā vinā na atra vastum śaknomi

original: tathā yady ahaṃ tava viruddham ācarāmi tat sukṛtam antare mayā vidhṛtam /
analyzed: tathā yadi aham tava viruddham ācarāmi tat sukṛtam antare mayā vidhṛtam
translated: And if I do anything against you, then I have held back the good deeds.

original: godhāpi tadvacanād gaṅgadattaṃ drutataram anviṣyāhabhadra gaṅgadatta /
analyzed: godhā api tad vacanāt gaṅgadattam drutataram anviṣya āha bhadra gaṅgadatta
translated: The she-goat, on his word, quickly searched for Gangadatta and said, Sir Gangadatta!

original: sa tava suhṛtpriyadarśanas tava mārgaṃ samīkṣamāṇas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa tava suhṛd priya darśanaḥ tava mārgam samīkṣamāṇaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: That friend of yours, Priyadarśana, is waiting, watching your path.

original: tac chīghram āgamyatām iti /
analyzed: tat śīghram āgamyatām iti
translated: So come quickly!

original: aparaṃ ca tena tava virūpakaraṇe sukṛtam antare dhṛtam /
analyzed: aparam ca tena tava virūpa karaṇe sukṛtam antare dhṛtam
translated: And furthermore, he has done a good deed for you in the meantime, making you ugly.

original: tanniḥśaṅena manasā samāgamyatām /
analyzed: tat niḥśaṅena manasā samāgamyatām
translated: So come, with a fearless mind.

original: tad ākarṇya gaṅgadatta āha
analyzed: tat ākarṇya gaṅgadattaḥ āha

analyzed: bubhukṣitaḥ kim na karoti pāpam

original: kṣīṇā narā niṣkaruṇā bhavanti /
analyzed: kṣīṇāḥ narāḥ niṣkaruṇāḥ bhavanti

original: ākhyāhi bhadre priyadarśanasya

analyzed: tat śrutvā makaraḥ āha bho mitra
translated: Hearing that, the crocodile said, Friend!

original: makara āhabhadra /
analyzed: makaraḥ āha bhadra

analyzed: sa kaḥ lambhakarṇaḥ

analyzed: katham dṛṣṭa apāyaḥ mṛtaḥ

original: tan me nivedyatām /
analyzed: tat me nivedyatām

original: vānara āha
analyzed: vānaraḥ āha
translated: The monkey said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā

original: karālakesarakathā
analyzed: karāla kesara kathā

original: padāt padam api calituṃ na śaknomi /
analyzed: padāt padam api calitum na śaknomi

original: tat kathaṃ te śuśrūṣāṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat katham te śuśrūṣām karomi
translated: So how can I serve you?

original: siṃha āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ āhabhoḥ

translated: so that I can kill it and get back to my normal state.”🔽Hearing that, the jackal went looking around and came upon a nearby village.

original: cirād dṛṣṭo 'si /

original: sa āhabho bhaginīputra /
analyzed: saḥ āha bho bhaginī putra
translated: The donkey said, “Sir, nephew of my aunt,

original: kiṃ kathayāmi /
analyzed: kim kathayāmi

analyzed: rajakaḥ tinirdayā atibhāreṇa mām pīḍayati
translated: A cruel washerman torments me with excessive burdens.

original: ghāsamuṣṭim api na prayacchati /
analyzed: ghāsa muṣṭim api na prayacchati
translated: He doesn’t give me even a handful of fodder.

original: kevalaṃ dūrvāṅkurān dhūimiśritān bhakṣayāmi /
analyzed: kevalam dūrvā aṅkurān bhakṣayāmi
translated: I only eat grass shoots mixed with chaff.

original: tat kuto me śarīre puṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: tat kutas me śarīre puṣṭiḥ
translated: So how can my body be nourished?

original: śṛgāla āhamāma /
analyzed: śṛgāle āhamāma
translated: The jackal said, “Sir,

analyzed: yadi evam tat asti marakata sadṛśa śaṣpa prāyaḥ nadī sanāthaḥ ramaṇīyataraḥ pradeśaḥ

translated: You've spoken well.

original: paraṃ vayaṃ grāmyāḥ paśavo 'raṇyacāriṇāṃ vadhyāḥ /
analyzed: param vayam grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ raṇya cāriṇām vadhyāḥ
translated: But we are domestic animals, to be killed by wild animals.

original: tat kiṃ tena bhavyapradeśena /
analyzed: tat kim tena bhavya pradeśena
translated: So what's the use of that beautiful place?

original: śṛgāla āha māma /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ āha māma
translated: The jackal said, Hey!

original: maivaṃ vada /
analyzed: mā evam vada
translated: Don't say that.

original: madbhujapañjaraparirakṣitaḥ sa deśaḥ /
analyzed: mad bhuja pañjara parirakṣitaḥ sa deśaḥ
translated: That place is protected by the cage of my arms.

original: tatrāsti na kaścid aparasya tatra praveśaḥ /
analyzed: tatra asti na kaścid aparasya tatra praveśaḥ
translated: No one else can enter there.

original: paramam anenaiva doṣeṇa rajakakadarthitās tatra tisro rāsabhyo 'nāthāḥ santi /
analyzed: paramam anena eva doṣeṇa rajaka kadarthitāḥ tatra tisraḥ rāsabhyaḥ nāthāḥ santi
translated: Moreover, due to this very fault, three she-donkeys, helpless, are being harassed by a washerman there.

original: tāś ca puṣṭim āpannā yauvanotkaṭā idaṃ mām ūcuḥyadi tvam asmākaṃ satyo mātulas tadā kaṃcid grāmāntaraṃ gatvāsmadyogyaṃ kaścit patim ānaya
analyzed: tāḥ ca puṣṭim āpannāḥ yauvana utkaṭāḥ idam mām ūcuḥ yadi tvam asmākam satyaḥ mātulaḥ tadā kaṃcid grāma antaram gatvā asmad yogyam kaścid patim ānaya
translated: And they, having grown fat and proud of youth, said to me, 'If you are our true uncle, then go to some other village and bring a suitable husband for us.'

original: tadarthe tvām ahaṃ tatra nayāmi /
analyzed: tad arthe tvām aham tatra nayāmi
translated: For that purpose I am taking you there.'

original: atha śṛgālavacanāni śrutvā kāmapīḍitāṅgas tam avocatbhadra /
analyzed: atha śṛgāla vacanāni śrutvā kāma pīḍita aṅgaḥ tam avocat bhadra
translated: Then, hearing the words of the jackal, his limbs afflicted by passion, he said to him, 'Good sir,

original: yady evaṃ tadagre bhava yenāgacchāmi /
analyzed: yadi evam tat agre bhava yena āgacchāmi
translated: If that's the case, then go ahead of me, so I can follow you.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: nāmṛtaṃ na viṣaṃ kiñcid ekāṃ muktvā nitambinīm /
analyzed: na amṛtam na viṣam kiñcid ekām muktvā nitambinīm
translated: Nothing is nectar or poison, except for a certain woman.

original: yasyāḥ saṅgena jīvyeta mriyate ca viyogataḥ // ///
analyzed: yasyāḥ saṅgena jīvyeta mriyate ca viyogataḥ
translated: By association with whom one would live, and by separation one would die.

original: tathā ca🔽yāsāṃ nāmnāpi kāmaḥ syāt saṅgamaṃ darśanaṃ vinā /
analyzed: tathā ca  yāsām nāmnā api kāmaḥ syāt saṅgamam darśanam vinā
translated: And so:🔽For those whose mere name would arouse passion, without union or sight,

original: tāsāṃ dṛksaṅgamaṃ prāpya yan na dravati kautukam // ///
analyzed: tāsām dṛś saṅgamam prāpya yat na dravati kautukam
translated: What wonder that they do not melt upon obtaining her sight and union.

original: tatrānuṣṭhite śṛgālena saha siṃhāntikam āgataḥ /
analyzed: tatra anuṣṭhite śṛgālena saha siṃha antikam āgataḥ
translated: Having done that, he came before the lion along with the jackal.

original: siṃho 'pi vyathākulitas taṃ dṛṣṭvā yāvat samuttiṣṭhati tāvad rāsabhaḥ palāyitum ārabdhavān /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ pi vyathā ākulitaḥ tam dṛṣṭvā yāvat samuttiṣṭhati tāvat rāsabhaḥ palāyitum ārabdhavān
translated: The lion, agitated with pain, seeing him, rose up, and the donkey began to run away.

original: atha tasya palāyamānasya siṃhena talaprahāro dattaḥ /
analyzed: atha tasya palāyamānasya siṃhena tala prahāraḥ dattaḥ
translated: Then, as he was running away, the lion gave him a blow with his paw.

original: sa ca mandabhāgyasya vyavasāya iva vyarthatāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: sa ca mandabhāgyasya vyavasāyaḥ iva vyartha tām gataḥ
translated: And that, like the resolve of an unlucky person, became futile.

original: atrāntare śṛgālaḥ kopāviṣṭas tam uvācabhoḥ /
analyzed: atrā antare śṛgālaḥ kopa āviṣṭaḥ tam uvāca bhoḥ
translated: In the meantime, the jackal, filled with anger, said to him, Hey!

original: kim evaṃvidhaḥ prahāras te /
analyzed: kim evaṃvidhaḥ prahāraḥ te
translated: How is it that you give such a blow?

original: yad gardabho 'pi tava purato balād gacchati /
analyzed: yat gardabhaḥ u pi tava puratas balāt gacchati
translated: That even a donkey goes forcefully in front of you.

original: tat kathaṃ gajena saha yuddhaṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: tat katham gajena saha yuddham kariṣyasi
translated: Then how will you fight with an elephant?

original: tad dṛṣṭaṃ te balam /
analyzed: tat dṛṣṭam te balam
translated: That strength of yours has been seen.

original: atha savilakṣasmitaṃ siṃha āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: atha sa vilakṣa smitam siṃhaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Then the lion, with a smile of embarrassment, said:

original: kim ahaṃ karomi /
analyzed: kim aham karomi
translated: Then the lion said with a slight smile, Sir, what can I do?

original: mayā na kramaḥ sajjīkṛta āsīt /
analyzed: mayā na kramaḥ sajjīkṛtaḥ āsīt
translated: I did not prepare the trap.

original: anyathā gajo 'pi matkramākrāntā na gacchati /
analyzed: anyathā gajaḥ mad krama ākrāntā na gacchati
translated: Otherwise, even an elephant would not go if it stepped on my trap.

original: śṛgāla āhaadyāpy ekavāraṃ tavāntike tam āneṣyāmi /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ āha adya api eka vāram tava antike tam āneṣyāmi
translated: The jackal said, I will bring him to you once today.

original: paraṃ tvayā sajjīkṛtakrameṇa sthātavyam /
analyzed: param tvayā sajjīkṛta krameṇa sthātavyam
translated: But you must stay with the trap ready.

original: siṃha āhabhadra /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ āha bhadra
translated: The lion said, Sir,

original: yo māṃ pratyakṣaṃ dṛṣṭvā gataḥ sa punaḥ katham atrāgamiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ mām pratyakṣam dṛṣṭvā gataḥ sa punar katham atra āgamiṣyati
translated: how will he come here again after going and seeing me in person?

original: tad anyat kim api sattvam anviṣyatām /🔽śṛgāla āhakiṃ tavānena vyāpāreṇa /
analyzed: tat anyat kim api sattvam anviṣyatām  śṛgālaḥ āha kim tava anena vyāpāreṇa
translated: So look for some other being.🔽The jackal said, What do you care about this business?

original: tvaṃ kevalaṃ sajjitakramas tiṣṭha /
analyzed: tvam kevalam sat jita kramaḥ tiṣṭha
translated: You just stay with the trap ready.

original: tathānuṣṭhite śṛgālo 'pi yāvad rāsabhamārgeṇa gacchati /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite śṛgālaḥ pi yāvat rāsabha mārgeṇa gacchati
translated: When that was done, the jackal went by the path of the donkeys.

original: tāvat tatraiva sthāne caran dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat tatra eva sthāne caran dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: While wandering there in that very place, he was seen.

original: atha śṛgālaṃ dṛṣṭvā rāsabhaḥ prāhabho bhaginīsuta /
analyzed: atha śṛgālam dṛṣṭvā rāsabhaḥ prāha bho bhaginī suta
translated: Then, seeing the jackal, the donkey said, Sir, nephew of my sister,

original: śobhanasthāne tvayāhaṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: śobhana sthāne tvayā aham nītaḥ
translated: you have brought me to a splendid place.

original: drāṅ mṛtyuvaśaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: drāk mṛtyu vaśam gataḥ
translated: I have fallen under the power of death.

original: tat kathaya kiṃ tat sattvaṃ yasyātiraudravajrasadṛśakaraprahārād ahaṃ muktaḥ /
analyzed: tat kathaya kim tat sattvam yasya ati raudra vajra sadṛśa kara prahārāt aham muktaḥ
translated: So tell me, what is that being from whose extremely terrible, diamond-like blow of the hand I am freed?

original: tac chrutvā prahasan śṛgāla āhabhadra /
analyzed: tat śrutvā prahasan śṛgālaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Hearing that, the jackal laughed and said, Sir,

original: rāsabhī tvām āyāntaṃ dṛṣṭvā sānurāgam āliṅgituṃ samutthitā /
analyzed: rāsabhī tvām āyāntam dṛṣṭvā sa anurāgam āliṅgitum samutthitā
translated: when the she-ass saw you coming, she got up to embrace you affectionately.

original: tvaṃ ca kātaratvān naṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tvam ca kātara tvāt naṣṭaḥ
translated: But you ran away out of fear.

original: sā punar na śaktā tvāṃ vinā sthātum /
analyzed: sā punar na śaktā tvām vinā sthātum
translated: She cannot stay without you.

original: tayā tu naśatas te'valambanārthaṃ hastaḥ kṣiptaḥ /
analyzed: tayā tu naśataḥ hastaḥ kṣiptaḥ
translated: But she threw out her hand to support you when you ran away.

original: nānyakāraṇena /
analyzed: na anya kāraṇena
translated: Not for any other reason.

original: tad āgaccha /
analyzed: tat āgaccha
translated: So come.

original: sā tvatkṛte prāyopaveśanopaviṣṭā tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sā tvad kṛte prāya upaveśana upaviṣṭā tiṣṭhati
translated: She is sitting there on a hunger strike for your sake.

original: etad vadatiyal lambakarṇo yadi me bhartā na bhavati tad aham agnau jalaṃ vā praviśāmi /
analyzed: etat vadati yat lambakarṇaḥ yadi me bhartā na bhavati tat aham agnau jalam vā praviśāmi
translated: Tell her this: 'If Long-Ear is not my husband, then I will enter the fire or the water.'

original: punas tasya viyogaṃ soḍhuṃ na śaknomi iti /
analyzed: punar tasya viyogam soḍhum na śaknomi iti
translated: I cannot bear to be separated from him again.

original: tat prasādaṃ kṛtvā tatrāgamyatām /
analyzed: tat prasādam kṛtvā tatra āgamyatām
translated: So be gracious and come there.

original: no cet tava strīhatyā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: no ced tava strī hatyā bhaviṣyati
translated: Otherwise you will be guilty of murdering a woman.

original: aparaṃ bhagavān kāmakopaṃ tavopari kariṣyati / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: aparam bhagavān kāma kopam tava upari kariṣyati uktam ca
translated: And the Blessed One will be angry with you. And it is said:

original: strīmudrāṃ makaradhvajasya jayinīṃ sarvārdhasampatkarīṃ🔽te mūḍhāḥ pravihāya yānti kudhiyo mithyāphalānveṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: strī mudrām makaradhvajasya jayinīm sarva ardha sampad karīm  te mūḍhāḥ pravihāya yānti kudhiyaḥ mithyā phala anveṣiṇaḥ
translated: The victorious seal of women, the banner of the god of love, which brings all prosperity,🔽those foolish ones, seeking false fruits, abandon it and go away.

original: te tenaiva nihatya nirdayataraṃ nagnīkṛtā muṇḍitāḥ
analyzed: te tena eva nihatya nirdayataram nagnīkṛtāḥ muṇḍitāḥ
translated: They are killed by him alone, more cruelly, stripped naked, their heads shaved,

original: kecid raktapaṭīkṛtāś ca jaṭilāḥ kāpālikāś cāpare // ///
analyzed: kecid rakta paṭīkṛtāḥ ca jaṭilāḥ kāpālikāḥ ca apare
translated: Some had red robes and matted hair, others carried skulls.

original: athāsau tadvacanaṃ śraddheyatayā śrutvā bhūyo 'pi tena saha prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau tat vacanam śraddheya tayā śrutvā bhūyas u pi tena saha prasthitaḥ
translated: Then he, having heard his words as trustworthy, set out again with him.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: jānann api naro daivāt prakaroti vigarhitam /
analyzed: jānan api naraḥ daivāt prakaroti vigarhitam
translated: Even knowing, a man out of fate commits what is condemned.

original: karma kiṃ kasyacil loke garhitaṃ rocate katham // ///
analyzed: karma kim kasyacid loke garhitam rocate katham
translated: What condemned deed is pleasing to anyone in the world?

original: atrāntare sajjitakrameṇa siṃhena sa lambakarṇo vyāpāditaḥ /
analyzed: atrā antare sajjita krameṇa siṃhena sa lambakarṇaḥ vyāpāditaḥ
translated: In the meantime, the lion, having prepared the way, killed that Long-Ear.

original: tatas taṃ hatvā śṛgālaṃ rakṣakaṃ nirūpya svayaṃ snānārthaṃ nadyāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas tam hatvā śṛgālam rakṣakam nirūpya svayam snāna artham nadyām gataḥ
translated: Then, having killed that jackal, he appointed a guard, and himself went to the river to bathe.

original: śṛgālenāpi laulyotsukyāt tasya karṇahṛdayaṃ bhakṣitam /
analyzed: śṛgālena api laulya utsukyāt tasya karṇa hṛdayam bhakṣitam
translated: And the jackal, out of greed and eagerness, ate his ear and heart.

original: atrāntare siṃho yāvat snātvā kṛte devārcanaḥ pratarpitapitṛgaṇaḥ samāyāti tāvat karṇahṛdayarahito rāsabhas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: atrā antare siṃhaḥ yāvat snātvā kṛte deva arcanaḥ pratarpita pitṛ gaṇaḥ samāyāti tāvat karṇa hṛdaya rahitaḥ rāsabhaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: In the meantime, the lion, having bathed, worshipped the gods, and offered oblations to the ancestors, returned, and the donkey stood there without ears and heart.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā kopaparītātmā siṃhaḥ śṛgālam āhapāpa /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā kopa parīta ātmā siṃhaḥ śṛgālam āha pāpa
translated: Seeing him, the lion, his soul filled with anger, said to the jackal, Evil one,

original: kim idam anucitaṃ karma samācaritam /
analyzed: kim idam anucitam karma samācaritam
translated: why have you committed this improper deed?

original: yat karṇahṛdayabhakṣaṇenāyam ucchiṣṭatāṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: yat karṇa hṛdaya bhakṣaṇena ayam ucchiṣṭa tām nītaḥ
translated: By eating his ears and heart, you have made him impure.

original: śṛgālaḥ savinayam āhasvāmin /🔽mā maivaṃ vada /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ sa vinayam āha svāmin  mā mā evam vada
translated: The jackal said politely, My lord, please don't say that.

original: yat karṇahṛdayarahito 'yaṃ rāsabha āsīt /
analyzed: yat karṇa hṛdaya rahitaḥ yam rāsabhaḥ āsīt
translated: This donkey was deaf and heartless.

original: tenehāgatya tvām avalokya bhūyo 'py āgataḥ /
analyzed: tena iha āgatya tvām avalokya bhūyas pi āgataḥ
translated: He came here, saw you, and left again.

original: atha tvadvacanaṃ śraddheyaṃ matvā siṃhas tenaiva saṃvibhajya niḥśaṅkitamanās taṃ bhakṣitavān /
analyzed: atha tvad vacanam śraddheyam matvā siṃhaḥ tena eva saṃvibhajya niḥśaṅkita manāḥ tam bhakṣitavān
translated: But thinking your word trustworthy, the lion shared it with him and ate him without fear.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiāgataś ca gataś caiva iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi āgataḥ ca gataḥ ca eva iti
translated: That's why I say, 'He came and went.'

original: tan mūrkha /
analyzed: tat mūrkha
translated: So, fool,

original: kapaṭaṃ kṛtaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: kapaṭam kṛtam tvayā
translated: you tried a trick.

original: paraṃ yudhiṣṭhireṇeva satyavacanena vināśitam /
analyzed: param yudhiṣṭhireṇa iva satya vacanena vināśitam
translated: But it was destroyed by the truth-telling of Yudhishthira.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or rather, this is well said:

original: svārtham utsṛjya yo dambhī satyaṃ brūte sumandadhīḥ /
analyzed: sva artham utsṛjya yaḥ dambhī satyam brūte su manda dhīḥ
translated: The fool who abandons his own interest and speaks the truth out of hypocrisy,

original: sa svārthād bhraśyate nūnaṃ yudhiṣṭhira ivāparaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa sva arthāt bhraśyate nūnam yudhiṣṭhiraḥ iva aparaḥ
translated: he certainly falls from his own interest, like another Yudhishthira.

original: makara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: makaraḥ āha katham etat
translated: The crocodile asked, How is that?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The story

original: yudhiṣṭhirākhyakumbhakārakathā🔽kasmiṃścit adhiṣṭhāne kumbhakāraḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira ākhya kumbhakāra kathā  kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne kumbhakāraḥ prativasati sma
translated: The story of the potter named Yudhishthira🔽In a certain town, a potter lived.

original: sa kadācit pramādād ardhamagnakharparatīkṣṇāgrasyopari mahatā vegena dhāvan patitaḥ /
analyzed: sa kadācid pramādāt ardha magna kharpara tīkṣṇa agrasya upari mahatā vegena dhāvan patitaḥ
translated: Once, out of carelessness, he fell with great force onto the sharp edge of a half-buried potsherd while running.

original: tataḥ khaparakoṭyā pāṭitalalāīoo rudhiraplāvitatanuḥ kṛcchrād utthāya svāśrayaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas khapara koṭyā rudhira plāvita tanuḥ kṛcchrāt utthāya sva āśrayam gataḥ
translated: Then, with the tip of his horn, he tore open his forehead, and with his body bathed in blood, he rose with difficulty and went to his own abode.

original: tataś cāpathyasevanāt sa prahāras tasya karālatāṃ gataḥ kṛcchreṇa nīrogatāṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca apathya sevanāt sa prahāraḥ tasya karāla tām gataḥ kṛcchreṇa nīroga tām nītaḥ
translated: And then, because of his improper diet, that blow became very severe for him, and he was with difficulty restored to health.

original: atha kadācid durbhikṣapīḍite deśe ca kumbhakāraḥ kṣutkṣāmakaṇṭhaḥ kaiścid rājasevakaiḥ saha deśāntaraṃ gatvā kasyāpi rājñaḥ sevako babhūva
analyzed: atha kadācid durbhikṣa pīḍite deśe ca kumbhakāraḥ kṣudh kṣāma kaṇṭhaḥ kaiścid rāja sevakaiḥ saha deśa antaram gatvā kasya api rājñaḥ sevakaḥ babhūva
translated: Then once, in a country afflicted by famine, a potter, his throat parched with hunger, went to another country with some royal servants and became a servant of a certain king.

original: so 'pi rājā tasya lalāṭe vikarālaṃ prahārakṣataṃ dṛṣṭvā cintayāmāsa /
analyzed: saḥ pi rājā tasya lalāṭe vikarālam prahāra kṣatam dṛṣṭvā cintayāmāsa
translated: That king, seeing on his forehead a very terrible wound from a blow, thought:

original: yadvīraḥ puruṣaḥ kaścid ayam /
analyzed: yad vīraḥ puruṣaḥ kaścid ayam
translated: This is some heroic man.

original: nūnaṃ tena lalāṭapaṭṭe sammukhaprahāraḥ /
analyzed: nūnam tena lalāṭa paṭṭe sammukha prahāraḥ
translated: Surely he was struck on the forehead with a blow.

original: atas taṃ samānādibhiḥ sarveṣāṃ rājaputrāṇāṃ madhye viśeṣaprasādena paśyati sma /
analyzed: atas tam samāna ādibhiḥ sarveṣām rāja putrāṇām madhye viśeṣa prasādena paśyati sma
translated: Therefore he looks upon him with special favor among all the princes, beginning with Samāna.

original: te'pi rājaputrās tasya taṃ prasādātirekaṃ paśyantaṃ paramerṣyādharmaṃ vahanto rājabhayān na kiñcid ūcuḥ /
analyzed: te api rāja putrāḥ tasya tam prasāda atirekam paśyantam parama īrṣyā dharmam vahantaḥ rāja bhayāt na kiñcid ūcuḥ
translated: And those princes, seeing that excessive favor of his, bearing the highest jealousy, did not say anything out of fear of the king.

original: athānyasminn ahani tasya bhūpater vīrasambhāvanāyāṃ kriyamāṇāyāṃ vigrahe samupasthite prakalpyamāneṣu gajeṣu saṃnahyamāneṣu vājiṣu yodheṣu
analyzed: atha anyasmin ahani tasya bhūpateḥ vīra sambhāvanāyām kriyamāṇāyām vigrahe samupasthite prakalpyamāneṣu gajeṣu saṃnahyamāneṣu vājiṣu yodheṣu
translated: Then on another day, when the king was honoring his heroes, a battle having taken place, the elephants being assigned their places, the horses being equipped, the warriors

original: praguṇīkriyamāṇeṣu tena bhūbhujā sa kumbhakāraḥ prastāvānugataṃ pṛṣṭo nirjanebho rājaputra /
analyzed: praguṇīkriyamāṇeṣu tena bhūbhujā sa kumbhakāraḥ prastāva anugatam pṛṣṭaḥ nirjana ibhaḥ rāja putra
translated: being mustered, that king, in the course of conversation, asked the potter in private, Sir, prince,

original: kiṃ te nāma / kā ca jātiḥ /
analyzed: kim te nāma kā ca jātiḥ
translated: what is your name? And what is your caste?

original: kasmin saṅgrāme prahāro 'yaṃ te lalāṭe lagnaḥ /
analyzed: kasmin saṅgrāme prahāraḥ yam te lalāṭe lagnaḥ
translated: And in what battle did you get this wound on your forehead?

original: sa āhadeva / nāyaṃ śastraprahāraḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āhat eva na ayam śastra prahāraḥ
translated: He replied, Your majesty, this is not a sword-wound.

original: yudhiṣṭhirābhidhaḥ kulālo 'haṃ prakṛtyā /
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira abhidhaḥ kulālaḥ haṃ prakṛtyā
translated: I am a potter by trade, named Yudhishthira.

original: madgehe'nekakharparāṇy āsan /
analyzed: mad gehena ika kharparāṇi āsan
translated: In my house there were many pestles.

original: atha kadācin madyapānaṃ kṛtvā nirgataḥ pradhāvan kharparopari patitaḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid madya pānam kṛtvā nirgataḥ pradhāvan kharpara upari patitaḥ
translated: Then one day, after drinking wine, I went out and fell over a pestle as I ran.

original: tasya prahāravikāro 'yaṃ me lalāṭe evaṃ vikarālatāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tasya prahāra vikāraḥ yam me lalāṭe evam vikarāla tām gataḥ
translated: This is the disfigurement on my forehead caused by that blow.

original: tad ākarṇya rājā savrīḍam āhaaho vañcito 'haṃ rājāputrānukāriṇānena kulālena /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya rājā sa vrīḍam āha aho vañcitaḥ ham rājā putra anukāriṇā anena kulālena
translated: Hearing this, the king, abashed, said, Ah, I have been deceived by this potter, who pretends to be a prince.

original: tad dīyatāṃ drāg etasya candrārdhaḥ /
analyzed: tat dīyatām drāk etasya candra ardhaḥ
translated: So give him at once the crescent moon.

original: tathānuṣṭhite kumbhakāra āhamā maivaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite kumbhakāraḥ āha mā mā evam kuru
translated: When this was done, the potter said, Don't do that.

original: paśya me raṇe hastalāghavam /
analyzed: paśya me raṇe hasta lāghavam
translated: Look at my dexterity in battle.

original: rājā prāhasarvaguṇasampanno bhavān /
analyzed: rājā prāha sarva guṇa sampannaḥ bhavān
translated: The king laughed and said, You are endowed with all good qualities.

original: tathāpi gamyatām / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tathā api gamyatām uktam ca
translated: Still, go. And it is said:

original: śūdraś ca kṛtavighnaś ca darśanīyo 'si putraka /
analyzed: śūdraḥ ca kṛta vighnaḥ ca darśanīyaḥ si putraka
translated: O son, you are a Shudra and have caused an obstacle, but you are handsome.

original: yasmin kule tvam utpanno gajas tatra na hanyate // ///
analyzed: yasmin kule tvam utpannaḥ gajaḥ tatra na hanyate
translated: In the family where you are born, an elephant is not killed.

original: kulāla āhakatham etat /
analyzed: kulālaḥ āha katham etat
translated: The potter asked, How is that?

original: rājā kathayati
analyzed: rājā kathayati
translated: The king told the story:

original: kathā🔽siṃhadampatīkathā
analyzed: kathā  siṃha dampatī kathā
translated: Story🔽The Story of the Lion Couple

original: kasmiṃścid uddeśe siṃhadampatī prativasataḥ sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid uddeśe siṃha dampatī prativasataḥ sma
translated: In a certain place, a lion couple lived.

original: atha siṃhī putradvayam ajījanat /
analyzed: atha siṃhī putra dvayam ajījanat
translated: Then the lioness gave birth to two cubs.

original: siṃho 'pi nityam eva mṛgān vyāpādya siṃhyai dadāti /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ u pi nityam eva mṛgān vyāpādya siṃhyai dadāti
translated: The lion also always killed deer and gave them to the lioness.

original: athānyasmin ahani tena kim api nāsāditam /
analyzed: atha anyasmin ahani tena kim api na āsāditam
translated: Then on another day, he did not obtain anything.

original: yena bhramato 'pi tasya ravir astaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: yena bhramataḥ upi tasya raviḥ astam gataḥ
translated: By which, even while wandering, the sun set for him.

original: atha tena svagṛham āgacchatā śṛgālaśiśuḥ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha tena sva gṛham āgacchatā śṛgāla śiśuḥ prāptaḥ
translated: Then, as he was returning to his own house, he found a young jackal.

original: sa ca bālako 'yam ity avadhārya yatnena daṃṣṭrāmadhyagataṃ kṛtvā siṃhyā jīvantam eva samarpitavān /
analyzed: sa ca bālakaḥ yam iti avadhārya yatnena daṃṣṭrā madhya gatam kṛtvā siṃhyāḥ jīvantam eva samarpitavān
translated: And considering that it was a child, he carefully placed it between his fangs and offered it alive to the lioness.

original: tataḥ siṃhyābhihitambhoḥ kānta /
analyzed: tatas siṃhyā abhihita mbhoḥ kānta
translated: Then the lioness said, Oh dear,

original: tvayānītaṃ kiñcid asmākaṃ bhojanam /
analyzed: tvayā ānītam kiñcid asmākam bhojanam
translated: have you brought us any food?

original: siṃha āhapriye /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ āha priye
translated: The lion said, My dear.

original: mayādyainaṃ śṛgālaśiśuṃ parityajya na kiñcit sattvam āsāditam /
analyzed: mayā adya enam śṛgāla śiśum parityajya na kiñcid sattvam āsāditam
translated: Today I have not found any other being except this young jackal, whom I have spared.

original: sa ca mayā bālo 'yam iti matvā na vyāpādito viśeṣāt svajātīyaś ca / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: sa ca mayā bālaḥ yam iti matvā na vyāpāditaḥ viśeṣāt sva jātīyaḥ ca uktam ca
translated: And I did not kill him, thinking he was a child, especially because he was of my own species. It is said:

original: strīvipraliṅgibāleṣu prahartavyaṃ na karhicit /
analyzed: strī vipraliṅgi bāleṣu prahartavyam na karhicit
translated: One should never strike a woman, a brahmin, a eunuch, or a child.

original: prāṇatyāge'pi sañjāte viśvasteṣu viśeṣataḥ // ///
analyzed: prāṇatyāge api sañjāte viśvasteṣu viśeṣataḥ
translated: Even when one's life is at stake, especially when they are trusted.

original: idānīṃ tvam enaṃ bhakṣayitvā pathyaṃ kuru /
analyzed: idānīm tvam enam bhakṣayitvā pathyam kuru
translated: Now you should eat him and make yourself comfortable.

original: prabhāte'nyat kiñcid upārjayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: prabhātenyat kiñcid upārjayiṣyāmi
translated: In the morning I will find something else.

original: sā prāhabhoḥ kānta /
analyzed: sā prāha bhoḥ kānta
translated: She said, Oh my dear.

original: tvayā bālako 'yam iti vicintya na hataḥ /
analyzed: tvayā bālakaḥ yam iti vicintya na hataḥ
translated: You thought he was a child and did not kill him.

original: tat katham enam ahaṃ svodarārthe vināśayāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat katham enam aham sva udara arthe vināśayāmi uktam ca
translated: So how can I destroy him for my own stomach? It is said:

original: akṛtyaṃ naiva kartavyaṃ prāṇatyāge'py upasthite /
analyzed: akṛtyam nā eva kartavyam prāṇatyāge api upasthite
translated: One should not do what should not be done, even when one's life is at stake.

original: na ca kṛtyaṃ parityājyam eṣa dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ // ///
analyzed: na ca kṛtyam parityājyam eṣa dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: And one should not abandon what should be done. This is the eternal dharma.

original: tasmān mamāyaṃ tṛtīyaḥ putro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasmāt mama ayam tṛtīyaḥ putraḥ bhaviṣyati

original: ity evam uktvā tam api svastanakṣīreṇa parāṃ puṣṭim anayat /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā tam api sva stana kṣīreṇa parām puṣṭim anayat

analyzed: evam te trayaḥ pi śiśavaḥ parasparam ajñāta jāti viśeṣāḥ eka ācāra vihārāḥ bālya samayam nirvāhayanti

original: atha kadācit tatra vane bhramann araṇyagajaḥ samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid tatra vane bhraman araṇya gajaḥ samāyātaḥ
translated: One day, a wild elephant wandered into the forest.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā tau siṃhasutau dvāv api kupitānanau taṃ prati pracalitau yāvat tāvat tena śṛgālasutenābhihitamaho /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā tau siṃha sutau dvau api kupita ānanau tam prati pracalitau yāvat tāvat tena śṛgāla sutena abhihitam aho
translated: Seeing him, the two lion cubs became angry and rushed towards him. Just then, the jackal cub said, Oh!

original: gajo 'yaṃ yuṣmatkulaśatruḥ /
analyzed: gajaḥ yam yuṣmad kula śatruḥ
translated: This elephant is an enemy of your family.

original: tan na gantavyam etasyābhimukham /
analyzed: tat na gantavyam etasya abhimukham
translated: So you should not go towards him.

original: evam uktvā gṛhaṃ pradhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā gṛham pradhāvitaḥ
translated: Having said this, he ran home.

original: tāv api jyeṣṭhabāndhavabhaṅgān nirutsāhatāṃ gatau /
analyzed: tau api jyeṣṭha bāndhava bhaṅgāt nirutsāha tām gatau
translated: The two older animals, discouraged by the breakup of their friendship,

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: But this is well said:

original: ekenāpi sudhīreṇa sotsāhena raṇaṃ prati /
analyzed: ekena api su dhīreṇa sa utsāhena raṇam prati
translated: Even by a single brave and enthusiastic person in battle,

original: sotsāhaṃ jāyate sainyaṃ bhagne bhaṅgam avāpnuyāt // ///
analyzed: sa utsāham jāyate sainyam bhagne bhaṅgam avāpnuyāt
translated: the army becomes enthusiastic, but when broken, it suffers defeat.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: ata eva vāñchanti bhūpā yodhān mahābalān /
analyzed: atas eva vāñchanti bhūpāḥ yodhān mahā balān
translated: For this very reason, kings desire warriors of great strength,

original: śūrān vīrān kṛtotsāhān varjayanti ca kātarān // ///
analyzed: śūrān vīrān kṛta utsāhān varjayanti ca kātarān
translated: brave, heroic, and enthusiastic, and avoid the timid.

original: atha tau dvāv api gṛhaṃ prāpya pitror agrato jyeṣṭhabhrātṛceṣṭitam ūcatuḥyathā gajaṃ dṛṣṭvā dūrato 'pi naṣṭaḥ /🔽so 'pi tad ākarṇya kopāviṣṭamanāḥ prasphuritādharapallavas tāmralocanas triśikhāṃ
analyzed: atha tau dvau api gṛham prāpya pitroḥ agratas jyeṣṭha bhrātṛ ceṣṭitam ūcatuḥ yathā gajam dṛṣṭvā naṣṭaḥ  saḥ pi tat ākarṇya kopa āviṣṭa manāḥ prasphurita adhara pallavaḥ tāmra locanaḥ triśikhām
translated: Then the two of them, having reached home, told in front of their parents the behavior of their elder brother: As he saw the elephant from afar, he ran away.🔽He, having heard that, with a mind filled with anger, his lip quivering, his eyes copper-colored,

original: bhrukuṭiṃ kṛtvā tau nirbhartsayan paruṣataravacanāny uvācatataḥ siṃhyai kānte nītvā
analyzed: bhrukuṭim kṛtvā tau nirbhartsayan paruṣatara vacanāni uvāca tatas siṃhyai kānte nītvā
translated: furrowing his brow in three lines, rebuking them, spoke harsh words: Then, O lioness, having taken him to a secluded place,

original: prabodhito 'sauvatsa /
analyzed: prabodhitaḥ sauvatsa
translated: you woke him up, saying: 'Son,

original: maivaṃ kadācij jalpa /
analyzed: mā evam kadācid jalpa
translated: do not speak like this again.

original: bhavadīyalaghubhrātarāv etau /
analyzed: bhavadīya laghu bhrātarau etau
translated: These two are your younger brothers.'

original: athāsau prabhūtakopāviṣṭas tām uvācakim aham etābhyāṃ śauryeṇa rūpeṇa vidyābhyāsena kauśalena vā hīnaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau prabhūta kopa āviṣṭaḥ tām uvāca kim aham etābhyām śauryeṇa rūpeṇa vidyā abhyāsena kauśalena vā hīnaḥ
translated: Then he, filled with great anger, said to her: 'Am I inferior to them in courage, beauty, learning, or skill,

original: yena mām upahasataḥ /
analyzed: yena mām upahasataḥ
translated: by which they mock me?

original: tan mayāvaśyam etau vyāpādanīyau /
analyzed: tat mayā avaśyam etau vyāpādanīyau
translated: Therefore I must certainly kill them.

original: tad ākarṇya siṃhī tasya jīvitam icchanty antar vihasya prāhatat samyak śṛṇu /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya siṃhī tasya jīvitam icchantī antar vihasya prāha tat samyak śṛṇu
translated: Having heard that, the lioness, desiring his life, smiled inwardly and said: 'Listen then.

original: tvaṃ śṛgālīsutaḥ /
analyzed: tvam śṛgālī sutaḥ
translated: You are the son of a jackal.

original: kṛpayā mayā svastanakṣīreṇa puṣṭiṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: kṛpayā mayā sva stana kṣīreṇa puṣṭim nītaḥ
translated: Out of compassion, I nourished you with the milk from my own breasts.

original: tad yāvad etau matputrau śiśutvāt tvāṃ śṛgālaṃ na jānītaḥ /
analyzed: tat yāvat etau mad putrau śiśu tvāt tvām śṛgālam na jānītaḥ
translated: So long as my two sons do not know you to be a jackal because of their youth,

analyzed: tāvat drutataram gatvā sva jātīyānām madhye bhava
translated: go quickly and be among your own kind.

original: no ced ābhyāṃ hato mṛtyupathaṃ sameṣyasi /
analyzed: no ced ābhyām hataḥ mṛtyu patham sameṣyasi
translated: Otherwise, killed by them, you will go the way of death.

original: so 'pi tadvacanaṃ śrutvā bhayavyākulamanāḥ śanaiḥ śanair apasṛtya svajātyā militaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi tad vacanam śrutvā bhaya vyākula manāḥ śanais śanais apasṛtya sva jātyā militaḥ
translated: Hearing those words, with a mind agitated by fear, he slowly slipped away and joined his own kind.

original: tasmāt tvaṃ api yāvad ete rājaputrās tvāṃ kulālaṃ najānanti /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api yāvat ete rāja putrāḥ tvām kulālam na jānanti
translated: Therefore, you too, while these princes do not know you to be a potter,

original: tāvad drutataram apasara /
analyzed: tāvat drutataram apasara
translated: quickly flee.

original: no ced eteṣāṃ sakāśād viḍambanāṃ prāpya mariṣyāmi /
analyzed: no ced eteṣām sakāśāt viḍambanām prāpya mariṣyāmi
translated: Otherwise, having been ridiculed by them, I will die.

original: kulālo 'pi tad ākarṇya satvaraṃ praṇaṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: kulālaḥ pi tat ākarṇya sa tvaram praṇaṣṭaḥ
translated: The potter, having heard that, quickly disappeared.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmisvārtham utsṛjya yo dambhī iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi sva artham utsṛjya yaḥ dambhī iti
translated: Therefore I say: The hypocrite who abandons his own interest...

original: dhiṅ mūrkha /
analyzed: dhik mūrkha
translated: Shame on you, fool!

original: yat tvayā striyo 'rtha etatkāryam anuṣṭhātum ārabdham /
analyzed: yat tvayā striyaḥ rthe etat kāryam anuṣṭhātum ārabdham
translated: For the sake of a woman, you have begun to perform this act.

original: na hi strīṇāṃ kathañcid viśvāsam upagacchet / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na hi strīṇām kathañcid viśvāsam upagacchet uktam ca
translated: One should never trust women in any way. And it is said:

original: yadarthe svakulaṃ tyaktaṃ jīvitārdhaṃ ca hāritam /
analyzed: yad arthe sva kulam tyaktam jīvita ardham ca hāritam
translated: For whose sake my family was abandoned and half my life was lost,

original: sā māṃ tyajati niḥsnehā kaḥ strīṇāṃ viśvasen naraḥ // ///
analyzed: sā mām tyajati niḥsnehā kaḥ strīṇām viśvaset naraḥ
translated: she abandons me without affection. What man can trust women?...🔽And it is said:

original: makara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: makaraḥ āha katham etat
translated: The crocodile asked, “How is that?”

original: vānara āha🔽kathā
analyzed: vānaraḥ āha  kathā
translated: The monkey replied:

original: brāhmaṇakathā
analyzed: brāhmaṇa kathā
translated: The Story of the Brahmins

original: asti kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne ko 'pi brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: asti kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: There was a certain Brahmin in a certain place.

original: tasya ca bhāryā prāṇebhyo 'py atipriyāsīt /
analyzed: tasya ca bhāryā prāṇebhyaḥ pi ati priyā āsīt
translated: And his wife was dearer to him than his life.

original: so 'pi pratidinaṃ kuṭumbena saha kalahaṃ kurvāṇā na viśrāmyati /
analyzed: sā u pi pratidinam kuṭumbena saha kalaham kurvāṇā na viśrāmyati
translated: And he never rested, quarreling with his family every day.

original: so 'pi brāhmaṇaḥ kalaham asahamāno bhāryāvātsalyāt svakuṭumbaṃ parityajya brāhmaṇyā saha viprakṛṣṭaṃ deśāntaraṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi brāhmaṇaḥ kalaham a sahamānaḥ bhāryā vātsalyāt sva kuṭumbam parityajya brāhmaṇyā saha viprakṛṣṭam deśa antaram gataḥ
translated: And that Brahmin, unable to bear the quarrel, out of love for his wife, abandoned his own family and went to a distant foreign country with his Brahmin wife.

original: atha mahāṭavīmadhye brāhmaṇyābhihitaḥāryaputra /
analyzed: atha mahā aṭavī madhye brāhmaṇyā abhihitaḥ āryaputra
translated: Then in the middle of the great forest, the Brahmin wife said, My dear husband,

original: tṛṣṇā māṃ bādhate /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā mām bādhate
translated: thirst is afflicting me.

original: tad udakaṃ kvāpy anveṣaya /
analyzed: tat udakam kvāpi anveṣaya
translated: So search somewhere for water.

original: athāsau tadvacanānantaraṃ yāvadudakaṃ gṛhītvā samāgacchati tāvat tāṃ mṛtām apaśyat /
analyzed: atha asau tad vacana anantaram yāvat udakam gṛhītvā samāgacchati tāvat tām mṛtām apaśyat
translated: Then, after those words, while he was going to fetch water, he saw her dead.

original: ativallabhatayā viṣādaṃ kurvan yāvad vilapati tāvad ākāśe vācaṃ śṛṇoti /
analyzed: ati vallabha tayā viṣādam kurvan yāvat vilapati tāvat ākāśe vācam śṛṇoti
translated: Out of extreme affection, lamenting, while he was wailing, he heard a voice in the sky:

original: yathā hiyadi brāhmaṇa tvaṃ svakīyajīvitasyārdhaṃ dadāsi tatas te jīvati brāhmaṇī /
analyzed: yathā hi yadi brāhmaṇa tvam svakīya jīvitasya ardham dadāsi tatas te jīvati brāhmaṇī
translated: If you, Brahmin, give half of your own life, then your Brahmin wife will live.

original: tac chrutvā brāhmaṇena śucībhūya tisṛbhir vācobhiḥ svajīvitārdhaṃ dattam /
analyzed: tat śrutvā brāhmaṇena śucībhūya tisṛbhiḥ vācobhiḥ sva jīvita ardham dattam
translated: Hearing this, the brahmin became pure and gave half of his life with three utterances.

original: vāksamam eva ca brāhmaṇī jīvitā sā /
analyzed: vāksamam eva ca brāhmaṇī jīvitā sā
translated: And the brahmin's wife was revived with the same number of utterances.

original: atha tau jalaṃ pītvā vanaphalāni bhakṣayitvā gantum ārabdhau /
