analyzed: kṣapaṇaka vihāram gatvā jinendrasya pradakṣiṇa trayam vidhāya
translated: having gone to the Jaina monastery, having circumambulated the Jina three times,

original: jānubhyām avaniṃ gatvā vaktradvāranyastottarīyāñcalas tārasvareṇemaṃ ślokam apaṭhat
analyzed: jānubhyām avanim gatvā vaktra dvāra nyasta uttarīya añcalaḥ tāra svareṇa imam ślokam apaṭhat
translated: having gone down on his knees, having placed the end of his upper garment at the door of his mouth, he recited this verse in a loud voice:

original: jayanti te jinā yeṣāṃ kevalajñānaśālinām /
analyzed: jayanti te jināḥ yeṣām kevala jñāna śālinām
translated: Victorious are those Jinas who possess only knowledge,

original: ā janmanaḥ smarotpattau mānasenoṣarāyitam // ///
analyzed: ā janmanaḥ smara utpattau
translated: From birth, the mind has become a desert in the production of memory.

original: anyac ca
analyzed: anyat ca
translated: And furthermore

original: sā jihvā yā jinaṃ stauti taccittaṃ yaj jine ratam /
analyzed: sā jihvā yā jinam stauti tat cittam yat jine ratam
translated: That tongue which praises the Jina, that mind which delights in the Jina,

original: tau eva tu karau ślāghyau yau tatpūjākarau karau // ///
analyzed: tau eva tu karau ślāghyau yau tad pūjā karau karau
translated: Those very hands are praiseworthy which make offerings to him.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said

original: dhyānavyājam upetya cintayasi kām unmīlya cakṣuḥ kṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: dhyāna vyājam upetya cintayasi kām unmīlya cakṣuḥ kṣaṇam
translated: Having resorted to the pretense of meditation, you think, opening your eyes for a moment,

original: paśyānaṅgaśarāturaṃ janam imaṃ trātāpi no rakṣasi /
analyzed: paśya anaṅga śara āturam janam imam trātā api naḥ rakṣasi
translated: Look at this person afflicted by Ananga's arrows, though saved, you do not protect us.

original: mithyākāruṇiko 'si nirghṛṇataras tvattaḥ kuto 'nyaḥ pumān
analyzed: mithyā kāruṇikaḥ si nirghṛṇataraḥ tvattaḥ kutas pumān
translated: You are falsely compassionate, more merciless than you, where is another man?

original: serṣyaṃ māravadhūbhir ity abhihito bauddho jinaḥ pātu vaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa īrṣyam māra vadhūbhiḥ iti abhihitaḥ bauddhaḥ jinaḥ pātu vaḥ
translated: Thus addressed with jealousy by Mara's wives, may the Buddhist Jina protect you all.

original: evaṃ saṃstūya /
analyzed: evam saṃstūya
translated: Having thus praised,

original: tataḥ pradhānakṣapaṇakaṇam āsādya kṣitinihitajānucaraṇaḥnamo 'stu vande ity uccārya /
analyzed: tatas pradhāna kṣapaṇa kaṇam āsādya kṣiti nihita jānu caraṇaḥ namaḥ stu vande iti uccārya
translated: then approaching the chief mendicant, with knees and feet placed on the ground, uttering Salutations, I pay homage,

original: labdhadharmavṛddhyāśīrvādaḥ sukhamālikānugrahalabdhavratādeśa uttarīyanibaddhagranthiḥ
analyzed: labdha dharma vṛddhi āśīrvādaḥ sukha mālikā anugraha labdha vrata ādeśaḥ uttarīya nibaddha granthiḥ
translated: having obtained the blessing of increased Dharma, having received the vow through the grace of Sukhamali, with the knot tied in the upper garment,

original: sapraśrayam idam āhabhagavan adya viharaṇakriyā samastamunisametenāsmadgṛhe kartavyā /
analyzed: sa praśrayam idam āha bhagavan adya viharaṇa kriyā samasta muni sametena asmad gṛhe kartavyā
translated: he respectfully said this: Lord, today the act of wandering should be performed in our house by you, together with all the sages.

original: tac chrutvā nāpita āhabhagavan /
analyzed: tat śrutvā nāpitaḥ āha bhagavan
translated: Hearing that, the barber said, Venerable sir,

original: vedmy ahaṃ yuṣmaddharmam /
analyzed: vedmi aham yuṣmad dharmam
translated: I know your Dharma.

original: paraṃ bhavato bahuśrāvakā āhvayanti /
analyzed: param bhavataḥ bahu śrāvakāḥ āhvayanti
translated: But your many disciples are calling me.

original: sāmprataṃ punaḥ pustakācchādanayogyāni karpaṭāni bahumūlyāni praguṇīkṛtāni /
analyzed: sāmpratam punar pustaka ācchādana yogyāni karpaṭāni bahu mūlyāni praguṇīkṛtāni
translated: Now, cloth suitable for covering books is being made very valuable.

original: tathā pustakānāṃ lekhanārthaṃ lekhakānāṃ ca vittaṃ sañcitam āste tat sarvathā kālocitaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: tathā pustakānām lekhana artham lekhakānām ca vittam sañcitam āste tat sarvathā kāla ucitam kāryam
translated: And money has been collected for writing the books and the scribes. That must be done in a timely manner.

original: tato nāpito 'pi svagṛhaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas nāpitaḥ sva gṛham gataḥ
translated: Then the barber also went to his own house.

original: tatra ca gatvā khadiramayaṃ laguḍaṃ sajjīkṛtya kapāṭayugalaṃ dvāri samādhāya sārdhapraharaikasamaye
analyzed: tatra ca gatvā khadira mayam laguḍam sajjīkṛtya kapāṭa yugalam dvāri samādhāya sārdha prahara eka samaye
translated: And having gone there, he prepared a stick of acacia wood, closed the two doors with a bolt, and at about half past midnight

original: bhūyo 'pi vihāradvāram āśritya sarvān bhaktiyuktān api paricitaśrāvakān parityajya
analyzed: bhūyas u pi vihāra dvāram āśritya sarvān bhakti yuktān api paricita śrāvakān parityajya
translated: again resorted to the monastery gate, abandoning all devoted disciples, even those he knew well,

original: prahṛṣṭamanasas tasya pṛṣṭhato yayuḥ /
analyzed: prahṛṣṭa manasaḥ tasya pṛṣṭhatas yayuḥ
translated: and went after him with a cheerful mind.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: ekākī gṛhasantyaktaḥ pāṇipātro digambaraḥ /
analyzed: ekākī gṛha santyaktaḥ pāṇi pātraḥ digambaraḥ
translated: Alone, having left home, with a bowl in his hand, naked,

original: so 'pi sambādhyate loke tṛṣṇayā paśya kautukam // ///
analyzed: saḥ pi sambādhyate loke tṛṣṇayā paśya kautukam
translated: he too is obstructed in the world by craving. Look at the wonder!

original: jīryante jīryataḥ keśā dantā jīryanti jīryataḥ /
analyzed: jīryante jīryataḥ keśāḥ dantāḥ jīryanti jīryataḥ
translated: As one grows old, the hair grows old, the teeth grow old as one grows old.

original: cakṣuḥ śrotre ca jīryete tṛṣṇaikā taruṇāyate // ///
analyzed: cakṣuḥ śrotre ca jīryete tṛṣṇā ekā taruṇāyate
translated: The eyes and ears grow old, but thirst alone remains youthful.

original: tataḥ paraṃ gṛhamadhye tān praveśya dvāraṃ nibhṛtaṃ pidhāya /
analyzed: tatas param gṛha madhye tān praveśya dvāram nibhṛtam pidhāya
translated: Then, having brought them into the middle of the house, he closed the door tightly.

original: laguḍaprahāraiḥ śirasy atāḍayat /
analyzed: laguḍa prahāraiḥ śirasi atāḍayat
translated: And he struck their heads with blows from a cudgel.

original: te'pi tāḍyamānā eke mṛtāḥ /
analyzed: te api tāḍyamānāḥ eke mṛtāḥ
translated: And some of them, being struck, died.

original: anye bhinnamastakā phūtkartum upacakramire /
analyzed: anye bhinna mastakā phūtkartum upacakramire
translated: Others, with their heads split open, began to moan.

original: atrāntare tam ākrandam ākarṇya koṭarakṣapālenābhihitambho bhoḥ kim ayaṃ kolāhalo nagaramadhye /
analyzed: atrā antare tam ākrandam ākarṇya koṭara kṣapālena abhihitam bho bhoḥ kim ayam kolāhalaḥ nagara madhye
translated: In the meantime, having heard that wailing, the watchman of the fortress said, Hey, hey, what is this commotion in the middle of the city?

original: tad gamyatām /
analyzed: tat gamyatām
translated: So go.

original: te sa sarve tadādeśakāriṇas tatsahitā vegāt tadgṛhaṃ gatā yāvat paśyanti tāvad rudhiraplāvitadehāḥ palāyamānā nagnakā dṛṣṭāḥ pṛṣṭāś cabhoḥ
analyzed: te sa sarve tad ādeśa kāriṇaḥ tad sahitāḥ vegāt tad gṛham gatāḥ yāvat paśyanti tāvat rudhira plāvita dehāḥ palāyamānāḥ nagnakāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ pṛṣṭāḥ cabhoḥ  /
translated: They all, obeying his order, together quickly went to that house. When they saw, they saw naked people with their bodies covered in blood running away, and asked, Hey,

original: kim etat /
analyzed: kim etat
translated: what is this?

original: te procur yathāvasthitaṃ nāpitavṛttam /
analyzed: te procuḥ yathāvasthitam nāpita vṛttam
translated: They told the situation as it was, the barber's conduct.

original: tair api sa nāpito baddho hataśeṣaiḥ saha dharmādhiṣṭhānaṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ api sa nāpitaḥ baddhaḥ hata śeṣaiḥ saha dharma adhiṣṭhānam nītaḥ
translated: And the barber was bound by those who remained after the killing, and taken to the court of justice.

original: tair nāpitaḥ pṛṣṭaḥbhoḥ /🔽kim etat bhavatā kukṛtyam anuṣṭhitam /
analyzed: taiḥ nāpitaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ bhoḥ  kim etat bhavatā kukṛtyam anuṣṭhitam
translated: They asked the barber, Hey,🔽what evil deed have you done?

original: sa āhakiṃ karomi /
analyzed: saḥ āha kim karomi
translated: He said, What can I do?

original: mayā śreṣṭhimaṇibhadragṛhe dṛṣṭa evaṃvidho vyatikaraḥ /
analyzed: mayā śreṣṭhi maṇi bhadragṛhe dṛṣṭaḥ evaṃvidhaḥ vyatikaraḥ
translated: I saw such a disaster in the house of the merchant Maṇibhadra.

original: so 'pi sarvaṃ maṇiprabhavṛttāntaṃ yathādṛṣṭam akathayat /
analyzed: saḥ pi sarvam maṇiprabha vṛttāntam yathādṛṣṭam akathayat
translated: He also told them the entire story of Maṇiprabhā as he had seen it.

original: tataḥ śreṣṭhinam āhūya te bhaṇitavantaḥbhoḥ śreṣṭhin /
analyzed: tatas śreṣṭhinam āhūya te bhaṇitavantaḥ bhoḥ śreṣṭhin
translated: Then they summoned the merchant and said, Hey, merchant!

original: kiṃ tvayā kaścit kṣapaṇako vyāpāditaḥ /
analyzed: kim tvayā kaścid kṣapaṇakaḥ vyāpāditaḥ
translated: Have you killed any naked ascetic?

original: tataḥ tenāpi sarvaḥ kṣapaṇakavṛttāntas teṣāṃ niveditaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tena api sarvaḥ kṣapaṇaka vṛttāntaḥ teṣām niveditaḥ
translated: Then he also told them the entire story of the naked ascetic.

original: atha tair abhihitamaho śūlam āropyatām asau duṣṭātmā kuparikṣitakārī nāpitaḥ /
analyzed: atha taiḥ abhihitam aho śūlam āropyatām asau duṣṭa ātmā ku parikṣita kārī nāpitaḥ
translated: Then they said, Oh, let this wicked barber who has acted improperly be impaled on a stake.

original: tathānuṣṭhite tair abhihitam
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite taiḥ abhihitam
translated: When that was done, they said,

original: kukkuṭaṃ kuparijñātaṃ kuśrutaṃ kuparīkṣitam /
analyzed: kukkuṭam ku parijñātam ku śrutam ku parīkṣitam
translated: The cock was poorly known, poorly heard, poorly examined.

original: tan nareṇa na kartavyaṃ nāpitenātra yat kṛtam // ///
analyzed: tat nareṇa na kartavyam nāpitena atra yat kṛtam
translated: Therefore, a man should not do what was done by the barber here.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: aparīkṣya na kartavyaṃ kartavyaṃ suparīkṣitam /
analyzed: a parīkṣya na kartavyam kartavyam su parīkṣitam
translated: One should not act without examination, one should act after thorough examination.

original: paścād bhavati santāpo brāhmaṇī nakulaṃ yathā // ///
analyzed: paścāt bhavati santāpaḥ brāhmaṇī nakulam yathā
translated: Afterwards there is remorse, like the Brahmin woman and the mongoose.

original: maṇibhadra āhakatham etat /
analyzed: maṇibhadraḥ āha katham etat
translated: Maṇibhadra said, How is that?

original: te dharmādhikāriṇaḥ procuḥ
analyzed: te dharma adhikāriṇaḥ procuḥ
translated: Those in charge of religious matters said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: brāhmaṇīnakulakathā
analyzed: brāhmaṇī nakula kathā
translated: The Story of the Brahmin Woman and the Mongoose

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne devaśarmā nāma brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne devaśarmā nāma brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain place, there lived a Brahmin named Devaśarman.

original: tasya bhāryā prasūtā sutam ajanayat /
analyzed: tasya bhāryā prasūtā sutam ajanayat
translated: His wife gave birth to a son.

original: tasminn eva dine nakulī nakulaṃ prasūya sṛtā /
analyzed: tasmin eva dine nakulī nakulam prasūya sṛtā
translated: On the same day, a mongoose gave birth to a mongoose.

original: atha sā sutavatsalā dārakavattam api nakulaṃ stanyadānābhyaṅgamardanādibhiḥ pupoṣa /
analyzed: atha sā suta vatsalā dāraka vat tam api nakulam stanya dāna abhyaṅga mardana ādibhiḥ pupoṣa
translated: Then, out of love for her son, she also raised the mongoose cub by feeding it milk, massaging it, and so on.

original: paraṃ tasya na viśvasiti /
analyzed: param tasya na viśvasiti
translated: But she did not trust it.

original: apatyasnehasya sarvasnehātiriktatayā satatam evam āśaṅkate yat kadācid eṣa svajātidoṣavaśād asya dārakasya viruddham ācariṣyati iti /
analyzed: apatya snehasya sarva sneha atirikta tayā satatam evam āśaṅkate yat kadācid eṣa sva jāti doṣa vaśāt asya dārakasya viruddham ācariṣyati iti
translated: Because affection for one's own child is greater than all other affections, she was always suspicious that it might do something harmful to her son due to the faults of its own species.

original: kuputro 'pi bhavet puṃsāṃ hṛdayānandakārakaḥ /
analyzed: bhavet puṃsām hṛdaya ānanda kārakaḥ
translated: Even a bad son can bring joy to a man's heart.

original: durvinītaḥ kurūpo 'pi mūrkho 'pi vyasanī khalaḥ // ///
analyzed: durvinītaḥ kurūpaḥ pi mūrkhaḥ pi vyasanī khalaḥ
translated: Even if ill-behaved, ugly, foolish, or addicted to vices...

original: evaṃ ca bhāṣate lokaś candanaṃ kila śītalam /
analyzed: evam ca bhāṣate lokaḥ candanam kila śītalam
translated: And the people say: Sandalwood is indeed cool.

original: putragātrasya saṃsparśaś candanād atiricyate // ///🔽sauhṛdasya na vāñchanti janakasya hitasya ca /
analyzed: putra gātrasya saṃsparśaḥ candanāt atiricyate  sauhṛdasya na vāñchanti janakasya hitasya ca
translated: The touch of a son's body surpasses sandalwood...🔽The people do not desire the affection of a father who is kind and beneficial,

original: lokāḥ prapālakasyāpi yathā putrasya bandhanam // ///
analyzed: lokāḥ prapālakasya api yathā putrasya bandhanam
translated: Just as they do not desire the affection of a protector who is like a son's fetter...

original: atha sā kadācic chayyāyāṃ putraṃ śāyayitvā jalakumbham ādāya patim uvācabrāhmaṇa /
analyzed: atha sā kadācid śayyāyām putram śāyayitvā jala kumbham ādāya patim uvāca brāhmaṇa
translated: One day, after putting her son to sleep on the bed, she took a water pot and said to her husband, Brahmin,

original: jalārtham ahaṃ taḍāge yāsyāmi /
analyzed: jala artham aham taḍāge yāsyāmi
translated: I am going to the pond for water.

original: tvayā putro 'yaṃ nakulād rakṣaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā putraḥ yam nakulāt rakṣaṇīyaḥ
translated: You must protect this son of ours from the mongoose.

original: atha tasyāṃ gatāyāṃ /
analyzed: atha tasyām gatāyām
translated: After she left,

original: pṛṣṭhe brāhmaṇo 'pi śūnyaṃ gṛhaṃ muktvā bhikṣārthaṃ kvacin nirgataḥ /
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe brāhmaṇaḥ pi śūnyam gṛham muktvā bhikṣā artham kvacid nirgataḥ
translated: the Brahmin also left the empty house to beg for alms somewhere.

original: mātāpi taṃ rudhiraklinnamukham ālokya śaṅkitacittā nūnam anena durātmanā dārako bhakṣitaḥ iti niścintya kopāt tasyopari taṃ jalakumbhaṃ
analyzed: mātā api tam rudhira klinna mukham ālokya śaṅkita cittā nūnam anena durātmanā dārakaḥ bhakṣitaḥ iti niścintya kopāt tasya upari tam jala kumbham
translated: When she saw her son with blood on his face, she became suspicious and thought, Surely this evil one has eaten my child. With anger, she threw the water pot

original: cikṣepa /
analyzed: cikṣepa
translated: on him.

original: evaṃ sā nakulaṃ vyāpādya yāvat pralapantī gṛhe āgacchati /
analyzed: evam sā nakulam vyāpādya yāvat pralapantī gṛhe āgacchati
translated: Thus she killed the mongoose and was lamenting when she returned home.

original: tāvat sutas tathaiva suptas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tāvat sutaḥ tathā eva suptaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Meanwhile, her son was sleeping as before.

original: samīpe kṛṣṇasarpaṃ khaṇḍaśaḥ kṛtam avalokya putravadhaśokenātmaśiro vakṣaḥsthalaṃ ca tāḍitum ārabdhā /
analyzed: samīpe kṛṣṇa sarpam khaṇḍaśas kṛtam avalokya putra vadha śokena ātma śiraḥ vakṣaḥ sthalam ca tāḍitum ārabdhā
translated: Seeing the black snake cut into pieces near him, she began to beat her head and chest out of grief for her son's death.

original: atrāntare brāhmaṇo gṛhītanirvāpaḥ samāyāto yāvat paśyati tāvat putraśoko 'bhitaptā brāhmaṇī pralapatibho bho lobhātman /
analyzed: atra antare brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhīta nirvāpaḥ samāyātaḥ yāvat paśyati tāvat putra śokaḥ bhitaptā brāhmaṇī pralapati bho bho lobha ātman
translated: In the meantime, the Brahmin, having finished his oblation, came back. When he saw that the Brahmin woman was lamenting, tormented by grief for her son: Hey, you who are full of greed!

original: lobhābhibhūtena tvayā na kṛtaṃ madvacaḥ /
analyzed: lobha abhibhūtena tvayā na kṛtam mad vacaḥ
translated: By you, overcome by greed, my words were not done.

original: tad anubhava sāmprataṃ putramṛtyuduḥkhavṛkṣaphalam /
analyzed: tat anubhava sāmpratam putra mṛtyu duḥkha vṛkṣa phalam
translated: Now experience the fruit of the tree of grief from your son's death.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: atilobho na kartavyaḥ kartavyas tu pramāṇataḥ /
analyzed: ati lobhaḥ na kartavyaḥ kartavyaḥ tu pramāṇataḥ
translated: Excessive greed should not be done, but it should be done to a proper extent.

original: atilobhajadoṣeṇa jambuko nidhanaṃ gataḥ // ///
analyzed: ati lobha ja doṣeṇa jambukaḥ nidhanam gataḥ
translated: Due to the fault arising from excessive greed, the jackal met with death.

original: brāhmaṇa āhakim etat /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ āha kim etat
translated: The Brahmin said: What is this?

original: sā prāha
analyzed: sā prāha
translated: She said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: Story

original: lobhāviṣṭacakradharakathā
analyzed: lobha āviṣṭa cakradhara kathā
translated: The story of Cakradhara possessed by greed

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne catvāro brāhmaṇaputrāḥ parasparaṃ mitratāṃ gatā vasanti sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne catvāraḥ brāhmaṇa putrāḥ parasparam mitra tām gatāḥ vasanti sma
translated: In a certain place, four Brahmin boys were living as friends to each other.

original: te cāpi dāridryopahatāḥ parasparaṃ mantraṃ cakruḥaho dhig iyaṃ daridratā / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: te ca api dāridrya upahatāḥ parasparam mantram cakruḥ aho dhik iyam daridra tā uktam ca
translated: And they, afflicted by poverty, consulted each other: Alas, this poverty! And it is said:

original: varaṃ vanaṃ vyāghragajādisevitaṃ
analyzed: varam vanam vyāghra gaja ādi sevitam
translated: Better a forest inhabited by tigers, elephants, and others,

original: janena hīnaṃ bahukaṇṭakāvṛtam /
analyzed: janena hīnam bahu kaṇṭaka āvṛtam
translated: devoid of people, covered with many thorns,

original: tṛṇāni śayyā paridhānavalkalaḥ
analyzed: tṛṇāni śayyā paridhāna valkalaḥ
translated: with grass for a bed, bark garments,

original: na bandhumadhye dhanahīnajīvitam // ///
analyzed: na bandhu madhye dhana hīna jīvitam
translated: than a life without wealth in the midst of relatives.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: svāmī dveṣṭi susevito 'pi sahasā projjhanti sadbāndhavāḥ
analyzed: svāmī dveṣṭi su sevitaḥ pi sahasā projjhanti sat bāndhavāḥ
translated: Even if well-served, the master hates, good friends suddenly abandon,

original: rājante na guṇās tyajanti tanujāḥ sphārībhavanty āpadaḥ /
analyzed: rājante na guṇāḥ tyajanti tanujāḥ sphārībhavanti āpadaḥ
translated: Virtues do not shine, children are lost, calamities increase.

original: bhāryā sādhu suvaṃśajāpi bhajate no yānti mitrāṇi ca
analyzed: bhāryā sādhu su vaṃśa jā api bhajate naḥ yānti mitrāṇi ca
translated: Even a wife born in a good family does not serve, friends go away,

original: nyāyāropitavikramāṇy api nṛṇāṃ yeṣāṃ na hi syād dhanam // ///
analyzed: nyāya āropita vikramāṇi api nṛṇām yeṣām na hi syāt dhanam
translated: For those men who do not have wealth, even if they have virtues imposed by justice.

original: śūraḥ surūpaḥ subhagaś ca vāgmī
analyzed: śūraḥ surūpaḥ subhagaḥ ca vāgmī
translated: A hero, handsome, fortunate, eloquent,

original: śastrāṇi śāstrāṇi vidāṃkarotu /🔽arthaṃ vinā naiva yaśaś ca mānaṃ
analyzed: śastrāṇi śāstrāṇi vidāṃkarotu  artham vinā nā eva yaśaḥ ca mānam
translated: Let him make weapons and treatises.🔽Without wealth, a mortal does not obtain fame, honor,

original: prāpnoti martyo 'tra manuṣyaloke // ///
analyzed: prāpnoti martyaḥ u tra manuṣya loke
translated: Or a wife in this human world.

original: tānīndriyāṇy avikalāni tad eva nāma
analyzed: tāni indriyāṇi avikalāni tat eva nāma
translated: Those very unimpaired senses, that very name,

original: sā buddhir apratihatā vacanaṃ tad eva /
analyzed: sā buddhiḥ a pratihatā vacanam tat eva
translated: That very unobstructed intellect, that very speech,

original: arthoṣmaṇā virahitaḥ puruṣaḥ sa eva
analyzed: artha ūṣmaṇā virahitaḥ puruṣaḥ saḥ eva
translated: That very man devoid of the heat of wealth,

original: bāhyaḥ kṣaṇena bhavatīti vicitram etat // ///
analyzed: bāhyaḥ kṣaṇena bhavati iti vicitram etat
translated: Instantly becomes an outsider - this is strange.

original: tad gacchāmaḥ kutracid arthāya iti sammantrya svadeśaṃ puraṃ ca svasuhṛtsahitaṃ gṛhaṃ ca parityajya prasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tat gacchāmaḥ kutracid arthāya iti sammantrya sva deśam puram ca sva suhṛd sahitam gṛham ca parityajya prasthitāḥ
translated: So let us go somewhere for the sake of wealth. Having thus consulted, they abandoned their own country, city, friends, and home, and set out.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: satyaṃ parityajati muñcati bandhuvargaṃ
analyzed: satyam parityajati muñcati bandhu vargam
translated: He abandons the truth, gives up his circle of relatives,

original: śīghraṃ vihāya jananīm api janmabhūmim /
analyzed: śīghram vihāya jananīm api janma bhūmim
translated: Quickly leaves his mother and even his birthplace,

original: santyajya gacchati videśam abhīṣṭalokaṃ
analyzed: santyajya gacchati videśam abhīṣṭa lokam
translated: And goes to a foreign land, to the world he desires,

original: cintākulīkṛtamatiḥ puruṣo 'tra loke // ///
analyzed: cintā ākulīkṛta matiḥ loke
translated: With his mind troubled by thoughts - such is the man in this world.

original: evaṃ krameṇa gacchanto 'vantīṃ prāptāḥ /
analyzed: evam krameṇa gacchantaḥ vantīm prāptāḥ
translated: In this way, they gradually went and reached Avanti.

original: tatra siprājale kṛtasnānāḥ mahākālaṃ praṇamya yāvan nirgacchanti tāvat bhairavānando nāma yogī saṃmukho babhūva /
analyzed: tatra siprā jale kṛta snānāḥ mahākālam praṇamya yāvat nirgacchanti tāvat bhairavānandaḥ nāma yogī saṃmukhaḥ babhūva
translated: There, after bathing in the waters of the Siprā, bowing to Mahākāla, as they were leaving, a yogi named Bhairavānanda appeared before them.

original: tatas taṃ brāhmaṇocitavidhinā sambhāvya tenaiva saha tasya maṭhaṃ jagmuḥ /
analyzed: tatas tam brāhmaṇa ucita vidhinā sambhāvya tena eva saha tasya maṭham jagmuḥ
translated: Then, after honoring him with the rites befitting a brahmin, they went to his ashram with him.

original: atha tena pṛṣṭāḥkuto bhavantaḥ samāyātāḥ /
analyzed: atha tena pṛṣṭāḥ kutas bhavantaḥ samāyātāḥ
translated: Then, he asked them, Where have you come from?

original: kva yāsyatha /
analyzed: kva yāsyatha
translated: Where will you go?

original: kiṃ prayojanam /
analyzed: kim prayojanam
translated: What is your purpose?

original: tatas tair abhihitamvayaṃ siddhiyātrikāḥ /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ abhihitam vayam siddhiyātrikāḥ
translated: Then they said, We are travelers seeking success.

original: tatra yāsyāmo yatra dhanāptir mṛtyur vā bhaviṣyatīty eṣa niścayaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tatra yāsyāmaḥ yatra dhana āptiḥ mṛtyuḥ vā bhaviṣyati iti eṣa niścayaḥ uktam ca
translated: We will go there where we will obtain wealth or death - this is our resolve. And it is said:

original: duṣprāpyāṇi bahūni ca labhyante vāñchitāni draviṇāni /
analyzed: duṣprāpyāṇi bahūni ca labhyante vāñchitāni draviṇāni
translated: Many unattainable things are obtained, desired riches.

original: avasaratulitābhir alaṃ tanubhiḥ sāhasikapuruṣāṇām // ///
analyzed: avasara tulitābhiḥ alam tanubhiḥ sāhasika puruṣāṇām
translated: Enough of these bodies weighed in the balance of opportunity for daring men.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is:

original: patati kadācin nabhasaḥ khāte pātālato 'pi jalam eti /
analyzed: patati kadācid nabhasaḥ khāte pātālataḥ u pi jalam eti
translated: Water sometimes falls from the sky into a pit, and water rises from the nether world.

original: daivam acintyaṃ balavad balavān nanu puruṣakāro 'pi // ///
analyzed: daivam acintyam balavat balavān nanu
translated: Fate is inconceivable, but indeed, powerful human effort is also powerful.

original: abhimatasiddhir aśeṣā bhavati hi puruṣasya puruṣakāreṇa /
analyzed: abhimata siddhiḥ aśeṣā bhavati hi puruṣasya puruṣakāreṇa
translated: All desired accomplishments of a man are due to his own effort.

original: daivam iti yadapi kathayasi puruṣaguṇaḥ so 'py adṛṣṭākhyaḥ // ///🔽bhayam atulaṃ gurulokāt tṛṇam iva tulayanti sādhu sāhasikāḥ /
analyzed: daivam iti yat api kathayasi puruṣa guṇaḥ saḥ pi adṛṣṭa ākhyaḥ  bhayam atulam guru lokāt tṛṇam iva tulayanti sādhu sāhasikāḥ
translated: Even what you call fate is a quality of the soul called unseen.🔽The bold ones weigh fear like a straw from the world of the elders.

original: prāṇān adbhutam etac cārtiṃ caritaṃ hy udārāṇām // ///
analyzed: prāṇān adbhutam etat ca ārtim caritam hi udārāṇām
translated: The conduct of the noble ones is indeed wonderful, they give up their lives and suffer.

original: kleśasyāṅgam adattvā sukham eva sukhāni neha labhyante /
analyzed: kleśasya aṅgam a dattvā sukham eva sukhāni na iha labhyante
translated: Without giving a limb of suffering, happiness alone is not obtained here.

original: madhubhin mathanāyas tair āśliṣyati bāhubhir lakṣmīm // ///
analyzed: madhu bhid mathanāyaḥ taiḥ āśliṣyati bāhubhiḥ lakṣmīm
translated: By those arms, they embrace Lakshmi for the churning of the ocean.

original: tasya kathaṃ na calā syāt patnī viṣṇor nṛsiṃhakasyāpi
analyzed: tasya katham na calā syāt patnī viṣṇoḥ nṛsiṃhakasya api
translated: How could his wife not be steady, even of Vishnu in the form of Narasimha?

original: māsāṃś caturo nidrāṃ yaḥ sevati jalagataḥ satatam // ///
analyzed: māsān caturaḥ nidrām yaḥ sevati jala gataḥ satatam
translated: He who always serves sleep for four months, dwelling in water.

original: duradhigamaḥ parabhāgo yāvat puruṣeṇa sāhasaṃ na kṛtam /
analyzed: duradhigamaḥ parabhāgaḥ yāvat puruṣeṇa sāhasam na kṛtam
translated: The highest state is difficult to attain as long as a man has not performed daring deeds.

original: jayati tulām adhirūḍho bhāsvān iha jaladapaṭalāni // ///
analyzed: jayati tulām adhirūḍhaḥ bhāsvān iha jalada paṭalāni
translated: But the sun, mounted on the scale, conquers here the masses of clouds.

original: tat kathyatām asmākaṃ kaścit dhanopāyo vivarapraveśaśākinīsādhanaśmaśānasevanamahāmāṃsavikrayasādhakavarjitaprabhṛtīnām ekatama
analyzed: tat kathyatām asmākam kaścid dhana upāyaḥ vivara praveśa śākinī sādhana śmaśāna sevana mahāmāṃsa vikraya sādhaka varjita prabhṛtīnām ekatama
translated: So tell us some means of acquiring wealth, such as entering a cave, practicing sorcery, frequenting cremation grounds, selling human flesh, or any other.

original: adbhutaśaktir bhavān śrūyate /
analyzed: adbhuta śaktiḥ bhavān śrūyate
translated: It is said that you have extraordinary power.

original: vayam apy atisāhasikāḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: vayam api ati sāhasikāḥ uktam ca
translated: We too are extremely daring. And it is said:

original: mahānta eva mahatām arthaṃ sādhayituṃ kṣamāḥ /
analyzed: mahāntaḥ eva mahatām artham sādhayitum kṣamāḥ
translated: Only the great are able to accomplish the great purpose of the great.

original: ṛte samudrād anyaḥ ko bibharti baḍavānalam // ///
analyzed: ṛte samudrāt anyaḥ kaḥ bibharti baḍavānalam
translated: Except for the ocean, who else can support the submarine fire?

original: bhairavānando 'pi teṣāṃ siddhyarthaṃ bahūpāyaṃ siddhavarticatuṣṭayaṃ kṛtvārpayat /
analyzed: bhairavānandaḥ pi teṣām siddhi artham bahu upāyam siddhavarti catuṣṭayam kṛtvā arpayat
translated: Bhairavananda, in order to bring about their success, made four perfected candles and gave them.

original: āha cagamyatāṃ himālayadiśi /
analyzed: āha ca gamyatām himālaya diśi
translated: And he said, Go in the direction of the Himalayas.

original: tatra samprāptānāṃ yatra vartiḥ patiṣyati /
analyzed: tatra samprāptānām yatra vartiḥ patiṣyati
translated: There, when you reach a place, wherever the candle falls,

original: tatra nidhānam asandigdhaṃ prāpyasva /
analyzed: tatra nidhānam asandigdham prāpyasva
translated: there you will undoubtedly find a treasure.

original: tatra sthānaṃ khanitvā nidhiṃ gṛhītvā vyāghuṭyatām /
analyzed: tatra sthānam khanitvā nidhim gṛhītvā vyāghuṭyatām
translated: Dig there, take the treasure, and disperse.

original: tathānuṣṭhite teṣāṃ gacchatām ekatamasya hastād varitr nipapāta /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite teṣām gacchatām ekatamasya hastāt varitr nipapāta
translated: When they were proceeding in this way, a candle fell from the hand of one of them.

original: athāsau yāvat taṃ praveśaṃ khanati tāvat tāmramayī bhūmiḥ /
analyzed: atha asau yāvat tam praveśam khanati tāvat tāmra mayī bhūmiḥ
translated: Then, as he was digging that hole, the earth turned into copper.

original: tatas tenābhihitamaho /
analyzed: tatas tena abhihitam aho
translated: Then he said, Oh!

original: gṛhyatāṃ svecchayā tāmram /
analyzed: gṛhyatām sva icchayā tāmram
translated: Take as much copper as you want.

original: anye procuḥbho mūḍha /
analyzed: anye procuḥ bho mūḍha
translated: The others said, Hey, fool!

original: kim anena kriyate yat prabhūtam api dāridryaṃ na nāśayati /
analyzed: kim anena kriyate yat prabhūtam api dāridryam na nāśayati
translated: What is this? Even a lot of it doesn't destroy poverty.

original: tad uttiṣṭha agrato gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat uttiṣṭha agratas gacchāmaḥ
translated: So get up, let's go ahead.

original: so 'bravītyāntu bhavantaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ bravīti āntu bhavantaḥ
translated: He said, Let it be, sirs.

original: nāham agra yāsyāmi /
analyzed: na aham agra yāsyāmi
translated: I will not go ahead.

original: evam abhidhāya tāmraṃ yathecchayā gṛhītvā prathamo nivṛttaḥ /
analyzed: evam abhidhāya tāmram yathā icchayā gṛhītvā prathamaḥ nivṛttaḥ
translated: Having said this, he took the copper as he wished and turned back first.

original: te trayo 'pi agre prasthitāḥ /🔽atha kiñcinmātraṃ gatasyāgresarasya vartir nipapāta /
analyzed: te trayaḥ pi agre prasthitāḥ  atha kiñcid mātram gatasya agresarasya vartiḥ nipapāta
translated: The three of them set out ahead.🔽Then, when he had gone only a little way, the leader's rope fell.

original: so 'pi yāvat khanitum ārabdhas tāvad rūpyamayī kṣitiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi yāvat khanitum ārabdhaḥ tāvat rūpya mayī kṣitiḥ
translated: And when he started to dig, the ground was made of silver.

original: tataḥ praharṣitaḥ prāha /
analyzed: tatas praharṣitaḥ prāha
translated: Then, delighted, he said,

original: yatbho bho /
analyzed: yat bho bho
translated: Hey, hey!

original: gṛhyatāṃ yathecchayā rūpyam /
analyzed: gṛhyatām yathā icchayā rūpyam
translated: Take as much silver as you want.

original: nāgre gantavyam /
analyzed: na agre gantavyam
translated: You don't need to go ahead.

original: tāv ūcatuḥbhoḥ pṛṣṭhatas tāmramayī bhūmiḥ /
analyzed: tau ūcatuḥ bhoḥ pṛṣṭhatas tāmra mayī bhūmiḥ
translated: The other two said, Sirs, behind is copper ground,

original: agrato rūpyamayī /
analyzed: agratas rūpya mayī
translated: ahead is silver.

original: tan nūnam agre suvarṇamayī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat nūnam agre suvarṇa mayī bhaviṣyati
translated: So surely ahead there will be gold.

original: kiṃ cānena prabhūtenāpi dāridryanāśo na bhavati /🔽tad āvām agre yāsyāvaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca anena prabhūtena api dāridrya nāśaḥ na bhavati  tat āvām agre yāsyāvaḥ
translated: Moreover, even with this abundance, poverty is not destroyed.🔽So we two will go ahead.

original: evam uktvā dvāv apy agre prasthitau /
analyzed: evam uktvā dvau api agre prasthitau
translated: Having said this, the two set out ahead.

original: so 'pi svaśaktyā rūpyam ādāya nivṛttaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi sva śaktyā rūpyam ādāya nivṛttaḥ
translated: He too, taking silver according to his ability, turned back.

original: atha tayor api gacchator ekasyāgre vartiḥ papāta /
analyzed: atha tayoḥ api gacchatoḥ ekasya agre vartiḥ papāta
translated: Then, as they were going along, a wick fell in front of one of them.

original: so 'pi prahṛṣṭo yāvat khanati /
analyzed: saḥ pi prahṛṣṭaḥ yāvat khanati
translated: He too, delighted, dug as far as he could.

original: tāvat suvarṇabhūmiṃ dṛṣṭvā dvitīyaṃ prāhabho /
analyzed: tāvat suvarṇa bhūmim dṛṣṭvā dvitīyam prāha bho
translated: Then, seeing a gold mine, he said to the second one, Hey!

original: gṛhyatāṃ svecchayā suvarṇam /
analyzed: gṛhyatām sva icchayā suvarṇam
translated: Take gold as you wish.

original: suvarṇād anyan na kiñcid uttamaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: suvarṇāt anyat na kiñcid uttamam bhaviṣyati
translated: Nothing is better than gold.

original: sa prāhamūḍha /
analyzed: sa prāhamūḍha
translated: He said, Fool!

original: na kiñcid vetsi /🔽prāk tāmraṃ /🔽tato rūpyaṃ /
analyzed: na kiñcid vetsi  prāk tāmram  tatas rūpyam
translated: You know nothing.🔽First there was copper.🔽Then silver.

original: tataḥ suvarṇam /
analyzed: tatas suvarṇam
translated: Then gold.

original: tan nūnam ataḥ paraṃ ratnāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tat nūnam atas param ratnāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: So surely jewels will come after this.

original: yeṣām ekatamenāpi dāridryanāśo bhavati /
analyzed: yeṣām ekatamena api dāridrya nāśaḥ bhavati
translated: By even one of which poverty can be destroyed.

original: tad uttiṣṭha /
analyzed: tat uttiṣṭha
translated: So get up.

original: agre gacchāvaḥ /
analyzed: agre gacchāvaḥ
translated: Let's go ahead.

original: kim anena bhārabhūtenāpi prabhūtena /
analyzed: kim anena bhāra bhūtena api prabhūtena
translated: What's the use of this abundant but burdensome (gold)?

original: sa āhagacchatu bhavān /
analyzed: saḥ āha gacchatu bhavān
translated: He said, You go.

original: aham atra sthitas tvāṃ pratipālayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham atra sthitaḥ tvām pratipālayiṣyāmi
translated: I will stay here and wait for you.

original: tathānuṣṭhite so 'pi gacchann ekākī /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite saḥ pi gacchan ekākī
translated: When that was done, he too, going alone,

original: grīṣmārkapratāpasantaptatanuḥ pipāsākulitaḥ siddhimārgacyuta itaś cetaś ca babhrāma /
analyzed: grīṣma arka pratāpa santapta tanuḥ pipāsā ākulitaḥ siddhi mārga cyutaḥ itas ca itas ca babhrāma
translated: his body scorched by the heat of the summer sun, troubled by thirst, and having strayed from the path of success, wandered here and there.

original: atha bhrāmyan /
analyzed: atha bhrāmyan
translated: Then, wandering,

original: sthalopari puruṣam ekaṃ rudhiraplāvitagātraṃ bhramaccakramastakam apaśyat /
analyzed: sthala upari puruṣam ekam rudhira plāvita gātram bhramat cakra mastakam apaśyat
translated: And on the ground he saw a man with blood flowing from his body, and a wheel revolving on his head.

original: tato drutataraṃ gatvā tam avocatbhoḥ /
analyzed: tatas drutataram gatvā tam avocat bhoḥ
translated: Then he went faster and said to him, Sir,

original: ko bhavān / kim evaṃ cakreṇa śirasi tiṣṭhasi /
analyzed: kaḥ bhavān kim evam cakreṇa śirasi tiṣṭhasi
translated: who are you? Why do you stand with a wheel on your head?

original: tat kathaya me yadi kutracij jalam asti /
analyzed: tat kathaya me yadi kutracid jalam asti
translated: So tell me if there is water anywhere.

original: evaṃ tasya pravadatas tac cakraṃ tatkṣaṇāt tasya śiraso brāhmaṇamastake caṭitam /
analyzed: evam tasya pravadataḥ tat cakram tad kṣaṇāt tasya śirasaḥ brāhmaṇa mastake caṭitam
translated: As he was speaking, that wheel immediately stuck to the head of that brahmin.

original: sa āhabhadra / kim etat /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhadra kim etat
translated: He said, Sir, what is this?

original: sa āhamamāpy evam etac chirasi caṭitam /
analyzed: saḥ evam etat śirasi caṭitam
translated: He said, It has stuck to my head in the same way.

original: sa āhatat kathaya /
analyzed: saḥ āha tat kathaya
translated: He said, So tell me.

original: kadaitad uttariṣyati /
analyzed: kadā etat uttariṣyati
translated: When will it come off?

original: mahatī me vedanā vartate /
analyzed: mahatī me vedanā vartate
translated: I have great pain.

original: sa āhayadā tvam iva kaścid adhṛtasiddhavartir evam āgatya /
analyzed: saḥ āha yadā tvam iva kaścid adhṛta siddha vartiḥ evam āgatya
translated: He said, When someone like you comes here with an unlit lamp,

original: tvām ālāpayiṣyati tadā tasya mastakaṃ caṭiṣyati /
analyzed: tvām ālāpayiṣyati tadā tasya mastakam caṭiṣyati
translated: and talks to you, then it will stick to his head.

original: sa āhakiyān kālas tavaivaṃ sthitasya /
analyzed: saḥ āha kiyān kālaḥ tava evam sthitasya
translated: He said, How long have you been standing like this?

original: sa āhasāmprataṃ ko rājā dharaṇītale /
analyzed: saḥ āha sāmpratam kaḥ rājā dharaṇī tale
translated: He said, Who is the king on earth now?

original: sa āhavīṇāvādanapaṭuḥ vatsarājaḥ /
analyzed: sa āha vīṇā vādana paṭuḥ vatsarājaḥ
translated: He said, The king of Vatsa, skilled in playing the lute.

original: sa āhaahaṃ tāvatkālasaṅkhyāṃ na jānāmi /
analyzed: saḥ āha aham tāvat kāla saṅkhyām na jānāmi
translated: He said, I do not know the number of years.

original: paraṃ yadā rāmo rājāsīt tavāhaṃ dāridryopahataḥ siddhavartim ādāyānena pathā samāyātaḥ /
analyzed: param yadā rāmaḥ rājā āsīt tava aham dāridrya upahataḥ siddhavartim ādāya anena pathā samāyātaḥ
translated: But when Rama was king, I, afflicted by poverty, took a magic pill and came this way.

original: tato mayānyo naro mastakaśrutacakro dṛṣṭaḥ / pṛṣṭaś ca /
analyzed: tatas mayā anyaḥ naraḥ mastaka śruta cakraḥ dṛṣṭaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ ca
translated: Then I saw another man with a wheel on his head, and asked him.

original: tataś caitaj jātam /
analyzed: tatas ca etat jātam
translated: And then this happened.

original: sa āhabhadra /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhadra
translated: He said, Sir,

original: kathaṃ tadaivaṃ sthitasya bhojanajalaprāptir āsīt /
analyzed: katham tadā evam sthitasya bhojana jala prāptiḥ āsīt
translated: how did you get food and water while standing like that?

original: sa āhabhadra /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhadra
translated: He said, Sir,

original: dhanadena nidhānaharaṇabhayāt siddhānām etaccakrapatanarūpaṃ bhayaṃ darśitam /
analyzed: dhanadena nidhāna haraṇa bhayāt siddhānām etat cakra patana rūpam bhayam darśitam
translated: out of fear of having his treasure stolen by Kubera, he showed this fear in the form of a wheel falling on the siddhas.

original: tena kaścid api nāgacchati /
analyzed: tena kaścid api na āgacchati
translated: Therefore, no one comes.

original: yadi kaścid āyāti /
analyzed: yadi kaścid āyāti
translated: If someone comes,

original: sa kṣutpipāsānidrārahito jarāmaraṇavarjitaḥ kevalam evaṃ vedanām anubhavati iti /
analyzed: sa kṣudh pipāsā nidrā rahitaḥ jarā maraṇa varjitaḥ kevalam evam vedanām anubhavati iti
translated: he experiences only this pain, free from hunger, thirst, and sleep, and free from old age and death.

original: tad ājñāpaya māṃ svagṛhāya /
analyzed: tat ājñāpaya mām sva gṛhāya
translated: So order me to go home.

original: ity uktvā gataḥ /🔽tasmiṃś cirayati sa suvarṇasiddhis tasyānveṣaṇaparas tatpadapaṅktyā yāvat kiñcid
analyzed: iti uktvā gataḥ  tasmin cirayati sa suvarṇasiddhiḥ tasya anveṣaṇa paraḥ tad pada paṅktyā yāvat kiñcid
translated: Saying this, he left.🔽And while he was delaying, Suvarṇasiddhi, searching for him, followed his footprints until he came to a certain forest.

original: vanāntaram āgacchati tāvad rudhiraplāvitaśarīras tīkṣṇacakreṇa mastake bhramatā
analyzed: vana antaram āgacchati tāvat rudhira plāvita śarīraḥ tīkṣṇa cakreṇa mastake bhramatā
translated: Then he saw a man with a body drenched in blood, with a sharp wheel spinning on his head,

original: savedanaḥ kvaṇann upaviṣṭhas tiṣṭhatīti dadarśa /
analyzed: sa vedanaḥ kvaṇan upaviṣṭhaḥ tiṣṭhati iti dadarśa
translated: He saw him sitting there, making a sound with his pain.

original: tataḥ samīpavartinā bhūvā sarvārthaṃ pṛṣṭaḥbhadra / kim etat /
analyzed: tatas samīpa vartinā bhūvā sarva artham pṛṣṭaḥ bhadra kim etat
translated: Then a man nearby asked him everything: Sir, what is this?

original: sa āhavidhiniyogaḥ /🔽sa āhakathaṃ tat /
analyzed: saḥ āha vidhi niyogaḥ  saḥ āha katham tat
translated: He said: It's a ritual injunction.🔽He said: How is that?

original: kathaya kāraṇam etasya /
analyzed: kathaya kāraṇam etasya
translated: Tell me the reason for this.

original: so 'pi tena pṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi tena pṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He too was asked by him.

original: sarvaṃ cakravṛttāntam akathayat /
analyzed: sarvam cakra vṛttāntam akathayat
translated: And he told the whole story of the wheel.

original: tac chrutvāsau taṃ vigarhayann idam āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā asau tam vigarhayan idam āha bhoḥ
translated: Hearing that, he rebuked him and said this: Sir.

original: niṣiddhas tvaṃ mayānekaśo na śṛṇoṣi me vākyam /
analyzed: niṣiddhaḥ tvam mayā anekaśas na śṛṇoṣi me vākyam
translated: You are forbidden by me many times, you do not listen to my words.

original: tat kiṃ kriyate /
analyzed: tat kim kriyate
translated: So what is to be done?

original: vidyāvān api kulīno 'pi vastuto buddhirahito 'si /
analyzed: vidyāvān api kulīnaḥ pi vastutas buddhi rahitaḥ si
translated: Though you are learned and of noble family, you are actually devoid of intelligence.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: varaṃ buddhir na sā vidyā vidyāyā buddhir uttamā /
analyzed: varam buddhiḥ na sā vidyā vidyāyāḥ buddhiḥ uttamā
translated: Better is intelligence than that knowledge, knowledge is supreme for intelligence.

original: buddhihīno vinaśyanti yathā te siṃhakārakāḥ // ///
analyzed: buddhi hīnaḥ vinaśyanti yathā te siṃhakārakāḥ
translated: Those devoid of intelligence perish, just like those lion-makers.

original: cakradhara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha katham etat
translated: The wheel-bearer said: How is this?

original: suvarṇasiddhir āha
analyzed: āha
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: siṃhakārakamūrkhabrāhmaṇakathā
analyzed: siṃha kāraka mūrkha brāhmaṇa kathā
translated: The Story of the Foolish Brahmins Who Made Lions

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne catvāro brāhmaṇaputrāh paraṃ mitrabhāvam upagatā vasanti sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne catvāraḥ brāhmaṇa putrāḥ param mitra bhāvam upagatāḥ vasanti sma
translated: In a certain place, four brahmin boys lived as close friends.

original: teṣāṃ trayaḥ śāstrapāraṅgatāḥ parantu buddhirahitāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām trayaḥ śāstra pāraṅgatāḥ parantu buddhi rahitāḥ
translated: Three of them had mastered the scriptures, but lacked intelligence.

original: ekas tu buddhimān kevalaṃ śāstraparāṅmukhaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ tu buddhimān kevalam śāstra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: One, however, was intelligent, but completely turned away from the scriptures.

original: atha taiḥ kadācin mitrair mantritamko guṇo vidyāyāḥ /
analyzed: atha taiḥ kadācid mitraiḥ mantritam kaḥ guṇaḥ vidyāyāḥ
translated: Then one day those friends consulted among themselves, What is the use of learning?

original: yena deśāntaraṃ gatvā /
analyzed: yena deśa antaram gatvā
translated: By which (means) going to another country,

original: bhūpatīn paritoṣyārthopārjanaṃ na kriyate /
analyzed: bhūpatīn paritoṣya artha upārjanam na kriyate
translated: having pleased the kings, wealth is not earned.

original: tat pūrvadeśaṃ gacchāvaḥ /
analyzed: tat pūrva deśam gacchāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, let us go to the eastern country.

original: tathānuṣṭhite kiñcin mārgaṃ gatvā teṣāṃ jyeṣṭhataraḥ prāhaaho /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite kiñcid mārgam gatvā teṣām jyeṣṭhataraḥ prāha aho
translated: Having proceeded a little on the way, the oldest of them said, Oh!

original: asmākam ekaś caturtho mūḍhaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam ekaḥ caturthaḥ mūḍhaḥ
translated: One of us is a fool,

original: kevalaṃ buddhimān /
analyzed: kevalam buddhimān
translated: only intelligent,

original: na ca rājapratigraho buddhyā labhyate /
analyzed: na ca rāja pratigrahaḥ buddhyā labhyate
translated: and the acceptance of royal gifts is not obtained by intelligence,

original: vidyāṃ vinā /
analyzed: vidyām vinā
translated: without learning.

original: tan nāsmai svopārjitaṃ dāsyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat na asmai sva upārjitam dāsyāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, we will not give him our own earnings.

original: tad gacchatu gṛham /
analyzed: tat gacchatu gṛham
translated: So let him go home.

original: tato dvitīyenābhihitambhoḥ subuddhe /
analyzed: tatas dvitīyena abhihitam bhoḥ subuddhe
translated: Then the second one said, Oh Subuddhi!

original: gaccha tvaṃ svagṛhaṃ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam sva gṛham
translated: Go to your own home,

original: yatas te vidyā nāsti /
analyzed: yatas te vidyā na asti
translated: since you have no learning.

original: tatas tṛtīyenābhihitamaho /
analyzed: tatas tṛtīyena abhihitam aho
translated: Then the third one said, Oh!

original: na yujyate evaṃ kartum /
analyzed: na yujyate evam kartum
translated: It is not proper to do this,

original: yato vayaṃ bālyāt prabhṛty ekatra krīḍitāḥ /
analyzed: yatas vayam bālyāt prabhṛti ekatra krīḍitāḥ
translated: since we have been playing together since childhood.

original: tad āgacchatu mahānubhāvo 'smadupārjitavittasya samabhāgī bhaviṣyatīti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat āgacchatu mahā anubhāvaḥ smad upārjita vittasya sama bhāgī bhaviṣyati iti uktam ca
translated: Come, let him be a partner in the wealth we have acquired. And it was said:

original: kiṃ tayā kriyate lakṣmyā yā vadhūr iva kevalā /
analyzed: kim tayā kriyate lakṣmyā yā vadhūḥ iva kevalā
translated: What is the use of that Lakshmi, who is like a bride all alone,

original: yā na veśyeva sāmānyā pathikair upabhujyate // ///
analyzed: yā na veśyā iva sāmānyā pathikaiḥ upabhujyate
translated: Who is not enjoyed by travelers like a prostitute in common?

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: ayaṃ nijaḥ paro veti gaṇanā laghucetasām /
analyzed: ayam nijaḥ paraḥ vā iti gaṇanā laghu cetasām
translated: This calculation of 'he is mine, he is another's' is for those with small minds.

original: udāracaritānāṃ tu vasudhaiva kuṭumbakam // ///
analyzed: udāra caritānām tu vasudhā eva kuṭumbakam
translated: But for those of noble conduct, the earth itself is their family.

original: tad āgacchatv eṣo 'pīti /
analyzed: tat āgacchatu eṣā u pi iti
translated: Therefore, let him come too.

original: tathānuṣṭhite tair mārgāśritair aṭavyāṃ mṛtasiṃhasyāsthīni dṛṣṭāni /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite taiḥ mārga āśritaiḥ aṭavyām mṛta siṃhasya asthīni dṛṣṭāni
translated: When this was done, those who had taken to the road saw the bones of a dead lion in the forest.

original: tataś caikenābhihitaṃaho /
analyzed: tatas ca ekena abhihitam aho
translated: Then one of them said, Oh!

original: adya vidyāpratyayaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: adya vidyā pratyayaḥ kriyate
translated: Today we will test our knowledge.

original: kiñcid etat sattvaṃ mṛtaṃ tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kiñcid etat sattvam mṛtam tiṣṭhati
translated: This dead creature is lying here.

original: tad vidyāprabhāveṇa jīvanasahitaṃ kurmaḥ /
analyzed: tat vidyā prabhāveṇa jīvana sahitam kurmaḥ
translated: By the power of our knowledge, we will bring it back to life.

original: aham asthisañcayaṃ karomi /
analyzed: aham asthisañcayam karomi
translated: I will collect the bones.

original: tataś ca tenautsukyād asthisañcayaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca tena autsukyāt asthi sañcayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then out of eagerness, he collected the bones.

original: dvitīyena carmamāṃsarudhiraṃ saṃyojitam /
analyzed: dvitīyena carma māṃsa rudhiram saṃyojitam
translated: The second one joined the skin, flesh, and blood.

original: tṛtīyo 'pi yāvaj jīvanaṃ sañcārayati /
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ u pi yāvat jīvanam sañcārayati
translated: The third one infused life.

original: tāvat subuddhinā niṣiddhaḥbhoḥ tiṣṭhatu bhavān /
analyzed: tāvat subuddhinā niṣiddhaḥ bhoḥ tiṣṭhatu bhavān
translated: Just then Subuddhi stopped him, saying, Hey, wait!

original: eṣa siṃho niṣpādyate /
analyzed: eṣa siṃhaḥ niṣpādyate
translated: This lion is being created.

original: yady enaṃ sajīvaṃ kariṣyasi tataḥ sarvān api vyāpādayiṣyati /
analyzed: yadi enam sa jīvam kariṣyasi tatas sarvān api vyāpādayiṣyati
translated: If you bring him to life, he will kill all of us.

original: iti tenābhihitaḥ sa āhadhiṅ mūrkha /
analyzed: iti tena abhihitaḥ saḥ āha dhik mūrkha
translated: When he said this, the other said, Shame on you, fool!

original: nāhaṃ vidyāyā viphalatāṃ karomi /
analyzed: na aham vidyāyāḥ viphala tām karomi
translated: I do not make knowledge fruitless.

original: tatas tenābhihitaṃtarhi pratīkṣasva kṣaṇaṃ yāvad ahaṃ vṛkṣam ārohāmi /
analyzed: tatas tena abhihitam tarhi pratīkṣasva kṣaṇam yāvat aham vṛkṣam ārohāmi
translated: Then he said, In that case, wait a moment while I climb the tree.

original: tathānuṣṭhite /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite
translated: When that was done,

original: yāvat sajīvaḥ kṛtas tāvat te trayo 'pi siṃhenotthāya vyāpāditāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat sa jīvaḥ kṛtaḥ tāvat te trayaḥ siṃhena utthāya vyāpāditāḥ
translated: as soon as he was brought to life, the three of them were killed by the lion as it rose up.

original: sa ca punar vṛkṣād avatīrya gṛhaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: sa ca punar vṛkṣāt avatīrya gṛham gataḥ
translated: And he again descended from the tree and went home.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmivaraṃ buddhir na sā vidyā iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi ivaram buddhiḥ na sā vidyā iti
translated: Therefore I say: 'Knowledge is better than intelligence.'

original: ataḥ param uktaṃ sa suvarṇasiddhinā
analyzed: atas param uktam sa suvarṇasiddhinā
translated: After this, it is said, Suvarṇasiddhi

original: api śāstreṣu kuśalā lokācāravivarjitāḥ /
analyzed: api śāstreṣu kuśalāḥ loka ācāra vivarjitāḥ
translated: Even those skilled in the scriptures, who abandon worldly conduct,

original: sarve te hāsyatāṃ yānti yathā te mūrkhapaṇḍitāḥ // ///
analyzed: sarve te hāsya tām yānti yathā te mūrkha paṇḍitāḥ
translated: All of them are ridiculed, like those foolish scholars.

original: cakradhara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Cakradhara asked, How is that?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The story

original: mūrkhapaṇḍitakathā
analyzed: mūrkha paṇḍita kathā
translated: The story of the foolish scholar

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne catvāro brāhmaṇāḥ parasparaṃ mitratvam āpannā vasanti sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne catvāraḥ brāhmaṇāḥ parasparam mitra tvam āpannāḥ vasanti sma
translated: In a certain place, four Brahmins who were friends lived together.

original: bālabhāve teṣāṃ matir ajāyatabhoḥ veśāntaraṃ gatvā vidyāyā upārjanaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: bāla bhāve teṣām matiḥ ajāyata bhoḥ veśa antaram gatvā vidyāyāḥ upārjanam kriyate
translated: In their childhood, they thought, Hey, let's go to another town and acquire knowledge.

original: ath /anyasmin divase te brāhmaṇāḥ parasparaṃ niścayaṃ kṛtvā vidyopārjanārthaṃ kānyakubje gatāḥ /
analyzed: atha anyasmin divase te brāhmaṇāḥ parasparam niścayam kṛtvā vidyā upārjana artham kānyakubje gatāḥ
translated: Then on another day, those Brahmins made a mutual agreement and went to Kanyakubja to acquire knowledge.

original: tatra ca vidyāmaṭhe gatvā paṭhanti /
analyzed: tatra ca vidyā maṭhe gatvā paṭhanti
translated: And having gone to the academy of learning there, they studied.

original: evaṃ dvādaśābdāni yāvad ekacittatayā paṭhitvā /
analyzed: evam dvādaśa abdāni yāvat ekacitta tayā paṭhitvā
translated: Thus, having studied with single-pointed focus for twelve years,

original: vidyākuśalās te sarve sañjātāḥ /
analyzed: vidyā kuśalāḥ te sarve sañjātāḥ
translated: they all became skilled in the Vedas.

original: tatas taiś caturbhir militvoktamvayaṃ sarvavidyāpāraṅgatāḥ /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ caturbhiḥ militvā uktam vayam
translated: Then the four of them gathered and said, We have mastered all the Vedas.

original: tadupādhyāyam utkalāpayitvā svadeśaṃ gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tad upādhyāyam utkalāpayitvā sva deśam gacchāmaḥ
translated: Let us dismiss our teacher Ukala and go to our own country.

original: tathaivānuṣṭhīyatām ity uktvā brāhmaṇāḥ upādhyāyam ukalāpayitvā anujñāṃ labdhvā pustakāni nītvā pracalitāḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva anuṣṭhīyatām iti uktvā brāhmaṇāḥ upādhyāyam anujñām labdhvā pustakāni nītvā pracalitāḥ
translated: Having said, Let it be done in that way, the Brahmins dismissed their teacher Ukala, obtained permission, took their books, and set out.

original: yāvat kiñcinmārgaṃ yānti /
analyzed: yāvat kiñcid mārgam yānti
translated: As they were going along the road a little,

original: tāvad dvau panthānau samāyātau upaviṣṭāḥ sarve /
analyzed: tāvat dvau panthānau samāyātau upaviṣṭāḥ sarve
translated: two paths came together, and they all sat down.

original: tatraikaḥ provācakena mārgeṇa gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ekaḥ provācakena mārgeṇa gacchāmaḥ
translated: There one said, By which path shall we go?

original: etasmin samaye tasmin pattane kaścit vaṇikputro mṛtaḥ /
analyzed: etasmin samaye tasmin pattane kaścid vaṇij putraḥ mṛtaḥ
translated: At that time, in that city, the son of a merchant died.

original: tasya dāhāya mahājano gato 'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya dāhāya mahā janaḥ gataḥ bhūt
translated: A large crowd of people went to burn it.

original: tataś catūrṇāṃ madhyād ekena pustakam avalokitammahājano yena gataḥ sa panthaḥ iti /
analyzed: tatas catūrṇām madhyāt ekena pustakam avalokitam mahā janaḥ yena gataḥ sa panthaḥ iti
translated: Then one of the four looked at a book and said, The path by which the large crowd went is this.

original: tan mahājanamārgeṇa gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat mahā janamārgeṇa gacchāmaḥ
translated: Let us go by that path of the large crowd.

original: atha te paṇḍitā yāvan mahājanam elāpakena saha yānti /
analyzed: atha te paṇḍitāḥ yāvat mahājanam elāpakena saha yānti
translated: Then those wise men went as far as the large crowd was going with the donkey.

original: tāvad rāsabhaḥ kaścit tatra śmaśāne dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat rāsabhaḥ kaścid tatra śmaśāne dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: In the meantime, a certain ass was seen in that cremation ground.

original: atha dvitīyena pustakam udghāṭyāvalokitam /
analyzed: atha dvitīyena pustakam udghāṭya avalokitam
translated: Then the second one opened the book and looked at it.

original: utsave vyasane prāpte durbhikṣe śatrusaṅkaṭe /
analyzed: utsave vyasane prāpte durbhikṣe śatru saṅkaṭe
translated: When there is a festival, a calamity, a famine, a danger from enemies,

original: rājadvāre śmaśāne ca yas tiṣṭhati sa bāndhavaḥ // ///
analyzed: rājadvāre śmaśāne ca yaḥ tiṣṭhati sa bāndhavaḥ
translated: at the king's gate, and in the cremation ground, he who stands is a relative.

original: tad aho / ayam asmadīyo bāndhavaḥ /
analyzed: tat aho ayam asmadīyaḥ bāndhavaḥ
translated: Oh! This is our relative.

original: tataḥ kaścit tasya grīvāyāṃ lagati /
analyzed: tatas kaścid tasya grīvāyām lagati
translated: Then someone clung to its neck.

original: kaścit pādau prakṣālayati /
analyzed: kaścid pādau prakṣālayati
translated: Someone washed its feet.

original: atha yāvat te paṇḍitāh diśām avalokanaṃ kurvanti tāvat kaścid duṣṭo dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha yāvat te paṇḍitāḥ diśām avalokanam kurvanti tāvat kaścid duṣṭaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, as those wise men were looking in the directions, they saw someone wicked.

original: taiś coktametat kim /
analyzed: taiḥ ca uktam etat kim
translated: And they said, What is this?

original: tāvat tṛtīyena pustakam udghāṭyoktamdharmasya tvaritā gatiḥ /
analyzed: tāvat tṛtīyena pustakam udghāṭya uktam dharmasya tvaritā gatiḥ
translated: Then the third one opened the book and said, The course of Dharma is swift.

original: tan nūnam eṣa dharmas tāvat /
analyzed: tat nūnam eṣa dharmaḥ tāvat
translated: So this is surely Dharma for now.

original: caturthenoktamiṣṭaṃ dharmeṇa yojayet /
analyzed: caturthena uktam iṣṭam dharmeṇa yojayet
translated: With the fourth, he should apply the desired dharma.

original: atha taiś ca rāsabha uṣṭragrīvāyāṃ baddhaḥ /
analyzed: atha taiḥ ca rāsabhaḥ uṣṭra grīvāyām baddhaḥ
translated: Then they tied a donkey to the neck of a camel.

original: tat tu kenacit tatsvāmino rajakasyāgre kathitam /
analyzed: tat tu kenacid tad svāminaḥ rajakasya agre kathitam
translated: But that was reported to the owner of those [animals], the washerman, by someone.

original: yāvad rajakas teṣāṃ mūrkhapaṇḍitānāṃ prahārakaraṇāya samāyātas tāvat te praṇaṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat rajakaḥ teṣām mūrkha paṇḍitānām prahāra karaṇāya samāyātaḥ tāvat te praṇaṣṭāḥ
translated: While the washerman came to strike those foolish and wise [men], they disappeared.

original: tato tāvad agre kiñcit stokaṃ mārgaṃ yānti tāvat kācin nadī samāsāditā /
analyzed: tatas tāvat agre kiñcid stokam mārgam yānti tāvat kācid nadī samāsāditā
translated: Then they went a little way in front, and then they reached a river.

original: tasya jalamadhye palāśapatram āyātaṃ dṛṣṭvā paṇḍitenaikenoktamāgamiṣyati yat patraṃ tas asmāṃs tārayiṣyati /
analyzed: tasya jala madhye palāśa patram āyātam dṛṣṭvā paṇḍitena ekena uktam āgamiṣyati yat patram asmān tārayiṣyati
translated: Seeing a palāśa leaf in the middle of the water, one wise [man] said, Whatever leaf comes, it will save us.

original: etat kathayitvā tatpatrasyopari patito yāvan nadyā nīyate tāvat taṃ nīyamānam alokyānyena paṇḍitena keśāntaṃ gṛhītvoktam
analyzed: etat kathayitvā tad patrasya upari patitaḥ yāvat nadyāḥ nīyate tāvat tam nīyamānam a lokya anyena paṇḍitena keśāntam gṛhītvā uktam
translated: Having said this, he fell on top of that leaf, and while being carried by the river, he was seen by another wise [man] who grabbed the end of his hair and said:

original: sarvanāśe samutpanne ardhaṃ tyajati paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: sarva nāśe samutpanne ardham tyajati paṇḍitaḥ
translated: When total destruction arises, the wise abandon half.

original: ardhena kurute kāryaṃ sarvanāśo hi duḥsahaḥ // ///
analyzed: ardhena kurute kāryam sarva nāśaḥ hi duḥsahaḥ
translated: With half, he accomplishes his purpose, for total destruction is unbearable.

original: atha taiś ca paścāt gatvā kaścit grāma āsāditaḥ /
analyzed: atha taiḥ ca paścāt gatvā kaścid grāmaḥ āsāditaḥ
translated: Then they went behind and reached a certain village.

original: te'pi grāmīṇair nimantritaḥ pṛthag gṛheṣu nītāḥ /
analyzed: te api grāmīṇaiḥ nimantritaḥ pṛthak gṛheṣu nītāḥ
translated: They too were invited by the villagers and taken to different houses.

original: tata ekasya sūtrikā ghṛtamaṇḍasaṃyutā bhojane dattā /
analyzed: tatas ekasya sūtrikā ghṛtamaṇḍa saṃyutā bhojane dattā
translated: Then to one, a small measure of ghee was given in the food.

original: tato vicintya paṇḍitenoktaṃ yatdīrghasūtrī vinaśyati iti /
analyzed: tatas vicintya paṇḍitena uktam yat dīrghasūtrī vinaśyati iti
translated: Then the wise one thought and said, The procrastinator perishes.

original: evam uktvā bhojanaṃ parityajya gataḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā bhojanam parityajya gataḥ
translated: Having said this, he abandoned the meal and left.

original: tathā dvitīyasya bhaṇḍakā dattāh /
analyzed: tathā dvitīyasya
translated: Similarly, a basket was given to the second.

original: tenāyuktaṃativistāravistīrṇaṃ tad bhaven na cirāyuṣam /
analyzed: tena ayuktam ati vistāra vistīrṇam tat bhavet na cira āyuṣam
translated: He said, That will become too extensive and not long-lived.

original: sa bhojanaṃ tyaktvā gataḥ /
analyzed: sa bhojanam tyaktvā gataḥ
translated: He abandoned the meal and left.

original: atha tṛtīyasya vāṭikā bhojane dattā /
analyzed: atha tṛtīyasya vāṭikā bhojane dattā
translated: Then a garden was given to the third in the meal.

original: tatrāpi tena paṇḍitenoktamchidreṣv anarthā bahulībhavanti /
analyzed: tatra api tena paṇḍitena uktam chidreṣu anarthāḥ bahulībhavanti
translated: There too, the wise one said, Misfortunes increase in holes.

original: evaṃ te trayo 'pi paṇḍitāḥ kṣutkṣāmakaṇṭhāloke hāsyamānās tataḥ sthānāt svadeśaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: evam te trayaḥ pi paṇḍitāḥ kṣudh kṣāma kaṇṭha āloke hāsyamānāḥ tatas sthānāt sva deśam gatāḥ
translated: Thus, those three wise ones, their throats emaciated with hunger, laughed and left that place for their own country.

original: atha suvarṇasiddhir āhayat tvaṃ lokavyavahāram ajānan mayā vāryamāṇo 'pi na sthitaḥ tata īdṛśīm avasthātum upagataḥ /
analyzed: atha suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha yat tvam loka vyavahāram a jānan mayā vāryamāṇaḥ na sthitaḥ tatas īdṛśīm avasthātum upagataḥ
translated: Then Suvarṇasiddhi said, Since you, not knowing worldly convention, did not stay even though warned by me, you have come to this state.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiapi śāstreṣu kuśalāḥ iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi api śāstreṣu kuśalāḥ iti
translated: Therefore I say, even those skilled in the scriptures...

original: tac chrutvā cakradhara āhaaho akāraṇam etat / yato hi
analyzed: tat śrutvā cakradharaḥ āha aho akāraṇam etat yatas hi
translated: Hearing this, Cakradhara said, Oh, this is groundless. For

original: subuddhayo vinaśyanti duṣṭadaivena nāśitāḥ /
analyzed: su buddhayaḥ vinaśyanti duṣṭa daivena nāśitāḥ
translated: The very wise perish, destroyed by bad fate,

original: svalpadhīr api tasmiṃs tu kule nandati santatam // ///
analyzed: su alpa dhīḥ api tasmin tu kule nandati santatam
translated: But even the dull-witted are constantly happy in that family.

original: uktaṃ ca
analyzed: uktam ca
translated: And it is said:

original: arakṣitaṃ tiṣṭhati daivarakṣitaṃ surakṣitaṃ daivahataṃ vinaśyati /
analyzed: a rakṣitam tiṣṭhati daiva rakṣitam su rakṣitam daiva hatam vinaśyati
translated: What is not protected remains protected by fate, what is well protected by fate perishes.

original: jīvaty anātho 'pi vane visarjitaḥ kṛtaprayatno 'pi gṛhe na jīvati // ///
analyzed: jīvati anāthaḥ pi vane visarjitaḥ kṛta prayatnaḥ pi gṛhe na jīvati
translated: Even a helpless one lives in the forest, abandoned, but one who makes effort does not live at home.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: śatabuddhiḥ śirastho 'yaṃ lambate ca sahasradhīḥ /
analyzed: śata buddhiḥ śira sthaḥ yam lambate ca sahasra dhīḥ
translated: This hundred-wit is on my head, and the thousand-wit hangs down.

original: ekabuddhir ahaṃ bhadre krīḍāmi vimale jale // ///
analyzed: ekabuddhiḥ aham bhadre krīḍāmi vimale jale
translated: I, the single-wit, O good lady, play in the clear water.

original: suvarṇasiddhir āhakatham etat /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha katham etat
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said, How is this?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: matsyamaṇḍūkakathā
analyzed: matsya maṇḍūka kathā
translated: The Story of the Fish and the Frog

original: kasmiṃścij jalāśaye śatabuddhiḥ sahasrabuddhiś ca dvau matsyau nivasataḥ sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid jalāśaye śatabuddhiḥ sahasrabuddhiḥ ca dvau matsyau nivasataḥ sma
translated: In a certain body of water, two fish named Shatabuddhi and Sahasrabuddhi were living.

original: atha tayor ekabuddhir nāma maṇḍūko mitratāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: atha tayoḥ ekabuddhiḥ nāma maṇḍūkaḥ mitra tām gataḥ
translated: Then a frog named Ekabuddhi became their friend.

original: evaṃ te trayo 'pi jalatīre velāyāṃ subhāṣitagoṣṭhīsukham anubhūya /
analyzed: evam te trayaḥ jala tīre velāyām subhāṣita goṣṭhī sukham anubhūya
translated: Thus, the three of them experienced the pleasure of a gathering of good stories on the shore of the water.

original: bhūyo 'pi salilaṃ praviśanti /
analyzed: bhūyas u pi salilam praviśanti
translated: And again, they enter the water.

original: atha kadācit teṣāṃ goṣṭhīgatānāṃ tasmin jalāśaye samāyātāḥ /
analyzed: atha kadācid teṣām goṣṭhī gatānām tasmin jalāśaye samāyātāḥ
translated: Then one day, as they were gathered together, they came to that pond.

original: tataḥ salilāśayaṃ dṛṣṭvā mithaḥ procuḥaho bahumatsyo 'yaṃ hrado dṛśyate /
analyzed: tatas salilāśayam dṛṣṭvā mithas procuḥ aho bahu matsyaḥ yam hradaḥ dṛśyate
translated: Seeing the pond, they said to each other, Oh, this pond is seen to have many fish.

original: svalpasalilaś ca/
analyzed: su alpa salilaḥ ca
translated: And it has little water.

original: tat prabhāte'trāgamiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat prabhātā itra āgamiṣyāmaḥ
translated: So we will come here in the morning.

original: evam uktvā svagṛhaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā sva gṛham gatāḥ
translated: Having said this, they went to their own homes.

original: matsyāś ca viṣaṇṇavadanā mitho mantraṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: matsyāḥ ca viṣaṇṇa vadanāḥ mithas mantram cakruḥ
translated: And the fish, with dejected faces, held a consultation among themselves.

original: tato maṇḍūka āhabhoḥ śatabuddhe /
analyzed: tatas maṇḍūkaḥ āha bhoḥ śatabuddhe
translated: Then the frog said, Oh Shatabuddhi,

original: śrutaṃ dhīvaroktaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: śrutam dhīvara uktam bhavatā
translated: have you heard what the fisherman said?

original: tat kim atra yujyate kartum /
analyzed: tat kim atra yujyate kartum
translated: So what should be done here?

original: palāyanam avaṣṭambho vā /
analyzed: palāyanam avaṣṭambhaḥ vā
translated: To flee or to stand firm?

original: yat kartuṃ yuktaṃ bhavati tad ādiśyatām adya /
analyzed: yat kartum yuktam bhavati tat ādiśyatām adya
translated: Tell us what should be done today.

original: tac chrutvā sahasrabuddhiḥ prahasya āhabhoḥ mitra /
analyzed: tat śrutvā sahasrabuddhiḥ prahasya āha bhoḥ mitra
translated: Hearing that, Sahasrabuddhi laughed and said, Oh friend,

original: mā bhaiṣīḥ /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣīḥ
translated: do not be afraid.

original: tayoḥ vacanaśravaṇamātrād eva bhayaṃ na kāryam /
analyzed: tayoḥ vacana śravaṇa mātrāt eva bhayam na kāryam
translated: Fear should not be entertained merely by hearing their words.

original: na bhetavyam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: na bhetavyam uktam ca
translated: And it is said:

original: sarpāṇāṃ ca khalānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ duṣṭacetasām /🔽abhiprāyā na sidhyanti tenedaṃ vartate jagat // ///
analyzed: sarpāṇām ca khalānām ca sarveṣām duṣṭa cetasām  abhiprāyāḥ na sidhyanti tena idam vartate jagat
translated: The intentions of all snakes and rogues with evil minds🔽are not fulfilled, and therefore this world continues to exist.

original: tāvat teṣām āgamanam api na sampatsyate /
analyzed: tāvat teṣām āgamanam api na sampatsyate
translated: As long as they do not come here,

original: bhaviṣyati tarhi tvāṃ buddhiprabhāveṇātmasahitaṃ rakṣayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati tarhi tvām buddhi prabhāveṇa ātma sahitam rakṣayiṣyāmi
translated: Then I will protect you and myself with the power of intelligence.

original: yato 'nekāṃsalilacaryām ahaṃ jānāmi /
analyzed: yatas na ikāṃsalila caryām aham jānāmi
translated: Because I know many water-related practices.

original: tad ākarṇya śatabuddhir āhabhoḥ yuktam uktaṃ bhavatā /
analyzed: tat ākarṇya śatabuddhiḥ āha bhoḥ yuktam uktam bhavatā
translated: Hearing that, Shatabuddhi said: Sir, you have spoken rightly.

original: sahasrabuddhir eva bhavān /
analyzed: sahasra buddhiḥ eva bhavān
translated: You alone are the one with a thousand buddhis.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate /
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: buddher buddhimatāṃ loke nāsty agamyaṃ hi kiñcana /
analyzed: buddheḥ buddhimatām loke na asti agamyam hi kiñcana
translated: In the world, there is nothing that is inaccessible to the intelligence of the intelligent.

original: buddhyā yato hatā nandāś cāṇakyenāsipāṇayaḥ // ///
analyzed: buddhyā yatas hatāḥ nandāḥ cāṇakyena asi pāṇayaḥ
translated: For, by intelligence, the axes of Chanakya killed the Nandas.

original: tathā
analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly:

original: na yatrāsti gatir vāyo raśmīnāṃ ca vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: na yatra asti gatiḥ vāyoḥ raśmīnām ca vivasvataḥ
translated: Where there is no passage for the wind or the rays of the sun,

original: tatrāpi praviśaty āśu buddhir buddhimatāṃ sadā // ///
analyzed: tatra api praviśati āśu buddhiḥ buddhimatām sadā
translated: Even there, the intelligence of the intelligent always enters quickly.

original: tato vacanaśravaṇamātrād api pitṛparyāyāgataṃ janmasthānaṃ tyaktuṃ na śakyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tatas vacana śravaṇa mātrāt api pitṛparyāya āgatam janmasthānam tyaktum na śakyate uktam ca
translated: Therefore, even by merely hearing the words, it is not possible to abandon the birthplace obtained from one's father. And it is said:

original: na yat svarge'pi saukhyaṃ syād divyasparśena śobhane /
analyzed: na yat svarge pi saukhyam syāt divya sparśena śobhane
translated: O beautiful one, that happiness which is not in heaven due to divine touch,

original: kusthāne'pi bhavet puṃsāṃ janmano yatra sambhavaḥ // ///
analyzed: kusthāne api bhavet puṃsām janmanaḥ yatra sambhavaḥ
translated: That will be for men even in a bad place, where birth is possible.

original: tan na kadācid api gantavyam /
analyzed: tat na kadācid api gantavyam
translated: Therefore, it should never be gone to.

original: ahaṃ tvāṃ buddhiprabhāveṇa rakṣayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham tvām buddhi prabhāveṇa rakṣayiṣyāmi
translated: I will protect you with the power of intelligence.

original: maṇḍūka āhabhadrau /
analyzed: maṇḍūkaḥ āhabhadrau
translated: The frog said, Gentlemen,

original: mama tāvad ekaiva buddhiḥ palāyanaparā /
analyzed: mama tāvat ekā eva buddhiḥ palāyana parā
translated: I have only one thought, which is to flee.

original: tad aham anyajalāśayam adyaiva sabhāryo yāsyāmi /
analyzed: tat aham anya jalāśayam adyā eva sa bhāryaḥ yāsyāmi
translated: So I and my wife will go to another pond today itself.

original: evam uktvā sa maṇḍūko rātrāv evānyajalāśayaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā sa maṇḍūkaḥ rātrau eva anya jalāśayam gataḥ
translated: Having said this, the frog went to another pond that very night.

original: dhīvarair api prabhāte āgatya /
analyzed: dhīvaraiḥ api prabhāte āgatya
translated: And the fishermen came in the morning and

original: jaghanyamadhyamottamajalacarāḥ matsyakūrmamaṇḍūkakarkaṭādayo gṛhītāḥ /
analyzed: jaghanya madhyama uttama jalacarāḥ matsya kūrma maṇḍūka karkaṭa ādayaḥ gṛhītāḥ
translated: caught the inferior, medium, and superior aquatic creatures such as fish, turtles, frogs, and crabs.

original: tāv api śatabuddhisahasrabuddhī sabhāryau palāyamānau ciram ātmānaṃ gativiśeṣavijñānaiḥ kuṭilacāreṇa rakṣantau jāle nipatitau /
analyzed: tau api śatabuddhi sahasrabuddhī sa bhāryau palāyamānau ciram ātmānam gati viśeṣa vijñānaiḥ kuṭila cāreṇa rakṣantau jāle nipatitau
translated: And those two, Śatabuddhi and Sahasrabuddhi, fleeing with their wives, protected themselves for a long time by their knowledge of special movements and by their crooked behavior, but fell into the net.

original: vyāpāditau ca /
analyzed: vyāpāditau ca
translated: And were killed.

original: athāparāhnasamaye prahṛṣṭās te dhīvarāḥ svagṛhaṃ prati prasthitāḥ /
analyzed: atha aparāhna samaye prahṛṣṭāḥ te dhīvarāḥ sva gṛham prati prasthitāḥ
translated: Then in the afternoon, those happy fishermen set out for their homes.

original: gurutvāc caikena śatabuddhiḥ skandhe kṛtaḥ sahasrabuddhiḥ pralambamāno nīyate /🔽tataś ca vāpīkaṇṭhopagatena maṇḍūkena tau tathā nīyamānau dṛṣṭvā abhihitā svapatnīpriye /
analyzed: guru tvāt ca ekena śata buddhiḥ skandhe kṛtaḥ sahasra buddhiḥ pralambamānaḥ nīyate  tatas ca vāpī kaṇṭha upagatena maṇḍūkena tau tathā nīyamānau dṛṣṭvā abhihitā sva patnī priye
translated: And because of their weight, one carried Śatabuddhi on his shoulder, while Sahasrabuddhi was dragged along.

original: paśya paśya
analyzed: paśya paśya
translated: Then a frog that had come to the edge of the pond saw them being carried in that way and said to his wife, My dear, look, look!

original: śatabuddhiḥ śiraḥstho 'yaṃ lambate ca sahasradhīḥ /
analyzed: śata buddhiḥ śiraḥ sthaḥ yam lambate ca sahasra dhīḥ
translated: This one with a hundred intellects hangs on his head, and this one with a thousand intellects hangs down.

original: ekabuddhir ahaṃ bhadre krīḍāmi vimale jale // ///
analyzed: ekabuddhiḥ aham bhadre krīḍāmi vimale jale
translated: I, O good lady, with a single intellect, am playing in the clear water.

original: ataś ca varaṃ buddhir na sā vidyā yad bhavatoktaṃ tatreyaṃ me matir yat na ekāntena buddhir api pramāṇam /
analyzed: atas ca varam buddhiḥ na sā vidyā yat bhavatā uktam tatra iyam me matiḥ yat na ekāntena buddhiḥ api pramāṇam
translated: Therefore, I think that intellect is not the only means of knowledge, as you have said.

original: suvarṇasiddhiḥ prāhayadyapy etad asti /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ prāha yadi api etat asti
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said: Although this is so,

original: tathāpi mitravacanaṃ na laṅghanīyam /
analyzed: tathā api mitra vacanam na laṅghanīyam
translated: still the words of a friend should not be transgressed.

original: paraṃ kiṃ kriyate /
analyzed: param kim kriyate
translated: What else can be done?

original: nivārito 'pi mayā na sthito 'si /
analyzed: nivāritaḥ pi mayā na sthitaḥ si
translated: Though restrained by me, you did not stay.

original: atilaulyāt vidyāhaṅkārāc ca /
analyzed: ati laulyāt vidyā ahaṅkārāt ca
translated: Out of excessive greed and pride in your knowledge.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: sādhu mātula gītena mayā prokto 'pi na sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sādhu mātula gītena mayā na sthitaḥ
translated: Though spoken to by me with a good song, you did not stay.

original: apūrvo 'yaṃ maṇir baddhaḥ samprāptaṃ gītalakṣaṇam // ///
analyzed: apūrvaḥ yam maṇiḥ baddhaḥ samprāptam gīta lakṣaṇam
translated: This unprecedented jewel is bound, the characteristics of the song have been attained.

original: cakradhara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Cakradhara asked: How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: rāsabhaśṛgālakathā
analyzed: rāsabha śṛgāla kathā
translated: The Story of the Donkey and the Jackal

original: kasmiṃścd adhiṣṭhāne uddhato nāma gardabhaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmin cd adhiṣṭhāne uddhataḥ nāma gardabhaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain town, there lived a donkey named Uddhata.

original: sa sadaiva rajakagṛhe bhārodvahanaṃ kṛtvā rātrau svecchayā paryaṭati /
analyzed: sa sadā eva rajaka gṛhe bhāra udvahanam kṛtvā rātrau sva icchayā paryaṭati
translated: He always carried loads in the washerman's house and roamed freely at night.

original: tataḥ pratyūṣe bandhanabhayāt svayam eva rajakagṛham āyāti /
analyzed: tatas pratyūṣe bandhana bhayāt svayam eva rajaka gṛham āyāti
translated: Then at dawn, out of fear of being bound, he himself comes to the washerman's house.

original: rajako 'pi tatas taṃ bandhanena niyunakti /
analyzed: rajakaḥ pi tatas tam bandhanena niyunakti
translated: And the washerman, from there, binds him with ropes.

original: atha tasya rātrau kṣetrāṇi paryaṭataḥ kadācic chṛgālena saha maitrī sañjātā sa ca pīvaratvād vṛttibhaṅgaṃ kṛtvā karkaṭikākṣetre śṛgālasahitaḥ 🔽praviśati /
analyzed: atha tasya rātrau kṣetrāṇi paryaṭataḥ kadācid śṛgālena saha maitrī sañjātā sa ca pīvara tvāt vṛtti bhaṅgam kṛtvā karkaṭikā kṣetre śṛgāla sahitaḥ  praviśati
translated: Then, as he was wandering in the fields at night, he once became friends with a jackal. And he, having become fat, broke his livelihood and entered the eggplant field with the jackal.

original: evaṃ tau yadṛcchayā cirbhaṭikābhakṣaṇaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: evam tau yadṛcchayā cirbhaṭikā bhakṣaṇam kṛtvā
translated: Thus, they ate the eggplant at will and

original: pratyahaṃ pratyūṣe svasthānaṃ vrajataḥ /
analyzed: pratyaham pratyūṣe sva sthānam vrajataḥ
translated: went to their own place every morning.

original: atha kadācit tena madoddhatena rāsabhena kṣetramadhyasthitena śṛgāo 'bhihitaḥbhoḥ bhaginīsūta /
analyzed: atha kadācid tena mada uddhatena rāsabhena kṣetra madhya sthitena śṛgāḥ bhihitaḥ bhoḥ bhaginī sūta
translated: Then one day, that intoxicated donkey, standing in the middle of the field, said to the jackal, Hey, brother's son.

original: paśya paśya /
analyzed: paśya paśya
translated: Look, look.

original: atīva nirmalā rajanī /
analyzed: atīva nirmalā rajanī
translated: The night is extremely clear.

original: tad ahaṃ gītaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat aham gītam kariṣyāmi
translated: So I will sing.

original: tat kathaya katamena rāgeṇa karomi /
analyzed: tat kathaya katamena rāgeṇa karomi
translated: Tell me, with what raga should I sing?

original: sa āhamāma / kim anena vṛthānarthapracālanena /
analyzed: saḥ āhamāma kim anena vṛthā anartha pracālanena
translated: He said, What's the use of this useless chatter?

original: yataś caurakarmapravṛttāv āvām /
analyzed: yatas caura karma pravṛttau āvām
translated: For we are engaged in thievery.

original: nibhṛtaiś ca caurajārair atra sthātavyam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: nibhṛtaiḥ ca caura jāraiḥ atra sthātavyam uktam ca
translated: And we should stay here with stealthy thieves. And it is said:

original: kāṃsī vivarjayec cauryaṃ nidrāluś cet sa puṃścalīm /
analyzed: kāṃsī vivarjayet cauryam nidrāluḥ ced sa puṃścalīm
translated: If you are sleepy, avoid a wanton woman.

original: jihvālaulyaṃ ca rujākrānto jīvitaṃ yo 'tra vāñchati // ///
analyzed: jihvā laulyam ca rujā ākrāntaḥ jīvitam vāñchati
translated: If you desire life here, afflicted by pain, avoid gluttony of the tongue.

original: aparaṃ tvadīyaṃ gītaṃ na madhurasvaraṃ /
analyzed: aparam tvadīyam gītam na madhura svaram
translated: Moreover, your singing is not melodious.

original: śaṅkhaśabdānukāraṃ dūrād api śrūyate /
analyzed: śaṅkha śabda anukāram dūrāt api śrūyate
translated: It sounds like the blaring of a conch shell, even from a distance.

original: tad atra kṣetre rakṣāpuruṣāḥ susuptāḥ santi /
analyzed: tat atra kṣetre rakṣā puruṣāḥ su suptāḥ santi
translated: Here, the guards are sleeping soundly.

original: te utthāya vadhaṃ bandhanaṃ vā kariṣyanti /
analyzed: te utthāya vadham bandhanam vā kariṣyanti
translated: They will rise up and do you harm, or imprison you.

original: tad bhakṣaya tāvad amṛtamayīś carbhaṭīḥ /
analyzed: tat bhakṣaya tāvat amṛta mayīḥ carbhaṭīḥ
translated: So eat these nectar-filled cakes first.

original: mā tvam atra gītavyāpāraparo bhava /
analyzed: mā tvam atra gīta vyāpāra paraḥ bhava
translated: Don't be engrossed in singing here.

original: tac chrutvā rābhasa āhabhoḥ vanāśrayatvāt tvaṃ gītarasaṃ na vetsi /
analyzed: tat śrutvā rābhasaḥ āha bhoḥ vana āśraya tvāt tvam gīta rasam na vetsi
translated: Hearing this, the donkey said, Hey, because you live in the forest, you don't know the taste of singing.

original: tenaitad bravīṣi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tena etat bravīṣi uktam ca
translated: Therefore you say this. And it is said:

original: śarajjyotsnāhate dūraṃ tamasi priyasannidhau /
analyzed: śarad jyotsnā hate dūram tamasi priya sannidhau
