translated: In the darkness pierced by the autumn moonlight, in the presence of a beloved,

original: dhanyānāṃ viśati śrotre gītajhaṅkārajā sudhā // ///
analyzed: dhanyānām viśati śrotre gīta jhaṅkāra jā sudhā
translated: The nectar born from the tinkling of singing enters the ears of the fortunate ones.

original: śṛgāla āhamāma / asty etat /🔽paraṃ na vetsi tvaṃ gītam /
analyzed: śṛgālaḥ āhamāma asti etat  param na vetsi tvam gītam
translated: The jackal said, Yes, that is so.🔽But you don't know singing.

original: kevalam unnadasi /
analyzed: kevalam unnadasi
translated: You just bray.

original: tat kiṃ tena svārthabhraṃśakena /
analyzed: tat kim tena sva artha bhraṃśakena
translated: So what's the use of that, which causes you to lose your own purpose?

original: rāsabha āhadhig dhiṅ mūrkha /
analyzed: rāsabhaḥ āha dhik dhik mūrkha
translated: The donkey said, Shame on you, fool!

original: kim ahaṃ na jānāsi gītam /
analyzed: kim aham na jānāsi gītam
translated: Do you not know the song?

original: tad yathā tasya bhedān śṛṇu
analyzed: tat yathā tasya bhedān śṛṇu
translated: Listen to its divisions as follows:

original: sapta svarās trayo grāmā mūrcchatāś caikatriṃśatiḥ /
analyzed: sapta svarāḥ trayaḥ grāmāḥ mūrcchatāḥ ca ekatriṃśatiḥ
translated: Seven notes, three scales, thirty-one modulations,

original: tānās tv ekonapaūcāśat tisro mātrā layās trayaḥ // ///
analyzed: tānāḥ tu ekonapaścāśat tisraḥ mātrāḥ layāḥ trayaḥ
translated: Ninety-nine tānas, three mātrās, three tālas,

original: sthānatrayaṃ yatīnāṃ ca ṣaḍasyāni rasā nava /
analyzed: sthāna trayam yatīnām ca ṣaḍasyāni rasāḥ nava
translated: Three places, six meters, nine rasas,

original: rāgā ṣaṭtriṃśatir bhāvāś catvāriṃśat tataḥ smṛtāḥ // ///
analyzed: rāgāḥ ṣaṭtriṃśatiḥ bhāvāḥ catvāriṃśat tatas smṛtāḥ
translated: Thirty-six rāgas, forty bhāvas are remembered,

original: pañcāśītyadhikaṃ hy etad gītāṅgānāṃ śataṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: pañcāśīti adhikam hi etat gīta aṅgānām śatam smṛtam
translated: This is known as one hundred and eighty-five parts of singing,

original: svayam eva purā proktaṃ bharatena śruteḥ param // ///
analyzed: svayam eva purā proktam bharatena śruteḥ param
translated: Proclaimed by Bharata himself in ancient times, beyond the Vedas.

original: nānyad gītāt priyaṃ loke devānām api dṛśyate /
analyzed: na anyat gītāt priyam loke devānām api dṛśyate
translated: Nothing else is seen to be dearer to the gods in the world than singing.

original: śuṣkasnāyusvarāhlādāt tryakṣaṃ jagrāha rāvaṇaḥ // ///
analyzed: śuṣka snāyu svara āhlādāt tryakṣam jagrāha rāvaṇaḥ
translated: Ravana seized the three-eyed Shiva due to the delight of the dry sinew-like notes.

original: tat kathaṃ bhaginīsuta mām anabhijñaṃ vadan nivārayati /
analyzed: tat katham bhaginī suta mām anabhijñam vadan nivārayati
translated: How then, O nephew of my sister, do you speak to me, who am ignorant, and try to dissuade me?

original: śṛgāla āhamāma /
analyzed: śṛgāle āhamāma
translated: The jackal said: Listen.

original: yady evaṃ yāvad vṛtter dvārasthitaḥ kṣetrapālam avalokayāmi /
analyzed: yadi evam yāvat vṛtteḥ dvāra sthitaḥ kṣetrapālam avalokayāmi
translated: If so, I will look at the field protector who is standing at the door of the house while you sing as you please.

original: tvaṃ punaḥ svecchayā gītaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tvam punar sva icchayā gītam kuru
translated: You, on the other hand, sing as you wish.

original: tathānuṣṭhite rāsabharaṭanam ākarṇya kṣetrapaḥ krodhāt dantān dharṣayan pradhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite rāsabha raṭanam ākarṇya kṣetrapaḥ krodhāt dantān dharṣayan pradhāvitaḥ
translated: When this was done, the field protector heard the donkey braying, and out of anger he ran, gnashing his teeth.

original: yāvad rāsabho dṛṣṭas tāval laguḍaprahārais tathā hato /
analyzed: yāvat rāsabhaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ tāvat laguḍa prahāraiḥ tathā hataḥ
translated: When he saw the donkey, he struck it so hard with blows from his club

original: yathā pratāḍito bhūpṛṣṭhe patitaḥ /
analyzed: yathā pratāḍitaḥ bhū pṛṣṭhe patitaḥ
translated: that it fell to the ground, beaten.

original: tataś ca sacchidram ulūkhalaṃ tasya gale baddhvā kṣetrapālaḥ prasuptaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca sa chidram ulūkhalam tasya gale baddhvā kṣetrapālaḥ prasuptaḥ
translated: Then the field protector fell asleep, having tied the hollow mortar around its neck.

original: rāsabho 'pi svajātisvabhāvād gatavedanaḥ kṣaṇenābhyutthitaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: rāsabhaḥ pi sva jāti svabhāvāt gata vedanaḥ kṣaṇena abhyutthitaḥ uktam ca
translated: And the donkey, by the nature of its own kind, recovered from the pain in an instant and got up. And it is said:

original: sārameyasya cāśvasya rāsabhasya viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: sārameyasya ca aśvasya rāsabhasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: For a dog, a horse, and especially a donkey,

original: muhūrtāt paratau na syāt prahārajanitā vyathā // ///
analyzed: muhūrtāt paratau na syāt prahāra janitā vyathā
translated: the pain caused by a blow does not last more than a moment.

original: tata tam evolūkhalam ādāya vṛttiṃ cūrṇayitvā palāyitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tata tam evā ulūkhalam ādāya vṛttim cūrṇayitvā palāyitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then, taking that very mortar, he ground up the food and started to run away.

original: atrāntare śṛgālo 'pi dūrād eva dṛṣṭvā sasmitam āha
analyzed: atrā antare śṛgālaḥ pi dūrāt eva dṛṣṭvā sa smitam āha
translated: In the meantime, a jackal saw him from a distance and said with a smile:

original: sādhu mātula gītena mayā prokto 'pi na sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sādhu mātula gītena mayā na sthitaḥ
translated: Well done, uncle! Though warned by me with a song, you did not stay.

original: apūrvo 'pi maṇir baddhaḥ sāmprataṃ gītalakṣaṇam // ///
analyzed: apūrvaḥ pi maṇiḥ baddhaḥ sāmpratam gīta lakṣaṇam
translated: Though a unique jewel is bound, now the characteristics of a song are...

original: tad bhavān api mayā vāryamāṇo 'pi na sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tat bhavān api mayā vāryamāṇaḥ na sthitaḥ
translated: So you, though warned by me, did not stay.

original: tac chrutvā cakradhara āhabho mitra /
analyzed: tat śrutvā cakradharaḥ āha bho mitra
translated: Hearing this, Cakradhara said, Friend,

original: satyam etat /
analyzed: satyam etat
translated: this is true.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: yasya nāsti svayaṃ prajñā mitroktaṃ na karoti yaḥ /
analyzed: yasya nā asti svayam prajñā mitra uktam na karoti yaḥ
translated: One who has no wisdom himself and does not do what a friend says,

original: sa eva nidhanaṃ yāti yathā mantharakolikaḥ // ///
analyzed: saḥ eva nidhanam yāti yathā mantharakolikaḥ
translated: he alone perishes, just like Mantharakaulika.

original: suvarṇasiddhir āhakatham etat /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha katham etat
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said, How is that?

original: so 'bravīt🔽kathā
analyzed: saḥ bravīt  kathā
translated: He said:

original: mantharakaulikakathā
analyzed: manthara kaulika kathā
translated: The Story of Mantharakaulika

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne mantharako nāma kaulikaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne mantharakaḥ nāma kaulikaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain place, there lived a wine-seller named Manthara.

original: tasya kadācit paṭakarmāṇi kurvataḥ sarvapaṭakarmakāṣṭhāni bhagnāni /
analyzed: tasya kadācid paṭa karmāṇi kurvataḥ sarva paṭa karmakāṣṭhāni bhagnāni
translated: One day, while he was working on cloth, all the wood for cloth work broke.

original: tataḥ sa kuṭhāram ādāya vane kāṣṭhārthaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa kuṭhāram ādāya vane kāṣṭhā artham gataḥ
translated: Then, taking an axe, he went to the forest for wood.

original: sa ca samudrataṭe yāvad bhraman prayātaḥ tāvat tatra śiṃśapāpādapas tena dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca samudra taṭe yāvat bhraman prayātaḥ tāvat tatra śiṃśapā pādapaḥ tena dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: As he wandered along the seashore, he saw a śiṃśapā tree there.

original: tataś cintitavānmahān ayaṃ vṛkṣo dṛśyate /
analyzed: tatas cintitavān mahān ayam vṛkṣaḥ dṛśyate
translated: Then he thought, This is a big tree that is seen.

original: tad anenaiva kartitena prabhūtāni paṭakarmopakaraṇāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tat anena eva kartitena prabhūtāni paṭa karma upakaraṇāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: With this cut, there will be plenty of tools for cloth work.

original: ity avadhārya tasyopari kuṭhāram utkṣiptavān /
analyzed: iti avadhārya tasya upari kuṭhāram utkṣiptavān
translated: Having understood this, he raised the axe above it.

original: atha tatra vṛkṣe kaścit vyantaraḥ samāśritya āsīt /
analyzed: atha tatra vṛkṣe kaścid vyantaraḥ samāśritya āsīt
translated: Now, a certain bird lived in that tree.

original: atha tenābhihitambhoḥ /
analyzed: atha tena abhihitam bhoḥ
translated: Then he said, Oh!

original: madāśrayo 'yaṃ pādapaḥ sarvathā rakṣaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: mad āśrayaḥ yam pādapaḥ sarvathā rakṣaṇīyaḥ
translated: This tree that I depend on must be protected in every way.

original: yato 'ham atra mahāsaukhyena tiṣṭhāmi /
analyzed: yatas ham atra mahā saukhyena tiṣṭhāmi
translated: Because I live here with great happiness.

original: samudrakallolasparśanāc chītavāyunāpyāyitaḥ /
analyzed: samudra kallola sparśanāt śīta vāyunā āpyāyitaḥ
translated: I am refreshed by the touch of the ocean waves and the cool breeze.

original: kaulika āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ āhabhoḥ
translated: The woodcutter said, Oh!

original: kim ahaṃ karomi /
analyzed: kim aham karomi
translated: What can I do?

original: dārusāmagrīṃ vinā me kuṭumbaṃ bubhukṣayā pīḍyate /
analyzed: dāru sāmagrīm vinā me kuṭumbam bubhukṣayā pīḍyate
translated: Without the wood, my family is suffering from hunger.

original: tasmād anyatra śīghraṃ gamyatām /
analyzed: tasmāt anyatra śīghram gamyatām
translated: Therefore, go quickly elsewhere.

original: aham enaṃ kartayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham enam kartayiṣyāmi
translated: I will cut down this tree.

original: vyantara āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: vi antare āha bhoḥ
translated: The bird said, Oh!

original: tuṣṭas tavāham /
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ tava aham
translated: I am pleased with you.

original: tat prārthyatām abhīṣṭaṃ kiñcit /
analyzed: tat prārthyatām abhīṣṭam kiñcid
translated: Therefore, ask for something you desire.

original: rakṣaimaṃ pādapam iti /
analyzed: rakṣa emam pādapam iti
translated: But protect this tree.

original: kaulika āhayady eva tad ahaṃ svagṛhaṃ gatvā svamitraṃ svabhāryāṃ ca pṛṣṭvā āgamiṣyāmi /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ āha yadi eva tat aham sva gṛham gatvā sva mitram sva bhāryām ca pṛṣṭvā āgamiṣyāmi
translated: The woodcutter said, If so, I will go to my house, ask my friend and my wife, and return.

original: tatas tvayā deyam /🔽atha tatheti vyantareṇa pratijñāte sa kaulikaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ svagṛhaṃ prati nivṛtto yāvad agre gacchati /
analyzed: tatas tvayā deyam  atha tathā iti vyantareṇa pratijñāte sa kaulikaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ sva gṛham prati nivṛttaḥ yāvat agre gacchati
translated: Then you can give it to me.🔽Then, when the bird agreed, the woodcutter, delighted, turned back to his house and went ahead.

original: tāvad grāmapraveśe nijasuhṛdaṃ nāpitam apaśyat /
analyzed: tāvat grāma praveśe nija suhṛdam nāpitam apaśyat
translated: As he was going, at the entrance to the village he saw his friend, a barber.

original: tataḥ tasya vyantaravākyaṃ nivedayāmāsa /
analyzed: tatas tasya vyantara vākyam nivedayāmāsa
translated: Then he conveyed the words of the bird to him.

original: yataho mitra /
analyzed: yataho mitra
translated: O friend, he said.

original: mama kaścit vyantaraḥ siddhaḥ /
analyzed: mama kaścid vyantaraḥ siddhaḥ
translated: I have a certain bird who is a sage.

original: tat kathaya /
analyzed: tat kathaya
translated: Tell me,

original: kiṃ prārthaye /
analyzed: kim prārthaye
translated: what should I ask for?🔽I have come to ask you.

original: ahaṃ tvāṃ praṣṭum āgataḥ /🔽nāpita āhabhadra /
analyzed: aham tvām praṣṭum āgataḥ  nāpitaḥ āha bhadra
translated: The barber said, Sir,

original: yady evaṃ tad rājyaṃ prārthayasva /
analyzed: yadi evam tat rājyam prārthayasva
translated: if that is so, then ask for the kingdom.

original: yena tvaṃ rājā bhavasi ahaṃ tvanmantrī /
analyzed: yena tvam rājā bhavasi aham tvad mantrī
translated: By which you become king and I become your minister.

original: dvāv apīha sukham anubhūya paralokasukham anubhavāvaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: dvau api iha sukham anubhūya para loka sukham anubhavāvaḥ uktam ca
translated: Both of us will experience happiness here and in the next world. And it is said:

original: rājā dānaparo nityam iha kīrtim avāpya ca /
analyzed: rājā dāna paraḥ nityam iha kīrtim avāpya ca
translated: The king, always devoted to charity, attains fame here,

original: tat prabhāvāt punaḥ svargaṃ spardhate tridaśaiḥ saha // ///
analyzed: tad prabhāvāt punar svargam spardhate tridaśaiḥ saha
translated: and by its power, he goes to heaven and rivals the thirty gods.

original: kaulika āhaasty etat tathāpi gṛhiṇīṃ pṛcchāmi /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ āha asti etat tathā api gṛhiṇīm pṛcchāmi
translated: The bird keeper said, This is true, but I will ask my wife.

original: sa āhabhadra /
analyzed: saḥ āha bhadra
translated: He said, Sir,

original: śāstraviruddham etat yat striyā saha mantraḥ /
analyzed: śāstra viruddham etat yat striyā saha mantraḥ
translated: this is contrary to the scriptures, that one should consult with a woman,

original: yatas tāḥ svalpamatayo bhavanti / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas tāḥ su alpa matayaḥ bhavanti uktam ca
translated: because they have little understanding. And it is said:

original: bhojanācchādane dadyād ṛtukāle ca saṅgamam /
analyzed: bhojana ācchādane dadyāt ṛtu kāle ca saṅgamam
translated: One should give food and clothing, and have intercourse at the proper time,

original: bhūṣaṇādyaṃ ca nārīṇāṃ na tābhir mantrayet sudhīḥ // ///
analyzed: bhūṣaṇa ādyam ca nārīṇām na tābhiḥ mantrayet sudhīḥ
translated: and give ornaments and so on to women, but a wise man should not consult with them.

original: yatra strī yatra kitavo bālo yatra praśāsitā /
analyzed: yatra strī yatra kitavaḥ bālaḥ yatra praśāsitā
translated: Where there is a woman, where there is a gambler, where there is a child as ruler,

original: tad gṛhaṃ kṣayam āyāti bhārgavo hīdam abravīt // ///
analyzed: tat gṛham kṣayam āyāti bhārgavaḥ hi idam abravīt
translated: That house goes to ruin, so said Bhārgava.

original: tāvat syāt suprasannāsyas tāvad gurujane rataḥ /
analyzed: tāvat syāt su prasanna āsyaḥ tāvat guru jane rataḥ
translated: One should be very pleased as long as one is devoted to elders,

original: puruṣo yoṣitāṃ yāvan na śṛṇoti vaco rahaḥ // ///
analyzed: puruṣaḥ yoṣitām yāvat na śṛṇoti vacaḥ rahaḥ
translated: As long as a man does not hear the words of women in private.

original: etāḥ svārthaparā nāryaḥ kevalaṃ svasukhe ratāḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ sva artha parāḥ nāryaḥ kevalam sva sukhe ratāḥ
translated: Women are solely devoted to their own interests and pleasure.

original: na tāsāṃ vallabhaḥ ko 'pi suto 'pi svasukhaṃ vinā // ///
analyzed: na tāsām vallabhaḥ sva sukham vinā
translated: For them, there is no beloved, not even a son, except for their own happiness.

original: kaulika āhatathāpi praṣṭavyā sā mayā /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ āha tathā api praṣṭavyā sā mayā
translated: The Kaulika said: Nevertheless, I must ask her.

original: yataḥ pativratā sā /
analyzed: yatas pativratā sā
translated: Because she is devoted to her husband.

original: aparaṃ tām apṛṣṭvāhaṃ na kiñcit karomi /
analyzed: aparam tām a pṛṣṭvā aham na kiñcid karomi
translated: Moreover, I do not do anything without asking her.

original: evaṃ tam abhidhāya satvaraṃ gatvā tām uvācapriye /
analyzed: evam tam abhidhāya sa tvaram gatvā tām uvāca priye
translated: Having said this, he quickly went and said to her: My dear,

original: adyāsmākaṃ kaścid vyantaraḥ siddhaḥ /
analyzed: adya asmākam kaścid vyantaraḥ siddhaḥ
translated: Today, some of our low-caste people have become successful.

original: sa vāñchitaṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: sa vāñchitam prayacchati
translated: They grant desired things.

original: tad ahaṃ tvāṃ praṣṭum āgataḥ /
analyzed: tat aham tvām praṣṭum āgataḥ
translated: Therefore, I have come to ask you.

original: tat kathaya kiṃ prārthaye /
analyzed: tat kathaya kim prārthaye
translated: Tell me, what should I request?

original: eṣa tāvan mama mitraṃ nāpito vatady evaṃ yatrājyaṃ prārthayasva /
analyzed: eṣa tāvat mama mitram nāpitaḥ vatadi evam yatra ājyam prārthayasva
translated: This is my friend, the barber. Go there and ask for ghee.

original: sāhaāryaputra /
analyzed: sā āha āryaputra
translated: Yes, my husband.

original: kā matir nāpitānām /
analyzed: kā matiḥ nāpitānām
translated: What is the opinion of barbers?

original: tan na kāryaṃ tad vacaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat na kāryam tat vacaḥ uktam ca
translated: Therefore, his words should not be acted upon. And it is said:

original: cāraṇair vandibhir nīcair nāpitair bālakair api /
analyzed: cāraṇaiḥ vandibhiḥ nīcaiḥ nāpitaiḥ bālakaiḥ api
translated: He should not consult with charanas, bards, low-caste people, barbers, children,

original: na mantraṃ maitmān kuryāt sārdhaṃ bhikṣubhir eva ca // ///
analyzed: na mantram mā ītmān kuryāt sārdham bhikṣubhiḥ eva ca
translated: or even with monks.

original: aparaṃ mahatī kleśaparamparaiṣā rājyasthitiḥ sandhivigrahayānāsanasaṃśrayadvaidhībhāvādibhiḥ kadācit puruṣasya sukhaṃ na prayacchatīti
analyzed: aparam mahatī kleśa paramparā eṣā rājya sthitiḥ sandhi vigraha yāna āsana saṃśraya dvaidhībhāva ādibhiḥ kadācid puruṣasya sukham na prayacchati iti
translated: Moreover, this state of kingship is a great series of afflictions, with peace, war, marching, halting, seeking refuge, dividing the army, and so on, it sometimes does not bring happiness to a man.

original: yataḥ🔽yadaiva rājye kriyate'bhiṣekas tadaiva yāti vyasaneṣu buddhiḥ /
analyzed: yatas  yadā eva rājye kriyate abhiṣekaḥ tadā eva yāti vyasaneṣu buddhiḥ
translated: Therefore,🔽As soon as the consecration is performed in the kingdom, the mind turns towards vices.

original: ghaṭā nṛpāṇām abhiṣekakāle sahāmbhasaivāpadam udgiranti // ///
analyzed: ghaṭāḥ nṛpāṇām abhiṣeka kāle saha ambhasā eva āpadam udgiranti
translated: At the time of the consecration of kings, calamities along with water are vomited out by the pots.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: rāmasya vrajanaṃ vane nivasanaṃ pāṇḍoḥ sutānāṃ vane
analyzed: rāmasya vrajanam vane nivasanam pāṇḍoḥ sutānām vane
translated: Rama's departure to the forest, the Pandavas' dwelling in the forest,

original: vṛṣṇīnāṃ nidhanaṃ nalasya nṛpate rājyāt paribhraṃśanam /
analyzed: vṛṣṇīnām nidhanam nalasya nṛpate rājyāt paribhraṃśanam
translated: the destruction of the Vrishnis, King Nala's fall from the kingdom,

original: saudāsaṃ tadavastham arjunavadhaṃ sañcintya laṅkeśvaraṃ
analyzed: saudāsam tad avastham arjuna vadham sañcintya laṅkā īśvaram
translated: thinking of the state of Saudasa and the killing of Arjuna by the lord of Lanka,

original: dṛṣṭvā rājyakṛte viḍambanagataṃ tasmān na tad vāñchayet // ///
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā rājya kṛte viḍambana gatam tasmāt na tat vāñchayet
translated: seeing the mockery for the sake of the kingdom, one should not desire it.

original: yadarthaṃ bhrātaraḥ putrā api vāñchanti ye nijāḥ /
analyzed: yad artham bhrātaraḥ putrāḥ api vāñchanti ye nijāḥ
translated: For the sake of which brothers and even one's own sons desire each other,

original: vadhaḥ rājyakṛtāṃ rājñāṃ tad rājyaṃ dūratas tyajet // ///
analyzed: vadhaḥ rājya kṛtām rājñām tat rājyam dūratas tyajet
translated: The king's killing of those who have done their duty in the kingdom, that kingdom should be abandoned from afar.

original: kaulika āhasatyam uktaṃ bhavatyā /
analyzed: kaulikaḥ āha satyam uktam bhavatyā
translated: The merchant said, It is true what you say.

original: tat kathaya kiṃ prārthaye /
analyzed: tat kathaya kim prārthaye
translated: Tell me, what do you want?

original: sāhatvaṃ tāvad ekaṃ paṭaṃ nityam eva niṣpādayasi /
analyzed: tāvat ekam paṭam nityam eva niṣpādayasi
translated: You always produce one cloth.

original: tena sarvā vyayaśuddhiḥ sampadyate /🔽idānīṃ tvam ātmano 'nyad bāhuyugalaṃ dvitīyaṃ śiraś ca yācasva /
analyzed: tena sarvā vyaya śuddhiḥ sampadyate  idānīm tvam ātmanaḥ bāhu yugalam dvitīyam śiraḥ ca yācasva
translated: By that, all expenses are met.🔽Now ask for another pair of arms for yourself and a second head,

original: yena paṭadvayaṃ sampādayasi purataḥ pṛṣṭhataś ca /
analyzed: yena paṭa dvayam sampādayasi puratas pṛṣṭhatas ca
translated: by which you will produce two cloths, in front and behind.

original: ekasya mūlyena gṛḥe yathāpūrvaṃ vyayaṃ sampādayiṣyasi /
analyzed: ekasya mūlyena gṛḥe yathāpūrvam vyayam sampādayiṣyasi
translated: With the price of one, you will meet expenses as before in the house.

original: dvitīyasya mūlyena viśeṣakṛtyāni kariṣyasi /
analyzed: dvitīyasya mūlyena viśeṣa kṛtyāni kariṣyasi
translated: With the price of the second, you will do special things.

original: evaṃ saukhyena svajātimadhye ślāghyamānasya kālo yāsyati /
analyzed: evam saukhyena sva jāti madhye ślāghyamānasya kālaḥ yāsyati
translated: Thus, your time will pass in happiness, being praised among your own people.

original: lokadvayasyopārjanā ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: loka dvayasya upārjanā ca bhaviṣyati
translated: And you will accumulate for both this world and the next.

original: so 'pi tad ākarṇya prahṛṣṭaḥ prāhasādhu pativrate /
analyzed: saḥ pi tat ākarṇya prahṛṣṭaḥ prāha sādhu pativrate
translated: He, having heard that, delighted, said, Well done, faithful wife.

original: sādhu /
analyzed: sādhu
translated: Well done.

original: yuktam uktaṃ bhavatyā /
analyzed: yuktam uktam bhavatyā
translated: What you say is right.

original: tad evaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat evam kariṣyāmi
translated: I will do that.

original: eṣa me niścayaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa me niścayaḥ
translated: This is my resolve.

original: tato 'sau gatvā vyantaraṃ prārthayāṃcakrebho /
analyzed: tatas sau gatvā vyantaram prārthayāṃcakre ibho
translated: Then he went and asked the jackal, Hey,

original: yadi mamepsitaṃ prayacchasi tat dehi me dvitīyaṃ bāhuyugalaṃ śiraś ca /
analyzed: yadi mama īpsitam prayacchasi tat dehi me dvitīyam bāhu yugalam śiraḥ ca
translated: If you will grant my wish, give me a second pair of arms and a head.

original: evam abhihite tatkṣaṇād eva sa dviśirāś caturbāhuś ca sañjātaḥ /
analyzed: evam abhihite tad kṣaṇāt eva sa dvi śirāḥ catur bāhuḥ ca sañjātaḥ
translated: As soon as this was said, he was instantly born with two heads and four arms.

original: tato hṛṣṭamanā yāvad gṛham āgacchati tāvallokaiḥ rākṣaso 'yam iti mānyamānair laguḍapāṣāṇaprahārais tāḍito mṛtaś ca /
analyzed: tatas hṛṣṭa manāḥ yāvat gṛham āgacchati tāvat lokaiḥ rākṣasaḥ yam iti mānyamānaiḥ laguḍa pāṣāṇa prahāraiḥ tāḍitaḥ mṛtaḥ ca
translated: Then, with a joyful heart, as he was returning home, the people, thinking him a demon, struck him with blows from sticks and stones, and he died.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiyasya nāsti svayaṃ prajñā iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi iyasya na asti svayam prajñā iti
translated: That's why I say, 'He who lacks wisdom himself...'.

original: cakradhara āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Cakradhara said, Sir,

original: satyam etat /
analyzed: satyam etat
translated: this is true.

original: sarvo 'pi jano 'śraddeyām āśāpiśācikāṃ prāpya hāsyapadavīṃ yāti /
analyzed: sarvaḥ pi janaḥ śraddeyām āśā piśācikām prāpya hāsya padavīm yāti
translated: Every person, when they encounter the imp of hope, which is unbelievable, goes to the state of laughter.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate kenāpi
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate kena api
translated: Or this is well said by someone:

original: anāgatavatīṃ cintām asambhāvyāṃ karoti yaḥ /
analyzed: anāgatavatīm cintām asambhāvyām karoti yaḥ
translated: He who makes an unrealizable plan for the future,

original: sa eva pāṇḍuraḥ śete somaśarmapitā yathā // ///
analyzed: saḥ eva pāṇḍuraḥ śete somaśarma pitā yathā
translated: he alone lies pale, like Somaśarman's father.

original: suvarṇasiddhir āhakatham etat /🔽so 'bravīt
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha katham etat  saḥ bravīt
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi asked, How is that?

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: He told the story:

original: somaśarmapitṛkathā
analyzed: somaśarma pitṛ kathā
translated: The Story of Somaśarman's Father

original: kasmiṃścin nagare kaścit svabhāvakṛpaṇo nāma brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid nagare kaścid svabhāvakṛpaṇaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain city lived a certain brahmin named Svabhāva-kṛpaṇa.

original: tasya bhikṣārjitaiḥ saktubhir bhuktaśeṣaiḥ kalaśaḥ sampūritaḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhikṣā arjitaiḥ saktubhiḥ bhukta śeṣaiḥ kalaśaḥ sampūritaḥ
translated: With the flour obtained from his alms, he filled a pot that was left over from his meal.

original: taṃ ca ghaṭaṃ nāgadante'valambya tasyādhastāt khaṭvāṃ nidhāya satatam ekadṛṣṭyā tam avalokayati /
analyzed: tam ca ghaṭam nāga dantā iva alambya tasya adhastāt khaṭvām nidhāya satatam eka dṛṣṭyā tam avalokayati
translated: Hanging that pot on an elephant's tusk, he placed a bed under it and constantly gazed at it with one eye.

original: atha kadācid rātrau suptaś cintayāmāsayat paripūrṇo 'yaṃ ghaṭas tāvat saktubhir vartate /
analyzed: atha kadācid rātrau suptaḥ cintayāmāsayat paripūrṇaḥ yam ghaṭaḥ tāvat saktubhiḥ vartate
translated: Then one night, while asleep, he thought: This pot is indeed full of flour.

original: tad yadi durbhikṣaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat yadi durbhikṣam bhavati
translated: If there is a famine,

original: tad anena rūpyakāṇāṃ śatam utpatsyate /
analyzed: tat anena rūpyakāṇām śatam utpatsyate
translated: from this I will obtain a hundred silver coins.

original: tatas tena mayājād vayaṃ grahītavyam /
analyzed: tatas tena mayā ajāt vayam grahītavyam
translated: Then I should take a wife.

original: tataḥ ṣāṇmāsikam āprasavavaśāt tābhyāṃ yūthaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas ṣāṇmāsikam ā prasava vaśāt tābhyām yūtham bhaviṣyati
translated: Then after six months, due to the birth of offspring, there will be a herd from them.

original: tato 'jābhiḥ prabhūtā gā grahīṣyāmi /🔽gobhir mahiṣīḥ /
analyzed: tatas jābhiḥ prabhūtāḥ gāḥ grahīṣyāmi  gobhiḥ mahiṣīḥ
translated: Then with the goats I will take many cows.🔽With the cows I will take buffaloes.

original: mahiṣīr baḍavāḥ /
analyzed: mahiṣīḥ baḍavāḥ
translated: With the buffaloes I will take mares.

original: baḍavāprasavataḥ prabhūtā aśvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: baḍavāprasavataḥ prabhūtāḥ aśvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: From the birth of the mares, many horses will be born.

original: teṣāṃ vikrayāt prabhūtaṃ suvarṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām vikrayāt prabhūtam suvarṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: From their sale, I will obtain much gold.

original: suvarṇena catuḥśālaṃ gṛhaṃ sampatsyate /
analyzed: suvarṇena catuḥśālam gṛham sampatsyate
translated: With the gold I will build a four-chambered house.

original: tataḥ kaścid brāhmaṇo mama gṛham āgatya prāptavayaskāṃ rūpāḍhyāṃ kanyāṃ mahyaṃ dāsyati /
analyzed: tatas kaścid brāhmaṇaḥ mama gṛham āgatya prāpta vayaskām rūpa āḍhyām kanyām mahyam dāsyati
translated: Then some Brahmin will come to my house and give me his marriageable daughter.

original: tatsakāśāṭ putro me bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tad sakāśāt putraḥ me bhaviṣyati
translated: From her I will have a son.

original: tasyāḥaṃ somaśarmā iti nāma kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tasyāḥ somaśarmā iti nāma kariṣyāmi
translated: I will name him Somaśarman.

original: tatas tasmin jānucalanayogye sañjāte'haṃ pustakaṃ gṛhītvāśvaśālāyāḥ pṛṣṭhadeśe upaviṣṭas tadavadhārayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatas tasmin jānu calana yogye sañjātā iham pustakam gṛhītvā aśvaśālāyāḥ pṛṣṭha deśe upaviṣṭaḥ tat avadhārayiṣyāmi
translated: Then, when he is able to crawl, I will take a book, sit behind the stable, and study it.

original: atrāntare somaśarmā māṃ dṛṣṭvā jananyutsaṅgāj jānucalanaparo 'śvakhurāsannavartī matsamīpam āgamiṣyati /
analyzed: atrā antare somaśarmā mām dṛṣṭvā jananī utsaṅgāt jānu calana paraḥ śva khura āsanna vartī mad samīpam āgamiṣyati
translated: In the meantime, Somaśarman, seeing me, will come to me from his mother's lap, crawling on his knees, near the horse's hoof.

original: tato 'haṃ brāhmaṇīṃ kopāviṣṭo 'bhidhāsyāmigṛhāṇa tāvad bālakam /
analyzed: tatas ham brāhmaṇīm kopa āviṣṭaḥ bhidhāsyāmi gṛhāṇa tāvat bālakam
translated: Then I, angry with the Brahmin woman, will say, First take the child.

original: sāpi gṛhakarmavyagratayāsmadvacanaṃ na śroṣyati /
analyzed: sā api gṛhakarma vyagra tayā asmad vacanam na śroṣyati
translated: She, being busy with household work, will not hear our words.

original: tato 'haṃ samutthāya tāṃ pādaprahāreṇa tāḍayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatas ham samutthāya tām pāda prahāreṇa tāḍayiṣyāmi
translated: Then I will get up and kick her.

original: evaṃ tena dhyānasthitena tathaiva pādaprahāro datto yathā sa ghaṭo bhagnaḥ /
analyzed: evam tena dhyāna sthitena tathā eva pāda prahāraḥ dattaḥ yathā sa ghaṭaḥ bhagnaḥ
translated: Thus, while he was meditating, he gave such a kick that the pot was broken.

original: svayaṃ ca saktubhiḥ pāṇḍuratāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: svayam ca saktubhiḥ pāṇḍura tām gataḥ
translated: And he himself became white with flour.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmianāgatavatīṃ cintām iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi anāgatavatīm cintām iti
translated: Therefore I say: Thinking about what has not yet happened...

original: suvarṇasiddhir āhaevam etat /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha evam etat
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said, That is so.

original: kas te doṣaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ te doṣaḥ
translated: What is your fault?

original: yataḥ sarvo 'pi lobhena viḍambito bādhyate / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yatas lobhena viḍambitaḥ bādhyate uktam ca
translated: Since everyone is deceived and harmed by greed. And it is said:

original: yo laulyāt kurute naivodarkam avekṣate /
analyzed: yaḥ laulyāt kurute na eva udarkam avekṣate
translated: He who out of greed does not consider the future,

original: viḍambanām avāpnoti sa yathā candrabhūpatiḥ // ///
analyzed: viḍambanām avāpnoti sa yathā candrabhūpatiḥ
translated: Attains ridicule, as did King Candra.

original: cakradhara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Cakradhara asked, How is that?

original: sa āha
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: candrabhūpatikathā
analyzed: candra bhūpati kathā
translated: The Story of King Candra

original: kasmiṃścin nagare candro nāma bhūpatiḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid nagare candraḥ nāma bhūpatiḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain city, there lived a king named Candra.

original: tasya putrā vānarakrīḍāratā vānarayūthaṃ nityam evānekabhojanabhakṣyādibhiḥ puṣṭiṃ nayanti sma /
analyzed: tasya putrāḥ vānara krīḍā ratāḥ vānara yūtham nityam eva aneka bhojana bhakṣya ādibhiḥ puṣṭim nayanti sma
translated: His sons, engaged in monkey-like play, always nourished a troop of monkeys with various foods, delicacies, and so on.

original: atha vānarādhipo yaḥ sa auśanasabārhaspatyacāṇakyamatavit tadanuṣṭhātā ca tatsarvān apy adhyāpayati sma /
analyzed: atha vānara adhipaḥ yaḥ sa auśanasa bārhaspatya cāṇakya mata vid tad anuṣṭhātā ca tad sarvān api adhyāpayati sma
translated: Then the leader of the monkeys, who knew the opinions of Uśanas, Bṛhaspati, and Cāṇakya, and who practiced them, taught them all.

original: atha tasmin rājagṛhe laghukumāravāhanayogyaṃ meṣayūtham asti /
analyzed: atha tasmin rājagṛhe laghu kumāra vāhana yogyam meṣa yūtham asti
translated: Now, in that royal household, there was a flock of sheep suitable for the young prince's carriage.

original: tanmadhyād eko jihvālaulyād aharniśaṃ niḥśaṅkaṃ mahānase praviśya yat paśyati tat sarvaṃ bhakṣayati /
analyzed: tad madhyāt ekaḥ jihvā laulyāt aharniśam niḥśaṅkam mahānase praviśya yat paśyati tat sarvam bhakṣayati
translated: From among them, one out of greed for the tongue, fearlessly entered the kitchen day and night, and ate whatever it saw.

original: te ca sūpakar yat kiñcit kāṣṭhaṃ mṛṇmayaṃ bhājanaṃ kāṃsyapātraṃ tāmrapātraṃ vā paśyanti tenāśu tāḍayanti /
analyzed: te ca yat kiñcid kāṣṭham mṛṇmayam bhājanam kāṃsya pātram tāmra pātram vā paśyanti tena āśu tāḍayanti
translated: And those cooks, whatever wooden or earthen vessel they saw, or a copper or brass vessel, they immediately struck with it.

original: so 'pi vānarayūthapas tad dṛṣṭvā vyacintayataho meṣasūpakārakalaho 'yaṃ vānarāṇāṃ kṣayāya bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saḥ pi vānara yūthapaḥ tat dṛṣṭvā vyacintayata ho meṣa sūpa kāra kalahaḥ yam vānarāṇām kṣayāya bhaviṣyati
translated: The monkey leader, seeing this, thought: Alas, this quarrel between the sheep and the cooks will lead to the destruction of the monkeys.

original: yato 'nnarasāsvādalampaṭo 'yaṃ meṣo /
analyzed: yatas nna rasa āsvāda lampaṭaḥ yam meṣaḥ
translated: For this sheep is greedy for the taste of food,

original: mahākopāś ca sūpakārā yathāsannavastunā praharanti /
analyzed: mahā kopāḥ ca sūpa kārāḥ yathā āsanna vastunā praharanti
translated: and the cooks are very angry and strike with whatever object is at hand.

original: tad yadi vastuno 'bhāvāt kadācid ulmukena tāḍayiṣyanti /🔽tadorṇāpracuro 'yaṃ meṣaḥ svalpenāpi vahninā prajvalayiṣyati /🔽tad dahyamānaḥ punar aśvakuṭyāṃ samīpavartinyāṃ pravekṣyati /
analyzed: tat yadi vastunaḥ bhāvāt kadācid ulmukena tāḍayiṣyanti  tadā ūrṇā pracuraḥ yam meṣaḥ su alpena api vahninā prajvalayiṣyati  tat dahyamānaḥ punar aśvakuṭyām samīpa vartinyām pravekṣyati
translated: If, due to lack of objects, they will strike with a firebrand at some point,🔽then this sheep, which is full of wool, will catch fire with even a small amount of fire.🔽Then, burning, it will enter the nearby stable of horses.

original: sāpi tṛṇaprācuryāj jvaliṣyati /
analyzed: sā api tṛṇa prācuryāt jvaliṣyati
translated: And that will burn due to the abundance of straw.

original: tato 'śvā vahnidāham avāpsyanti /
analyzed: tatas śvā vahni dāham avāpsyanti
translated: Then the horses will suffer from the fire.

original: śālihotreṇa punar etad uktaṃ yatvānaravasayāśvānāṃ vahnidāhadoṣaḥ praśāmyati /
analyzed: śālihotreṇa punar etat uktam yatvā anara vasayā aśvānām vahni dāha doṣaḥ praśāmyati
translated: But Śālihotra has said that the fault of fire burning the horses is cured by the fat of monkeys.

original: tan nūnam etena bhāvyam atra niścayaḥ /
analyzed: tat nūnam etena bhāvyam atra niścayaḥ
translated: Therefore, this must certainly happen here.

original: evaṃ niścitya sarvān vānarān āhūya rahasi provāca / yat
analyzed: evam niścitya sarvān vānarān āhūya rahasi provāca yat
translated: Having thus resolved, he summoned all the monkeys in secret and said:

original: meṣeṇa sūpakārāṇāṃ kalaho yatra jāyate /
analyzed: meṣeṇa sūpa kārāṇām kalahaḥ yatra jāyate
translated: Where quarrels arise among cooks due to a ram,

original: sa bhaviṣyaty asandigdhaṃ vānarāṇāṃ kṣayāvahaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa bhaviṣyati asandigdham vānarāṇām kṣaya āvahaḥ
translated: there will undoubtedly be destruction of the monkeys.

original: tasmāt syāt kalaho yatra gṛhe nityam akāraṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt syāt kalahaḥ yatra gṛhe nityam akāraṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, where there is always causeless quarreling in a house,

original: tadgṛhaṃ jīvitaṃ vāñchan dūrataḥ parivarjayet // ///🔽kalahāntāni harmyāṇi kuvākyāntaṃ ca sauhṛdam /
analyzed: tad gṛham jīvitam vāñchan dūratas parivarjayet  kalaha antāni harmyāṇi ku vākya antam ca sauhṛdam
translated: desiring life, one should avoid that house from afar.🔽Homes end in quarrels, friendship ends in harsh words,

original: kurājāntāni rāṣṭrāṇi kukarmāntaṃ yaśo nṛṇām // ///
analyzed: ku rāja antāni rāṣṭrāṇi ku karma antam yaśaḥ nṛṇām
translated: kingdoms end in bad kings, and human fame ends in bad deeds.

original: tan na yāvat sarveṣāṃ saṅkṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: tat na yāvat sarveṣām saṅkṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, as long as there is no total destruction,

original: tāvad evaitad rājagṛhaṃ santyajya vanaṃ gacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat eva etat rāja gṛham santyajya vanam gacchāmaḥ
translated: we should leave this Rājagṛha and go to the forest.

original: atha tat tasya vacanam aśraddheyaṃ śrutvā madoddhatā vānarāḥ prahasya procuḥbho bhavato vṛddhabhāvād buddhivaikalyaṃ sañjātaṃ /
analyzed: atha tat tasya vacanam aśraddheyam śrutvā mada uddhatāḥ vānarāḥ prahasya procuḥ bho bhavataḥ vṛddha bhāvāt buddhi vaikalyam sañjātam
translated: Then, hearing his words as unbelievable, the arrogant monkeys laughed and said: O sir, due to your old age, a deficiency in intellect has arisen,

original: yenaitad bravīṣi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: yena etat bravīṣi uktam ca
translated: by which you speak thus. And it is said:

original: vadanaṃ daśanair hīnaṃ lālā sravati nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: vadanam daśanaiḥ hīnam lālā sravati nityaśas
translated: A face without teeth always drips saliva,

original: na matiḥ sphurati kvāpi bāle vṛddhe viśeṣataḥ // ///
analyzed: na matiḥ sphurati kvāpi bāle vṛddhe viśeṣataḥ
translated: the mind does not shine anywhere, especially in the young and the old.

original: na vayaṃ svargasamānopabhogān nānāvidhān bhakṣyaviśeṣān rājaputraiḥ svadattān amṛtakalpān parityajya tatrāṭavyāṃ kaṣāyakaṭutiktakṣārarūkṣaphalāni
analyzed: na vayam svarga samāna upabhogān nānāvidhān bhakṣya viśeṣān rāja putraiḥ sva dattān amṛta kalpān parityajya tatra aṭavyām kaṣāya kaṭu tikta kṣāra rūkṣa phalāni
translated: We will not abandon the various kinds of food and special delicacies given by the princes, which are like nectar, and eat the astringent, bitter, sour, pungent, and dry fruits in the forest.

original: bhakṣayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: bhakṣayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: They said, We will not go to the forest.

original: tac chrutvāśrukaluṣāṃ dṛṣṭiṃ kṛtvā sa provācare re mūrkhāḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā aśru kaluṣām dṛṣṭim kṛtvā sa provāca re re mūrkhāḥ
translated: Hearing that, he cast a tearful glance and said, Hey, you fools!

original: yūyam etasya sukhasya pariṇāmaṃ na jānītha /
analyzed: yūyam etasya sukhasya pariṇāmam na jānītha
translated: You do not know the consequences of this happiness.

original: kiṃ pākarasāsvādanaprāyam etat sukhaṃ pariṇāme viṣavad bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kim pāka rasa āsvādana prāyam etat sukham pariṇāme viṣa vat bhaviṣyati
translated: Is this happiness, which is like tasting the flavor of cooked food, going to be like poison in the end?

original: tad ahaṃ kulakṣayaṃ svayaṃ nāvalokayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat aham kula kṣayam svayam na avalokayiṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, I will not myself witness the destruction of the family.

original: sāmprataṃ vanaṃ yāsyāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: sāmpratam vanam yāsyāmi uktam ca
translated: I will now go to the forest. And it is said:

original: mitraṃ vyasanasamprāptaṃ svasthānaṃ parapīḍanam /
analyzed: mitram vyasana samprāptam sva sthānam para pīḍanam
translated: A friend who has fallen into misfortune, a healthy person who oppresses others,

original: dhanyās te ye na paśyanti deśabhaṅgaṃ kulakṣayam // ///🔽evam abhidhāya sarvāṃs tān parityajya sa yūthādhipo 'ṭavyāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: dhanyāḥ te ye na paśyanti deśa bhaṅgam kula kṣayam  evam abhidhāya sarvān tān parityajya sa yūtha adhipaḥ ṭavyām gataḥ
translated: The fortunate ones who do not see the destruction of the country and the ruin of the family...🔽Having said this, that leader of the herd abandoned them all and went to the forest.

original: atha tasmin gate'nyasmin ahani sa meṣo mahānase praviṣṭo /
analyzed: atha tasmin gateni asmin ahani sa meṣaḥ mahānase praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, after he had left, on another day that sheep entered the kitchen.

original: yāvat sūpakāreṇa nānyat kiñcit samāsāditaṃ tāvad ardhajvalitakāṣṭhena tāḍyamāno jājvalyamanaśarīraḥ śabdāyamāno 'śvakuṭyāṃ pratyāsannavartinyāṃ
analyzed: yāvat sūpa kāreṇa na anyat kiñcid samāsāditam tāvat ardha jvalita kāṣṭhena tāḍyamānaḥ jājvalyamana śarīraḥ śabdāyamānaḥ śva kuṭyām pratyāsanna vartinyām
translated: As long as the cook did not obtain anything else, he was beaten with half-burnt wood, his body blazing and making a sound, in the stable nearby.

original: praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ
translated: As long as the cook did not obtain anything else, he was beaten with half-burnt wood, his body blazing and making a sound, and entered the nearby horse shed.

original: tatra tṛṇaprācuryayuktāyāṃ kṣitau tasya praluṭhataḥ sarvatrāpi vahnijvālās tathā samutthitā yathā kecid aśvāḥ sphuṭitalocanāḥ pañcatvaṃ
analyzed: tatra tṛṇa prācurya yuktāyām kṣitau tasya praluṭhataḥ sarvatra api vahni jvālāḥ tathā samutthitāḥ yathā kecid aśvāḥ sphuṭita locanāḥ pañcatvam
translated: There, on the ground rich in grass, as he rolled around, the flames of fire arose everywhere in such a way that some horses, with their eyes bursting,

original: gatāḥ /
analyzed: gatāḥ
translated: went to death.

original: kecid bandhanāni troṭayitvā ardhadagdhaśarīrā itaś cetaś ca hreṣāyamāṇā dhāvamānā sarvam api janasamūham ākulīcakruḥ /
analyzed: kecid bandhanāni troṭayitvā ardha dagdha śarīrāḥ itas ca itas ca hreṣāyamāṇāḥ dhāvamānā sarvam api jana samūham ākulīcakruḥ
translated: Some, having torn their bonds, with their bodies half-burnt, neighing here and there, running about, agitated the entire crowd of people.

original: atrāntare rājā saviṣādaḥ śālihotrajñān vaidyān āhūya provācabhoḥ /
analyzed: atrā antare rājā sa viṣādaḥ śālihotra jñān vaidyān āhūya provāca bhoḥ
translated: In the meantime, the king, with sadness, summoned the physicians who knew about Shalihotra, and said, Gentlemen,

original: procyatām eṣām aśvānāṃ kaścid dāhopaśamanopāyaḥ /
analyzed: procyatām eṣām aśvānām kaścid dāha upaśamana upāyaḥ
translated: please tell me some remedy to alleviate the burning of these horses.

original: te'pi śāstrāṇi vilokya procuḥdeva /
analyzed: te api śāstrāṇi vilokya procuḥ deva
translated: They too, having looked at the scriptures, said, Your Majesty,

original: proktam atra viṣaye bhagavatā śālihotreṇa / yat
analyzed: proktam atra viṣaye bhagavatā śālihotreṇa yat
translated: it has been said by the revered Shalihotra on this matter that

original: kapīnāṃ medasā doṣo vahnidāhasamudbhavā /
analyzed: kapīnām medasā doṣaḥ vahni dāha samudbhavā
translated: the fault arising from the burning of fire is removed by the fat of monkeys.

original: aśvānāṃ nāśam abhyeti tamaḥ sūryodaye yathā // ///
analyzed: aśvānām nāśam abhyeti tamaḥ sūrya udaye yathā
translated: as darkness disappears at sunrise.

original: tat kriyatām etac cikitsitāṃ drāk /
analyzed: tat kriyatām etat cikitsitām drāk
translated: So quickly have this treatment done.

original: yāvad ete na dāhadoṣeṇa vinaśyanti /
analyzed: yāvat ete na dāha doṣeṇa vinaśyanti
translated: Before they are destroyed by the fault of burning.

original: so 'pi tad ākarṇya samastavānaravadham ādiṣṭavān /
analyzed: saḥ pi tat ākarṇya samasta vānara vadham ādiṣṭavān
translated: He, having heard that, ordered the killing of all the monkeys.

original: kiṃ bahunā / sarve'pi te vānarā vividhāyudhalaguḍapāṣāṇādibhir vyāpāditāḥ iti /
analyzed: kim bahunā sarve api te vānarāḥ vividha āyudha laguḍa pāṣāṇa ādibhiḥ vyāpāditāḥ iti
translated: What's the use of much talk? All those monkeys were killed with various weapons, clubs, stones, and so on.

original: atha so 'pi vānarayūthapas taṃ putrapautrabhrātṛsutabhāgineyādisaṅkṣayaṃ jñātvā viṣādam upagataḥ /
analyzed: atha saḥ pi vānara yūthapaḥ tam putra pautra bhrātṛ suta bhāgineya ādi saṅkṣayam jñātvā viṣādam upagataḥ
translated: Then that leader of the monkey troop, having learned of the destruction of his sons, grandsons, brothers, nephews, and so on, became despondent.

original: santyaktāhārakriyo vanād vanaṃ paryaṭati /
analyzed: san tyakta āhāra kriyaḥ vanāt vanam paryaṭati
translated: Abandoning food and activity, he roams from forest to forest.

original: acintayac cakatham ahaṃ tasya nṛpāpasadayānṛṇatākṛtyenāpakṛtyaṃ kariṣyāmi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: acintayat ca katham aham tasya nṛpa apasa dayā anṛṇa tā kṛtyena apakṛtyam kariṣyāmi uktam ca
translated: And he thought, How can I repay that evil king's injury with an injury? And it is said:

original: marṣayed dharṣaṇāṃ yo 'tra vaṃśajāṃ paranirmitām /
analyzed: marṣayet dharṣaṇām yaḥ tra vaṃśa jām para nirmitām
translated: He who endures the insult born in the family created by another,

original: bhayād vā yadi vā kāmāt sa jñeyaḥ puruṣādhamaḥ // ///
analyzed: bhayāt vā yadi vā kāmāt sa jñeyaḥ puruṣa adhamaḥ
translated: whether out of fear or desire, he should be known as the lowest of men.

original: atha tena vṛddhavānareṇa kutracit pipāsākulena bhramatā padminīkhaṇḍamaṇḍitaṃ saraḥ samāsāditam /
analyzed: atha tena vṛddha vānareṇa kutracid pipāsā ākulena bhramatā padminī khaṇḍa maṇḍitam saraḥ samāsāditam
translated: Then, by that old monkey, wandering somewhere out of thirst, a lake adorned with a cluster of lotuses was reached.

original: tad yāvat sūkṣmekṣikayāvalokayati tāvad vanacaramanuṣyāṇāṃ padapaṅktipradeśo 'sti na niṣkramaṇam /
analyzed: tat yāvat sūkṣma īkṣikayā avalokayati tāvat vanacara manuṣyāṇām pada paṅkti pradeśaḥ sti na niṣkramaṇam
translated: So he looked around carefully, and saw that there was a line of footprints of foresters, but no way out.

original: tataś cintitamnūnam atra ākrānte duṣṭagrāheṇa bhāvyam /
analyzed: tatas cintitam nūnam atra ākrānte duṣṭa grāheṇa bhāvyam
translated: Then he thought, “Surely, if I enter here, I will be seized by a wicked crocodile.

original: tatpadminīnālam ādāya dūrastho 'pi jalaṃ pibāmi /
analyzed: tat padminī nālam ādāya dūra sthaḥ jalam pibāmi
translated: So I will take a lotus stalk and drink water from a distance.”

original: tathānuṣṭhite tanmadhyād rākṣaso niṣkramya ratnamālāvibhūṣitakaṇṭhas tam uvācabhoḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite tad madhyāt rākṣasaḥ niṣkramya ratna mālā vibhūṣita kaṇṭhaḥ tam uvāca bhoḥ
translated: When he did so, a demon came out of the water, his neck adorned with a jeweled necklace, and said to him, “Hey!

original: atra yaḥ salile praveśaṃ karoti sa me bhakṣyaḥ iti /
analyzed: atra yaḥ salile praveśam karoti sa me bhakṣyaḥ iti
translated: Whoever enters this water is my food.”

original: tan nāsti dhūrtataras tvatsamo 'nyo yaḥ pānīyam anena vidhinā pibati /
analyzed: tat nā asti dhūrtataraḥ tvad samaḥ nyaḥ yaḥ pānīyam anena vidhinā pibati
translated: So there is no trickster like you, who drinks water in this way.

original: tatas tuṣṭo 'haṃ /
analyzed: tatas tuṣṭaḥ haṃ
translated: But I am pleased with you.

original: prārthayasva hṛdayavāñchitam /
analyzed: prārthayasva hṛdaya vāñchitam
translated: Ask for whatever you desire in your heart.

original: kapir āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: kapiḥ āhabhoḥ
translated: The monkey said, “Sir,

original: kiyatī me bhakṣaṇaśaktiḥ /
analyzed: kiyatī me bhakṣaṇa śaktiḥ
translated: how much power do I have to eat?”

original: sa āhaśatasahasrāyutalakṣāṇy api jalapraviṣṭāni bhakṣayāmi /
analyzed: saḥ āha śata sahasra ayuta lakṣāṇi api jala praviṣṭāni bhakṣayāmi
translated: He said, “I can eat hundreds, thousands, ten thousands, and even hundreds of thousands that enter the water.

original: bāhyataḥ śṛgālo 'pi māṃ dharṣayati /
analyzed: bāhyatas śṛgālaḥ u pi mām dharṣayati
translated: But a jackal outside can harm me.”

original: vānara āhaasti me kenacid bhūpatinā sahātyantaṃ vairam /
analyzed: vānaraḥ āha asti me kenacid bhūpatinā saha atyantam vairam
translated: The monkey said, “I have a great enmity with a certain king.

original: yady enāṃ ratnamālāṃ me prayacchasi /
analyzed: yadi enām ratna mālām me prayacchasi
translated: If you give me this jeweled necklace,

original: tat parivāram api taṃ bhūpatiṃ vākyaprapañcena lobhayitvātra sarasi praveśayāmi /
analyzed: tat parivāram api tam bhūpatim vākya prapañcena lobhayitvā atra sarasi praveśayāmi
translated: I will lure the king and his retinue with a series of words and make them enter this lake.

original: so 'pi śraddheyaṃ vacas tasya śrutvā ratnamālāṃ dattvā prāhabho mitra /
analyzed: saḥ pi śraddheyam vacaḥ tasya śrutvā ratna mālām dattvā prāha bho mitra
translated: Hearing his credible words, the king gave him a jeweled necklace and said, Friend,

original: yat samucitaṃ bhavati tat kartavyam iti /
analyzed: yat samucitam bhavati tat kartavyam iti
translated: you should do what is appropriate.

original: vānaro 'pi ratnamālāvibhūṣitakaṇṭho vṛkṣaprāsādeṣu paribhraman janair dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: vānaraḥ pi ratna mālā vibhūṣita kaṇṭhaḥ vṛkṣa prāsādeṣu paribhraman janaiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: The monkey, his throat adorned with a jeweled necklace, wandered among the trees and palaces, seen by the people.

original: pṛṣṭaś cabho yūthapa /
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ cabho yūthapa
translated: And asked, Sir, leader of the herd,

original: bhavān iyantaṃ kālaṃ kutra sthitaḥ /
analyzed: bhavān iyantam kālam kutra sthitaḥ
translated: where have you been all this time?

original: bhavatā īdṛg ratnamālā kutra labdhā /
analyzed: bhavatā īdṛś ratna mālā kutra labdhā
translated: Where did you get such a jeweled necklace?

original: dīptyā sūryam api tiraskaroti /
analyzed: dīptyā sūryam api tiraskaroti
translated: It outshines even the sun.

original: vānaraḥ prāhaasti kutracid araṇye guptataraṃ mahat saro dhanadanirmitam /
analyzed: vānaraḥ prāha asti kutracid araṇye guptataram mahat saraḥ dhanada nirmitam
translated: The monkey said, In a certain forest, there is a very hidden great lake created by Kubera.

original: tatra sūrye'rdhodite ravivāre yaḥ kaścin nimajjati /
analyzed: tatra sūrya īrdhā udite ravivāre yaḥ kaścid nimajjati
translated: There, when the sun is half-risen on a Sunday, whoever bathes

original: sa dhanadaprasādād īdṛgratnamālāvibhūṣitakaṇṭho niḥsarati /
analyzed: sa dhanada prasādāt īdṛś ratna mālā vibhūṣita kaṇṭhaḥ niḥsarati
translated: comes out with his throat adorned with such a jeweled necklace by the grace of Kubera.

original: atha bhūbhujā tad ākarṇya /
analyzed: atha bhūbhujā tat ākarṇya
translated: Then, hearing that, the king

original: sa vānaraḥ samāhūtaḥ /
analyzed: sa vānaraḥ samāhūtaḥ
translated: summoned that monkey.

original: pṛṣṭaś cabho yūthādhipa /
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ cabho yūtha adhipa
translated: And asked, Sir, leader of the herd,

original: kiṃ satyam etat /
analyzed: kim satyam etat
translated: is this true?

original: ratnamālāsanāthaṃ saro 'sti kvāpi /
analyzed: ratna mālā sanātham saraḥ sti kvāpi
translated: Somewhere there is a lake with a jeweled necklace on it.

original: kapir āhasvāmin /
analyzed: kapiḥ āha svāmin
translated: The monkey said, Your Majesty.

original: eṣa pratyakṣatayā matkaṇṭhasthitayā ratnamālayā pratyayas te /
analyzed: eṣa pratyakṣa tayā mad kaṇṭha sthitayā ratnamālayā pratyayaḥ te
translated: This is the proof for you, with the jeweled necklace right here around my neck.

original: tad yadi ratnamālayā prayojanaṃ tan mayā saha kam api preṣaya /
analyzed: tat yadi ratnamālayā prayojanam tat mayā saha kam api preṣaya
translated: If you have a use for the jeweled necklace, then send someone with me.

original: yena darśayāmi /
analyzed: yena darśayāmi
translated: So that I can show it to you.

original: tac chrutvā nṛpatir āhayady evaṃ tad ahaṃ saparijanaḥ svayam eṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat śrutvā nṛpatiḥ āha yadi evam tat aham sa parijanaḥ svayam eṣyāmi
translated: Hearing that, the king said, If that's the case, then I myself will come with my retinue.

original: yena prabhūtā ratnamālā utpadyate /
analyzed: yena prabhūtā ratna mālā utpadyate
translated: So that a large jeweled necklace can be obtained.

original: vānara āhaevaṃ kriyatām /
analyzed: vānaraḥ āha evam kriyatām
translated: The monkey said, Let it be done that way.

original: tathānuṣṭhite bhūpatinā saha ratnamālālobhena sarve kalatrabhṛtyāḥ prasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite bhūpatinā saha ratna mālā lobhena sarve kalatra bhṛtyāḥ prasthitāḥ
translated: When that was done, out of greed for the jeweled necklace, the king, his wife, and servants all set out.

original: vānaro 'pi rājñā dolādhirūḍhena svotsaṅge āropitaḥ sukhena prītipūrvam ānīyate /
analyzed: vānaraḥ pi rājñā dolādhirūḍhena sva utsaṅge āropitaḥ sukhena prīti pūrvam ānīyate
translated: The monkey was also placed on the king's lap while riding in a swing, and was happily and affectionately brought along.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or rather, this is well said:

original: tṛṣṇe devi namas tubhyaṃ yayā vittānvitā api /
analyzed: tṛṣṇe devi namaḥ tubhyam yayā vitta anvitāḥ api
translated: O Goddess Craving, I pay homage to you, by whom even those endowed with wealth

original: akṛtyeṣu niyojyante bhrāmante durgameṣv api // ///
analyzed: akṛtyeṣu niyojyante bhrāmante durgameṣu api
translated: are engaged in fruitless pursuits and wander in difficult places.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

original: icchati śatī sahasraṃ sahasrī lakṣam īhate /
analyzed: icchati śatī sahasram sahasrī lakṣam īhate
translated: One desiring a hundred desires a thousand, one desiring a thousand desires a hundred thousand,

original: lakṣādhipas tathā rājyaṃ rājyasthaḥ svargam īhate // ///🔽jīryante jīryataḥ keśāḥ dantā jīryanti jīryataḥ /
analyzed: lakṣa adhipaḥ tathā rājyam rājya sthaḥ svargam īhate  jīryante jīryataḥ keśāḥ dantāḥ jīryanti jīryataḥ
translated: and the lord of a lakh desires the kingdom, and the king seeks heaven.🔽As one grows old, the hair and teeth decay.🔽As one grows old, the eyes and ears decay.

original: jīryataś cakṣuṣī śrotre tṛṣṇaikā taruṇāyate // ///
analyzed: jīryataḥ cakṣuṣī śrotre tṛṣṇā ekā taruṇāyate
translated: Only thirst grows young.

original: atha tatsaraḥ samāsādya vānaraḥ pratyūṣasamaye rājānam uvācadeva /
analyzed: atha tat saraḥ samāsādya vānaraḥ pratyūṣa samaye rājānam uvāca eva
translated: Then, having reached that lake, the monkey said to the king at dawn, Your Majesty,

original: atrārdhodite sūrye'ntaḥpraviṣṭānāṃ siddhir bhavati tat sarvo 'pi jana ekadaiva praviśatu /
analyzed: atra ardha udite sūrya intar praviṣṭānām siddhiḥ bhavati tat janaḥ ekadā eva praviśatu
translated: when the sun has risen halfway, those who enter inside attain success. So let all the people enter at once.

original: tvayā punar mayā saha praveṣṭavyaṃ /
analyzed: tvayā punar mayā saha praveṣṭavyam
translated: But you must enter with me.

original: yena pūrvadṛṣṭasthānam āsādya /
analyzed: yena pūrva dṛṣṭa sthānam āsādya
translated: Having reached the place seen by me before,

original: prabhūtās te ratnamālā darśayāmi /
analyzed: prabhūtāḥ te ratna mālāḥ darśayāmi
translated: I will show you many jeweled garlands.

original: atha praviṣṭās te lokāḥ sarve bhakṣitā rākṣasena /
analyzed: atha praviṣṭāḥ te lokāḥ sarve bhakṣitāḥ rākṣasena
translated: Then those people who entered were all eaten by the demon.

original: atha teṣu ciramāṇeṣu rājā vānaram āhabho yūthādhipa kim iti cirāyate me parijanaḥ /
analyzed: atha teṣu ciramāṇeṣu rājā vānaram āha bho yūtha adhipa kim iti cirāyate me parijanaḥ
translated: Then, when they had been gone a long time, the king said to the monkey, Hey, lord of the herd, why is my retinue taking so long?

original: tac chrutvā vānaraḥ satvaraṃ vṛkṣam āruhya rājānam uvācabho duṣṭanarapate /
analyzed: tat śrutvā vānaraḥ sa tvaram vṛkṣam āruhya rājānam uvāca bho duṣṭa narapate
translated: Hearing that, the monkey quickly climbed a tree and said to the king, Hey, wicked king!

original: rākṣasenāntaḥsalilasthitena bhakṣitās te parijanaḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasena antar salila sthitena bhakṣitāḥ te parijanaḥ
translated: That retinue of yours has been eaten by a demon dwelling in the water inside.

original: sādhitaṃ mayā kulakṣayajaṃ vairam /
analyzed: sādhitam mayā kula kṣaya jam vairam
translated: I have accomplished the enmity born from the destruction of my family.

original: tad gamyatām /
analyzed: tat gamyatām
translated: So please leave.

original: tvaṃ svāmīti matvā nātra praveśitaḥ / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tvam svāmī iti matvā na atra praveśitaḥ uktam ca
translated: Thinking you were the master, I did not let you in here. And it is said:

original: kṛte pratikṛtaṃ kuryād dhiṃsite pratihiṃsitam /
analyzed: kṛte pratikṛtam kuryāt hiṃsite pratihiṃsitam
translated: One should do in return what is done, and retaliate when harmed.

original: na tatra doṣaṃ paśyāmi yo duṣṭe duṣṭam ācaret // ///
analyzed: na tatra doṣam paśyāmi yaḥ duṣṭe duṣṭam ācaret
translated: I do not see any fault in that, for one who acts badly towards a bad person...

original: tat tvayā mama kulakṣayaḥ kṛtaḥ mayā punas tava iti /🔽athaitad ākarṇya rājā kopāviṣṭaḥ padātir ekākī yathāyātamārgeṇa niṣkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tat tvayā mama kula kṣayaḥ kṛtaḥ mayā punar tava iti  atha etat ākarṇya rājā kopa āviṣṭaḥ padātiḥ ekākī yathā āyāta mārgeṇa niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: So you destroyed my family, and I destroyed yours.🔽Then, hearing this, the king, filled with anger, went out by the same path he had come, on foot, all alone.

original: atha tasmin bhūpatau gate rākṣasaspṛṣṭo jalān niṣkramya sānandam idam āha
analyzed: atha tasmin bhūpatau gate rākṣasa spṛṣṭaḥ jalāt niṣkramya sa ānandam idam āha
translated: Then, after that king had left, the monkey, touched by the demon, came out of the water and joyfully said this:

original: hataḥ śatruḥ kṛtaṃ mitraṃ ratnamālā na hāritā /
analyzed: hataḥ śatruḥ kṛtam mitram ratna mālā na hāritā
translated: The enemy is killed, the friend is made, the jeweled necklace is not stolen.

original: nālena pibatā toyaṃ bhavatā sādhu vānara // ///
analyzed: nālena pibatā toyam bhavatā sādhu vānara
translated: By drinking the water through the stalk, you have done well, O monkey.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiyo laulyāt kurute karma iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi iyaḥ laulyāt kurute karma iti
translated: Therefore I say: One who does an act out of curiosity...

original: evam uktvā bhūyo 'pi sa cakradharam āhabho mitra /
analyzed: evam uktvā bhūyas sa cakradharam āha bho mitra
translated: Having said this, he again said to Cakradhara: Friend,

original: preṣaya māṃ /
analyzed: preṣaya mām
translated: send me back.

original: yena svagṛhaṃ gacchāmi /
analyzed: yena sva gṛham gacchāmi
translated: So that I can go to my own home.

original: cakradhara āhabhadra /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha bhadra
translated: Cakradhara said: Good man,

original: āpadarthe dhanamitrasaṅgrahaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: āpad arthe dhana mitra saṅgrahaḥ kriyate
translated: wealth and friends are gathered for the sake of misfortune.

original: tan mām evaṃvidhaṃ tyaktvā kva yāsyasi / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: tat mām evaṃvidham tyaktvā kva yāsyasi uktam ca
translated: Leaving me in this state, where will you go? As it is said:

original: yas tyaktvā sāpadaṃ mitraṃ yāti niṣṭhuratāṃ vahan /
analyzed: yaḥ tyaktvā sa āpadam mitram yāti niṣṭhura tām vahan
translated: He who abandons a friend in misfortune, carrying out his cruelty,

original: kṛtaghnas tena pāpena narake yāty asaṃśayam // ///
analyzed: kṛtaghnaḥ tena pāpena narake yāti asaṃśayam
translated: by that sin of ingratitude, he undoubtedly goes to hell.

original: suvarṇasiddhir āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said, Sir,

original: satyam etad yadi gamyasthāne śaktir bhavati /
analyzed: satyam etat yadi gamya sthāne śaktiḥ bhavati
translated: this is true, if there is the ability to go to a place that can be reached.

original: etat punar manuṣyāṇām agamyasthānam /🔽nāsti kasyāpi tvām unmocayituṃ śaktiḥ aparaṃ yathā yathā cakrabhramavedanayā tava
analyzed: etat punar manuṣyāṇām agamya sthānam  nā asti kasya api tvām unmocayitum śaktiḥ aparam yathā yathā cakra bhrama vedanayā tava
translated: But this is a place that cannot be reached by humans.🔽No one has the ability to free you. Moreover, the more I see your facial expression from the pain of the wheel

original: mukhavikāraṃ paśyāmi tathā tathāham etaj jānāmi yat drāg gacchāmi mā kaścin mamāpy🔽anartho bhaved iti / yataḥ
analyzed: mukha vikāram paśyāmi tathā tathā aham etat jānāmi yat drāk gacchāmi mā kaścid mama api  anarthaḥ bhavet iti yatas
translated: the more I know that I should quickly leave, lest some misfortune befall me too. Because

original: yādṛśī vadanacchāyā dṛśyate tava vānara /
analyzed: yādṛśī vadana chāyā dṛśyate tava vānara
translated: the facial expression that is seen in you, monkey,

original: vikālena gṛhīto 'si yaḥ paraiti sa jīvati // ///
analyzed: vikālena gṛhītaḥ asi yaḥ paraiti sa jīvati
translated: He who is seized by Vikāla and escapes, he lives.

original: cakradhara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Cakradhara asked, How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: vikālavānarakathā
analyzed: vikāla vānara kathā
translated: The Story of the Monkey Vikāla

original: kasmiṃścin nagare bhadraseno nāma rājā prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid nagare bhadrasenaḥ nāma rājā prativasati sma
translated: In a certain city, there lived a king named Bhadra-sena.

original: tasya sarvalakṣaṇasampannā ratnavatī nāma kanyāsti /
analyzed: tasya sarva lakṣaṇa sampannā ratnavatī nāma kanyā asti
translated: He has a daughter named Ratnavatī, who is endowed with all the auspicious marks.

original: tāṃ kaścid rākṣaso jihīrṣati /
analyzed: tām kaścid rākṣasaḥ jihīrṣati
translated: Some demon desires her.

original: rātrāv āgatyopabhuṅkte /
analyzed: rātrau āgatya upabhuṅkte
translated: He comes at night and enjoys her.

original: paraṃ kṛtarakṣopadhānāṃ tāṃ hartuṃ na śaknoti /
analyzed: param kṛta rakṣaḥ upadhānām tām hartum na śaknoti
translated: But he cannot carry her off when she has made protective arrangements.

original: sāpi tatsamaye rakṣaḥsānnidhyajām avasthām anubhavati kampādibhiḥ /
analyzed: sā api tad samaye rakṣaḥ sānnidhya jām avasthām anubhavati kampa ādibhiḥ
translated: And at that time she experiences a state of being in the presence of the demon through trembling and so on.

original: ekam atikrāmati kāle kadācit sa rākṣaso madhyaniśāyāṃ gṛhakoṇe sthitaḥ /
analyzed: ekam atikrāmati kāle kadācid sa rākṣasaḥ madhya niśāyām gṛha koṇe sthitaḥ
translated: Once, when a long time had passed, that demon stood in a corner of the house in the middle of the night.

original: sāpi rājakanyā svasakhīm uvācasakhi /
analyzed: sā api rāja kanyā sva sakhīm uvāca sakhi
translated: And that princess said to her friend, Friend,

original: paśyaiṣa vikālaḥ samaye nityam eva māṃ kadarthayati /
analyzed: paśya eṣa vikālaḥ samaye nityam eva mām kadarthayati
translated: look, this untimely one always torments me at the wrong time.

original: asti tasya durātmanaḥ pratiṣedhopāyaḥ kaścit /
analyzed: asti tasya durātmanaḥ pratiṣedha upāyaḥ kaścid
translated: Is there any means of preventing that evil-minded one?

original: tac chrutvā rākṣaso 'pi vyacintayatnūnaṃ yathāhaṃ tathānyo 'pi kaścid vikālanāmāsyā haraṇāya nityam evāgacchati /
analyzed: tat śrutvā rākṣasaḥ u pi vyacintayat nūnam yathā aham tathā anyaḥ api kaścid vikāla nāmā asyāḥ haraṇāya nityam eva āgacchati
translated: Hearing that, the demon also thought, Surely, just as I am, another named Vikala always comes to carry her off.

original: paraṃ so 'py enāṃ hartuṃ na śaknoti /
analyzed: param saḥ api enām hartum na śaknoti
translated: But he too cannot carry her off.

original: tat tāvad aśvarūpaṃ kṛtvāśvamadhyagato nirīkṣayāmi /
analyzed: tat tāvat aśva rūpam kṛtvā aśva madhya gataḥ nirīkṣayāmi
translated: So now I will assume the form of a horse, and looking from the middle of the horses, I will see

original: kiṃrūpaḥ sa kiṃprabhāvaś ceti /
analyzed: kiṃrūpaḥ sa kiṃprabhāvaḥ ca iti
translated: what form he has and what power.

original: evaṃ rākṣaso 'śvarūpaṃ kṛtvāśvānāṃ madhye tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam rākṣasaḥ śva rūpam kṛtvā aśvānām madhye tiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, the demon assumed the form of a horse and stood among the horses.

original: tathānuṣṭhite niśīthasamaye rājagṛhe kaścid aśvacauraḥ praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite niśītha samaye rāja gṛhe kaścid aśva cauraḥ praviṣṭaḥ
translated: When this was done, at midnight a certain horse thief entered the royal palace.

original: sa ca sarvān aśvān avalokya taṃ rākṣasam aśvatamaṃ vijñāyādhirūḍhaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca sarvān aśvān avalokya tam rākṣasam aśvatamam vijñāya adhirūḍhaḥ
translated: He looked at all the horses and, recognizing the demon as the best horse, mounted it.

original: atrāntare rākṣasaś cintayāmāsanūnam eṣa vikālanāmā māṃ cauraṃ matvā kopān nihantum āgataḥ /
analyzed: atrā antare rākṣasaḥ cintayāmāsa ūnam eṣa vikāla nāmā mām cauram matvā kopāt nihantum āgataḥ
translated: In the meantime, the demon thought, Surely this one named Vikala, thinking me to be a thief, has come out of anger to kill me.

original: tat kiṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat kim karomi
translated: What shall I do?

original: evaṃ cintayan so 'pi tena khalīnaṃ mukhe nidhāya kaśāghātena tāḍitaḥ /
analyzed: evam cintayan saḥ pi tena khalīnam mukhe nidhāya kaśā ghātena tāḍitaḥ
translated: Thinking thus, he too put the bit in his mouth and was struck with the whip.

original: athāsau bhayatrastamanāḥ pradhāvitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha asau bhaya trasta manāḥ pradhāvitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then he began to run away, his mind terrified with fear.

original: cauro 'pi dūraṃ gatvā khalīnākarṣaṇena taṃ sthiraṃ kartum ārabdhavān /
analyzed: cauraḥ pi dūram gatvā khalīna ākarṣaṇena tam sthiram kartum ārabdhavān
translated: The thief too, having gone far, began to make him stop by pulling on the reins.

original: sa tu vegād vegataraṃ gacchati /
analyzed: sa tu vegāt vegataram gacchati
translated: But he went faster and faster.

original: atha taṃ tathāgaṇitakhalīnākarṣaṇaṃ matvā cauraś cintayāmāsaaho naivaṃvidhā vājino bhavanty agaṇitakhalīnāḥ /
analyzed: atha tam tathā agaṇita khalīna ākarṣaṇam matvā cauraḥ cintayāmāsa aho na evaṃvidhāḥ vājinaḥ bhavanti agaṇita khalīnāḥ
translated: Then, thinking that he was not stopping despite the pulling on the reins, the thief thought, Oh, horses are not like this, not stopping despite the pulling on the reins.

original: tan nūnam anenāśvarūpeṇa rākṣasena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tat nūnam anena aśvarūpeṇa rākṣasena bhavitavyam
translated: So it must be that this is a demon in the form of a horse.

original: yadyapi kañcit pāṃsulaṃ bhūmideśam avalokayāmi tad ātmānaṃ tatra pātayāmi /
analyzed: yadi api kañcid pāṃsulam bhūmi deśam avalokayāmi tat ātmānam tatra pātayāmi
translated: If I see some dusty place on the ground, I will throw myself there.

original: nānyathā me jīvitavyam asti /
analyzed: na anyathā me jīvitavyam asti
translated: Otherwise, I have no reason to live.

original: evaṃ cintayata iṣṭadevatāṃ smaratas tasya so 'śvo baṭavṛkṣasya tale niṣkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: evam cintayataḥ iṣṭadevatām smarataḥ tasya saḥ śvas baṭa vṛkṣasya tale niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: While he was thinking like this, remembering his chosen deity, that horse came out at the foot of the banyan tree.

original: cauro 'pi baṭapraroham āsādya tatraiva vilagnaḥ /
analyzed: cauraḥ pi baṭapraroham āsādya tatra eva vilagnaḥ
translated: The thief also reached the banyan tree and got stuck right there.

original: tato dvāv api tau pṛthagbhūtau paramānandabhājau jīvitaviṣaye labdhapratyāśau sampannau /
analyzed: tatas dvau api tau pṛthak bhūtau parama ānanda bhājau jīvita viṣaye labdha pratyāśau sampannau
translated: Then the two of them, separated, became enjoyers of supreme bliss, and their hopes were fulfilled regarding their lives.

original: atha tatra baṭe kaścid rākṣasasuhṛd vānaraḥ sthita āsīt /
analyzed: atha tatra baṭe kaścid rākṣasa suhṛd vānaraḥ sthitaḥ āsīt
translated: Now, in that banyan tree, there was a monkey who was a friend of the demon.

original: tena rākṣasaṃ trastam ālokya vyāhṛtambho mitra /
analyzed: tena rākṣasam trastam ālokya vyāhṛtam bho mitra
translated: Seeing the demon frightened, he said, Hey friend!

original: kim eva alāyyate'līkabhayena /
analyzed: kim eva alāyya telīka bhayena
translated: Why are you running away in false fear?

original: tad bhakṣyo 'yaṃ mānuṣaḥ bhakṣyatām /
analyzed: tat bhakṣyaḥ yam mānuṣaḥ bhakṣyatām
translated: This human is food for you, so eat him!

original: so 'pi vānaravaco niśamya /
analyzed: saḥ pi vānara vacaḥ niśamya
translated: He too, hearing the monkey's words,

original: svarūpam ādhāya śaṅkitamanāḥ skhalitagatir nivṛttaḥ /
analyzed: sva rūpam ādhāya śaṅkita manāḥ skhalita gatiḥ nivṛttaḥ
translated: assumed his own form, his mind apprehensive, his gait faltering, and turned back.

original: cauro 'pi taṃ vānarāhūtaṃ jñātvā kopāt tasya lāṅgulaṃ lambamānaṃ mukhe nidhāya carvitavān /
analyzed: cauraḥ pi tam vānara āhūtam jñātvā kopāt tasya lāṅgulam lambamānam mukhe nidhāya carvitavān
translated: The thief, knowing that he was called by the monkey, out of anger put the hanging tail in his mouth and chewed it.

original: vānaro 'pi taṃ rākṣasābhyadhikaṃ manyamāno bhayān na kiñcid uktavān /
analyzed: vānaraḥ pi tam rākṣasa abhyadhikam manyamānaḥ bhayāt na kiñcid uktavān
translated: The monkey, thinking the demon was superior to him, out of fear said nothing at all.

original: kevalaṃ vyathārto nimīlitanayanas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kevalam vyathā ārtaḥ nimīlita nayanaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: He just stood there, his eyes closed, in pain.

original: rākṣaso 'pi taṃ tathābhūtam avalokya ślokam enam apaṭhat
analyzed: rākṣasaḥ pi tam tathābhūtam avalokya ślokam enam apaṭhat
translated: The demon, seeing him in that state, recited this verse:

original: yādṛśī vacanacchāyā dṛśyate tava vānara /
analyzed: yādṛśī vacana chāyā dṛśyate tava vānara
translated: O monkey, the tone of your words

original: vikālena gṛhīto 'si yaḥ paraiti sa jīvati // ///
analyzed: vikālena gṛhītaḥ asi yaḥ paraiti sa jīvati
translated: is such that you have been seized by the wrong time. He who goes forth lives.

original: ity uktvā praṇaṣṭaś ca /
analyzed: iti uktvā praṇaṣṭaḥ ca
translated: Having said this, he disappeared.

original: tat preṣaya māṃ yena gṛhaṃ gacchāmi /
analyzed: tat preṣaya mām yena gṛham gacchāmi
translated: So send me off so I can go home.

original: tvaṃ punar anubhuṅkṣvātra sthita eva lobhavṛkṣaphalam /
analyzed: tvam punar anubhuṅkṣva atra sthitaḥ eva lobha vṛkṣa phalam
translated: But you, staying here, continue to enjoy the fruits of the tree of greed.

original: cakradhara āhabhoḥ akāraṇam etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha bhoḥ akāraṇam etat
translated: Cakradhara said: Sir, this is groundless.

original: daivavaśāt sampadyate nṛṇāṃ śubhāśubham / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: daiva vaśāt sampadyate nṛṇām śubha aśubham uktam ca
translated: Good and bad fortune befalls men by the power of fate. And it is said:

original: durgas trikūṭaḥ parikhā samudro
analyzed: durgaḥ tri kūṭaḥ parikhā samudraḥ
translated: Trikuta is a difficult fortress, the ocean is a moat,

original: rakṣāṃsi yodhā dhanadāc ca vittam /
analyzed: rakṣāṃsi yodhāḥ dhanadāt ca vittam
translated: demons are the soldiers, and wealth comes from Kubera.

original: śāstraṃ ca yasyośanasā praṇītaṃ
analyzed: śāstram ca yasya uśanasā praṇītam
translated: And whose scriptures were composed by Ushanas,

original: sa rāvaṇo daivavaśād vipannaḥ // ///
analyzed: sa rāvaṇaḥ daiva vaśāt vipannaḥ
translated: that Ravana perished by the power of fate.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: andhakaḥ kubjakaś caiva tristanī rājakanyakā /
analyzed: andhakaḥ kubjakaḥ ca eva tristanī rāja kanyakā
translated: Andhhaka, Kubjaka, and the three-breasted princess,

analyzed: trayaḥ pi anyāyataḥ siddhāḥ saṃmukhe karmaṇi sthite
translated: All three are established unjustly, when the act is performed in the presence of the accused.

original: suvarṇasiddhiḥ prāhakatham etat /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ prāha katham etat
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said, How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā

original: andhakakubjakatristanīkathā
analyzed: andhaka kubjaka tristanī kathā
translated: The story of the blind, hunchbacked, and three-breasted woman

analyzed: asti atra dharā tale uttarāpathe madhupuram nāma nagaram

analyzed: tatra madhusenāḥ nāma rājā babhūva

translated: Once, while he was enjoying the pleasures of his kingdom, a three-breasted daughter was born to him.

analyzed: atha tām trastanīm jātām śrutvā sa rājā kañcukinaḥ provāca
translated: Then, hearing that this three-breasted girl was born, the king said to his chamberlains:

analyzed: yat bhoḥ tyajyatām iyam trastanī gatvā dūra iraṇye yathā kaścid na jānāti

analyzed: tat śrutvā kañcukinaḥ procuḥ mahā rāja jñāyate yat aniṣṭa kāriṇī tri stanī kanyā bhavati
translated: Hearing that, the chamberlains said: Your Majesty, it is known that a three-breasted girl is born who brings misfortune.

original: tathāpi brāhmaṇam āhūya praṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: tathā api brāhmaṇam āhūya praṣṭavyāḥ
translated: Nevertheless, a brahmin should be summoned and asked,

original: yena lokadvayaṃ na virudhyate / yataḥ
analyzed: yena loka dvayam na virudhyate yatas
translated: so that both worlds are not opposed. For:

original: yaḥ satataṃ paripṛcchati śṛṇoti sandhārayaty aniśam /
analyzed: yaḥ satatam paripṛcchati śṛṇoti sandhārayati aniśam
translated: He who always asks, listens, and remembers without end,

original: tasya divākarakiraṇair nalinīva vivardhate buddhiḥ // ///
analyzed: tasya divākara kiraṇaiḥ nalinī iva vivardhate buddhiḥ
translated: his intelligence grows like a lotus with the rays of the sun.

original: tathā ca
analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so:

original: pṛcchakena sadā bhāvyaṃ puruṣeṇa vijānatā /
analyzed: pṛcchakena sadā bhāvyam puruṣeṇa vijānatā
translated: A wise man should always be ready to ask questions.

original: rākṣasendragṛhīto 'pi praśnān mukto dvijaḥ purā // ///
analyzed: rākṣasa indra gṛhītaḥ pi praśnāt muktaḥ dvijaḥ purā
translated: In the past, a Brahmin was freed from a demon king's grasp by answering questions.

original: rājā āhakatham etat /
analyzed: rājā āha katham etat
translated: The king asked, How is that?

original: te procuḥ
analyzed: te procuḥ
translated: They said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: caṇḍakarmanāmarākṣasakathā
analyzed: caṇḍakarma nāma rākṣasa kathā
translated: The Story of the Demon Named Fierce Action

original: deva / kasmiṃścid vanoddeśe caṇḍakarmā nāma rākṣasaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: deva kasmiṃścid vana uddeśe caṇḍakarmā nāma rākṣasaḥ prativasati sma
translated: Your Majesty, in a certain forest region, there lived a demon named Fierce Action.

original: ekadā tena bhramatāṭavyāṃ kaścid brāhmaṇaḥ samāsāditaḥ /
analyzed: ekadā tena bhramatā aṭavyām kaścid brāhmaṇaḥ samāsāditaḥ
translated: One day, while wandering in the forest, he encountered a Brahmin.

original: tatas tasya skandham āruhya provācabho agresaro gamyatām /
analyzed: tatas tasya skandham āruhya provāca bho agresaraḥ gamyatām
translated: Then, climbing onto his shoulder, he said, 'Sir, go ahead.'

original: brāhmaṇo 'pi bhayatrastamanās tam ādāya prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ pi bhaya trasta manāḥ tam ādāya prasthitaḥ
translated: The Brahmin, his mind terrified with fear, took him and set out.

original: atha tasya kamalodarakomalau pādau dṛṣṭvā brāhmaṇo rākṣasam apṛcchatbhoḥ /
analyzed: atha tasya kamala udara komalau pādau dṛṣṭvā brāhmaṇaḥ rākṣasam apṛcchat bhoḥ
translated: Then, seeing his feet soft as the inside of a lotus, the Brahmin asked the demon, 'Sir,

original: kim evaṃvidhau te pādāv atikomalau /
analyzed: kim evaṃvidhau te pādau ati komalau
translated: why are your feet so extremely soft?'

original: rākṣasa āhabhoḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasaḥ āha bhoḥ
translated: The demon said, 'Sir,

original: vratam asti /
analyzed: vratam asti
translated: I have a vow.

original: nāham ārdrapādo bhūmiṃ spṛśāmi /
analyzed: na aham ārdra pādaḥ bhūmim spṛśāmi
translated: I do not touch the ground with wet feet.'

original: tatas tac chrutvātmano mokṣopāyaṃ cintayaṃs tatsaraḥ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tat śrutvā ātmanaḥ mokṣa upāyam cintayan tat saraḥ prāptaḥ
translated: Hearing that, thinking of a means to free himself, he reached that lake.

original: tato rākṣasenābhihitaṃbhoḥ /
analyzed: tatas rākṣasena abhihitaṃbhoḥ
translated: Then the demon said, 'Sir,

original: yāvad ahaṃ snānaṃ kṛtvā devatārcanavidhiṃ vidhāyāgacchāmi tāvat tvayātaḥ sthānād anyatra na gantavyam /

translated: Until I return from bathing and worshipping the gods, you should not go anywhere else from here.

original: tathānuṣṭhite divjaś cintayāmāsanūnaṃ devatārcanavidher ūrdhvaṃ mām eṣa bhakṣayiṣyati /

original: tad drutataraṃ gacchāmi /
analyzed: tat drutataram gacchāmi
translated: So I must go even faster.

original: yenaiṣa ārdrapādo na mama pṛṣṭham eṣyati /
analyzed: yena eṣaḥ ārdra pādaḥ na mama pṛṣṭham eṣyati
translated: So that with wet feet he will not come after me.

analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite rākṣasaḥ vrata bhaṅga bhayāt tasya pṛṣṭham na gataḥ
translated: When this was done, the demon did not follow his back out of fear of breaking his vow.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmipṛcchakena sadā bhāvyam iti /🔽atha tebhyas tac chrutvārājā dvijān āhūya provācabho brāhmaṇāḥ /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi pṛcchakena sadā bhāvyam iti  atha tebhyaḥ tat śrutvā rājā dvijān āhūya provāca bho brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Therefore I say: One should always be inquisitive.

original: tristanī me kanyā samutpannā /
analyzed: tri stanī me kanyā samutpannā
translated: Then, having heard that from them, the king summoned the brahmins and said, Gentlemen, a three-breasted daughter has been born to me.

original: tat kiṃ tasyāḥ pratividhānam asti / na vā /
analyzed: tat kim tasyāḥ pratividhānam asti na vā

analyzed: hīna aṅgī vā adhika aṅgī vā yā bhavet kanyakā nṛṇām
translated: A daughter who is either deficient in limbs or has extra limbs,

translated: will be the destruction of her husband and the ruin of her own virtue.

original: tasmād asyā darśanaṃ pariharatu devaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt asyāḥ darśanam pariharatu devaḥ
translated: Therefore, Your Majesty should avoid seeing her.

original: tathā yadi kaścid udvāhayati /
analyzed: tathā yadi kaścid udvāhayati
translated: And if someone were to marry her,

original: tad enāṃ tasmai dattvā /
analyzed: tat enām tasmai dattvā
translated: having given her to him,

original: evaṃkṛte lokadvayāviruddhatā bhavati /
analyzed: evaṃkṛte loka dvaya aviruddha tā bhavati
translated: When this is done, there will be no contradiction with either world.

original: atha teṣāṃ tadvacanam ākarṇya sa rājā paṭahaśabdena sarvatra ghoṣaṇām ājñāpayāmāsaaho /
analyzed: atha teṣām tat vacanam ākarṇya sa rājā paṭaha śabdena sarvatra ghoṣaṇām ājñāpayāmāsa aho

analyzed: tristanīm rāja kanyām yaḥ kaścid udvāhayati sa suvarṇa lakṣam āpnoti deśa tyāgam ca

analyzed: atra tatra eva nagare kaścid andhaḥ tiṣṭhati  tasya ca mantharaka nāmā kubjaḥ gresaraḥ yaṣṭi grāhī  tābhyām tam paṭaha śabdam ākarṇya
translated: In that very city, there was a blind man.🔽And his chief assistant was a hunchback named Mánthara, who held a staff.🔽Having heard that drum sound,

analyzed: mithas mantritam spṛśyate iyam paṭahaḥ
translated: they consulted each other: This drum is being beaten.

analyzed: lajjā snehaḥ svara madhura tā buddhayaḥ yauvana śrīḥ
translated: Shame, affection, sweetness of voice, youthfulness, beauty,

translated: all these are present in the pot-belly of living beings when full.🔽Having said this, the blind man went and

analyzed: sa paṭahaḥ spṛṣṭaḥ

original: uktaṃ cabhoḥ /
analyzed: uktam ca bhoḥ
