analyzed: yadi rājā me prayacchati
translated: if the king gives her to me.

original: tatas tai rājapuruṣair gatvā rājñe niveditamdeva /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ rāja puruṣaiḥ gatvā rājñe niveditam deva
translated: Then those royal officers went and reported to the king: Your Majesty,

original: andhena kenacit paṭahaḥ spṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: andhena kenacid paṭahaḥ spṛṣṭaḥ
translated: a certain blind man has touched the drum.

original: tad atra viṣaye devaḥ pramāṇam /
analyzed: tat atra viṣaye devaḥ pramāṇam
translated: Therefore, Your Majesty is the authority in this matter.

original: rājā prāha
analyzed: rājā prāha
translated: The king said:

original: andho vā vadhiro vātha kuṣṭī vāpy antyajo 'pi vā /
analyzed: andhaḥ vā vadhiraḥ vā atha kuṣṭī vā api vā
translated: Whether blind, deaf, or even a leper or an outcaste,

original: parigṛhṇātu tāṃ kanyāṃ salakṣāṃ syād videśagaḥ // ///
analyzed: parigṛhṇātu tām kanyām salakṣām syāt videśa gaḥ
translated: Let him take that girl with a lakh of gold coins and go to a foreign land.

original: atha rājādeśāt tai rājapuruṣais taṃ nadītīre nītvā suvarṇalakṣeṇa samaṃ vivāhavidhinā tristanīṃ tasmai dattvā /
analyzed: atha rāja ādeśāt taiḥ rāja puruṣaiḥ tam nadī tīre nītvā suvarṇa lakṣeṇa samam vivāha vidhinā tri stanīm tasmai dattvā
translated: Then, by the king's order, those royal officers took him to the riverbank and, with a lakh of gold coins, gave him the three-breasted girl in a marriage ceremony.

original: jalayāne nidhāya kaivartāḥ proktāḥbho /🔽deśāntaraṃ nītvā kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne'ndhaḥ sapatnīkaḥ /
analyzed: jalayāne nidhāya kaivartāḥ proktāḥ bho  deśa antaram nītvā kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāna indhaḥ sa patnīkaḥ
translated: Placing her in a boat, the fishermen said, Hey!

original: kubjakena saha mocanīyaḥ /
analyzed: kubjakena saha mocanīyaḥ
translated: Taking her to a foreign land, in some town, the blind man should be released along with his wife and the hunchback.

original: tathānuṣṭhite videśam āsādya kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne kaivartadarśite trayo 'pi mūlyena gṛhaṃ prāptāḥ sukhena kālaṃ nayanti sma /
analyzed: tathā anuṣṭhite videśam āsādya kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne kaivarta darśite trayaḥ pi mūlyena gṛham prāptāḥ sukhena kālam nayanti sma
translated: When that was done, they reached a foreign country and in some town, the three of them bought a house with money and were living happily.

original: kevalam andhaḥ paryaṅke suptas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: kevalam andhaḥ paryaṅke suptaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Only the blind man slept on a couch.

original: gṛhavyāpāraṃ mantharakaḥ karoti /
analyzed: gṛha vyāpāram mantharakaḥ karoti
translated: Māthura did the household work.

original: evaṃ gacchatā kālena tristanyā kubjakena saha vikṛtiḥ samapadyata /
analyzed: evam gacchatā kālena tri stanyā kubjakena saha vikṛtiḥ samapadyata
translated: As time passed in this way, the three-breasted woman had an affair with the hunchback.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: yadi syāc chrītalo vahniś candramā dahanātmakaḥ /
analyzed: yadi syāt śrī talaḥ vahniḥ candramāḥ dahana ātmakaḥ
translated: If Śrī Tāla were fire, and the moon had the nature of burning,

original: susvādaḥ sāgaraḥ strīṇāṃ tatsatīs tvaṃ prajāyate // ///
analyzed: susvādaḥ sāgaraḥ strīṇām tad satīḥ tvam prajāyate
translated: and the ocean were sweet-tasting, then you would be born as a chaste woman.

original: athānyedyus tristanyā mantharako 'bhihitaḥbhoḥ subhaga /
analyzed: atha anyedyus tri stanyā mantharakaḥ bhihitaḥ bhoḥ subhaga
translated: Then the next day, Slow-Wit was addressed by Three-Teat: “My dear!

original: yady eṣo 'ndhaḥ kathañcit vyāpādyate /
analyzed: yadi eṣaḥ ndhaḥ kathañcid vyāpādyate
translated: If this blind man is somehow killed,

original: tad āvayoḥ sukhena kālo yāti /
analyzed: tat āvayoḥ sukhena kālaḥ yāti
translated: then time will pass pleasantly for us.

original: tad anviṣyatāṃ kutracid viṣam /
analyzed: tat anviṣyatām kutracid viṣam
translated: So look for poison somewhere.

original: yenāsmai tat pradāya sukhinī bhavāmi /
analyzed: yena asmai tat pradāya sukhinī bhavāmi
translated: By giving it to him, I will be happy.

original: anyadā kubjakena paribhramatā mṛtaḥ kṛṣṇasarpaḥ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: anyadā kubjakena paribhramatā mṛtaḥ kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ prāptaḥ
translated: One day, while the hunchback was wandering, he found a dead black cobra.

original: taṃ gṛhītvā prahṛṣṭamanā gṛham abhyetya tām āhasubhage /
analyzed: tam gṛhītvā prahṛṣṭa manāḥ gṛham abhyetya tām āha subhage
translated: Taking it, with a cheerful mind he went home and said to her: “My dear!

original: labdho 'yaṃ kṛṣṇasarpaḥ /
analyzed: labdhaḥ yam kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ
translated: This black cobra has been found.

original: tad enaṃ khaṇḍaśaḥ kṛtvā prabhūtaśuṇṭhyādibhiḥ saṃskāryāsmai vikalanetrāya matsyāmiṣaṃ bhaṇitvā prayaccha yena drāg vinaśyati /
analyzed: tat enam khaṇḍaśas kṛtvā prabhūta śuṇṭhī ādibhiḥ saṃskārya asmai vikala netrāya matsya āmiṣam bhaṇitvā prayaccha yena drāk vinaśyati
translated: So cut it into pieces, season it with plenty of ginger and so on, and give it to the one-eyed man, calling it fish, so that he will die quickly.

original: yato 'sya matsyāmiṣaṃ sadā priyam /
analyzed: yatas sya matsya āmiṣam sadā priyam
translated: Because he always likes fish.

original: evam uktvā mantharako bahir gataḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā mantharakaḥ bahis gataḥ
translated: Having said this, Slow-Wit went outside.

original: sāpi pradīpte vahnau kṛṣṇasarpaṃ khaṇḍaśaḥ kṛtvā takrasthālyām ādhāya gṛhavyāpārākulā taṃ vikalākṣaṃ sapraśrayam uvācaāryaputra /
analyzed: sā api pradīpte vahnau kṛṣṇa sarpam khaṇḍaśas kṛtvā takra sthālyām ādhāya gṛha vyāpāra ākulā tam vikala akṣam sa praśrayam uvāca ārya putra
translated: She too, in a blazing fire, cut the black cobra into pieces, put it in a pot of buttermilk, and, busy with household affairs, respectfully said to the one-eyed man: “My dear!

original: tavābhīṣṭaṃ matsyamāṃsaṃ samānītam /
analyzed: tava abhīṣṭam matsya māṃsam samānītam
translated: The fish meat you wanted has been brought.

original: yatas tvaṃ sadaiva tat pṛcchasi /
analyzed: yatas tvam sadā eva tat pṛcchasi
translated: Because you always ask about that.

original: te ca matsyā vahnau pāvanāya tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: te ca matsyāḥ vahnau pāvanāya tiṣṭhanti
translated: And those fish stand in the fire for purification.

original: tad yāvad ahaṃ gṛhakṛtyaṃ karomi /
analyzed: tat yāvat aham gṛha kṛtyam karomi
translated: So while I do the household work,

original: tāvat tvaṃ darvīm ādāya kṣaṇam ekaṃ tān pracālaya /
analyzed: tāvat tvam darvīm ādāya kṣaṇam ekam tān pracālaya
translated: you take the ladle and stir them for a moment.

original: so 'pi tad ākarṇya hṛṣṭamanāḥ sṛkkaṇī parilihan drutam utthāya darvīm ādāya pramathitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi tat ākarṇya hṛṣṭa manāḥ sṛkkaṇī parilihan drutam utthāya darvīm ādāya pramathitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: He too, hearing that, his mind delighted, licking the corners of his mouth, quickly got up, took the ladle, and began to stir.

original: atha tasya matsyān mathnato viṣagarbhabāṣpeṇa saṃspṛṣṭaṃ nīlapaṭalaṃ cakṣurbhyām agalat /
analyzed: atha tasya matsyāt mathnataḥ viṣa garbha bāṣpeṇa saṃspṛṣṭam nīla paṭalam cakṣurbhyām agalat
translated: Then, as he was stirring the fish, a blue film, touched by the smoke of poison, came out of his eyes.

original: asāv apy andhas taṃ bahuguṇaṃ manyamāno viśeṣān netrābhyāṃ bāṣpagrahaṇam akarot /
analyzed: asau api andhaḥ tam bahu guṇam manyamānaḥ viśeṣāt netrābhyām bāṣpa grahaṇam akarot
translated: He too, thinking it had many qualities, especially held back the tears from his eyes.

original: tato labdhadṛṣṭir jāto yāvat paśyati /
analyzed: tatas labdha dṛṣṭiḥ jātaḥ yāvat paśyati
translated: Then he regained his sight, and as he looked,

original: tāvat takramadhye kṛṣṇasarpakhaṇḍāni kevalāny evāvalokayati /
analyzed: tāvat takra madhye kṛṣṇa sarpa khaṇḍāni kevalāni eva avalokayati
translated: he saw only pieces of a black snake in the buttermilk.

original: tato vyacintayataho / kim etat /
analyzed: tatas vyacintayata ho kim etat
translated: Then he thought, Oh, what is this?

original: mama matsyāmiṣaṃ kathitam āsīd anayā /
analyzed: mama matsya āmiṣam kathitam āsīt anayā
translated: This was told to me as fish meat by her.

original: etāni tu kṛṣṇasarpakhaṇḍāni /
analyzed: etāni tu kṛṣṇa sarpa khaṇḍāni
translated: But these are pieces of a black snake.

original: tat tāvad vijānāmi samyak tristanyāś ceṣṭitam /
analyzed: tat tāvat vijānāmi samyak tristanyāḥ ceṣṭitam
translated: So I will know properly the behavior of the three-teated one.

original: kiṃ mama vadhopāyakramaḥ kubjasya vā /
analyzed: kim mama vadha upāya kramaḥ kubjasya vā
translated: What is the plan for killing me or Kubja?

original: utāho anyasya vā kasyacit /
analyzed: uta aho anyasya vā kasyacid
translated: What is the plan for killing me, the hunchback, or someone else?

original: evaṃ vicintya svākāraṃ gūhayann andhavat karma karoti yathā purā /
analyzed: evam vicintya sva ākāram gūhayan andha vat karma karoti yathā purā
translated: Thinking thus, he concealed his true nature, and like a blind man, he continued to do as before.

original: atrāntare kubjaḥ samāgatya niḥśaṅkatayāliṅganacumbanādibhis tristanīṃ sevitum upacakrame /
analyzed: atrā antare kubjaḥ samāgatya niḥśaṅka tayā āliṅgana cumbana ādibhiḥ tri stanīm sevitum upacakrame
translated: In the meantime, the hunchback came and without hesitation began to serve the three-breasted woman with embraces, kisses, and so on.

original: so 'py andhas tam avalokayann api yāvan na kiñcic chastraṃ paśyati /
analyzed: saḥ pi andhaḥ tam avalokayan api yāvat na kiñcid śastram paśyati
translated: Although the blind man looked at him, he did not see any weapon.

original: tāvat kopavyākulamanāḥ pūrvavac chayanaṃ gatvā kubjaṃ caraṇābhyāṃ saṅgṛhya sāmarthyāt svamastakopari bhrāmayitvā tristanīṃ hṛdaye vyatāḍayat
analyzed: tāvat kopa vyākula manāḥ pūrvavat śayanam gatvā kubjam caraṇābhyām saṅgṛhya sāmarthyāt sva mastaka upari bhrāmayitvā tristanīm hṛdaye vyatāḍayat
translated: Then, with a mind agitated by anger, he went to bed as before, grabbed the hunchback with his feet, and by force whirled him over his head. He struck the three-breasted woman in the heart.

original: atha kubjaprahāreṇa tasyās tṛtīyaḥ stana urasi praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha kubja prahāreṇa tasyāḥ tṛtīyaḥ stanaḥ urasi praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, by the blow of the hunchback, her third breast entered her chest.

original: tathā balān mastakopari bhramaṇena kubjaḥ prāñjalatāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tathā balāt mastaka upari bhramaṇena kubjaḥ prāñjala tām gataḥ
translated: And by the force of being whirled over his head, the hunchback became like a folded hand.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiandhakaḥ kubjakaś caiva iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi andhakaḥ kubjakaḥ ca eva iti
translated: Therefore I say: The blind man and the hunchback...

original: suvarṇasiddhir āhabhoḥ satyam etat /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ āha bhoḥ satyam etat
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said, Sir, this is true.

original: daivānukūlatayā sarvaṃ kalyāṇaṃ sampadyate /
analyzed: daiva anukūla tayā sarvam kalyāṇam sampadyate
translated: By the favor of fate, everything turns out well.

original: tathāpi puruṣeṇa satāṃ vacanaṃ kāryam /🔽punar evam eva vartitavyam /
analyzed: tathā api puruṣeṇa satām vacanam kāryam  punar evam eva vartitavyam
translated: Still, a good person should do what the good say.

original: atha evam eva yo vartate /
analyzed: atha evam eva yaḥ vartate
translated: One should conduct oneself in this very way again.🔽Now, one who conducts oneself in this very way,

original: sa tvam iva vinaśyati / tathā ca
analyzed: sa tvam iva vinaśyati tathā ca
translated: he perishes like you. And so:

original: ekodarāḥ pṛthag grīvā anyānyaphalabhakṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: eka udarāḥ pṛthak grīvāḥ anya anya phala bhakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Having one belly, separate necks, eating different fruits,

original: asaṃhatā vinaśyanti bhāruṇḍā iva pakṣiṇaḥ // ///
analyzed: a saṃhatāḥ vinaśyanti bhāruṇḍāḥ iva pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: they perish ununited, like the Bhāruṇḍa birds.

original: cakradhara āhakatham etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha katham etat
translated: Cakradhara asked, How is this?

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: Story

original: bhāruṇḍapakṣikathā
analyzed: bhāruṇḍa pakṣi kathā
translated: The Story of the Bhāruṇḍa Birds

original: kasmiṃścit sarovare bhāruṇḍanāmā pakṣī ekodaraḥ pṛthaggrīvaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid sarovare bhāruṇḍa nāmā pakṣī eka udaraḥ pṛthak grīvaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain lake, a bird named Bhāruṇḍa lived with one belly and separate necks.

original: tena ca samudratīre paribhramatā kañcit phalam amṛtakalpaṃ taraṅgakṣiptaṃ samprāptam /
analyzed: tena ca samudra tīre paribhramatā kañcid phalam amṛta kalpam taraṅga kṣiptam samprāptam
translated: And while wandering on the ocean shore, he obtained a certain fruit like nectar, thrown by the waves.

original: so 'pi bhakṣayann idam āhaaho /
analyzed: saḥ pi bhakṣayan idam āha aho
translated: And while eating it, he said this: Oh!

original: bahūni mayāmṛtaprāyāṇi samudrakallolāhṛtāni phalāni bhakṣitāni /
analyzed: bahūni mayā amṛta prāyāṇi samudra kallola āhṛtāni phalāni bhakṣitāni
translated: I have eaten many fruits like nectar brought by the waves of the ocean.

original: param apūrvo 'syāsvādaḥ /
analyzed: param a pūrvaḥ sya āsvādaḥ
translated: But this taste is unprecedented.

original: tat kiṃ pārijātaharicandanatarusambhavam /
analyzed: tat kim pārijāta haricandana taru sambhavam
translated: Is it from the pārijāta or haricandana tree?

original: kiṃ vā / kiñcid amṛtamayaphalam idam avyaktenāpi vidhināpātitam /
analyzed: kim vā kiñcid amṛta maya phalam idam avyaktena api vidhinā āpātitam
translated: Or is this some kind of nectar fruit that has fallen by some unseen means?

original: evaṃ tasya bruvato dvitīyamukhenābhihitambho /
analyzed: evam tasya bruvataḥ dvitīya mukhena abhihitam bho
translated: When he said this, the second mouth said, Hey!

original: yady evaṃ tan mamāpi stokaṃ prayaccha /
analyzed: yadi evam tat mama api stokam prayaccha
translated: If that's the case, then give me a little too,

original: yenāham api jihvāsaukhyam anubhavāmi /
analyzed: yena aham api jihvā saukhyam anubhavāmi
translated: so that I can also experience the pleasure of the tongue.

original: tato vihasya prathamavaktreṇābhihitamāvayos tāvad ekam udaram /
analyzed: tatas vihasya prathama vaktreṇa abhihitam āvayoḥ tāvat ekam udaram
translated: Then, laughing, the first mouth said, We two have one stomach,

original: ekā tṛptiś ca bhavati /
analyzed: ekā tṛptiḥ ca bhavati
translated: and one satisfaction.

original: tataḥ kiṃ pṛthag bhakṣitena /
analyzed: tatas kim pṛthak bhakṣitena
translated: So what's the point of eating separately?

original: varam anena śeṣeṇa priyā toṣyate /
analyzed: varam anena śeṣeṇa priyā toṣyate
translated: It's better to please my beloved with this leftover food.

original: evam abhidhāya tena śeṣaṃ bhāruṇḍyāḥ pradattam /
analyzed: evam abhidhāya tena śeṣam bhāruṇḍyāḥ pradattam
translated: Having said this, he gave the leftover food to the Bhāruṇḍī.

original: sāpi tad āsvādya prahṛṣṭatamāliṅganacumbanasambhāvanādyanekacāṭuparā ca babhūva /
analyzed: sā api tat āsvādya prahṛṣṭatama āliṅgana cumbana sambhāvanā ādi aneka cāṭu parā ca babhūva
translated: She too, having tasted it, became extremely happy, and was engaged in many kinds of flattery such as embracing, kissing, and showing affection.

original: dvitīyaṃ mukhaṃ taddinād eva prabhṛti sodvegaṃ saviṣādaṃ ca tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: dvitīyam mukham tad dināt eva prabhṛti sa udvegam sa viṣādam ca tiṣṭhati
translated: From that day on, the second mouth remained anxious and dejected.

original: athānyedyur dvitīyamukhena viṣaphalaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: atha anyedyus dvitīya mukhena viṣa phalam prāptam
translated: Then on another day, the second mouth obtained a poisonous fruit.

original: tad dṛṣṭvāparam āhabho nistriṃśa /
analyzed: tat dṛṣṭvā aparam āha bho nistriṃśa
translated: Seeing it, the other one said, Hey, sword!

original: puruṣādhama /
analyzed: puruṣa adhama
translated: Lowest of men!

original: nirapekṣa /
analyzed: nirapekṣa
translated: Careless!

original: mayā viṣaphalam āsāditam /
analyzed: mayā viṣa phalam āsāditam
translated: I have obtained a poisonous fruit.

original: tat tavāpamānād bhakṣayāmi /
analyzed: tat tava apamānāt bhakṣayāmi
translated: I will eat it out of contempt for you.

original: apareṇābhihitammūrkha /
analyzed: apareṇa abhihitam mūrkha
translated: The other one said, Fool!

original: mā maivaṃ kuru /
analyzed: mā mā evam kuru
translated: Don't do that!

original: evaṃ kṛte dvayor api vināśo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam kṛte dvayoḥ api vināśaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If this is done, both of you will be destroyed.

original: athaivaṃ vadatā tenāpamānena tat phalaṃ bhakṣitam /
analyzed: athā evam vadatā tena apamānena tat phalam bhakṣitam
translated: But if he eats that fruit out of contempt for the one who speaks thus,

original: kiṃ bahunā / dvāv api vinaṣṭau /
analyzed: kim bahunā dvau api vinaṣṭau
translated: what more needs to be said? Both of you will be destroyed.

original: ato 'haṃ bravīmiekodarāḥ pṛthaggrīvāḥ iti /
analyzed: atas ham bravīmi eka udarāḥ pṛthak grīvāḥ iti
translated: Therefore I say: 'Having one belly, but different necks.'

original: cakradhara āhasatyam etat /
analyzed: cakradharaḥ āha satyam etat
translated: Cakradhara said: 'This is true.

original: tad gaccha gṛham /
analyzed: tat gaccha gṛham
translated: So go home.

original: param ekākinā na gantavyam / uktaṃ ca
analyzed: param ekākinā na gantavyam uktam ca
translated: But one should not go alone. And it is said:

original: ekaḥ svādu na bhuñjīta ekaś cārthān na cintayet /
analyzed: ekaḥ svādu na bhuñjīta ekaḥ ca arthān na cintayet
translated: One should not eat alone, nor should one think alone.

original: eko na gacched adhvānaṃ naikaḥ supteṣu jāgṛyāt // ///
analyzed: ekaḥ na gacchet adhvānam na ekaḥ supteṣu jāgṛyāt
translated: One should not travel alone, nor should one stay awake alone when others are sleeping.'

original: api ca
analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

original: api kāpuruṣo mārge dvitīyaḥ kṣemakārakaḥ /
analyzed: api kāpuruṣaḥ mārge dvitīyaḥ kṣema kārakaḥ
translated: Even a coward as a companion brings safety on the road.

original: karkaṭena dvitīyena jīvitaṃ parirakṣitam // ///
analyzed: karkaṭena dvitīyena jīvitam parirakṣitam
translated: My life was saved by a crab as a companion.'

original: suvarṇasiddhiḥ prāhakatham etat /
analyzed: suvarṇasiddhiḥ prāha katham etat
translated: Suvarṇasiddhi said: 'How is that?'

original: so 'bravīt
analyzed: saḥ bravīt
translated: He said:

original: kathā
analyzed: kathā
translated: The Story

original: brāhmaṇakarkaṭakakathā
analyzed: brāhmaṇa karkaṭaka kathā
translated: The Story of the Brahmin and the Crab

original: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne brahmadattanāmā brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: kasmiṃścid adhiṣṭhāne brahmadatta nāmā brāhmaṇaḥ prativasati sma
translated: In a certain place, there lived a Brahmin named Brahmadatta.

original: sa ca prayojanavaśād grāmaṃ prasthitaḥ svamātrābhihitaḥ / yadvatsa /
analyzed: sa ca prayojana vaśāt grāmam prasthitaḥ sva mātrā abhihitaḥ yadvat sa
translated: He was about to set out for a village on some business, when his mother said to him, 'My son,

original: katham ekākī vrajasi /
analyzed: katham ekākī vrajasi
translated: how can you go alone?'

original: tad anviṣyatāṃ kaścid dvitīyaḥ sahāyaḥ /
analyzed: tat anviṣyatām kaścid dvitīyaḥ sahāyaḥ
translated: So find some other companion.

original: sa āhaamba / mā bhaiṣīḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha amba mā bhaiṣīḥ
translated: He said, Mother, don't be afraid.

original: nirupadravo 'yaṃ mārgaḥ /
analyzed: nirupadravaḥ yam mārgaḥ
translated: This path is free from danger.

original: kāryavaśād ekākī gamiṣyāmi /
analyzed: kārya vaśāt ekākī gamiṣyāmi
translated: I will go alone due to the demands of the task.

original: atha tasya taṃ niścayaṃ jñātvā samīpasthavāpyāḥ sakāśāt karkaṭam ādāya mātrābhihitaṃvatsa /
analyzed: atha tasya tam niścayam jñātvā samīpa stha vāpyāḥ sakāśāt karkaṭam ādāya mātrā abhihitam vatsa
translated: Then, knowing his resolve, the mother, taking a crab from a nearby pond, said, Son,

original: avaśyaṃ yadi gantavyam /
analyzed: avaśyam yadi gantavyam
translated: if you must go,

original: tad eṣa karkaṭo 'pi sahāyo bhavatu /
analyzed: tat eṣa karkaṭaḥ pi sahāyaḥ bhavatu
translated: then let this crab also be your companion.

original: tad enaṃ gṛhītvā gaccha /
analyzed: tat enam gṛhītvā gaccha
translated: So take him and go.

original: so 'pi mātur vacanād ubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ na saṅgṛhya karpūrapuṭikāmadhye nidhāya /
analyzed: saḥ u pi mātuḥ vacanāt ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām na saṅgṛhya karpūra puṭikā madhye nidhāya
translated: He, out of his mother's words, not holding him with both hands, placed him in the middle of a camphor box,

original: pātramadhye saṃsthāpya śīghraṃ prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: pātra madhye saṃsthāpya śīghram prasthitaḥ
translated: established him in a vessel, and quickly set out.

original: atha gacchan grīṣmoṣmaṇā santaptaḥ kañcin mārgasthaṃ vṛkṣam āsādya /
analyzed: atha gacchan grīṣma ūṣmaṇā santaptaḥ kañcid mārga stham vṛkṣam āsādya
translated: Then, as he was going, scorched by the heat of summer, he reached a tree on the path,

original: tatraiva prasuptaḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva prasuptaḥ
translated: and fell asleep right there.

original: atrāntare vṛkṣakoṭarān nirgatya sarpas tatsamīpam āgataḥ /
analyzed: atrā antare vṛkṣa koṭarāt nirgatya sarpaḥ tad samīpam āgataḥ
translated: In the meantime, a snake emerged from the hollow of the tree and came near him.

original: sa cābhyantaragatāṃ karpūrapuṭikām atilaulyād abhakṣayat /
analyzed: sa ca abhyantara gatām karpūra puṭikām ati laulyāt abhakṣayat
translated: And out of excessive greed, he ate the camphor box that was inside.

original: so 'pi karkaṭas tatraiva sthitaḥ san sarpaprāṇān apāharata /
analyzed: saḥ pi karkaṭaḥ tatra eva sthitaḥ san sarpa prāṇān apāharata
translated: And that crab, remaining right there, took away the snake's life.

original: brāhmaṇe'pi yāvat prabuddhaḥ paśyati /
analyzed: brāhmaṇe api yāvat prabuddhaḥ paśyati
translated: Even a Brahmin, as long as he is awake, sees.

original: tāvat samīpe mṛtakṛṣṇasarpo nijapārśve karpūrapuṭikopari sthitas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tāvat samīpe mṛta kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ nija pārśve karpūra puṭikā upari sthitaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Right next to him, on top of a camphor box, lay a dead black snake.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā vyacintayatkarkaṭenāyaṃ hataḥ iti /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā vyacintayat karkaṭena ayam hataḥ iti
translated: Seeing it, he thought, This must have been killed by the crab.

original: prasanno bhūtvābravīc cabhoḥ /
analyzed: prasannaḥ bhūtvā abravīt cabhoḥ
translated: Delighted, he said, Oh!

original: satyam abhihitaṃ mama mātrā yat puruṣeṇa ko 'pi sahāyaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: satyam abhihitam mama mātrā yat puruṣeṇa kaḥ pi sahāyaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: My mother was right when she said that a man must have some companion.

original: naikākinā gantavyam /
analyzed: na ekākinā gantavyam
translated: One should not go alone.

original: yato mayā śraddhāpūritacetasā tadvacanam anuṣṭhitaṃ tenāhaṃ karkaṭena sarvavyāpādanād rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: yatas mayā śraddhā pūrita cetasā tat vacanam anuṣṭhitam tena aham karkaṭena sarva vyāpādanāt rakṣitaḥ
translated: Because I followed her words with a mind filled with faith, I was saved from all harm by that crab.

original: athavā sādhv idam ucyate
analyzed: athavā sādhu idam ucyate
translated: Or this is well said:

original: kṣīṇaḥ śrayati śaśī ravim ṛddho vardhayati payasāṃ nātham /
analyzed: kṣīṇaḥ śrayati śaśī ravim ṛddhaḥ vardhayati payasām nātham
translated: The waning moon resorts to the sun, the waxing moon increases the lord of the waters.

original: anye vipadi sahāyā dhanināṃ śriyam anubhavanty anye // ///
analyzed: anye vipadi sahāyāḥ dhaninām śriyam anubhavanti anye
translated: Others are companions in misfortune, others enjoy the wealth of the rich.

original: mantre tīrthe dvije deve daivajñe bheṣaje gurau /
analyzed: mantre tīrthe dvije deve daivajñe bheṣaje gurau
translated: In mantras, holy places, Brahmins, gods, astrologers, medicines, and gurus,

original: yādṛśī bhāvanā yasya siddhir bhavati tādṛśī // ///
analyzed: yādṛśī bhāvanā yasya siddhiḥ bhavati tādṛśī
translated: One's success is of the same nature as one's faith.

original: evam śrutvā suvarṇasiddhis tam anujñāpya svagṛhaṃ prati nivṛttaḥ /
analyzed: evam śrutvā suvarṇasiddhiḥ tam anujñāpya sva gṛham prati nivṛttaḥ
translated: Having heard this, Suvarṇasiddhi took leave of him and returned to his own house.

original: iti śrīviṣṇuśarmaviracite pañcatantre aparīkṣitakārakaṃ nāma
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇuśarma viracite pañcatantre aparīkṣitakārakam nāma
translated: Thus ends the Foolish Agent chapter, the third in the Pancatantra.🔽

original: pañcamaṃ tantraṃ samāptam ////
analyzed: pañcamam tantram samāptam
translated: Thus ends the fifth Book called The Foolish Agent of the Five Books of Ancient Tales.

original: yady apy evaṃ tathāpi tvaṃ darśaya taṃ caurasiṃhaṃ yathā vyāpādayāmi /
analyzed: yadi api evam tathā api tvam darśaya tam caura siṃham yathā vyāpādayāmi
translated: Although it is so, still show me that thief-lion so that I may kill him.

original: alt / yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
analyzed: alt yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
translated: He who sees, sees.

original: alt / rājapuruṣaiḥ
analyzed: rājan puruṣaiḥ
translated: By the king's men.

original: alt / devaśaktikathā
analyzed: deva śakti kathā
translated: The story of Devashashi.
